jobs.title: JavaScript Software Developer
jobs.content:
The developers at StateScape are a small, cohesive team that offer a supportive environment and that allows for great deal of independence. We are looking for a mid- to senior-level developer. This individual will get to experiment with interesting technology and regularly see their work enter production.


The key things we’re looking for in a new hire are excellent problem solving abilities as well as the technical skills to work with our JavaScript platform and existing environment. This technology is mission critical and will support daily operations across the company.


Our offices are located in Old Town Alexandria, VA. We offer a casual work environment with flexible hours, both in-office and remote. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. StateScape provides free parking on-site and is within walking distance of the King Street Metro Station.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend - London
jobs.content:
LiveRamp is looking for senior backend engineers to help us scale and grow our UK engineering team. Here at LiveRamp, we’re changing the world of data connectivity. Our technology unites the marketing technology ecosystem, enabling brands to measure the impact of digital marketing on sales and deliver highly relevant messages to consumers on virtually any channel or device.


As a Senior Software Engineer, Backend, you will help bring this vision to life by building systems that collect, process, and distribute enormous quantities of data. You’ll collaborate with other engineers to execute on a diverse range of projects. This might include building out our large distributed systems, implementing algorithms, or discovering new ways to leverage 35 petabytes of data and 100 billion requests per month at lightning speeds.


As a member of our UK team, you’ll spend three months training in San Francisco, one of the most important technology hubs in the world.  You’ll also work with teams across the globe to help make LiveRamp the worldwide leader in data connectivity.


On the engineering team at LiveRamp, we value ownership and individual contribution within a collaborative environment. Be ready to leave your ego at the door, roll up your sleeves and start solving huge challenges as soon as you begin.


Day in the Life of a LiveRamp Engineer:



  • Design and implement algorithms to efficiently process, analyze, and serve massive datasets on a 1200+ node Hadoop cluster.

  • Build, operate, and optimize large distributed systems.

  • Embrace and introduce technology innovations to keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become stronger engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Take our engineering, business development and culture in a whole new direction during one of our four Hackweeks every year.


You are an ideal candidate if you:



  • Demonstrated deep technical capabilities writing and deploying production code.

  • Have a passion for building large scale, distributed systems and are comfortable writing  high performance code.

  • Have a startup personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and productive.

  • Are a data enthusiast who wants to be surrounded by brilliant teammates and huge challenges.


Benefits:



  • 25 days for holiday

  • Private medical

  • Life insurance

  • Matched pension to 10%

  • Strong social committee – events, free lunches, etc.

  • Onsite gym

  • Bike to work scheme

  • Location. Work in the heart of central London (SE1) – one of the best cities in the world, and take advantage of our season ticket loan.


More about us:


LiveRamp is the leader in data connectivity, helping the world’s largest brands use their data to improve customer interactions on any channel and device. We thrive on mind-bending technical challenges and value entrepreneurship, humility, and constant personal growth.


There is so much more that we want to build and that we could continue to improve. We value strong engineers who are agile enough to hit the ground running and tackle challenges.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ProModel Corporation is looking for an experienced software developer with a desire to create web-based Line of Business (LOB) applications typically centered on predictive analytics, modeling and simulation.


What You’ll Do



  • You will be a part of a Scrum team composed of talented developers, testers, DBAs, server administrators, technical writers, business analysts, and a person that silkscreens t-shirts on the weekend. Your primary responsibility will be taking QA oriented stories. As you gain domain knowledge and experience, the expectation is for you take on developer oriented stories of increasing complexity.

  • You will develop high-quality, sophisticated features in various languages such as C#, HTML, JavaScript, SQL and Silverlight.

  • You will test what you develop. You will test what others develop.

  • You will solve problems -- the phrase “I don’t do windows” will never cross your lips.

  • You will help the team become a better team.

jobs.title: Java Backend Developer for CRM Software
jobs.content:
Job Description Software developers - are you looking for an opportunity to build a great career with a dynamic and growing company? Join our team at Momentum CRM!  At Momentum CRM, we provide state-of-the art proprietary CRM software along with customized support and training to help high-end auto dealerships to maximize their sales. Due to our continued growth, we are currently seeking top candidates for an open Back End Java Developer position at our location in Laguna Hills, CA


As Java Developer, you will play a major role in the continued development of our core back-end infrastructure and building integrations with our platform partners. More specifically, you will:



  • Spearhead and build integrations between our platform and leading DMS, OEM and other 3rd  party vendors

  • Build robust and scalable software in Java/J2EE and develop object-oriented software in Java

  • Design and develop services and system architecture for your projects

  • Create web services accessible by mobile/web platforms

  • Build Java-based back-end apps and REST API services

  • Improve our code quality through writing unit tests, automation and performing code reviews

  • Work seamlessly in an agile environment

  • Troubleshoot and debug technical issues

  • Pitch in and support other functions (e.g. product) as needed


Benefits  At Momentum CRM, you will be part of a vibrant and growing organization with a supportive and team-oriented small-business environment. Ours is a friendly and relaxed work atmosphere. We offer schedule flexibility and plenty of opportunities for professional development and advancement. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation and great benefits, including: , a really cool place to work, on campus Gym, Yoga and Ping-pong.


100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance



  • Paid holidays

  • Week-long company-wide Christmas break

  • Vacation

  • Sick days

jobs.title: Lead Marketing Designer
jobs.content:
Heroku provides the fastest path for application developers to turn an idea into a production app of any scale. Heroku provides not only the fastest path to success, but the most beautiful one too, crafted with care, flair, and attention to detail.  Everything, from our web sites to our developer experience, is imbued with our design, our brand, and some sense of where we come from, and where we’re headed to.

In this role, you will be part of the Marketing Team at Heroku, which is responsible for most of the public facing aspects of Heroku – for projecting our brand and its design. You will be responsible for the design of all that Marketing owns: everything from web properties like www.heroku.com, signup, blog, and Dev Center, to online advertising and email marketing, as well as collateral like newsletters, t-shirts and yes, even socks. You will also be responsible for stewarding the brand — including educating and evangelizing, and implementing the design of most of these items. You will work within a dynamic marketing team, all the while collaborating with and representing the greater Heroku team.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate closely with the marketing and product design teams to build, extend and act as the guardians of the Heroku brand promise and marketing experience.
  • Amplify Heroku positioning while ensuring consistent, on-brand execution – everywhere.  Understand and represent both marketing and product initiatives.
  • Produce wireframes, storyboards and other material to help communicate research and prove the case for all new concepts and ideas.
  • Own the design of our marketing web properties.  Own extending, producing, and creating material to support product launches and other initiatives. Create design to support new services and functionality.  Be ready to iterate (and innovate) constantly.
  • Execute – create & build & deliver the designs for our sites, extend our designs for our sites, own & code the technical bits that make that design.
  • Manage external relationships to augment in house production (design sub-contractors, event agencies, printers, & production vendors) and work with cross-functional internal teams; Marketing Web Ops, Vibe, Languages, Product, and Design, all of whom collaborate closely to develop and successfully execute our marketing programs.
  • Effectively share ideas and designs with the team. Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
  • Managing extensive digital asset library of branded resource, art and templates so the wider team can self-serve, share and collaborate.
  • Conceptualize and execute collateral for external events and internal use by Heroku. Design items for swag, presentation templates, booth design, banners posters, and other digital and print materials.

Key Competencies:

  • Comfortable working in a fast paced, agile environment. Track-record of getting design work from draft to final in very few steps and iterating quickly after launch.
  • Fluent in HTML5 / CSS3 required.
  • Ability to work with Sass, JavaScript, git and the command line – all would be a plus.
  • Master of the craft and the tools. Fluent in Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Sketch and other key visual design tools. Animation skills a plus.
  • Ability to translate design and brand thoughts to clear input and direction.
  • 5+ years of proven, multi discipline design experience in a combination of high-tech, developer and b-to-c design teams.
  • Curiosity, creativity, and ambition. Expensive diploma or not, true talent isn’t always something that can be taught in school. True passion breeds “incredible.” Understanding of design principles and designing for marketing.
  • Proven ability to work within a distributed team.
  • Must own a rich portfolio of relevant work examples – online, print, events, packaging, typography, collateral, iconography, infographics etc. Video production skills and creating assets for online marketing earn bonus points.

jobs.title: C++ Software Engineer with SQL - $45k
jobs.content:
C++ Software Engineer with SQL - $45k


Are you one of top Software Engineers in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 2x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $45,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

Company Description

Devfactory provides enterprise software solutions that deliver business results, performance and scalability while dramatically reducing IT spending. Devfactory's patented solutions decrease IT expenditures by reducing hardware and associated maintenance, leveraging open source technology, and accelerating value delivery to business customers.


Devfactory is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in todays global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Job Description

At Devfactory you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources.


Key responsibilities

Responsibilities will include:

  • Writing and debugging both unit and integration tests for enterprise applications

  • You will be expected to effectively execute the transition of current code to new technologies and update third party components

  • Proactively plan, implement, and maintain DB operational services, backup and recovery.

  • Take ownership of the process of identifying dependencies and performing code reviews, helping us to maintain our standard of excellence throughout the process.

jobs.title: Senior Compliance Program Manager
jobs.content:
Heroku’s security team is responsible for the overall security of the Heroku platform and infrastructure and for compliance with established security policies. We’re looking for a  dedicated and thorough program manager, who understands large cross-functional projects, to join the team.

Reporting to the head of trust for Heroku, the primary focus of this role will be that of program manager for our security and compliance journey. You should have a proven track record of program or project management experience and some familiarity with security, compliance and privacy frameworks such as HIPAA, PCI-DSS, SOX ITGC, ISO 27001, and SOC 2. You’ll need to be comfortable running large scale cross cutting projects which require parallel efforts from dozens of teams. You will work closely with engineering and product management and our compliance engineers to ensure timely delivery of all compliance projects. You will also be responsible for building our relationships with other compliance teams throughout the larger Salesforce family.

If you’re the right person for this job, you take a communicative and collaborative approach to program management. You know how to assess cost and risks, and you’re adept at guiding individual teams in striking a healthy balance between their needs and the needs of the larger program. You will partner with engineering to foster a deep understanding of the meaningful security work driving compliance requirements. You set a high standard in your own work, and also enjoy helping others with their project challenges.

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Manage the compliance programs for Heroku, including HIPAA and PCI efforts currently underway, SSAE 16, SOC and others as they come online.
  • Manage large cross-cutting security development projects
  • Coordinate with all project managers responsible for remediating compliance gaps
  • Manage the relationship with compliance teams throughout Salesforce
  • Drive Heroku’s compliance efforts, both in achieving new certifications and maintaining existing ones.
  • Guiding vision for evidence creation, validation, and assessment workflows.
  • Host customer security and compliance audits

Key competencies:

  • Program/project management experience on large cross-functional projects
  • Software industry knowledge of technical security certifications, such as PCI, HIPAA, SSAE/SOC, etc.
  • Able to work collaboratively across diverse engineering teams and products to meet organizational security goals.
  • Able to effectively communicate compliance and security requirements to diverse teams with differing priorities and experience levels.
  • Able to tailor program status information for the needs of various stakeholders by understanding how they’ll be able to most efficiently consume the information.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills across multiple levels and functions.

Location:

Heroku is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Due to the training nature of this role, we’re seeking a candidate who will be able to work with us here for six months to one year. The security team is fully distributed and this position can convert to 100% remote after the candidate has ramped up on security fundamentals.

jobs.title: Lead Infrastructure Engineer (Data)
jobs.content:
We’re looking for passionate engineers who will join us in reinventing how databases are deployed, used, and protected.

The Department of Data is a team that provides performant data services in a highly dynamic environment. We manage one of the largest collections of databases in the world, and you could have an impact on the developers’ experiences by designing and implementing simple, intuitive workflows for running databases and interacting with their data.

In this role you will work directly on automating operations behind our database-as-a-service platforms, focused specifically on Cassandra operations. You will write tools to reliably operate thousands of servers including automated backups, disaster recovery, high availability  orchestration, monitoring systems, configuration management, security and much more. If you have experience operating Cassandra at scale, have passion for data storage and management, intuition for code maintainability, and care about making customers succeed, get in touch.

You should be familiar with Cassandra operations, and be excited to learn any of these skills:

  • Go, Ruby, Python and Bash
  • Amazon web services (EC2, S3, VPC, and so on)
  • Databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Cassandra and other NoSQL databases)
  • Unix tools and services
  • LXC containerization, Docker
  • Information security
  • RESTful API design and implementation
  • Distributed systems and service-oriented design

While most of the team is located in our San Francisco office, we are open to hiring someone who prefers to work remotely from locations with significant time zone overlap.

jobs.title: Senior Platform Engineer (Cedar)
jobs.content:
Heroku operates the world’s largest PaaS cloud, continuously delivering millions of apps with 6+ million container deployments, 5+ billion routing requests, and 10+ terabytes of application logs per day. Our vision is for developers to focus on their applications and leave operations to us.

Our team members each bring a personal area of expertise, such as containerization, networking, API development, HTTP routing, orchestration, AWS, etc, while also being versed in the entire system from a high level and responsible for its production development and operation. Within our team, engineers are comfortable moving between the technologies, from web app development to infrastructure services. If you don’t know how do something, we’ll make sure you have the time, mentors, and opportunity to learn.

We work in small groups who are heartfelt about our user’s problems. We plan weekly, chat daily, and work closely together. Our team is a remote community with members excited to work together on challenging distributed systems problems. Equality is a core value for Salesforce; it’s at the heart of everything we do and strive to be. That means Equal Opportunity, Equal Advancement and Equal Pay for all. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We hope you are passionate about joining our community of engineers who love to learn, work, and operate a gigantic distributed system, build and sustain a remote culture, and help grow and mentor other engineers.

Your Responsibilities

  • Contribute throughout the full stack, from APIs and web applications to core infrastructure services
  • Develop and operate critical production applications written in Go, Erlang, Elixir, and Ruby
  • Serve on the team’s on-call rotation and respond to production incidents and investigations
  • Contribute to architectural design discussions and technical decisions
  • Ensure that we are continuously raising our standard of engineering excellence by implementing patterns for coding, testing, deploying and supporting

Your Capabilities

  • Proficiency developing in at least one of the following: Ruby, Go, Elixir, or Erlang
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to work effectively with geographically distributed teams and people of various backgrounds

Your Experience

  • Experience developing and operating highly scalable distributed systems
  • Familiarity with AWS (VPC, IAM, CloudFormation, EC2) and Heroku
  • Strong programming and operational experience in one of our domains. Examples include:
    • For Routing: HTTP, SSL, TLS, TCP, ELB, HAProxy, or Nginx
    • For Orchestration: Kubernetes, Mesos, Swarm, or Yarn
    • For Runtimes: LXC, Docker, or Linux
    • For Logging: Syslog, ELK stack, Hadoop, EMR, or Splunk

Bonus Points

  • Experience transitioning from apps to services including skills in NSQ, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Kinesis, Microservices
  • Would rather automate than operate
  • Front-end experience with Ember, Node.js, and HTML5/CSS
  • A good story about a problematic distributed system that you diagnosed and fixed

Location

Heroku is headquartered in San Francisco, California. For this position, we are open to candidates in locations with no more than a two hour time difference from the US Central timezone, given sufficient remote work experience.  This includes the majority of the Americas.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Overview:  The Software Engineer II is responsible to analysis, design, develop and test software solutions for the company’s products.  This position is also responsible to provide maintenance and support to existing code following company’s standards and best code practices. The Software Engineer II, with little help, will be able to abstract requirements to innovate solutions to enhance our products within our environment. 


We offer...



  • The opportunity to work for a well-established, industry leader in local government web design and introduce a highly marketable product that is changing the way citizens interact with their government

  • Competitive compensation, autonomy, workplace perks (free beverages, social events, etc.), and benefits (Health, Dental, 401k) 

  • An informal, "Google-esque", social workplace where enthusiasm and talent are rewarded

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer, Networking Software Systems
jobs.content:
WHAT? A wave of innovation is bringing sweeping changes to networking technology. Virtualization, unimaginable scale, hardware commoditization, and automation are revolutionizing network software.



WHERE? At Amazon we push the boundaries in robustness, fault-tolerance and smart adaptive algorithms that can react intelligently to real-world events. Software engineers on our team contribute to every phase of the development process and deploy scalable software systems worldwide.



WHY THERE? Amazon Web Services (AWS) runs one of the biggest networks in the world. We leverage big data technologies and deep network analytics software to drive network automation, performance, and reliability.



WHY CARE? Make history as a software developer at AWS Networking. We develop software at every level of the stack from front-end user interfaces to low-level embedded software and everything in between. We are a highly motivated, co-operative, and fun loving team of software developers who thrive on solving challenging problems and building large-scale distributed software systems.



Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority / Female / Disability / Vet

Visit www.amazon.jobs for more information.


  • A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent).

  • 3+ years of experience in building production software applications.

  • Software development skills, preferably in Java, C/C++, Ruby and/or Perl in Linux environment.

  • Familiarity with distributed systems, asynchronous messaging, and network protocols.

  • A solid grounding in Computer Science fundamentals, data structures, algorithms, object-oriented design and systems architecture.

  • Problem solving and troubleshooting skills.




  • Knowledge of major protocols, topology design, network hardware and device configuration.

  • 5+ years of experience in building production software applications with focus on efficient back-end components is required.

  • A solid understanding of performance and efficiency issues.

  • Experience with distributed computing and enterprise-wide systems.

  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers.

  • Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills, and make them more effective, product software engineers.

  • Experience influencing software engineering best practices within your team.

  • Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.

  • A strong customer orientation.


**LI-LJ1

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer, AWS Networking
jobs.content:
Amazon is looking for Software Development Engineers to build the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring team.



- You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

- Solving problems at scale excites you.

- You do not implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

- You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

- You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they are a core part of writing great software.

- You do not throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

- You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

- Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

- Ability to gather customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions.

- Strong track record of launching projects of significant complexity.

- Ability to mentor other software developers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

- Experience with software engineering best practices (code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, release and change management).

- Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

- Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

- Proficient at designing software systems, from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to your application’s object model.

- Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.

- Knowledge of at least one scripting language.

- Comfortable with Linux and a good understanding of networking concepts.



- Experience of working in a DevOps team.

- Experience developing robust, highly scalable distributed systems.

aws-sdesdm-ea/ad

jobs.title: Software Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
We at simplesurance are building an innovative and unique cross-selling platform for insurance products. In 30 countries across the world, our technology is used by 1.000+ e-shops including world's biggest insurance companies and smartphone brands.


We are looking for experienced Software Solutions Architects (f/m) to solve design and scale challenges for our cloud based, micro service oriented architecture.


About the job



  • You will produce all the technical design specifications for the new features coming from the Product Team

  • You will create technical tasks for each development team, and prioritize them

  • You will be working in close contact with the QA team to create test specifications


With us…


…you have the chance to gain first experiences within the Start-Up world. With us, you’ll be working together with over 90 teammates from 17 different nations – we are quite multicultural and we love it. And when work should last longer than expected – dinner is on us!

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Imaginary Landscape is seeking a full-time Software Engineer who will work on a technical team that specializes in building, deploying, and maintaining Django web applications.



About Us:



Imaginary Landscape is a web development agency that specializes in Django and Python.  We've been hard-core Python developers since 1998, and have been Djangonauts since 2006.  Over the years, we've built social networking sites, eCommerce sites, banking sites, hospital network sites, sites for startups, and more.  Our loft offices are in the Andersonville neighborhood on Chicago’s north side, the work atmosphere is relaxed and we offer strong benefits.  


About the Position:


You will frequently interact with Rackspace, AWS Cloud servers, Digital Ocean, and Heroku servers, as well as physical servers, in a variety of different server configurations and utilizing a variety of Linux-based operating systems.  You'll be using many modern web-dev tools, such as Nginx, PostgresSQL, MySQL, Redis, Memcached, Saltstack, Ansible, Fabric, Supervisord, Git, and more.  You'll have the opportunity to interact with numerous 3rd party APIs.  You may have opportunities to work with the latest front-end technologies, such as Node.js, Gulp/Grunt, React.js, Angular.js, etc.  And more specifically, you will become an expert in Django.  If you are excited by this, we'd be excited to speak with you!

jobs.title: SDE - AWS Application Engineer | Time Inc.
jobs.content: Cloud Application Engineer for the Ecommerce and Enterprise Solutions team will be responsible for development and enhancement of our enterprise applications and services both in the cloud and on premise. jobs.title: Mid-level ASP.NET MVC C# web developer
jobs.content:
We work with a wide range of clients to design and build custom websites tailored to each project's requirements. We are a Chicago-based boutique firm with a reputation for creating easy-to-use and highly functional web-based solutions.


Join our team of talented designers and software developers and you will quickly become an active contributor with new and existing clients. Whether you're implementing a dynamic website based on our content management system, customizing our web-based association management system, or building a cool data visualization, you'll be working with fun and motivated colleagues, great clients, and making a difference with your software development and technology skills.


Qualifications



  • An interest in applying technology to solve real world problems

  • Self-motivated, independent, and capable of adapting to meet client needs

  • A good communicator (with colleagues and clients) and team player

  • Eagerness to learn from colleagues and to learn new technologies

  • Practical perspective and ability to balance innovation and productivity


About us



  • Chicago-based team of 15 software developers and designers

  • We've been solely focused on web development for 20 years

  • All members of our team work out of our loop office

  • Casual, creative, results-oriented work environment

  • Flexible work schedule

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Looking for hungry, ingenious, and hands-on full-stack Node.js web developers to work on the next-generation of IoT products.


As Kano continues to grow, we’re looking for a full-time full-stack Node.js developers to join the team.  This person should be a hungry, ingenious, and a hands-on full-stack Node.js web developer to work on API Development, IoT projects and Web Applications (yes, even standalone Web Apps). You’ll work to build our last generation creative coding products, that allow beginners of all ages to create apps, drawings and .... more exciting things we can’t yet reveal.


Our stack includes technologies such as Node 4/ES6 (both API and IoT development), Express, Socket.io, MongoDB, Redis, Web Components, Polymer, Angular, VueJS, HTML5, CSS3.


This role is a unique opportunity to prototype and build new applications and creative games while integrating new features into a fast-growing online platform, where thousands of kids around the world are creating and sharing millions of lines of code – in the form of classic games, art projects, and Minecraft megaliths, with more to come.


What you should expect by working at Kano?



  • Work in a development team that are building the next generation IoT products

  • Play with new tech and gadgets to explore new avenues of innovation

  • We tend to enjoy theme parks but also open for new ideas

  • We give a £2,000 annual benefits package which can be used as reimbursement for any form of personal and professional development

  • You will be part of the company’s Stock Option plan (we’ll tell you why EMI is important)

  • Work with exceptional and diverse group of multinational people

  • Playful office environment in East London (we love flying drones and play table tennis)

jobs.title: Sr. Ruby Software Developers
jobs.content:
PhishMe is seeking professional and experienced Rails developers to join its software engineering team.  Our product line is growing and constantly improving, so we need some really talented people who have worked well on Scrum teams and want to do so again to build truly world class software.


If adding features, extending capabilities, and actually delivering working and fully tested software excites you, then we want to talk with you!  We’re looking for software developers, not just coders.


The successful candidate will have professional work experience (internships or professional jobs held as a student are valid). This is a full-time position working for PhishMe, Inc in the Leesburg, VA office.




Successful Applicants Must Be:



  • A self-starter who is willing to take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance

  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of both collocated and remote teams in a dynamic business environment

  • Comfortable working independently or paired and is able to escalate problems when necessary

  • Able to communicate effectively in writing and orally.

  • Eager to learn and able to understand and apply new things relatively quickly

  • Willing to mentor and guide fellow team members kindly and constructively

  • Detail-oriented

  • Willing to work for eight solid hours per day where at least five overlap with 8am to 6pm EST

  • Available to work off-hours occasionally

  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events

jobs.title: React Developer / Web Designer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a passionate Software Engineer who eats, sleeps and breathes code.  The kind of person who dreams about perfectly encapsulated objects, elegant method signatures, and consistent indentation.  Are you hacking away on hobby projects on the weekend?  Do you contribute regularly to Open Source projects on GitHub?  You know who you are.  You couldn’t imagine doing anything else for a living.  We want to harness your passion to drive our business forward.


We have multiple development projects that we need to get over the finish line this year.  These projects include a Customer Portal, Back-End Administrative Dashboard, Feature-rich Scheduling App, Automated Workflow Engine, and a customized CRM/ERP implementation.  We’re a polyglot shop so you must have a wide variety of experiences from Windows to Linux and an assortment of software languages and technologies.  You must be able to pick up new skills quickly as things are constantly evolving and we like to stay on the cutting edge.


We need a sharp, creative, prolific front-end developer who specializes in React.js.  The components you develop will become the foundation for many dynamic and interactive web apps.  You must be up to date on ES6/7, Babel, Webpack, etc.  Also, a rock-solid understanding of the React Component lifecycle is a must, and you should be able to integrate 3rd-party libraries into this cycle in a Reactful way.  We want to make use of animations and transitions so in-depth knowledge of react-motion & gsap is essential.


The second half of this position is related to Web Design.  We need an artist to help us create beautiful websites with stunning CSS and custom graphics.  We are tired of the same templates that you see everywhere and want to differentiate ourselves with uniquely designed pages.  You'll need to leverage all the latest features of CSS to bring our applications to life.  We are always in need of custom graphics so you'll need to be able to sketch out ideas quickly and then translate those into gorgeous graphics and vector art using Adobe.

jobs.title: Programmer Analyst II
jobs.content:
Programmer Analyst II – Business Technologies Systems (BSD)


What IS Business Technologies Systems (BTS) Development does…


The IS BTS Development team is responsible for providing re-usable front-end components, libraries and services and the support needed to allow teams to deliver an integrated look and feel to our 12,000 branch teams. By researching technology advancements, we recommend and help implement solutions that fit Edward Jones' business needs. We're seeking an exceptionally talented person to provide full lifecycle systems development.


What you'll do …



  • Innovate – Proactively seek technical improvements and take the initiative to communicate and implement solutions

  • Lead – Stay informed of trends and provide technical leadership to others on systems development and design

  • Collaborate – Participate in and represent BTS Development in cross−functional groups across the IS division and the firm to continually advance the firm's technology solutions and take our systems to the next level

  • Strategize – Advise teams on the effective use of technology within the enterprise architecture tools, especially front-end technologies, methodologies, best practices, processes and standards

  • Design – Perform lead analyst role to design, develop, test and support complex enterprise applications using object-oriented analysis and design principles

  • Implement – Ensure tools and best practice processes are in place for technologies

  • Mentor – Provide guidance, training and mentorship on the business impact of the systems supported, technical systems design, development of best practices, and IS processes and tools

jobs.title: Senior PHP Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an excellent Senior PHP Developer (polyglot) to join our growing team in West London.


Working in this role, you will deliver wide range of high profile projects and features in collaboration with Product team and develop and maintain code base of high quality, security, and performance.


Developers choose the tools that work best for them - for instance, we have a mix of Linux and Mac workstations in the team. We are adopting and adapting agile development techniques such as test-driven development, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.


We hold regular retrospectives to improve our working environment and lightning talks to share cool ideas whether work-related or not. We expect developers to be generalising specialists, ready at the drop of a hat to refine an algorithm, write a tricky integration test, tune a SQL query, or discuss feature nuances with a product manager.


Our technology stack includes PHP, node.js, Python, Scala, Puppet, and early attempts in microservice architecture, so there’s plenty of opportunity if you’re up for the challenge.


About You:



  • self motivated person with passion for writing quality, well designed code

  • you believe unittests are mandatory, and your design makes it possible and easy

  • you love helping others, and when needed you don't have trouble collaborating with people outside of technology team

  • you prefer to rely on data when making decisions rather than a popular opinion

  • you take pride and responsibility in getting your feature/project into production


Main Responsibilities:



  • Work on variety of projects, ecommerce platform, backoffice/internal systems, there's something for everyone

  • Ensure code is of high quality, secure and performant based on Development Guidelines as defined by Development Lead

  • Deliver tasks according to agreed timelines

  • Submit unit and functional tests with your code changes

  • active participation in agile ceremonies and peer code review process

jobs.title: Product Engineer
jobs.content:
Alluvium is currently seeking a Product Engineer to join our team, and work directly with our world-class software engineers and data scientists to develop and deliver engaging products across a wide range of platforms and browsers.


We are a tight knit team and highly collaborative team where everyone is expected to participate in product development. Our Product Engineer will — among other things — travel with the team to customer on-sites to conduct user interviews and user-centric design sessions; develop wireframe UX/UI mockups for new product features and deployments; and, implement and revise web-based user interfaces and touch points.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.content:
The Data Engineering team at Infectious Media forms the core of the Platform team, linking all the other departments together and facilitating simple, fast and robust data exchange between each and every system we use. We are looking for someone to support the smooth day-to-day running of our data systems and contribute to ongoing development in the department.


This position within the team provides someone with great data manipulation skills to manage and process the vastly increasing data volumes we are seeing (we record more than 200 million unique events each day), whilst at the same time manage the process of switching from a backend data driven process (where data is processed hourly or daily) to one where data is processed live in real time. Infectious Media are leaders in the Real Time Bidding Industry and data is the key to the cutting edge technology that we use. This role is essential for ensuring we use data in the best and most innovative ways possible. 


Key Responsibilities:



  • Managing the Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) processes of the company to ensure they remain efficient and robust

  • Understanding the data warehousing needs of the company to help identify weaknesses in the current architecture and suggest improvements

  • Identifying and resolving data issues in a timely manner.

  • Maintaining a broad knowledge of all data intelligence systems the company utilises.

  • Helping to improve the efficiency and reliability of data systems and processes by identifying areas that would benefit from automation.

  • Working with other platform Analysts and Managers to support the introduction of new technologies and data streams.

  • Working with the Insights team to support their understanding of the company’s data warehouses.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Infectious Media are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer in order to maintain, develop and enhance our robust cloud based infrastructure that supports a high throughput, low latency application. The role also involves maintaining and improving our existing cloud infrastructure to ensure all our production systems are robust, stable and able to service a growing number of clients in this fast moving, award winning company. Managing data forms the backbone of the role (the infrastructure needing to support the ingestion and processing of 6Tb of data a day, currently) and the development and implementation of smart solutions for analysing and deriving benefit from this data is something that is a regular challenge.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Work closely with our Engineering team to maintain and extend our Google Cloud Engine cloud based infrastructure to a robust, scalable and fault tolerant platform for our data warehouse and business intelligence systems

  • Ensure best practice tools and technologies are used to maximize uptime and recover from downtime

  • Help design and implement new infrastructure to deal with the optimisation of real time bidding (RTB), with a focus on supporting the Data Science team by providing them with an environment to test their algorithms

  • Enhance our data warehouse and ETL systems to handle the processing of more data more frequently, specifically to improve data analysis and optimisation

  • Support the infrastructure during periods of downtime, both by reducing the number of occurrences of downtime, and by reducing the time taken to resolve issues, as well as ensuring adequate team support during holiday periods.

  • Maintain the bleeding edge mentality at the company by attending relevant conferences/ meet-ups to ensure we are aware of and using the very best techniques and technologies.

  • Consult on, guide and implement the company’s cloud infrastructure strategy over the next few years.

jobs.title: Watson Cloud Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description


Ready to change the way the world works? IBM Watson is ushering in the next phase of Cognitive Computing and in doing so is tackling some of humanity’s most challenging problems - e.g. revolutionizing how doctors research cancer or transforming how businesses engage with their customers. We have an exciting opportunity for software engineers to join our fast growing, highly visible Watson North American development organization
As an IBM Watson Cloud developer you will bring Watson solutions and services to the cloud. The ideal candidate will be passionate about the potential of cloud computing, and about building elegant software solutions, customer centric products, and utilize agile development processes. We are looking for cloud developers who are motivated and successful in delivering high quality technology products/services in a high growth environment where priorities shift quickly. Sample of the types of experience we are looking for are: • Micro-Service Oriented Architecture  design/implementation 
• Large scale systems design/implementation 
• Software as a Service offerings 
• Cloud computing 
• Service registration and discovery 
• Distributed logging stack .. eg  ELK. (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) • Representational State Transfer (REST)ful services 
• Systems Development Java Distributed computing 
• Highly available systems, and performance engineering is an advantage. 
• Continuous Delivery  
• Distributed datastores: Casandra, Redis, ZooKeeper, Swift 
• Java web application development: front end and back end solutions. Java, jQuery, Dojo, CSS, Ajax, JMX, Servlets, SQL. 
• DevOps 
• Multi-tenancy design/implementation
• Deployment technology experience in areas such as containers, Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos
• Securing data in cloud environments



 Come join us on our journey...

jobs.title: BMW Group - Senior SW Specialist - Infotainment Head Unit
jobs.content:
A SMOOTH-RUNNING SYSTEM NEEDS A SMOOTH-RUNNING TEAM.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR MODERN INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY.


Networks are about more than IT Networks. They are about connecting people who make things possible. Close teamwork is key to understanding how IT can help integrate processes into systems. We put this insight into practice, and it's part of our success. We want to stay ahead in the future, so our team is currently seeking a:


Senior System Software Specialist - Infotainment Head Unit Software (m/f)
Job reference: 104042


BMW Car IT offers you the chance to take up an interesting role in automotive software development. You will work in an international team at BMW Car IT, which acts as a company-internal vendor of software. Your role is to work in the software architecture team for our next-generation Linux based automotive infotainment head unit system.


Your key tasks and responsibilities consists in:
- Investigating on target transversal system software issues.
- Defining system configuration for transversal system services.
- Performing code reviews to reinforce compliance of design with overall software architecture.
- Checking sw design implementation and proposing improvements.
- Implementing dedicated tools to support these investigations.
- Analyzing root cause for problems found in R&D testing phase.
- Very close cooperation with architects, SW developers and test engineers.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.title: SDE - Sr. DevOps Architect; Multimedia  | TimeInc.
jobs.content:
The successful candidate is passionate about building world-class tools for world-class photo and video content producers. As the Senior Multimedia DevOps engineer, you will be part of the team that is at the center of building the technology for Time Inc.’s photo and video asset management and workflow systems.



Responsibilities:
• Act as the primary engineer for the team, working to develop systems and user experiences for internal-facing products.
• Work with end users on resolving escalated issues on supported systems; participate in on-call rotation.
• Familiarity with asset management systems: SCC Mediaserver & Mediafactory, Mediabeacon.
• Develop against 3rd party APIs to integrate various internal systems; familiarity with Aspera Connect API.
• Create documentation regarding code deployment and support.
• Build dashboards for monitoring storage, memory, CPU on local Windows and Linux infrastructure, setup automation deployments of server updates and patches.

jobs.title: Web Developer, Harvard Law School
jobs.content:
The Harvard Library Innovation Lab (LIL) is looking for a dynamic and thoughtful developer that will contribute deeply to our web archiving effort, Perma.cc.

Located in the Harvard Law Library, LIL is a fun and collaborative lab working to make libraries better by exploring the countless, dimly lit pathways that connect libraries to the larger world. We are a small but active team of thinkers and doers. Please see our website at http://librarylab.law.harvard.edu to get a sense of our current projects and activities.

LIL’s projects can range from large to small, and can bring immediate benefit or prototype the future. A great deal of passion and creativity is required, as well as the ability to work collaboratively on long-term and short-term projects with a great team. A good design sense and user-centricity are important. Proficiency in JavaScript or Python is expected, and familiarity with web archiving tools and standards is helpful.

While broad collaboration is highly encouraged, this role will primarily direct energy into Perma.cc. Perma.cc has an exciting future and a tremendous amount of positive momentum.

•    Design, develop, test, and document enhancements to Perma.cc
•    Work with design experts to ensure that enhancements are highly usable and are visual gold
•    Be an endless stream of ideas - both good and bad
•    Have a bias for action – we expect you to build your good and bad ideas quickly. We think and we DO.
•    Collaborate and bring great energy to an existing team
•    Work closely with librarians in the Law School Library and the designers, developers, lawyers, and freewheeing minds in the Lab

jobs.title: Javascript Games Developer Relocation to Gibraltar.
jobs.content:
What would be your role?


Here at Casumo we pride ourselves on our products pushing the expectations of the industry and standing out in the crowd. You will be joining a team with a goal to push the online casino experience further into unexplored territory than ever before.


As part of the team you will collaborate daily with game designers, artists, math-magicians and players, participating fully in the creative process. We don’t work in silos, and don’t pass responsibility; build something great and take it all the way to the players. We welcome you to show us the latest rendering tricks, get stuck into the architecture or optimise our build steps and deployment flow, either directly or by giving feedback on pull requests. We share ownership of everything we create together.


As part of a new studio working on greenfield projects you will have an exciting opportunity and a great impact on its future. The skills and creativity of our team in Malta is here to support, and looking forward to your visit. Our brand new office in Gibraltar has a seat waiting for you. Come and destroy boredom with us.

jobs.title: [Senior Mobile Developer Android]
jobs.content:
Your role @ Travian Games:


You will be working with a new dedicated team of engineers in Munich (no remote position!) building and improving our existing and future native mobile apps.


Your job will be to



  • Design, implement and maintain Features for existing and future apps

  • Work closely with UI artists, game designers and backend engineers to determine how a given feature can be implemented

  • Document your code and share insights

  • Assist colleagues working on related backend services, e.g. Cloud Messaging, In-App Billing

  • Maintain and improve continuous integration and delivery infrastructure and processes

  • Be a central contact point in the company for Android-related questions

jobs.title: Bitcoin/Blockchain;  Server-side Engineer
jobs.content: Design and development of all aspects of back-end systems used for Bitcoin exchange, design and development of APIs for the web and apps, development of new products, etc.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Full Stack Developer that is eager to work on some of the best work of his/her life. This position will focus on the User Interface portion of the stack, but the ideal candidate should also have a monstrous appetite to learn and work on every aspect of software development. Tasks will include researching new techniques/frameworks, building new APIs/standalone apps, brainstorming creative solutions to tough technical problems, and automating deployments. 



Responsibilities:


Working with the product team to design, build, and deploy user interfaces


Improving and adding features to existing applications


Troubleshooting client issues


Maintaining a robust test-suite

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.content:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND - full relocation and visa sponsorship provided.

Overview:

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it's 30°+ outside, our engineers don't sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there - and get your career going places, too.

Responsibilities:
  • Provide problems and analysis results with valuable insights for management
  • Work closely with Business to identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using different techniques and tools such as R studio or Tableau
  • Analyze and optimize data usage, and precise for more data capturing if needed
  • Propose actionable solutions and options to solve problems


Qualifications:
  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering
  • At least 3-years in Data Analyst position or otherwise in projects involving big data
  • Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. T-SQL commands, Tableau and MS Excel
  • Must be data savvy and love crunching numbers
  • Strong analytical skills and excellent demonstrative ability in collection of data and analysis of trends in order to predict the conclusions and recommendations
  • Experience in R studio and data modeling is a plus
  • Fluent in English with strong communication skills

jobs.title: Development Manager - Asia's Leading E-Commerce Platform - BKK
jobs.content:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND - full relocation and visa provided.

Overview:

The development manager role at Agoda is one of the most significant and challenging roles at the company. The right candidate should both be extremely hands on, technically excellent and solid engineering principles as well as exhibiting strong leadership and people development skills. We are looking for world class development managers to lead our website engineering team and bring it to where it belongs: the number one spot.

Responsibilities:

The hands on part of the job is fundamental. Whilst you may not be expected to code, it's important to have a love of engineering and a passion for building things. Staying in touch with where the industry is going is a must as well as having strong opinions about how systems must be engineered and maintained. Our company believes in full stack engineering and as such this should mean you have solid experience in all parts of the technology stack: infrastructure, client-side, back-end, performance, data and others.

As a technology company we have to keep up with the latest ideas and innovations and make key choices when to adopt, when to follow and when to innovate. Previous experience of making the right choices will be required as you will be responsible for the technical direction of our key asset: the Agoda website.

Despite our investment and belief in technology, people are still our greatest asset. The right candidate will have a keen interest in developing people: inspiring those around them so they can achieve their potential. Being able to bring A-players such as yourself from outside and integrating them into the business will also be important.

Qualifications:

Skills:
  • Extremely proficient in an object orientated language (C#, java, Scala)
  • Extremely proficient in modern coding practices (dependency injection, design patterns)
  • Client side technologies (javascript, SASS, html)
  • Back-end development (MVC, APIs, data retrieval)
  • Proficient in lower level engineering (Garbage collection, context switching, threading)
  • Extremely proficient in automatic testing (Nunit, Selenium, Mocha)
  • Good understanding of Internet technologies (HTTP, SSL, TCP)


Qualifications:
  • Passionate about technology and the Internet
  • Must have worked in a successful agile development team
  • Be an inspiring leader; what will make your engineers go the extra mile?
  • Must have run engineering teams before, teams no smaller than 6 people


If you feel you are the right candidate to take us to the next level then get in touch! Agoda is full of like minded people who demand success and ensure we reach it,

We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available.

jobs.title: This is far from the usual developer or sysadmin role
jobs.content:
We offer a full-time position as a Cloud Architect in our small and relaxed team in Bjørvika, in the heart of Oslo.


Oslo is currently one of the fastest-growing cities in Europe. Situated between mountain ranges and at the head of the beautiful Oslofjord, the city has everything to offer in terms of outdoor activities. The recent years’ boom in everything from underground music, niche art, tasty microbrewery beers, the vibrant tech community with lots of meetup groups and several hacker- and makerspaces, means there is always something to do.


As one of our Cloud Architects you will, together with our experts in cloud technology who come from various backgrounds, work on projects of varying duration, complexity and technical environments. You will also have a chance to work with a variety of high-profile customers from several industries.


Day-to-day work can be anything from implementing configuration management infrastructure, to taking a step back and giving design recommendations to a technical team.

jobs.title: Software Developers - Bangkok - Finance IT Development
jobs.content:
Agoda, Asia's Leading OTA (Online Travel Agent) is looking for top talent to relocate to Bangkok, Thailand - full visa and relocation provided.

Overview:


Are you:
  • An application developer with a background in finance?
  • Open to working abroad?
  • Strong technically and hungry to learn new tools, languages and technologies?
  • Looking to work for a fast-paced internet company?
  • Based in Bangkok or interested in moving here?


About Agoda

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen. We love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition.

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

What's stopping you from getting in touch?


Responsibilities:


Agoda is looking for Software Developers to work on financial payment and reconciliation systems. These systems are the backbone of our company, ensuring that hotels get paid on time for each customer booking. We are currently expanding the team to create and scale these systems, and we're looking for experienced developers to come and join us.


Qualifications:


What we are looking for
  • You have 2+ years' experience under your belt developing financial or other reliability-critical applications that run in a production environment.
  • You write code that is well designed, testable and maintainable.
  • You are passionate about the craft of software development and constantly work to improve your knowledge and skills.
  • You have deep experience in one or more of C#, C++ or Java.
  • You have experience working with SQL and large data sets.
  • You have great written and spoken English communication skills, and are happy working with developers, QA and business users.


If you have any experience or interest in the following it would be useful:

- The .NET/Microsoft development ecosystem

- NoSQL and caching solutions

- Web development frameworks

- Tools such as Git, Puppet and Jenkins

What we can offer
  • Work for a profitable business with the atmosphere of a start-up.
  • Work on interesting problems with a high degree of autonomy.
  • Work as part of a team of experienced Scrum developers.
  • Competitive salary and benefits.


This is a full time position working on site in our offices in downtown Bangkok, Thailand.





We are happy to receive CV from both international & local candidates as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible candidates.

jobs.title: Senior Data Scientist  / Team Lead - Work in Thailand
jobs.content:
We're Hiring Senior Data Scientists to relocate to Bangkok, Thailand

Full visa and relocation provided!

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it's 30°+ outside, our engineers don't sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there - and get your career going places, too.

Maintaining this growth requires an incredible amount of data, a superior IT infrastructure, and world class talent to bring it all together.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop predictive models and algorithms to support business decisions
  • Work with the business domains to help shape the right questions
  • Mine our large & growing volumes of data to find actionable insights to drive ongoing improvements
  • Be part of a production oriented team


Qualifications:

Do you have what it takes?
  • At least 3 years working as a statistician / analyst / data scientist
  • At least a BSc in Statistics / Computer Science / Physics / Operational Research / Math or other quantitative field (a PhD is a major plus)
  • Leadership skills and experience in leading data science projects
  • Good knowledge of what's "Under the hood" of statistical methods (and preferably knowing how to utilize them in R or equivalent).
  • Proficiency in at least 1 scripting/programming language like Python, C#, Java, C++, or Scala (our native language so a major plus)
  • Knowledge of SQL a plus
  • A good balance between theory and practice
  • A strong desire to learn
  • The desire to keep up with the latest technologies and stay ahead of the curve
  • Great communication and interpersonal skills; a good sense of humor is always a plus
  • Mindset of a team player
  • Independent and quick learner


We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

jobs.title: Hadoop Solution Architect
jobs.content:
CSC Big Data and Analytics is a high priority incubator unit with in the Emerging Business Group with focus on helping our customers accelerate their path to innovation through the introduction of breakthrough analytic, big data platform and data science consulting capabilities. We are currently looking for a Hadoop Engineer to join our team.



What you will do:



  • Solution Architecture Role will be responsible for developing Hadoop based solutions to support typical use cases such as data ingestion (ETL), machine learning analytics, data archiving, text analytics, Internet of Things (IOT) and reporting.

  • Responsibilities include gathering requirements, designing a solution, determining the effort to implement the solution, and possibly leading the team to implement the solution.

  • Document solutions for long term support

  • Travel to client site as needed

  • Assist client support team with Solution related issue resolution

jobs.title: Senior System Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior System Engineer, you will launch and maintain the infrastructure for large-scale websites all over the world. 


At Rocket, no two days are the same. The following tasks will be part of your new role:



  • You will ensure sustainable availability, performance and scalability of the infrastructure across multiple continents and regions to help our companies to get started



  • Manage our server infrastructure and work together with hosting providers



  • Ensure automated system and software deployments



  • Support our development team with test and staging environments

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - IT Platform
jobs.content:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND - full visa and relocation package provided if successful.

Agoda Overview:

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen. We love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition.

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Are you:
  • Top-notch developer with extensive knowledge in Scala, Java or C#?
  • Has strong background in design and implementation of Scalable architecture and a good understanding of Algorithms, Data structures and design patterns?
  • Hungry to learn new tools, languages and technologies?
  • Based in Bangkok or interested in moving here?


Responsibilities:

Agoda Platform team is looking for a developers to work on mission critical systems that deals with the designing and development of a system that serves millions of users a day.

Qualifications:

What we are looking for
  • You will have 3+ years' experience under your belt developing performance-critical applications that run in a production environment.
  • You have extensive knowledge in Scala, Java or C#
  • You have RDBMS knowledge (SQL Server, Oracle, MySql or other)
  • Some plus if you have knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSQL (especially, but not only Cassandra), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ), Play framework, Akka library and/or Hadoop.
  • You have a Good command of the English language.
  • You are passionate about the craft of software development and constantly work to improve your knowledge and skills.


What we can offer
  • Work for a profitable business with the atmosphere of a fun start-up.
  • Work on interesting problems with a high degree of autonomy.
  • Competitive salary and benefits.


This is a full time position working on site in our offices in downtown Bangkok, Thailand. We are open to candidates from all nationalities and will help with relocation if you are not currently based here.

jobs.title: Agile Test Engineer
jobs.content:
Remote working (UK based) is an option, as is working from one of our amazing co-working hubs. 


Do you embrace being a fully integrated member of an agile team, who will rely on you and your attention to detail to derive additional, intuitive and exploratory tests that ensure we continue to deliver the service our customers trust and expect from us?


Primary responsibilities are:



  • For each project, write a clear and concise test strategy (including quality gates/criteria), based on functional and non-functional requirements (including security and vulnerability assessment), delivered using the appropriate level of manual and automated testing

  • For each requirement, ensure it is well defined, elaborated and testable, and has agreed acceptance criteria and outline tests

  • For each design, during creation, understand the implications for the test suite (or framework), and help refine the manual or automated tests and their outline implementation

  • To write accurate and concise test scripts (at both the service and UI level) that trace back to requirements

  • To execute tests in line with the test strategy / release cycle, raising bug/defect reports as required

  • To report on test progress, to inform a go/no-go decision (based on defined quality criteria)


Secondary responsibilities are:



  • Assist in the maintenance of automated test frameworks, whilst following applicable software engineering practices; such as configuration management, change management – both project and generic-, necessary and sufficient design (but not ‘no design’), and peer reviews

  • Share knowledge, expertise and best practice with other members of the team, including the application and selection of appropriate tools

  • Enhance processes relating to all areas of software and test engineering

  • Develop strategies for testing against non-functional requirements, e.g. security/vulnerability, performance, usability and accessibility

jobs.title: Hadoop Spark Architect
jobs.content:
CSC Big Data and Analytics is a high priority incubator unit with in the Emerging Business Group with focus on helping our customers accelerate their path to innovation through the introduction of breakthrough analytic, big data platform and data science consulting capabilities. We are currently looking for a Hadoop Engineer to join our team.



What you will do:



  • Solution Architecture Role will be responsible developing Spark based solutions to support near real-time data ingestion, analytics, and reporting.

  • Responsibilities include gathering requirements, designing a solution, determining the effort to implement the solution, and possibly leading the team to implement the solution.

  • Document solutions for long term support

  • Travel to client site as needed

  • Assist client support team with Spark related issue resolution

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Remote and/or On-Site 


We need brilliant people who love using cutting edge technologies like HTML5 and CSS3 to create engaging responsive websites.


This role is someone who is great at taking any design from photoshop and turn it into a great CSS/HTML page that millions of customers will use. We affectionately term this role a Slice 'n Dicer.

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
Remote and/or On-Site (US Only Please)


We need brilliant people who love using cutting edge technologies to create engaging mobile applications on Android and/or iOS, using Java and/or ObjC. If you are good at either, you will be a great fit. Our primary development platform is Xamarin, but no prior experience required.


This role is for someone who loves mobile development and building great apps. You will work in an exciting fast paced team environment to ship new mobile products. Brainstorm, estimate, and develop new applications across a variety of platforms. The applications that you build will be used on millions of consumer phones and tablets, as well as millions embedded Android tablets.


*Required Drug Test before hired.

jobs.title: iOS Developer - Come work with the best in Thailand
jobs.content:
Please note this role is based in Bangkok, Thailand - full visa and relocation provided

Overview:

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia, and as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Despite the success and size of the company, we still operate with a start-up feel; you get to be part of choosing where and what you're working on, the technologies and how we solve the business concerns.

We understand the value of a great mobile experience for our customers and are constantly investing in mobile app development. Right now we are on the finishing lines of launching an exciting update to our iOS and Android apps - a totally re engineered and redesigned experience - built from the ground up with the newest technologies. We have a road-map to extend this significantly and are constantly pushing to become the world's best.

We are looking for engineers who love and understand native apps and seek the challenge of using cutting edge technologies to create robust, smooth and beautiful apps. You will be expected to deliver high quality, well-designed and thoroughly tested code within tight time constraints; so a solid understanding of modern app design principles and familiarity with unit-testing will be crucial. You are also expected to be fluent in explaining and justifying your design decisions. Expertise in MVVM and reactive programming is a major plus, but we expect candidates to be able to master these and many other technologies as we go.

In addition, we expect superb attention to detail on the UI and performance of code produced. We believe a high-performance back-end is not enough, we also have to deliver the best possible UI and UX experience to our customers when it comes to layout, animations and transitions.

Ultimately, we are looking for real technologists who have a great passion for mobile apps. We want innovative ideas on how to enhance our products using latest cutting edge technologies, and if needed, create our own new standard.


Responsibilities:

Candidates will join the mobile app scrum team and as part of their day-to-day responsibilities will:
  • Come up with best suitable technology and architecture for their tasks
  • Work closely with API team to understand back-end functionality and architecture
  • Communicate constantly with product owner to understand and measure business values of developed features
  • Contribute ideas (technological and product) to enhance the overall app experience

Qualifications:





Technologies of interest (we are not expecting you to have them all):
  • Objective-C / Swift
  • Cocoa Touch
  • ReactiveCocoa
  • Typhoon
  • OCMock, Specta, Expecta
  • HTTP, HTTPS, REST API
  • AFNetworking, SDWebImage
  • Bug and crash reporting solutions
  • Tracking (Google Analytics and more)
  • Jenkins


Please note this role is open to both Thai and International candidates, however a good standard of English (both written and spoken) is a must.

jobs.title: PHP Utvikler med Magento erfarenhet
jobs.content:
Vi søker etter en PHP-utvikler med lang erfaring fra Magento både på frontend og backend-utvikling. Arbeidsoppgavene er primært å utvikle nye nettbutikker, vedlikeholde og oppdatere eldre,  eksisterende nettbutikker. Det finnes også planer for å utvikle og distribuere egenutviklede extensions.
