Vi planlegger å vokse innen webbutikk-utvikling og vil bli ledende innen området. Vi søker derfor en dyktig medarbeider som kan hjelpe oss mot dette målet.

Interesse og kunnskap innen IT / Server er meget verdsatt da dette går hånd i hånd med flere av arbeidsoppgavene.

jobs.title: PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Be a part of an expert team and start your career as a PHP developer.

Our IT team is comprised of experts who support our portfolio companies in their growth phases as they scale in Europe and worldwide.

Our goal is to equip our ventures with scalable, sustainable and permanent IT systems for their optimal development. In the past, we have helped to scale the IT infrastructure of several successful companies such as Tirendo, Contorion, PetsDeli and nu3.

Besides working and learning from experts of all fields, you can expect a versatile working environment that is characterized by open communication, willingness to improve and focus on personal development.

Your colleagues are experts in their area, and through open communication we welcome suggestions and further development.


Your tasks:



  • Professional development of scalable IT systems for and with our ventures

  • Selection of appropriate technologies and architecture discussions within our team

  • Programming clean, testable code

  • Quality assurance through testing and code reviews

  • Sharing of knowledge and willingness to learn

  • Personal and professional development


We look forward to getting to know you learn about your ideas in detail. Your knowledge will be comprehensively used as a basis in a Backend, Full Stack or DevOp position.

jobs.title: Infrastructure Software Developer / DevOps Engineer - Bangkok
jobs.content:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND - full relocation and visa provided.

About us

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. As a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world and maintaining this position requires an incredible amount of data, a superior IT infrastructure, and world class talent to bring it all together. Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. We love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition.

What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

For our team in Bangkok, we are looking for a Software Developer/DevOps Engineer to improve the automation of an IT infrastructure that spans multiple continents with one of the largest OpenStack clusters in the world.

Responsibilities/Key skills:
  • Design and develop automation software for infrastructure services that helps drive efficiency in Agoda's IT infrastructure including OS deployments, software installation, systems monitoring and reporting etc.
  • Work with stakeholders (IT Infrastructure management/team members, software development managers, data teams) to gather requirements and develop tools to support the needs of the infrastructure organization.
  • Proactively document and train operations staff on the tools developed


Qualifications:
  • At least 3 years' software development experience
  • Experienced with languages/scripting such as python, ruby, bash, powershell etc.
  • A good knowledge of web development frameworks, programming libraries and protocols such as django, flask, jquery, HTML, CSS, AJAX, RESTful APIs etc
  • Familiar with database development/administration. Knowledge of (or willingness to learn) NoSQL databases (Elasticsearch, Cassandra) would be beneficial.
  • Knowledge of OpenStack operation and API's is advantageous
  • Systems/DevOps experience in:
    • Knowledge of Linux and Linux tools including scripting
    • Configuration Management (Puppet, Ansible and Salt Stack)
    • General Networking (switches, routing)
    • High availability
    • Monitoring services (Sensu, Nagios, logstash, graphite)
    • RESTful and API services
    • Virtualization (KVM is preferred)
    • Understanding of Auth/Directory services
    • Understanding of Storage (RAID etc)
  • Proficiency in developer supporting tools such as SVN, Git, CVS etc.) is advantageous
  • Familiar with IT Operations/Service management (such as ITIL, DevOps, Microsoft Operations Framework)
  • Experience collaborating with developers and operations in DevOps enabled environments.
  • Strong analytical skills, eager to learn new things
  • Experience working in a large enterprise organization and dynamic environment.
  • Able to work under pressure and deliver projects on time.
  • Self-motivated, approachable, and adaptable and have excellent communication skills (both written and verbal).


Do you have what it takes?
  • A strong desire to learn.
  • The desire to keep up with the latest technologies and stay ahead of the curve.
  • Great communication and interpersonal skills; a good sense of humor is always a plus.
  • Mindset of a team player.
  • The ability to communicate clearly in spoken and written in English.



We welcome applications from both local and international candidates - full relocation and visa sponsorship available.

jobs.title: Back end Team Engineer - Data Architecture  - Move to Bankgok
jobs.content:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND AND IF SUCCESSFUL YOU WILL BE EXPECTED TO RELOCATE (full visa and relocation package provided).


Agoda Overview:

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. Being part of Priceline group, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Although we are in hotel booking business, we see ourselves as an IT company where major focus is on engineering highly scalable, high performance solutions with goal of being the best on the market. In addition of being large company with enough capital to make things happen, we are start-up at heart, with flat hierarchy and ability to move very fast to react on market demands. We are achieving this by being KPI oriented and organized in SCRUM teams for maximum flexibility and efficiency.

We are looking for highly skilled engineers to join our multinational group and help us further push the boundaries of innovation and creativity. Join us and work side by side with amazing people from all over the world and directly impact experience of our customers on global level!

Qualifications:
  • 3+ years of experience in software development
  • experience and high programming skills in at least one of following languages: Scala, Java, Python or C#
  • strong problem solving skills
  • strong background in object oriented programming, understanding data structures and design patterns
  • exposure to big data
  • ability to communicate in English clearly and concisely in both written and verbal form
  • being able to debate and communicate your ideas
  • software engineering enthusiasm is a must!


Highly desirable additional skills:
  • experience in designing highly scalable solutions
  • experience with following technologies: Zookeeper, Cassandra, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, Elasticsearch, Spray or alternatives
  • experience with concurrent processing
  • experience with designing/building/supporting high availability products
  • experience in software continuous integration
  • experience working in cross functional SCRUM team
  • experience in DevOps role


What we offer:
  • live and work on full-time position in Bangkok, Thailand
  • receive competitive salary and benefits
  • work on solving challenging problems on huge scale
  • learn from many experienced professionals currently working with us
  • build products that currently do not exist on the market

jobs.title: Software Engineer -Based in Thailand - Agoda / A Priceline Co.
jobs.content:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND - FULL VISA A RELOCATION PACKAGE PROVIDED

Working at Agoda

For our rapidly growing IT organisation, we are looking for Software Engineers from many different experiences and qualifications to strengthen our teams.

Being a software engineer at Agoda isn't just about developing software. It's about being a center piece of the innovation and technical excellence that the rapidly changing field of online travel requires. If you find yourself frequently pondering how to do things faster and better, how technology could interact, how a new technology would help you to do new things or how a customer would use your products, then Agoda is the right place for you.

Responsibilities:

We expect our engineers to think about the full life cycle of our products, and not just about a single piece of code. From customer requirements, technology selection to coding standards, agile development, unit and application testing. You might call yourself "full stack" or you might consider yourself an expert in a certain field, but you will have a keen interest in how the different systems work together.

Qualifications:

Some of the technologies that we work with:
  • Scala, C# or Java. You might have experience in other languages but are confident you can learn.
  • Frontend technologies like Mocha, SAS and frameworks like Angular and Bootstrap (in addition to HTML and Javascript, of course).
  • Data platforms like SQL, Cassandra or Hadoop. You understand that different applications have different data requirements.
  • Core engineering infrastructure tools like Git for source control, Jenkins for Continuous Integration and Puppet for deployment.


Please get in touch if you are experienced in any of the above technologies (note - we are not looking for you to have them all). We are interested in speaking to persons of any level from junior candidates to experts in their field.

Please apply now and we will tell you all about the numerous projects we currently have on the go!

We are happy to receive CV from both international & local candidates as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible candidates.

jobs.title: Robotics Frontend engineer
jobs.content:
We are a young company focusing on novel robotics solutions and offer an
innovative, flexible and dynamic environment. In the position offered, you have
the chance to help develop an exciting, heterogeneous software product that
powers the FRANKA EMIKA platform. You will work in a small and agile team where
you develop on all levels, ranging from software architecture all the way to
implementation.

jobs.title: Lead Architect DRIVE
jobs.content:
Job description


GfK DRIVE is a cutting –edge technical platform for end-2-end market research solutions which pushes our business to the next technological level from data retrieval to real time interactive visualizations in a more and more customer-centric world. Our initial success now leads to strong global growth and the need for scalable and robust solutions based on the DRIVE platform which provides data driven services, tools, Apps and modern Dashboards developed on MongoDB, Analytic Column Stores, php, Java Script, Meteor.js and Cloud Computing.


As the Lead Architect for DRIVE you are responsible for the overall architecture of the Platform and also heading the domain architects of our four agile technical teams (~30 experts) in the Netherlands. As a thought leader you are shaping our real-time / end-2-end research platform in continuous evolution and identify and decide when pivotal shift is indicated. In close collaboration with DevOps and Infrastructure Teams you are leveraging GfKs Cloud capabilities to ensure focus on the software architecture and development.


As Lead Architect DRIVE you are part of the global Data & Technology Team (~500 Technology Experts and Data Scientists). And working at the crossroad where Software Engineering meets Data Science!


Key Activities



  • Responsible for the overall Architecture and the Software Engineering of the DRIVE as a service based platform and providing thought leadership for other architects and senior developers.

  • Build technical product vision and roadmap and design all levels of scalable and robust software architecture – from platform concept and application landscape to APIs, modules, web services. Ensure overall alignment of the several evolving assets which build the service based platform.

  • Align technical product vision with global product teams and their strategy and support product teams in project/customer related questions and successful implementation.

  • Provide advanced technical consulting and advice to proposal efforts and solution design.

  • Act as an advisor to customer senior Information Technology (IT) leadership and set strategic direction for customers based on HPE’s solutions and products in the Big Data and Analytics space

  • Enable the teams working on the right things and doing the things right, based on lean and agile Software Engineering methods and processes.

jobs.title: AWS Architect
jobs.content:
WHAT YOU’LL DO





  • Position yourself as a trusted advisor to CTP's clients, and partner with them to understand their requirements for cloud implementations.

  • Provide recommendations to clients with respect to cloud migrations and prepare technical implementation roadmaps for AWS adoption.

  • Create functional design specifications, reference architectures, and assist with other project deliverables as needed.

  • Design state-of-the-art technical solutions on AWS that address customer’s requirements for scalability, reliability, security, and performance.

  • Collaborate with other project teams on technical solutions and help improve CTP's service IP.

  • Learn, learn, and learn by staying up-to-date on all technical developments related to AWS.

  • Travel and work onsite at client locations (typically 50%).

jobs.title: Web Performance Engineer - Work for Asia's No1 leading OTA
jobs.content:
Overview:

Agoda is one of the leading technology companies, not only in the industry but the world. We want candidates who have the need for speed, and appreciate that a faster website means a better customer experience. The right candidate has experience creating lightning quick websites using best practice and the latest technologies. You will know how to create scalable infrastructure and architecture ensuring content is measured in milliseconds not seconds and delivering an uninterrupted customer experience.

Part developer, part researcher, part evangelist. The role involves developing and experimenting the most optimal way to deliver web pages and content to the customer as fast as possible on any device or browser. You will be a technical leader able to rapidly prototype, measure and deliver best practice for high performance website development.

Responsibilities:

Candidates will be exposed to the business side, and be able to measure the true value of their work. As a technology evangelist you will have to identify areas for optimization, then research and prototype solutions to develop best practices to propagate across the website development teams. You will be required to analyze and tune bottlenecks in code, content delivery and on the full array of browsers and client.

Key Skills:
  • Experience designing high traffic websites.
  • Understand browser behavior and events and how browsers interpret HTML, CSS, DOM etc. to produce pages on any device as fast as possible.
  • Explain the full flow of Navigation Timings and how each step can impact the customer and how to measure and monitor this information.
  • Exceptional OO and software development.
  • Deep understanding of web protocols and networking.
  • Web application design, architecture and optimization.
  • Database tuning and stored procedure optimization.
  • Knowledge of broadband, 3G and 4G Networks as well as how traffic passes through internet exchanges is a considered a plus.


Every millisecond counts. We want innovative ideas about how browsers can render content in milliseconds, that we can process TB's of data in minutes, or how to architect the server side to support tens of thousands of requests a second.

Technologies of interest (we are not expecting you to have them all):
  • Java (or other JVM languages), C#
  • js, JavaScript, Gulp
  • HTML and CSS and SASS
  • Memcached, Redis
  • Cassandra, Hadoop
  • MySQL, SQLServer, Postgres


A good standard of English both written and spoken is required.

Please note this role is open to both Thai and International candidates.

jobs.title: Java
jobs.content:
As Java (Scala) Developer, you will design and implement solutions according to customer requirements, conduct module testing and prepare documentation of executed work. When realizing projects, you will report directly to the Team Leader.


If you have at least 2 years of documented experience in commercial projects realized using Java and Scala programming languages, and if you speak English fluently, apply!

We're looking for talented developers to develop our new modules and maintaining existing ones for Snapp within an agile/scrum sprint work-flow. Your work will be tested and deployed on real systems, in real-world conditions. The experience you gain will be unique and unparalleled.

jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
As Senior JavaScript Developer, you will design and implement solutions according to customer requirements, documenting your work and mentoring less experienced developers. During implementation of projects you will report directly to the Team Leader.


If you have advanced knowledge of vanilla JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 and the browser environment, if you have commercial experience in creation of complex single page applications using one of the commercially available MVC frameworks such as AngularJS, and finally if you speak English fluently, apply!

jobs.title: Full Stack Team Engineer  - Online Travel - Relocate to Bangkok
jobs.content:
A life less ordinary.



PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE WILL REQUIRE YOU TO RELOCATE TO BANGKOK, THAILAND IF SUCCESSFUL.

We're not just talking about the location; as Asia's fastest growing online hotel booking platform and the biggest pure Tech company in Thailand, you'll use every last ounce of your Engineering talent at Agoda!

The Job

In essence you'll be responsible for the complete scope, design, build and testing of products and features for one of Asia's fastest growing e-commerce websites. As a part of the Agoda team, you will be exposed to numerous innovative technologies in the fields of data-processing, big data, efficient data storage structures, recommender systems / machine learning, natural language processing, and many more. Whichever technology we work with, it must operate at the performance needs of a hyper-scale infrastructure operating at thousands of requests per second.

We move as fast as you want to! As an Engineer at Agoda you'll get to own what you're working on, end to end. So if you have a bright idea, we'll act on it. Chances are you'll be the person charged with making it happen - good for us, great for you.

Our team structures are pretty flat so when we say that we're a big company operating as a start-up, we mean it. You'll need bags of initiative, but you'll also have experience of building for scalability, reliability and performance. A full-stack developer knows what's under the bonnet, and you're no different.

Our ambition to grow and be the best is immense - matched only by, well, yours.

What about Bangkok?

A big question, one we've answered many times before. Truly 'International' is one word to describe our Engineering Team here in Bangkok.

'Interesting', 'fun', 'friendly' and 'supportive' are among the other comments we've heard. And with 'all the latest toys' (tech) at your fingertips, Agoda's a great platform to push your career to the next level! Plus with a great salary package, the biggest decision you'll have to make is whether to have a Suburban Pad or City Condo

We spare no expense when it comes to the best technologies, nor do we pull any punches in relation to your workspace and office perks. Our offices are based in Central World - Thailand's ultra-modern business & leisure complex; right in the heart of the buzzing Bangkok metropolis.

With relocation support and visa sponsorship available we've got you covered, leaving you free to look forward to an amazing new experience!

Your Skills

We're looking for Architect level expertise but you still love to code! This means your primary concern is about 'what' you make not 'how' - you're not tied down to a specific programming language, moreso you adapt as the solution demands and can pick up new tech in no time.

You may well have worked on a raft of different projects before but you'll have the same enquiring mind and hunger for knowledge and to make things better for the end user.
  • Architect level expertise but want to stay 'hands on' to make your vision a reality!
  • You're a master in either C# .Net, Java or other OOP language
  • You have a deep level of Engineering experience through the stack and have touched on many elements that translate well to full e-commerce software architecture
  • You take full ownership of whatever you're building, and see it through to completion
  • You're confident in your ability
  • And passionate about your work (but not afraid to let others in to help too)
  • Your expertise spans the full SDLC thru' concept, design, build, test (automation if poss) and deployment
  • Your natural Engineering-mindset considers problem, solution and alternative in equal measure
  • The end user is at the heart of what you do, as is the commercial value to Agoda
  • You have a progressive outlook - TDD, BDD, Agile are second nature to you
  • You love working in a Change environment with fewer formal processes
  • Your experience will certainly be strong in backend Engineering primarily, ideally with decent frontend expertise to help things along
  • Able and willing to test your own work and create automated tests along the way


About Agoda

Agoda is one of the fastest-growing online hotel platforms worldwide, listing hundreds of thousands of hotels and providing services in 38 different languages. We employ more than 2,000 travel professionals, representing more than 20 countries with major operations in Singapore, Bangkok, Kuala Lumpur, Tokyo, Sydney, Hong Kong, and Budapest, and an additional presence in major cities across Asia, Africa, the Middle East, Europe, and the Americas.

Interested?

Get in touch and apply now!

Doubtless you'll have many unanswered questions; we'd expect nothing less after all an enquiring mind is what we're looking for. But fear not there's plenty of chance to discuss when we talk.



Please note this role is open to both Thai and International candidates - Full visa sponsorship available!

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer - Chinese Market
jobs.content:
Make your next move count.
  • Want an Engineering job where you can make amazing achievements?
  • Can you build technology that Chinese consumers really love?
  • Want the chance to improve your international language skills?


If so, Agoda is the place for you! Join our exciting new innovation team at the start of something big! Agoda is an award-winning website and one of the fastest-growing online hotel platforms worldwide; we're also the biggest pure 'Tech' company in Thailand.

This exciting opportunity is full-time, permanent based in Bangkok, Thailand.

We also offer English language lessons so you can improve your business and technical skills at Agoda!

Our Engineers describe Agoda as interesting, challenging, fun, friendly and supportive. In short, the kind of environment where you get license and ownership to produce your best work!

In essence you'll be responsible for the complete scope, design, build and testing of products and features for one of Asia's fastest growing e-commerce websites. As a part of the Agoda team, you will be exposed to numerous innovative technologies in the fields of data-processing, big data, efficient data storage structures, recommender systems / machine learning, natural language processing, and many more. Whichever technology we work with, it must operate at the performance needs of a hyper-scale infrastructure operating at thousands of requests per second.

About you:

We're looking for Architect level expertise but you still love to code! If you're the kind of person that looks at the bigger picture and want to build something that has a real impact on the end user Agoda is the place for you.
  • Excellent written and spoken Mandarin language skills
  • Broad fully-rounded full stack engineering experience
  • Strong backend engineering expertise (C# .Net, Java or other OOP)
  • Strong frontend web development skills are highly desirable
  • Knowledge of core architectural elements of e-commerce websites
  • You'll be able to describe in great detail the SDLC, all factors that impact your end build and relish the prospect of a job that enables you to do that day in, day out
  • And when we start talking about performance, security, unit testing and automation? Well that's music to your ears
  • You don't need to be fluent in English at all, but if you are that is good also


We program in C# .Net but would love to hear from Java aficionados or proponents of other OOP languages with unparalleled Engineering experience - you know as well as we do it's what you build not how that's most important!

Interested?

Get in touch and apply now!

Doubtless you'll have many unanswered questions; we'd expect nothing less after all an enquiring mind is what we're looking for. But fear not there's plenty of chance to discuss when we talk.

With relocation support and visa sponsorship available we've got you covered. English language lessons available to improve your international business skills

jobs.title: Front-End Engineer - Relocate to Bangkok, Thailand
jobs.content:
Please note this role is based in Bangkok, Thailand and will require you to relocate if successful - Full relocation and visa sponsorship available!



You're in good company.

As one of Asia's fastest growing e-commerce sites we have a deep-rooted Engineering focus at Agoda. So now that you've mastered your craft we'll give you the platform to really kick on and showcase your talent!

In essence you'll be responsible for the complete scope, design, build and testing of products and features for one of Asia's fastest growing e-commerce websites. As a part of the Agoda team, you will be exposed to numerous innovative technologies in the fields of data-processing, big data, efficient data storage structures, recommender systems / machine learning, natural language processing, and many more. Whichever technology we work with, it must operate at the performance needs of a hyper-scale infrastructure operating at thousands of requests per second.

What's more, our flat structure means you'll have more autonomy to see your ideas through to fruition and more control over how, what and where you build.

Scalability, performance, personalisation - that's our mantra, and we hope those words mean a lot to you too. Creative yet pragmatic, your work will help catapult the business into the stratosphere!

Agoda Tech

We're working with the latest technologies too - we recently re-platformed everything so we're scaling for some major growth. Like you we're currently working on the latest tools, but what's more important is your Engineering-based approach to problem solving.

You see technology as the means not the ends, this helps you to see & Solve Tech challenges before they happen. And working in a blameless environment, we give you the platform to produce your best work yet.

About You

You're looking for the ultimate challenge - a household brand without the formality and constraints of overwhelming process, with big things to achieve.

You're a true expert in the backend SDLC (Java / C# .Net / other OOP) with a firm grasp of high performance websites from concept right thru' design, build, test and release. You've also got a strong grasp of frontend development and a strong portfolio to boot. You'll naturally see the bigger picture and consider all angles, and make sure your solution is scalable and performance driven. And when it come to testing your own work, you've got it covered.

You have Architect level expertise but still want to code to see your vision become reality! What's more you're hands-on and happy to personally be involved at all stages, always thinking 'user first'. And when it comes to the codebase you're highly passionate and love to produce pure, clean readable code that you can't wait to share!

About Agoda

Agoda is one of the fastest-growing online hotel platforms worldwide, listing hundreds of thousands of hotels and providing services in 38 different languages. We employ more than 2,000 travel professionals, representing more than 20 countries with major operations in Singapore, Bangkok, Kuala Lumpur, Tokyo, Sydney, Hong Kong, and Budapest, and an additional presence in major cities across Asia, Africa, the Middle East, Europe, and the Americas.

Interested?

Get in touch and apply now!

With relocation support and visa sponsorship available we've got you covered, leaving you free to look forward to an amazing new experience!

jobs.title: BMW Group - Innovative Software Technology Developer
jobs.content:
EVEN IN ELECTRONICS, YOU CAN GO AGAINST THE CURRENT.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Ulm is currently seeking a:


Innovative Software Technology Developer (m/f)


Job reference: 102901


BMW Car IT GmbH Munich are seeking a software engineer (m/f) to develop innovative solutions for future BMW Group automobiles. In this role, you will handle issues related to embedded systems, architecture, distributed systems, middleware, service-oriented systems, infrastructure for intelligent mobility and human-machine interaction. Using modern software engineering methods and technologies for conception, specification and development of forward-looking and also unconventional solutions is an essential part of your role. You will work in a team to create prototypes that can be realized in production development to demonstrate the sustainability of the solutions, and also work closely with other BMW departments.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.title: Collaboration App
jobs.content:
We don’t develop simplistic, boring apps… And, you would be ~Dev # 12 on our growing team in idyllic, Bethlehem, PA, one block from the Brew Works!


Intelliquip develops web apps for manufacturers/specifiers of complex, engineered-to-order, fluid-handling equipment (e.g., pumps, compressors) to select, configure, price, quote (CPQ), and process orders for their products.


Work with our fun and hard working team; including one of authors of the Agile Manifesto — Jon Kern — to help chart the course for a brave new world of new applications to meet our growing demand for modern, clean, responsive, UX.


We are looking for awesome Rails engineers for our new app development.



  • Rails stack with MongoDB, JavaScript, Zurb Foundation, etc.


We also integrate with our legacy app (Java stack -- Apache, Tomcat, SQL Server), so knowledge of Java is a plus.


Apply if you have:



  • A passion for being a professional software craftsman

  • Strong problem-solving skills, able to adapt to a wide variety of challenges

  • A desire for pragmatic delivery of solutions while still honing our craft

  • The ability to generate high-quality, well-architected solutions

  • The knack for staying on the leading edge of modern web app development

  • Outgoing personality, able to work in a team environment and have fun debating architecture and alternative designs (but not ad infinitum :-p)

  • A nut about test-driven development and behavior-driven development (or willing to be guided)

  • An interest in challenging problem domains: fluid handling mechanical equipment (pumps, valves, etc.), mathematical algorithms, cool graphing requirements, etc.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Meltwater builds digital intelligence and marketing solutions for a global client base. Our teams in Manchester, NH deliver value to our customers building a variety of solutions in the Meltwater Platform.


Our technology portfolio includes applications based on the MEAN stack (MongoDB, Express, AngularJS, and Node.js) in the frontend, connecting to services using ElasticSearch and RabbitMQ in the backend.


We are looking for an experienced software engineer to join our team that is building an extendable library of common data services and UI components, highly discoverable interactive documentation and a community for collaboration and innovation.


Your responsibilities



  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment in production

  • Actively evolve our agile development process together with us (Scrum)

  • Commitment to excellence and mastery: We want to keep getting better together!

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Web Developer required for a 6 month contract in the heart of Glasgow City Centre.


Why contract at Hays?


Hays is the UK's leading technology recruiter that places thousands of contractors into some of the most exciting assignments across the sector. We have been recognised by users of contractoruk.com as the 'best recruitment agency to contract with' for three consecutive years.


Our recruiting experts are vastly knowledgeable and focused on specific skill-sets, allowing us to better understand the needs of our clients. This insight is then transferred into helping place our candidates


in the best position when applying for contract developer jobs.


With an extensive network of specialist offices across the UK, we pay our contractors weekly and have an unrivalled range of contract developer opportunities available.


Your new role

You will be working as a consultant, hired by Hayes at an international leader in their field with headquarters in Glasgow City Centre, joining an existing projects team to assist with an enterprise level, internal project that is due to commence in early July.



  • Liaising with members of the development team, other departments and internal customers to determine requirements and produce technical specifications.



  • Providing comprehensive documentation on all deliverables.

  • Defining & documenting business processes related to the applications.

  • Any other duties as determined by the application development team lead.


What you'll need to succeed



  • Solid experience of .Net: C# and ASP.NET, HTML / CSS/ JavaScript / AJAX / JQuery, Angular JS and IIS.

  • Strong database development skills; you should have database design experience, be proficient in writing SQL stored procedures, functions, assemblies etc. and understand the concepts of database performance tuning.

  • Experience of one or more integration or orchestration systems would be an advantage.

  • Experience of the full lifecycle of software development - analysis, design, build, test and deploy - is essential. A history of delivering solutions in an enterprise level environment is essential

  • Experience of working in a fast moving/challenging environment; exposure to RAD/Agile methodologies would be advantageous


What you'll get in return
This is a fantastic opportunity to work with the latest Cloud Technologies, as well as a 6 month initial engagement which could be extended.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

jobs.title: Experienced .Net Developer
jobs.content:
We are an independent software company looking for experienced software developers (2+ years work experience or similar). We are a world-wide developer of software for engineers and product designers. Take a look at our website to find out more about us.


We believe in:


Doing the right thing– Taking the longer route to writing code if it means a higher quality.


Openness– We are open to sharing and listening to you. Whether it’s about development choices, company focuses or the colour of the bike shed.


Experimentation– Trying out new languages, frameworks etc. Even if we don’t end up using things, we can still learn from them.


Automation– Our software is all about automation but we also automate it and everything else we possibly can.


Passion– It takes a little something extra to make great software. Every developer at DriveWorks believes we are making the best software we can and want to see it become great!


Freedom – We try to let people control their time and tasks as much as possible.


Testing and Tracking– Humans are squishy and data is king. Writing tests can be fun!


Technically speaking we:


Are mainly .NET based– We use a lot of C# and VB.NET (currently VS 2015 C#6, VB 14).


Use git– We even have our own internal Github Enterprise server.


Review code– Everyone gets their code reviewed and anyone can review anything.


Continuously Integrate– We use build servers like TeamCity and ensure even small tools get a place there.


Create Windows desktop software– using lots of WPF.


Create web services, windows services and a plethora of tools– using whatever fits best.


Create web sites– We write a lot using TypeScript currently and we have our own UI system.


Are pretty up to date– At the start of every dev cycle we try to ensure that we are using the most up to date tooling we can.


Deal with interesting and varied problems – The interesting part might be a little subjective, but we deal with a full spectrum of ever changing dev tasks.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are currently looking for enthusiastic senior software engineers to strengthen our sports and well-being product development teams. We are developing cross-platform desktop and tablet applications, server backends and web client applications. We will also need mobile application development skills in the near future.


In summary, we are looking for a proactive, self-motivated senior full stack developer or an experienced developer eager to expand expertise and grow professionally.

jobs.title: iOS Mobile Software Engineer
jobs.content:
MyDrive is going places fast. We are a world leader in using data to build understanding of customer behaviour through telematics. We employ the latest thinking in data analytics and software engineering across a variety of sectors including motor, home and health automation. We are looking for a talented iOS Mobile Software Engineer with three to five years of intensive software engineering experience in a start-up business and/or a commercial environment to join our team. We are a global player and have an truly international team to reflect this.


We need an iOS Mobile Software Engineer to produce iOS software app development focused on using sensor data (GPS, accelerometer, etc) who can demonstrate commercial experience in app building and architecture.


In this role, you will plan and work with design houses, app agencies, and be fully integrated with the DevOps team. Delivering great engineering, issue analysis and resolution, which is well tested and delivered into a CI environment is core to the role.


You will evaluate the iOS connected car ecosystems now and in the future so we can take advantage of new technology as well as be ready for change so we maintain our clients’ confidence. Part of this will be to maintain and develop the Mobile SDK used to collect and manage data within our range of customer Apps and communicate with our RESTful API. App building, using the SDK.


You will also implement the benefits of automated testing, evaluate software performance for optimisation and maintain test coverage and write automated tests for new production software, including continuous integration and delivery.


We are looking for engineers who gather and maintain lines of communications with different project stakeholders and research and recommend new technologies to develop the MyDrive Telematics offering worldwide.


You will need to work closely with other software developers, operations engineers, and data scientists to design and implement mobile software to interoperate with our web services and systems including coding.


Keeping MyDrive up to date with the state of the art in mobile software development, including new features, functionality, security, and performance is both vital and fun. Each engineer contributes to Hack Days and we take personal development very seriously.


Ideally you will also have superb customer service skills and be able to support the service and undertake remedial fixing if needed.

jobs.title: Support Software Developer - Managed Services
jobs.content:
• Work with some of the best people in the industry

  • Keep your skills current with paid professional development

  • Work with people who believe in quality software 


Readify is seeking a Support Software Developer to join our expanding Managed Services in either our Melbourne or Brisbane team during an exciting period of growth. Readify is all about software innovation and our technically brilliant people work with clients to deliver outstanding software with velocity and uncommon sense. Since 2001, Readify has been helping customers in a range of industries to develop and support innovative software projects. We've been awarded Microsoft's Partner of the Year and the only organisation in Australia to ever win a Global Award by Microsoft for Software Development. We have achieved global recognition for our ability to help customers build software that drives collaboration, productivity, business growth and profitability. Our customers value our capacity to understand their business and apply our software expertise to consistently deliver great results, and great value, every time.

As our Support Software Developer, it will be your role to:



  • Resolve SupportPod requests from internal and external clients.

  • Maintain and improve Readify's business software systems and contribute to projects.

  • Provide our internal and external clients with an extremely high level of technical expertise

  • Represent Readify as technical experts.

jobs.title: BMW Group - Software Engineer Personalization Framework
jobs.content:
THESE DAYS, AUTOMOTIVE HISTORY IS WRITTEN IN C++.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.



More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Ulm is currently seeking a:



Software Engineer – Personalization Framework (m/f)
Job reference: 100991


BMW Car IT offers you the chance to take an exciting role in automotive software development. As a part of the agile development team for the next generation Linux-based head-unit you will be working on the personalization framework. The personalization framework is the foundation of a seamless customer experience across different vehicles and devices. Your tasks as a Software Engineer in our agile development team are the design, implementation, testing and debugging of modern high quality software. You will work together with skilled colleagues from all over the world in Ulm. BMW Car IT is a company-internal software development centre and takes a leading role in shaping the future of software development at BMW.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.title: Developer
jobs.content: We are looking for a Full stack UI Developer (Angular, Ember, React Javascript skills). The incumbent should have experience in working CSS, HTML5, experience in developing single-page applications and have worked within an agile team.

jobs.title: Junior Software QA Engineer
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Do you want to help to develop the tools that revolutionize how our departments function? Our Business Operations & Strategy team is looking for an ambitious individual to learn the trivago approach to software quality assurance. Instead of following test instructions, you’ll be detecting problems and root causes by combining IT skills with exploratory testing, an analytical mind, healthy mistrust and the ambition to find bugs before anyone else does. You will test all aspects of newly developed features for web-based applications to ensure that they will work on current browsers and operating systems.

As part of a cross-functional team, you will learn to write test plans for manual and automated testing and will work alongside developers and project owners to detect malfunctions and deliver software that is bug-free. You will be expected to critically question the usability of product owners’ new ideas and suggest design improvements or corrections throughout the development process, as well as contribute during the planning and coordination of new software releases.



The ideal candidate:



  • Holds a degree in an IT-related field of study. Other majors are welcome to apply but please explain relevant IT skills and your passion for the web in your cover letter.

  • Has a good knowledge of PHP, HTML and MySQL.

  • Speaks English (our company language) fluently.

  • Has a valid work permit for Germany.

  • Has the strong analytical and problem-solving skills necessary for analysing data and recognizing trends.

  • Is a stickler for detail and a thorough worker.

  • Must be comfortable with a testing approach that is fast, flexible and continuously changing.

  • Has a hunger to learn, sets high goals and won’t rest until they achieve them.

  • Wants to work in a dynamic international team where communication and collaboration are the keys to success.

  • Can start as soon as possible.



Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Being an active member of our PHP, JavaScript, and UI guilds.

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hoursbased on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • Working at our head office in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of lifein the world for expats.



Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

  • This is a fixed-term position of 1 year with a long-term perspective.

  • We do not require the services of an agency for this position.

jobs.title: NetSuite Infrastructure Architect - zLabels
jobs.content:
The Opportunity


As our NetSuite Infrastructure Architect, you will facilitate the implementation and optimization of process and systems infrastructure. The role uses strong project management skills, detailed industry knowledge of best practices, and a formal understanding of the implementation as it pertains to our business needs. You will be the point of contact for all crucial NetSuite design decisions and will own the viability of the overall NetSuite solution for the business. This is a great opportunity to join a fast growing fashion company in a greenfield NetSuite deployment.


Your responsibilities



  • Design our new NetSuite infrastructure, architecture and processes

  • Define our development methodology, testing and release processes

  • Consult on cross-functional and cross-technology design discussions

  • Manage integrations with other internal enterprise systems

  • Ensure smooth transition to the post-production support team

  • Document best practices in developing and deploying solutions

  • Lead internal knowledge sharing to promote cross education

  • Coach and mentor new and existing team members


What you can expect from us



  • Gaining experience from a  startup-driven environment where you work closely with our VP of Technology

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical leads who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals.


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our Tech recruiter Matthias Schmeißer.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
As a Senior FrontEnd developer you will have agency experience, strong technical experience and will be used to working within a team of UX, creatives and backend developers.

You should have a minimum 3 years experience in UI for desktop/mobile web. Ideally you have further background in object oriented programming and or back-end development.


You will be working as a part of an on-going green field project with three more front end developers. You will be expected to deliver to high standards and with your technical expertise and experience.


Key responsibilities and accountibilities



  • Develop, test and deliver unique creative pieces using the latest front-end technologies.

  • Write clean, lean, well-documented code.

  • Work with the development team to spread knowledge and develop resources.

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer - Embedded - Device Drivers
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Primary Function / Primary Goals / Objectives:
* Recognized expert in software development with broad expertise in complete lifecycle management of software-based products and/or medical devices, specifically in the areas of new software development, software maintenance, resolving significant technical issues as well as providing direction for new software technology/process development activities that have a broad impact to the company goals.
* Responsible for functional or technical leadership of the software group or software projects, driving for excellence in team performance and in product design by the introduction of new technologies, processes and/or software development methodologies.
* Provide technical leadership for application software and firmware designs and development to be used in medical diagnostic devices (both class II and III).
* Works on the design and development of application software and system level software for products based on embedded microprocessors. Works within a disciplined product development process that meets FDA requirements.
* Key decision-maker in identifying of areas of software technology for potential implementation into company products and processes.
* Leads the technical supervision and project management of complex software projects/activities.
* Develops networks involving cross functional/cross departmental groups as well as communication to Senior and Executive Management.
* Readily adjusts priorities and works within team environment for timely completion of common objectives for multiple projects.

Major Responsibilities:

Capable of working at high level of performance on projects and activities that dramatically impacts the business. Functional management of software engineering or very senior technical contributor and may be, responsible for staffing and maintaining the groups high level of technical competence and productivity. Technical leader responsible for maintaining and enhancing the high level of technical competence of the Engineering Staff. Provide technical leadership in application/embedded software development and project scheduling. Reliably deliver high-quality software within schedule constraints. Participate as senior engineering representative in product development teams for development strategies of new products and services. Work with external software consultants as required for system development, algorithm design and project management to deliver on established project milestones Interacts with the QA engineers to insure that software products are robust and of very high quality. Implement software design efficiently in current programming languages (C#, Java, C++, C, Assembly, etc.) Proficient use of appropriate tools and techniques for productivity and code quality: debuggers, profilers, unit testing, source control, etc. Research technical issues and propose technical solutions. Participate in the full life cycle of development, from specification and design through implementation, testing, and support. Lead the evaluation of new software design tools, software architectures, microprocessors and algorithms. Coordinating and working effectively with other departments to provide software support as needed.

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:

Bachelors in Electrical or Computer Science or related engineering or scientific f...

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Responsibilities
* Hands-on working experience on Apache Hadoop, HIVE, HDFS, KIBANA, Elastic,HBase
* Engineer data pipelines to arrive at data-driven products catering to various use cases
* Experience of designing and implementing solutions (in the Hadoop ecosystem) that have remained scalable/ robust months/ years after they were first implemented
* Ability to translate small POC's into industrial strength applications.
* Ability to seamlessly integrate data across different forms (structured and unstructured)
* Enable tools for using data science techniques ranging from statistics, algorithms to machine learning.
* Strong academic background with deep knowledge in core computer science topics of distributed systems, databases, software development and algorithms
* Willingness to mentor and coach junior team members in the art of data science and the science of data engineering
* Hands-on Hadoop experience is a must (across any industry)
* Review the solution across all the projects
* This position is also responsible to align with standard bank process and ensure there are no deviations
* Manage the change request effectively and efficiently during the project delivery with all the agreed controls
*Superior stakeholder management and helps the team to collect the requirements/help to fine tune the requirements

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Full Stack Developer in Tokyo, [International atmosphere]
jobs.content:
Do you want to change the world? Starting with Japan? Then here is your chance to be part of a fantastic new project that has the potential to make a difference to the experiences of millions of travellers to this incredible country.

Odigo is a new travel start-up, aimed at English and Chinese speaking visitors to Japan. Through our website, mobile app and blog, Odigo boasts a wealth of information for intrepid explorers, covering well loved favourite spots, as well as lots of hidden gems, all chosen by a community of local experts. As well as all of this, our fantastic planning tool creates a unique combination of information and itinerary planning that ensures visitors can create their perfect trip to Japan.


We are also looking for UI/UX Designer and other positions.
http://careers.odigo.travel/join-us/

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Product Development Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





The Strategic Data Infrastructure (SDI) team is part of Comcast Cable's Technology & Product (T&P) organization and serves the larger company with scalable, multi-tenant data platforms. Our products help the company make decisions at the petabyte scale.





We're a small group of technologists working primarily with open source, big data technologies. We're pushing the envelope, and are always looking for opportunities to contribute back to the supporting communities. As a Software Engineer, you will be a full-time contributor to the team, having the opportunity to influence design and implementation on a regular basis. On our team, leadership is earned and not appointed; your communication and collaboration skills are just as importantif not more importantthan your technical skills.





Core Responsibilities




  • Producing technical designs and documentation at varying levels of granularity

  • Writing production-quality, tested code

  • Performing code reviews, even of more senior team members

  • Collaborating with our technical operations teams to provide outstanding customer service

  • Resisting the accrual of "technical debt" in our systems.

  • Working with product development teams to assist them in meeting their business goals through judicious application of SDI technologies.

  • Building proof-of-concept systems or conducting exploratory experiments with new technology.





Preferred Qualifications:




  • 1-2 years of relevant work experience, including extensive programming experience and strong object-oriented skills; and/or a BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field.

  • Familiarity with a diverse set of programming styles (procedural, objected-oriented, functional). Experience with Java, Scala, Python/Ruby, and bash shell scripting a plus.

  • UNIX/Linux background: facility with command-line utilities; familiarity with system administration tools and concepts a plus.

  • Willingness to learn new things!








Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Sr. Manager, Software Dev & Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Summary:



Responsible for providing strategic leadership and oversight for all aspects of the Application Maintenance and Support, Software Development and Engineering for the department's applications and projects. The responsibility extends for internal, outsourced, and geographically diverse teams used to accomplish goals and objectives. The responsibility may include multiple functional areas; requiring a strategy for each functional area.



Responsible for leading a team of Software Development Engineers in the

planning and designing of software and web applications. Manages

projects from design to testing, including new programs, enhancements,

and modifications. Collaborates with Quality Assurance team to conduct

testing. Develops financial and operational objectives. Ensures

operational plans are aligned with business objectives. Contributes to

functional strategy development. Has a greater degree of impact on

business results, and typically manages one or more groups of

professional employees.





Core Responsibilities:



- Creates and drives strategies in alignment with the Company's overall vision and business goals for each functional area.

- Leads the Application Support team in the ongoing support of the existing production applications; meeting all service level commitments, application up time requirements, and performance requirements.

- Leads the Software Development and Engineering team in the development of new software applications and updates to existing applications.

- Works with Business teams to ensure understanding of business goals and priorities.

- Works with support and operations personnel to define and implement standards and frameworks with regard to application operations and meeting service level commitments for multiple applications.

- Measure and enforce acceptance criteria for work products of development teams

- Works with project personnel to define and implement standards and frameworks with regards to coding, programming, and the general development of software for multiple applications.

- Oversees the implementation of initiatives, software updates, and the deployment of new software releases.

- Works with Supervisors, Managers and others to ensure all deliverables adhere to deadlines, specifications, and budgets.

- Develops and implements application metrics. Reviews and reports on application metrics to leadership team.

- Prepares and manages budget(s) and financial targets.

- Continuously researches new techniques with respect to application management, coding technologies and overall technology practices.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Oversees the planning and designing of software and web applications,

including new programs, enhancements, and modifications.

- Provides guidance to the Software Engineering team and other

departments in identifying product and technical requirements. Serves as

primary point of contact and liaison between Software Engineering and

other teams.

- Directs implementation initiatives for new software products and

applications. Organizes software update process for existing

applications and coordinates the roll-out of software releases.

- Manages all the deliverables to ensure adherence to deadlines,

and vendors to ensure accurate and timely implementation of new trunk

jobs.title: Software Application Support Specialist
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.






TECHNICAL AND PRODUCTION SERVICES (TAPS)



- TECHNICAL AND PRODUCTION SPECIALIST



Summary



The TAPS Technical and Production Specialist provides advanced STRATA software support to the Client Service, Onsite Training, and Sales departments, assists in maintaining the STRATA hosted application environment, and works directly with clients to resolve complicated technical issues. The Technical and Production Specialist documents and prioritizes support issues, refers them to the Product Management Department (SWAT), if required, and monitors those issues until they are concluded. The Technical and Production Specialist reports directly to the Director of Technical and Production Services.



Minimum Requirements



The successful candidate for the Technical and Production Specialist Position will meet all of the following requirements:



Skills:



Proficiency in supporting Microsoft applications and technologies, including but not limited to:




  • Windows Client and Server operating systems.

  • Relational database management systems including MS SQL Server and MS Office Access.

  • MS Office applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

  • MS Terminal Services or Citrix.


  • Scripting experience such as PowerShell




  • Experience with C++, C# or Java is a plus



  • A solid understanding of information technology.

  • An aptitude for troubleshooting problems with hardware and peripheral devices.

  • Strong technical written and verbal communication skills.


  • BA or BS in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field.





Essential Functions



The TAPS Technical and Production Specialist is responsible for the following:



Responding to, troubleshooting, and resolving daily problems and requests forwarded by Client Service representatives.



Working directly with STRATA clients to resolve complicated technical issues. This may include inheriting particularly challenging or sensitive issues from Client Service Representatives, or if otherwise requested to do so by a manager.



Working directly with members of other STRATA departments, including Onsite Training, Sales, and SWAT as required.



Supporting the STRATA hosted application environment by performing installations, upgrades and other needed tasks.



Escalating urgent problems requiring more in-depth knowledge to the appropriate internal resources, such as SWAT.



Monitoring the status of issues in the “Mantis” issue tracking software on a daily basis, when the manager is not available to do so.



Expanding their own knowledge of STRATA products and of the underlying technologies required to support those products (e.g. Operating systems, database platforms, etc.).



Documenting customer feedback concerning software use, needed application adjustments, and enhancement requests.



Performing an on-going analysis of all applicable STRATA programs to identify possible improvements.



Updating TAPS resources including shared knowledge bases, and the documentation used to support the hosted application environment.



Updating documentation to support the use of STRATA’s Agency software products, if required.



Assisting in quality assurance testing for STRATA’s Agency software products, if required.



Providing guidance to Client Service Representatives who are working on special projects (e.g. Writing documentation, product testing, etc.)



Assisting the Client Service Manager in identifying training needs and/or improvement opportunities for the Client Service Department.



Ensuring the continuous operation of the help desk by answering calls from clients during times when there are not enough Client Service Representatives available.



Performing certain essential job functions outside of business hours, including on weekends, if required.



Carrying out other duties requested of them which are within their capabilities.



Carrying out all essential job functions in a courteous and professional manner.



Working conditions



Workplace – All employees are responsible for maintaining a professional, courteous, and respectful workplace environment. Each employee must conduct himself/herself appropriately without causing disruption for other STRATA employees, and adhere to the policies outlined in the STRATA Policy Manual.



Attendance – be punctual and available to help clients and STRATA employees when his/her shift begins (or when returning from a “break”).



Education:



BA or BS in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field.



MA or MS in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field is preferred.



Success factors



The successful Technical and Production Specialist will be able to interface with clients and coworkers and employ a high degree of tact and diplomacy to promote a positive image of the TAPS Department. They will be able to resolve problematic situations in a professional manner, build strong partnerships with end users by projecting a positive attitude, and provide helpful support whenever required. They will demonstrate the ability to deliver against service level agreements to continually increase customer satisfaction

jobs.title: Part Time Lot Attendant ($12/hr)
jobs.content:
Overview

 

 

We share your drive. 

At DriveTime, we're committed to providing you with a clearly defined career path that will allow you to go as far as your drive and ambition will take you. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, welcome a challenge, have high personal standards of achievement and are extremely motivated, we have endless opportunities for you to succeed. Use your strong interpersonal skills to accelerate your career within our strong, rapidly growing organization.

Responsibilities

A typical day as a Part Time Lot Attendant

Expect to walk into a fun environment. As a Lot Attendant for DriveTime you will be exposed to the automotive side of the dealership. You will work closely with our Lot Tech in cordinating our fleet. This is the perfect opportunity to work within a fast paced environment where you will play a key role within your team.

 Your responsibilities will be, but not limited to:

  • Inventory management including minor repairs
  • Rotating fleet between dealerships 
  • Be flexible enough to organize and adapt daily work to changing situations and demands.
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

Enjoy the Rewards and Benefits.

Money: Great pay – $12/hour

Environment: Fun and exciting environment where you work closely with both co-workers and customers

Qualifications

    • 2+ years of general automotive experience 
    • Excellent communication skills (oral and written), math, and interpersonal skills.
    • Intermediate computer skills in Microsoft Office programs, especially Word and Excel.
    • Must be polite, professional, energetic and presentable, with strong communication, organization and customer service skills
    • Be flexible enough to organize and adapt daily work to changing situations and demands.
    • High school diploma or equivalent required
    • Valid driver's license, a clean driving record, and the ability to pass a drug test and a background check

 

Physical Demands

The Physical demands described within are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • This job position is designated as a safety sensitive position.

  • Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds independently; majority of lifting from knee to shoulder heights; other lifting required from various levels.

  • Must be able to carry and transport up to 25 pounds up to 60 feet.

  • Requires standing for extended period of time with frequent stretching, reaching, walking and stooping, pushing and/or pulling.

  • Requires excellent visual acuity and manual dexterity.

  • Requires sitting for extended periods of time. Must be able to type for extended periods of time.

  • Requires being able to hear and speak with others in-person or on the phone.

  • Must adhere to regular and predictable attendance.

And when it comes to hiring, we don't just look for the right person for the job, we seek out the right person for DriveTime. Along the way, we provide plenty of opportunity to be creative and grow professionally in a fun, high-energy environment.

 

Hiring is contingent upon successful completion of our background and drug screening process. DriveTime is a drug-free, tobacco-free workplace.

EOE

jobs.title: Principal Software Developer
jobs.content:
Atlassian helps teams everywhere change the world through the power of software and we are looking for a part visionary, part technical wizard. As a Principal Engineer you’ll be part of the technical authority on products that are revolutionizing the software industry and helping teams collaborate and create that magic in delivering their best work. Think NASA launching the Rover on Mars or Cochlear gifting children born deaf with the ability to hear, your work directly impacts the products they use to advance humanity. The primary focus of your role will be to take ownership of the broad technical direction to ensure our products are evolving and sustainable for the long term.


Aside from strong technical prowess including hands on coding ability you will have deep understanding of architecture and an ability to foresee and plan for changes, you are also an effective communicator. You need to be able to translate your deep technical skills to influence other developers, product managers and senior managers to ensure the team understands the vision, is on-board with it, and is moving towards achieving the product’s ongoing goals. With the rapidly changing software industry, you’ll be constantly learning and improving your own skills and knowledge, which will ultimately help to grow our products and advance humanity through the power of software.

jobs.title: npm install `Full Stack JS Developer'
jobs.content:
Who are we?


In a Law firm, everyone should know what they should be doing. And why. Fanatical lawyers leave Law School every year seeking to advise and protect their clients. They then spend their careers filing paperwork and manually running their business instead of focusing on the one thing they want to do: Practicing Law.


Allowing small law firms to practice law: This is our passion and why we do what we do.


Over the last year, we have gone from 100 users to over 1200 today. In a year, we’ll be at 3500 with a set of features and products that will make us the dominant legal software in the US and Australia.


With our engineering team based in Sydney, we’re currently looking to add to our multi disciplined development environment of 15 passionate .Net and Javascript, yep, we have more than a few “discussions” as to the best technology. Tech talk Fridays are impassioned affairs. Current summary: Why not have the best of both?


Our .Net backend is the foundation of our product, originally conceived as WPF desktop software, we’re using this springboard to launch our javascript front end with Node ES6 and Angular.js.
