jobs.title: System Engineer - Dev Ops (m/f) - Linux Environment      €40,000 - 48,000
jobs.content:
SmartTrade’s customers run a wide range of deployments that consume our API. Our microservice architecture needs to be a highly available and provide consistent performance, with the challenge of customers generating diverse sets of workloads depending on their own data structure and usage patterns. Our goal is to provide High Availability, respecting SLAs for performance and uptime, in a context of high volume traffic and sustained growth. We manage a deep modern stack starting from real time CDN integrations at the outer level to internal layers of HTTP traffic, routing and caching, several services that all together compose our public APIs, a message bus collecting all the events happening on the platform with a set of consumers processing these events. We deploy our infrastructure on the AWS cloud and we also use other several CDN and infrastructure services provider for global real-time content distribution.

  • You are responsible for the conception and development of the infrastructure for large-scale IT projects
  • You enjoy the challenge of rock solid uptime and consistent performance in a frame of continuous delivery and diversity of workloads,
  • You enjoy researching and curating key metrics that expose anomalies and trends before systems deviate from sane behavior.
  • You ensure sustainable availability, performance, and scalability of the infrastructure across multiple continents and regions
  • You are managing our infrastructure, addressing security concerns, managing large scale software rollouts, configuration management of the software stack
  • You are supporting development with test and staging environments, automated testing environments, and virtualization
  • With the help of your ambition and curiosity you are able to handle upcoming challenges and tasks

Skills & Requirements

  • Multiple years of experience in planning and running Linux-based production deployments in high-availability & high-performance environments.
  • Strong experience with serving HTTP traffic, including knowledge of load-balancing, caching/CDNs and HTTP security.
  • Experience with a variety of data stores such as PostgreSQL, Redis, RabbitMQ, S3 and MySQL.
  • Experience working with configuration management tools.
  • Specific experience in the area of uptime and performance monitoring and SLAs.
  • Familiarity with operations: on call emergency procedures, incident management, post mortems.
  • Knowledge of OO and functional programming paradigms. Experience with at least two languages such as Java, Ruby, JavaScript, Python or Golang.
  • Familiarity with Continuous Integration services a plus (TravisCI, CircleCI, Jenkins). We are using Docker heavily in CI so hands-on experience with Docker will also come in handy.
  • Excellent English communication skills, verbal and written (German not required).
  • You get stuff done. We are looking for someone we can trust to do a good job without much handholding - you should enjoy responsibility.

BENEFITS

  • The Web is changing and becoming more interactive, be part of this revolution and work with cutting-edge technologies on the future of the Web.
  • Be in a fast-paced environment in a company that’s growing quickly. Garner responsibility and make a significant impact, instead of being just another cog in a machine.
  • Pick your own equipment to get the best out of your working days.
  • Live in Berlin.
  • We fully support your move to Berlin with a relocation budget. We also get your back in terms of settling down in a new city.

About SmartTrade (www.smarttra.de) SmartTrade is a fintech company which assists institutional investors, banks and asset managers with the independent evaluation of financial instruments and risk management, as well as the fulfillment of regulatory requirements. Our services and tools are aimed at asset managers, risk controllers, traders and investment advisors and are implemented, among other things, for the generation of trading ideas, for efficient risk assessment, and for due diligence or reporting purposes. Our technologies are at work during the complete life cycle of a trade. We support our clients with the initial pre-trade risk analysis, with ongoing monitoring and generation of trading signals, as well as with the calculation of relevant risk indicators such as mark-to-model values and value at risk.

Preferred: Bachelor of Science Degree in a technical discipline or related area. Excellent benefits package and salary commensurate with experience. Send a resume and cover letter with salary requirement to Human Resources Manager, Faculty Student Association, Stony Brook University West Side Dining (2nd Floor Rm 207), Stony Brook, NY 11794-4460 or fax 632-6582 or email responsehiringmanager@gmail.com Equal Opportunity Employer, females, minorities, disabled, veterans.

jobs.title: Customer Experience Associate
jobs.content:
About Us:

At Opendoor, we are revolutionizing the way people buy and sell homes by putting the power back into our customer’s hands. Sellers can get an offer on their home in hours and close in days, and buyers can browse Opendoor's inventory, visit them on their own schedule, and buy directly from us. Our goal is to make working with Opendoor as easy and pain-free as possible. We’ve been operating in Phoenix since November of 2014 and Dallas since December 2015 with upcoming expansion plans for late 2016.

The Role:

At Opendoor, the CX team is the face of our home acquisitions. We are advocates for our sellers and passionate about the Opendoor Experience. As a member of our team, you’ll be the first point of contact between home sellers and Opendoor, managing both phone and email communication and helping our sellers out from contract to closing. You will help build internal processes and tools to streamline and share customer insights and metrics with the company, as well as work with our Transaction Coordination team to ensure a seamless closing process for all customers.

Opendoor is new to the Dallas market, so you will be on the ground floor working along side a scrappy team that is dedicated to finding success in an exciting real estate market while also helping to build the Opendoor Dallas family. We are looking for someone who is excited about having a significant impact on recruiting, company culture, and local community development.

Our Ideal Candidate Has:

  • Fantastic interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • A passion for providing an outstanding customer service
  • Empathy for the challenges of buying and selling homes
  • A knack for juggling many tasks, from phone calls to email to metrics and tool-building
  • A do-whatever-it-takes attitude

Bonus Points:

  • Experience working on Sales or Customer Experience teams at other tech startups

What We Can Offer You:

  • Open vacation policy
  • Educational budget for whatever interests you
  • Fitness stipend
  • Generous parental leave
  • Uber credits

Oh yeah, and we also offer all the usual stuff too:

  • Full medical, dental, and vision with optional 50% coverage for dependents
  • Catered meals

jobs.title: Marketing Operations Manager
jobs.content:
About Us:

Would you like to work at fast-growing startup living at the intersection of artificial intelligence, behavioral science, and cutting-edge design? Glint technology and data science is at the heart of a transformation occurring at the world’s leading organizations, leveraging real-time people data to create highly-engaged employees and thriving organizations. The company has quickly emerged as a leader in the large and growing market for organizational effectiveness software. Glint has an extraordinary team passionate about our mission to help people be happier and more successful at work. The leadership team has a strong record of success of founding and growing innovative high-tech companies.

We empower some of the world’s leading brands like United Airlines, FICO, Palantir, eBay, AOL, and Pandora to create environments where their employees can thrive through a unique combination of:

  • highly-scalable, real-time analytics platform
  • world-class design and user experience
  • sophisticated artificial intelligence
  • deep organizational development science
  • strong commitment to customer success

If working with smart, fun people as part of a fast-growing, revolutionary Bay Area startup sounds good to you, come be a part of the team helping over 100 organizations give voice to their employees and enable real, positive change.

The Role:

You will run the marketing engine behind this fast-growing company committed to helping people be happier and more successful at work. Glint helps leading organizations measure and improve employee engagement, leading to better employee retention, performance, and business results.

In this role, you’ll architect and manage Glint’s demand funnel, marketing automation, account- based marketing, and analytics. You’ll be a key partner to the CMO and an advisor to the marketing, sales and executive teams. You’ll work for a leader who gets marketing ops and is a past SiriusDecisions ROI winner. You’ll also work with a really smart, fun group of people.

You are a strategic, data-driven marketer with a commitment to excellence. You like to impose structure on data so it can inform better decision making. You’re smart, analytical, and a good communicator who loves to automate and optimize.

You Will:

  • Manage technical aspects of key marketing and sales systems including marketing automation, CRM, and marketing analytics
  • Implement and optimize the demand funnel process, lead scoring, lead nurturing, and account-based marketing (ABM) programs
  • Oversee and track effectiveness of marketing campaigns
  • Help optimize spending within and across marketing programs including search, email, events, etc.
  • Advise sales, marketing, and executive teams on how to maximize return on marketing investment
  • Network outside the company to benchmark our operations and ensure best-in-class practices

Our Ideal Candidate Has:

  • Strong analytical skills combined with business acumen
  • Experience in marketing automation (preferably Marketo), Salesforce.com, and Excel
  • Systems thinker – able to design, implement, and test workflows associated with demand generation and sales
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Understanding of digital marketing techniques and metrics
  • BA/BS or equivalent work experience

Bonus Points:

  • MBA
  • Familiarity with SiriusDecisions waterfall and/or other methodologies

What We Can Offer You:

  • Competitive compensation and full benefits, including healthcare, life insurance, PTO and 401K
  • Early-stage equity
  • Catered lunches and flexible work arrangements
  • Regular company offsites and monthly happy hours
  • Learn from smart people and smart leadership
  • Work for dynamic, early-stage startup, helping organizations thrive

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer  Amazon Business
jobs.content:
The Amazon Business team is seeking a QAE who want to disrupt the way businesses institutions purchase their supplies. Our team is focused on building solutions to enable business customers to research, discover and buy business, industrial and scientific products in large catalogs; across multiple devices, marketplaces and regions. Our customers include individual professionals, businesses and institutions that buy in either high frequency or in bulk quantities. Our customers have different needs than the traditional Amazon customer base. Your will be part of a team that is responsible for all aspects of the customer experience - from the visual interface to the back end services. Our systems need to meet remarkably high standards of quality, performance and reliability, operating around the clock on a massive scale. You are a talented, detail, oriented and enthusiastic SQA who is passionate about quality and is enthusiastic about the new cutting edge technology offered to consumers.



QAE test code at the user level, both manually and with automated tools. Our QAE are not pure black box testers; they are more grey box, able to understand software internals, debug problems using log files, and write automated tests with Perl/Java scripts and/or user-level automated tools. QAE work with Software Development Engineers to understand features and technical implementation. QAE should also work with groups such as Product Management, User Interaction, and Customer Support to understand customer usage models and develop test plans and suites that approximate real-world environments and regression tests and driving the software development process towards quality-centric methodologies.

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (or related field)

Five or more years of QA experience

* Ability to translate use cases and/or technical specifications into test cases

* Ability to write code (java, Perl, python) for automated web testing tools, services, and frameworks

* Ability to write code to packages tests into regression test suites

* Strong knowledge of QA methodology and tools

* Ability to understand technical specifications and analyze log files

* Effectively Communicating cross-functionally and across management levels in formal and informal settings

* Strong organizational skills, tracking multiple test executions simultaneously and are able to synthesize the results



* Strong knowledge of Agile or Scrum development methodologies

* Ability to perform and track multiple test executions simultaneously and synthesize the results

* Capable of digging into the business needs and translating them into QA plans and processes



#hltech #amazonbusiness

jobs.title: Software Engineer II/III - C# and Instrument Integration

jobs.title: Web Designer
jobs.content:
At Volusion, we make products that people love. Our teams are dedicated to providing SaaS commerce solutions and services for all business types, ranging from startups to large enterprises. Our product portfolio includes Volusion, for emerging business, and Mozu, for leading enterprise brands. If you are the kind of entrepreneur that loves working in teams, has a passion for driving positive change, and wants to change the world with your ideas, we want to hear from you.


Your Quest:

Are you a talented designer with a solid web design portfolio? Do you operate well in a fun, fast paced and high-energy environment? Are you passionate about delivering strong, user-centric creative? If yes - we want to hear from you!

What you'll embark on:

  • Design responsive ecommerce websites for a variety of industries including some logo, social media, and marketing designs
  • Work on multiple projects, organize, and manage your time to meet deadlines
  • Communicate effectively with customers and Project Coordinators
  • Provide design elements, comps, templates, and finished designs
  • Work with Front-end Web developers to create HTML files and optimized graphics
  • Do your best work in a fun, respectful and supportive environment

What's in your arsenal:

  • 2+ year web design; experience in ecommerce design a plus
  • Creative web design experience; web design portfolio including responsive designs is required for consideration
  • BA/BS degree in Interactive design, Communications Design, Graphic Design or a related field preferred
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver)
  • HTML5 and CSS3
  • Working knowledge of Bootstrap, JavaScript (desired but not required)
  • A passion for design methodologies, particularly user-centered design process
  • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team
  • A desire and willingness to learn and take on new challenges
  • Ability to set and meet deadlines as well as prioritize when in crunch-mode.
  • Humble and open to constructive criticism
  • Excellent writing and communication skills
  • Previous experience with a content management system is preferred, but not required
  • Previous experience in a web design agency is a plus
  • Excellent organizational skills and able to meet deadlines
  • Fluent with Mac OS


Your crew:

These are the folks behind the curtain, making our Volusion websites and applications beautiful. They are creative beyond belief and make it a point to stay at the forefront of design trends. They excel in a work hard, play hard atmosphere and like to participate in team happy hours at some of Austin’s “weirdest” establishments.

jobs.title: Senior .Net Engineer
jobs.content:
Apogy is looking for a Senior Staff engineer skilled in enterprise level  .Net development to help lead a US based team and manage various off shore development resources. The candidate must have experience with the Amazon AWS cloud environment and be well versed in AWS and Microsoft best practices with regard to security, scalability multi tenant architecture and high availability.



The individual must have strong communication skill and thrive with an SCRUM oriented agile environment with numerous short sprints and system updates.



Our current product offering focus on corporate learning with iOS based mobile delivery and a web based admin to control all aspects of the products. The candidate must therefore have experience in building large scale WebAPI based systems and have a working knowledge of mobile development.  Our systems must integrate with our clients internal and party systems ranging from SSO, AD and to SharePoint, SAP and SalesForce which in turn often requires significant customization.



The position will involve both primary programming, architecture, documentation, and direct client interaction. We currently utilize C#, ASP.net MVC and RDS MSSQL Server but are looking to hybridize out to include various open source and AWS technologies including NOSQL solutions, Node and SQS and Lambda.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.content:
Hello, future addition to Customer.io! Weâre looking forward to getting to know you better, but you probably want to know what youâre getting yourself into. You can check out our careers page, or read on.

At Customer.io, our mission is helping businesses talk like people. Today, we do this with messaging software that allows businesses with large user-bases to send targeted, more relevant communication at scale. Our customers include Shutterstock, DigitalOcean, Handy, and Watsi.

Our new Product Manager:

In short, weâre looking for someone who will help us take customer.io beyond email and empower our customers to reach their users no matter the medium. You will own the creation, execution and ongoing improvement of our process for prioritizing new enhancements and existing bugs.

You would collaborate with multiple teams; right now, Product consists of our CEO Colin, product manager JÃ³hann, and senior UX/UI designer Ivana. Youâll spend significant time learning both the product and our customers and be able to speak to their needs and pain points. Youâd also work with people from the front-end team, customer success, engineering, and tech support.

 
What skills will you bring to the table?

At your core, youâll be an excellent communicator, in a variety of contexts. Youâll be collaborating with our multidisciplinary teams â being able to express your ideas and building understanding will be key.

Wondering about the specifics? Here they areâ in your day-to-day, weâd want you to:

  • Collaborate with our team to prioritize and define the roadmap;  youâll be distilling abstract features into discrete requirements
  • Assist with backlog grooming, and ticket prioritization, and contribute to design tasks like prototyping and wireframing.
  • Own the system for bugs and enhancements - youâll prepare the weekly engineering meeting with a prioritized list of work for the engineers.
  • Participate in and conduct user research; help us create a process for this so we can continue to provide external feedback to the whole team, and forge relationships with our customers.
  • Help us iterate and improve on our developing product processes to build features faster and more confidently
  • Interact daily with multiple teams including engineering, support, design, marketing, sales, and success across multiple timezones to share product knowledge, align our teams, and surface ways to best serve our customers.
As you can see, communication and collaboration are the foundations of this role, as is a solid software/SaaS background. We want to talk to you about your experience in product or development or design, on how you owned a feature from product planning stages to release, and what excites you about the future of audience engagement by using data and messaging.

Weâre trying to move fast and build things the right way, and building our processes iteratively as we go. If theyâre looking for a work environment where all of this is in place, they likely wonât find it here. But if they want to contribute to these foundations, awesome!

 
Why should you work with Customer.io?

We want to enable you to do your best work, and this is how we aim to do thatâ

Equity: Youâll own a piece of the company. It's not a get-rich-quick deal, but if you stay around for a while, we're planning to be a long-lasting company, and your piece of it may be a nice bonus.
Big impact: Our team is small, but growing quickly. The work you do will materially impact how successful we are as a company, both with our product and our culture.
Great tools: Everyone in the company has a budget for a great computer, motorized standing desk, Steelcase Leap office chair, external monitor, and anything else you'd like to get your job done.
Health benefits: We pay 100% of your premiums for medical, dental and vision.
Retreats: We want everyone in our company to connect in person whenever possible, so we get everyone together once a year. We've had retreats in Barcelona, Romania, and Hunter Mountain, NY.
Vacation: Rest and recuperation are important. We offer unlimited paid time off with a two week minimum per year.

Diversity at Customer.io

At Customer.io, weâre committed to building a diverse environment, and encourage minority applicants. So far, we have team members in Scotland, Germany, Saint Maarten, Canada, and all over the US. Our CEO and CTO grew up in Singapore and Arkansas respectively, but met in New York City. Our company culture is always evolving; people from different backgrounds bring valued perspective and thoughtfulness to the work that we do and the culture we foster.

Customer.io provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Customer.io complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Basically, we follow the law, but also like you for who you are!

To apply: Intrigued? Talk to us!Apply via our website, and make sure you tell us why youâre interested in the position! Weâd love see examples of shipped products or features that youâre proud of and are excited to talk about. Let us know what excites you about the role, what problems you want to dig into, and how we can work together.

jobs.title: Haskell Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Wrinkl is building a fullstack Haskell team.


Currently, Wrinkl is working with Obsidian Systems, a leading Haskell software consulting company that uses a combination of cutting-edge and tried-and-true technologies to build custom software solutions, which range from seed-stage startups to multinational corporations. Wrinkl’s technology stack is based on Haskell, Reflex and Reflex-DOM, GHCJS, NixOS, PostgresSQL and AWS. Wrinkl is looking to hire experienced and capable Haskell developers to initially work with Obsidian Systems and to be the core on which our in-house technology development team is built.


Wrinkl is building a world-class team that enjoys an intellectually challenging and high-energy environment. We want developers who are fully invested, enthusiastic and take great pride in their work. Wrinkl also fully appreciates the need to live a balanced life and values productive output over face time.


While we are located in New York City, and we will be hiring people locally, remote work is also available. If you are highly proficient with front-end and/or back-end architecture and have a passion for innovation, we would love to tell you more about our exciting opportunity.


Wrinkl provides its developers a competitive compensation package, including cash, equity and health care coverage.

jobs.title: Application Architect & Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Portland, Oregon based recycling company is seeking a senior application architect to lead our enterprise-wide technology development efforts. A successful candidate enjoys a fast-paced environment while demonstrating an attention to detail and a can-do attitude.  This position will own all planning, coordinate all aspects of software and related hardware development and align stakeholders across the entire business to successfully deploy projects for our growing company.


Responsibilities of this role include: 



  • Performing complex software application programming in C#, Microsoft .NET, Java, and web/app development to maintain, enhance existing, or build new custom applications.

  • Reviewing, analyzing and understanding business department(s) needs and goals for the purpose of incorporating into overall strategies to design, develop and implement technology solutions.

  • Providing senior management guidance on appropriate strategies regarding long-term technology direction. Ensure alignment with all business departments and technology standards.

  • Carrying on design and development duties on complex and multiple on-going projects, often involving multiple disparate technologies and/or integration of third-party systems.

  • Acting as a focal point of expertise (both within the company and our suppliers) on key technologies or skills.

  • Defining and reviewing enterprise technology architectures in order to maintain a broad view and understanding of the company’s software landscape.

  • Other projects as may be assigned by the CFO. 


Requirements: 



  • Minimum of 10 years of extensive experience working as a hands-on application developer and 5 years as an architect.

  • Detail driven with strong communication, business analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Resilient and able to work in an organization that is undergoing change due to growth.

  • Must be self-motivated, disciplined, able to work on own initiative and take responsibility for own work.

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or information systems required. Master’s degree preferred.

  • Must demonstrate ability to effectively communicate with all levels of company personnel including the CFO and President.

Pay and Benefits: 



  • Salary will be highly competitive

  • Medical/Dental/Life STD/LTD/LTC Insurance Plans

  • 401(k) with company match

  • Paid Time Off

  • Paid Holidays

jobs.title: IT Security Specialist
jobs.content:
In this role you will work with the Information Security group to provide hands-on implementation of security infrastructure, enforcement of best practices with the following work:


Ensure the security of our infrastructure by assisting with the design and installation of security services and applications. You will develop, install, manage, maintain and optimize security infrastructure, systems and applications to ensure compliance with security controls.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.content:
At Continu we’re on a mission to build better workplaces through the development of thoughtful software that solves problems for our users. Our Learning platform has been used by some of the world's smartest companies to help develop their employees.

We’re seeking a passionate and talented Senior Product Designer to lead design at Continu. This person will play a critical role in how we solve design problems on a daily basis, as well as be instrumental in future hiring decisions for the design team.


How you’ll work:

You’ll work wherever you feel most creative – from home, a coffee shop or a co-working space. We’re a completely distributed team with employees located across 7 cities and 4 countries.


What you’ll be doing:

  • Utilize best practices to shape and define design processes
  • Design user flows, sketches/wireframes, and produce visual design
  • Define the user experience, interactions, user interface and information architecture
  • Design simple, elegant, user-centric experiences that delight our users
  • Build functional prototypes to validate and test your designs
  • Contribute to and work with existing patterns to create consistent, reusable experiences
  • Lead user research to gain product insights from our users
  • Collaborate with the engineering and business teams to translate business goals into unique product experiences
  • Help shape the product strategy and vision
  • Look for opportunities to solve problems in unique and innovative ways
  • Help maintain visual and brand consistency between all products and outlets


About You:

As our Senior Product Designer you:

  • Always put the user’s needs first
  • Have a solid, well defined design process
  • Are passionate about product design, and highly motivated
  • Are a self-starter and incredibly organized
  • Are passionate about keeping up with new technologies and analyzing trends
  • Consider copy an important element of the product experience
  • Love to find creative ways solve to problems
  • Value learning and constantly strive to develop in new ways
  • Look at data to help inform design decisions
  • Can think about high-level product strategy and vision
  • Think that how it works is just as important as how it looks
  • Can communicate design concepts precisely to all team members
  • Obsess over details and are excited to polish until your work is pixel­ perfect


Requirements:

  • 3 - 5 years experience designing and shipping user-centric product experiences
  • In-depth understanding of responsive design and usability limitations for the web and mobile platforms
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, iterative environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong understanding of design fundamentals: composition, typography, grid systems, etc.
  • Advanced proficiency of design and prototyping tools including Balsamic, Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator and Invision
  • General understanding of HTML and CSS fundamentals


Bonus Points if you have:

  • Experience working in a distributed/remote team environment
  • Have lead a design team in the past
  • Experience building design teams

jobs.title: Senior Software Architect
jobs.content:
Improve the lives of hundreds of thousands of people by working on our award-winning telehealth product with us.  We serve 150,000 Alaska Natives, and many more commercial customers in 17 countries.


Our product suite includes an ASP.NET Gmail-style power user interface, a touchscreen-optimized cart kiosk interface with medical device integration, and mobile apps for iOS and Android using Xamarin, with SQL Server on the back-end.  Portions of our system run on Microsoft Azure.  We externally integrate with the Cerner electronic health record system, and are deepening that integration even further by embedding our product directly in the Cerner user interface.  We also do video teleconferencing integration with Vidyo, and will likely be integrating that with Cerner in the near future.  Mobile medical device integration is also on the roadmap.


 What we use:



  • C#, SQL, JavaScript, ES6, CSS, HTML, XSLT

  • .NET Framework 4.6, ASP.NET, Web API, SignalR, WinForms

  • jQuery, AngularJS, Bootstrap, JSPM

  • Xamarin.iOS, Xamarin.Android

  • Subversion (moving to Git), CruiseControl.NET build automation

  • Slack, Trello, Mercury bug tracking (moving Trello and Mercury to Jira)

  • Scrum with 3-week sprints, plus documentation to satisfy FDA medical device regulations

jobs.title: Sr. Salesforce Platform Administrator and Developer
jobs.content:
Role:


We are looking for a senior Salesforce Platform Administrator and Developer who will provide technical strategy and direction to ensure that the Salesforce application is effectively implemented and managed across our Sales, Marketing, Technical Services and Support, Products, R&D, and Order Management Business Groups. The candidate will offer best practices and recommendations for process integration, application development, deployment and ongoing enhancements of the Salesforce Platform. The candidate would also have a proven track record of related experience to support and fulfill the strategic objectives of a highly cross-functional organization.


Job Description:



  • Evaluate and propose how best to leverage Salesforce.com technology to meet evolving business requirements and information needs both within and across functions

  • Work effectively with key business stakeholders to identify and prioritize specific requirements

  • Design and implement solutions (using industry standard best practices) with functions in the organization that utilize and accessSalesforce.com

  • Plan and lead initiative to integrate Salesforce.com to backend business systems to enable near real-time access to key performance metrics

  • Provide global day-to-day end-user support (including system configuration, complex formulas and system maintenance) and assist users with proactive best practices to enhance and increase their knowledge of Salesforce.com

  • Maintain user roles and profiles, security settings, access settings etc. (User Profiles, Role Hierarchy, Sharing Rules and Security)

  • Hands-on experience in Mass Data Migrations using different data migration tools

  • Experience in production deployment using ANT, Force.com IDE, etc.

  • Experience to respond to production support requests and troubleshoot issues.

  • Experience integrating the 3rd party Apps with Salesforce

  • Create and manage custom objects, fields, formulas, validation rules, custom workflow, and approval processes

  • Perform data integrity and manipulation tasks such as merging duplicate records and establishing proper ownership of existing accounts and contacts in accordance with sales territories

  • Establish and implement best practices with regards to system maintenance, configuration, development, testing, data integrity, etc.

  • Design, document, build, test and deploy enhancements to Salesforce custom objects, page layouts, workflows, alerts, reports and complex dashboards within Salesforce

  • Research changes in upcoming versions of Salesforce.com and other integrated applications

  • Provide recommendations when necessary to enhance efficiency and productivity

  • Develop and maintain report folders, dashboards, etc. to improve system usability

  • Maintain a holistic view of all business processes and users in the system to understand cross functional impacts with regard to configuration, process, workflow and reporting

  • Lead with user requirement sessions and document user requirements to address changing business needs

  • Develop and maintain Visual Force, AppExchanges, Force.com pages and integration to other third party solutions

  • Ability to design, code, test, debug, package and deploy quality, scalable and well documented solutions on the Salesforce platform

  • Ability to design and develop integrations between Salesforce and other applications / systems (including SAP)

  • Successfully document / maintain documentation on application code, application use and flow and training materials

  • Perform routine review of code, configuration, data, and usage to ensure long term viability, integrity, and adoption

  • Make recommendations for enhancements and modifications to improve system performance, efficiency, internal business process, and reporting

  • Ability to interact with senior members of management, including C-level executives

  • Prepare and present clear business and technical analysis

  • Effective verbal and written communication skills and strong work ethic

  • Strong partnership with business leads to ensure they have the skills needed to train end users and support the business functionally

  • Lead efforts to develop, train and expand use of Salesforce.com to optimize productivity and effectiveness resulting in enhanced user knowledge and competency with Salesforce.com

  • Define, measure, and report on sales and business metrics

  • Keeps management apprised of project status and keeps the continuous flow of information among all business stakeholders

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager Amazon Publishing
jobs.content:
Amazon Publishing is the full-service publishing arm of Amazon. Our mission is to invent new mechanisms to connect authors and readers. We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Manager to own development of demand generation products from the very early stages through implementation.



This role is inherently cross-functional -- you will work closely with engineering, design, operations, finance, external stakeholders, and executive teams to bring features and products to market and develop and grow business opportunities. You will proactively identify and resolve strategic issues, as well as secure and schedule the resources and to deliver to the program. Other key responsibilities include monitoring the execution of the project and ensuring appropriate levels of quality to maintain the overall integrity of the project.



An ideal candidates is one who thrives in a fast paced start-up like environment, has an entrepreneurial attitude, a passion for marketing, and wants to invent for the future.


  • Qualified candidates must have 4 to 5 years of Product Management experience with at least two years of working on marketing related products.

  • Passion for product: conceiving, designing, building, and shipping it.

  • Experience driving decisions for a technical product, ideally a consumer facing website or device.

  • Deep understanding of user interface design and user testing best practices. A good product starts with a good design, and the ability to recognize and innovate on good UI design is crucial.

  • Highly quantitative. Enjoy analyzing user data - lots of it!

  • Ability to prioritize ruthlessly and get stuff done.

  • Excellent communicator both verbally and written with an ability to communicate with all levels in the organization (technical, business, executive).

  • Decision Making/ Complex Problem Solving- system thinker who proactively gathers the right data from appropriate sources to make the right decisions




  • MBA preferred

  • Excellent customer experience intuition; demonstrated success in creating innovative and user-friendly websites and customer-facing features

  • Strong strategic aptitude; proven ability to define a winning business strategy and product roadmap

  • Demonstrated analytical skills; business trend analysis and forecasting

  • Experience in bringing technology products to market in a fast-paced environment

  • Nimbleness and comfort with ambiguity; demonstrated track record of creative problem solving; thinks big, starts small, grows fast

  • A proven track record of setting and exceeding aggressive goals; evidence of the ability to consistently make good decisions through a combination of analysis, experience, and judgment

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
crowdSPRING is changing the way entrepreneurs, startups, established companies, agencies and non-profits around the world buy graphic design, industrial design, and naming/writing services. Over 185,000 designers and writers from nearly every country in the world work on crowdSPRING.


We launched in 2008, re-launched a brand new site in 2010, and are now working to make crowdSPRING even better by reimagining everything about our business and our industry. This is an amazing opportunity for someone who wants to join a profitable startup. We have big plans, but we can't do it alone.


As a senior engineer, you’ll have a huge impact on how we design, build and deliver our services to millions of people. We're looking for extraordinarily talented engineers to join our team. Our site is seen by millions of people around the world and we’re focused on solving real problems. Your contributions will be immediate and far-reaching. This isn't the kind of gig where you're handed a to-do list from a PM - you'll help make the big decisions. You'll not only be developing the code, you'll also contribute to analysis, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance. You'll be a thought leader and driving force for coding standards and automated testing.


We’re looking for engineers who are not afraid to stick their neck out in pursuit of innovation and creative solutions. People who know what they want, who execute against all odds, are meticulous, detail oriented, and take pride in their work. Above all we’re looking for passionate individuals who enjoy what they do and seek to live balanced and happy lives.


We want to know you’re qualified, but more importantly, we want to know that you want this job and not just any job. Tell us why you want to join our team.


When applying, please send links to things you’ve built. We are not concerned with your education. We are concerned with your experience and want to see your recent work.

jobs.title: Senior SQL DBA
jobs.content:
WHO WE ARE


Cylance is one of the fastest growing companies in the history of cybersecurity. By successfully applying artificial intelligence and machine learning to crack the DNA of malware, Cylance has redefined the endpoint protection market, garnered acclaim from industry analysts and won numerous awards including “Best Emerging Vendor” from SC Magazine. If you have the passion and desire to disrupt industries, protect the world from cyberattacks, and be at the forefront of a revolutionary new technology, we want you to join us!


THE POSITION


At the heart of Cylance Product Development is our state of the art threat detection system. Unlike traditional approaches, Cylance does not rely solely on signatures or even pre-determined behaviors to determine if something is known to be good or bad. Instead, we have developed a mathematical approach to identifying advanced threats. This intelligent system evolves in real-time as new threats emerge, providing continuous detection and protection.


We are looking for a Senior SQL DBA to help design and implement the database architecture for our cutting edge cybersecurity platform. You'll be at the heart of our technology, defining our data vision and implementing a high performance, scalable database infrastructure. We want you to be as passionate and enthusiastic about data as we are about protection. Ready to make a difference?

jobs.title: Front End Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Sense is building hardware and mobile apps to help people analyze their home energy consumption, see what is going on in their homes, and ultimately reduce their energy footprint -- all powered by cutting-edge machine learning technology that can tell which appliances are on in your house and how much power they're using, in real time.


As a front end software engineer at Sense, you will help bring the Sense experience to the web with an elegant, responsive, and modern web app.


Requirements:



  • 3+ years of web software development experience

  • Experience building responsive web applications with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

  • Experience with at least one modern JavaScript front end framework (react, angular, etc)

  • Excitement and passion for web development


Nice to have's:



  • Degree in computer science or related field

  • Experience using AWS for deployment (CloudFront, S3, etc)

  • Excitement and experience with data visualization (D3, etc) is a plus

  • Own copy of JavaScript the good parts


Why we think you will love working with us:



  • Be a part of building something that will make a difference in the world

  • Have a big impact at an early-stage, VC-backed consumer startup

  • Work with a small team of experienced entrepreneurs creating revolutionary technology

  • Competitive compensation, benefits, and a great office in Harvard Square

jobs.title: Python Web Developer
jobs.content:
We have an ASAP 1-year consulting opportunity for an on-site project with Google's Youtube division. This is a fantastic opportunity that involves both design and development for a new development effort. A mix of strong technical capabilities in addition to superb communication skills is required.


This position includes the 'Google Perks', as well as the opportunity to deliver technology while working with a superb group of people. The work involves development of a system to manage the workflow and clicks for a complex music licensing system used by companies throughout the world! 


Minimum Qualifications:



  • -BA/BS degree in computer science or related field (In lieu of degree, 4 years relevant work experience).

  • Minimum 5 years experience with web technologies)

  • Knowledge of javascript frameworks (Angular is preferred)

  • 4+ years of coding experience in Python.

  • Basic SQL knowledge

  • Strong ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively


For immediate confidential consideration please email me - noah@scopusit.com

jobs.title: Web/Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
This is an exciting opportunity in the large and growing segment of healthcare and well-being. The Web / Mobile App Developer designs and develops customer-facing mobile applications and responsive web sites. This individual also serves as a usability, accessibility, and web design expert.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develops responsive web pages, mobile applications, and associated services according to business needs and project schedules

    • Collaborates with business and technical stakeholders to define the user experience

    • Effectively applies HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript to implement responsive designs

    • Makes enhancements to improve website accessibility

    • Develops and tests mobile applications for iOS and Android

    • Designs and develops web services using Java to expose data consumed by mobile apps

    • Assists in the design, development, and maintenance of other websites, as needed



  • Proposes solutions, rather than discusses problems

    • Thinks through problems and determines alternative solutions; ensures problems do not reoccur

    • Removes obstacles by asking upfront questions. Moves ahead, rather than waiting on others



  • Follows a disciplined approach, rather than a “code and fix” approach, to software development

    • Captures user experience in the form of wireframes and mock-ups

    • Estimates work effort and delivers assigned tasks according to the agreed upon schedule

    • Performs up-front prototyping and documents software design

    • Develops source code according to project team coding guidelines

    • Follows project team practices for source code configuration management

    • Verifies source code by performing unit, feature, and/or performance testing



  • Contributes as part of a high performing, technical team

    • Clearly communicates task status and informs management of deviations

    • Actively helps and collaborates with peers. Makes efforts to proactively resolve conflicts

    • Works well with other technologists and content authors

    • Ability to manage and prioritize multiple concurrent assignments

    • Takes initiative to self manage; does not always rely on management direction/supervision

jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Sense is building hardware and mobile apps to help people analyze their home energy consumption, see what is going on in their homes, and ultimately reduce their energy footprint -- all powered by cutting-edge machine learning technology that can tell which appliances are on in your house and how much power they're using, in real time.


As an embedded software engineer at Sense, you will be responsible for the operating systems and software running on Sense hardware.



  • Develop, enhance and maintain bootloader, operating system, device drivers, and application code

  • Work with hardware teams on board bring-up and hardware support


Requirements:



  • Degree in relevant field or equivalent practical experience

  • 4+ years experience embedded systems programming, Linux, and C/C++

  • Experience developing and debugging Linux kernel drivers

  • Experience building Linux-based system images for use on embedded hardware 


Nice to haves:



  • Experience working with Linux wireless networking and data acquisition drivers

  • Experience working with ARM SoCs

  • Familiarity with GNU toolchain or equivalent cross platform development tools


Why we think you will love working with us:



  • Be a part of building something that will make a difference in the world

  • Have a big impact at an early-stage, VC-backed consumer startup

  • Work with a small team of experienced entrepreneurs creating revolutionary technology

  • Competitive compensation, benefits, and a great office in Harvard Square

jobs.title: Hadoop Data Architect
jobs.content: The Data Architect assume overall technical responsibility for the design and implementation of end-to-end, large scale complex solutions, that integrate data from desperate systems, and delivers business solutions typically over a multi-tenant cloud environment. The Data Architect also advises on engineering practices, development environments, and processes.

jobs.title: Senior .Net Software Developer
jobs.content:
ComputerEase Software, the national leading provider of construction accounting, project management and field-to-office software for the construction industry, is actively seeking candidates for a Senior .Net Software Development Engineer position.


The Software Development Engineer is responsible for designing, coding, documenting, and testing .NET/SQL Server-based applications for ComputerEase Construction Accounting Software.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities



  • Perform product design, bug verification, release testing, and beta support on software projects

  • Identify and communicate opportunities for improving development methods and procedures

  • Follow Agile Development methodologies for effective delivery of project goals

  • Proactively anticipate risks and mitigate them before they occur

  • Demonstrate professionalism, discretion, and good judgment in all interactions

jobs.title: System Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Join the team that operates and manages the Hubble Space Telescope and its successor, the James Webb Space Telescope. Take part in work at the forefront of astronomy in a job that offers a competitive salary and generous benefits. The Space Telescope Science Institute (STScI) is located on the Homewood campus of the Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, MD. STScI is seeking a Systems Software Engineer to join the Astronomical Planning and Support Branch in the Engineering and Operations Division to support the Hubble and James Webb NASA space telescope missions.

The Systems Software Engineer designs, codes, and integrates Java based GUI software applications used by astronomers to prepare observations for the James Webb and Hubble Space Telescopes. This includes working with teams of engineers and end users to help derive software requirements, implementation approaches, and testing strategies. The Systems Software Engineer is responsible for the maintenance of existing software components and the full life cycle development of new software features.

Successful candidates will have experience in applying Java and Java-related technologies to mathematical or visualization domains and a working knowledge of data structures, databases, operating systems, programming languages, compilers, and multi-threaded program execution. Experience in developing and deploying web-based applications is a plus and a background in math, physics or astronomy is desirable.


Requirements:



Applicants must have a BS in Computer Science, or a MS (preferred) or PhD in Computer Science. Candidates with a degree in a related engineering discipline with past programming experience may also be considered.

This position requires 4+ years of experience in software development. Previous experience with system engineering design and processes and scientific spacecraft ground systems is desirable.

The qualified candidate will have:
-Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
-The ability to effectively utilize programming technologies to code algorithms that satisfy specified software requirements
-Working knowledge of Object Oriented design and development.
-A team-player mentality
-Strong verbal and written communication skills

Candidates must be a US citizen or Permanent Resident. ITAR clearance is required.

STScI offers an excellent benefits package, tuition reimbursement, competitive salaries, and a stimulating work environment. Interested candidates are requested to complete an on-line application at http://www.stsci.edu/institute/employment and attach a resume in the "Resume Upload Section." Please include job #16-0123 in the file name. Resumes received by June 3, 2016will receive full consideration.

STScI sees the diversity of its staff as a strategic priority in our desire to create a first-rate scientific community. We reflect that deep commitment in strongly encouraging women, minorities, veterans and disabled individuals to apply for these opportunities. As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, STScI does not discriminate because of race, sex, color, age, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, lawful political affiliations, veteran status, or mental or physical handicap. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V.

If anyone needs assistance applying or making edits to a profile, please email careers@stsci.edu.

jobs.title: Java Data Tier Developer
jobs.content:
Develop In the Chat's data tier. This is a message-passing network of Java daemons that acquires large volumes of data from Twitter, Facebook, Twilio, chat clients and other sources. The daemons classify the incoming messages and route them to call centre agents. See "About the Company" for more on the application. Classification uses a variety of techniques, most prominently NLP.


We prefer that individuals work on site face to face with their team-mates, most of the time. We will consider remote-only but in that case you must be resident in the Americas. We prefer permanent employment arrangements but we will consider contract arrangements.

jobs.content:
Develop In the Chat's data tier. This is a message-passing network of Java daemons that acquires large volumes of data from Twitter, Facebook, Twilio, chat clients and other sources. The daemons classify the incoming messages and route them to call centre agents. See 'About the Company' for more on the application. jobs.title: Senior test automation framework developer
jobs.content:
As the team behind Decisio Health’s FDA-cleared clinical intelligence platform, we operate in an environment with very little margin for error. We need a senior Python developer to design and implement an automated testing framework that meets our regulatory requirements while allowing us to release updates quickly and reliably.


What you'll be doing:



  • Designing APIs that allow tests to run against multiple production configurations

  • Working with clinicians to simulate patient and hospital data

  • Validating all stages of our data processing and display pipelines

  • Working with devops to make deployments repeatable and testable

  • Automating everything, so end-to-end tests run every time we push code

jobs.title: High Resolution 3D Illustrator
jobs.content:
This is a remote position and is part-time / freelance.  Please do NOT apply if you are not interested in part-time / freelance work.

This Job is Simple

You MUST be a highly skilled 3D illustrator that can make digital images of objects and animals that look hyper-realistic and almost "real"... yet the drawings are 100% digital.

Here is the EXACT STYLE and Quality of 3D visuals we Seek:

https://lstore.graphics/fancy/

The 3D Elements in the kit listed above are hyper-realistic, hyper-resolution, and almost real... but not quite.

We seek a 3D illustrator that can render new objects in the EXACT same style, color pallet, but will do so with themes that include:

  • Animals - tigers, panthers, etc.
  • Super Hero's - X-Men, Fantastic 4, etc. 
  • Pop Culture- Jedi Knights, Storm Troopers, etc.

Art Direction As Well!

You must also possess the art direction skills required to take a concept like "Storm Troopers" and turn it into a hyper realistic, 3D style Avatar / Icon that looks good both in large scale as well as all the way down to a 100x100 pixel size.

To apply: brad.murphy@gearstream.com
