jobs.title: Clojure Developer
jobs.content:
Dean and Company is looking for a Clojure Developer to develop financials systems in collaboration with affiliated trading firms and hedge funds. The system is being developed both for these affiliates and as a commercial product. You will be involved with the development from an early stage.

The software underpinning all of this will be written mainly in Clojure, but we value developers who can think in terms of functional programming languages (e.g. Scala, Lisp, Scheme). Our ideal candidate is a polyglot with an aptitude for learning new languages.

jobs.title: MySQL/PHP Software Developer
jobs.content: You will help acquire and optimize data storage from our many sources across the web. This involves designing and implementing solutions to challenging cURL, parsing, and data storage problems using our proprietary PHP-based applications, all the while ensuring data flows seamlessly into our MySQL and custom NoSQL databases. You may also be responsible for creating dashboards and displays we use to view this data. As your experience with tackling these data acquisition and storage problems grows, you may contribute to developing our in-house frameworks.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
DC Energy is looking for software engineers to help develop and refine the software that powers our business. We take a do-it-yourself approach and have built a stack composed of a variety of technologies (e.g. R, Python, Shiny, NoSQL, MySQL, PHP, Go, Subversion). We employ the tools best suited for a given job, and seek individuals who share that philosophy. Our ideal candidate is a polyglot with an aptitude for picking up new languages and technologies.

This is a hands-on, technical role in a highly-collaborative team. Responsibilities will include development of software new and old across many aspects of our business. As your experience grows, you will contribute to more general design and architecture questions.

jobs.title: Windows C# Developer - Work on our Flagship Product!
jobs.content:
Tired of working on projects that never see the light of day?  Have an immediate impact on Bluebeam's flagship product that boasts a suite of advanced industry specific tools beloved by a large customer base in the architecture, engineering, and construction industries. Take a look at what you might be working on: http://www.bluebeam.com/us/products/revu/. 


As part of Bluebeam’s Revu Team, you will be working both independently and collaboratively to extend the existing functionality as well as develop new eXtreme features; including back-end and front-end development. Bluebeam's development environment is fast-paced, having product delivery cycles measured in months rather than years. You will get the opportunity to learn a wide spectrum of technologies and work with your team to solve complicated problems. Instead of simply executing tasks according to detailed instructions, we want our engineers to develop a deep understanding of the product and how it impacts our customers’ needs. When something doesn’t work, you and your team will come together to  design, validate, implement and test the right fix. We aren’t formal here. You’ll need to pick things up quickly and be self-motivated to learn, research and ask the right questions about what you don’t know. In return, your ideas and opinions will be valued as important assets in our daily work. Think this sounds like you?  Keep reading.


We are a proactive, positive, tight-knit team with a great sense of humor and passion for our work. Want to see? http://careers.bluebeam.com/culture


What we'd want to see in you



  • 5+ years of experience in a related field

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher - Computer Science or equivalent field

  • Proven Windows Desktop Development experience in .NET technologies, particularly C#  and Visual C++

  • Familiarity with JavaScript

  • Familiarity with integrating with open source libraries

  • Bonus points if you have a familiarity with the Functional Programming paradigm with languages such as OCaml, F#, or Haskell

  • UI Design Experience

  • Experience using OO methodologies in designing software solutions.

  • Strong ability to analyze vague problem descriptions and formulate effective solutions. Be able to analyze a need and engineer a solution. 

  • Strong written and verbal communications skills

  • Sharp critical thinking skills, including systems and business analysis, problem analysis and resolution, and sound judgment/decision making ability

  • Proven ability to work in a rapid release production environment

  • Passion for writing strong, dependable code.

  • Demonstrated trait of being a self-starter

  • Be able to see shades of grey instead of black or white when presented with an issue

  • Did you take the compilers class in college?  Awesome!  Big plus here!


What we'd LOVE to see in you



  • Architectural, Engineering, design domain knowledge

  • Computer graphics including Windows Graphics frameworks (e.g. DirectX, OpenGL) beneficial

  • Product Lifecycle Management applications


If you think you are a good match for the Bluebeam team, please send us the following:



  • Cover Letter (And we’d love it to show us a little of who you are and why you are  interested in us)

  • Resume 


Learn about working here at Bluebeam: http://careers.bluebeam.com/.

jobs.title: Full Stack .NET Software Engineer, Rally Choice
jobs.content:
Purpose, mastery and autonomy. We provide all three at Rally Health (rallyhealth.com), a well-funded, financially successful grown-up startup that's revolutionizing health and the face of health care, improving the lives of millions of people. Join an elite team of engineers and have the autonomy to architect the solutions that scale to fit our user growth. 


In 2016 our Rally Choice enrollment platform will be used by millions of people to enroll in their health care benefits, most in a period of just a few weeks. Our domain is extremely complicated and our traffic pattern is highly episodic.


We are looking for strong full-stack developers to join our team of about 30 engineers, who are in turn part of a 100 person nationwide engineering team. Most of our codebase is C# fronted by ReactJS but we write a fair amount of Scala and Python on the team as well. The platform is service-oriented, event-sourced, and well-written, and our culture is friendly with minimal BS.


We collaborate: expect to show your work to your peers, teach them things and learn from them. We have a cozy office with big monitors, beer or fancy juice on Fridays, and a casual but high-performance culture. In addition to a typical startup benefit package, we offer free health care for individuals (families prorated and highly discounted), catered lunches and snacks, unlimited PTO, and a competitive compensation package including stock options. 


Like most shops we cherry pick the parts of Agile, Scrum, and Kanban that fit our current work. We're pragmatists, not, um, dogmatists: methodology mavens or architecture astronauts will not like it here.


Since your resume (and maybe the search that brought you here!) includes an obligatory list of keywords, here's ours: C#, NEventStore, Chef, ReactJS, Flux, Jasmine, Jenkins, Bow Truss, RabbitMQ, Octopus Deploy, PowerShell.

jobs.title: SCM Administrator
jobs.content:
(Quality Assurance, SCM Administrator):


We are currently seeking a SCM Administrator who will drive implementation of Git for source code management, including source code branching, merging, build strategies and deployment strategies along with maintaining the tools and environments to help the teams deliver major software releases.This is an on-site position and will be located in our Naperville office.



Responsibilities Include:




  • Administration, maintenance, and upgrade of source code management tools

  • Education and evangelism of source code management tools

  • Define, implement, and manage the build, integration, system deployments and release process

  • Develop required scripts or code to automate and integrate configuration management tools and processes

  • Assist in day to day change management activities, including creating new branches, code merging, versioning and general code maintenance along with configuration changes

  • Communicate configuration management process information and changes as appropriate to different teams.

  • Provide troubleshooting expertise and drive resolution for all issues in all environments on an as-needed basis

jobs.title: Product Architect
jobs.content:
Product Architect


As Product Architect, you will lead the design effort on a variety of projects in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment. Your role is to design innovative solutions to real market problems. You will work closely with product and marketing managers, user interaction designers, and software engineers to develop new product offerings and improve existing ones.


.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:




    • Designing user interaction models, workflows and user interfaces

    • Integrating internal and external product design into a cohesive user experience

    • Creating prototypes and authoring detailed interaction specifications

    • Working with user experience researchers to design and observe usability studies

    • Translating usability and field research findings into design improvements

    • Working with visual designers to improve and refine product visual design and consistency




  • Follow the strategic direction of the department as a whole and providing suggestions to improve the company and department processes.

  • Maintain in-depth technical expertise in all areas of Microsoft products, industry trends, competitive offerings, and applies it to the business needs of customers.

jobs.title: Software Engineer III
jobs.content:
Responsible for the design and development of multi-tiered web applications for an Application Service Provider (ASP). Perform detailed design of individual components and implement user interface, business logic and database layer.



  • Responsible for translating functional requirements and high-level design of components and modules into a developed and tested, multi-tier solution, including user interface, business logic and database.

  • Implement solutions on the Microsoft .NET platform, within an existing application development framework.

  • Provide technical leadership to a project team, including mentoring and code reviews.


Provide support to Solutions Manager, Technical Architect or Solutions Architect during systems development lifecycle



  • Follow the strategic direction of the department as a whole and providing suggestions to improve the company and department processes.

  • Maintain in-depth technical expertise in all areas of Microsoft products, industry trends, competitive offerings, and applies it to the business needs of customers.

jobs.title: Wanted: .NET / C# Developer with a heart of gold
jobs.content:
Wanna work with a bunch of assholes?


Neither do we.


Good Character = Good Culture


At Engagency, culture is the natural result of attracting good people. We believe that a good company culture depends as much on what you give, as what you get. It’s the character of each individual that defines us. It’s our values and motivations that bind us. It’s something that each member of our team has the privilege and the responsibility to help define, nurture and protect.


Help us save the web.


At Engagency, you will use C# to make the web a better place. You will build and integrate C#/MVC/Enterprise IT/Cloud applications with Sitecore, the world's leading .NET enterprise web content management system (WCMS). You will help create digital marketing and commerce experiences that are so responsive, helpful, and relevant, that buying almost feels like a joy. We call that a “MeCommerce Experience” and you will get paid to bring a personal touch back to the buying process, for millions of people every day.


Call us idealists, but we don’t think it’s too much to ask...


We're looking for hardworking C# / .NET developers with curious minds and servants' hearts.



  • This is no brochure site/Wordpress shop. We’re helping $500M - $10B companies deploy, enhance, and support Sitecore, the most sophisticated and highly rated .NET web content management and digital marketing platform in the industry.

  • We're looking for people who are self-motivated and don't require coddling or micro-management to go the extra mile.

  • We’re building an elite team of web architects, developers, data analysts, and support engineers, fit to serve the world's leading companies.


PLEASE NOTE: WE ARE NOT ACCEPTING REMOTE APPLICANTS


This position is located on the south side of downtown Austin Texas and is on-site only. At Engagency, we believe that people do their best work when they have a team of people to collaborate and coordinate with, in person. We find that work is more meaningful when it's done with a sense of community, and you have a good group of people to share lunch and talk with every day. We work hard to find good people to work with. If you're looking for more than a job, we look forward to hearing from you.


WORK VISA SPONSORSHIP


We are open to considering TN sponsorship for citizens of Canada and Mexico. However, we are unable to provide H1B sponsorship at this time.


RECRUITERS


We are unable to work with candidates represented by a third party at this time. We ask that all recruiters respect our policy and do not contact us.

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Reports to Technical Support Manager


It’s been said around here that today’s “big data” is tomorrow’s normal data, and it shouldn’t take a Data Scientist to make it useful.  Zoomdata enables us all to explore and gain insights from an array of data sources, visualizing billions of records in the blink of an eye.  We turn data into knowledge, and we do it with an evolving, real time perspective.


As a Technical Support Engineer, you are a polished communicator. You are obsessed with making customers successful.  You have worked with sophisticated/demanding customers, and you have an innate sense of how to manage expectations and inspire confidence. You demonstrate excellent judgment in prioritization and are a multi-tasker. You love learning new cutting-edge technology and can’t help but make suggestions about how to improve the product and company, overall.  You are naturally driven to become the expert in the space.

jobs.title: Seasoned DevOps/SysAdmin - startup hedge fund
jobs.content: Higher Moment, a startup hedge fund, is looking for an experienced SysAdmin with DevOps experience to help manage and grow our self hosted automation platform and related hw/sw/vm infrastructure. We are looking to grow our platform to accommodate the demands of an institutional investment manager.

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer - Subject Matter Expert
jobs.content:
We're playing with the coolest toys, and working on interesting problems that engage both the technical and aesthetic sides of the brain. We move quickly - projects are short (generally 3-7 days), and we have a new native release every month. The features you create will be used by millions of people every day. Trip is well known for having an extremely strong engineering organization - you'll be working with the best and getting stuff done, in the fastest growing area of an incredibly profitable, growing, fun company. Download our Android app and give it a spin.


The Facts


* Our apps are used around the world and have been download over 250 million times


* We have well over 375 million average monthly unique visitors, half of which are via our apps


* We have over 5 million unique users / engineer, among the highest in the industry


* As mobile devices are replacing desktops and laptops as the standard for browsing the web, we have a unique opportunity as well as the market position to capitalize on enormous monetization potential


You Will


* Design complex systems and lead the technical solution of projects


* Work closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications


* Be responsible for the code quality on your team


* Mentor more junior developers


* Develop, deploy and maintain the consumer-facing features of the native Android App


* Be responsible for all aspects of software engineering, from design to implementation, QA and maintenance.

jobs.title: VP, Technology
jobs.content:
The VP, Technology for Razorfish LA office will oversee and provide technical leadership to the Technology discipline while supporting the Client Services department and agency business development manager in all new business efforts. A VP, Technology must have senior architectural level technical skills along with business development skills. The ideal candidate must be client relation savvy. The responsibilities also include analyzing business problems and proposing innovative engineering solutions and/or making strategic technical recommendations for development solutions.




  • Act as a strategic advisor to the client and demonstrate the ability to create a technology vision, strategy, and roadmap

  • Often serves as the Technology Discipline Lead for the office or a large group within an office

  • Provide technical and business oversight to all projects within the designation

  • Works with the Client Services' teams and Project Managers during pre-production meetings to translate the client's business requirements to a sound technical architecture/approach. Oversees the execution of the technical strategy once the clients' approval is obtained.

  • Oversees unit and system integration testing and code reviews for the work completed by the programming team.

  • Assist in identifying and developing new customers and projects by providing technical guidance while collaborating with business development

  • Explain project technology and process to client and Razorfish management as well as the technical teams.

  • Mentor and grow technology architects within the office.

  • Ensure that the technology group is constantly acquiring new technology skills, as well as enhancing and growing the current skills within the group. Research new products and technologies to determine fit with the overall application architecture.

  • Ensure all operational elements of the technology group are closely and properly managed, such as staffing, hiring, business development and career management.

  • Works closely with other discipline leads to ensure that tight integration across all disciplines is in place, as well as diversifying the company’s offering in order to meet market and Razorfish Agile+ methodology.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.content: Robinhood is hiring a Senior Product Designer in Palo Alto, CA

jobs.title: Data Architect
jobs.content:
You live and breathe data architecture for analytics, linguistics, and natural language processing at scale, easily ingesting, understanding, and transforming data to achieve your objectives. You balance out-of-the box thinking and pragmatic execution, and have a strong track record of continuously improving great data products.



You are:


• Highly energetic and committed to a great product and culture.


• Leaving your ego at the door to thrive in healthy debate.


• Passionate with integrity and a healthy sense of work/life balance.


• A team player as likely to learn as to mentor your colleagues.


• Strong communication and analytical skills.


• Self-driven and tireless in the pursuit of high quality results in a fast paced environment.


• A world-class engineer looking for the right team & opportunity to make an impact.



Your Tasks


• Reporting directly to the CTO, you will design and implement the data architecture for complex datasets including lexicons, hundreds of related corpora, machine learning data, including natural language processing datasets, and analytical data from hundreds of sources, all combined into a cohesive platform for analysis, research, and the development of data-driven products, at scale with 100M+ unique users across different platforms.


• Collaborate closely with technical, analytical, and product teams to achieve data architectural objectives.

jobs.title: Sr. JavaScript Engineer
jobs.content:
What you get to do:



• Tackle key architectural and design considerations for header bidder solution.


• Work with advertising partners to integrate and maintain their respective bidder solutions.


• Work with publisher partners to integrate our header bidder solution.


• Work with the machine learning team to implement algorithms to optimize revenue.


• Collaborate closely with product managers, business owners and the reporting team.


• Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Tester
jobs.content:
**ENTRY LEVEL CONTRACT POSITION LOCATED IN IOWA**


Texture is looking for an experienced QA tester to add to our growing dynamic team. The ideal candidate must be able to creatively and accurately follow through with testing of content in a high-energy, fast-paced, and agile environment. You will be responsible for performing a variety of QA testing tasks, including content validation testing and test case creations for iOS/Android/Win8 platforms. This position will be located in our Iowa office and reports to the Quality Assurance Manager. 


Responsibilities:



  • Execute full content QA lifecycles for testing the interaction between the content and the application(s) within a targeted timeline.

  • Track and verify bugs in production with each product release.

  • Participate in all aspects of the content QA product lifecycle: understand the product requirements, test case creation, feature, regression, integration, end-to-end test execution.

  • Execute common testing techniques, including black box, functional, system integration, smoke, load, performance, and regressions.

  • Construct test cases for the defined test plan; modify the existing test cases as the test requirements change.

  • Communicate status and escalate issues in a timely fashion.

  • Provide status updates regarding test progress and results on a daily basis.

  • Assist other teams with content-based problem solving.

jobs.content: Love With Food is a product sampling platform that builds online and offline brand awareness and collects product intelligence data for consumer food brands. We’re looking to bring a talented and cr...

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
As Help Scout's first dedicated Site Reliability Engineer you will own and define the best practices, tools and automation to ensure our fast growing SaaS provides best in class high availability while increasing engineering velocity. Your work will empower more than 6,000 businesses around the world to deliver a great customer support experience. This is a critical role that will influence every engineer in the company and directly impact our customer's satisfaction. No matter how elegant our product is, it means little if customers can't always access our site with great performance.



ABOUT THE ROLE



  • We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to build sophisticated continuous delivery and test automation to keep our AWS-based services highly available and fast while increasing the engineering team's velocity.

  • Help Scout engineering is 24 full time engineers organized into 6 teams. You will be a member of a small team with one engineer focused on continuous delivery (CD) pipelines, and 3 engineers focused on our AWS infrastructure and operations. Working with your team, you will partner with our feature delivery teams to build any automation they need to improve site reliability and velocity.

  • You will be responsible for working on our three biggest site reliability priorities: four 9s high availability, continuous delivery and test automation. You will own the implementation and roadmap planning for improvements to our automation, tools and tests to support these priorities. The majority of your time will be spent building or implementing continuous delivery, test and self-healing automation and supporting tools. You will be a key internal champion for any and all changes to make our production environments more resilient, scalable, and performant.

  • Your potential projects will include expanding our CI pipeline across all teams, testing and implementing auto-scaling groups, expanding our test automation (smoke, stress, chaos monkey, etc), and enhancing the velocity of our CI pipeline (parallel tasks, containers, etc).

  • This is not a primary on-call position. However you should expect to be called upon if services you own such as CD pipelines or test automation fail and primary on-call team members can't resolve the issue.

  • Our 100% remote engineering team spends most of their time in Slack and Github. Engineers can focus for long stretches with typically only 2 scheduled meetings a week (one with your team and one with your manager). Engineers write their own automated unit and integration tests, and use our CI pipeline to release code to production several times a day. You can read more about our culture and how our remote team stays agile at https://www.helpscout.net/blog/agile-remote-teams/

jobs.title: Mobile Software Developer - What's Your Github Profile?
jobs.content:
Contribute to the design and development of software applications, firmware and device drivers for embedded microprocessors under a disciplined product development process that meets FDA requirements. Works on software design, coding, and validating embedded software, supporting verification and validation testing, and ensuring that all product development conforms to design specifications and coding standards for medical devices Exercises judgment in coding following the software designs and conducting investigation activities following defined methods. Develops productive internal/external working relationships.

Bachelors in Electrical or Computer Science or related engineering or scientific field. MS or PhD degree ideal

2 years experience in software engineering. Solid knowledge of software engineering principals. Knowledge of design controls and regulations for medical device development. Knowledge of the principles of quality software engineering as described by software lifecycle development processes that are consistent with ISO, IEEE, or other FDA recognized standards. Experience in design, engineering, and testing of software contained in medical devices developed under the FDAs regulations for 510(k) or PMA products is preferred. Technical experience in software engineering with excellent written and verbal communication skills is essential.

Working knowledge of Java or C++ required. Experience with Android, iOS, C#, C, C++ or Matlab desirable. Strong understanding of object oriented design principles both in theory and practice – especially encapsulation and polymorphism. Strong understanding of automated testing (test driven development, dependency injection, unit testing). Basic familiarity with source control tools. Basic familiarity with database design and use is desirable (relationships, indices, object-relational mapping).

Abbott Diabetes Care 1360 South Loop Road Alameda, CA 94502

jobs.title: Python/JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Muster is a cloud based web platform that enables organizations to connect their members with key decision makers to influence public policy.

We are seeking an experienced developer to help build and maintain our web application, written primarily in Python/Django. You will be one of the first developers to join our team and will have the unique opportunity to help shape the future of our product.

The majority of the work you will be doing will focus on new development with the remainder concentrating on maintenance of existing applications.


Take a look at us here -- www.muster.com -- and if this looks like a fit then we need 2 important things from you:

(1) A short message describing why this seems like a good fit to you

(2) A link to your GitHub profile


This position is a full-time, on site role in Richmond, VA. Salary will be based on experience.


Benefits


  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Work with an exciting and energetic team in an attractive downtown RVA office space [with free parking!]
  • Stock options for employees
  • Paid holidays and vacation

jobs.title: Cloud Security Engineer
jobs.content:
Make an Impact – help in securing Cloud!



Join the Cloud Security Team at Autodesk as a Security Engineer and be a part of the talented team that designs, builds and deploys solutions that protect Autodesk and its customers against advanced adversaries. You will research the latest threats & methods for deploying controls in the prevention, detection and reaction to best securing the environment and automate threat identification and defense capabilities. Your mission will be to ensure that Autodesk and customer data remains secure. You will work across many teams including infrastructure, engineering, operations and product development. You will work across multiple work streams including application and infrastructure security, security operations, and incident response.



As a global leader in 3D design, engineering, and entertainment software, Autodesk helps people imagine, design, and create a better world. Autodesk accelerates better design through an unparalleled depth of experience and a broad portfolio of software to give customers the power to solve their design, business, and environmental challenges. In addition to designers, architects, engineers, and media and entertainment professionals, Autodesk helps students, educators, and casual creators unlock their creative ideas through user-friendly applications.



  • As a hands-on technical specialist, handle complex and detailed technical work necessary to establish and maintain secure cloud security.

  • Securing perimeter and network of Autodesk’s cloud environment.

  • Implement and maintain network security infrastructure globally including Firewalls, IDS/IPS, DDOS mitigation, VPN and remote access.

  • Architect, configure, manage and deploy devices including firewalls, IPS and IDS to improve Autodesk’s ability to prevent and detect intrusions in real-time.

  • Track down targeted vulnerabilities and defend against active adversaries.

  • Gather threat intelligence and build, optimize, and automate systems to consume threat feeds and track adversaries.

  • Ensure critical data remains secure while working in many different areas ranging from infrastructure, architecture, engineering, operations, incident response, and red teaming.

  • Create innovative solutions to complex security problems including development of software to identify security issues, deploy security solutions and reporting

  • Develop, automate and maintain hardened images for the software in the Cloud (OpenStack, VMware, multiple operating systems and middleware technologies)

  • Develop cloud security automation framework to plug-in various security tools

  • Build and maintain PKI, Key Management solution for Cloud environment

  • Deploy and maintain WAF for cloud applications

  • Implement and manage SIEM for cloud security team, integrate SIEM with cloud security automation framework

  • Work with application and infrastructure teams to design and architect infrastructure (network, OS, databases) and applications to protect against attackers.

jobs.title: ETL/Database Developer
jobs.content:
An Augeo ETL/Database Developer will be responsible for developing, testing and implementing ETL packages within Microsoft SQL Server SSIS along with supporting other database architecture and development efforts.  You will be required to work on fairly complex assignments and collaborate with Augeo’s IT applications team. The ideal candidate understands business needs and translates them into technical solutions, as well as manages internal and external client relationships as needed.


You will have many opportunities to guide our data architecture evolution as well as improve our intelligence and analytics capabilities. With your help we'll keep the business happy and improve efficiency, giving us time to work with new tools and skills.


Your responsibilities include (but aren't limited to):



  • Manage and develop SSIS ETL packages as a member of the Augeo Data Architecture team

  • Strong SQL Query knowledge for both DDL and DML

  • Provide guidance to the IT management team on best practices for database design

  • Work with internal and external users to gain understanding of needs and elicit and document user requirements within the scope of data and file automation

  • Follow management policies and procedures for maintaining all changes to the database and processing jobs

  • Monitor databases in production to ensure correct operation

  • Effect resolution of any reported defects

  • Analyze performance of database queries and take action to correct deficiencies

  • Document programming problems and resolutions for future reference (lessons learned)

jobs.title: Customer Support Specialist
jobs.content:
About Poll Everywhere

We make a popular app that lets audiences use their mobile phones to vote on questions - and have the results show up in the presentation instantly. It’s been described as magic, kind of like running your own American Idol in PowerPoint. You see us used on TV, in stadiums, schools, concerts, CEO presentations, and little Chloe's kindergarten Idol talent competition (it's thrilling) - wherever an audience can text or tweet. Our customers include Google, TED, McDonalds, Starbucks, and other assorted badasses large and small (like Chloe). We scare companies that make "Audience Response Systems" or "Clickers".

We are a healthy, profitable, organically-grown company. Curious what we do?

About the job

Real time audience response is a high stakes game. You have nervous presenters, stressed event planners, and the occasional television executive all who require clear, helpful advice. They also appreciate creative ideas for spicing up their presentation and enjoy a personality that matches our own quirky style.

We take helping our customers really seriously at Poll Everywhere. It’s one of the few things that stops all remote controlled helicopter flying in the office. Everyone from the engineers to the marketing folks rely on the support folks to channel the user - to know them, love them, and be their voice.

And while support would be your full time job, everyone does support. In fact, many times the CEO is the first to answer the phone. It's really important.

ENOUGH ABOUT US. LET’S TALK ABOUT YOU...

  • You genuinely enjoy making customers happy. It’s just part of your nature. You’re also comfortable with technology, really dig it, and take pride in helping people use it. You have a tailored resume, a completed bachelors degree with a decent GPA, and real life experience helping customers.
  • You have done technical customer support in the past but are looking for a new opportunity to spread your wings and take on challenges at a place where your opinions not only matter, but will help shape the product.You also have ideas.
  • We rely on support to not just fix the caller's issue, but to identify things we can build to make their life easier so they don't have to call. Your enthusiasm gives you insight that ultimately makes us a better company.

WE ALL DO A LITTLE BIT OF EVERYTHING - THE BEAUTY OF START-UPS - BUT YOU SPECIFICALLY WILL...

  • Provide email and phone support. And help them. However. You. Can.
  • Respond to emails and phone calls from our users with a blend of patience, wit, and crystal clear communication.
  • Collect cool stories of how people use us and help package them into material to teach new users.
  • Be an effective, compelling advocate with our teammates for what will make our users happy.
  • Notice ways to make your job easier and our customers' lives happier and make it happen. This might be a revised FAQ, a new product feature, a more intuitive interface, or clearer labelling on the PopTart and oatmeal shelf.
  • Use numbers. We really like data and expect you to be comfortable playing with some basic metrics like call volume, answer rates, and conversion.

jobs.title: Python Engineer - $75k
jobs.content:
Python Engineer - $75k


Are you one of top Python Engineers in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 2x more productive than the typical Engineer? Are you interested in earning $75,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

Company Description

Crossover is a well-funded startup that has developed a unique way to find, curate and manage the top 1% of global talent and connect them to medium and large businesses. We are experiencing rapid growth within the private equity companies we currently serve and are increasing our staff to expand our business.
We believe that brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical employment. But we dont just find the best; we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.


Job Description

At Crossover you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products and APIs and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources.


Key responsibilities

Responsibilities will include:

  • Writing and debugging both unit and integration tests for enterprise applications/specific platforms/products

  • Proactively plan, implement, and maintain new services within the distributed system that comprises our backend platform (e.g APIs, internal services, and data processing pipelines)

  • Develop new user-facing features from conception to execution

  • You will be expected to effectively execute the transition of current code to new technologies and update third party components

  • Take ownership of the process of identifying dependencies and performing code reviews, helping us to maintain our standard of excellence throughout the process.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
jobs.content:
EXP is seeking strong candidates from junior through senior levels, with experience in several of the following areas:



  • Computer vision

  • Pattern recognition

  • Machine learning, especially deep learning

  • Feature detection and estimation

  • Advanced image and video processing

  • Navigation

  • Radar

  • Lidar

  • Data science and analysis

  • Cloud-based software development


A strong scientific software development background is essential.


Successful applicants will support a range of programs and roles, potentially including a combination of conceptual R&D, product development, project management, team leadership, customer engagement and new business development. Occasional travel may be required. Candidates must have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field of study.  Advanced degrees are strongly preferred.


U.S. citizenship is required for this position. The ability to obtain a U.S. security clearance is strongly desired. Current security clearance preferred.


Expedition Technology, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability or national origin.

jobs.title: Drupal Manager for Worldwide NonProfit in DC Area
jobs.content:
United Way Worldwide is the world’s largest privately funded nonprofit. Our global mission is to improve lives by mobilizing the caring power of communities to advance the common good. United Way envisions a world in which all individuals and families develop and achieve their full potential through education, income stability, and healthy living. United Way employees possess the passion, expertise, and resources required to make great things happen – we invite you to be a part of the change – to Live United.


We are searching for a Drupal Developer to join our dynamic and innovative IT team.  As a valued member of our web development team, you will be responsible for developing, managing and enhancing the technical infrastructure of our Drupal-based websites, including our 13,000 user Drupal Commons-inspired intranet/extranet and other Drupal 7 sites.


A part of your daily duties will be to work closely with our other web and database developers as well as with the team’s internal clients. You will have the opportunity to work broadly and independently with the team, producing creative, reliable solutions with attention to detail that will greatly enhance our worldwide website visited by millions.

We’re building something really special at EcoATM-Gazelle.  We’ve recently combined the automated cell phone and electronic device buyback kiosks at ecoATM, with the best online storefront and marketplace for buying and selling used electronics at Gazelle.  Together, we’re here to change how the world thinks about recycled technology and the fundamental way it’s bought and sold.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Pivotal Labs: We Transform Ideas into Software.
 
As a recognized leader in highly disciplined agile software development practices, Pivotal Labs has been building high reliability software for over 20 years. We build consumer and enterprise web and mobile applications for global clients, and have a growing practice building applications for the iOS and Android platforms. We also developed Pivotal Tracker, the project management and collaboration tool used by thousands of software developers worldwide.
 
We Can Go Fast Forever.
 
We pair program, all day, every day because we know it delivers remarkable results. We practice and teach an approach to software engineering that applies across industries and organizations, so you’ll experience all types of teams, products, and technologies. And we believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge and refocus.
 
We Court Perfection.
 
Working at Pivotal means you get better at what you already do well. We set up regular retrospectives to figure out what we're doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we're doing right so we can improve on it. We consistently practice Test Driven Development, which results in high-quality, reliable and more maintainable code. And we believe that methodical, steady, relentless forward momentum drives consistent results.
 
Get Breakfast Everyday. And Get Paid to Master The Latest Technologies.
 
To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks are available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded Pivots who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers on beer night.

You have a passion for automating manual processes, building software that delights customers and interest in the hardware space.  We are looking for a team player who will learn, coach and help us make this incredible vision a reality! We're helping satellites go to space, A.I.'s progression, robotic innovation, and making the internet of things a reality. Join us!

To learn more about working at Tempo, visit our careers page.

jobs.title: Stylist Assistant
jobs.content:
About Us:

Reformation is a fast-growing company that is redefining fashion. We make killer clothes that don’t kill the environment and want our garments’ impact on the planet to be as low as possible. After all, there’s nothing less sexy than leaving a big nasty mess.

 

Job Description:

Reformation is looking for a full time Stylist Assistant to support our retail and editorial shoots. The Stylist Assistant will be a key contributor to our Creative team. This involves creating concepts and innovative ways to showcase our collections. This is the perfect position for someone who admires our social ethos and has great style and a strong work ethic. This person will be instrumental in driving the look and feel of not only Reformation's digital presence, but also our overall brand image to customers all around the world.

 Responsibilities:

  • Assist styling all looks prior to photo shoots, both retail + editorial.
  • Attend all photoshoots and prepare merchandise to be styled and photographed
  • Collaborate with team to propose and source styling apparel/accessories for shoots
  • Order and manage styling closet purchases and returns
  • Submit trend and style decks as well as concept ideas to the Design and Creative teams

 

Qualifications:

  • Experience working in a fast paced environment; relevant industry experience preferred.
  • Amazing style and keen eye for design
  • Acute attention to detail, accuracy, and organization
  • Must demonstrate understanding of the Reformation brand and look
  • Hard working team player with strong communication skills
  • Ability to work well under pressure, multitask, and adhere to deadlines
  • Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Powerpoint)
  • Los Angeles-based or willing to relocate at your own expense

 

 Benefits & Perks:

  • Health, vision, and dental insurance

  • Clothing discount

  • Paid volunteer time-off

  • Bi-Monthly “Ref Talks” to learn about other aspects of our business

  • Regular company events and parties (Yoga! Tie-Dye! Documentaries!)

  • Pet-friendly office

 

To Apply:

Please submit your resume and a short cover letter telling us about yourself and why you are a great fit for Reformation! Please also submit a link to your portfolio.

jobs.title: Sales Engineering Team Lead  - New Business
jobs.content:
As a New Business SE Team Lead at Twilio, you will set the strategy and direction for our technical engagement in the New Business sales cycle at Twilio, while also owning and driving new opportunities.

About you:

You have a deep technical understanding of the Twilio Platform and one or more of our common use cases, combined with proven results in bringing new software developers onto the platform.  You enjoy motivating and leading a team, and you are adept at metrics and data-driven management as well as emotionally intelligent people management . 

Responsibilities:

  • This is a player-coach role. You will own opportunities as well as manage and lead a team.
  • Partner with New Business sales leadership to set our strategy for finding, closing and supporting new opportunities.
  • Proactively attract, develop, and motivate a team of high-performing Solutions Architects and Sales Engineers, continually seeking innovative solutions for improving team effectiveness with a data-driven approach.
  • Manage a team that presents complex sales and engineering proposals to C-level executives at large Enterprise and Fortune 500 companies.
  • Inspire the team – be a leader and a role model for excellence in the sales engineering function.
  • Technical strategy – determine what role sales engineers should play in closing new business, and how to deploy the existing resources most effectively.
  • Measure and communicate results – use data to communicate results and make decisions.
  • Be a coach and mentor – ensure that your team has the support that they need to be successful.
  • Engage with cross-functional leadership where needed – engage with Product, Support, Sales and Engineering as needed to effectively advocate for new prospects.

 Requirements:

  • Typically 7-10 years in a customer-facing technical role.
  • Strong team leadership ability is required, and prior experience as a direct manager of teams is strongly preferred.
  • A strong understanding of the new business sales cycle, as well as experience in the technology areas relevant to Twilio’s market: IP-based telephony, real-time communications, scaling web and mobile applications.
  • A world class communicator. Confident influencing and engaging with a highly skilled and experienced audience including C-level executives.
  • Typically 25-30% travel, depending on role.
  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, MIS or a comparable field is preferred. Advanced degrees or formal training in management is preferred.
  • Experience leading RFI/RFP and contracting processes.
  • Strong project management, problem solving and analytical skills.

About us:

Twilio makes communications easy and powerful. With Twilio's platform, businesses can make communications relevant and contextual by embedding real-time communication and authentication capabilities directly into their software applications. Twilio gives businesses the ability to innovate, prototype, create, and connect with their customers at the right time and in the right way. Founded in 2008, Twilio is a public company based in San Francisco, California with other offices around the world.


Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

jobs.title: Java Instructors- 14 week contract, on site, premium pay!
jobs.content:
The Iron Yard: Java Instructors - two positions available, 14 week contract (2 weeks training, 12 weeks instruction), starting 7/25/16 and 8/8/16.


The Iron Yard exists to create real, lasting change for people, companies and communities through technology education. 


We are partnering with a large agency to train their team members in relevant and emerging technologies to provide better service to the public. Through this program you will have the opportunity to transform lives by teaching the next generation of developers and set them up for future success.


What the role and responsibilities look like:


You will teach a 12-week semester with 25 students.  There will be a Assistant Instructor assigned to your class for support. Instructor’s lecture from 9:00-12:00, then  students spend the afternoon in labs, where the Instructor is on campus, available for questions.


Additional responsibilities include conducting student assessments prior to the class start date and reviewing student assignments and projects.


Our instructors serve as lecturers and mentors to our students, helping them learn to think like engineers and hone their skills in a programming discipline.


What we believe in:


First and most importantly, here are a few of our values when it comes to teaching someone how to be a developer:



  • Thinking over syntax - We believe syntax is the easy part of programming and that we are successful when we’ve helped someone learn to think like an engineer.

  • Quality over quantity – We’re interested in training true professionals, not getting as many people into our classes as possible.

  • Real projects over scripted assignments – People learn programming best by tackling hard problems with a mentor, not following a list of steps and taking a quiz.

  • Emphasis on open source – We deeply value the open source mindset and intentionally create and contribute to open source projects.

jobs.title: Sr. .Net Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Applications Developer


Are you looking to advance  your Information Technology career?  If so, then UPS is the place for you!


UPS is now recognized as a technology company spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology. UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence.  This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.

UPS Information Services, a leader in information technology, is currently seeking career-minded individuals to join our team.  If you are highly motivated with a degree in Computer Science or related discipline, then UPS is a great place for you to advance your career.


Job Description:


The Senior Applications Developer provides input and support for, and performs full systems life cycle management activities (e.g., analyses, technical requirements, design, coding, testing, implementation of systems and applications software, etc.).  He/She participates in component and data architecture design, technology planning, and testing for Applications Development (AD) initiatives to meet business requirements. This position provides input to applications development project plans and integrations.  He/She collaborates with teams and supports emerging technologies to ensure effective communication and achievement of objectives. This position provides knowledge and support for applications development, integration, and maintenance. He/She provides input to department and project teams on decisions supporting projects.


The successful candidate needs to be an expert in C# and .Net Framework using Microsoft Visual Studio.  Expected to have an understand of Object Oriented Concepts and experience developing an application in an object oriented language. The successful candidate might also have knowledge of test-driven development, unit testing frameworks and using Microsoft office produces such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.


Responsibilities:


Contributes to I.S. Projects



  • Conducts systems and requirements analyses to identify project action items.

  • Creates task lists and cost and time estimates to support project plan development.

  • Performs assigned functions and tasks to meet project plan and quality review requirements.

  • Records, updates, monitors, and determines solutions for project deviations to ensure effective resolutions.

  • Reviews project team accomplishments to assist with peer development and to provide project updates for management and customers.

  • Reviews and compiles project issues to support effective resolutions.

  • Monitors project activities to ensure I.S. governance, standards, and policies compliance.


Performs System Analysis and Design



  • Participates in defining and developing technical specifications to meet systems’ requirements.

  • Analyzes and translates logical designs to create physical designs.

  • Assesses detailed designs and documentation to ensure alignment with business requirements.

  • Defines interfaces among systems components to ensure interoperability.

  • Creates and reviews interface agreements to ensure proper transfer of information between systems.

  • Evaluates vendor technologies to recommend potential products for use.

  • Leads peer reviews to ensure requirements are met.


Designs and Develops Moderate to Highly Complex Applications



  • Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, corrects, and documents moderate to highly complex programs to ensure optimal performance and compliance.

  • Reviews and understands specifications to achieve coding tasks.

  • Reviews, analyzes, and refines requirements and specifications to ensure quality.

  • Records and updates defects log to ensure thorough and accurate documentation.


Develops Application Documentation



  • Develops and maintains system documentation to ensure accuracy and consistency.

  • Creates unit test plans and reviews documented results to ensure requirements are met.

  • Creates technical documentation in compliance with UPS Software Development Lifecycle to communicate and update project teams and stakeholders.


Produces Integration Builds



  • Defines and produces integration builds to create applications.

  • Performs build processes to produce software and to prepare application for delivery.

  • Produces integration test specifications to conduct tests, record failures, and conduct fault diagnoses.


Performs Maintenance and Support



  • Defines and administers procedures to monitor systems performance and integrity.

  • Performs applications maintenance and support functions to support problem resolution.

  • Documents maintenance and support activities to ensure quality control.

  • Performs business continuity and disaster recovery activities to ensure availability requirements are met.

  • Provides maintenance and support modifications to developers, users, and external groups to communicate updates.

  • Observes and evaluates the systems usage by users to improve applications quality and effectiveness.

  • Records and updates defect logs to monitor system reliability.

  • Designs, creates, develops, customizes, and maintains training content to enhance quality of support.


Supports Emerging Technologies and Products



  • Monitors the industry to gain knowledge and understanding of emerging technologies.

  • Identifies new and emerging hardware and software technologies and products to maintain industry competitiveness.

  • Determines relevance and potential value of new technologies to support business objectives and strategy.


Primary Skill:


.NET Environment
 
Additional Skills:


SQL Language - Intermediate
SQL Programming - Intermediate
.NET Environment - Advanced
.NET Windows Forms Programming - Advanced
C# .Net - Advanced


Education:


The desired Senior Applications Developer will possess a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field or the equivalent in education and work experience.

jobs.title: Intel Ireland expanding PAAS team!

We are looking for a wide range of Engineers to join our growing Cloud platform team at Intel Security - Cork.


The expanding Cloud Platform team develops systems that provide real time threat information that allow Intel Security to protect its customers in the battle against the bad guys. These systems provide continuous protection to our customers and have a very strong focus on quality. We think big and build big. Our solutions are built to provide 24x7 ‘Always On’ threat intelligence to our products.  


Our teams work on cutting edge Cloud technology and are challenged daily to think outside the box and push themselves to achieve breakthroughs in design, programming skill and most of all engineering excellence. Our teams build mission critical systems that are central to Intel Security’s success and have a direct impact on the abilities of our products to keep our customers secure.


Our teams come from a wide range of backgrounds, however all of them share the same core values of problem solving, technical skill and an unshakable drive for quality.


If you are passionate about Coding, QA and Cloud Services, we are offering you a unique and great opportunity to build your career with us and gain experience working with high-performance Cloud systems.


We are looking for the following profiles:


C, C++ Software Development Engineers


Big Data Engineers


Cloud Scalability Engineers


Tools Design Engineers


Automation Test Engineers


Production Operations Engineers


Application Operation Engineers


Cloud API Engineers


Cloud Monitoring Engineers


McAfee, a wholly owned subsidiary of Intel Corporation (NASDAQ:INTC), is the world's largest dedicated security technology company. We are relentlessly focused on constantly finding new ways to keep our customers safe. Share your talents with us in the dynamic security industry, and experience the meaningful, interesting work that is waiting for you!


Intel Security brings together the experience and expertise of McAfee, the world’s largest dedicated security company, with the performance and innovation of Intel, one of the world’s most trusted brands.

jobs.title: Lead Backend Development
jobs.content:
With 1.4 million vehicles, mobile.de is the largest online vehicle trade site in Germany. This is an excellent opportunity to work for one of the most challenging product development organizations in eBay Germany. We support the entire mobile.de platform including our international marketplaces, mobile devices, and build critical technology to build the best of class experience in the vehicle market. Mobile.de is hiring in Berlin!
The Technology group is looking for a

Lead Backend Development (m/f)

The Dialogue/Advertising team deals with all technical tasks to integrate various premium partners (mostly of the automotive industry) on the pages of MOTOR-TALK.de. Underlying is a separation of the partner themed sites from the core sites. This means that the current MySQL setup will be replaced and the data is pulled via a REST-interface. The Tech stack will change with this transition from MySQL, spring, Java8 to a play framework with Scala.

Job responsibilities:

  • Drive the separation of the dialogue pages from the core platform for MOTOR-TALK.de
  • Support managing the Advertising tech infrastructure on mobile.de
  • Own the entire development lifecycle from specification to deployment
  • Be an active partner for Product management in order to provide the best value for stakeholders and our customers
  • Innovate technology, process and product with your team
  • Leading and coaching junior developers

Job requirements:

  • 5+ years’ experience as a Java/Scala developer with a deep understanding of the surrounding technology ecosystem
  • Strong architecture and design experience in agile environment (Kanban / Scrum) and ideally in cross-functional teams
  • You are an absolute pro in Java / MVC / Spring4 / REST and you speak HTTP and REST like your mother tongue
  • You're a strong believer that Advertising/Marketing is a key to success and not a burden
  • Solid understanding of up-to-date front-end technologies (Javascript, modern JS frameworks, CSS)
  • Proven excellence in analyzing, designing, implementing, running and maintaining large scale distributed scalable solutions for the Web Knowledge in MySQL / Hibernate / Linux is beneficial.
  • You understand that quality is not assured by a QA engineer, but by the team
  • Ability to plan strategically and execute in a result-oriented manner
  • Passion for keeping up to date with the latest developments in the industry
  • Excellent communication skills, ability to explain technical decisions to colleagues at all levels and from all trades
  • Excellent English language skills, German language skills not required, but a plus

What we offer:

  • A competitive salary, great benefits and an excellent working environment
  • Dynamic, international teams with very skilled personalities, a passion for e-commerce and a great sense of humor
  • Potential for career advancement in just about any line of business and the opportunities to work almost anywhere in the world within eBay Inc.
  • Silicon Valley Amenities (iPhones and MacBooks, Ping-Pong and kicker tables, volleyball and basketball courts, free coffee and juice, tasty subsidized lunches, a nice forest for walking and thinking and a free on-campus gym with trainers)

.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Ruby on Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
Its All Gravy is reinventing the way businesses send gifts to employees, clients, prospects, and partners. Our technology platform and fulfillment operations combine the convenience of e-commerce with the elegance of a Tiffanys box. We are seeking a senior-level Ruby application engineer with Ruby on Rails experience to join or growing team.  The candidate should have a passion for clean, well-tested code, as well as a desire to learn and try new tools and technologies.

Our current technology stack and systems include:

   Ruby on Rails

   Github

   AWS

   Heroku

   Mandrill and Mailchimp

   Shipstation

   Spree e-commerce storefront

   Stripe

Experience

We are looking for a full-stack Ruby engineer.  The candidate should have experience with a range of development and conceptual skillsets, from CSS and HTML to database design.  For example, you do not need to be a JavaScript expert, but you should be comfortable with jQuery and know the principals of good database design.

Required Qualifications:

   At least 5 years of hands on work experience with Ruby-on-Rails as a developer or software engineer

   Strong full life-cycle experience developing web applications

   Previous experience working with product teams

   You are a motivated self-starter excited to make an impact on an early stage start up

   You are comfortable working in a fast paced, high energy environment where priorities sometime shift

   You have experience with Git version control

   You are able to work in Charlotte, N.C.

Benefits and Perks:

   Competitive salary

   Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays

   Medical, Dental, Life&AD, Short-term and Long-term disability insurance

   Supplemental and Voluntary Insurance

   Flexible spending accounts

About Its All Gravy:

Its All Gravy was founded in 2014 to reinvent how businesses send gifts to employees, clients, prospects, and partners. Our fast-growing team includes experienced startup operators, developers, designers, and marketers. Our office is housed inside a sparkling new, 10,000 square foot, super green (LEED Certified) office in Charlotte. Pretty cool, right? You won't be the first to think so.

We pride ourselves on helping our clients make deeper connections with employees and clients. We strive to give our employees the opportunity to grow and thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment. We want every person on our team to feel ownership over our vision and direction as a company. We'll do all we can to get you there.

www.itsallgravy.com

jobs.title: Senior Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
POSITION/TITLE: SeniorDrupalDeveloper ABOUT US


THE ROLE


Senior Drupal Developers at Code and Theory are hands-on lead developers. They will work with a team of developers who have built some of the largest Drupal sites in the world, to craft solutions to a wide range of problems. At Code and Theory, Drupal is primarily used for large, well-known media and publishing clients. A Senior Drupal Developer will often be expected to participate during the Define and Design phases of a project, to specify the Drupal modules and techniques that will be used to achieve the project vision. They will map visual elements to Drupal concepts and create prototypes and proofs of concept to validate feasibility early on.


This role requires participation in the full product lifecycle, from design to deployment, to post launch phases including editorial and technical training. In many cases this is a client-facing role.

jobs.title: Software Engineer – Android
jobs.content:
Our Mobile Software Engineering Team work on the cutting edge to produce high-quality mobile apps for both iOS and Android. We are now on the lookout for a Software Engineer to join this dynamic team. If your heart beats a bit faster when you are writing clean code and if you have a natural instinct for spotting new trends or technologies then we want to hear from you. Our Software Engineering teams help to shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search. With around 3 billion requests per month, we are operating on a large scale, complex and rapidly evolving IT landscape. We encourage all team members to question established processes and give them the freedom to experiment with new technologies in order to drive Trivago to the next level.

 What you'll do:

  • Develop our mobile apps in an agile environment.
  • Use your expert knowledge to bring fresh new ideas to the table.
  • Analyze feature requests and then plan & implement them in a test-driven way.
  • Create and review pull requests in order to achieve the best possible solution.
  • Contribute to the maintenance and development of new and existing open source components.
  • Exchange ideas and share your knowledge with the rest of the team and participate in pair programming.

 What you'll definitely need:

  • You are a driven individual who is looking for a new challenge!
  • A degree/equivalent qualification in Computer Science or a similar field.
  • Experience in dealing with Android SDK, design patterns and software architectures such as MVC/MVP/MVVM.
  • Genuine interest in agile development processes and automated testing.
  • You are an excellent team player who believes great teamwork is at the heart of all great products.
  • You speak English (our company language) fluently.  What we'd love you to have:
  • Code references that you can share with us.
  • Familiarity with Scrum, Kanban, TDD, BDD, Reactive Programming and Continuous Integration.
  • Experience in agile development processes and automated testing.
  • German language skills.

 Life at trivago is...

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.
  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.
  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.
  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.
  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.
  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.
  • Living in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.  Additional information:
  • Our Mobile Software Engineering team is not based in our Headquarters but still based in Düsseldorf.
  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.
  • We do not require the services of an agency for this position.

jobs.title: Front End / Web Engineer

We aim to grow contractor businesses by reducing administration work, enabling more time to focus on craftsmanship, and making home renovation projects as effortless as possible. jobs.title: Developer in Test Engineer
jobs.content:

Our developers in test will be expected to provide specialised and bespoke technical solutions in tool agnostic and open-source environment to ensure the quality of the system. We expect and encourage our engineers to use the latest and most appropriate technologies to verify and ensure the quality of a system, the role is predominantly a development role with focus on automation, repeatability, performance and quality assurance.


We combine a engineer’s technical understanding of the system in question with the quality focus of a QA engineer. We also welcome those currently operating in development, outside of testing who are looking enhance their experience and make the transition.


We are looking for people with experience in creating automated tests suites for a variety of solutions, web applications, Rest services, mobile or embedded solutions.  A successful candidate will have commercial experience of automated test tools within an agile environment, and also have the necessary verbal and written communication skills to communicate progress to senior stakeholders in a project.

We are happy to train and mentor the right people; the important thing is to have a bright mind and the motivation to question, explore and learn. Having published work, on Github or elsewhere, is extremely helpful. CVs should focus on what you really know, not what you've seen once.


Most of all, we love people who are focused on development and self-learning and really want to move our industry forward with new ideas and concepts!

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
It’s been said around here that today’s “big data” is tomorrow’s normal data, and it shouldn’t take a Data Scientist to make it useful.  Zoomdata enables us all to explore and gain insights from an array of data sources, visualizing billions of records in the blink of an eye.  We turn data into knowledge, and we do it with an evolving, real time perspective.


Every part of our unique product needs to handle data at massive scale.  Zoomdata’s engineers are creative and versatile - experts in at least one part of our stack, but often with experience in other parts as well. This stack includes Apache Spark, Spring Boot microservices, software containers (Docker, Kubernetes or Apache Mesos), Java 8, ReactJS, Backbone, ECMAScript 6 (ES6), WebGL, and TypeScript.


We’re looking for software engineers to join our HQ team in Reston, Virginia. We’re hiring engineers with a wide variety of backgrounds. Whether you’ve built query planners, REST/HATEOAS microservices or web components, if you have a strong background in engineering and computer science, there’s probably something for you at Zoomdata! Although a degree in computer science is highly recommended, we hire people with math and other kinds of engineering degrees, too. If you know your data structures and algorithms, and have a passion for high quality and pushing limits, you’ll fit right in here!

jobs.title: Manager, Software Development, Load Balancing Control Plane Systems
jobs.content:
AWS Load Balancing Control Plane platform is one of the largest in the industry, managing service endpoints for Amazon services with billions of requests. We are looking for a Software Development Manager to define and build our next-generation control plane software system. This team owns the API's and systems used for both directly customer-facing services as well as the control plane for many internal services. This is a balanced team of senior and junior engineers that has proven it can deliver very important features for our customers. This leader will own staffing and managing the team for a key part of the service, setting the team culture, best practices, planning, and delivering on the product roadmap. The successful candidate will be comfortable dealing with ambiguity, be very customer-centric and able to think big.



Our mission is to enable all Amazon service owners to completely manage load-balancing for their services. We develop highly available and robust APIs so that all Amazon service owners can build/scale service endpoints and safely mange deployments to existing endpoints in a completely automated fashion. Our APIs and UIs make it easy for customers to deploy services that strictly adhere to Amazon availability and security best practices and make it impossible to perform actions that are unsafe, and difficult to set up services that do not adhere to best practice guidelines.



The ideal candidate will be passionate about the potential of high-scale load balancing solutions as well as about building great resilient, scalable and high-performance services. This leader has thrived and succeeded in delivering high quality technology products/services in a rapid growth environment where priorities shift quickly. We are looking for a strong leader who prioritizes well, communicates clearly and understands how to drive a high level of focus and excellence with a strong team. They are a seasoned, mature engineering leader who is comfortable building teams and developing staff. This person has a proven track record of building a culture centered on customer focus, efficient execution, high quality, rigorous testing, deep monitoring, and solid deployment practices. AWS in general, and this business in particular, operates at very large scale and on critical workloads, so a passion and discipline around operational excellence is key. A high level of ownership and accountability is a must.



As a manager of this team, you will be leading a team of highly motivated software developers that thrives on solving challenging problems with innovative solutions building large-scale distributed software systems in Python, Java and other languages using open source technologies like Apache, Celery, Redis, HTTP/REST services etc., and other Amazon’s proprietary technologies. You will own, build, and operate a fundamental Tier-0 service - Amazon's Load Balancing Control Plane Service. You will also provide exceptional leadership & management for the engineers in your team. As a manager of this team, you will have the opportunity to:



Be great fun to work with. Our company credo is “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. The right candidate will love what they do and instinctively know how to make work fun. Enjoy being a really great people manager. Building, motivating and mentoring a world-class systems & software engineering team is the most important part of this role. You should have a proven track record in recruiting and retaining top talent and excel in day-to-day people and performance management tasks.



Enjoy building large scale distributed software systems. Drive the development of software framework that allows AWS and Amazon retail systems to use load balancing solutions seamlessly. Identify areas of improvement in our existing frameworks, tool, and processes and strive to make them better. You will enjoy keeping your technical skills reasonably current and can contribute meaningfully to architecture discussions.



Have strong project & product management experience. The successful candidate will create product roadmaps for the team. This will include helping innovate and invent new value-add services. You will need excellent technical project management skills to deliver product roadmap items as well as other cross-team projects. Experience with Agile methodologies is an advantage.



Know how to run a tight, lean, efficient operation. The right candidate will want to measure everything and be very data driven. He/she will excel at using metrics, monitoring and alarming to measure and improve the operational processes and performance of their team.



Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority / Female / Disability / Vet

Visit www.amazon.jobs for more information.


  • BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • 5+ years of industry experience.

  • A minimum of 5 years of software development

  • A minimum of 2—3 years of software management experience.




  • Technically sound in software development activities and life cycles

  • Passion for great customer experience and API usability

  • Software development experience in Java, XML, Web services, UNIX tools

  • Experience with large scale distributed systems

  • Strong knowledge of networking concepts and features

  • A passion for people management and mentoring

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Strong analytic and problem solving skills

  • Internet and operating system fundamentals
