The IMALab is a unique group within the cultural institution space.  The IMALab develops innovative, open source solutions for art museums, gardens, historic societies, and other cultural institutions and works with these institutions to implement and optimize the solutions.   The IMALab specializes in online collections and integrations with collection management systems, online and in-gallery interactives, website and app development.  Examples of IMALab innovation includes ArtBabble, TAP, and OSCI.  In addition, the IMALab works directly as the in-house developer for IMA applications.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Web Services
jobs.content:
Reports to VP of Engineering


It’s been said around here that today’s “big data” is tomorrow’s normal data, and it shouldn’t take a Data Scientist to make it useful.  Zoomdata enables us all to explore and gain insights from an array of data sources, visualizing billions of records in the blink of an eye.  We turn data into knowledge, and we do it with an evolving, real time perspective. 


Zoomdata is not only a powerful browser-based app for visualizing Big Data, it’s also a platform for building powerful data-driven applications. Zoomdata’s public REST API does a lot more than power our own web application. It provides additional advanced analytic capabilities that data-driven app developers may use when building more case-specific applications. The REST API is a first-class product like our web UI. Just as our web UI takes user experience (UX) very seriously, our REST API takes developer experience (DX) very seriously as well.


Providing good DX while supporting so many different applications and continuing to evolve as a product takes serious planning! To make things easier, Zoomdata’s REST API uses HATEOAS principles to ensure that we can upgrade it without breaking clients. We strive to provide clients with blazing performance and the ability to degrade gracefully in any service failure mode.


Zoomdata is looking for experienced software engineers who love to build powerful tools for other software engineers and stay on the cutting edge of public API development.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Web Applications
jobs.content:
Reports to VP of Engineering


Zoomdata makes huge amounts of data easy for anyone to understand and explore. The trouble is, the engine on the backend keeps evolving and getting better! Zoomdata’s public web service API uses HATEOAS principles to keep from breaking 3rd-party clients as we evolve - and now we’re building our own web application on it, too!


It’s been said around here that today’s “big data” is tomorrow’s normal data, and it shouldn’t take a Data Scientist to make it useful.  Zoomdata enables us all to explore and gain insights from an array of data sources, visualizing billions of records in the blink of an eye.  We turn data into knowledge, and we do it with an evolving, real time perspective.


We are looking for software engineers who love building highly-modular single-page apps (SPAs) using ReactJS, ECMAScript6 (ES6) and TypeScript - and who love trying out the new JavaScript technologies that show up every day. Our engineers aggressively test their work using things like Karma, Jasmine, Grunt, Jenkins and test coverage analysis tools, so our other engineers can trust what they pull down from our internal npm repository. And of course, HATEOAS lets the UI evolve when the web service changes without requiring a lot of release synchronization.

jobs.title: Senior Automation and Tools Engineer
jobs.content:
With nearly 20,000 organizational customers and millions of student users, Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company. Blackboard is shaping the future of education with big ideas that challenge conventional thinking and advance new models of learning. Every day we’re inspiring people to find new ways to learn, connect and drive change in the way education is delivered and experienced. Through technology and services we bring people closer to the knowledge they seek and to ways they can change their own education and the world for the better.
 
Do you have a passion for Cloud and SaaS applications that run on Amazon Web Services? Do you have technical expertise with Web and Java Application Servers, build/deployment pipelines and Linux? Do you enjoy scripting, automation, developing robust monitoring tools, and working with configuration management tools like Chef? Then you have to talk to us!
As a senior member of our Engineering team, you will have the opportunity to join the group responsible for building, deploying and running industry leading mobile, SaaS and web services platform. We are looking for experienced candidates to drive, design, implement and scale our DevOps methodology driven technologies, approach, and tooling to support our cloud and mobile platforms. Qualified candidates will bring the latest software development, automation and deployment practices.

  • Bring the latest tools and techniques to achieve optimal results

  • Stay up to date on the latest Cloud development and deployment technologies

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
If you're interested in high impact DevOps opportunities working on highly visible AWS offerings that are critical to the competitiveness and growth of Rackspace and the Managed Cloud Market as a whole, you’ve come to the right place!!


Do you like to automate even the most simple tasks to avoid manual work?  Do single points of failure and non-redundant systems give you nightmares?  Are you most comfortable on the cutting edge of technology? If this describes you and you’re ready to attack some of the most complex problems in the industry, then it’s time for you to take on the challenge of being a DevOps Engineer for Fanatical Support for AWS at Rackspace.



With over 200,000 customers hosting their environments from ten data centers across the globe, the opportunities to solve the complex problems they present or to build the infrastructure they rely upon is endless—you choose which path you want to take. Put that genie LAMP away (pun intended) …this isn’t a wish, it’s the real deal.


Customer Focused: Launched in October 2015, Fanatical Support for AWS is the next generation of Fanatical Support. With over 200+ AWS Certified Architects, we throw years of talent and knowledge at our customer’s issues to create winning solutions.  From architecting customer infrastructure to deploying it programmatically and supporting it long term, our DevOps Engineers get to create one-of-a-kind, cutting edge cloud solutions for our customers.


Automation: Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Salt, Cloud Formation and whatever comes next. These are the toys of the trade, and our DevOps Engineers always share their toys with our Software Developers, Infrastructure Engineers and Quality Engineers. This is a team sport, kids. Silo workers need not apply.


Ready to launch your career into the clouds?  (You see what we did there?) Hit the apply button already, talk with one of our talent specialists and start building a better future for you!

jobs.title: Software Engineer - JavaScript Frameworks
jobs.content:
Reports to VP of Engineering


It’s been said around here that today’s “big data” is tomorrow’s normal data, and it shouldn’t take a Data Scientist to make it useful.  Zoomdata enables us all to explore and gain insights from an array of data sources, visualizing billions of records in the blink of an eye.  We turn data into knowledge, and we do it with an evolving, real time perspective.


We’re looking for software engineers who love to apply their CS and math expertise to the world of client-side JavaScript frameworks. Zoomdata’s JavaScript client is the heart of our flagship web application, and is used by our customers and partners to build their own data-driven applications. It routes streaming data to our beautiful, real-time visualizations, and exposes our WebSocket query API to clients.


We’re looking for JavaScript experts experienced with NodeJS, TypeScript, ECMAScript 6 (ES6), functional programming, high-performance stream processing - and of course unit testing and automated performance testing! Although a degree in computer science is highly recommended, we hire people with math and other kinds of engineering degrees, too. If you know your data structures and algorithms, and have a passion for high quality and pushing limits, you’ll fit right in here!

jobs.title: Technical Application Specialist
jobs.content:
Do you get excited about designing, implementing and managing Microsoft based communication platforms? Are you the person that will make our business applications as cutting edge as our trading applications? As a Technical Application Specialist you could be part of the team which owns the Optiver IT business systems on premise and in the cloud. 



What you'll do
As a Technical Application Specialist you will work closely with the business to understand their needs and translate those into strategic technical solutions. You will show the business how to make the most of the systems they use. Within our team you will have the freedom to lead projects and work independently, but you will also co-ordinate, communicate and work in partnership with other technical teams to deliver cross platform distributed solutions. As our new Technical Application Specialist you will bring expertise in Microsoft Exchange / Office 365 and Lync / Skype for business to optimize our use of these platforms. Furthermore, you will liaise with Global counterparts in our Sydney and Chicago offices to contribute to the innovation of solutions in and around your core competencies.
In short, as our new Technical Application Specialist you will be:



  • Responsible for the functional and technical performance of our Microsoft applications like AD, Exchange, ADFS;

  • Responsible for the functional and technical performance of video conferencing with Skype for Business;

  • Responsible for managing daily operations including fixing incidents and solving technical problems;

  • Automate these daily operations as much as possible with PowerShell.

jobs.title: Software developer Java
jobs.company: PAY.ON AG - AN ACI WORLDWIDE COMPANY
jobs.content:
You will …



  • join a team of strong software engineers, developing integrations with a growing variety of payment types and payment systems from all over the world.

  • connect this system to other payment systems of different complexity, ranging from traditional credit card systems, over direct debit and billing systems to eWallets, online transfer, mobile systems.

  • be focusing on “Software as a Service” (SaaS).

  • have loads of fun.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Being a profitably growing product company is great: we get to build the best team possible. Since everything’s changing so rapidly, we’re always open to new ways to improve our work.


Facebook advertising is a challenging domain, with some of the brightest minds in the world working on it. We process terabytes of data every day, dynamically generating content for our customers, or building predictive models to optimize the campaigns.


Developers work closely with account managers and customers, and we rotate people across our offices in Helsinki, Berlin, San Francisco and Singapore. Our account managers are also very technical, sometimes even contributing to the product.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
With nearly 20,000 organizational customers and millions of student users, Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company. Blackboard is shaping the future of education with big ideas that challenge conventional thinking and advance new models of learning. Every day we’re inspiring people to find new ways to learn, connect and drive change in the way education is delivered and experienced. Through technology and services we bring people closer to the knowledge they seek and to ways they can change their own education and the world for the better.

Every day we build products that impact millions of teachers, students, career advisors, and everyone involved in the full educational experience. We are looking for a Senior Front-End Developer to join us. Our ideal candidate:

You are a developer who can both build from scratch and work with existing platforms, who is excited to work directly with world-class designers, and who is passionate about building great products. In this role you will be a lead in developing the future of Blackboard’s products. You are an expert in craft. You sweat the details of both your code and the aesthetics and interactions of the products you build. We'll get the meetings out of your way so you can just focus on your work.


Primary responsibilities

Day-to-day responsibilities include, but are not limited to:



  • Writing clean, simple, readable, documented code

  • Participating in brief stand-up meetings

  • Working closely with both interaction and visual designers

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Automation Engineer in an Agile Environment
jobs.content:
Farmers Insurance is reinventing itself via a Digital Transformation to drive agility and to respond faster to market demands. We need your help to ensure our products and platforms continue to meet the quality standards our customers have come to expect.



As an Automation Engineer at Farmers, you will join our Marketing QA team, a flat organization playing a central role in creating/evolving areas of automated testing.  You will Set/adapt our test automation processes and identify needed tools/integrations.



Depending on your experience, you’ll embed directly with one of our product teams such as the Mobile or Web teams. You’ll be working side-by-side with these developers not working in a vacuum.  As you grow with us, you’ll have the flexibility to move between teams while expanding your skill sets and exposure to new technologies.

jobs.title: Teacher
jobs.content: Skillshare is hiring a Teacher anywhere

jobs.title: Software Engineers  Scala
jobs.content:
itv loves scala, scalaz, akka, jenkins, terraform, graphite...


 ...and automation, and scalable apps, and agile engineering, and brilliant people, and inspirational spaces, and awesome environments...


And that’s just the beginning.


Right now, we’re looking for someone who shares our love of tech to work on our viewer registration, login and personalisation services.


We’re deploying a brand new Scala microservice based architecture based on best of breed open source technology, which means you’ll need to mix commercial experience of Scala with a deep understanding of software and test driven development, and a typed functional approach to your code - particularly using higher kinded types such as monads and monad transformers.


You’ll be working with a tech stack that also includes Scalaz and Akka, Git and GitHub Vagrant, Jenkins, Puppet, RabbitMQ, AWS, Terraform, ELK and Graphite.


And you’ll soon discover cross-functional, self-organising, commercially-minded, boundary-pushing engineering teams, underpinned by a devops culture that’s critical in powering our business.


We’ve created the kind of working environment where you’ll never stop learning. We’re creative, tech-driven, and people-focused. We’re 60 years of TV history - and we’re also its future.


There’s never been a more exciting time to join us.

jobs.title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking full-time full stack software development professionals with the commitment, skill and work ethic necessary to join the A-team. 


You will collaborate with ownership, executives and users to help shape our product and deliver new features monthly. With everything you develop you will be building our future success, improving our effectiveness, and making our users happier.


You are critical to our success, leveraging your skill, knowledge and dedication to build the applications that will make us more than we are today.


While delivering fantastic outcomes through Agile processes you will further develop your skills and knowledge. You will be pushed to solve ever more complex problems and continually make things better.


You will work under the tutelage of our Team Lead, and developer extraordinaire, and alongside other like minded professionals. 


You have the option of working in one of our three offices alongside other team members, 100% remote in the comfort of your most effective environment, or a hybrid of the two based on your location.

jobs.title: Platform Engineers
jobs.content:
itv loves open source, cloud tech, scalable apps... 



...and and agile engineering, and brilliant people, and inspirational spaces, and awesome environments...


And that’s just the beginning.


Right now, we’re looking for platform engineers at all levels who share our love of tech to help expand the home of our key systems ­- the Common Platform.


It involves anything from running our ITV Hub, to working on the system that pays Ant & Dec, to deploying a microservice that handles millions of requests during the X Factor final. But wherever you are, you’ll be working with great people using the latest technology in a stack that includes AWS, centos, terraform, consul, vagrant, sensu, elk, graphite/grafana, packer, puppet, docker, jenkins, redis, rabbitmq, nginx, varnish, haproxy, trello, ruby, golang, microservices, github, slack and more.


A solid working knowledge of linux (ideally Centos) is essential, and you’ll already be familiar with config management, deployment, automation, orchestration, and monitoring tools. You’ll also have experience with the cloud based services, and you’ll be a strong communicator who’s happy having their code critiqued.


In return, you’ll discover cross-functional, self-organising, commercially-minded, boundary-pushing engineering teams, underpinned by a devops culture that’s critical in powering our business.


We’ve created the kind of working environment where you’ll never stop learning. We’re creative, tech-driven, and people-focused. We’re 60 years of TV history - and we’re also its future.


There’s never been a more exciting time to join us.

jobs.title: Senior Brand Designer
jobs.content: Joyce Meyer Ministries is hiring a Senior Brand Designer in St. Louis, MO

jobs.title: Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about software development and eager to define, develop and review new APIs? Can you work with the Agile / SCRUM methodology? Please read this vacancy and apply for:



Full-Stack Developer (PHP)



What is the role about?
As a Full-stack Developer you design, construct and support our systems written in PHP. You will work in an Agile self-organized team that takes care of the Customer Portal of LeaseWeb and the other organizations within Ocom group. Customer Portal is the main customer facing control panel where the customers manage their services, payments, support tickets, etc.. Your responsibilities will vary from simple maintenance to very complex tasks in one of our innovative R&D projects.


 Your typical day will start with a short stand-up meeting and continue with development, brainstorming and refinement of new features, lunch with your colleagues, communication with different teams and departments, code reviews and some more development.

jobs.title: User Interface Developer
jobs.content:
Goal:  Determine client needs and translate those needs into a beautiful, rich user experience on multiple platforms using current tools and technologies across a wide variety of domains.  Enable clients to leverage their enterprise solutions to meet current business needs bridging the gap in design elements from desktop to mobile (or traditional to modern). 


An eye for design, passion for client side technologies in general and front end development while feeding your strong curiosity for understanding how it all works.

jobs.title: Developer in Test
jobs.content:
itv loves automation, testing, continuous integration…


 ...and microservices, and agile engineering, and brilliant people, and inspirational spaces, and awesome environments...


And that’s just the beginning.


Right now, we’re looking for an automation and tools engineer who shares our love of tech to help us deliver ever increasing standards of product quality by enhancing and scaling out our test automation frameworks.


We’re transforming our deploy timelines - from months down to hours - and you’ll help us build a brand new architecture that’s underpinned with microservices and best of breed open-source technology.


To join us, you’ll need a good level of experience with Ruby and Linux, together with a well defined background in testing. You’ll already have used common Ruby frameworks such as Cucumber and RSpec, you’ll have a sound understanding of JavaScript, HTML, CSS, HTTP, XML and JSON, and you’ll be familiar with all major browsers and browser tools, e.g. firebug, devtools, version control systems including Git, and a range of debugging tools.


You’ll be working with a tech stack that includes Ruby for test automation Vagrant, Jenkins, Puppet, PostgreSQL and MySQL, Git and GitHub, RabbitMQ, Scala, CentOS, AWS and more.


And you’ll soon discover cross-functional, self-organising, commercially-minded, boundary-pushing engineering teams, underpinned by a devops culture that’s critical in powering our business.


We’ve created the kind of working environment where you’ll never stop learning. We’re creative, tech-driven, and people-focused. We’re 60 years of TV history - and we’re also its future.


There’s never been a more exciting time to join us.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about software development and eager to define, develop and review new APIs? Can you work with the Agile / SCRUM methodology?



We look forward to meeting you:




Software Engineer (PHP)




What is the role about?
As a PHP Developer you design, construct and support our systems written in PHP. Your responsibilities can vary from simple maintenance to very complex tasks in one of our innovative (Research and Implementation) projects.

Key responsibilities:



  • Analyzing requirements and designs, developing and maintaining products and services

  • Modifying existing software products to add new functions, adapt to new hardware, improve performance or enhance product usability

  • Ensuring that all LSW applications are tested and deployed in an automated process

  • Participating in all aspects from detailed programming to high-level systems design

  • Participating actively in the team Scrum activities and registering the activities in JIRA

  • Giving assistance to non-technical colleagues and collaborate with different departments (also non-technical) and customers

jobs.title: iOS Solutions Developer, TD Lab Accelerator
jobs.content:
The future of TD is in your hands – literally.


We're looking for an iOS Solutions Developer to set up shop in our TD Lab. Your day to day will involve exploring new solutions and emerging mobile technologies through ideation, design, and prototyping. Learn, creative, and experimental, the TD Lab is definitely not what comes to mind when you think of banking – and that's the way we like it.


Responsibilities include:



  • Designing, developing, testing, deploying, maintaining, and enhancing solutions being delivered to customers.

  • Leading by example – you aren't afraid to roll up your sleeves, so to speak.

  • Fostering an environment that encourages productivity, innovation, equality, and teamwork.

  • Supporting and participating the strategic direction of the TD Lab – you'll have a say that counts.

  • Participating in knowledge transfers – after all, the best way to learn is by teaching someone else!

  • Staying up to date on the latest trends, and providing recommendations to stakeholders where possible.

  • Acting as an expert in your field, and providing consultation whenever needed.

  • Last but not least – is there some way we can improve? Always let us know!

jobs.title: Magento Developer
jobs.content:
Since 1996, Electric Pulp has focused on developing cutting-edge interactive solutions. We are looking for a server-side developer who can use PHP to help us continue to produce top-of-the-line digital experiences for our clients, particularly in the ecommerce arena. We work hard; we play hard; and our clients demand the best. So if you're great at what you do, and what you do happens to be ecommerce and PHP programming, we want to hear from you.

We prefer that you are or could be local to Sioux Falls, SD or even in the Minneapolis area, but don’t let that stop you from making contact. We understand that the right fit might not live here.

About The Job

As an ecommerce developer at Electric Pulp, you will be integral to the success of the project, working with our project managers and front-end developers to implement the underlying server-side functionality of our projects. Typical projects involve working in Magento, developing functional modules, supporting sites and optimizing performance.

While coding is the core function of this role, there are a few other things that we'll be looking for:

  • Ability to work well with others
  • Self-starter tendencies (especially important if you're out of the area)
  • Dedication required to meet a deadline
  • Interest and proven history of learning new methods and technologies
  • Ability to write effectively and without typos
  • U.S. candidates only

This position is available now, and is already loaded with work, so we'd like you to be able to hit the ground running. Skills and experience required are as follows:

  • 2+ years PHP development experience
  • Expertise developing for Magento (esp. custom extensions and Magento Enterprise Edition). Magento certification preferred, but not required.
  • Experience integrating ecommerce platforms with third-party systems
  • Experience with MVC frameworks and concepts
  • Familiarity with AWS
  • Familiarity with Docker a plus
  • Experience with server configuration (esp. Apache and nginx)
  • Experience with server-side caching tools (esp. Memcache and Varnish)
  • Proficiency with version control tools (preferably git)
  • Proficiency with HTML5 & CSS2/3, JavaScript (esp. jQuery)
  • Familiarity with CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress)

This is a full-time salaried position with benefits:

  • Paid time off for vacations or illness
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Laptop provided
  • iPad mini or iPhone provided
  • Competitive Ping Pong environment
  • Free pop, (That’s soda, for you coastal types.)

We’re very serious about our work, but the team is cool, the projects are fulfilling and the Fridays allow for casual attire. As do the other days.

So, send us your resumé and your github repo or examples of your work in the wild. We look forward to hearing from you.

The future of TD is in your hands – literally.


We're looking for an Android Solutions Developer to set up shop in our TD Lab. Your day to day will involve exploring new solutions and emerging mobile technologies through ideation, design, and prototyping.   • Leading by example – you aren't afraid to roll up your sleeves, so to speak.

jobs.title: DevOps/System Engineer
jobs.content:
Our mission is to disrupt the online lottery business with innovative and engaging products. Product discovery through user testing, prototypes and qualitative research help us validate ideas at an early stage. Quantitative analysis and conversion rate optimization help us to iterate products and improve performance. Self-empowered and autonomous teams foster ownership and a drive to exceed expectations. Collaboration nurtures trust, inventiveness and a willingness to be bold. As a multicultural team with over 150 employees from 15 countries, we develop and run a state of the art e-Commerce platform.


In order to scale and hit the needs of the market, we are looking for a DevOps/System Engineer who is able to write infrastructure as code within an agile environment. If you want to create scalable and reliable environments, enjoy peer reviews, hackathons and cross-functional team work then we should get together and find out if we’re a match.


Your development branch at eSailors:



  • You itch to automate manual, repetitive ‘no-brainer’ tasks.

  • You still want to automate things people tell you only happen rarely every eight weeks.

  • You strive for Continuous Delivery / Deployment of Web Applications using CI Tools like Jenkins.

  • Cross-functional teams are your catalyst to expand your horizons.

jobs.title: IT Development Manager
jobs.content:
Your banking experience should be the same whether it's in person at a branch, or from your phone at home. It should be – in one word – legendary. And we want you to be a part of it.


We're looking for an IT Development Manager to join our Channels Technology Solutions team. You'll help drive the vision to create a customer experience that's integrated and effortless. You'll lead the development team through ideation, design, iteration – and celebration. Small victories matter here, but even the smallest improvement changes the lives of over 22 million customers around the world.


Responsibilities include:



  • Learning the ins and outs of the business' needs, and translating them to deliverables.

  • Providing technical expertise and counsel where needed – after all, you love to lead by example.

  • Doing your research, in order to recommend the best solutions possible.

  • Providing influence from an architectural perspective within the business environment, and fulfilling a data/service governance role.

  • Following best practices (and making sure others do too) through nightly builds, integrated builds, peer code reviews, incorporating design patterns.

  • Ensuring source control through versioning, labelling, branching, code merging and code maintenance.

  • Putting out fires as they happen – and avoiding them altogether by making sure the deployment process is built efficiently and error-free.

  • Making a development plan (and putting into action) within budget and scope.

  • Identifying, recommending, sourcing, and implementing emerging solutions.

  • Defining team members' roles and expectations, and provide timely feedback along with any resources necessary.

  • Building and maintaining relationships with partners, teams, and vendors across the business. There's a lot of moving parts to each projects, and you'll in charge of keeping track!

jobs.title: Software Developer joining Abcam on a journey of multi-year investment
jobs.content:
Abcam is on a journey of a multi-year investment in its core IT systems and we’re looking for an experienced Software Engineer with strong commercial experience of SOA design and implementation using a C# Restful web service framework to support our team on this mission. 


Our architectural landscape which supports our industry leading E-Commerce engine will consist of in-house developed systems utilising middleware solutions (WebMethods) to incorporate Oracle Cloud ERP as well as other packaged systems (Cloud and On-Premise). Therefore any experience in messaging, interfacing and architecting in this ecosystem is advantageous.


On a day-to-day basis our software engineers are responsible for working with other members of a multi-disciplinary agile project team to design solutions and deliver stories. When the stories are done, then there’s time to unwind with a bit of table tennis!


You will work closely with Architects, Operations, Business Analysts and QAs to ensure a quality delivery and be responsible for executing software refactoring where needed and appropriate.

jobs.title: Are you a master of Java?
jobs.content:
The role


Joining a growing team in the Delhi NCR office the right candidates will be able to take leadership of key areas within the development of these disruptive systems.  This role will take a significant role in architectural design and technology choices.


The candidate


We're looking for an individual who recognises that writing tests is not something you do after writing code. You believe that doing something twice is enough of a reason to script it for next time.  You have experience in a range of new technologies through your current role but have also researched and played around with other new technologies in your own time...because coding matters and to make the right decisions you need to be informed.


The projects


We are working on a selection of exciting projects including an Internet of Things platform. Working closely with a growing team in India and our colleagues in London you will be involved in supplying disruptive technology solutions to a range of industries.

jobs.title: Solutions UX Designer
jobs.content:
Here, we know that curiosity is just the beginning of something great.


We're looking for a Solutions UX Designer to join our TD Lab team. Lean, creative, and experimental, the TD Lab delivers exceptional experiences, and really gets to the core of our customers' needs. You'll spend your days exploring, innovating, ideating, and prototyping the next big thing.


Responsibilities include:



  • Producing design with the customer in mind – simple, elegant, and easy to understand.

  • Bringing your unique skills to the table. You'll be part of a team of designer, engineers, and

  • marketing individuals all collaborating to ship extraordinary products and experiences.

  • Designing highly functional user interfaces using design research techniques, including in-field

  • observations, customer interviews, usability testing, and other forms of user need-finding.

  • Doing your research. You'll build personas, storyboards, flowcharts, wireframes and prototypes.

  • Effectively communicating research findings, conceptual ideas, detailed design, and design

  • rationale both verbally and visually. What good is a good idea if nobody understands it?

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
As the leading developer of laser engraving and cutting technology, Epilog Laser is looking to add a web designer and developer to our marketing team. If you have strong web design and development abilities and have worked in a marketing department before, then we’re looking for you! Working with our marketing team, you will be working on special projects related to the web and internet marketing.


If you haven’t seen what our lasers can do, check us out at www.epiloglaser.com. When you apply tell us what you would create, engrave, or cut with our laser systems?


Essential Job Duties:



  • Responsible for maintaining, expanding, and updating website content and pages

  • Proven project coordination experience, ability to set timeframes and meet deadlines, including the ability to be flexible and manage simultaneous projects with varying priorities

  • Help to enhance our website to increase general traffic to the website and traffic-to-lead conversion rates

  • Design, implement, and maintain templates and web pages for Epilog Laser marketing efforts

  • Work on international websites and help organize content for translation

  • Ensure that website branding is consistent with Epilog Laser standards

  • Work with software designers on software release documentation

  • Ensure responsive web pages work on a variety of web browsers and mobile devices

  • Contribute to the design and implementation of email marketing and online advertising efforts

  • Strategize and help implement ways to improve and track site performance

  • Approaches problem diagnosis and solving aggressively and demonstrates creative problem solving abilities

  • Ensure best security practices and compliance measures are implemented and maintained

  • Create and maintain system updates and implementation documents

  • Excellent organizational, interpersonal and problem-solving skills - ability to work independently and with a team

  • Other duties may in include: graphic design, copy writing/editing, photo and video capturing/editing

jobs.title: Innovation Architect and Solutions Developer
jobs.content:
Here, we know that curiosity is just the beginning of something great.


We're looking for an Innovation Architect & Solutions Designer to join our TD-Cisco innovation lab. You'll spend your days working alongside other talented members of your team, developing creative and innovative ideas to bring to the business. You'll make mistakes, learn from them, and then turn them into something bigger and better. You'll explore new solutions and emerging technologies through fast-paced ideation, design and prototyping, and by bringing your all to each and every day.


Responsibilities include:



  • Figuring out what to tackle first. You'll translate and brainstorm the business's problem areas, and look at how to make improvements across the board.

  • Familiarizing yourself with many areas of the bank. How else will you know what's not working?

  • Working as part of a team. This means collaborating, communicating, updating, and everything else that comes along with working with people at many different levels.

jobs.title: Core Java Developer for Real Time Risk
jobs.content: The Real Time Risk Intra-day system is still in it’s early phases. The client would like to improve upon the current system by using a distributed streaming technologies. As part of this project, the java developer will help in the evaluation of the technology stack being used, and in particular the choice of No SQL DB solutions to incorporate.

jobs.title: Sr. Quality Assurance Manager
jobs.content:
Are you inspired by inventors who develop and launch new products that reach millions of Amazon customers? Our Amazon Digital Products teams have worked on Echo, Tablets, and Firefly. We are looking for someone who is passionate to create innovative experiences that customers love.



The Role:

The successful Senor Software Quality Assurance Manager will be obsessed with quality improvement, experienced and highly committed to creating world class automation for regression and feature testing. The manager will be able to develop and drive a high-level test strategy, as well as take a hands-on approach to implementing that strategy. In this role, you will:

  • Work with business and development teams to understand product vision and requirements

  • Understand how all elements of the system software ecosystem work together and develop QA approaches that fit the overall strategy

  • Be responsible for development of test strategies and creation of appropriate test harnesses

  • Oversee the development and execution of test plans and monitor and report on test execution

  • Work with a team of quality engineering professionals to ensure the highest quality product delivery

  • Be an experienced but hands-on manager who can build an organization and ensure it performs




  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering or equivalent combination of technical education and experience

  • 10+ years of industry experience, including at least 3 years of hands-on testing and 2 years as a manager

  • Experience in internet and wireless protocols, distributed systems design and testing required

  • Knowledge of QA concepts and methodology




  • Strong people management skills, with a proven ability to hire and grow talented programmatic and user-level personnel

  • Experience working closely with development and business teams to communicate problem impacts and to understand business requirements

  • Strong organizational skills, ability to track multiple test executions simultaneously and to be able to synthesize the results

  • Experience in agile development methodologies with continuous integration

  • Experience validating high quality consumer facing applications on embedded communications platforms

  • Experience with systems automating client / server testing with a heterogeneous mix of client applications and embedded devices

  • Shows creativity and initiative to improve product test coverage and effectiveness

  • Comfortable communicating cross-functionally and across management levels in formal and informal settings


Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer- Female/Minority/Disability/Vet

jobs.title: Software Engineer/Lead Dev PHP H/F
jobs.content:
En grande autonomie sur votre périmètre, vous êtes le garant de la solidité technique et fonctionnelle des projets dont vous avez la charge, de la phase de conception à la mise en ligne puis au suivi opérationnel.


Vous partagez avec les autres des responsabilités grandissantes (sur les outils de dev, refactoring, conférences...). Vous aimez le challenge technique lié aux problématiques de montée en charge que seuls les plus gros sites français ont à gérer.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.content:
We’re looking for focused and passionate people to help grow PrimeHammer. Explain why PrimeHammer is awesome, close new customers, and help us on the front lines in our mission to conquer the world! As sales representative, you need to have excellent phone and email manners. You need to understand our service completely so you can explain it to folks who'd like to work with us.

What is PrimeHammer:

We are Uber for software development. Skilled software engineers help startups succeed, save employment and hiring costs. Our current clients include companies in San Francisco and New York.
Similar companies: TopTal, X-Team

What you'll do:

  • Identify and create new business opportunities
  • Act as the backbone of our sales process: lead building, presenting, and closing with proposals + contracts
  • Creating an automated and repeatable sales processes
  • Over time you'll hire and manage account managers to help accelerate growth.
  • Research and find the right contact at each organization
  • Have a direct impact on the growth and success of PrimeHammer… no pressure

We’re looking for someone:

  • Highly motivated, driven and self-starting – no babysitting required
  • Tenacious, likeable and persuasive, who can get the job done all day long
  • Comfortable making cold calls and writing emails to develop leads and set meetings
  • With strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Confident, self-motivated and instinctive

Why us:

Young and ambitious team that is fun to work with. Big business potential - we've grown from 2 people to 8 people within the first year.
Trip to our European office (cheap beer, teambuilding).
Commission per signed contract.

Opportunity to set up sales pipeline on your own, have a big influence on our brand and the way we present ourselves.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Web Developer on our Veslink team, you will help the world’s leading shipping organizations transform vessel communication and navigate the future of global commerce. We’re looking for bright, energetic, highly motivated self-starters with experience in a fast-paced, results oriented organization.


As a key member of the Veson Nautical team, your technical insights will influence our architectural vision and our ability to rapidly expand Veslink’s reach and impact. At Veson Nautical you’ll always be encouraged to develop imaginative solutions and further your professional development.

jobs.title: Creative Director
jobs.content:
ImagiCorps is a cutting edge experiential branding and production firm located in picturesque Redmond/Seattle, WA. Our philosophy of ‘Never say never’ has lead us since 1989 in the practical application of extraordinary ideas for our many client brands: Starbucks, Nintendo, Microsoft, Coca-Cola, American Express, GM, Disney and Major League Baseball. We specialize in retail design and theater, dimensional merchandising and point of purchase displays, experiential event and mobile marketing, exhibit creation, interactive kiosks and design/manufacturing consulting within the dimensional universe.

We live and breathe to solve our client’s most challenging branding needs.

Job Summary/Mission

Lead ImagiCorps to the next level... We want someone who can see the big conceptual picture, lives to create unexpected experiences for some of the world’s greatest brands and can create killer design, after killer design, after killer design regardless of communication channel.
Reporting directly to the President, and working closely with the senior management team, you’ll be the creative conscience for the firm and with your design teams - responsible for creative output of ImagiCorps.
Responsibilities
• Provide overall creative and conceptual leadership for the Company.
• Direct, manage, build and mentor a staff of talented designers through the multi-step process from concept to implementation of experiential branding concepts that exceed our client expectations.
• Work with fellow senior management and clients to identify and understand marketing strategies, goals and branding opportunities.
• Live on the edge of design, experiential branding, marketing and promotional trends.
• Bring ImagiCorps creative to the next level.
Requirements
• 10+ years in creative management and a proven track record of leading heart-stopping creative and design development.
• Experience in dimensional design: retail, trade shows/exhibits, interior design, non-traditional advertising, related architectural design or environmental design work.
• Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively (both oral & written) with clients and internal partners.

jobs.title: Python Software Developer
jobs.content:
Love cinema?! We work primarily in Python and JavaScript and use a variety of technologies such as CherryPy, Flask, Docker and Redis. We’ll train you in our technology stack, which also includes PostgreSQL and jQuery. This is a rare opportunity for a candidate with class-leading experience to define the next stage of their career in an inspirational technical team, working on innovative digital cinema software.


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement new application architecture

  • Ensure architecture for all applications is flexible, testable, maintainable and scalable

  • Development across full application stack

  • Ensure quality thresholds are continually met

  • Provide technical leadership, communicating ideas to peer group

  • Define and implement improvements to existing toolsets used in the technical development environment, with a focus on best practice

  • Continuously improve the Scrum environment in collaboration with other Agile practitioners

  • Establish close relationships with internal customers and line managers

  • Technically mentor more junior developer

jobs.title: Software Developer in Test
jobs.content:
Love cinema?! Be involved in a cutting-edge industry leading our automation efforts as a Software Developer in Test. You will work with Python, Postgres and Git and be an embedded and integral part of a Scrum team. The Developer in Test will write automation code, build and maintain the test infrastructure needed to support automation. You will be reporting to the QA Manager and working as a member of the software development team.


Responsibilities



  • Help drive our development of test automation, working in Python with an emphasis on testing RESTful web services.

  • Act as a thought leader for test automation best practice at AAM.

  • Work with other devs to maintain and further develop an appropriate Python automation framework, built for maintainability, scalability and ease of use.

  • Create, configure and build jobs on Jenkins to provide the best feedback on the quality of the code being developed.

  • Continually research and experiment with different methods and tools to improve our process and the quality of our services.

  • Regularly interact with the wider testing community, promoting AAM and bringing back new techniques and practices to trial.

  • Mentor other members of the test team as they increase their automation skills.

  • Promote and evangelise the benefits of automated testing to the organisation.

jobs.title: User Experience Designer
jobs.content:
As a UX Designer at Chef you will be responsible for shaping and crafting our User Experience and strategy, and for helping define the overall UX vision throughout the Chef ecosystem. You will often serve as an advisor to our engineering team, and should be prepared to evangelize User Experience as a discipline. As such, you should have an acute sense of how research, persona development and usability testing lead to empathy to our users’ needs, and will improve our product User Experience..

Description

The Chef User Experience Team is a small but dedicated group that work collaboratively with our product management, engineering, customer success and marketing teams across multiple facets of our products. You’ll be responsible for crafting experiences across web, mobile, and desktop UX, deftly balancing power, simplicity and beauty across an expanding set of capabilities. You should be a strong conceptual thinker and be prepared to leverage your creativity to satisfy users’ needs and extend their ability to see, engage, and be delighted by their experience within the Chef ecosystem.

As a UX Designer at Chef you will be responsible for shaping and crafting our User Experience and strategy, and for helping define the overall UX vision throughout the Chef ecosystem. You will often serve as an advisor to our engineering team, and should be prepared to evangelize User Experience as a discipline. As such, you should have an acute sense of how research, persona development and usability testing lead to empathy to our users’ needs, and will improve our product User Experience. If you are cut, you bleed whiteboard ink, graphite, and wireframes.

Responsibilities

  • Working closely with UX leadership, product management and engineering to define UX and UI requirements
  • Creating user-centered designs by considering market analysis, customer feedback, technical constraints/opportunities and usability findings
  • Creating wireframes, user flows, storyboards, prototypes and other UX deliverables
  • Scoping and managing multiple concurrent design tracks
  • Mentoring peers, stakeholders, and teammates on user-centered design principles and methodologies
  • Conducting user research, ethnography and usability tests to collect and react to user feedback
  • Championing UX team initiatives, such as creation of design guidelines, process enhancements, toolkits and more

Experience & Qualifications

  • Master’s or Bachelor’s Degree in fields such as Human-Computer Interaction (HCI),
  • Industrial Design, Cognitive Science or equivalent professional experience
  • Approx. 5-7 years experience as a senior UX designer, UX architect, Senior UX researcher, or similar role
  • Demonstrated experience in the 5 core disciplines of User Experience: Information
  • Architecture, Interaction Design, Visual Design, Usability Engineering and
  • Prototyping
  • Strong knowledge of usability principles, testing, and design techniques
  • Fluency in best practices for web-based or mobile-based information architecture
  • and visual design
  • Demonstrated visual design expertise; capacity for creating delightful, highly usable designs and layouts, and a propensity towards simplicity
  • Experience working in collaborative, multi-disciplinary teams and working directly
  • with developers for implementation of designs
  • Experience in product design and development, and software design a major plus.
  • (as opposed to strictly agency / advertising based web design).
  • A portfolio or work samples demonstrating experience creating great user-centered
  • design solutions

Skills

  • Ability to give and interpret creative direction
  • Solid understanding of usability and heuristics
  • Strong conceptual and compositional skills
  • Ability to turn around rigorous wireframes and mockups in an iterative, agile environment
  • Must have strong presentation skills, and outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
  • Proficiency with web standards and accessibility compliance
  • Experience with Adobe Suite and Omnigraffle is highly desirable
  • Experience in Instructional Design is highly desirable
  • Familiarity with Javascript, HTML/CSS/SVG as well as frameworks such as Angular and/or Backbone and their capabilities is a plus

PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR ONLINE PORTFOLIO ON YOUR RESUME OR COVER LETTER FOR CONSIDERATION

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Software engineers play a vital role in the success of our business and form a core part of the organization. We tend to look for talented generalists who are capable of working in areas that can include large scale distributed systems, high-performance trading platforms, complex applications, infrastructure, and tools. Successful candidates will have the flexibility and skills to contribute in one or more of the following domains:



  • Development and maintenance of large, complex software and hardware systems, including identification of bottlenecks and optimization of performance.

  • Design and development of monitoring tools and interfaces that enable analysis of data from all aspects of our existing systems.

  • Leadership of complex software projects and initiatives.

jobs.title: Data and Operational Software Developer
jobs.content:
At TGS, data and operational software developers form a core part of our business and are among our most valued resources. This role is mission critical, so we’re searching for an uncommonly reliable professional who enjoys writing programs, working with data, and providing support for large-scale production systems.


In addition to software development and data management, this position is likely to involve interaction with external resources such as data providers, brokers, dealers, and software vendors, as well as colleagues from the research and engineering teams.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
Come help us build the teams that are building Chef Automate, Chef, Habitat, and InSpec at Chef!  The teams are distributed across the United States and committed to delighting our users with software that provides workflow and visibility over our open source automation platform.

  • As an Engineering Manager at Chef, you will have significant responsibility to grow engineers and develop quality software.
  • You will manage multiple engineers, who will work with other engineers on dynamic, flexible teams.
  • You will manage several engineering teams concurrently.
  • You will help engineers grow their careers and become more effective – in their craft and in their interpersonal skills.
  • You will work closely with the Product and UX teams to understand and then become a champion of the vision.
  • You will ship high quality software regularly, showing iterative progress with working software on a weekly basis.
  • You will gather metrics and take action to correct common cause problems and improve development efficiency.
  • You will meet with our users to gain an understanding of the problems they want to solve and the constraints they operate under

About our team:

Our mission is to write the software that defines how an entire generation of businesses deliver technology to their customers.

We work small so we can win fast, fail small, and learn continuously. We strive to iterate on the product by synthesizing customer feedback and product direction in order to identify small slices of work that add customer value. We build software for our users — we do what is right for them. We are allergic to things that are slow.

We use kanban to help us visualize our work and improve our process. Features and fixes are written as pull requests and reviewed by the team. Pairing and code review are essential parts of our process. Work is not complete unless it is tested.

Technology:

The service layer, including the REST API, is written in Erlang and talks to a PostgreSQL database. Our web interface is written in AngularJS. We use Ruby and Chef for build automation, testing, and deployment.  Chef Automate’s command line tool as well as the entire Habitat project are written in Rust.

jobs.title: Customer Success Architect
jobs.content:
Our Customer Architects work with Chef’s customers to develop, engineer, and guide implementation of their automation strategy. Customer Architects lead quarterly review sessions with Chef’s customers to ensure they are being successful on their automation journey.

Customer Architects are also responsible for technical mentorship of our Success Engineers. As Customer Architect, you would help with coaching Chef’s Success Engineers to better support our customer’s needs.

This position requires moderate travel to assist with complex projects and gather feedback from customers.

Responsibilities

  • Develop a trusted advisor relationship with customers based on your technical depth on all things Chef. You represent Chef in all our customer communications, responding to questions on system automation//configuration management/continuous delivery software, including such software’s configuration, use, and functionality, and leading resolution of technical issues.
  • Establish and oversee our Enterprise customer’s love of Chef, train and develop patterns of success to continually drive incremental value and return of their investment in Chef.
  • Provide technical mentorship to Chef Success Engineers
  • Take proactive ownership in identifying and recommending product improvements based on customer’s key data points and advocating improvements within Chef because you love customers.
  • Work closely with Chef core engineering and support teams to develop new features and resolve our customers issues.
  • Work closely with Chef consulting team in the development of specific cookbooks or other Chef use cases to further build out the body of Chef knowledge in the Chef Community.

Desired Qualifications

  • Expert-level working knowledge of Chef in a Continuously Delivered Production environment
  • Ability to work directly with customers and a commitment to their success an abundance of empathy
  • Senior level individuals with demonstrated experience in Systems Engineering, Deployment/Test Automation or Software Development
  • Superb verbal communications skills, including a dynamic and engaging presentation style that inspires confidence — significant training experience a big plus
  • Love for debugging complex technical issues at every level of a modern application stack
  • Experience with several scripting/programming languages, particularly Ruby
  • Experience with version control (particularly git)
  • Experience running production infrastructures for high-availability, high-volume web services is a strongly desired
  • Experience engaging with the Chef Open Source community is strongly desired

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer - UI and Web Applications
jobs.content:
We're searching for a talented full stack engineer with a particular interest in building User Interfaces (UI's). This isn't a typical UI position - the person working in this role will be interacting with complex backend systems, exposing critical data to users, working with the research team, and developing full stack web applications. The ability to write production ready code is an important part of the equation, but to be successful in an environment as complex as ours, you'll also have to demonstrate an ability to solve novel problems and learn new things at speed. 


You'll find this opportunity particularly appealing if you enjoy working with smart people in a collaborative environment, have general expertise in software / UI development, and are willing to dive into any kind of programming challenge. Possible areas of focus are likely to include:



  • Design, development, and maintenance of monitoring tools, including user interfaces, to analyze data from all aspects of our existing system(s).

  • Development and maintenance of complex software and systems, including identification of bottlenecks and optimization of performance.

  • Parsing, processing, and analyzing large financial data sets, including writing complex queries.

  • Building, adapting, and maintaining user-friendly interfaces.

jobs.title: Front-end developer
jobs.content:
Vacature front-end developer


Heb je zin om te werken bij de grootste en leukste online opleider van Nederland?  Bouw jij in een handomdraai van ieder grafisch ontwerp een échte pagina die als een geoliede machine in elkaar steekt? En ben je een meester in Javascript? Reageer dan nu op deze vacature!
Het is jouw voornaamste focus om alle gebruikers van GoodHabitz een topervaring op het gebied van online trainingen te geven met onze website, trainingen, apps en alles wat daarbij hoort. Daarbij vertaal je mockups en / of functionele eisen moeiteloos in een betrouwbare en vlotte applicatie / website / pagina, waarbij je communiceert met de backend door het aansturen van een API. ‘The full works' met als belangrijkste kernwoorden frisheid, innovatie en kwaliteit!

jobs.title: Customer Support Representative
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a super smart support team member! Specifically, we’re seeking a native English speaker in the US (preferably EST).

You’ll be responsible for providing tremendous customer service via email and phone for all versions of Basecamp. You’ll also help us answer questions via Twitter, create and edit help documentation, run personalized demos, and maybe some online classes.

During training, you’ll be expected to be proactive in your process and learn quickly. Once fully up-to-speed (2-3 months), you’ll write about 100 emails per day. This is a significant volume, so be sure that you’re ready and able to deal with that kind of daily load — you’ll get all the love and help you need along the way!

We’re looking for some great writers who love helping our customers, so you should enjoy making complicated situations simple and painless and have a passion for our products. This means being a great problem solver with the ability to process and resolve issues quickly.

If you want to join Carrie, Chase, Chris, Elizabeth, James, Jayne, Jim, Joan, Kristin, Merissa, Natalie, Sylvia and Tony in making our customers happy, please apply!

Please submit a cover letter explaining:

  • Why you want to work in customer support.
  • Why you want to work at Basecamp and not somewhere else.
  • A description of a great customer service/support experience you had recently, and what made it great.
  • A time you taught yourself a new skill to complete a job or project.
  • A guide to making a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. (Seriously.)

Also, pick three of the questions from customers below and answer them like you would if you worked here:

  • Does the new Basecamp offer time tracking?
  • Is the new Basecamp offered in any other language besides English?
  • I’ve been a Basecamp user for years and see you have a new version. What’s the difference between the versions, and why should I switch?
  • How do I work with clients in the new Basecamp?

We offer heaps of lovely benefits, a competitive salary, plus a progressive work environment.

We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Awesome Developer
jobs.content:
For the development of new innovative and individual solutions for our text generation engine, we are looking for dedicated Software Developers (f/m) and/or Computational Linguists.


YOUR TASKS



  • Realization of development tasks for the new development and expansion of customer projects

  • Conception, planning, and realization of software components

  • Realization in teams with agile methods

  • Test-driven programming

jobs.title: Content Writer (Personal Finance)
jobs.content:
Student Loan Hero (SLH) combines financial education with easy-to-use tools to help the millions of Americans living with student loan debt to manage their student loans smarter.

Since 2012, Student Loan Hero has helped more than 80,000 borrowers to manage and eliminate over $1 billion in student loan debt. Each year, it helps more than one million people become financially healthy.

For both current and former students who want to manage their loans in line within their own budget, Student Loan Hero offers free loan calculators, unbiased personalized advice, and repayment plans, all with a user-friendly interface and dashboard.

What does the Content Writer do?

The mission of the Content Writer is to craft amazing blog posts and other content that knocks our readers’ socks off. We want the reaction to our writing to be “Wow! This is the most insanely useful resource I’ve ever read on the topic!”

We help our readers and users answer important questions about their student loans and their finances in general. This process includes making concepts from the often-confusing world of student loans and personal finance easy to understand so that our readers can take action.

The Content Writer is crucial to making this happen. The primary way the Content Writer will do this is through the SLH blog and website. The Content Writer should be comfortable writing content, especially related to student loans and topics of personal finance. Knowing how to identify interesting topics and produce a compelling blog post is a must for this position.

The Content Writer will also help SLH create and publish content writing on external sites as well, such as Forbes,Huffington Post, Entrepreneur, and more.

The ideal candidate for this position should have an entrepreneurial mindset and be ready to take on and initiate new projects when he or she sees the need.

What’s it like to work on the Student Loan Hero team?

Student Loan Hero is a fully remote team. We have team members all over the world, in cities including NYC, Austin, Portland, Santiago, and St. Petersburg.

Since we’re literally all over the map, communication using Slack, Gmail, Basecamp, Google Hangouts, and other tools is key for us. Don’t worry—you won’t be alone. We communicate regularly throughout the day.

In our small group, each team member uses highly specialized skills while working on a variety of projects. We enjoy giving our team members autonomy to do the work that interests them. We’re focused on the output of each team member, not putting in long hours.

We’re always open to new ways to create better content and make Student Loan Hero better for student loan borrowers, and we want to hear new ideas from you. A large part of our culture and values is transparency. We believe that team members should collaborate and communicate, not compete or engage in office politics.

At the same time, we like to make work as much fun as possible. We want everyone on our team to grow both personally and professionally, which is why we offer wellness and educational bonuses, as well as several other great perks.

Above all, we’re each proud to work on solving meaningful problems and to impact lives every day. Whether it’s authoring a blogpost read by thousands of borrowers or answering a one-on-one customer support question, we value that working for Student Loan Hero makes a positive impact.

Required:

  • 2+ years experience writing and publishing online, particularly in blog post format
  • Familiarity with proper formatting, style, and tone of blog posts
  • Ability to research and contribute ideas you can write about
  • Ability to quickly turn around assignments for breaking news, etc.
  • Availability to work full time

Preferred:

  • Experience writing about student loans and other personal finance topics
  • Experience with conducting interviews for articles
  • Experience promoting blog posts (on social media, via email, etc.)
  • Familiarity with WordPress
  • Familiarity with SEO best practices

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary: Based on experience and location
  • Equity: 0.05–0.15% in vested company ownership
  • Vacation:Unlimited
  • Flexible hours: Work when you’re most productive
  • Work remotely: Work from wherever you want in the world (Costa Rica, anyone?)
  • New equipment: We’ll hook you up with a $2,000 technology stipend to purchase a laptop or whatever helps you work
  • Remote workspace: We’ll pay up to $500/month for a remote office space (e.g., co-working space)
  • Wellness: Up to $450/month for wellness-related expenses, including health insurance and gym membership
  • Continuing education: Up to $100/month for courses, books, or anything you’d like to learn!
  • Financial contribution: Receive a 100% match of up to 3% of annual salary to a retirement account, or a 100% match of up to 3% of annual salary towards student loan repayment assistance.

jobs.title: Structural Packaging Designer
jobs.content:
The Structural Packaging Designer will be part of the Veritiv Packaging Designer Center and will work in a diverse group of Program Managers, Graphic Designers, Package Engineers and Lab Technicians under the leadership of the Regional Packaging Design Manager. The Designer will create custom and innovative packaging design concepts for a variety of clients and industries. These engineered solutions will meet our customers packaging requirements and solve the packaging manufacturing challenges faced by Veritiv suppliers. Suggestions of a better packaging solution are expected along with delivering the original solution requested. The Designer will work independently, manage multiple projects of various complexities and will utilize available resources including an ISTA certified test facility. All of the Designer’s efforts are targeted to support Veritiv sales professional team.

Job Responsibilities
• Generate high quality ideas, prototype, evaluate and refine.
• Review packaging design, manufacturing and materials to reduce the total cost of packaging.
• Prepare, develop proposals and present to the client with a comprehensive action plan.
• Conduct on-site packaging audits, specification reviews, lab testing and trials of packaging concepts.
• Incorporate information on customer’s current practices at packaging sites and distribution centers.
• Responsible for the organization, storage and distribution for all design specifications, revision control, assembly instructions and manufacturing releases files.
• Collaborates with internal and external customer as well as other functions of Veritiv Engineered Solutions team in the development or testing of engineered solutions.
• Stays current with Artios CAD, Tops/CAPE, Solidworks, PowerPoint, Word, Excel and other software updates, industry standards and technology developments (continuing education, trade shows, conferences, etc.).
• Calibrates and ensures that the Kongsberg cutting table is working well and makes full utilization of the cutting tables capability as well as the drop test system.
• Knowledgeable in corrugated, folding carton, foam and manufacturing capabilities and practices. Understand what and how packaging components will be printed, die cut, stripped, glued and assembled using automated equipment. Has a good understanding of corrugated material, including liners and mediums and board various board combinations.
• Manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously.
• Present concepts to clients.
• Other related duties and responsibilities as required or assigned.

Required Skills
• Expert level experience using 2D software (Artios CAD, CAPE or Tops, etc).
• Advanced critical thinking and problem solving skills.
• Creative/Innovative.
• Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and technically challenging assignments simultaneously.
• Strong communication and technical writing skills are required with ability to discuss technical issues in business environment.
• Ability to adapt to rapidly changing business priorities and assignments.
• Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills.
• Demonstrated ability to present to clients.
• Knowledge of packaging testing a plus.

Required Experience
• 5+ years experience in Packaging Design and Development.
• BS in Engineering, Packaging Science or a similar discipline. Advanced degree is a plus.
• Advanced level experience using 2D software (Artios CAD, CAPE or Tops, etc). Experience with Adobe CS suite for graphic interaction is preferred. 3D modeling and presentation skills are a plus.
• Has some experience with 3D software (Solidworks or Pro-E).
• Experience working with point-of-purchase, corrugated, folding carton, foams and cushioning products. Knowledge of production processes, machine limitations and production standards are required.

jobs.title: SQL Developer/DBA in Denver Tech Hub
jobs.content: As a SQL Server Developer/DBA, your primary responsibilities will include Database development and support in MS SQL Server 2014 environments. You will be responsible for writing stored procedures, managing the database performance and ensure data entity and schema design follows best practices and standards. You will respond to database related alerts and escalations and work to come up with strategic solutions to recurring problems.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer (m/f)
jobs.content:
We shape the hotel room of the future!

SuitePad is a Berlin SaaS company that re-defines the way hotels connect with guests. In the hotel room of the future, you’ll find the guest directory, telephone, remote control, newspapers, and room service, all rolled into a single device - the SuitePad.

As the European market leader for in-room tablets, we already reach more than 250.000 hotel guests per month. Now, we’re looking to complete our team with a Ruby on Rails Developer (m/f).

Your Playground:

  • design, build and improve our backend infrastructure responsible for serving content to thousands of tablets
  • split up our system even further into microservices
  • deeply integrate our product into hotel software (PMS, PoS, Spa software)
  • shape the future of our tablet landscape and work closely with our core team of Web, Android and Dev Ops engineers

Your Profile:

  • you have at least 3 years of professional experience in developing web applications with Ruby on Rails
  • you know Javascript and Node.js
  • you have extensive knowledge in developing REST APIs
  • you have worked with Docker, RabbitMQ and the AWS ecosystem
  • TDD is not only a nice concept to you, but the only way you want to code
  • you are legally permitted to work in Germany

We offer:

  • a team of excellent international engineers to work with
  • a product with global traction
  • a modern office, right in central Berlin
  • swift decision making and flat hierarchies
  • a high degree of freedom in your work

jobs.title: Network and Telecom Operations Technician
jobs.company: CERN  European Organization for Nuclear Research
jobs.content:
Functions:

As a Network and Telecom Operations Technician you will join a small team responsible for ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of network and telecom services at CERN. This will involve:
  • The monitoring of incidents on the network infrastructure, follow-up with experts of the affected service;
  • The coordination of external partners and the scheduling of interventions on the network and telecommunications infrastructure;
  • Advanced user support for unusual requests and incidents reported by users;
  • In-depth investigation and resolution of highly technical networking and telecom issues affecting various types of systems at CERN (industrial controllers, high performance computing applications etc.), in collaboration with experts of the group, the IT department or other departments;
  • Active participation in the continuous improvement of operational processes and procedures in line with ITIL recommendations;
  • Liaison with Internet and telephony service providers and with research institutes directly connected to CERN.
Qualification required:

Higher technical diploma in the field of Computing, Telecommunications or related fields, or equivalent.

*Please note that preference will be given to candidates with the above-mentioned qualifications: in principle consideration will not be given to applications from people with higher qualifications.

The experience required for this post is:
  • Experience in the fields of networking and/or telecommunications;
  • Experience on a service provider role in a technical environment;
  • Experience in analysing complex technical problems and finding means to resolve them;
  • Initial experience of coordinating work with external providers and subcontractors would be an advantage.
The technical competencies required for this post are:
  • Network support: the provision of network monitoring, support and maintenance services based on solid understanding of underlying networking/telecom technologies, such as IP switching and routing, DHCP and DNS;
  • Customer relationship management: on behalf of a team supplying IT services, the coordination of communication of services and delivery activities to one or more user groups; assistance to the groups to ensure that they gain maximum benefit from the services supplied;
  • Problem management: the resolution of incidents and problems, including classification, prioritisation and initiation of action, documentation of root causes and implementation of remedies.
The language competencies required are:
  • English or French: spoken and written, with the ability to draw-up technical specifications, and/or to make oral presentations. Ability to understand and speak the other language in professional contexts or an undertaking to acquire it rapidly.
Eligibility conditions:

Employing a diverse and international workforce is a CERN core value and central to our success. We welcome applications from all Member States irrespective of gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or personal situation.

This vacancy will be filled as soon as possible, and applications should normally reach us no later than 14.08.2016.

By applying here, you allow CERN to consider your application for any position it considers relevant with respect to your profile. Please ensure you update your profile regularly with any relevant information and that you inform the recruitment service if you wish your file to be removed from the database.

Note on Employment Conditions:

We offer a limited-duration contract for a period of 5 years. Limited-duration contracts shall terminate by default on their date of expiry. Subject to certain conditions, holders of limited-duration contracts may apply for an indefinite position.

These functions require:
  • Stand-by duty, when required by the needs of the Organization.
  • Work during nights, Sundays and official holidays, when required by the needs of the Organization.
*Effective 1 September 2016, CERN will introduce a new career structure, the details of which shall be published in the Staff Rules and Regulations on that date.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
• Full stack application development including backend, frontend, configuration management and operation tasks

jobs.title: Développeur Web Drupal PHP
jobs.content:
Basé à Paris, en tant que Développeur, vous vous concentrerez sur la conception, le développement et la maintenance de différentes fonctionnalités.


Votre fonction
