jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer | Design & Deploy Systems Processing >200qps
jobs.content: Yieldify is growing in a very fast pace, adding millions and millions of requests each month. As Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be designing, developing and deploying systems ready to scale with our growth while maintaining the best quality. This role will expose you to various projects our current team are working on - which ranges from tag, data and dashboard projects - all of which interact with over millions of our clients' customers globally. Our diverse team works across different projects so it doesn’t matter whether you’re an mid-level coder or a project lead, we’ve love to hear from all levels of talent!

jobs.title: Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
To define, develop and support the customised product solutions and applications required by our customers in a dynamic and creative Agile development environment. 


To ensure that the solutions fully integrates with customers other systems.  Working closely with key Customers to define and deliver the solution.


Greenfield, full stack MS development.


Flexible working potentially available.


Define and support the development of new applications


Define and prepare program specifications to meet business requirements and future strategy


Present plans for new functionality or solutions improvements to both the development community and external customers


Liaise with BA and QA teams


Communicate with trainers, demonstrators and implementers regarding new software functionality


Travel to client sites and provide onsite support when required


Assist with transfer of knowledge & skills to other team members as required


Offer input into future design and development of the Core product


Work as part of a team, Agile sprint team or individually on projects

jobs.title: Junior+/ Medior PHP Programmeur
jobs.content:
Vendiro is per direct op zoek naar een Junior+/ Medior PHP programmeur. Je bent werkzaam in een klein team en je werkzaamheden bestaan uit het ontwikkelen van koppeling met (inter)nationale marketplaces, het vergaren van prijsinformatie en doorontwikkeling van ons platform. Iedere marketplace heeft een eigen webservice, met andere eisen en wensen. Je zal modules bedenken en ontwikkelen voor het verzenden van productinformatie en het ophalen van informatie over de bestellingen en betalingen. Daarnaast zal je je bezighouden met het onderhouden en ontwikkelen van nieuwe features voor reeds bestaande modules. Tot slot zullen je werkzaamheden bestaan uit het aansluiten van nieuwe klanten en het bieden van eerstelijns support voor de bestaande klanten.


Werkzaamheden:



  • Het ontwikkelen van nieuwe features voor de interface.

  • Het aansluiten van nieuwe marketplaces en functionaliteiten bij bestaande uitbreiden.

  • Het aansluiten van nieuwe klanten op het Vendiro platform.

  • Eerstelijns support voor de bestaande klanten.

  • Meedenken over de verdere ontwikkeling van Vendiro.

jobs.title: DevOps Data Engineer
jobs.content:
As our new DevOps Engineer, you will be working on the development and support of various environments, involving data analysis, transformation and loading utilising both the Elastic Stack and Oracle. You’ll be supported with training and will hit the ground running in this varied and fast paced role.


Reporting the to Data Services Manager, you will be working with a variety of people; technology specialists, internal managers and staff as well as our external customers, usually at operational level, and suppliers. You will also have the opportunity to participate in technical forums within the company. 


Key responsibilities:



  • Design, construct, install, test and maintain highly scalable data management systems, research opportunities for data acquisition and new uses for existing data.

  • Build high-performance algorithms, prototypes, predictive models and proof of concepts.

  • Clear and timely communications (verbal and written) to colleagues and internal customers.

  • Assist technology colleagues in achieving agreed service standards by ensuring service operates to required operational levels.

  • Adoption and maintenance of standards of process, coding, documentation and working practices to improve service quality and performance.

  • Participation in data services implementation and development projects.

  • Adopt a team player mentality to ensure that the team is functioning optimally (supporting and developing colleagues, knowledge sharing etc.)

jobs.title: Industrial Design Director
jobs.content:
IA Collaborative currently seeks an accomplished Industrial Design Director with industry experience within the medical device, home appliance and/or consumer electronic sectors. This individual will set the vision for the product design studio in partnership with the Engineering Director, lead project teams through the design strategy and implementation of assigned projects and will strategically advise and guide clients through various ID processes to create an commercialize compelling design solutions that push the boundaries of product design in the world.

As a Design Director, you will be expected to:
• Lead the design strategy and vision for external and IA Ventures projects.
• Create and drive innovative ideas from initiation to completion working across cross-functional teams.
• Determine and set appropriate action plans for new ID projects and oversee the execution of design research, product strategies, concept drawings, physical modeling, and presentations accordingly.
• Provide leadership to industrial design group by sharing expertise in sketching, storyboarding, loose/tight conceptualization, 3D modeling, simple clean rendering, & layouts.
• Become an influential member of the industrial design group by staying in touch with industry trends, technology, materials, and processes
• Work with teams of managers, designers, writers and researchers to understand project expectations, achieve the highest level of creative, achieve client objectives and ensure that deadlines are met. This also includes working with colleagues to conduct user research as needed for design ideation, participating in the synthesis process and developing key insights, and creative concepts.
• Collaborate with outside partners and vendors to communicate client needs and achieve desired results.
• Ensure continued growth of ID at IA by working with our new business team to identify new opportunities and provide ID leadership in pitches.
• Develop approaches or project plans to scope out potential new projects.
• Work with account management and resourcing team to ensure projects are correctly staffed.
• Be actively involved in recruiting world class designers to the ID team.
• Provide regular updates regarding ID activities to the leadership team at IA

jobs.title: Software Engineer J2EE
jobs.content:
Are you the software engineer that wants to participate actively in automating processes that make it possible to produce a word-wide well known car in large volumes and high quality? Do you want to work in an experienced and collegial team where you can improve your skills? Please read further and don’t forget to apply!


As software engineer at the information management department you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of the software that makes it possible to produce the well known car at our customer. You will work on several applications for production planning, logistics management and follow-up with the help of several logistic concepts, production controlling and documentation and analyse and report quality information.


You will be applying your professional knowledge in the design and modification of new and existing applications within the indicated technical frameworks. Next to that, development, modification and maintenance of software based on a design and functional requirements are part of your daily responsibilities. When the software is finished you will also be involved in the preparation and guidance when implementing the new and modified software.

jobs.title: Application Security Engineer
jobs.content: We require an experienced engineer who has a background in software development and understands secure application coding principles. You will be involved in projects ranging from working with teams on initial concepts for new projects and services through to checking source code and testing for vulnerabilities. You will be required to make recommendations on better coding or process flows to development teams. As part of the security team you will also be required to work on other projects from time to time.

jobs.title: Build Engineer for Games
jobs.content:
A build engineer at YAGER sits at the border of tools programming, IT and the development teams.


Our core job is maintaining and extending the build coverage to make sure we have shippable builds conforming to first party needs. In addition we help set up and maintain automated tests for code and content. We have a big online component in our game and are building ways to handle deployment in different environments and enabling debugging there as well.


Together with IT we are continuously looking into ways to improve deployment of SDKs or other mandatory software using configuration management.


On the tools side we help setting up workflows for local developer work, both via automation/tooling and researching what is possible on the new consoles.


Responsibilities



  • Ensure the game builds all assets and binaries for all platforms

  • Troubleshoot build problems

  • Extension and maintenance of automated build system

  • Continuous improvement of the automated build pipeline

jobs.title: Mjukvaruutvecklare till litet bolag med stor valfrihet
jobs.content:

  • Fokus på kundnöjdhet, inte antalet arbetade timmar.

The Senior Developer will join an existing team working on a technology refresh project, (.Net/Microsoft application stack to use Web API / Angular JS).  The role will develop specific enhancements to the existing services as well as troubleshoot a production environment and liaise closely with the Client.

jobs.title: Test Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
De functie
Wij zijn op zoek naar een Test Automation Engineer die beschikt over de kennis en kunde om software door te testen binnen een complex IT landschap.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer  Resale
jobs.content:
We’re looking for passionate and knowledgeable engineers to help us design, build and scale a new generation of products and services with the latest technology like ES6, React and Node. Working with a talented pool of engineers, architects and UX experts in a DevOps culture, you’ll help guide and deliver the engineering vision with a special appreciation for crafting exceptional user experiences. The future of accessing live events starts here. We provide our Software as a Service to clients to enable fans access to tickets across multiple platforms 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Our systems work at scale; handling tens of thousands of concurrent users, selling thousands of tickets for massive sporting, music, multi-show stadium, touring, festivals and thousands of smaller events globally. Every large event on-sale is a Black Friday for us. Working at this scale and keeping up with rapidly changing technology ensures that even the most innovative person will be consistently challenged and pushed to develop new solutions in a highly collaborative and diverse organisation.


Responsibilities 



  • Create clean, testable JavaScript for dynamic high performance websites.

  • Build cutting edge UI for multiple devices.

  • Drive standards in performance, scalability and reliability.

  • Share knowledge through workshops, documentation, code reviews and coaching.

  • Follow software development best practice.

jobs.title: DevOps/Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content: We're looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to help us build out the next phase of our infrastructure, supporting us on our journey from monolith to micro. Depop has a lot of interesting problems that need solving and we’re working really hard to build apps that can keep up with the high growth we’ve continually seen. Working at Depop is a hugely collaborative effort and it’s important to us that we work with people who are easy to get on with and take pride in doing a great job. At Depop you’d be a big part of helping us create a huge social marketplace that we can be proud of and hopefully have a lot of fun along the way.

jobs.title: Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you a Systems Engineer seeking a new exciting role within a fast paced organisation?  We’re looking for talented people to join our team at Ticketmaster in London.  You will be working with systems at scale on multiple platforms that have been built for coping with huge demand, handling thousands of concurrent users who are all contending for the best available inventory.   



We’re looking for Systems Engineer that is able to work alongside our sports engineering teams across a breadth of technology.  The products support some of the most recognised brands in the sports industry and the rapidly changing environment ensures that the most innovative person will be consistently challenged.

jobs.title: Software Developer, Android
jobs.content: We are looking for an Android developer with a passion for mobile communication apps. The ideal candidate will be a highly-motivated and proactive individual that combines a desire to learn with strong collaboration and excellent communication skills.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.content:
ATLASON/studio is looking for a super talented Senior Product Designer to join our Soho design team. A detail oriented person with a versatile skill-set.

About our studio
We are a boutique sized operation with a growing team of designers.
We design products and packaging and furniture.
We work on product innovation projects that require research and thinking.
We work with some great clients, big and small.
We are not a corporation with rigid policies nor do we have a human resources department.
We do believe in a results oriented atmosphere, a place where you like to be and feel ownership of the work you do.

For this senior position we require;
• degree in product design
• 5 years of relevant product design experience
• great SolidWorks skills
• graphic design and presentation skills
• curiosity and enthusiasm for creating visionary products
• experience with complete product development process from idea to production
• familiarity with a variety of materials and manufacturing processes
• able to lead projects and mentor junior designers
• positive & infectious attitude
• located in the tristate area

Should you fit this description and identify with our culture and the work we do, do send us an email with a portfolio PDF and resume.
For more about the studio; www.atlason.com.

jobs.title: Senior Testledare/Testarkitekt
jobs.content:
Vill du fortsätta att utvecklas som testledare och testarkitekt? Vill du göra det som konsult, bland trevliga och kompetenta kollegor? Då är du välkommen till oss på Kentor och till vårt testteam – Kentor Test & Quality Management. Vi söker personal både till vårt kontor i Göteborg och Stockholm.


Vi söker nu seniora testledare, som är vana att arbeta i komplexa sammanhang med många integrationer mot andra system och många leverantörer inblandade. Du är även van att arbeta som testarkitekt; skriva teststrategier, göra reviewer/genomlysningar och komma med rekommendationer. Om du dessutom har en vana och ett intresse av att arbeta som kravanalytiker är det ett plus.


Arbetsuppgifter Testledarrollen innebär att leda både funktionella och icke-funktionella tester, där du kommer att vara del av ett team, som varierar beroende på uppdragets karaktär och komplexitet. Du kommer arbeta med att driva och leda test- och kvalitetsarbete i våra projekt för våra kunder. Arbetsuppgifterna består av testledning, testprocessutredningar och införande av testverktyg.


Som testledare/testarkitekt kommer du även arbeta med proaktiva åtgärder, såsom t.ex. att tillhandahålla rekommendationer och teststrategier. I din roll måste du känna dig bekväm med att göra riskanalyser och arbeta nära kravspecialister och utvecklare i teamet, för att kunna planera och leda testuppdraget – som givetvis anpassas efter kund, uppdrag och projekt. Ibland kan rollen som testarkitekt också innebära att ta fram en teststrategi för hela IT-avdelningen, och ge rekommendationer kring hur organisationen jobbar med test, vilka verktyg som används, och vad som ska testas och inte.


Som konsult hos våra kunder är det viktigt att du är en ”doer” som ser till att saker och ting blir gjorda. Arbetet ställer krav på att du är flexibel, affärsmässig, samarbetsvillig och kan leda andra. Du har det där lilla extra som skiljer dig från mängden, och som gör dig till en utmärkt lagspelare i vårt team.

jobs.title: .NET-utvecklare med driv!
jobs.content:
Business Solutions är en framgångsrik affärsenhet inom Kentor, som arbetar med konsultverksamhet inom CRM, portaler och beslutsstöd. Vi kan erbjuda helhetslösningar inom CRM kombinerat med SharePoint, E-handel/webb och BI. Vi gillar att använda det bästa de senaste teknikerna kan erbjuda, samtidigt som vårt motto är att skapa verklig nytta för dem som i slutändan skall använda de system vi utvecklar. 


Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att utvecklas till specialist. Du får chansen att testa på det mesta en utvecklare kan önska sig, men du måste gilla omväxling. Vi gör allt ifrån lättare konfigurering till komplexa integrationer – webservices eller varför inte molnbaserade lösningar i Microsoft Azure. Du kommer att lära dig Microsoft Dynamics CRM, en produkt som är mycket efterfrågad och där kompetensen ständigt är en bristvara. Tidigare erfarenhet av MS Dynamics CRM är meriterande.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer - Customer Insights
jobs.content:
We are looking for an outstanding Software Development Engineer to build new personalized product recommendations and features. In this role, you will join Customer Insights, our personalization engineering team at our development centre in Edinburgh, Scotland. Our features appear to Amazon Customers in personalized and automated content throughout the Amazon websites in all worldwide retail marketplaces across web, mobile and devices (Fire tablet, TV and phone). You will deliver key consumer website features and algorithms in personalization, search and advertising and will lead to better selection and lower prices for customers.



You will work as part of an Agile team at our development centre in Edinburgh, Scotland, launching and growing new initiatives for Amazon's global websites. Your team will own the business, technology and operations, giving you the responsibility and authority to ensure success. You will be involved in every aspect of the process - from idea generation, business analysis and technical design through to software development across a variety of technologies. Your systems will meet remarkably high standards of performance and reliability, and will operate at massive scale, 24x7.



Our position offers exceptional opportunities for every candidate to grow their technical and non-technical skills. If you are selected, you have the opportunity to make a difference to our business ($100BN annual sales in 2015) by designing and building state of the art personalization systems, leveraging Amazon’s vast computing resources (AWS), working on exciting and challenging projects, and delivering meaningful results to customers world-wide (300MM in 2015).


  • Extensive experience delivering software in industry or in a research environment.

  • Computer Science Honours degree (2:1 or better) or postgraduate study. In lieu of degree, relevant skills and equivalent experience.

  • Demonstrated coding and problem solving skills in at least one modern programming language.

  • Strong computer science grounding in a broad range of algorithms and data-structures.

  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills.




  • Demonstrated best-practice software engineering including Agile methodologies, unit testing, refactoring, code reviews, build and deployment processes.

  • Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring other engineers.

  • Experience operating and maintaining production software.

  • Advanced coding skills (concurrency, profiling and performance optimisation).

  • Designed and built complex systems (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling).

  • Experience in web and user-interface development (JavaScript, HTML, CSS).

  • Experience in basic data manipulation and analysis, including command-line tools and scripting.


Personal qualities


  • Results oriented and analytical, with a strong customer and business focus.

  • Ability to communicate and discuss technical topics with both technical and business audiences.

  • Highly innovative, self-directed and able to deal well with ambiguous problems.

  • Strong sense of ownership, with a passion for software and continuous learning.




We offer a highly competitive salary, and other excellent benefits including healthcare. This is your opportunity to develop a rewarding career, work in a unique environment, and be part of a passionate and international team to work hard, have fun and make history!

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills.



All offers are conditional on references, verification of the right to work in the UK, and a successful background screening check. This check will include previous employment verification, qualification verification (if relevant) and a basic criminal check. Further details of this policy and procedure will be sent to you along with your conditional offer.

jobs.title: BACK-END WEBDEVELOPER
jobs.content:
The digital department is looking for a BACK-END WEBDEVELOPER (Fulltime, M/F)  to start immediately


As a back-end developer at G+J Media you'll be working on the digital portfolio for the brands: VOGUE, Glamour, JAN, National Geographic, Quest and Designer-Vintage.


You will work on a variety of existing web-presences, develop new ones and you must have the ability to work with, and maintain, other people's code.


You will work in a small (4 fte) development team together with front-end developers, product managers and designers. Your main responsibility is to maintain existing websites and extend our portfolio with new features.

jobs.title: Teknisk IT-Arkitekt med verksamhetsfokus till Kentor
jobs.content:
Som Teknisk IT arkitekt med verksamhetsfokus ska du ha ena foten i det tekniska (gärna med bakgrund som utvecklare) och den andra foten i det verksamhetsmässiga, dvs någon som förstår teknikens möjligheter för att stödja kundens affärer.

jobs.title: (Senior) Java Developer, Sofia, Bulgaria
jobs.content:
Become part of our global „Data & Technology“ network of Data Scientists & Software Engineers, and join our exciting journey to bring our strategic client-oriented data platforms to new levels.


We develop the future of Market Research in our Technology Centers in Germany, Netherlands, United States, Bulgaria, Malaysia, Israel, Belgium and Sweden and  apply the latest in software technology including the Hadoop Big Data stack, NoSQL, and various JS frameworks paired with massive data processing power from in-memory computing.


Our Software Engineers build our Data Lake where we bring together the best of internal and external data – and our Data Scientists dive in it: Numerous Awards are the result of our expertise in Predictive Modeling, Big Data Analysis, Preference Analysis, Segmentation and Targeting - just to name a few.


Join one of the most promising companies for Software Engineers and Data Scientists worldwide and leave your footprint!


Java Developer Key objective of the role: To further foster our ability to deliver global software development projects and expand our German software development team with new positions in Bulgaria. Main Responsibilities:



  • Deliver modular and tested code that follows design decisions of Architects (Software Developer);

  • Deliver artifacts that are economic for the GfK, i.e. cost effective solutions;

  • Be proactive and prepared when “the team” has to contribute to a meeting e.g. iteration review, team meetings, work on impediments etc.;

  • Support the (Lead) Architects and Project Manager, communicate project risks to PM;

  • Give status proactively and effectively, ask for help early and escalate topics when needed to PM, Lead technical/functional Architect;

  • Create TFS work items to corresponding iteration goals, update TFS work items daily, so that they have always accurate original estimate, remaining work, completed work and status;

  • Get active when unspecific, uneconomic, incomplete requirements/demands etc. or broken unit-tests, failed builds, bad code, etc. is recognized.

jobs.title: Frontend Software Engineer
jobs.content: Do you have an apt for creating great user experience? Are you an ardent web programmer and do you love being involved in both, product and development? Do you like being challenged and finding innovative solutions? We are looking for a frontend engineer to join our tech-team.

jobs.title: Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Join our Software Engineering team and help us to improve the speed and scalability of our application. In this role you will be given the freedom to experiment with new technologies in order to find ways of optimizing our PHP, Java and JavaScript code so it executes faster and consumes less resources.



Your responsibilities:



  • Make trivago faster by improving our logging stack and optimizing our code.

  • Scale our profiling and log analysis platform.

  • Integrate new log systems or migrate existing ones into the platform.

  • Improve automated performance measurements.

  • Research new approaches and build prototypes using Docker, SalSstack or equivalent to back up your ideas.

  • Work cross-functionally with other teams and departments to find out what impacts our site’s performance and work on solutions to these issues.

  • Share your knowledge with the team by documenting your tools, tests, changes, solutions, concepts and approaches.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Dentally, we're helping improve the oral health care of people by building cutting edge online tools for dentists. We're used by dental practices and patients all over the World.


We have an amazing engineering team that has built a product people love. We need an experienced engineer to help us bring out next ideas to life. We believe Dentally is a place to come and deliver career-defining achievements that actually make a difference.


What would I do at Dentally?


It's pretty simple. We have too many ideas. We have lots of features that we'd like to add to Dentally while continuing to provide great support to our fast growing customer base.


With a good experience of shipping high quality software, you'll be iterating quickly on features and services that dental practices depend upon. You'll be given autonomy and independence when writing your own code and will be expected to manage your own projects. That said, we work as a close knit team so you'll also be involved in other projects and will collaborate with the rest of the team to ship features.


Technology



  • The core Dentally product is a Ruby on Rails application with an Ember JS frontend. We use Postgres and Redis for most of our storage.

  • Our iOS app is built upon Apache Cordova and uses our public API.

  • We use C# and Objective C for our lightweight imaging connectors that run natively.

  • Our infrastructure runs entirely within Amazon Web Services and we have a continuous deployment service to keep things moving.

jobs.title: .NET Developer
jobs.content:
.NET Developer


Professional Services


Voor de locaties Eindhoven, Limburg & Randstad




Functiebeschrijving .NET Developer
Jij bent een developer die meedenkt met de klant. Je bouwt niet zomaar een oplossing, maar je denkt in meerwaarde voor de klant. Jouw kennis van usability en performance zorgen voor kwalitatieve en innovatieve oplossingen. Via de Daily Standups houd je elkaar op de hoogte over de voortgang.

Jij houdt van afwisseling en werkt graag aan meerdere applicaties voor, bij en met de klant. Je bent gewend om in complexe situaties overzicht te houden en weet systemen te koppelen voor een optimaal resultaat.

Cegeka is een toonaangevend ICT bedrijf dat kwalitatieve oplossingen biedt. Wij streven steeds naar een oplossing op maat, wij willen de ideale match voor de klant zijn om zijn doelstellingen te bereiken. Ook bij de uitbreiding van ons team zoeken wij naar deze match. Competenties en karakter zijn voor ons essentieel, naast ervaring en ambities. Cegeka investeert voortdurend in talent management zodat elke medewerker zijn potentieel kan realiseren.

jobs.title: JAVA Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Wat zeg je wanneer iemand vraagt wat je nu precies doet?
"Ik ben een van die geniale types bij Stater. Oftewel de lijm die alle data van Stater met elkaar verbindt."

De functie
Wat je echt doet:
Stater loopt al jaren voorop als het gaat om IT, digitaal ontsluiten en DevOps, Continuous Integration/ Delivery en digitaliseren van processen. Ons hypotheeksysteem is one of a kind en behandeld de hypotheken van miljoenen klanten. Als JAVA Software Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor de realisatie en implementatie van wijzigingen binnen het complexe, altijd veranderende, applicatielandschap dat dit unieke hypotheekproces ondersteunt. Je gaat doelgericht aan de slag binnen het unieke Stater IS-landschap specifiek binnen het Midoffice domein. Je houdt de balans tussen functionaliteit en kwaliteit, waarbij je inspeelt op de groeiende eisen op het gebied van beschikbaarheid en veiligheid. Waardoor je uiteindelijk de meest complexe zaken simpel maakt. Durf jij het aan?

jobs.title: Agile Scala Software Engineer
jobs.content:
eBay is hiring! We are looking for Scala Agile Software Engineers  to join our team in Berlin.


We are looking for developers who have an expert's depth and breadth of experience of building high availability, scalable web applications and services. You will be proficient in teaching and leading by example, and be comfortable mentoring both junior and senior developers.


Day to day, we write code in Java, Scala or Javascript, but as someone who is passionate about development, you'll be open to picking up new languages and frameworks when the situation arises.


We are continually striving for the highest quality, and work in small focussed teams following  bits of Scrum, Kanban, with a healthy dose of Extreme Programming.


You will work with people who care about well written, test-driven, clean code, delightful user experiences and all the lovely stuff that's involved with automatically tested, zero-touch deployed applications. The team works very closely, and like to pair program on pretty much everything.


Developers write their own tests, whilst learning from test engineers embedded in the team. EPD developers learn form each other. For example, our Java specialists learn from our Javascript experts, and vice-versa. Having a desire to expand and master something new means you're a good fit for us. 


Our developers decide on the right tool for the job, so you should be comfortable in doing the same. We have a lot of fun discussing the merits of different technology and want people who can lead these conversations. 


We hope you get the idea of what we're looking for. We're looking for great developers, with an opinion, and the capability to back it up.


We are an active part of the Berlin tech community. For more information: http://www.meetup.com/eBay-Europe-Technology

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Our developers have the freedom to take control of providing a beautiful experience for our customers. We love agile and work in small squads to ensure each squad has a focus and a mission. This way we ensure every squad member counts, has a voice, shares ideas and is involved from the moment they join. We deliver great products to our customers and make sure we remain digitally at the forefront of the market. Each squad is unique, some focus on front or back end development whilst others work across the full stack. We have a number of opportunities available across our squads for Senior Developers so if you want to find out more then why not start your adventure in awesomeness now?


We use test driven / continuous delivery practices to build RESTful JSON web services and web applications using Java. We make sure our systems can scale to meet the demands of a high-traffic website as we can peak as high as 70 million page views per day. We really care about how performance impacts our customers. We are looking for people with a deep interest in technology who are comfortable finding and adopting new technical approaches all the way from the browser to the database-it's a fast moving market so we have engaged and responsible self-organising teams.

jobs.title: Rigorous & Articulate Microsoft Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a skilled Microsoft developer to join our smart, seasoned team. Five years of rapid growth have taught us what it takes to succeed as a financial-technology vendor to the industry’s top tier, including hedge funds, investment banks, and asset managers. Building quality software for the planet’s most demanding users is not an easy job, and working through data-driven problem-solving requires stronger focus and drive than most line-of-business applications. We care about programming—its art as well as its science—and are looking for developers who master not only what they build but why and how, and who can articulate options and choices with ease and intelligence.


In exchange, Advise offers a true growth opportunity: we are a successful, revenue-driven ex-start-up, and developers are the company’s product life force; our team members work with remarkable autonomy and have lots of opportunity for direct, creative input into product decisions. Rigor and discipline are baked into our products and practices, and coupled with a commitment to the latest (primarily Microsoft) technologies and an aggressive growth strategy, there are great full-stack build-from-scratch opportunities, and full ownership of the results. Our international growth is real and rapid: incorporated in New York in 2010, now expanded to Dublin and London (2014), Amsterdam and Paris (2015). And in spite of the pressure (or because of it), we remain an informal, sometimes goofy bunch of nerds, from diverse backgrounds and cultures.

Each team has certified and highly skilled Magento developers who work for projects like Hunkemoller, Coltex, FNG, Score, Riviera Maison, Euroshoe. Within the teams we highly value education and gaining knowledge of new technologies and products. As a developer your work can differ from building new shops or adding functionality to existing ones, to providing support for deployed shops.


With the introduction of Magento 2 we are making sure all our developers have room to educate themselves. Since last year Kega is a 'Magento 2 Ready' trained partner by successfully meeting all demands set by Magento. 


https://magento.com/partners/portal/details/partner/id/154/

jobs.title: BackEnd Architect
jobs.content:
Do you enjoy working with big complex backend systems, bringing multiple distributed parts together to a well architected whole?  Do you like collaborating with talented colleagues, sparring and facilitating as you reach a logical conclusion?


At MovieStarPlanet we are developing a set of C# .Net Microservices exposed through the REST API, serving our suite of social games, enjoyed by millions of kids across the world.


The MicroServices are hosted in the AWS Cloud, and using a variety of storage solutions, such as MSSQL, DynamoDB, ElastiCache and S3, to cope with the huge amounts of data generated by our kids.


As a BackEnd Architect you will:



  • Lead a cross-team collaboration of developing our MicroServices framework

  • Influence procedures and patterns for refactoring our legacy C# using Agile Methodologies

  • Mentor Juniors and spar with experienced seniors with a variety of different backgrounds


Develop Highly Scalable MicroServices 


As BackEnd Architect you will play a leading role in our development of highly scalable MicroServices, such as our payment systems, a multi-million user messaging system, a multi-billion image sharing system, and many other areas. 


You will report to the Lead Programmer, and work closely with our CTO in developing an overall technical strategy and maintaining the vision for our BackEnd development. 


You will be a part of a cross-game technical team, bridging the gap between DevOps and feature development.  You will also collaborate closely with our 5 cross-disciplinary feature teams, facilitating their collaboration, mentoring and ensuring their solutions are in synch with the overall strategy.

jobs.title: Full stack .NET Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Title: Software Developer
Reporting to: Software Development Manager
Business unit: Traka, Olney (nr Milton Keynes)
Department: R&D Software
Term: Permanent


Job Description:


We are looking for a bright, motivated and passionate software developer to join our team.


You will maintain and extend our existing range of software solutions and products, and contribute your knowledge and experience to help shape our software solutions for the future.


You will be analytical, pragmatic and resourceful, and enthusiastic to get under the skin of what our products are, how they work and the benefits they provide for our customers.


Your main duties will include:



  • Learning and assisting with the development of our software platform written primarily in VB.NET and ASP.NET MVC, with some C#. (Please note: The majority of our codebase is VB.NET at present.)

  • Participate in the development and implementation of desktop and web based software. This part of the role will be especially interesting as you will be able to see the development of the software evolve and your input will significantly influence the way in which our software develops in the future.

  • Produce functional and technical documentation, and provide support for the development cycle that you have been involved with.

  • Provide high level product technical support where required. This may include liaison with suppliers, internal departments and end customers.

  • Participate in peer code reviews, stand-ups and retrospectives.


Any other duties required to assist in supporting the achievement of the Company objectives.


Note: Applicants must be located in the UK and your regular place of work will be at our Olney office. Therefore, this position is not applicable for remote workers.


Education/Qualifications:



  • Ideally qualified to degree level in Computer Science or an Engineering discipline.


Experience:


Essential



  • Experience in VB.NET including ASP.NET and MVC 4. (Individuals with relevant C# experience will also be considered for the position.)

  • Experience developing applications using Entity Framework and LINQ.

  • Competent in HTML/CSS and jQuery.

  • Experience developing WinForms desktop applications.

  • Experience consuming Web Services.

  • Experience with a Version Control System (such as Git).

  • Experience of distributed software architectures.

  • Experience developing and interfacing to application programming interfaces (APIs).

  • Experience with all Windows based operating Systems.

  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server.


Desirable



  • Agile software development methodology and working in a Scrum team.

  • Experience in C#.

  • WCF Web Services / Web API.

  • Desktop application development using WPF.

  • Test Driven Development.

  • Design Patterns.

  • Experience in Windows Embedded development using .NET CF.

  • MySQL or Oracle databases.

  • MCTS .NET certification.


Functional competencies:



  • Have the ability to work on an individual basis and as part of a team.

  • Great analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • To be proactive and driven.

  • Be able to work to strict deadlines.

  • Excellent documentation skills (including code commenting).

  • Adherence to coding standards.

  • Management of workload and issue lifecycle with tools such as JIRA.


Personal characteristics:



  • Excellent communication skills with colleagues, end customers and other partner company development teams.

  • The role requires the candidate to be self-motivated, enthusiastic, willing to learn, honest and trustworthy.

jobs.title: ecommerce frontend developer
jobs.content:
Want to apply your skills to the world's fastest growing Ecommerce platform? Work with a dynamic team of web professionals building global websites here in Adelaide. You'll enjoy rewarding work, add some attention-grabbing projects to your resume and develop highly-valued skills!

Our company is built on a culture of excellence and collaboration, based on sound development practices and active engagement with the extensive Magento community. Through an in-depth knowledge of software engineering principles and years of real-world experience with Magento, we are proud to put our stamp on websites for some of the world's best known brands.

We are looking for a software developer who cares and who thinks. Cares about quality and shared knowledge; thinks about code that is constantly improving and how to build the best site for our clients' needs now and into the future.

Many of our clients and collaborators are located remotely, so we depend on effective communication and thrive on teamwork.

Your work will focus on frontend development using the latest techniques including Javascript templating, SASS/SCSS (Compass) and advanced responsive design, and will interface with backend code developed by our engineering team. Elegant, reusable and maintainable interfaces will be the hallmark of your output.

jobs.title: Cloud Engineer - Azure IaaS, Identity, and Microsoft Infrastructure
jobs.content:
Job Description



The Cloud Systems Engineer is a senior level consulting engineer within the Datacenter Team. This post-sales position is customer-facing and consists of the delivery of business-transformation technology projects, as well as providing consulting services for next-generation projects and services. The Cloud Systems Engineer (CSE) is a responsible and trusted member of the customer’s technology team, relied upon to provide exceptional services and solutions that make a visible and valued contribution to customer goals. 


Agile IT works on the latest technologies (primarily Microsoft) and is a leader in deploying them in the market. Based on this, we understand that there might not be many applicants that have certain experiences. Once hired, you’ll be mentored and trained in one or more of the following technologies by our senior staff. 


Agile IT Cloud System Engineers deliver technical designs, implementations, and support services. These services will include projects within the following areas: 


Design, Deployment, Upgrade, and Decommission of Windows services  



  • Active Directory 

  • Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), 

  • Certificate Services 

  • DNS 

  • DHCP 

  • Direct Access 

  • Remote Desktop Services 


Microsoft Azure projects focused on Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), including: 



  • Design Azure deployments based on customer requirements, best practices, and following patterns and practices developed by Agile IT. 

  • Automating Azure tasks using PowerShell 

  • Moving or expanding Active Directory from on premise to Azure

  • Migration of workloads into Azure 


Certification in selected Microsoft Cloud services is required as well as experience. If you have not previously attained Microsoft Azure Certification, you must pass the exam within your first 90 days using self-study and on-the-job training.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer / Architect
jobs.content:
Greenfinch Technology has an opening for a senior software developer to join our senior team in order to help us to service our existing customers and projects and assist us in building upon our service and product offering into the future. 


This is a hands-on role for an intelligent software developer with deep experience of Java technologies. In addition to having the skills and experience listed here, successful candidates will be self-starting and care deeply about delivering great solutions. It is expected that the successful applicant will take on a team leadership role and will need to demonstrate soft-skills including managing clients and other software developers. This represents an opportunity to join a talented team in a fast-growing and successful Irish software company.


What we're offering:


In return for the hard work we offer:



  • Competitive salary

  • Flexible working arrangements

  • 20 days holidays + the 9 Irish public holidays

This is a full time permanent role in our office in Dublin - direct applicants only.


Greenfinch does not accept unsolicited CVs from 3rd party recruitment agencies without a written agreement in place for placements. Greenfinch is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs and no fee will be paid should the candidate be hired by Greenfinch.

jobs.title: Browser Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Summary:



Comcast is looking for a talented and dedicated software engineer to develop and maintain it's Xfinity X1 browser software. Comcast's X1 platform builds heavily on open source software and cloud infrastructure to deliver a best in class user experience for both video and broadband products.





Core Responsibilities:



The Browser Software Engineer will provide technical leadership and will actively contribute to the design, development, integration, test, documentation and support of browser-related technologies. This hands-on position requires broad engineering competence and in-depth technical knowledge of browser-related technologies as well as demonstrated experience successfully planning, organizing and executing software development projects in a dynamic environment.





Requirements:




  • Strong C++

  • Portable C++ Development

  • Linux

  • Sockets

  • Javascript

  • Strong Debugging and Root Cause Analysis Skills

  • Strong knowledge of W3C specifications and standards

  • Stong knowledge of IETF specifications and standards

  • Knowledge of Webkit or Chromium Internals (or other browser)

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field, Masters Degree a plus.





Experience in the following areas would also be advantageous:




  • Performance Optimization and Tuning

  • OpenSSL

  • DirectFB

  • Video (Gstreamer)

  • Using OpenGL for 2D graphics

  • Qt Framework

  • Audio Mixing





Job Specification:




  • Bachelors Degree or Equivalent concentration in Computer Science, Engineering

  • Generally requires 11+ years related experience






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Eng 2, Network Eng
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.






Summary:



Responsible for implementing and troubleshooting CPE issues in all regions of the Commercial Services network on the Test & Turn Up team. Resolves all first contact issues and escalations in an organized and timely fashion and escalates issues exceeding scope of expertise in a timely manner, as needed. Troubleshoots and provides resolutions according to established practices and procedures. Provides project management and status updates. Contributes on cross-functional teams, as required. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities.





Core Responsibilities:




  • Demonstrates proficiency in all service types and equipment types.

  • Tests and turns up new circuits in a production commercial services environment, according to Comcast practices. May recommend new practices and procedures, as necessary.

  • Interfaces with commercial customers in regards to commercial product offerings. Troubleshoots issues, providing resolutions according to established practices and procedures.

  • Coordinates and resolves service issues with providers and vendors to ensure accurate and timely implementation of new trunk groups and augments to existing trunk groups.

  • Coordinates and implements new features, technologies, upgrades, and patches in the production environment with respect to circuit design, turn up, and test.

  • Escalates issues in a timely fashion. Provides all relevant information, accurately entering information into database.

  • Opens and updates service tickets in database/tracking system.

  • Directs efforts so as to maintain service Mean Time to Repair (MTTR) within regional or contractual standards.

  • Provides expertise and guidance to junior team members.

  • Provides technical training to junior team members.

  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

  • Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

  • Work with internal and external customers in a courteous and professional manner.

  • Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.





Education Level: Bachelors Degree or Equivalent





Certifications: CE-A required. CE-P CCNA or JNCIA preferred.





Year's Experience: Generally requires 2-5 years related experience






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Alternate Content
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Job Description





Do you love to write code? Are you passionate about software craftsmanship? Would you like to work on projects with tangible impact?





As a software engineer in the Alternate Content Engineering team you will join a small team of experienced software engineers who are passionate about technology. The alternate content platform is a cloud-based product serving thousands of transactions per second per node. You will work closely with a cross functional team to design, implement and maintain quality software.





At VIPER Alternate Content Engineering you will help shape the next generation of cloud-based, video delivery pipeline that provides live streams, full linear lineups, on-demand video and cloud DVR services.





Who do software engineers work with?



Software engineers collaborate with industry experts from many disciplines: software architects, quality assurance engineers, network engineers, big data scientists, player developers, content security specialists, and various streaming video technologists. They also engage with technical operators, and product owners on a daily basis. We're a small team, delivering software solutions at the leading edge of streaming video technology.





What are some interesting problems you'll be working on?



Comcast manages an enormous library of on-demand videos and vast array of national and regional channels. The Alternate Content platform provides video source switching and dynamic ad insertion for an growing percentage of these video assets. The system must make near real-time decisions, based on predefined parameters, provide complete audits, and sustain prime-time peaks. We are focused on performance, traceability, stability and scalability.





Where can you make an impact?



Your code will process the video content that is distributed to tens of millions of devices, all day, everyday. The systems you design and build will enable first-to-market product features, for example cloud DVR. You can help influence leading edge streaming video technology standards with real world lessons learned by being a first implementer. Replace expensive vendor provided solutions with better, more stable, more scalable, more operable platforms, and see that your individual contributions will have multi-million dollar impacts to the bottom line.





Responsibilities




  • Design new software applications, support applications under development, and customize existing applications. Develop software update process for existing applications. Assist in the rollout of software releases.

  • Collaborate with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.




  • Diagnose performance issues and propose and implement code improvements

  • Prove scalability with load generating tools

  • Ensure the software architecture is lean and extensible

  • Ensure software modules are reliable for reuse

  • Work with Quality Assurance Engineers to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements.





Here are some of the specific technologies we use for Alternate Content:




  • Java

  • Javascript, Ember.js, Handlebars, CSS

  • Scala

  • Golang

  • Apache Camel

  • MongoDB

  • Zookeeper

  • Apache Kafka

  • Hadoop, Spark

  • Git

  • Puppet, Foreman





Skills & Requirements:




  • BS in Computer Science and 5+ years equivalent experience

  • Experience building and maintaining production software using any programming language; e.g. Java, C/C++, Ruby, Python, Javascript, Golang, Scala.

  • Knowledge of Object Oriented Design, Design Patterns, and Algorithms.

  • Experience developing software for Networking, Web services, HTTP, and TCP/IP

  • Experience with Zookeeper, MongoDB, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, Scala is a plus.

  • Good communicator; able to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies

  • Great design and problem solving skills, with a strong bias for architecting at scale

  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership

  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment





About Comcast VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research)



VIPER(Video IP Engineering & Research), is a startup division within Comcast's Technology and Product Division and spun out from IP Video and online projects originated within Comcast Interactive Media is based in downtown Denver, CO. We are a cloud-based, IP video infrastructure that's been built to deliver a broad mix of on-demand video, live TV streams and an assortment of other digital media to an array of connected devices in the home.






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Video Compression Engineer Develop the future of 3D video
jobs.content:
Come and Join the Intel freeD Group, a dynamic and creative group with a start-up atmosphere within Intel, developing the future of video technology.
"freeD" stands for Free Dimensional Video, and is an entirely new concept for capturing, processing and rendering video that allows users to interact with real, live video. Our content is captured in the largest sport and entertainment venues in the world -Super Bowl, Soccer, NBA, etc.


About Your Team:


Within FreeD, this team develops the future 3D video standard to facilitate image data flow from game fields to everyone's mobile or home screen.
The team is responsible for finding new and fascinating ways to compress, stream and simplify the rendering tasks of our three dimensional video on the client side.


Your Challenge:


As a Video Compression Engineer you will process, analyze, manipulate and compress 3D models, images and H.264 / HEVC video.

jobs.title: Vice President of SaaSOps - $200k
jobs.content:
Vice President of SaaSOps - $200k


If you are a world-class software as a service leader with the intellectual curiosity and desire to execute to drastically differentiated cutting edge operating processes; if you have a passion for metrics-driven approach to productivity management; if you possess senior organizational leadership, combined with the deep technical experience necessary to manage SaaS operations for a portfolio of software companies generating $100M annually this role is for you.

Company Description

Aurea Software is a fast growing enterprise software company that delivers transformative customer experience through a variety of world class software products. The Aurea leadership team manages product management SaaS operations and engineering delivery for a collection of affiliated solutions, as such, a VP of SaaSOps will have the opportunity to lead a true multi-product, multi-domain, multi-team organization.

Aurea is a company with a long-term view on delivering customer success at a high level of efficiency and profitability. Aurea is a company with a strategy to grow both through expansion of its core business and through acquisition of additional software companies. Today we serve companies such as Disney, British Airways, PayPal, and Bank of America, helping them transform their customers experiences.


Aurea is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in todays global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Job Description

The Vice President of SaaSOps will be responsible for building out a globally dispersed SaaSOps team and ultra efficient application hosting infrastructure. You will not be starting from scratch - as a result of Aureas aggressive acquisition strategy, a set of inherited SaaSOps activities already exist. Priority one will be to standardize, stabilize, and optimize these activities all while continuing to meet tight, daily SLAs. Priority two will focus on long-term planning to drive continual improvement.


Key responsibilities

Responsibilities of the role will include:

  • Manages all of Aureas customer-facing and internally focused SaaSOps environments and service delivery activities

  • Develops metrics to enable effective measurement of key performance indicators

  • Develops and manages quarterly SaaSOps budget

  • Develops long-range staffing and resource planning for organic and inorganic growth

  • Develops, maintains and executes a clear integration playbook for SaaSOps inherited from future acquisitions

  • Establish world-class standards and technical operations to deliver consistent, high-quality products across dispersed, global teams

  • Implement engineering management strategies to achieve world-class productivity and cost efficiency

jobs.title: Tech Lead
jobs.content:
Australia’s premier women’s media network is on the lookout for a talented Tech Lead to join the team.


The Tech Lead will be responsible for the systems, processes, troubleshooting and functionality of software products for the Mamamia business.


We are looking for an energetic and service focused individual who has a creative approach to problem solving. You will have experience managing  high performing teams and excellent communication skills.


If you have experience in a similar role and want to be  part of  a vibrant and dynamic organisation, we want to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We have 3 full time developers and have completed the MVP. We gained 60 enterprise customers in the last 3 quarters with no marketing. We are already operational cash flow positive and need 1 more team member that can help us accelerate and scale even more quickly.


Equity is generous, and we will reward those who contribute above and beyond.


Friends and family angel funding only - don't expect to need a series A to reach our goals.


1. Python, Django, Docker, ELK, Amazon Web Services (lots of AWS)
2. Mobile App development – if you want to get into it
3. You will also be involved in a “Security Analyst” job – perhaps about 5-7 hours a week. Primarily being on calls when every other timezone is asleep. Of course we will make sure you get trained.
4. Incredible amount of agility – absolutely required. There is no technology marriage – we use whatever is good for the task at hand. We tend to be python oriented, but that’s only inertia.
5. You are always able to change something if you don’t like it – but don’t get to complain. If you don’t like something fix it
6. Customer conversations – whenever you want. You don’t have to hide in a cubicle. Preference is working in the Plano office (121/Tollway), but remote is OK for the right candidate.
7. Absolute mandated requirement: Self motivation and the ability to keep up with the pace.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Overview


We're looking for someone. Someone to help build our digital health platform (for insurers).


We just raised funding and need another pair of hands. With 1/3 of the population becoming obese, 3bn self-tracking devices on the planet, and new possibilities in AI, we see a huge untapped opportunity to use real world behavioral data to help people stay and become healthy. To do this we've build a mobile coaching platform that draws on mobile data (location, movement, comms), wearable data (like Basis, Jawbones and Fitbits), and that uses AI to hold coaching conversations with our users.


That's where you come in. We need you and your brilliant mind. You'll be many things to us: the go to guy for platform improvements, the trusted builder of great features, a fifth/sixth member of the team, programming guru that builds working stuff and ideally a teller of dry but humorous jokes. 


And if all goes to plan you'll help us build a beautiful, intelligent tool that nearly everyone on the planet likes to use.


You won't be doing this alone. And you'll be compensated for helping our company grow, with money, and the pleasure of working with a cool startup on a great project.


  
The Role:



  • Creating technology that helps 1000's of people stay or become healthy

  • Key developer for the backend of our health platform

  • Working as one of the core team members for a startup in health-tech

  • Full-time based in our Leederville office, Perth

  • Market rate salaries ($70.000 – $120.000)

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Core Systems - SolidFire
jobs.content:
Does developing high performance, highly available, fault-tolerant software sound like a fun challenge? Would you be even more interested if that same software is running concurrently on 20-100+ nodes that flawlessly pool their resources, all while maintaining data integrity even when the network, rack, node, hardware, device, file system, kernel or other software components fail? If challenges like these are exciting for you, read on....


NetApp is looking for a Software Engineer (Core Systems) to join our new SolidFire team. SolidFire’s product is a rapidly growing enterprise class data storage company currently in production with an all SSD solution, specifically designed for large scale, public and private cloud deployments. SolidFire is delivering high availability, high performance, fault tolerant software that runs concurrently on up to 100 nodes. We flawlessly pool resources and can maintain data integrity even when the network, rack, node, hardware, device, file system, kernel or other software components fail. This is a great opportunity to work on a high powered team delivering an industry changing product within an extremely high growth sector of the tech industry.

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test - SolidFire
jobs.content:
NetApp | SolidFire is a market leader in all-flash data storage systems for the next generation data center. Born out of the largest cloud infrastructures in the world and purpose built around the problem of delivering high performance applications from a multi-tenant infrastructure, we have revolutionized the way forward-thinking companies acquire and deploy storage solutions. NetApp | SolidFire counts some of the world’s largest enterprises and cloud service providers amongst its current customers, and the pace of growth will accelerate as we become a part of NetApp in an acquisition anticipated to close in the first quarter of 2016.


NetApp | SolidFire is looking for an experienced Software Engineer in Test who is passionate about testing and testability and uses that knowledge to develop innovative automated testing solutions for our state­ of­ the ­art storage solution. This is a high ­visibility role that will impact the fundamental performance of our new cloud storage product. More specific responsibilities include:



  • Drive test effort from planning and organization to execution and delivery.

  • Participate in developing effective test strategies.

  • Design and develop reliable, scalable and maintainable test automation to validate complex storage features

  • Communicate and collaborate with the engineering teams to develop automation processes and plans

  • Diagnose, debug and perform root­ cause analysis of issues and defects

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Infrastructure team is a small but critical part of our organization, responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining Greenhouse’s platform. We craft the environment that enables our product engineers to focus on shipping new features, each of which brings us closer to the goal of delivering the best recruiting software possible.

We’re working on some interesting problems, and we’re searching for a Senior DevOps Engineer who’ll help keep our site performant and secure by building scalable and fault-tolerant cloud infrastructure. You’d design and implement features that support our in-house development platform, using technologies like Consul, Docker, Mesos, and Marathon.

In the coming year, you'd help us build out continuous integration and deployment for our applications, support for global scalability and disaster recovery and automated, end-to-end tests on our infrastructure. If you’re looking for a dynamic environment and excited by what we’re looking to do, this may be the job for you.

What you have:

  • A deep understanding of Linux systems
  • Solid programming skills
  • An aim to design and build large, distributed systems
  • A dedication to solve problems and deliver solutions

What tools you’ll learn and use:

  • AWS
  • Ansible
  • Consul
  • Docker
  • Mesos and Marathon
  • Ruby and Ruby on Rails
  • Ubuntu Linux

Pay, Perks & Such

At Greenhouse, we take care of our employees and it shows. Greenhouse was proudly named among Crain's New York Business 2015 Best Places to Work in NYC, we were also named as a Best Places to Work by the San Francisco Business Times in 2016! We provide competitive salaries, stock options and a full slate of benefits including health coverage, an FSA, a 401K plan and pre-tax commuter benefits. We invest in our people to ensure that they have everything needed to excel on the job. We pride ourselves on a collaborative culture, including company get-togethers like our monthly CEO "Ask Me Anything" and All Hands meetings. We are a distributed company with offices in New York and San Francisco. Check us out on Glassdoor where we have outstanding reviews by current employees and interviewees alike!

Our philosophy is to empower ourselves and each other to do the best work of our careers. Come join us!

jobs.title: Engineering Manager (Discovery Team)
jobs.content:
Summary

The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for an experienced and hands-on Engineering Manager to help build features that enable our communities to achieve our Vision: a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.

Engineering Managers at Wikipedia support engineers and designers who build features, products and services used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. This is an opportunity to ‘do good’ while having a high level of impact at a large-scale media property.

You will join the Discovery Department, where we build the infrastructure for search and discovery of Wikipedia content. You’ll be supporting teams that work on exciting open source technologies, such as ElasticSearch, OpenStreetMaps, and Wikidata Query Service. These teams are working on ambitious projects that are transforming the way users find and interact with Wikipedia.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. We also welcome remote and international applicants across all timezones.

As an Engineering Manager, we’d like you to do these things:

  • Organize teams to be effective in meeting their goals
  • Develop goals and track progress publicly and collaboratively
  • Represent team members within the organization and publicly
  • Coordinate with other teams and departments
  • Support your team’s members to develop their individual career paths
  • Recruit and hire new team members

We’d like you to have these skills:

  • BS in Computer Science or other relevant technical field or the equivalent in work experience
  • 3+ years’ leadership experience in the internet industry
  • 1+ years’ experience managing a software engineering team
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
  • Passion for content discovery on the Web

And it would be even more awesome if you have this:

  • 3+ years of experience working in an agile software development environment
  • Experience managing a geographically distributed software engineering team
  • Experience with search technologies
  • Experience with open source software development

About the Wikimedia Foundation

The Wikimedia Foundation is the non-profit organization that operates Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia. Wikipedia and the other projects operated by the Wikimedia Foundation receives hundreds of millions of visitors per month, making them the 5th most popular web property worldwide. Available in more than 287 languages, Wikipedia contains more than 32 million articles contributed by a global volunteer community of more than 100,000 people. Based in San Francisco, California, the Wikimedia Foundation is an audited, 501(c)(3) charity that is funded primarily through donations and grants. The Wikimedia Foundation was created in 2003 to manage the operation of Wikipedia and its sister projects. It currently employs over 240 staff members. Wikimedia is supported by local chapter organizations in 40 countries or regions.

Benefits & Perks

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, massages, cooking classes and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax

  • Great colleagues - international staff speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

  • for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location

More Information

https://wikimediafoundation.org

https://blog.wikimedia.org

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
Rackspace is looking for an experienced and talented Python developer to join a highly motivated and empowered development team using Python, Flask, AngularJS, Ansible, MongoDB and other modern application technologies and platforms to deliver software that empowers Fanatical Support. Our team builds, maintains and troubleshoots software aligned with enabling the various operating mechanisms of the technical operations teams at Rackspace, helping to scale our business and enable leaders and front-line Rackers alike to deliver outstanding customer outcomes.



Specifically, this role will require somebody experienced with systems integration, programmatic interfaces (APIs), and operations automation platforms (Ansible).



In a typical day, you will:



* Design and develop software for large-scale enterprise services.


* Translate functional requirements into conceptual and detailed designs; providing estimates for development effort; implementing proof of concept, prototypes and production-grade software.


* Creating unit and acceptance tests; coordinating sign-off from QA/Test; automating deployment; and assisting Operations and Support staff in trouble-shooting software issues, as well as, implementing bug fixes.


* Depending on the assignment and level of responsibility, expertise, or working knowledge in multiple programming languages, technologies, and software platforms.


* Adhere to established coding and process best practices.


* Make regular contribution to engineering standards and best practices.


* Develop own technical leadership skill by providing mentorship to others.


* Initiate ideas and acts upon ideas that result in indirect benefits.


* Display the ability to develop, adopt, and share quality improvement strategy.


* Initiate opportunity for collaborating outside of his/her team.


* Maintain a collaborative working relationship with others by seeking, using and giving feedback.


* Design robust, scalable, secure, and globalized feature. Demonstrates sound rationale in making design trade-offs for various feature areas.


* Identifiy risks and mitigation for various feature areas.


* Effectively manags dependencies for various feature areas. Drives continuous adoption and integration of relevant new technologies into design.


* Efficiently implement feature area with minimal technical debt. Feature areas are easy to deploy and maintainable.


* Proactively drive refactoring and code-reuse. Feature areas are bug free. Includes unit tests for feature areas to achieve established code coverage targets. Feature areas are test-driven designed, enabling efficient regression testing.


* Make regular contribution to test automation.


* Evolve feature area(s) with new ideas to realize greater benefits or to solve newly anticipated problems. Focuses on multiple feature areas or components.


* Consistently contribute to key functionalities for our product and service offering.
