jobs.title: Research Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Position


As a software development engineer you will be responsible for designing, building, delivering, and maintaining tools that will allow our researchers to be more efficient in their research allowing them to make research discoveries faster. You will also be working closely with our research scientists to help deploy their work in a production environment and develop prototypes and demos to showcase their work.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Work closely with research scientists to deploy their research into a production environment

  • Assist researchers in troubleshooting issues that arise when translating research work into a production environment

  • Develop tools to automate common research scientist tasks

  • Create prototypes that showcase the capabilities of Maluuba's deep learning research

jobs.title: Senior Frontend developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.


Responsibilities



  • Develop new user-facing features

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs

  • Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders

jobs.title: Infrastructure Security Engineer
jobs.content:
INFRASTRUCTURE SECURITY ENGINEER


As an Infrastructure Security Engineer at Fastly you will help ensure we provide a secure edge for the biggest online platforms in the world, handling massive amounts of traffic at very low latency.


We are looking for versatile engineers at all levels of seniority who enjoy being deeply involved in all aspects of building and securing our platform. Qualified candidates will excel at analyzing components of our infrastructure, and will show an aptitude for discovering complex security issues. We encourage our security engineers to present at network and security conferences and participate in the open source community.


This is a role with a high impact, friendly security team. In addition to contributing to industry leading security products and services, you’ll make sure our customers benefit from a service built to the highest security standards in the industry. We’re in beautiful downtown San Francisco, but for the right candidate, we’re open to considering a remote position, and we have the team and tools in place to make it work.

jobs.title: Software Developer for Hulu's Customer Retention Team
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


Software engineers on the customer retention team build software for our customer service representatives. Our main focus is the suite of applications that make up our customer management system and the Hulu help site (http://www.hulu.com/help). Our home-grown Simpsons-themed customer management system allows representatives to troubleshoot and resolve any issues ranging from billing to video play back. Representatives use our tools to create/modify customer facing articles on our help site. As a member of this team you will be responsible for full-stack development of these tools.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Develop state-of-the-art web applications using the latest web technologies

  • Write, test and release robust and scalable production ready code

  • Integrate third party application into our application suite

  • Troubleshoot production issues

jobs.title: Streaming Engineer
jobs.content:
STREAMING ENGINEER


We’re looking for talented software engineers with experience in streaming media to join our team. We’re building exciting products to deliver our clients’ video to their customers on any number of devices in a variety of formats.


We use a variety of technologies to power Fastly.  We have systems written in Ruby, Python, Perl, and Go, comprising a mix of RESTful servers, controllers, and utilities which manage our fleet as well as backend services to manage things like video processing, security, and customer site acceleration.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer for the Wine Industry
jobs.content:
What you’ll do:


We’re looking for an experienced developer to take ownership of our existing web application and APIs, and help drive future development of new products and features to deliver greater value to our clients and support them as they make the world’s finest wines. You’ll be joining a small but efficient IT team, and will play a large role in developing our product roadmap and planning future development.


You’ll be responsible for maintaining and monitoring our existing Rails web app, and undertaking continuous improvement including enhancements, optimization, and platform updates. This will include communicating and collaborating with the product manager and our customers to troubleshoot bugs and operational issues. You will also need to optimize and manage our existing APIs, refactoring if necessary, and create new APIs to support future development and 3rd-party integrations.


As our main Rails developer, you’ll need to rely on your experience and expertise to be self-sufficient and work independently a majority of the time, while also collaborating heavily with our .NET developer and lab staff to understand and integrate legacy systems and extend the functionality of the current app. You’ll also work as part of a project team with outside development partners when tackling new applications and major releases.


Who we are:


We partner with the world’s greatest winemakers to provide them with innovative analytical tools of the highest quality and an unmatched expertise to support the art of winemaking. ETS Laboratories is the worldwide leader in providing independent, ISO-accredited analytical services to the wine industry. 


We’re an established, profitable company with real users – since we opened in 1978, ETS Laboratories has grown to five locations across the West coast with a staff whose knowledge covers a broad range of expertise. We recruit globally, and boast a diverse, highly trained team with a broad range of experience and advanced degrees.

jobs.title: Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
Magpul Marketing Manager Job Description-
The Marketing Manager for Magpul Industries will be responsible to the Director of Product Management and Marketing for the planning, execution and performance of marketing, advertising, branding, social media, and promotional activities. The Marketing Manager will work with key leaders to cultivate and execute the creative vision for the brand in accordance with Magpul brand strategies and creative guidance from higher, and will be responsible for providing analysis and planning of print, web, trade show, and other advertising and media efforts. With guidance and direction from senior Marketing and Company Leadership, this position will lead the efforts of the Branding and Marketing team to develop and execute communication materials, video, photography, etc. for the Magpul family of companies (Magpul and Magpul Core) while staying loyal to the Magpul brand image.

Responsibilities include:
• Identify and execute Marketing goals and strategies with Sales/Marketing team to meet branding, advertising, publicity and culture goals for the Magpul family of brands
• Shape project goals/requirements and ensure they meet overall brand strategy
• Provide direction and management of execution for a wide variety of communications projects that achieve program and company objectives
• Cultivate and execute campaigns that work across media (print, web, environmental, etc)
• Identify, prioritize, and purchase advertising coverage; manage submission deadlines
• Work with Product Management to produce materials for the execution of product marketing plans
• Manage Trade Show presence and appropriate personnel
• Define and develop internal marketing team processes/procedures and organizational tools
• Guide social media efforts for Magpul brands in accordance with branding strategies and leadership priorities
• Direct, conduct, and present market research on customers, overall market conditions, competitor activity, and other indicators to assist product, sales, and marketing efforts.
• Manage large project execution, including service provider management, as required.
• Other duties as assigned.
• Must be able to travel up to 20% of the time; both international and domestic.

Requirements
• Marketing degree and experience managing complex marketing activities, or other degree and equivalent experience
• Minimum 3 years of experience leading a marketing team.
• Ability to lead and manage a diverse, cross functional team to perform at their best
• Experience with managing Print and Web advertising production and strategies
• Experience with Market data compilation and analysis
• Experience with retail merchandising desired
• Familiarity and experience with event planning and/or trade show activities management
• Familiarity with advanced social media functions and strategy
• Understanding of photo and video production
• Knowledge of the firearms and firearms accessories and/or outdoor industries desired, work experience within the industry not required
• Ability to manage and meet deadlines
• Ability to work in a fast-paced, self-starter environment
• Ability to assimilate, understand, and convey the Magpul brand image

Additional
• Competitive pay commensurate with experience.
• Benefits include medical, dental, vision, life and long-term disability insurance as well as voluntary short-term disability and accident insurance. Additionally we offer a 401(k) Plan.

Must be eligible to work in the United States for any employer.
The applicant must be authorized to receive Technical Data and/or Technology under U.S. export control laws. Any offer made is contingent on the applicant passing a background check that will include a restricted party screening and, for prospective employees who are Foreign Persons, on the Company obtaining all necessary export licenses. In addition, the applicant will be required to pass a criminal background check and drug screening.

Magpul is an equal opportunity employer.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer at a growing SaaS company
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Vancouver, Canada and San Francisco, CA
URL: https://angel.co/retailzipline/jobs/142646-senior-javascript-frontend-engineer

Are you a front-end developer that likes tackling diverse problems and believes that the end user's experience is worth the extra effort? If so, read on..

“Terrific founders with technical and domain expertise, totally focused on customer success. Their progress in the first year is amazing.” - One of our investors

Retailers use archaic, old systems that don't work (think fax machines and voicemails). We're replacing the core operational processes with a modern platform that our customers love. Help us transform a $4.4 trillion industry and improve the way millions of people work. Major retailers are already using Zipline every day, but there is much more to do!

“I think I just shed a tear. This is great!” – One of our Fortune 100 customers

You will start out being responsible for the user interface of our core application. But, you aren't limited to one area of the product. There are a million other things that go into making a full-featured, modern SaaS app. The role will grow and change along with our customer's needs and your interests. Plenty of room to learn, grow, and make an impact.

Our front-end stack is Slim, React.js, SCSS (Bootstrap + Atomic). Solid understanding of browser performance/quirks, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a must, and previous experience with Ruby on Rails is preferred so that we can move quickly. We don't have any immediate plans to build an SPA, but we're always open to better ways to get the job done. You will be central to those conversations and influence the direction that we take.

You will help define our culture through hiring decisions, process design, and your personality. You don't need to have experience with management. But, a desire to help your co-workers grow makes a world of difference.

Ideally, you are:
- able to distill complex problems into simple, elegant solutions 
- in a senior or leadership position on a large website 
- a developer who cares about the people who use your product 
- a good writer and can back up your opinions
- an even better listener; always looking to expand your knowledge 
- driven to get things done and willing to put in the work 
- experienced with working remotely or managing a remote team 
- interested in the journey of growing a company

We are a 100% remote company, which means that you can work from home, the beach, or really wherever as long as you're connected and responsive. We meet regularly for lunches or drinks in Vancouver, and there are off-sites twice a year (next one is in Costa Rica) as a team to get to know each other.

If this sounds like a job that you would love and be great at, send us an email and:
- include a summary of your experience with samples we can look at
- tell us two things you would fix about this job posting
- tell us why you would be great at this job

Looking forward to meeting you!

To apply: careers+fedwwr@retailzipline.com

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
Is .NET your thing?


Working in a Java shop?


Front-end developer looking to write more code?


Open-source advocate?


Weekend hacker?


TRICAST is looking for a highly motivated senior level developer to join our team. Compensation is very competitive.


If your experience aligns with our technology stack, you’ll be successful out of the gate.


But don’t give up yet!


If you’re passionate, driven, outgoing, intelligent, confident, pragmatic, curious and just love creating product with code, you’ll be successful over the long haul. If you’re the type of person we’re looking for, we have no doubt you can learn our stack.


Need specifics?


We…



  • Seek T-Shaped developers, capable and willing to work in multiple disciplines (Development, QA, Design, Analyst, Ops).

  • Develop and deliver software using Scrum with certified Scrum Masters, Product Owners and Scrum Developers on staff.

  • Use Microsoft’s .NET platform as the primary base for our software platforms, but do not shy away from using the best tool for the job when .NET won’t cut it.

  • Offer the opportunity to become a world-class developer for the Microsoft® Azure™ platform.

  • Are rapidly growing and looking to fill multiple developer roles on our team in the next six months.

  • Recently closed a first round of investment and are using that money to enhance our development team through hiring and training.

  • Have begun the process of capturing an enormous market with a first-of-its-kind, highly disruptive SaaS application.


You…



  • Advocate strongly for unit/integration/regression testing because you care deeply about software quality.

  • Enjoy the process of understanding business problems and creating software requirements.

  • Have developed on Azure™ or Amazon Web Services, are familiar with architectures suited for cloud deployment and grimace when the term “cloud” is overused.

  • Understand agile principles, but realize “Agile” is an adjective and “Agility” is what’s important.

  • Can spend a day banging out code, but loves face to face interaction with your team and product stakeholders.

  • Are intelligent and confident enough to pick up any programming language thrown at you.

  • Value making decisions using empirical data, not gut instinct.

  • Believe in collaboration across all areas of a business.

  • Understand that to become a “Unicorn Developer” you need to work at a company that values and encourages the development of a broad spectrum of skills.


Visit our website at http://www.tricast.com/. See what we’re up to.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
LiveSafe is looking for a meticulous DevOps engineer to join our team. The LiveSafe platform is a robust 24/7/365 cloud-based system and we are searching for someone to join our team with strong experience supporting deployment of production SaaS platforms. You will create cloud formation templates to build AWS services that support our custom Scala/Akka and legacy PHP applications. You’ll need to cover the whole stack from APIs to data stores, from local dev rigs up to the deployment of the app to production (we actually have a great start in place).


In this role, you'll work collaboratively with software engineering to deploy and operate our systems. Help automate and streamline our operations and processes. Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations, and troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, test, and production environments.

jobs.title: Web Designer, Brandfuse
Full Stack Mobile Engineer
jobs.content:
Flurry Live is looking for full-stack mobile developers with experience in iOS as well as back-end development. Our iOS client code is Swift and our back-end is in Go. Our servers are deployed on AWS. We would be happy to consider engineering candidates who may not have experience with these specific languages/tools but are excited to learn new things.


For our low-latency video stack, we use a combination of Web-RTC and commercially available streaming media servers. Because of our recent growth, one of our main challenges right now is to scale our video infrastructure to be able to handle thousands of live viewers while maintaining low latency. The latter is key to the success of the product, due to the interactive nature of the app and the ability to talk face-to-face on camera.

jobs.title: Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content: Sendence is a small but fast growing company, backed with revenue. We're building a real-time message-processing platform to operate at low latency, with resiliency and consistency. We use the best tools to analyze and react to our data. We're looking to scale our current platform to over a million messages per second. We believe in open source and strive to build on these technologies and contribute back to the projects we use. Our team is 15 people but we are looking to grow to close to 20 by the end of the year. We have a lot of green field problems and the chance for each new team member to make a lasting impact on our technology and culture. We're passionate about the team we work with and the tools we use to realize our vision. Sendence is looking for an Infrastructure Engineer to join our team. Our culture values smart people with good ideas and high energy. The most important qualifications for us are that you’re driven to solve problems, learn concepts and skills quickly, believe in creating maintainable systems, and enjoy collaborating. In this role, you will be responsible for bringing your love of automation and infrastructure to bear on a very important part of our project. We need a solid, flexible, easy to operate infrastructure that allows us to easily spin up development and testing environments while easily recording results. Responsibilities include setting up continuous integration and delivery services, working with other engineers to provide tooling that makes their jobs easier, setting up reproduce-able testing environments and more. Additionally, you'll lead the charge for getting our software repeatably set up in client environments. Depending on your qualifications and preferences, this role can over time also grow into helping build out our production support and operations team. We are willing to consider candidate who have a love for all things “devops” but lack work experience.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Why Vacasa?


Here at Vacasa, we help travelers experience unforgettable vacations. When you grow as quickly as we have been, every day is an exciting one. We embrace opportunities, and have a tendency to hand out responsibilities to our employees to see how they can stretch and challenge themselves. This is a place to grow as an individual, and to be part of our collective growth as a company and a team...and so far, it's been an unbelievably rewarding journey together.


We’re searching for new employees who can contribute to our most important asset, our culture. Vacasa has eight core values that clearly define what our culture is. We’re looking for those people who both understand the need for these core values and are willing to embrace and embody them.


What You’ll Do:


At Vacasa our primary goal is to provide a premium vacation rental experience for both guests and property owners. We are here for the guests that want a safe home and experience they can trust. We're here for the people that don't want to manage their own properties.


Currently we have 2,500 properties, over 1,000 employees across 14 states, 4 countries and growing. We were recently listed on Inc. Magazine's top 10 fastest growing private companies and our recent 35 million dollars in funding is going to go towards accelerating that expansion because we're already cash positive. We're looking to double the size of our department in the next year and we'll be moving into a our new office in the pearl in June.


Our company culture has streaks of outdoor adventure and volunteerism. We frequently participate in thing such as the Pole Peddle Paddle in Bend and blood drives.


Don’t Forget the Perks!



  • Health/Dental/Vision Insurances

  • 401k Retirement Savings Plan with up to a 4% company match

  • Paid Time Off

  • Paid holidays

  • Employee discounts

  • All of the equipment you’ll need to be successful

  • Smart Phone

jobs.title: Senior .Net Developer
jobs.content:
Our Technology team is looking for a Senior.Net Developer with passion for learning. You will help millions of Canadians find their dream jobs and maybe yours is right here! You will see a modern scalable web application leveraging microservices, RESTful and messaging architecture, and polyglot persistence in action. You will be part of an Agile team where we plan, develop, test and deploy in quick iterations.


Here’s what you’ll get to do:



  • Develop in depth technical understanding of new applications and complex technology frameworks

  • Participate in the design, implementation and ongoing evolution of our Product and Technology roadmaps

  • Leverage engineering best practices including continuous integration, deployment automation, test automation, TDD, code review, and pair programming

  • Work as part of an Agile team to define and implement user stories leading to deployable software at the end of every cycle

  • Develop code with an appreciation for performance, scalability, security, analytics, and SEO

  • Work collaboratively in a team that is focused more on communication rather than the documentation of heavy requirements and processes

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Sorenson Media is looking for a DevOps Engineer to work with our development teams to build system monitoring tools, automating deployments, and programmatically handling our cloud infrastructure. Sorenson Media is growing rapidly and our DevOps engineers will be a key role in that growth, and will ensure that our platform operates proficiently and that our developers can continue building great software.


Great opportunities and a great team of people!  If you’re good at what you do and want to be a leader in a field that everyone is talking about, then come join Sorenson Media!


Benefits Offered to Full Time Employees:



  • Traditional PPO medical insurance, and a high deductible Health Saving Plan

  • Dental, Life and Disability Insurance

  • 15 vacation days annually

  • 12 recognized company holidays

  • Stock options

  • 401K company match up to 5% of salary

  • Fitness stipend

  • Flexible work schedule

  • Catered meals and full Break room with free drinks, treats, & food

  • Opportunity to develop and learn new skills


Duties:


Help drive SaltStack development standards and procedures.


Develop automation scripts for consistency and supportability across multiple environments.


Ensure DevOPS and engineering teams are trained on developing, contributing, and executing consistent configuration management tools, and practices.


Administer the following tools: BitBucket, Confluence Atlassian / Jira; HipChat; Icinga; Salt. 


Plan, and execute timely Linux system upgrades and software patches.


Employ best practices to ensure high availability of systems that operate a global advertising platform. 


Work across Operations and Engineering teams to identify and recommend continuous improvements.


Develop and maintain documentation and troubleshooting playbooks detailing usage, standards, and procedures.


Strong understanding of deployment requirements across DEV, QA, Beta, and Production environments.

jobs.title: Backend Developer
jobs.content:
Be a part of SNT Media’s growing team. We’re building a team of developers, data scientists and writers to produce smart written content using natural-language generation across a variety of verticals, including finance, sports and real estate. We’re auto-generating dynamic, personalized digital magazines and other products in partnership with some of the largest publishing companies in the United States, so you’ll contribute to products read by millions.


As a Backend Developer, you’ll integrate multiple data sources and databases into a unified system that will power our interactive products.


This is a full-time, on-site position based at our office in Wichita, Kan. You must be authorized to work in the United States.


Responsibilities:



  • Write, test, maintain and document reusable code in PHP using Lumen/Laravel and MySQL.

  • Develop enterprise-quality, horizontally scalable code using best practices, quickly and according to spec.

  • Develop APIs, outputting JSON or XML for use by frontend interfaces.

  • Participate fully in code reviews and work with internal designers, developers and QA to ensure quality code.

  • Collaborate daily with other backend developers, frontend developers, writers and our data team across the full software development lifecycle.

jobs.title: Senior Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are a fast-growing, cloud-based, SaaS model company, exploding in a multi-billion dollar market. We are looking for you – a brilliant, creative, and entrepreneurial developer to join our fun, energetic and unorthodox team. You’ll help drive the development process and build a unique, world-class product that combines high tech, with high touch, to redefine modern marketing. This is a rare opportunity to come in at the ground floor with an experienced, dynamic team and lead them to build and grow this revolutionary product. You must be independently driven as you will work from home and set your own hours. We are not a 9-5 company and this is a true lifestyle job for the right person.



Role / Mission
As the Senior Lead Developer for RapidFunnel, you will provide direction and guidance in the process of developing a world class enterprise level software product, by supporting a dedicated development team and maintaining high quality contributions and engagement. Reporting to the CTO, the role would involve guiding the process of writing modular and maintainable code thus ensuring that the software product is built with excellent quality, is fully documented and rigorously tested. Additionally, you will contribute to creating a world class user experience by creating alignment between the user experience, company business needs and proposed technological solutions.



Vision
We launched in August of 2015, are private equity backed and currently self funding. With over 20,000 active users and several enterprise level customers lined up, we will grow/scale as fast as the quality of our development team will allow.. Ten percent of our stock is set aside for incentives and to develop the culture of a winning organization. This opportunity allows for the satisfaction of helping companies succeed coupled with the potential to create significant personal wealth as you grow with the company.



Outcomes
Implement and maintain agile development and release cycle
Full code quality tools compliance (code sniffer, etc.)
Setup and oversee Continuous Integration for the project
Raise and maintain unit test coverage to over 80%
Decouple REST API from application dashboard (web interface)
Improve and maintain mobile app performance and responsiveness
Convert existing code into modules and maintain modularity of the platform


General
Detail oriented
Organized
Good communication skills
Clear writing and documentation skills
MUST be local, and reside in Denver, Colorado



“Cultural” (in alignment with company culture)
Open, honest and curious
Loves to learn - committed to personal growth
Proactive self-starter, entrepreneurial spirit
Thick-skinned - able to handle blunt feedback
Can work with people of different cultures and backgrounds (offshore developers)



Ensure Alignment and Communicate
Able to take direction from different sources and consolidate that information
Asks questions to clarify intent
Can work well with management team (COO, Development Architect and CTO)

jobs.title: Reporting Engineer Needed to Help Us Run Social Ads for Major Media Companies!
jobs.content:
SocialFlow is seeking a reports developer to support our advertising services department’s reporting needs. In this position you will be creating and prioritizing development of client facing reports and internal control panels as well as regular ad hoc reports.


Day to day this position will:



  • Support internal ads team on reporting and usage of interactive reporting tools.

  • Develop ad hoc reports to support ads team and SocialFlow clients

  • Develop reporting solutions to deliver social media ad campaign metrics.

  • Work with ads team to prioritize reporting development


SocialFlow currently provides unique social media advertising solutions for Twitter, Facebook, and Pinterest.



SocialFlow is a great place to work and we take pride that we are building and providing advertising solutions for many of the most prominent and demanding media companies in the world.



Salary commensurate with experience.

jobs.title: UX Designer
jobs.content:
Altus Analytics, makers of ARGUS software, has a reputation for developing innovative software products in the commercial real estate (CRE) industry. We are the global standard and have set the bar high as we lead the industry and continue to grow at an incredible rate. To stay at the top, we continuously evolve our technology products and put client success at the top of our priority list. To that end, we are seeking a UX Designer for our ARGUS Enterprise Platform.


We need a UX Designer who is passionate about delivering both an intuitive and engaging user experience as well as great design. Someone who can work with Business Analysts to take functional requirements and translate them into intuitive user-centric interfaces.


We want a UX designer with a love for usability design and responsive layout. Someone guided by forward-thinking principles and best practices. A UX designer who is equally excited to work on new features and existing ones. Someone who wants to actively contribute to the long-term success of our solutions and our company.


If you want to create rapid responsive interfaces that are engaging and visually appealing, while enriching your own career and increasing your exposure, this is the UX Designer opportunity to consider.


Here’s what you will do:



  • You will apply your extensive experience designing UX for on-premise enterprise and SaaS applications to design intuitive interfaces, logical task workflows and responsive layouts.

  • You will create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.

  • You will present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders.

  • Collaborate: You will work with a team of Business Analysts to prepare an optimized design for the implementation of functional enhancements.

  • You will participate in brainstorming and planning meetings for new features and upgrades to existing features.

  • You will review and research use-cases, best practices and proven standards to inform your designs.

jobs.title: User Interface
jobs.content:
Our Engineering Teams:
At Dealer.com, we offer the chance to do your best work and lead the digital revolution of the auto industry with gusto. Our Engineering professionals are energetic influencers who have built a world-class software platform, for auto dealers, from the ground up. Collaboration is woven into the fabric of everything we do; from 24-hour Hackathons to sprint reviews and scrum teams, you'll be immersed in an environment that nurtures individualism, creative problem-solving, and intellect.


The Job:
As a User Interface (UI) Developer you will work in a collaborative team environment that encourages you to perform at your best, and challenges you to engineer elegant solutions for complex business problems. You will work with senior developers and technical leads to design and develop highly usable web based user interfaces.

You will be an accomplished, well-rounded user interface developer, with a mastery use of best practices, design patterns, and frameworks and a thorough understanding of the implication of software designs and implementation choices on application usability, performance and maintainability.


The UI Developer will join our Website Platform located in Burlington, VT. This team is responsible for executing on the vision for the Dealer.com Website Platform, which includes Seamless Websites,  My Cars™, and Digital Retailing.  The Website Platform team focuses on the technology platform that supports over 15,000 individual websites. Our Website Platform team is highly dynamic and creates new solutions to change the way people buy, sell, and own cars.


Your Role:



  • Write readable, maintainable, and efficient code

  • Participate in the design and development of new industry-leading products, with proven advanced technologies

  • Enhance the performance and reliability of our current web-based applications

  • Collaborate with developer team members on best practices, code reviews, internal tools and process improvements

  • Passion for unobtrusive JavaScript and standards compliant HTML5 and CSS3

  • Knowledge of UI Concepts including application development using MVC architecture

  • Proficiency in subject matter must be developed. Context and understanding is everything for a developer

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
Who we are


At Jibestream, we have a platform that helps our customers improve people’s Experience of Place. We do this by enabling them to provide people with the most up-to-date and relevant information based on where they are and where they are going. Today, it’s all about the mobile device, being location-aware, and killer business rules that keep us the best at what we do.


We have graduated from a fast growing start up to playing in the big leagues with rapid global expansion. The pipeline is strong and is comprised of Tier 1 companies looking to deploy across entire networks; the product is the best in the market.


Now all we need to win is to continue growing our A team. Traction and product can be developed – finding amazing people is the single hardest part of building a success story. We take our culture and our people very seriously.


What's our tech stack?


Our application runs on cloud hosted Restful Webservices leveraging the latest distributed architecture technologies. Our deployment tools include Jenkins and HockeyApp. We develop our mobile applications and mobile SDKs using Objective C for iOS and Java for Android. Our mobile SDKs are used by our partners and customers to embed our mapping engine into applications built in both Objective C and Swift.  Other technologies we work with include Javascript for Web SDK.


What problem are we trying to solve with this role?


We have an amazing opportunity to enhance to the user’s mobile experience of our wayfinding solutions. We want our mobile wayfinding software to look and feel like our favourite games. Now we just need someone who can do that! We need to find the best mobile developer in the market who shares our vision and super-high standards to join our team.


What we’re looking for


Technology is at the core of all our products, and the right candidate will share our enthusiasm. We are cutting edge, and it reflects in our product. We’re looking for a passionate Android Developer who can work in a tightly knit Agile team environment. We only work with the best and brightest. You’ll be joining a multi-disciplinary team, working closely with other software engineers, product managers, project managers and graphic designers, or, as we like to call them, Tech’s Mightiest Heroes. We need a Android Developer who is:


Tech savvy: We need someone who lives and breathes Mobile technology.  Someone who can push past the front end of the application and get right to the guts of how it works. As the virtual owner of Jibestream’s mobile development, you will be all, know all, share all, and get it all done.  This is your world and you will build it.


Insightful: We need someone with insights into what the user’s mobile experience should look and feel like.  Someone who understands the expectations of next generation app users; and how to blend that with easy-to-use functionality for the rest of the population.


Awesome: We need someone who gets it, who believes in it, and who enjoys sharing the love, or just the plan. Our team is super smart and resourceful, if you frame up the problem properly, together you will strategize and solve it.


And here’s what you are looking for, you want to:



  • Be amazed: As our Android Developer you will get to see the things you have built be deployed and change the way people interact with our space. You will continue to be wowed by how quickly we adopt new technologies and just how fun and cool indoor mapping is.

  • Be committed. This is the long-term career opportunity you have been seeking.  A chance to take your gaming skills, both as a developer and as a player, and use them for good. And to make money.

  • Be challenged.  You will have the chance of a lifetime to push Mobile to its very limits.  

  • Be passionate.  You love what you do and you will love who you are doing it with.  Creating quality solutions for exciting clients, with a group of amazing developers. Our team truly wants our tech solutions to be the best in the world.  That’s how hard we work.

  • Be something of a wish-granter. Whether it’s a new functionality or an upgrade, you will continuously explore ways to improve current and future releases of our products.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Ruby)
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Boston
URL: www.taxjar.com

TaxJar's looking for the next Ruby developer to join our company and contribute right away. We all work from home, spread across the US from coast-to-coast. Here's why one ecommerce vet joined the team not too long ago.

You'll contribute from your first week in multiple projects from our public sales tax API to our sales tax reporting and filing web application that supports more than 5,000 paying customers.

We work with Ruby on Rails, Postgres, Heroku, AWS and Redis on a daily basis. You will be involved from day one in supporting and scaling multiple Rails apps, private gems, open source plugins, hundreds of gigabytes of data across multiple databases and a 24/7 API to monitor and scale.

Our small team gives you the opportunity to work with everyone in the company. Our entire company spends time working in the customer success inbox, even the CEO. There's plenty of opportunity to learn from others as well as share your ideas and experiences in making TaxJar and the SmartCalcs API better.

This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the US. Salary is heavily influenced by experience.

Requirements
  • Experienced with: Rails 4, Postgres, Heroku, AWS, Git, CSS, Javascript, Sidekiq
  • Ability to write clear and accurate tests using RSpec/Capybara
  • Write code that is maintainable and readable by your team
  • Be accountable for the code you deliver to production
  • Manage development tasks from assignment through to production
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Passion for building simple and intuitive solutions for complex problems in ecommerce
  • Prior SaaS development, API development or similar app dev experience
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc).

You Could Be a JarHead If You're....
  • A pro at communicating
  • Well-experienced working remotely
  • Accountable
  • Never tired of learning
  • A team player. (We adhere to the No Jerk Code. Too much work to be done to deal with egos.)
  • Hungry to play an impactful role

Benefits
All of our employees get the following benefits:
  • Competitive salary
  • Above market-level equity
  • Work from anywhere (obviously)
  • Health, dental, vision, short-and-long-term disability plans
  • Flexible vacation policy (actually, there is no policy)
  • Company retreats around the country 2x year
  • Perks including Spotify, Netflix, Kindle, and Fitbit

To apply: Tell us about yourself and why you're the next 'Jarehead here: https://taxjar.workable.com/jobs/226091/candidates/new

jobs.content: Du kommer jobba som konsult primärt ute hos kund, direkt i deras team. Du vet vad det handlar om och du kan leverera kod från dag 1. Vi är ett bolag som levererar de bästa konsulter till några av de bästa varumärkena i Sverige.

jobs.title: Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
The position


We are looking to hire intermediate to senior level Drupal developers. You need to have Drupal experience, but compatibility with team culture and attitude towards learning and improvement come paramount to incoming expert knowledge. At Savas Labs we provide peer support and work collectively to achieve our individual and company goals. You will work with a team primarily located in Durham, NC, though we are growing remotely. Remote and on-site positions are available. You will often interface directly with our clients. The position will require proficiency in most aspects of Drupal development. You will also have a voice in the kind of work you find most rewarding, and we will do what we can to meet your preferences.


Working at Savas Labs


At Savas Labs, we prioritize a few things. We like people who are enjoyable to work with. We like to learn from and teach one another, and often the result is others learn as well either via blog posts, conference prezzies or social media. We dedicate time each week for self-improvement, socializing, and collaboration. We encourage a flexible work schedule so long as we are upholding our commitments to one another and our clients. We value openness; you are encouraged to be vocal about not knowing something, and fix it. We are very honest, yet very respectful; this is not a cut-throat environment. We take a lot of pride in the quality of our work. We value a work/life balance that keeps us productive and happy. We like to have fun and we takeour values seriously. We use emoji a lot . You absolutely don’t have to , since we greatly embrace diversity!

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
At NexJ Health, we are really passionate about the technology we build – and the positive impact it makes on the everyday lives of our end users. We are looking for outstanding new grads to join one of our agile teams as a full-time Software Developer with a focus on application development.  Successful candidates will be passionate about technology, software development and have relevant coop or work experience.  They will enjoy working in an agile scrum team: rapidly changing priorities, collaborative work, and on-the-spot problem solving.    


Our Tech, Our Stack


Our application runs on Node.js with MongoDB as the database. The application is built using a JavaScript platform leveraging AJAX, HTML5 and CSS technologies. Our build system leverages Jenkins and we use provisioning automation tools like Vagrant. 


As a Software Developer on the Product Development Team you will:



  • Own the full lifecycle of development including support of released product.

  • Be involved in designing, building, implementing, and working with NexJ Health’s cutting edge framework.

  • Contribute to the design and specification of the UI architecture and UI implementation patterns.

  • Develop reusable components and usability standards.

  • Ensure high quality, compelling and usable customer facing interfaces.

  • Innovate and research new approaches and technology to be implemented into the product.

jobs.title: Native Mobile or JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Come build mobile and hardware apps for some of the biggest companies in the world. Detroit Labs is hiring software developers to write beautiful, reliable, maintainable apps for client projects. Our integrated team approach means you'll work directly with other developers, designers, quality engineers, and project managers on a project team to self-organize, solve problems, and ship software. Because mobile technology changes often you'll be able to learn and adapt to new technologies and discoveries, and incorporate them into ongoing work. Experience with agile methodologies and incorporating them in a client services team environment very helpful. Note: if you don't already have experience building iOS or Android apps, that doesn't disqualify you. We look for individuals that can contribute to real projects after a month of study and training; if you have software development skills and the will to learn, you can be wildly successful.


Detroit Labs is a relatively flat, low-overhead environment. Individuals that enjoy self-organizing teams, people over process, a high degree of independence and self-management, and a minimum of micromanagement and hierarchy will thrive. 



All roles are full-time with lots of benefits, normal ones like medical, dental, 401k match, and vision, and special ones like personal growth and development expense budgets, monthly team outings, and team bikes to explore the city. 




At Detroit Labs, we create amazing things and have fun doing it. Our Detroit Labs Services and OnSite teams are growing fast, and we want your help. Whether you work for Detroit Labs Services at HQ in Detroit or are representing us at a client site, you are important to us. We truly value being free of kings, building diverse and great projects, working with the best, and continuous learning. If this excites you, let's talk. To learn more check out www.detroitlabs.com.




HOW WE HIRE

Step 1: Getting to Know You (GTKY) - a questionnaire we ask everyone to fill out that will let the team learn more about you. We'll share the GTKY with the team and collect feedback. This is what we use instead of a resume, and what the apply link will take you to. It's a little long, but at least we aren't asking for a resume purpose statement.


Step 2: If there is a desire to move forward, we'll ask you to come down for a 1st interview to meet some of us, chat, and get to know each other.


Step 3: If there is a desire to move forward, we'll do a final interview which is focused on practical and technical skills.


Talk to you soon.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The position of Senior Software Engineer entails software architecture, implementation, development of best operational practices, and the testing and documentation of non-trivial systems with massive scalability requirements. We are seeking Full Stack developers who have experience with Java or Ruby on Rails and popular client frameworks such as Angular.js and React.js.  As a boutique consultancy, we are looking for motivated individuals who do not require step-by-step directions and can work cohesively with our team.


Successful applicants will have a proven track record with non-trivial enterprise Java or Ruby on Rails projects, are comfortable with agile development methodologies, have a solid grounding in OO software architecture / design patterns, and understand the enterprise technology stack from front to back. Most importantly, candidates must have a passion for programming. Our interviews are rigorous, so only serious developers with the requisite skills need apply.  Please note:  We are unable to offer visa sponsorship.

jobs.content: Angie's List is hiring a Senior Visual Designer - User Experience in Indianapolis, IN

jobs.title: The Best DevOps Engineer Ever
jobs.content:
You have entered into the competition to demonstrate yourself as "The Best DevOps Engineer Ever"!  Join us, and claim your lofty title!


Parkour Method, Inc. is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer to oversee our global backend infrastructure.  We remotely configure, send and collect location data constantly, to all of our location SDK deployments across the globe; and we need to guarantee constant uptime of all critical services in AWS.  We are preparing to scale by more than an order of magnitude, and we need an experienced DevOps engineer to help get there.  If you are passionate about building, configuring, maintaining and monitoring high-availability and distributed systems, adding more ‘9’s to the end of an uptime / durability metric, and watching lots of solid green lights on a dashboard, then you might be the right fit!


You will be helping implement high availability, secure infrastructures using AWS.  Everything will be automated and repeatable end-to-end.  You hate when a process involves a combination of shell scripts that only work on one machine, and rely on human intervention.  Consequently, you build continuous deployment architectures that maximize uptime and maintainability.  You love getting a constant stream of requirements that need to be supported by many interrelated systems, and managing their deployment, and building solutions that repair themselves, so you can spend your day worry-free on Reddit.  Just kidding: you will find that there is a lot of challenging work to be done as we scale and process tens, to hundreds-of-millions of users' data. And you will love watching your baby grow!

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
SoftSource Consulting is looking for talented and experienced Senior Java Software Engineers in Portland, Oregon.


We’re looking for candidates who…


…have at least five years of real-world Java full-stack experience.


…have built client-side web applications using the latest JavaScript and CSS frameworks.


…have built server-side web applications and REST services.


…have worked with relational and NoSQL databases.


…are able to commute and work on-site at client engagements within the Portland, Oregon metropolitan area.


We don’t just hire engineers who have excellent technical skills, they also have excellent consulting skills.  These soft skills are critical to the success of our consulting engagements, and represent clear differentiators between our “Consultants”, and other firms’ “contractors”. 


Communicating effectively with clients and colleagues - SoftSource Consultants have excellent written and verbal communication skills, which leads to successful consulting engagements.


Contributing positively to an architecture discussion - Our clients see us a technical experts and depend on us for sound architectural and technical advice.  SoftSource Consultants know how to present and defend their architectural proposals, and when it’s appropriate to do so.


Identifying pragmatic solutions to business problems - Our clients expect straightforward and timely solutions to their business problems.  SoftSource Consultants design and deliver simple, understandable, and maintainable solutions.


Having ownership and independence – SoftSource Consultants take ownership of their engagements, and never worry about being micromanaged by headquarters. Our engineers are entrusted with our reputation and are the key to our success.


Focusing on the details - SoftSource Consultants not only deliver great software design, but can back it up by producing really high-quality code.


Embracing new technologies and opportunities - SoftSource Consultants like the idea of working on a health care website in the first part of the year, a multi-platform computer game in summer and fall, and then starting on complex scheduling algorithms when winter is setting in.

jobs.title: Associate - Corporate Development (M&A)
jobs.content:
The Priceline Group, a fast growing, highly profitable global online travel company is looking to hire an Associate to join its Corporate Development group.   

The individual will be an integral part of a small team that identifies, evaluates and executes acquisitions and venture investments for The Priceline Group on a global basis.  The Corporate Development group is very active and has been responsible for the acquisitions that now provide over 90% of the company’s operating income. Noted transactions in prior years include: OpenTable, KAYAK, TravelJigsaw (now rentalcars.com), Agoda.com, Active Hotels and Booking.com. 

The Priceline Group Inc. (NASDAQ: PCLN) is a $60+ billion market cap, S&P 100 company that operates in over 200 countries. It has grown its employee base from less than 700 in the first quarter of 2007, to over 16,000 today.  It was ranked as one of the top 20 most innovative companies in the world by Forbes.



Primary Responsibilities:

  • Developing detailed financial and valuation models
  • Coordinating and conducting business due diligence
  • Performing industry research and strategic analyses
  • Preparing presentations for senior management and the board of directors
  • Updating industry and valuation databases
  • Ad-hoc analyses for senior management


Qualifications:
  • Deep understanding of finance and accounting 
  • Strong financial modeling and valuation skills
  • Track record of defining and executing key analyses with minimal supervision
  • Ability to see the “Big Picture”; Understand, at a marco level, the key drivers and risks of a business and/or industry
  • Experience communicating complex information to senior leaders
  • Experience creating power point presentations for senior executives
  • Demonstrated experience working in a team environment
  • Willingness to travel both domestically and internationally
  • High level of energy and maturity
  • Fluent in multiple languages a plus


Required Experience: 
  • 2+ years of experience in investment banking, private equity, or corporate M&A
  • Bachelors degree from a top-tier university
  • MBA or Masters a plus, but not required

jobs.title: Platform Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Company Description

Verizon Digital Media Services brings together world-class technology to prepare, deliver and display content — so users can watch and enjoy on their terms. The purpose of our platform is simple. It delivers next-generation digital experiences for today’s demanding users, whether it be their favorite TV shows, catching up with friends via social media or shopping for the latest gadgets. Built on top of one of the world’s largest networks, our platform easily handles your users’ appetite for instant, secure and always-on media, anytime, anywhere.

Job Description

Verizon Digital Media Services (VDMS) is looking for highly talented and technical engineer to help us build the next generation of software powering the internet. This is an excellent opportunity to join a world class technical team, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies.


Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is what you get when you treat operations as if it’s a software problem. The purpose of this role is to watch over the availability, latency, performance, and reliability of the software and systems behind EdgeCast Networks.


This is an unusual job, unlike others in the industry. Like traditional operations groups, we keep important, revenue-critical systems up and running despite hurricanes, bandwidth outages, and configuration problems. Unlike traditional operations groups, we also have full access to and authority to fix, extend, and scale the code to keep it working and harden it against all the vagaries of the Internet. We hire people from both systems and software backgrounds. Strong candidates will have experience with both.


In SRE, we flip between the fine-grained detail of disk driver I/O scheduling to the big picture of continental-level service capacity, across a range of systems and a user population measured in billions. We own those products in production. We drive reliability and performance across massive scale by mastering the full depth of the stack. We literally do learn something new every day - usually surprising things - that have the potential to transform the lives of billions of our users around the world.


As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will work on large-scale system design and troubleshooting, and be fluent in systems programming and/or automation. You will have a desire to tackle the complex problems of scale. Familiarity with running production environments at scale is crucial in this job along with an in-depth understanding of Unix systems internals, and networking.

The SRE is always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.


Responsibilities

  • Design, write and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and reliability of Edge services.

  • Solve problems relating to mission critical services and build automation to prevent problem recurrence; with the goal of automating response to all non-exceptional service conditions.

  • Influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale distributed systems.

  • Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning.

  • Conduct periodic on call duties.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.

  • M.S. +2 years or B.S. +4 years of professional experience in a similar role or function

  • Experience in one or more of: C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Go, or scripting experience in Shell and Perl.

  • Experience working with Unix/Linux systems from kernel to shell; including experience working with system libraries, file systems, and client-server protocols.

  • Networking: knowledge of network protocols e.g. TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, etc., MAC addresses, IP packets, DNS, OSI layers, and load balancing.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.

  • In-depth knowledge of operating systems (processes, threads, concurrency issues, locks, mutexes, semaphores, monitors and how they work).

  • Familiarity with algorithms, data structures and complexity analysis.

  • Systematic problem solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.

Additional Information

EEO/AA Women, Minorities, Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities Employer: AOL offers a competitive salary and benefits package, including 401(k) match and performance bonus. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or other protected category.

During the hiring process you'll have the opportunity to find out everything there is to know about the role, the company, meet with your manager and team and see how your ideas could contribute to our success.

Aol is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Aol employees are rewarded competitively and are entitled to a wide range of benefits that encourage a positive lifestyle. Our recruitment team will always welcome any conversations about flexible working requirements.

We do not accept resumes from recruitment agencies that have not signed a formal agreement with us.

jobs.title: Sr. Technical Product Manager
jobs.content:
eBay Classifieds Group is an innovative leader in online classifieds, with 12 brands that offer services in more than 1,000 cities around the world. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities - whether it’s a job, an apartment, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Our central product and tech organization services all our markets by providing key capabilities & services which are demonstrated by all of our sites. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our environment.



What you can expect from us:




  • A harmonious, informal, international and playful work environment

  • Work with cool modern technologies, processes and consumer facing products

  • Access to tools and resources to do your job (best-in-class laptop, Safari Online subscription, conferences and meet-ups, all the coffee and soda you can drink, and much more)

  • Ability to join multiple internal interest groups in eBay in trending topics like data science, mobile development, customer experience and others

  • Continuous Deployment of product changes to get rapid feedback about your work



You will have the ultimate mandate of driving the strategy and delivery for a suite of shared services that power the broader eBay ECG platforms. Your role is a highly visible role with a global impact. We expect you to have an extensive career (8 years) in product and technology. To be successful, you have an excellent track record of crafting product strategy and shown experience in turning to execution. To thrive in this role, you will need drive, energy and positive mindset to motivate others. Also, you are passionate about building great products, has impact every single day, is a strategic operator, and wants to take a leading role. This is a big challenge where you will work on high-profile products to improve customer experience.



What we expect from you:




  • 8-10 years’ experience in a global organization, ideally e-Commerce or classifieds

  • Has excelled in both product and technology with deep understanding disciplines

  • Applies a strategic 'lense' to technology and operations

  • The drive and attention to detail that transforms strategy into impactful actions

  • Passionate about product & technology innovation with ability to identify and validate emerging trends - both bespoke solutions and 3rd party integrations

  • Experience influencing mid to senior level partners

  • Collaboration skills and ability to influence a multi-functional team to deliver results

  • Can balance customer experience and commercial offerings

  • Understands the big picture and can handle ambiguity

  • Challenge and prioritize initiatives based on customer impact and business goals



What do we offer:




  • Competitive salary and great benefits e.g. conference budget, company pension scheme, employee stock plans, mobile phone for business

  • Dynamic eBay team with exciting personalities, real passion for e-commerce and professionalism

  • International career opportunities at eBay


Interested?

Please contact Donja Huidar, Talent Manager or Grant Bryce Chief Product Officer via +31 650839943.

jobs.title: Perl Developer
jobs.content:

With around 470.000 unique visitors per day 2dehands.be is very popular and the number of visitors keeps growing. Every day we get 60.000 new listings on average in categories like Clothes, Collectables, Cars and Household goods. Because we are the biggest classifieds site that connects the most demand with the largest supply, we are the fastest way to buy or sell. It is cheaper and more environmentally friendly than buying new and a great way to make some money and to give your things a second life. 2dehands.be is looking for an experienced perl engineer. As a member of the agile team you will have direct impact on the technology and user experience of the third biggest site in Belgium. If you can combine a drive for having the right impact with technological excellence to delight our 6.4 million unique visitors per month you can help us become the undisputed leader in classifieds.



What you can expect from us:

Interested?

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer 3
jobs.content:
Job Information:

 

                Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay - a company you can be proud to be a part of.

 

Our Team:

 

Want to be constantly challenged by highly technical and real-world problems? Interested in working with cutting edge technologies, massively distributed environments and Big Data? Does working on cloud computing, distributed systems and data mining problems sound interesting to you? Want to make an impact on one of the biggest social community of buyers and sellers and do it while working for an iconic eCommerce industry giant?



If so then look no further for we have some real exciting openings at eBay Bellevue that present such an opportunity. We are looking for self-motivated and super talented individuals to join us to work on new products that will evolve and grow the eBay Shipping Experience, introducing creative alternative options to our sellers and buyers.

 

This is a highly technical Senior Software Engineer role requiring analytical, innovative thinkers to work on a global, distributed component architecture serving millions of users per day for the largest eCommerce platform in the world. We work in agile, tightly integrated scrum teams to build the products, platforms, services and tools that our customers depend on every day.



If you are a self-starter with a passion for technology, eCommerce and are used to writing high-quality code then eBay is the right place for you.

Here are some of the problems we are working on:




  • Determining an item’s weight and dimensions from a human-readable description.

  • Finding the ideal shipping method for a given item, taking into account buyer behavior and inferred item characteristic.

  • Using predictive analytics to determine item delivery dates Inferring similarity between items described in different locales. 


In this role, you will:


  • Design and implement projects throughout all phases of the software development life cycle.

  • Work with engineers and other cross functional teams to develop great software that meets market needs with respect to functionality, reliability, performance, scalability, etc...

  • Implement proof-of-concept prototypes for data collection, analysis and presentation.

  • Research state-of-the-art data mining techniques, implement them at eBay, roll them to production, analyze results offline/online, and measure site impact.

  • Provide technical leadership and mentoring to other team members.

  • Communicate your methodology and results to a community of researchers, developers, analysts, and product managers.

  • Design and implement projects throughout all phases of the software development life cycle.

  • Research, prototype, and develop new machine learning / data mining solutions.

  • Work with engineers as well as other cross functional teams to produce end-to-end production-ready solutions.

  • Maintain responsibility for the quality, performance, scalability, and reliability of the products.

  • Estimate engineering effort, build research and development plans, and prioritize work according to the needs of the business.

  • Perform data analysis, conduct experiments and use the gained insights to drive product direction.

  • Communicate your methodology and results to a community of researchers, developers, analysts, and product managers.


Job Requirements:


  • BS in computer science or related field with 5+ yrs. of related professional experience or MS with 3+ yrs. of related professional experience or PH.D. with 1+ yrs. of related professional experience.

  • Outstanding coding skills in Java, C++, C#, or similar

  • Excellent understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms

  • Great design and problem solving skills, passion for quality and engineering excellence at scale

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Track record of deploying cutting-edge technology in an industrial setting

  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, iterative development environment

  • Expertise in machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, natural language processing, and/or distributed systems highly preferred



 

eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms. Collectively, we connect millions of buyers and sellers around the world, empowering people and creating opportunity through Connected Commerce. Founded in 1995 in San Jose, Calif., eBay is one of the world’s largest and most vibrant marketplaces for discovering great value and unique selection.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
The Internet of Things (IoT) is not new to Lixar, over the past 15 years, Lixar has worked on a number award-winning connected products and solutions.The Lixar journey began in ’99 with website development. Since then technology has evolved and Lixar has accelerated with a drive for success and constant innovation.


Lixar has grown from systems integration & business automation in 2000 to mobile apps and connected devices today. Throughout Lixar’s history, the company has driven end-to-end solutioning. Today’s Lixar’s technology ecosystem consists of IoT, Mobile, Data Science, UX, Proximity Awareness, Concepts and Design, and Cloud.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Twitch seeks a talented DevOps engineer to help us create scalable infrastructure supporting thousands of developers building the next generation of games.

You have a passion for efficient operations, a deep understanding of the cloud, and a belief that resilient self healing infrastructure is its own reward. You will be in a unique position to set standards and best practices, and bring cutting edge techniques to the table.

The Developer Success team helps creators create great apps that stand out, present their products to viewers who may like them, engage with their existing users, and find innovative ways to generate revenue. With your help we will delight developers and shape the landscape of the gaming industry.

jobs.title: C++ Trading Infrastructure Developer
jobs.content:
Do you want to join a team of developers who are trying to solve hard problems in the financial industry? Our team of software engineers provide Spot with next-generation trading technology that enables traders, quants, research analysts and other developers to trade in the ultra-competitive electronic trading space. Spot prides itself on a unique culture of collaboration between traders, developers, and QA. We also allow technologists to work up to 2 days per week from home.


What are some examples of things that we work on?



  • We developed a low-latency execution platform that allows trading algorithms to trade futures, options and equities across all U.S. exchanges

  • We built market data libraries and services that disseminate millions of updates per second across the firm

  • We developed our own big-data analytics platform that gives quants and traders powerful insights into how their algorithms interact with the market

  • We built monitoring tools with HTML5 and websockets to provide historical and real-time statistics about our trading platform

jobs.title: Application Security Engineer
jobs.content:
The NFL Information Security ( IT Sec) Office is seeking an Application Security Engineer who can positively impact the security of the NFL's Media division. This person will be expected to weigh in on all areas that impact the Confidentially, Integrity and Availability of the NFL Information Assets including but not limited to: application architecture, code, SDLC, policies, network architecture and operations. Your role will be to balance the strategic and operational aspects of Security with the needs of a fast paced digital business model.


Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):



  • Ensure application software, databases and infrastructure are architected, designed and operate to uphold Application Security policies and best practices

  • Partner with Architects to plan application/infrastructure security

  • Provide input and visibility into emerging application security technologies, deployment strategies and other security protocols to ensure awareness and compliance within the organization

  • Identify security requirements and improvements within the system development life cycle (SDLC) and change management processes

  • Perform quality assurance review for application security based documentation developed by other members of the team to ensure the application security was properly addressed

  • Review planned application changes and assesses security impact

  • Perform risk and vulnerability assessments needed to identify potential security risks

  • Develop risk mitigation plans

  • Review Security controls for third party application development

  • Provide crisis leadership during a security threat or breach

  • Create and / or approve security documentation for projects and support

  • Support compliance and audit-related initiatives if/as required
