jobs.title: Customer Success Engineer
jobs.content:
Excellent opportunity for a database or Customer Success professional to be part of an exciting, growing company delivering a cloud based Agile Analytic Solution!  At DataKitchen we have created the world’s first company focused on enabling Agile Analytic Operations. We do that by providing both an Agile Analytic Operations product and consulting services to build, operate, train and transfer an Agile Analytic Environment.  Our company is profitable, stable, rapidly growing and stock will be part of the package.


You should have solid SQL development experience along with the ability to interface with customers (though there will be no significant travel required). This position requires excellent technical skills, good business communication skills, excellent attention to detail and follow-up, and the ability to self-manage. You will get great exposure as you work directly with our customers to tackle tough business challenges.

jobs.title: Full Stack Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Excellent opportunity for a full stack software engineer professional to be part of an exciting, growing company delivering a cloud based Agile Analytic Solutions! At DataKitchen we have created the world’s first company focused on enabling Agile Analytic Operations. We do that by providing both an Agile Analytic Operations product and consulting services to build, operate, train and transfer an Agile Analytic Environment.  Our company is profitable, stable, rapidly growing and stock will be part of the package.



As a member of the DataKitchen Product Development Team, you will help build all layers of our web-based analytic operations  product. This role involves designing and implementing core python, angular, javascript in modern cloud based stack. You will work closely with company founders and our customers.

jobs.title: Back End Python Developer with Django or Flask experience
jobs.content:
Festicket is transforming the way music fans discover and book tickets and travel packages for festivals around the world. Our platform revolutionises the music festival industry by offering an end-to-end experience for music travellers through an efficient two-sided marketplace for 500+ music festivals across 40 different countries! In three short years, we have become Europe's largest music festival platform.

We've just announced a Series B raise - https://techcrunch.com/2016/06/30/festicket-let-it...

Never mind Brexit. We have cash and the willingness to spend it on highly skilled staff and we already sponsor the visas of our staff whenever we need to.


The Role

We are looking for mid-senior level developers who specialise in the Django framework (Flask specialising applicants will also be considered).

We've just had a big funding round and now we need to overhaul our technology to meet the business's ambitions for the next 5 years.

We are a small team of 5 looking to double in size over the next 12 months. To do this we need your dedication to get work done on time, to train new staff and integrate many new team members into this rapidly growing team while working with the other mid-senior developers to ensure that standards stay high and keep getting higher.


The stack: http://stackshare.io/festicket/festicket


Methodology:

We work incrementally but do occasionally take on bigger projects to update our stack and offering. Our current methodology is Agile SCRUM but we are open to other agile methodologies and are looking at the tribal model (https://labs.spotify.com/2014/03/27/spotify-engine...) as the basis of our long term work.



Benefits


Were located in Camden (NW1 8LH). The tech team has a partitioned space so we can work in peace away from the rest of the company but we are always engaging with them and destroying them in our regular ping pong games.

The company culture is very idea orientated and driven but also very social. It's entirely normal at 6pm on a Friday for half the company to be drinking together in the office and then planning to head out for a night out.

Day-to-day perks include free tea, coffee, fruit, snacks and beer. And of course a lot of chill-out space: two kitchens each with a breakfast bar, dining tables (cafeteria style), some ramparts (usually used to sleep off hangovers) and centre-stage are our glorious ping pong table and big screen smart tv.

jobs.title: Microsoft Shop Lead Developer
jobs.content:
Come join a team of over 130 web developers and 80 engineers working together to build and maintain high traffic web applications that help our clients visualize complex financial data. We are looking for a senior web developer to lead project teams of web developers and engineers in the delivery of new revenue project initiatives.  In this position, you will be responsible for identifying and bringing clarity to all technical requirements of a project, mentoring junior web developers, and interacting with all other technical disciplines.


Position requirements



  • Set technical direction for new revenue projects.

  • Ability to lead small to medium size technical teams in project development and delivery.

  • Knowledgeable in the purpose and application of OO principles and patterns.

  • Mentor web developers in the adherence to defined technical direction, patterns, and code standards.

  • Work directly with client technical teams to resolve technical issues around visual integrations, data integrations, and authentication.

  • Own the overall quality of the solution and its deployment into all environments including production.

  • Maintain and manage project source control strategies for multiple developers.

  • Support project process by leading technical daily standups, participate in backlog grooming, and refining the project execution process.

  • Actively participate in defining future technical direction.

  • Bring an enthusiastic positive attitude to match our unique and fun loving culture.


 Skills & requirements:



  • 5+ years of Microsoft .NET web development experience using ASP .NET MVC 3+, Razor, REST APIs, and Web API in a Visual Studio environment.

  • 5+ years of front end development, highly skilled in JavaScript, JQuery 1.4+, JSON, Bootstrap, HTML5, and CSS3.

  • Experience with VCS such as git and SVN.

  • Exposure to packaging, task runner, and repository manager frameworks; Bower, npm, NuGet, Gulp, etc.

  • Experience with iterative development methodologies; Scrum, XP, or Kanban

  • Exposure to requirement tracking tools such as JIRA and Confluence.

  • Demonstrated critical thinking, decision making, analytical problem solving, and troubleshooting skills.

  • Must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.


 Nice to have:



  • Familiarity with Confluence, Less, Sass, Gulp, Maven, Artifactory, SVN, CI Tools / TeamCity, Angular, React, Jasmine, JUnit, NUnit, and .NET Core are all pluses

jobs.title: Embedded Developer
jobs.content:
We at ubirch are convinced that the IoT offers more than controlling lights and heating from your couch. We develop a next generation secure platform for the internet of things with a strong base on open source hardware and software.


Work with the ubirch team to design and develop new IoT applications, decide on the best hardware components and help implement the firmware for our board based on ARM-Cortex-M4F/M0+ MCUs with crypto support, mobile connectivity and a multitude of sensors.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Backend Services
jobs.content:
The Twilio platform enables companies to integrate communications directly into their applications via simple cloud APIs and with on-demand global reach.  Twilio is therefore challenged with abstracting away a world of complexity so that our customers can go global without concern for managing a global communications network, carrier integrations and relationships throughout the world.


About the job:


As a member of our communications teams you will implement real-time voice and messaging services.  To take it to scale, you will be developing a complex distributed platform with points of presence globally and will be concerned with availability, throughput, latency, media fidelity as well as real-time considerations. There will be a significant data component so you will be working with distributed SQL and NoSQL databases and caches.  At the core are cloud technologies that enable deployment and management of computing resources globally.   


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects and Engineering leaders to define, architect and build new customer-facing features.

  • Own, operate, and maintain your team’s services in a distributed production environment. Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.

  • Drive quality by writing unit, functional, load and performance tests.

  • Work closely with DevOps engineers to ensure services are reliable, scalable, manageable and supportable.  Develop diagnostic and troubleshooting tools made available via our developer portal and to our customer support organization.

  • Excel as an engineer and be a productive member of the team where leadership is a behavioral trait, not a title.  Lead architecture, design and code reviews as well as mentor junior engineers.

jobs.title: Cloud Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Ixia (NASDAQ: XXIA) provides application performance and security resilience solutions so that organizations can validate, secure and optimize their physical and virtual networks. Enterprises, service providers, network equipment manufacturers and governments worldwide rely on Ixia’s solutions to deploy new technologies and achieve efficient, secure ongoing operation of their networks. With Ixia's powerful and versatile solutions, their global support, and professional services staff, Ixia customers can focus on exceeding their customer’s expectations and achieving better business outcomes.

Learn more at www.ixiacom.com. Join the Ixia team and be a part of our future!

Location: Calabasas California or Austin Texas

Position #: P022857

Cloud Senior Software Engineer

Job Description Work as part of a team delivering Ixia’s cloud products. This team requires strong technical candidates with a proven ability to develop large-scale applications in a cloud-based environment. Candidate needs to be able to work effectively in a fast paced and highly innovative environment.

Required

  • Strong experience developing for cloud based platforms like Amazon Web Services, or Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, RackSpace, etc.
  • Familiar with the concept and development of Docker containers and micro services
  • Understanding of Services¬Oriented Architecture (SOA and REST)
  • Very good understanding of large scale distributed systems
  • Experience building sophisticated and highly automated infrastructure
  • Management of continuous integration servers like Jenkins, Bamboo and TeamCity
  • Proficient in C++, Java or C
  • Strong scripting skills, i.e., Python, Bash, Ruby, Perl, etc.
  • Experience with revision control source code repositories (Git, Perforce, SVN)
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to think clearly, analyze quantitatively, solve problems, scope technical requirements and prioritize work
  • BS/MS in Computer Science with 7+ years of relevant experience

Preferred

  • Experience with Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments
  • Experience with ElasticSearch
  • Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
  • Working knowledge of HTML5
  • Understanding and experience with code deployment (tagging).
  • Familiarity with Serverless Computing Technologies like Amazon Lambda, Azure Functions, etc. is a plus
  • Linux and Windows¬based systems administration skills in a Cloud or Virtualized environment

To apply: http://ixiacom.force.com/careers/ts2__JobDetails?jobId=a0x160000055E5KAAU&tSource=

Or Apply directly to Ryan Redman: rredman@ixiacom.com

3rd Party Or Unsolicited Resumes Will Not Be Accepted

jobs.title: Embedded Hardware Engineer
jobs.content:
At Spaceflight we are creating the future. We are transforming how spacecraft are built, launched and operated and our customers are using these technologies to push the boundaries of space exploration and look at our planet in entirely new ways. Being a pioneer is not easy – it requires ingenuity, creativity, perseverance, and dedication. We are looking for exceptional people who have these traits to be part of our exceptional team.


Job Description


Summary & Responsibilities:


The embedded hardware team is responsible for engineering spacecraft avionics and ground-based electronics through all phases of the product life-cycle. You will create embedded systems incorporating FPGAs, microcontrollers, analog and digital signal processing, motor control, and sensor/data acquisition. Working with a small team of software, FPGA, and hardware engineers, you will participate in the design, integration, and test of innovative small spacecraft. Major emphasis is placed on building highly reliable systems that are low-cost and extremely mass and power efficient.



As a member of our team, you will be empowered to apply your creativity and experience to the next generation of spacecraft avionics, and have a direct impact on the development of our solutions.

jobs.title: Développeur Java
jobs.content: Notarius est à la recherche de développeurs passionnés et créatifs, qui carburent à l’apprentissage de nouvelles technologies et à les utiliser dans un contexte d’entreprise. jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Treinen is a tight-knit team that works for the benefit of our clients. We seek individuals who desire a strong team environment and want to contribute their expertise to our team at Treinen. We are seeking two senior developers and one junior developer to work in Olympia to assist our development team. Developers will be building custom applications for both public sector and private sector clients across several industries (law enforcement, social service, education, etc.). Prior consulting and/or project work experience is very desirable, but not required.


The developers we are seeking will be part of our technical consulting practice, where they will be using current technologies to assist our clients with a variety of technical needs. We are looking for team oriented contributors that bring a positive attitude and can work within complex project environments.


Projects can range from small simple applications, for example building a simple user interface to loading large volumes of data files and producing reports to fully customized ground-up applications that require web, complex transactional capabilities, security, audit, extensive UI, large volumes of data interfaces, and data conversion. Understanding Agile and having experience in Agile development practices is a big plus. Projects typically run six months for a small engagement to a couple of years. The typical technical consultant/developer will be working on several projects concurrently, so excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills are needed.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a member of the Interface Designer team, you will help build a tool for creating dynamic, interactive interfaces.  Your goal is to enable designers to build complex interfaces using an intuitive, easy-to-use tool that provides live feedback at design time, allowing them to test the interface immediately as they build it.


About you



  • You’re an expert in front end development (preferably Java, JavaScript, and React) and have worked with these technologies for at least 3 years

  • You have a solid foundation in Java, even if it isn’t your primary language

  • Agility is your mantra, and building quality software is your goal

  • Assembling UI’s declaratively and directly in code comes naturally to you

  • You consider yourself a tinkerer at heart and have an innate ability to solve tough comp sci problems

  • You’re well educated, with at least a BS in Computer Science or related field/degree

  • Required: professional experience in Java and excellent communication skills

  • Preferred: React, Javascript, CSS3, functional programming, MVC, Git, continuous integration (CI), JSON, JUnit, and/or frameworks such as AngularJS


How you’ll contribute



  • In a Scrum team you will develop simple yet elegant solutions to complex problems using technologies including but not limited to Java, React, JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3

  • Participate in system design and architectural decisions for our web-based and mobile platforms

  • Respond to and resolve emergent problems; write software to prevent problem recurrence

  • Automate functional tests in JUnit as well as testing for performance and security

  • Mentor other software engineers and perform code reviews

jobs.title: Information Security Architect - Build the Security that helps Hulu redefine TV
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


Hulu’s Security team is seeking an Information Security Architect who will be an exceptional addition to our Security team. As an Information Security Architect at Hulu, you will work with the technology and information security group to develop and implement a comprehensive security posture to protect Hulu. Develop and deploy technical controls, for secure transmission of data including digital content delivery, risk mitigation, provide senior engineering support across the business. The right person for this role will have experience securing  distributed environments. If you are someone who has experience building and securing high performance environments, then this is a great role for you.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Work across technology and security teams to develop and deploy technical controls and secure architectures to protect the integrity of data and the ability to deliver digital content.

  • Perform vendor review, business risk analysis, protocol evaluation and technical vulnerability assessments.

  • Work with information security leadership to develop strategies and plans to enforce security requirements and address identified risks.

  • Collaborates on critical security projects to identify and document best practices with Hulu and vendor applications and hardware to design secure architectures for their deployment.

  • Study, understand, and document current application architectures, implementations for domains assigned.

  • Create “as-is” vs “t o-be” architecture and Gap Analysis documents.

  • Drive end to end security process development

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.content:
Parenting can be tough, but at Skip Hop, we believe it can be easier when you have highly functional products on hand. Our team brings modern design to life, creating innovative essentials for moms, dads and infants worldwide; our products have broad retail distribution in independent, specialty, and department stores in the US and 60+ international markets. The brand is a favorite of parents worldwide, sought after for its best-in-class products that feature iconic designs with an emphasis on function, high quality and authenticity.

Skip Hop is seeking a hands-on product designer to work full-time in our New York office. Candidate must be a strategic thinker and have experience working with creative teams in a fast-paced, high-energy environment. You will have the opportunity to help develop innovative products from design through final product.

JOB FUNCTIONS:
· Researching and sketching outstanding solutions for variety of simple to complex problems
· Reviewing design directions with management, create presentations for internal and sales presentations
· Designing new products and creating manufacture-ready 3D CAD files
· Communicating with factories and/or model-makers to develop innovative products
· Collaborating with product designers and directors to find compelling solutions to design challenges.
· Working with Skip Hop's overseas office and factories to optimize tooling and identify key cost savings
· Product categories include: accessories, toys, feeding and more

REQUIREMENTS:
• 4-year degree in industrial design
• 3+ years design experience (toy and children’s product background preferred)
• Advanced SolidWorks skills required (proficiency in Fusion 360 is plus)
• Experience designing for injection-molding and general DFM
• Ability to communicate ideas through sketching
• Proficiency in Adobe CS and Microsoft Office
• Clean, modern aesthetic, and a love of function
• Excellent organization skills and attention to detail
• Must be available for international travel 2-3 times/year
• Experience working with overseas factories is preferred


This is a full-time on-site position. Please respond with resume and portfolio (link or file under 3Mb please) or link, and salary requirements to: jobs@skiphop.com

jobs.title: Senior Developer with experience writing SSL encryption/decryption software
jobs.content:
The selected individual will be responsible the design and development of a proxyless  L2 SSL/TLS decryption capability for a next-generation IDS/IPS system.


WE DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES USE OUTSIDE RECRUITERS


Reports to: CTO

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you the person on your team who is always looking for the precise abstractions to express the solution? Do you believe that the process of writing software applications is far less efficient than it could be? Are you the type who wishes that user interfaces had kept up with the developments in modern graphics hardware, and that the cool UIs in movies were available to people in real life?


Intentional Software Corporation (ISC) is looking for smart developers to contribute to a next-generation software platform and/or applications built using that platform. Our software captures the intent of users and projects it into many useful forms, including direct-manipulation UIs with rich graphics and animation. By conforming to this model, applications automatically acquire a rich set of high-level functionality that few companies can afford to develop themselves.


We are continually improving our platform and are also building flagship applications in-house that leverage and showcase our technology.  We are looking for software engineers who thrive on continually pushing the envelope, and we think we offer one of the best opportunities in the industry to truly apply your skills.

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Collage is a changing the way businesses manage HR forever.


Collage believes in empowering people to do their best work. We achieve this with our product by reimagining the way businesses manage HR, payroll and benefits. Our revolutionary platform automates tedious HR administration, which allows businesses to focus on their most meaningful work.


We also believe in empowering our own people to do their best work by fostering the best possible work environment. We seek to attract the best people and give them unparalleled resources to thrive.


Collage is launching with significant financial and strategic backing from Diagram, a venture fund/incubator with focus on insurance, financial and health technology. Diagram is backed by PFC ventures and a top-tier Silicon Valley VC. Our backing from Diagram gives us an significant strategic advantage that will help us win our market.


As a recently funded startup, we are looking to make early hires in all key functional areas. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to make meaningful contributions in leadership positions for a company on a high-growth trajectory.


BACK-END OR FULL-STACK ENGINEERS WILL:



  • Work with our product and design teams to understand customer pain points,come up with solutions, and then prototype, iterate, and launch daily.

  • Actively participate in code reviews and design planning.

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Optimize the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Implement security and data protection

  • Translate UI/UX wireframes to visual elements

  • Integrate the front-end and back-end aspects of the web application

jobs.title: Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team as a technical leader responsible for delivering innovative eCommerce solutions built for sustainability and performance. Your passion for architecture optimization will enable you to become a key contributor in the development and enhancement of our core eCommerce architecture. You will be a go-to-person in designing and guiding teams in the delivery of high quality software that scales and performs at a best-in-class level. Collaborating closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers, you will design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.


Our teams are composed of talented software engineers working in a very dynamic, challenging, fast-paced, sustainable and fun Agile (Scrum) environment.


Job Description:



  • Translate business requirements into architecture designs:

    • Understand the existing software core architecture, interactions and dependencies between its main components.

    • Support product managers to gather and filter key information from stakeholders.

    • Evaluate risk by identifying development complexity, limitations and impacts.

    • Determine development feasibility within identified constraints.



  • Support product managers with drafting functional specifications.

  • Write minimum technical specifications and documents.

  • Participate in detailed development reviews and demos.

  • Write unit tests.

  • Troubleshoot and guide the team to resolve complex problems.

  • Suggest core infrastructure enhancements based on current and future technology trends.

  • Brainstorm and solve very interesting problems that will considerably increase product user experience.

  • Coach and mentor junior team members:

    • Contribute and promote software best practices and processes across the team.

    • Participate actively in code reviews.

    • Provide teammates continuous technical support.

    • Provide guidance for new feature integration and key architectural decisions.



  • Share knowledge through collaboration, training, peer review, presentations, and articles.


Requirements:



  • 7 + years of C# and ASP.NET experience.

  • 4+ years of hands-on technical leadership experience around system engineering.

  • 2 + years of MVC experience.

  • 2 + years experience working under Agile scrum framework.

  • Strong knowledge of SQL Server.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field; Master’s degree preferred.

  • Strong experience with web development (HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, relational databases and SQL).

  • Experience with MongoDB or NoSQL preferred.

  • Experience implementing REST architecture preferred.

  • Good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.content:
Description/Job Duties
Product Strategy



  • Define solution roadmap by defining product vision, gathering and prioritizing requirements

  • Determine how products and offerings will be bundled and packaged with existing and other products

  • Collaborate with services group to determine the right services offerings to package with the product

  • Plan release schedules including Development partners, Early Release/Early Adopters and General Release including working with Sales to find appropriate customer partners.



Product Development



  • Coordinate with the product development teams through the product lifecycle including design (translation of requirements into functional and interface designs), technical designs and architecture, development, QA and release management

  • Ensure that the delivered product meets market needs by tracking against requirements and roadmap



Market Opportunity Analysis



  • Define market spaces where products and offerings can add value

  • Track market trends, competitive offerings, innovation vectors, analyze existing and new technologies

  • Develop insights into customer problems and needs driving opportunity that solutions can meet



Marketing Analysis



  • Develop market segmentation (including needs-based segmentation), target segment definitions (down to specific prospect lists) and position solutions that meet the specific needs in a defined opportunity

  • Perform competitive analysis and differentiate offerings from competitors

  • Translate market needs into specific solutions/offerings/products/product features and define the requirements that product needs to meet

  • Identify specific value propositions that are delivered by these product offerings

  • Quantify market size, penetration, adoption of offering and potential revenues and costs



Market and Sales Support



  • Provide information and act as a resource working with the sales group to drive opportunities

  • Assist in strategic demos and ensuring that opportunities move through the sales pipeline

  • Ensure the support and services organizations have the necessary information to meet customer needs relevant to this product

  • Benchmark value delivered to customers to drive referencability  to help with other opportunities
    Monitor customer adoption, usage and satisfaction



Product Market Introduction



  • Design sales and channel approach in collaboration with the sales group

  • Collaborate with product marketing to develop promotional programs including branding, customer/analyst/media outreach

  • Create in collaboration with marketing communications - product profiles, case studies, competitive analysis, presentations, demos, white papers, and sales and marketing collateral

  • Drive product roll-out and introduction process – including training and roll-out internally to sales, support, services and other groups; as well as externally to existing customer base and broader market



Revenue Generation Management



  • Identify pricing, revenue models to drive adoption and meeting revenue expectations within budget



Partnership Development



  • Identify potential go-to-market partnership opportunities with complementary services and product vendors

  • Support driving additional revenue through these partnership opportunities

  • Ensure that these partnerships align with our product and go-to-market strategy

jobs.title: Software Engineer-10133
jobs.company: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory
jobs.content:
Introduction: The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL), a national leader in scientific research and development, located midway between Baltimore and Washington, DC is seeking a Simulation Software Engineer.



Job Summary: The Combat System Development and Assessment Group (A3B) of the Air and Missile Defense Sector (AMDS) is seeking an individual to perform software development as part of a team utilizing Modeling and Simulation (M&S) to address complex Air and Missile Defense (AMD) real-world challenges.



Duties (Listed in order of importance with the estimated amount of time spent at each task):



  1. Software development and integration of real-time and/or event driven models representing current or future tactical system behavior. Tasks include software design, implementation, integration, and testing. (70%)

  2. Research and consultation with Subject Matter Experts to identify software requirements. (20%)

  3. Documentation and presentations of software designs/implementations and M&S results.(10%)


Note: This job summary and listing of duties is for the purpose of describing the position and its essential functions at time of hire and may change over time.

jobs.title: iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
About Guidebook:

At Guidebook, we’re developing mobile apps to help organizations of all types connect with their audiences. Now, at 5 years old, we’ve powered over 20,000 events, conferences, and guides. On average, we serve hundreds of thousands of users per week, and some of our more popular events can attract tens of thousands by themselves.  We are looking for an enthusiastic, experienced iOS Engineer to join our team.

 

Why join Guidebook now?

We’re at a very exciting point in the company’s journey. We’re beginning to expand in a couple big ways:

  • First, we’re expanding globally. In addition to our SF office, we have a presence in Raleigh, London, and Seoul. We’re excited about bringing our products to the international market, and looking forward to the unique challenges that brings.

  • Secondly, we manage hundreds of apps and counting. Submitting so many apps to the app stores presents a unique challenge in terms of both code architecture and build infrastructure.  Guidebook’s app’s branding capabilities allow us to customize apps based on our client’s needs.  Our proprietary build infrastructure has automated the process of submitting to the App Store.

 

Engineering at Guidebook

Working as an engineer at Guidebook means you’ll be collaborating as part of an agile team. Teams typically consist of a product manager, designer, and 4-8 engineers. We work in 2 week sprints with the entire team contributing to product, design and architecture decisions.

 

As an iOS Engineer at Guidebook you will be responsible for:

  • Building amazing iOS apps seen by millions of users

  • Working with product managers to design new features

  • Architecting complex, data-driven code

  • Ensuring top notch performance in both the UI and data handling

 

We’re looking for someone with the following experience:

  • 2-5 years experience developing iOS apps

  • Experience with both Swift and Objective-C

  • Experience with RESTful network architectures

  • Proficient in Cocoa design patterns and API design

 

Nice to have:

  • Familiarity with BDD and specifically Quick/Nimble

  • Experience mentoring junior engineers

  • Ability to work independently as part of a fast moving Agile team

 

Perks:

  • 100 percent paid benefits: medical, dental, and vision

  • Unlimited vacation time!

  • Stock options

  • Awesome company retreats, aka Guidetrips to places like Tahoe and Yosemite!

  • Make your workstation yours: Desk customization (fancy hydraulic standing desks; docks/stands; keyboards; whatever else you need to be productive)

  • Fully stocked kitchens with every snack and drink your heart desires

  • Fancy, Free lunches twice a week through MyEatClub.com

  • Transportation Benefits: Clipper Card tax benefit program and a free Caltrain GoPass so you can ride the Caltrain an unlimited number of times!

  • Comfortable lounge areas for work and play

  • Great office space in SOMA

  • Discounted gym memberships through AnyPerk!

  • Reap some good karma: Group Volunteer Events


Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with the Fair Chance Ordinance.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Why EMS?


If you crave the chance to achieve at the highest level while working with an exceptionally talented team with enlightened leadership, we have the opportunity you’ve been looking for.


Used by millions of people, EMS manages some of the highest profile spaces in the world like the NASDAQ bell! The EMS team is consistently delivering new features to its suite of products, and we want to grow our team, tackle even bigger challenges, and do amazing things. We work in small, concentrated teams to constantly improve our code base, and have amassed a large backlog of interesting technical challenges and product initiatives. We want to grow to enable even greater success within our industry. This is where you come in.


Summary:


As our first DevOps Engineer, you’ll help define the success factors and key metrics for the role. You’re a seasoned leader with expertise in domains spanning DevOps, Cloud Architecture, IT, and middleware. You have extensive experience supporting applications developed in at least 3 of the following: .NET, Java, Ruby, Python, Node, and GO. You’re passionate about solving problems and developing creative solutions with automation.


Responsibilities:


In your first month, as your familiarity with the product grows, your responsibilities will grow as well. You will mentor other team members in established patterns and continue to hone your skills as you push the development and quality assurance environments towards more stable solutions.


Within 2 months of your start, you will utilize an agreed up technology stack (for example, Ansible, quai, docker) to create a well-tested, low-latency continuous integration environment.


Within your 3 months, you will help integrate efficiency into tracking and information flow on the app stack.


Other duties and responsibilities include:



  • Design, provision, configure and maintain the platform operations to handle the scale of running several application stacks in the cloud that will be consumed worldwide.

  • Automate the deployment and maintenance of cloud platform technologies

  • Oversee operations; log management, data warehouse, and database operations including management of Splunk services in-house and in-cloud

  • Ensure all monitoring systems (IT, development, service management, Apdex) are in place

  • Enforce consistency of monitoring, reporting, alarming systems

  • Drive process improvements for service management including outage/incident management and reporting

  • Research emerging virtualization techniques and advise management

  • Perform capacity management, load and scalability planning

  • Ensure compliance with deployment and operations documentation

  • Assist management in development and optimization of operational cost models

  • Design cloud infrastructure for high reliability and availability

  • Build strategic and tactical plans for continued improvement of cloud architecture and operations

  • Manage, maintain, and enforce service level agreements

  • Provide operational reports (Service Level, Usage, Costs) to upper management

  • Optimize cost structure for cloud operations (owns resourcing)

jobs.title: Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
Why Join Us:

QBP is currently looking to expand our Industrial Design team and is in search of individuals with a passion for cycling and pursuit of design innovation at their core. Are you ready to help build and establish Design as a key asset for our organization? Voted one of the top 50 work places by Outdoor Magazine multiple years in a row, QBP is based in Bloomington, MN, and respected as one of the best business’ in the cycling industry. QBP’s product development team designs and develops innovative products and experiences for our portfolio of 15+ Brands including the likes of Surly, Salsa Cycles, 45Nrth, and many more.

What You Will Do:
As an Industrial Designer for QBP, you will have a key role in supporting the development of Design as a leading competency for QBP. Expect to work on a variety of projects ranging from small parts and accessories, soft goods, and complete bicycles. The ideal candidate will be a cyclist who is able to merge the ability to listen and observe the experiences of others with their own to create unique and innovative products. The person must be driven, passionate, self- motivated, and capable of integrating into a larger development team that interacts between marketing, creative, product management, and engineering.
If you are an exceptional designer who is passionate about cycling and design-driven innovation this is the role for you.

• Work seamlessly on cross functional teams to design and develop innovative products ranging from complete bikes, accessories, softgoods and components that are consistent with direction of the brand.
• Identify, visualize, document, and present back to the larger team:
• Potential product and insights
• Use case and user experience strategies
• Visual product language for brands.
• Maintain a strong sense of trends and stay abreast of brand competition within cycling, the outdoor industry, and the market as a whole
• Direct involvement with all aspects of the product development process, from concept to production
• Refine product concepts with 3D modeling and physical prototyping.



What You Need to Succeed:

• Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Design or equivalent experience with 1-7 years of experience in industrial/product design
• Ability to utilize appropriate visual tools for the application, whether that is 2D, Sketching, interactive media, 3D, or prototyping.
• Exceptional verbal, written, and visual Communication skills
• Exceptional 3D modeling skills, specifically in surfacing, preferably in Solidworks.
• Experience and proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite and Autodesk Sketchbook
• Aesthetic Sensibility, the ability to define and articulate strong and appropriate product form.
• General understanding of manufacturing practices in welding, casting, machining, and molding
• Understanding of bicycle mechanics with the ability to assemble and evaluate prototypes, component fit, and use.
• Ability to communicate with international development partners via written communication
• Self-motivated and detail orientated person
• Domestic and international travel 4-6 weeks per year, valid driver’s license and passport required
• Ability to use computer extensively
• Ability to periodically lift up to 50 lbs.


ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE:

This employee will report directly to the Industrial Design Manager. This individual will work collaboratively with product managers, art directors, engineering, and project managers for several brands as assigned. The employee will be based in QBP’s Minnesota location and travel periodically both domestic and international.

SALARY:

Pay based on experience. QBP strives to pay market competitive rates for all positions

APPLICATION:

Candidates interested in this position must provide a cover letter, resume, and portfolio examples with their application in either a PDF or weblink. Failure to submit all required documents will result in dismissal.


All candidates are subject to a pre-employment criminal background check and a drug screen. Some applicants may be subject to a credit check and driving check as well.

jobs.title: 3D Rendering & Graphic Design  Specialist
jobs.content:
BASIC FUNCTION

Responsible for creating photo-realistic digital assets to be used by marketing, sales and project management departments for Bernhardt Design. Assist in the general administration of the Bernhardt Design division marketing program. Perform functions as assigned and directed by the Manager – Digital Media relating to any general or specific marketing activities.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES

Create photo-realistic architectural/environmental renderings using 3D software and Engineering CAD files as directed by Marketing, Design, Sales, and Project Management.
Prepare and present innovative 3D conceptual environments consistent with the Bernhardt Design brand.
Render specific products for custom sales presentations as requested by Sales and Project Management.
Create 2D cad files of modular furniture layouts as requested by Sales.
Exhibit design sensitivity and technical skills in material creation, texture mapping, lighting and scene set-up including the application of specific Bernhardt Textiles to models.
Adhere to and maintain consistency with the brand marketing strategy as determined by the Director of Marketing.
Maintain a library of texture maps, models and environments for use in product renderings.
Maintain a library of 2D and 3D CAD files including Revit models using Families for use by outside clients.
Other digital media tasks such as image manipulation, animation, and video editing as needed.


EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

Work effectively in a fast paced, ever-changing, multi-disciplinary environment.
Exhibit proficiency in:
- 3D Studio Max, V-Ray or other 3D modeling/rendering software
- Adobe Creative Suite with emphasis on Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator
- Autodesk product line with emphasis on 3D Studio Max, Revit using Families, and AutoCAD
- MS Office
Experience in Solidworks, ProE, or other 3D solid modeling software is a plus.

jobs.title: Cloud Senior Product Manager
jobs.content:
ixia (NASDAQ: XXIA) provides application performance and security resilience solutions so that organizations can validate, secure and optimize their physical and virtual networks. Enterprises, service providers, network equipment manufacturers and governments worldwide rely on Ixia’s solutions to deploy new technologies and achieve efficient, secure ongoing operation of their networks. With Ixia's powerful and versatile solutions, their global support, and professional services staff, Ixia customers can focus on exceeding their customer’s expectations and achieving better business outcomes.

Learn more at www.ixiacom.com.

Join the Ixia team and be a part of our future!

Location: Calabasas, California

Position #: P022861

Cloud Senior Product Manager

Position Overview:

This Product Manager is responsible for understanding the Cloud market segment and developing targeted solutions within Ixia's Network Visibility Solutions business unit. The focus will be on visibility solutions within cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Computing). The Product Manager will be the product champion for the internal team and the customer champion for the sales team, and as such the candidate will need to be able to forge strong working relationships with customers, sales, engineering and support.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for researching market opportunity, developing market entry strategy and growing the product into a meaningful business
  • Responsible for product competitiveness and develops go to market plans with marketing
  • Manage and plan product lifecycle from conception, planning, to launch activities
  • Help the Product Management team in guiding the product direction and managing customer priorities and trade-offs
  • Assist the PM team with competitive analysis and technology assessment
  • Works with technical and business leads to prioritize investments and roadmap
  • Takes ownership of solution roadmap and manage ongoing tactical priorities.
  • Manages prioritization, trades-offs and ensures alignment across cross functional groups
  • Interface with multiple company functions including engineering, manufacturing, sales, finance and customer support
  • Support customers and SEs with Ixia product evaluations, strategic bake-offs and provide pre-sales support as needed
  • Deliver in-depth and high-level technical presentations for customers and sales personnel
  • Develop application notes, white papers, technical briefs and product videos that will help elevate the product knowledge Ixia field, channels, and customers

Requirements:

 Bachelor’s Degree in a computer science or engineering background  Strong understanding of Service oriented/Cloud applications development  A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in real-world Cloud Computing (preferably Salesforce.com, AWS, Azure)  Experienced with developing products for Infrastructure-as-a-Service platforms (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure…)  Familiar with the concept of containerized applications (Docker) and micro services  Familiar with Data scaling – Elasticsearch technologies  Understanding of virtualization products and technologies  Must be able to build relationships within internal development/PM organization, sales and customers  Must be able to quickly adapt to a quickly changing competitive and technology landscape  Regional travel as needed for training and business meetings, customer visits and speaking engagements  Must have good verbal and written communications skills  Ability to work independently and as a team-player in a fast-paced environment

A little about us:

Core Values: Ixia's Core Values are posted at every Ixia site in every location. Ixia employees use these values to guide their interactions with internal and external customers.

The Ixia Way: Wow our customers! Trust, respect, and develop our people! Listen and be open! Be passionate courageous, and decisive! Win with teamwork and collaboration! Celebrate excellence!

Diversity: Ixia's strong and diverse workforce spreads across multiple continents. Because of our wide range of backgrounds, our employees always manage to bring fresh perspectives, increased creativity and superior problem-solving skills to Ixia. We cherish and embrace our employees' diversity of styles and perspectives and we can truthfully say that diversity is one of our biggest strengths.

To apply: http://ixiacom.force.com/careers/ts2__JobDetails?jobId=a0x160000055E5TAAU&tSource=

OR Apply directly to Ryan Redman: rredman@ixiacom.com

3rd Party Or Unsolicited Resumes Will Not Be Accepted

jobs.title: Software Architect
jobs.content:
FLAGSHIP SOFTWARE ENGINEERING


Our clients are senior business executives who value BCG's strategic, fact-based, and impact-oriented approach supported by highly experienced senior expert teams and rich benchmarking databases and analytical capability. BCG has a number of flagship software products that support our core capabilities. These products are critical to the success of our project teams to deliver superior quality insight and implementation of major change efforts. The Flagship Software Engineering team has been an invaluable partner of the Practice Areas in this endeavor. Together, we have custom developed and deployed a number of software applications with proven success in the field.


POSITION SUMMARY:


The Software Architect will play a critical role in driving next generational development of these software applications, likely collaborating in successful multi-million dollar, multi-year investments. Under general guidance from the Applications Development Technical Lead, and working with Business Analyst and Product Manager, this role will be at the center of development efforts, overseeing application architecture and database design, and ensuring application security, flexibility, scalability, and performance. Key activities will include defining the interaction between application modules, layers, and middleware systems; as well as to communicate design choices and coding standards to third party vendors.


BASIC JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Demonstrate and communicate a passion for digital products and services

  • Apply your knowledge of online, cloud and mobile platforms (Windows Azure, Google App Engine, Amazon Cloud, OS X, Android are essential)

  • Drive analysis of how business requirements can be technically implemented

  • Integrate large and complex system integration projects and collaborate with cross-functional teams

  • Design complex bespoke solutions that require creative and complex investigations and evaluations of alternative architectural solutions

  • Utilize proactive problem-solving to address challenges and functional concerns

  • Demonstrate initiative, self-motivation, creative problem-solving and effective interpersonal/communication skills that support the process of building collaborative teams

  • Institute superior technology capabilities with diligence, attention to detail and technical intuition

  • Implement advanced organizational and planning skills to developmental projects

  • Balance competing priorities while adhering to deadlines and aligning resources with value demands

  • Serve as a thought leader in digital platforms and solution architecture, regardless of the screen, device or deployment environment

  • Design bespoke online and mobile IT architecture, drawing on knowledge of open source and/or commercially available platforms

  • Apply industry best practices and design patterns to create scalable and secure solutions that have superior technical performance

  • Develop system implementation plans/processes and oversee the development, integration, testing and launch stages

  • Defines application architecture as a mean to achieve the business' security, flexibility, scalability, and performance goals; and makes sure that, over time and through the architecture's evolution, all stakeholders requirements can be met

  • Documents and communicates the architecture to the development team, third party vendors (as required), and all stakeholders (to the detail appropriate to the audience)

  • Ensures code development follows the architecture blue print and established coding standards

  • Proposes modeling and proofs-of-concept as required

  • Ensures the architecture is optimal not only for development, but also for operations, deployment, and continuous enhancements

  • When confronted with technical challenges, must find creative, economical, and elegant software engineering solutions

  • Identifies risks and proposes risk mitigation strategies associated with the architecture

  • Evaluate third-party suppliers, products and solutions and engage in/leading collaborative discussions


Other:



  • Mentors and directs other, more junior members of the team.

  • Performs other projects and duties as assigned or required.

  • Moderate amount of traveling – dependent on project requirements.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
We build our software incrementally, iteratively, and continuously, so you’ll be able to see new work go live to over four million visitors around the globe every week. XP and Kanban heavily influence our flavour of agile and if something isn’t working, we change it.


Our teams are cross-discipline so that our work delivers value to both the business and our customers: business analysts and UX designers work with stakeholders to coordinate research and understand requirements, frontend developers and software engineers pair with quality analysts to develop the most robust solutions, and our platform engineers work across the organisation to ensure our infrastructure never lets us down.


What you'll do…



  • Create complex, enterprise-class web applications

  • Use the latest tools and technologies

  • Influence every step of the delivery process and take ownership for what you build

  • Contribute to project priorities and find innovative ways to meet objectives

  • Collaborate and work closely with analysts, designers, testers, operations, and product owners, in a diverse and informal environment

jobs.title: Cloud Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Ixia (NASDAQ: XXIA) provides application performance and security resilience solutions so that organizations can validate, secure and optimize their physical and virtual networks. Enterprises, service providers, network equipment manufacturers and governments worldwide rely on Ixia’s solutions to deploy new technologies and achieve efficient, secure ongoing operation of their networks. With Ixia's powerful and versatile solutions, their global support, and professional services staff, Ixia customers can focus on exceeding their customer’s expectations and achieving better business outcomes. Learn more at www.ixiacom.com.

Join the Ixia team and be a part of our future!

Location: Calabasas, California

Position #: P022856

Cloud Site Reliability Engineer

Job Description Site Reliability Engineers are hybrid systems and software engineers who are responsible and take ownership for reliability, automation, and other issues related to Ixia’s customer facing cloud service. We are looking for an engineer to work as part of a team delivering Ixia’s cloud products. This position requires a strong technical candidate with experience in automation and system integration. As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) you will work collaboratively with multiple partners to build tools that ensure this software remain on-line for all the people that rely on it. You come from a systems or development background (or are comfortable in both areas). You are self-directed and have the ability to track solutions from design through implementation, owning every step along the way. SREs combine engineering experience, a desire to improve existing systems and processes, and creative problem solving to develop novel solutions to evolving challenges. Our team strives to automate processes whenever possible, using whatever tools are best for the job.

Required

  • Strong experience developing for cloud based platforms like Amazon Web Services, or Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, RackSpace, etc.
  • Familiar with the concept and development of Docker containers and micro services
  • Understanding of Services­Oriented Architecture (SOA and REST)
  • Very good understanding of large scale distributed systems
  • Automation – Bash, Python, REST, etc
  • Continuous Integration/Delivery – Jenkins, Buildbot, OpsWorks, Chef, Puppet,Ansible, SaltStack
  • Monitoring – Prometheus, BorgMon, Zabbix, ELK stack
  • Work with product owner(s) to establish service level objectives for a SaaS based product offering
  • Automation and system integrations that allow fully automated operations and deployments to meet SLOs
  • Manage escalations with vendors and internal support teams
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to think clearly, analyze quantitatively, solve problems, scope technical requirements and prioritize work
  • BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent with 7+ years of relevant experience

Preferred

  • Experience with Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments
  • Experience with ElasticSearch
  • Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
  • Working knowledge of HTML5
  • Understanding and experience with code deployment (tagging). 
  • Familiarity with Serverless Computing Technologies like Amazon Lambda, Azure Functions, etc. is a plus
  • Linux and Windows­based systems administration skills in a Cloud or Virtualized environment 
  • Experience building sophisticated and highly automated infrastructure
  • Management of continuous integration servers like Jenkins, Bamboo and TeamCity 
  • Proficient in C++, Java or C
  • Strong scripting skills, i.e., Python, Bash, Ruby, Perl, etc. 
  • Experience with revision control source code repositories (Git, Perforce, SVN)

A little about us:

Core Values: Ixia's Core Values are posted at every Ixia site in every location. Ixia employees use these values to guide their interactions with internal and external customers.

The Ixia Way: Wow our customers! Trust, respect, and develop our people! Listen and be open! Be passionate courageous, and decisive! Win with teamwork and collaboration! Celebrate excellence!

Diversity: Ixia's strong and diverse workforce spreads across multiple continents. Because of our wide range of backgrounds, our employees always manage to bring fresh perspectives, increased creativity and superior problem-solving skills to Ixia. We cherish and embrace our employees' diversity of styles and perspectives and we can truthfully say that diversity is one of our biggest strengths.

To apply:
http://ixiacom.force.com/careers/ts2__JobDetails?jobId=a0x160000055E67AAE&tSource=

Or Apply directly to Ryan Redman: rredman@ixiacom.com

3rd Party Or Unsolicited Resumes Will Not Be Accepted

jobs.title: Flexibly Capable Engineer - Video
jobs.content:
What you would do: If you are  passionate about video software development, we are looking for your kind. You will work with a new team that is taking Mezzanine to the next level. You will be responsible for developing audio and video aspects of our platform, including media capture, transcoding, streaming and rendering.  Your role will include designing and implementing C++ APIs and frameworks for handling video data across distributed, multi-user systems.

Mezzanine is the only product that truly enables rich, real time collaborative work between users situated in the same room or across distances. This is an opportunity to work on one of the coolest technologies being built today.

Responsibilities:
• Implementing efficient mechanisms for streaming video and audio, including compression, bit-rate management, encoding and decoding
• Optimizing video capture for video storage, random access and real time low-latency streaming
• Integrating standards based protocols and 3rd party components
• Creating efficient video and graphics pipelines for parallel rendering across room-scale displays

Requirements:
• Substantial experience delivering production-quality code
• Proficiency in C and C++ in a Linux environment
• Working knowledge of encoding standards, especially MPEG4 (H.264)
• Working knowledge of network protocols, architecture and analysis (IP, TCP, UDP)
• Experience with video streaming protocols (RTSP, RTP, SRTP) and techniques (dynamic bit-rate adjustment, encryption and forward error correction)

Nice to have:
• Experience with 4K video
• Experience with encoding and decoding video in hardware
• Experience with native C++ WebRTC API and NAT traversal protocols (STUN, ICE...)
• Experience working and contributing to Open Source projects (e.g. GStreamer)

Benefits and perks:
• Competitive compensation package of salary and stock options
• Medical, dental, and vision insurance
• 401K plan
• Gourmet lunches 3 days/week

* Please include relevant examples of your work, such as: a link to or bundle of code you’ve written, pointers to topical prose, a link to a mailing list thread in which you submit patches or offer contributions to a project, slides from a presentation you’ve given, or other relevant work.

jobs.title: Chief Java Architect - $100k
jobs.content:
Are you one of top Software Architects in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 10x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.


Company Description:

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.


Job Description:

You will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architecture problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.


Key Responsibilities:

Developing expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products.

Leveraging your broad technology capability set and maintain a level of excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy real enterprise class software

Achieving an expert level understanding of our customers environments and their use of our products.

Architecting and leading weekly technical delivery of one or more products in a way that maintains an unyielding focus on quality while matching the needs of the target customer base.

Creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs for solutions that scale to the customers enterprise/global requirements

Leading a small team of Software Engineers to apply software engineering practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery

Manage accountability of team members, with pinpoint focus on quality; Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

Ensuring our customers are supremely confident in the adv
