jobs.title: Mobile Technology Manager
jobs.content:
Preferred candidates will have a application development background. This position will ensure delivery of mobile and web solutions. Preferred candidates will also have a background in technical leadership and experience with cloud development.


The Technology Solution Delivery Manager is responsible for the successful definition, delivery and support of software solutions to end-user clients to meet business needs. Manages relationships with multiple business stakeholders; assembles and manages a cross functional team required to complete client work; defines implementation plans, effort, and cost; manages risks and problems, assess the quality of the work and ensures the final product meets client expectations. Maintains an awareness of other projects and activities within the division and their possible effect on ongoing department work. Promotes and provides an environment conducive to teaming within a matrix organization.

jobs.title: Android Developer for $42m funded start-up with 450,000 new users per month
jobs.content:
Our engineering teams are passionate about building the best recruitment platform in the world. The teams are responsible for giving Jobandtalent’s service to millions of people, processing millions of job openings, and generating millions of job suggestions. Your code is more than meaningful, it changes lives.


As a member of our engineering team you will build and improve our products, add new features, and work closely with other teams across the company to define our engineering roadmap. Engineering at Jobandtalent is divided into small teams that work independently, focused on a feature set: mobile, candidates, companies, algorithms and architecture are some of those teams. They’re multidisciplinary and manage the life-cycle of any idea from inception to deployment.


Our teams are small, multidisciplinary, and product focused. We take a very lean approach and plan quarterly roadmaps that we keep track of using kanban. We keep bureaucracy out of the equation and always choose metrics-backed decisions.


What we're looking for


You should apply if:


- You've been programming at least 2 years in Android and 5 in JAVA.


- You love to learn and take on challenges.


- There are books about patterns and architecture on your bedside table.


- There is an Uncle Bob picture on your wallet.


- You think that SOLID aren't only five letters.


- A rebel pixel can be your biggest enemy.


- And you develop products to contribute beyond the code.



Why it´s a great place to work


We value learning and feedback and are committed to encouraging and supporting each other’s professional growth. Moreover, we believe in sharing our knowledge with and contributing to the wide tech community. We frequently host guest speakers at our Gin & Talent events, which feature technology and business leaders from top start-ups in the area.


We’ve put a lot of energy into creating an office environment that sparks creativity and promotes social interactions. There are plenty of spaces where you can take a break from work to refresh your mind. Jam in our DJ spot, spend an afternoon in our sofa area, or battle your teammates in a nerf© guns war.

jobs.title: SDE - Software Engineer, Media Asset Management | Time Inc.
jobs.content: As Software Engineer, MAM Integration, you will be hyper-focused on building out integrations between the Evolphin Zoom MAM and a variety of third party systems. You have a thorough understanding of how to extract and embed metadata from/to digital assets, how to move these assets and/or their metadata between systems and how to transcode video. You love automating tasks through code.

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer
jobs.content:
CALLING ALL MOBILE APP DEVELOPERS…


LunarLincoln is a mobile app development shop located in the heart of Nashville. We develop beautifully designed apps for iOS, Android, and Mac. As a small company with big-name clients, we’ve built a great reputation for delivering quality work in a timely manner. We are looking to add a motivated developer to our team. This position provides a great opportunity for developers looking to get into the mobile space or further their career with the many opportunities a small shop provides. Develop your skill base, and help us maintain our growing trajectory as one of Nashville’s most sought after dev shops.


LunarLincoln was born not only from the desire to make quality apps and road test our own ideas but also from past experiences with corporate culture. We endeavor not to micromanage and never to produce subpar solutions. We do, however, have time for the important things, like morning coffee, discussing the latest tech news, and posting distracting gifs to the company chatroom. In addition to loving our day jobs, we value life outside of the office, which is why we only work 35-hour weeks and have great benefits like healthcare, matching retirement contributions, and bi-annual performance bonuses.


Here at LunarLincoln, we like developers who have a passion for learning and can challenge themselves by creatively working through problems. Since this is a small shop, you will become an integral part of our team. New hires must undergo a trial run. Get a feel for our development style, clients, and work/life balance. Candidates will be considered for full-time employment based on performance at the end of the trial period.


If you’re a great software developer, we’d love to meet you. Learn more about how we think and work at our website and blog. Submissions should be made to jobs@lunarlincoln.com.


Must be Tennessee residents or willing to relocate. Note that we do not offer H-1B sponsorship, and that all employees must be U.S. citizens. No recruiters please. No offense guys. We’re just looking to hand-pick someone ourselves.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Lead - ScienceDirect - Java, JVM, React, Node.
jobs.content:
Job description


ScienceDirect is the world's leading collection of science information on the web and Elsevier's flagship product.  A new project is underway to replace the product from the ground up with a brand new, cutting edge technology platform that is fast and reliable and enables continuous delivery so the product team can test new ideas, be more innovative and respond more quickly to rapidly changing customer needs.  This exciting new project is being delivered by newly formed agile teams in London, so this is an opportunity to be part of a new and fast-growing cross-functional development group from the early stages and a chance to help shape the culture and the way the teams work. 


The Role:


We are seeking a Software Engineering Lead to help build the SD Technology team and deliver our product goals. This is a hybrid role involving software engineering and people management. Technologies used by the team are Java, Node.js, Isomporphic React, client-side JavaScript and JVM. You will be a hands-on developer, contributing code in one or more of the above languages/technologies, and you will need to balance your coding responsibilities with line management tasks and providing support to your team members.  The Software Engineering Lead role is distinct from a Technical lead – your direct reports will be able to get further technical leadership and guidance from our technical teams, while you ensure they are settled, integrated and comfortable to perform their role in a creative, welcoming and flexible environment.  


You will be joining a new and fast-growing agile team in our offices in London to help design and build a high volume, high availability and high performance web site.  This is an exciting opportunity to play a leading role in changing the way that web products are delivered within the company, devising and implementing a modern approach to software engineering that enables continuous delivery and releasing features on-demand.  You will be part of a cross-functional product development group using agile management and engineering practices.


Key Tasks



  • Work as part of a highly collaborative, cross-functional, agile product development team to develop a new responsive web application from the ground up

  • Lead and motivate your team to consistently high standards in engineering practices and delivery of quality software

  • Line management tasks for your direct reports, e.g.:

    • appraising performance

    • coaching and providing feedback

    • supporting their professional development

    • helping them to resolve technical and non-technical problems



  • Mentor and train junior or less experienced software engineers, ensuring they are knowledgeable in critical aspects of their roles

  • Web development in Java or JavaScript

  • Integrate with wider enterprise systems using service oriented architecture

  • Write well tested, documented and peer-reviewed code

  • Work with Product Managers and QA to ensure software is high quality and meets user requirements

  • Help to grow the London teams by assisting with the recruitment of other developers and team members

jobs.title: SDE - Lead Engineer; People.com | Time Inc.
jobs.content: As a PHP/JavaScript Lead you will lead a team of developers responsible for building and supporting new and existing Time Inc websites. You’ll be working closely with project stakeholders including editorial, sales, marketing, and business development. Our customers require creative engineering balanced with high quality and a customer focus.

jobs.title: Salesforce Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Salesforce developer passionate about elegant execution on a challenging technical platform, who will work with our team of talented application engineers to design a next generation workflow management experience on Salesforce.
  What You’ll Do:



  • Own significant areas of technical work

  • Design Salesforce development lifecycle to guide changes through multiple stages while minimizing WIP, and implement a continuous delivery pipeline

  • Be a thought leader by taking ownership of our team to greater understanding of Salesforce as platform

  • Know the Salesforce way in-and-out, but be prepared to step outside of that box when you need to in order to achieve a great outcome!

jobs.title: Software Engineer for Neuroscience
jobs.content:
The Seung Lab at Princeton University is looking for talented, enthusiastic, relentlessly curious software engineers to take on the challenge of mapping the mammalian brain. Help us answer the ultimate question: How do the 80 billion neurons in your 3 pound brain create thoughts, feelings, and perceptions?


Here at the Seung Lab, there’s a lot of things happening that you could join in on:



  • Automate reconstruction of neural circuits in the cerebral cortex

  • Develop a computation platform capable of analyzing petavoxel images of brain

  • Work with social computing and citizen science in collaboration with EyeWire

  • Implement the latest and greatest technologies in computer vision and deep learning

  • Whatever you do, you’ll have a direct impact on the future of neuroscience!


Interested in joining the team? Submit your application online. Please also email your CV and a longish code sample directly to Prof. Sebastian Seung <sseung@princeton.edu>.


If you want a better idea about what we’ve been up to, check out the links below. We've been covered by the New York Times, NPR, Wired, and more:



  • http://www.seunglab.org

  • http://bit.ly/SeungNYTmag 

  • http://bit.ly/EyeWireNature

  • http://bit.ly/EyeWireNatureNPR

  • http://bit.ly/EyeWireZachWise

  • http://bit.ly/SeungTEDTalk

jobs.title: Software Development Director for InferMed - Clinical Decision Support
jobs.content:
InferMed's vision is for everyone to receive healthcare that is right, first time, every time.  InferMed makes it possible for every clinician to choose the most appropriate pathway and treatment for each patient, regardless of the complexity of their disease, the patient gender or their location. By doing so, InferMed helps to improve care outcomes while taking unnecessary costs out of the system.  With Arezzo and MACRO we are also uniquely placed to promote synergy between clinical research and practice, driving a virtuous circle of continual improvement in best practice



Based from new offices in the City of London this position is responsible for all aspects of technology and development leadership for MACRO and Arezzo products.  This position sets the architectural standard for the workgroup as well as providing the team with day-to-day management and direction to accomplish on-time, efficient delivery of product development goals. Additionally, the position will also lead a development team to perform research, design, and software development assignments within a software functional area and provide direct input to project plans, schedules, and methodology in the development of cross-functional software products.



The markets that these products serve are highly regulated and the new agile processes will need to meet these requirements.  This role reports to the Director Software Development EMEALA and will also line manage a new Clinical Key development team.



Key Responsibilities:




  • Lead internal and external technology resources.

  • Ensure that the development team and processes meet the regulatory environment for the Arezzo and MACRO products.

  • Successfully partner and lead offshore resources in solving complex business needs.

  • Perform reviews to ensure enterprise and architectural standards and processes are followed.

  • Complete management responsibilities to include performance management, hiring, and coaching of staff.

  • Utilize best practices and understands emerging trends.

  • Write advanced complex code for computer systems and serve as a senior source of expertise.

  • Manage system and user acceptance testing cycles to ensure accurate and quality business solutions.

  • Lead the development of technical standards, and perform reviews to ensure enterprise and architectural standards and processes are followed.

  • Serve as a primary technical point of contact for external technology resources.

  • Recommend technical strategy and direction across functional area.

  • Participate in development and evolution of architecture.

  • Consult with stakeholders to find alternative work-arounds during system outages.

  • Provide design input across a product.

  • Work directly with customers and end users.

  • Serve as acknowledged “go to” person on coding and technical issues.

  • Interface with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.

  • Write and review portions of detailed specifications for the development of system components of moderate complexity.

  • Complete bug fixes.

  • Design and work with complex data models.

  • Carry out management responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies, procedures, and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; and addressing complaints and resolving problems.

  • Ensure all staff is provided with training and resources needed to perform their jobs to the most outstanding degree possible. Ensure all staff is provided with frequent feedback and coaching in order to meet and exceed individual and team performance goals consistently.

  • Manage and encourage new ideas from staff to foster improvements through innovations.

  • Empower the staff to be accountable and responsible for their own actions and decisions.

  • Seek diverse ideas and perspectives from a variety of sources to create better solutions, products, and services.

jobs.title: SDE - Software Engineer, Video | Time Inc.
jobs.content: As the Video Player Software Engineer, you will be developing, integrating and standardizing a player experience across multiple platforms and brands. You will also be the expert on all things video player for a large team of software engineers across the globe. You must have a thorough understanding of how advertising and analytics integrate with the video player and how the player integrates with web and mobile content.

jobs.title: Programmatic Product Manager
jobs.content:
We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced Programmatic Product Manager (m/f) that has worked with in the programmatic advertising environment (DSP, SSP, DMP or Exchange) before and has a strong technical background to bring plista´s programmatic products to the next level. You will be our expert for all our Real Time /Programmatic products and will work in a cross-functional team tasked with developing leading real time recommender technology, data driven products and features within the plista portfolio. Working with our internal data engineering team and external technology parties you will identify product opportunities and further develop our current data products. You have the chance to work in an international environment in bi-weekly SCRUM sprints and grow further both personally and professionally.


 Your responsibilities:



  • Coordinate with all participants in the digital ecosystem to develop strategy for, and enhancements to plista´s proprietary programmatic products

  • Responsible for managing market research and opportunity assessment on new ideas and concepts

  • Establish and communicate the product management roadmap for all relevant stakeholders

  • Work as a part of a highly collaborative cross-functional team to oversee the planning, development and design of strategy from product initiation decision through the end of the product life cycle.

  • Build relationships with internal and external stakeholders to gather feedback for development of product offerings

  • Work closely with business teams to market and appropriately monetize new products

  • Building a comprehensive set of product Specs, and working with our engineering team to translate this into a real product

  • Translate and present products to internal and external customers with technical/non-technical background on a senior level

  • Be the visible advocate for your products internally and externally

jobs.title: Software Expert Computer Vision / Machine Learning
jobs.content:
Hexagon (www.hexagon.com) is a global supplier of technologies for geodesy and metrology solutions, providing a broad array of modern systems for the capture, visualization, modeling and technical use of spatial information.


The Hexagon Technology Center (HTC) is situated in Heerbrugg, Switzerland, sharing the headquarters of Leica Geosystems. HTC and Leica Geosystems are part of the global Hexagon group.


HTC drives the evaluation and introduction of new technologies to our partners. These technology projects encompass the fields of mechanics, electronics, optics, software (computer vision) and laser technology.
To complement our international team of physicists, engineers, and mathematicians we are looking for a Software Expert Computer Vision / Machine Learning (f/m) whose main tasks will include:



  • Contribution in feasibility studies to investigate opportunities in the fields of surveying, metrology, security, agriculture, etc.

  • Development of machine-learning algorithms and evaluation on real-life problems

  • Prototypical development of software modules for object detection, pattern recognition, classification, etc.

jobs.title: Lead Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Mic's Lead Data Engineer will own the way we collect, analyze, and query data across the company.  This person will work across a variety of teams to understand data needs, including but not limited to editorial analytics, sales, and product management.  This hire will up our game and help us to reason with data in all phases of developing a product - from setting requirements to implementation.


The Lead Data Engineer will also manage the development of our in-house data platform.  We collect and process over 300 million data points each month, using keen.io, AWS S3, AWS Redshift, AWS Lambda & MySql.  They will manage this process, and also manage relationships with external data visualization/reporting vendors.

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About EMS Software:


If you had the best system for managing meetings and events which powers some of the highest profile spaces in the world (like the NASDAQ bell!), what would you do? Make it even better! The EMS Software team is consistently delivering new features to its suite of products and we are just getting started. We want to grow our team, tackle even bigger challenges and do amazing things. We work in small, concentrated teams to constantly improve our code base, and have amassed a large backlog of interesting technical challenges and product initiatives. We want to grow to enable even greater success within our industry. This is where you come in!


Job Overview:


We are seeking a Principal Software Engineer to help build out our Software as a Service (SaaS) platform. We're looking for a dynamic individual who is no stranger to building well-designed, high-performance and secure REST APIs. You will start by learning from the experiences of our current team and on premise offerings and become intimately familiar with our .NET technology stack. As you improve your skills, you will contribute your SaaS experiences by architecting from the ground up a new PaaS that our yet-to-be-built edge applications in the SaaS world will use. You will work with the other developers to choose the future technology stack makes the most sense for the business. You will leverage your experience to establish best practices for backend development and drive the team and the codebase to a higher level.


After the first month, as your familiarity with the product grows, your responsibilities will grow as well. You will mentor other team members in established patterns and continue to hone your skills as you push the architecture towards more stable solutions.


Responsibilities:


Within two months of your start, you will utilize our chosen technology stack (for example, Java, Scala and Play) to create well-tested, low-latency REST APIs.


Drive backend architectural decisions to develop a maintainable and reliable set of edge applications.


Collaborate with other teams to build shared microservices that can serve many applications and scale independently.


Enable our product team to tap into our valuable data sources and build incredible features for our customers.


Actively participate in all SaaS projects and work together to build high quality solutions.


Present ideas in the form of brown bags to all engineers to help shape our technical landscape.


Provide constructive feedback on pull requests to increase code quality.

jobs.title: Technical Business Analyst
jobs.content:
Main responsibilities

Understand the needs:
• Analyze business requirements submitted by Product Management.
• Review change requests.
• Provide information to Product Management as necessary for the elaboration of business cases and RFP responses.



Define the solution:
• Elaborate functional specifications.
• Define detailed application wireframes and UI flows 
• Deliver test plans and test scenarios.
• Interface with relevant departments to identify interaction with other Amadeus packages and assure functional compatibility.



Manage quality:
• Carry out the functional walk-through of the product with the Development team and Product Management.
• Test product in order to ensure compliance of the delivered functionality and system integrity, and perform functional sign off.
• Ensure production integrity by validating and prioritizing reported problems.



Interface and communicate:
• With Product Management.
• With customer during functional specification, testing and initial implementation phases as necessary.
• With developpers during construction phase



Other related duties as required.

jobs.title: Manager of Software Development
jobs.content:
You are a catalyst of change.  You have the ability to learn continuously and adapt easily. You create situations where engineers can give their best while providing technical leadership and taking responsibility for the professional growth of individuals on your team.


Managers of Software Development provide technical leadership in a specific technology layer or area of the product and are responsible for the professional growth and development of engineers working in that layer. As a Chapter Lead, they provide direct 1-on-1 mentoring and coaching to a small group of junior software engineers of similar skills (called a Chapter) to improve their skills in a specific technology layer while also handling general HR management responsibilities. Managers are servant/leaders who should enjoy helping groups succeed.  They spend roughly 75% of their time as a developer and 25% managing direct reports responsibilities. 

Responsibilities:



  • Deep technical understanding in a specific technology layer, providing effective code reviews and technical feedback (must be comfortable hands on coding)

  • Effectively manage up to 6 direct reports through mentoring and coaching.

  • Develop and guide the career paths of direct reports.

  • Provide input to create staffing plans with departmental leadership.

  • Be an agent for change, at both the team and departmental level.

  • Foster a culture of learning and growth.

  • Performance of HR Management tasks related to each direct report; such as timesheet approval, communication of raises and bonuses, performance reviews, etc.


Preferred Experience Level: 5+ years in software development, with 1+ years as a mentor or manager


Education: B.S. in Computer Science or related field, advanced degree preferred

About our Environment:


Our technology stack is modern and constantly evolving some of the tools & technologies we leverage include Java, Javascript, React.js, HTML5, CSS3, MVC, RESTful services, SOAP,  ElasticSearch, Jenkins, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and Git.


We practice Agile and Extreme Programming (XP), Test Driven Development (TDD), Continuous Integration CI/CD, do code reviews and are always open to new ideas that will help drive a highest quality code base.

jobs.title: Sr. C++ Software Developer
jobs.content:
The Synopsys code instrumentation team is looking for someone with strong C++ skills to help develop a state of the art code instrumentation engine.

This position requires deep understanding of C++, compilers, linkers and ASTs. You will initially develop and extend the core runtime library that is called from the instrumentation call sites. The runtime library is a core component of our code instrumentation engine. You will also work on other components of the code instrumentation engine as necessary, including automatic injection of instrumentation into source code.

The ideal candidate is someone who can communicate well in English, who is easy to work with, who has a strong understanding of C++, compilers, linkers and ASTs, who insists on producing high quality work, who likes a challenge and who has a strong desire to learn, grow and improve.


The Responsibilities

Developing a core component of our code instrumentation engine—namely a runtime library
Building runtime integrations with various linkers on different platforms
Extending and enhancing the code injection component
Analyze the performance of the runtime library and injected code
Writing tests to validate the correctness of your code

The Compensation

Competitive base salary
Annual bonuses based on personal, business unit and company performance
Health benefits (medical, dental, vision)
Matching RRSP/401k contribution program
Monthly commute allowance
Employee referral bonuses
Insurance (travel, life, short/long-term disability)
Synopsys is a meritocracy (get rewarded based on merit—produce more, earn more)

The Environment

San Francisco
You will work in an open concept office one block from AT&T Ball Park
The Caltrain station is one block from the office
Seattle
You will have the option to work in our Columbia Center office or in our Fremont office.
The Link Light Rail station is one block from the office
Calgary
You will work in a newly renovated, open concept office in downtown Calgary
The LRT station is one block from the office
Foosball/ping-pong for mental breaks (and fun!)
You will work on top of the line equipment:
Newest laptop (MacBook Pro Retina)
Dual 24" monitors
Ergo keyboard

The Team

We have high standards
We work on challenging problems
Our goal is to produce excellent software and have fun while doing it
We help each other

jobs.title: SHOP MASTER
jobs.content:
Founded in 1865 as a land-grant institution adjacent to downtown Lexington, UK is nestled in the scenic heart of the Bluegrass Region of Kentucky. Recently ranked as one of the safest, most creative, and the brainiest cities in the nation, Lexington is an ideal location to experience the work-life balance that the University strives to provide to its employees. Visit the University of Kentucky Website and see for yourself what makes UK one great place to work!

In advancing our culture of making, the position of Shop Master in the College of Design focuses on forward thinking about design and experimental fabrication in an academic setting. Specifically, the position centers on taking the College of Design forward as a larger, cross-campus collaborative fabrication hub as we transition into a new facility during the next three years. We are seeking applicants who have an analog to digital appreciation and understanding of fabrication with any specializations in wood, metal, or plastics. The Shop Master will collaborate with College of Design faculty and administrators to establish a new vision for the integration of the workshop concept into our new strategic plan. As we move forward the Shop Master will be overseeing evolving rapid prototyping technologies (including various types of 3D printers, desktop CNC mills, and robotic arms) and must be willing to learn and grow as technologies advance. In addition to overseeing the safe and effective operation of the shop facilities, the Shop Master will be expected to design and teach workshop courses that interweave with foundation level studios for multidisciplinary design, and participate as a critic with other faculty in studio reviews.

Our resolution for 2016 is a re-imagined College of Design, infused with Kentucky’s indigenous spirit. The vision is bold: new programs, new partners, new identity, all built upon our history and its imprint on our unfolding story.

Submit an online application to requisition number RE08140 at: http://ukjobs.uky.edu/postings/115648. Contact HR Employment for questions at: (859) 257-9555, option 2. Application deadline is August 21, 2016.

The University of Kentucky is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from minorities and women.

jobs.title: Explore the future of eye tracking: Join our X-team!
jobs.content:
Do you want to shape the future of gaze interaction and work on exciting concepts years into the future? Do you have a passion for finding the right mix between creative hacking and applied research in a HCI environment?


If so, we might have the position you are looking for!


In Tobii’s X-Team we investigate eye tracking and interaction concepts with a time frame of 24 months. In a small team of highly motivated independent thinkers we investigate what might redefine eye trackers, the desktop and beyond. We don’t consider us developers, UX or scientists, but we can be any if the situation demands it. Our outputs are prototypes, leads and knowledge, and we try to take the fastest path to core of a question. 


The role and responsibilities


This role offers a variety of tasks where no day are ever the same. Your role will be to take on different projects and ideas and investigate them further. This is an exciting opportunity, where you will explore the future of eye tracking and interaction in a unique blend of hacking, research and general wizardry.


We offer you



  • A project position in the X-Team, Tobii’s spearhead team for future interactions and eye tracking concepts 

  • Work in a fast-paced, highly agile “no-week-like-the-other” team 

  • Brilliant and fun colleagues


All our jobs at Tobii are about innovation, passion and not the least - making things real.


We are looking for someone who



  • Has an M Sc. in computer science, physics or equivalent.

  • Can hack things deep in the system level and has very good engineering skills - and has found the perfect balance between the two.

  • Has good programming skills, e.g., in C# and JavaScript / TypeScript (e.g., contributed to or founded open source projects).

  • Has practical HCI and user interface experience.

  • Is creative and like to work with several projects at the same time.


We find it to be a strong merit if you have knowledge in eye tracking technology.


To be successful in this role and at Tobii you need to be self-going and manage to work with very little specification and high system uncertainty. Since you will work in a fast-pace environment, we need you to be flexible and have the ability and will to switch between different projects. 


The project will last for approximately 3 to 6 months, with start as soon as possible. If successfully completed, a full time contract will be offered. 


Please address your questions to Ralf Biedert (ralf.biedert@tobii.com), and submit your resume through our website as soon as possible. Attached to it should be a brief cover letter (0.5 - 1p) of how the task you are applying for would benefit your academic résumé, recent grade transcripts, and a proof of prior experience (e.g., links to projects / code of yours, published papers, …). Don’t wait, at Tobii we move quickly!

jobs.title: Cloud Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
Summary:


You’ll be part of a small, focused team that builds out the future of our company. You’ll start by running and improving our existing managed services operation, and you’ll serve a critical role as we build out our next-generation SaaS offering.



We are looking for an exceptional Cloud Operations Engineer that lives by the philosophy of the “customer is first.”   We’re the leader in systems to manage events, meetings, and workspaces. We work with an amazing list of great companies and educational institutions to help them manage and optimize their use of all kinds of spaces: meeting rooms, workspaces, executive briefing centers, classrooms, athletic fields, event space, and many other types.



We want to bring your experience working with cloud-based production systems into an energetic, fun environment where the work you will do makes a difference.  On a daily basis you will:



  • Manage our customers’ cloud-hosted applications, deploy new customers, and migrate existing customers to new releases

  • Collaborate and use professional concepts to resolve issues and assist in our design decisions

  • Work with Development teams as a resource regarding cloud technologies

  • Review and respond to cloud hosting requirements from customers and prospects



Essential Duties and Responsibilities



  • Drive customer satisfaction by providing world-class application availability and protection of customer confidentiality

  • Enhance the scalability of our products and systems for our clients

  • Work with cloud vendors on external technical support, upgrades, problem resolution

  • Understand the IaaS environment to ensure a continued strong foundation of a stable, reliable, highly available, and highly secure least privilege policy

  • Understand, implement and automate security controls, governance processes and compliance validation

  • Assist in the establishment of 24x7 performance monitoring and response protocols

  • Participate and provide recommendations on penetration testing activities and disaster recovery exercises

  • Ensure efficiency and predictability of deployments and upgrades

  • Provide on-call support outside of normal work hours and work days

jobs.title: UI Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Summary:



Visionist Inc. is seeking an enthusiastic Desktop Java Software Developer to maintain and provide enhancements for a large suite of SIGINT analyst and developer tools including both GUI and back-end solutions in a distributed application. 


This opportunity is great for someone looking to expand their knowledge of java tools with a small group of experienced and passionate software developers. The work environment is casual and team oriented; it offers new high speed equipment and lots of developer tools including all the IDEs and/or plug-ins you could ever want. 


This is unique opportunity provides deep insight into overall mission and direct support of users in the field. Few positions offer such a connection to a critical security mission.





Core Responsibilities:




  • In an AGILE/SCRUM development environment provide break/fix solutions for a large suite of software tools widely used by Intel and field data analysts and developers

  • Develop and maintain a variety of front and back end software applications including DSP, data visualization, analysis, database connectivity, and Web based UIs

  • Utilize modern technologies and COTS products to provide requested customer enhancements

  • Attend monthly customer meetings and assist with task prioritization and scheduling

jobs.title: Junior Product Owner
jobs.content:
London; full time; fixed term to 31/03/2017 (with poss of extension depending on funding)


£25,000-£30,000 per annum


Into Film is an education charity that puts film at the heart of children and young people’s educational and personal development.  Working with the education and informal youth sectors, we provide 5-19 year olds with unparalleled opportunities to learn through and about film.  Our ambitious UK-wide programme includes a network of extra-curricular film clubs, educational resources, training opportunities, a cinema-based film festival and the annual Into Film Awards. To our knowledge, no other UK-wide cultural education initiative has such a high take-up by schools and youth groups, with a network of over 16,000 registered clubs.  We work with a range of partners in England, Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales, in addition to the film industry at large and several high profile ambassadors.  Our work is supported by the BFI, through the National Lottery, and other film organisations including Cinema First.


Reporting to the Product Manager, the Junior Product Owner sits within the Digital Team and works alongside the Product Manager to commission, develop and launch new digital products in development as well as support the development and maintenance of existing Into Film sites.  They support the Product Manager in the timely and successful delivery of any new digital products in development. This includes working to produce and manage the Agile requirements, gather stakeholder input and feedback and lead on the delivery of these sites.  They play a key role in managing the relationships with internal teams as well as with external digital partners/agencies.


Responsibilities:



  • To gather stakeholder and user requirements for new products – helping facilitate brainstorms and meetings with internal and external stakeholders

  • To research collaborations and opportunities with new technologies, agencies or digital partners – assessing content and functionality for inclusion on our products.

  • To prioritise requirements and provide project status updates - working closely on the build with stakeholders.

  • To work closely with UX on wireframes and designs - ensuring that they are delivered on time, meet our design guidelines and evolve with stakeholder feedback.

  • Commissioning, engaging and managing relationships with external digital agencies to build new products - including writing project briefs, shortlisting agencies and inputting into statements of work.

  • To manage and prioritise the product and sprint backlog to meet our goals and KPIs.

  • To define and elaborate user stories - creating and managing them in JIRA.

  • To write the acceptance criteria for user stories and do the acceptance testing.

  • To plan and theme sprints and communicate with the developers.

  • To participate in the Scrum Meetings in the role of a Product Owner - attending daily stand-up meetings, reviews, retrospectives, sprint and release planning meetings.

  • To lead on the development of the sites including co-ordinating the work of external agencies with that of our internal services team to manage co-dependencies and integrations.

  • To work closely with the Product Manager and Solutions Architect to ensure that systems and functionality are reusable.

  • To work closely with content teams, Comms web team and project leads to plan and scope content requirements and manage content delivery deadlines and the timely upload of assets. This may include (where not possible to delegate) gathering, producing and uploading assets, writing copy and ensuring sign off of assets.

  • Assessing, refashioning and migrating relevant content from the existing sites (e.g. Film Club) to new products.

  • To run user testing to gather feedback and ensure sites meet our user needs.

  • To work closely with development to ensure that sites are quality assured and meet our technical guidelines.

  • Writing test scripts, performing manual testing and smoke testing of any new features and bug fixes.

  • To plan releases and work closely with the Scrum Master to ensure sites deliver on time and to budget.

  • Help manage the Digital Team’s relationships with all the internal teams to ensure that we are all working to common standards, strategy and timelines.

  • To produce handover documentation and run training with internal teams.

  • Report on the analytics and interpret those analytics to suggest product enhancements.

  • Raising any copyright clearance or safety issues that may arise.


Please download the job description and apply at https://intofilm.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk06dqd.  The closing date for applications is 9am on Wednesday 3rd August, with interviews 11th and 12th August.


Please note that we will only consider application forms uploaded at the link above - CVs or email applications will not be considered.

jobs.title: Speculative Applications  Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At our Cranfield based Web Development Centre of Excellence, we are responsible for the development of a number key components of the iDirect product, as well as providing professional services, training and product support to our global user-base. Satellite networks are complex systems; configuration, maintenance, monitoring and reporting is made a lot easier with our innovative web-based Network Management System tools we develop here at Cranfield.


iDirect Pulse, our primary NMS, is made up of three key components; a C++ based Back-End which collects and caches real-time information from around the network, a JavaScript based Front-End which visualises this information for the user, and a Perl/Node based Middle-End, which acts as an interface between the BE and FE. All three components seamlessly work together to allow for management of the wider iDirect satellite platform.


Our organisation as a whole is very much Scrum/Agile focussed, and as such we work in diverse teams where thoughts and ideas are shared and collaboration is actively encouraged. This gives all our staff the opportunity to work across the product, really getting to understand exactly how and why it operates, and how it fits seamlessly within the larger iDirect communication platform.



About you:


We’re looking for the very best candidates to join us in Cranfield, where you will work alongside a wider team of smart, creative and dedicated colleagues. We value a good approach to problem solving, logical thinking and the enthusiasm, passion and ability to learn new skills quickly


Those who are successful within iDirect:



  • Are excited by and demonstrate a passion for the latest developments in web technology

  • Enjoy regularly coming up with clever, creative solutions to difficult problems

  • Have strong communication skills, and enjoy sharing ideas and knowledge with technical and non-technical colleagues across the globe

  • Show a strong ownership ethic

  • Display both flexibility and dedication to their work, colleagues and product

  • Show a genuine interest in learning about satellite communication

jobs.content:

jobs.title: UX Developer
jobs.content:
Come help us create the future of iDirect. We're looking for passionate, create UX developers who are excited about solving new problems.

What you will do:



  • Evangelize user experience across the organization, both in terms of general best practices and research findings specific to iDirect



  • Analyze real user behavior and make actionable, data-driven user experience recommendations based on a combination of existing knowledge and learnings from our unique user base

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Developer
jobs.content:
Intelliware is looking for full stack software developers to join our dev team. If you’re looking to work on everything from front-end to server-side code and database architecture, we’d love to hear from you.


At Intelliware you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a top-notch team and work on a wide range of complex projects. We have a unique team-based Agile environment with collaborative project rooms where you’ll find continuous learning opportunities and challenging work. Project teams work closely with client subject matter experts, end users and IT teams to deliver anything from proof-of-concept prototypes to bulletproof, long living, high volume production applications.


While working within a team in an Agile environment, you will be:



  • Designing high quality applications that are highly scalable and extensible

  • Estimating, tasking and prototyping

  • Contributing clear and maintainable code to a shared codebase

  • Collaborating with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation

  • Investigating, learning and applying new technologies/processes

  • Clarifying requirements with team and client representatives


Intelliware’s niche is delivering mission critical software applications for complex business or technical challenges. The nature of our work allows project teams the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies although our core development is in Java and JavaScript. Recent projects we’ve delivered include technologies such as: AngularJS, jQuery, Meteor, Node.js, MongoDB, Apache Wicket, Spring Batch, Spring Data JPA and Hibernate.

jobs.title: Graphic Designer - Interactive
jobs.content:
Cortina Productions designs and produces award-winning interactive applications and films for museums. Our interactive experiences allow deeper exploration of exhibition content in new and exciting ways. Our signature films touch visitors on an emotional level, opening their hearts and minds to new ways of considering exhibition content. From multi-user interactive installations to 4D theaters, we stay on the forefront of technology to develop innovative avenues for expression.

Our workplace in McLean, Virginia is located steps away from the McLean Silver Line metro station and is a modern work environment designed to maximize creativity and team collaboration. We are fortunate to work on some of the best projects in the world from the National Civil Rights Museum and seven different Presidential Libraries, to the San Francisco 49ers museum and the Smithsonian Institution’s National Museum of American History.

Graphic Designer - Interactive

Cortina Productions of McLean, VA is seeking an experienced Interactive Graphic Designer to be part of the creative team for the design and development of innovative interactive exhibits for museums. Successful candidates will bring innovative conceptual and graphic design skill for interactive content delivery and user interface design, and think creatively as well as strategically in design development. Must have expert level proficiency with the entire Adobe Creative Design Suite.​

Job Requirements:

5+ ​ years experience and BFA/MFA in Graphic Design
Strong visual design skills, including an eye for good typography, composition, and use of color
Demonstrated experience creating user interfaces in 2D and 3D, development of color schemes with a strong understanding of composition
Demonstrated experience producing design process deliverables – wireframes, style frames, experience map, mood boards, etc.
Experience with touch-screen interactive applications
Expert level in Adobe Creative Suite software including Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign
Experience designing interfaces for Unity, HTML 5, WPF, and Flash-based design and animation environments
Strong written and verbal communication skills, strong organizational, project and time management skills
A great attitude with an emphasis on design excellence
Ability to work effectively and successfully in a collaborative team-oriented work environment
Natural ability to work effectively under pressure and meet tight deadlines
3D Experience a plus

Compensation and benefits:
Salary commensurate with experience and an excellent benefit plan are included. Please send cover letter, resume, salary requirements, and three professional references to latashahughes@cortinaproductions.com.

jobs.title: Senior Graphic Designer
jobs.content:
The Graphic Designer will assist the marketing team by developing and executing multi-media creative campaigns. The ideal candidate will maintain the brand’s vision and identity while advising on best practices to help further the brand’s growth. In this position, you are leading the integrated creative for 3 brands. You will need to be able to work with the marketing team but be able to think out of the box and take initiative to always push the creative work to the next level.

Creative Responsibilities:
Develop and execute creative design for:
-3 footwear brands
-Work with photographer to lead/manage lifestyle photo shoots for 2 brands
-Take all projects from start to finish – Concept to production
-Work with vendors to get quotes/ choose materials/ supply finished print ready files
-Print advertising and sales collateral for magazine/trade ads, look books, catalogs, brochures, pamphlets, etc.
-Branding, logos, packaging
-Digital advertisements
-Email Blasts
-Promotional items, point-of-purchase displays
-Trade show graphics and displays
-Direct mail
-Brand’s website assets
-Social campaigns
-Retouch lifestyle and product photography

QUALIFICATIONS:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and or ability required.

Desired Skills and Experience:
Bachelors Degree in Graphic Design or related field a must
Minimum 3-4 years graphic design experience
-Stays calm under pressure with great time management
-Willing to learn and maintain current design trends/technology
-Willingness to copy edit/proofread, own your work
-Strong print production/ pre-press knowledge
-Detail oriented – this is a small team that gets a lot done. You will need to manage multiple projects from start to finish (concept to production)
-Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign)
-Strong working knowledge of CSS, HTML and responsive web design a plus
-Video production experience a plus
-Must be a self-starter but also have the ability to work with a team
-Strong communication skills a must
-Ability to work on multiple projects at one time

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Crest Financial, one of the fastest growing companies in Utah, is growing and looking to hire a few new Software Developers. We are an exciting entrepreneurial company providing services for the Finance industry. Our company uses many of the latest technologies offered by Microsoft. We have been in business for over 10 years with continued growth each year. We are located in Draper UT.

We have openings for a developer (2 or more years experience). This is a permanent position. Salary is commensurate with experience. Our company offers health insurance, 401K, life insurance and vacation/holiday benefits. Candidates must pass a background check and drug screening.

What Youll Do:

Developers will be responsible for creating business related desktop and web applications. The role is a mix of new development, application enhancements, and application support.


Benefits


Compensation, Perks & Benefits

We know that talented people are attracted to companies with long term success, an amazing culture and one that provides competitive pay, comprehensive benefits and outstanding career advancement opportunities. If hired, you can expect;

  • Competitive Base Salary
  • Medical/Dental/Vision Coverage, 401K,
  • Paid Time Off
  • Fun and relaxed work environment


Founded in 2005, Crest has been able to achieve success due to our awesome employees that believe in our mission statement of "...provide Families with No Credit Needed financing through selected Retail partnerships". We truly believe in helping our customers and retailers nationwide with options that they normally wouldn't have access to! We are looking for individuals that are up for the challenge in helping us not just maintain but exceed our past growth!


A truly Employee-Centered company, Crest Financial believes in hiring the right people, for the right job, and giving them the creative freedom to use their strengths to benefit the team.

Crest Financial does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Crest Financial does business.

jobs.title: Linux Cloud Hosting Platform in Toronto Seeking DevOps Talent
jobs.content:
VM Farms is looking for experienced Linux System Administrators who want to grow their career using modern tools and methods. If you have a DevOps mindset and want to ensure your skill set remains modern and relevant, this is the job you're looking for!


This position employs DevOps tools and methodologies to service our clients and continuously expand our automation platform. As a part of the operations team, you will use tools such as Github, Puppet, Terraform, Packer, Jenkins, Vagrant, and Ansible to build and refine automated workflows.


If you're the type of person that enjoys troubleshooting, responding to customer inquiries, and finding the right solutions to technical challenges in a Linux environment, this position will keep you engaged. We work with a lot of OSS web application technologies like PHP, Python, Ruby, Java, Node.js, and Go Lang. These are typically paired with OSS RDBMS or NOSQL backends like MySQL, PostgreSQL, Mongodb, Redis, or Cassandra. New tech is constantly coming out and we offer a great environment to learn and incorporate these web technologies in to our platform as well as your CV.


If you're the type that values research, planning, and properly documenting your work, you're on the right track. Our environment is highly collaborative and as a result you will partner with development, sales, management, and vendors to accomplish our goals.


We're considering the position for two different shifts:


- 9am-5pm EDT


- 1pm-9pm EDT (If you are located in the PDT or MDT timezone, there is consideration for remote work.)

jobs.title: Sr./Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Software Engineer to join the development team behind the API layer for the Search API (http://places.demo.api.here.com).


 HERE location services are used by millions of people every day on mobile devices, in cars, wearables and on the web. We are pushing the boundaries of, and extending the horizons for the highly-autonomous driving, Virtual Reality and IoT. 


 Our team is part of the wider HERE Search and Places group.


 We work very closely with the Search Backend and the Analytics team to integrate new features and help to improve the ranking of the search results. Every team member gets the opportunity to analyse, develop, test software, and eventually press the release button.


Also, the team supports the analysis of usage data and the monitoring of production systems.


The API layer is implemented in Scala and we are committed to test-driven development and pervasive automation of everyday tasks. We run extensive functional and performance test suites upon every commit. We also make extensive use of Java in the search backend as well as JavasScript for our playground and demo UIs.


 
The implementation of the API is pretty mature and features its own little acceptance test framework that enables you to really develop in a test-driven fashion.
 
Your role encompasses working on features and technical tasks in a self-directed fashion, working with product management to analyse requirements, talking to stakeholders, designing, implementing and documenting solutions as well as testing and reviewing your
colleagues' work.

jobs.title: Experienced SysAdmin
jobs.content:
Who We Are

Credit Card Compare is a growing comparison website focussed solely on credit cards in the Australian market. We work hard to make it as easy as possible for customers to compare hundreds of credit card offers from 50+ banks and make an informed decision. Our team is mostly all remote, with staffers spread across 4 continents.

How We Work

We use Slack for day-to-day communication and Trello for managing the workflow. We don't really do much by way of internal email. Everyone in the companyâincluding our foundersâhave worked remotely previously. We know the benefits of this style of working and try to mitigate the problems it brings too.

About You & What We Need

  • You should be AWS certified. Spinning up an instance is something you can do with one hand behind your back.
  • NGINX is your best friend. You know it inside out and have experience in tuning a server for performance. You can also lock it down like Fort Knox.
  • MySQL, memcache, DNS and IP addressing, VPCs, subnets, etc. These are your bread and butter.
  • Working with Google Apps for Work is a breeze. Postfix and SendGrid too.
  • You are always looking for efficiencies, performance improvements, and more automation.
  • You are not the SysAdmin from Jurassic World. We appreciate that was a funny character, but... yea. You're not that guy.
  • It goes without saying that you have excellent English, both written and verbal.

How It Will Work

  • You can work from wherever you want.
  • Schedules are flexible, but you would be expected to work Mon - Fri. You don't have to do Sydney work hours.
  • You will be the go-to person for anything within the SysAdmin realm.
  • It's not a one-way street. Speak up and tell us what we can improve, whether in the tech we use or the way we work together.

To apply: Send your resume to charlene@creditcardcompare.com.au

jobs.title: Senior C# Engineer
jobs.content:
Sr. Software Engineer


(Advertising Technology / Marketing Automation)

jobs.title: Open challenge in Technology
jobs.content:
Flow Traders is looking for IT staff to support our business and its growth strategies. We are not making it easy for ourselves though.  We don't just want to hire IT skills.  We want to hire those rare jewels of the IT industry, namely IT Talent with strong personalities.  We are looking for creative people that can also function within our risk-free structure.  We are looking for perfectionists who actually manage to get things done.  And to make it just a little harder on ourselves, applicants need a thick skin and a love of pressure.


As an applicant, you should be geeky yet bold, off-the-wall yet structured, and a perfectionist who actually manages to get things done. 

If you can't sleep at night until you've worked out why you're measuring 0.000001% packet loss between your NIC capture and your OS capture, read on.

From our experience, the perks far outweigh the effort.  We let you purchase whatever tools you need to help us generate P&L.  We take you on holiday once a year.  We let you travel between offices. We have an open bar. We offer great technical challenges in a fast paced environment where people are ambitious, driven and love teamwork. Basically, we do everything we can to make your life sweet. 

You will start your career on our support desk.  The requests for assistance will fly at you from each and every direction.

You will need to work your socks off in your Flow career, because 12 months later if you have shown the team that you are more than capable, more than willing, and generally top notch, you'll then be presented with the opportunity to move to a more specialist area.  That is, only if you want to.  Some folks simply don't want to leave the support desk. It is the hotbed of activity and the main hub of almost everything that goes on during the trading day.  It is undoubtedly where the action is.  You'll be exposed to Software, Hardware, Operating Systems, Networking.  You name it, you'll need to fix it. 

 
Hopefully by now you've realized we're presenting you with a challenge!

jobs.title: Java Developers Glasgow Technology Centre
jobs.content:
Glasgow has been home to JP Morgan’s award winning Technology Centre since 1999. With more than 1400 Technologists designing, building and supporting global systems, our centre is one of the largest IT employers in Scotland. Our firm lives and breathes technology, with over 40,000 tech employees located in 13 strategic hubs around the world.


Due to ongoing investment and expansion at our award winning Glasgow Technology Centre, we have a number of new opportunities available for talented Java Developers. Located in the heart of Glasgow City Centre, our centre is one of 2 strategic, pure technology hubs globally at JP Morgan.


Our opportunities offer the chance to work on interesting challenges and projects, with what are truly cutting edge technologies.



Responsibilities include:


• Delivery of software on time and on budget, based on original scope & requirements


• Designing software and producing scalable and resilient technical designs


• Digesting and understanding Business Requirements and designing new modules/functionality to meet those needs


• Creating Automated Unit Tests using Flexible/Open Source Frameworks using a Test Driven Development approach


• Partner with supporting tech leads to develop realistic and achievable project estimates


• Analysis and build within Control, Stability, Resiliency, Capacity & Performance areas


• Testing: Unit, SIT & UAT planning and management


• Robust delivery of code into the production environment


• Take part in decisions affecting long range organizational goals & strategic planning.


• Proactively look to develop, implement and further development best practices across the group. The areas of focus should include, but not be limited to quality improvement, code reviews, code/architecture standards, code reuse, and reduction of support calls, technical documentation and technical design specifications.

jobs.title: Senior .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Your job will include:

  • Develop and implement new, exiting features in order to simplify the planning and booking of advertising campaigns

  • Leveraging the power of Microsoft’s cloud computing platform Windows Azure for our application

  • Mentoring and providing an example for junior and intermediate developers on the team


You will work in an international, dynamic and highly motivated cross-functional team based in Munich. We have great working conditions in a nice office in Schwabing across the street from the English Garden. We offer you access to the latest and best technologies and tools in the .NET world (we are a Microsoft Silver Partner).  Our dev team members come from 8 different countries, so our day-to-day language is english but we also provide free German courses for both beginner and intermediate German speakers.


Besides an attractive remuneration you will find short decision paths, flexible working condition, and much room for creativity and clever solutions. And of course we regularly have fun together outside the office - from grilling at the Isar, to skiing, to enjoying festivals like Tollwood and Oktoberfest.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ClickShare is Barco's wireless presentation and collaboration system that allows any meeting participant to share content on the central meeting room screen.
But ClickShare also means being part of an exciting technical environment, within a multicultural team at a global technology company.
To further sustain the growth of the ClickShare product line, Barco is looking for new talented software engineers.
The Software Engineer is involved in the development of both application and embedded software on all ClickShare products.


To be successful in this challenging and rewarding role, the software engineer will:
• Design, develop and modify modules based on functional and system requirements
• Discuss and review specifications to build solid architectures
• Ensure architectural integrity and product quality
• Take part of the continuous development of the existing software.
• Setup test procedures together with the Test team.

jobs.title: Test Development Engineer
jobs.content:
The Test Development Engineer shall be responsible to monitor the quality of the software of all ClickShare Products. In order to do this, the engineer will:


• Create functional and non-functional test cases based on product requirements
• Execute test cases on different platforms. This includes:


     - Testing PC applications that run on Windows, Mac and Linux Ubuntu/Fedora.
     - Testing the embedded software of our ClickShare Units.
     - Web interface testing on ieplorer, Chrome, FireFox and Safari.
     - Testing ClickShare Apps on mobile devices (iOS and Android).


• Automate test cases by writing python scripts (multi-platform), updating the selenium test framework (for several supported browsers) and come up with new ideas for test automation tooling.
• Create unit/component tests.


The Test Development Engineer will work in a SCRUM environment and be part of a test team which is located in 3 different countries.

This includes

jobs.title: Software Architect - Tallinn or Tartu
jobs.content:
IMS is a flagship of Playtech Product representing the sessions, player and wallet management systems. It is the central platform for all shared services of different Playtech products: authentication, player management, financial transaction processing, promotions, loyalty, chat, etc. Most of these are developed in Estonia. IMS is the main competitive advantage of Playtech. All gaming products such as Casino, Poker, Bingo are integrated with IMS.  


Software architect is responsible for leading complex architectural design projects involving new feature developments inside IMS, integrations with different products inside Playtech and partners externally. 


Architects main role in development is to define the high level design, but if needed the architect has to be able to also review the low level solution in code, define and verify solutions for meeting the non-functional requirements like security, reliability, hardware requirements and usage of third party technologies.

IMS architects work closely together with IMS product managers, business analysts and software analysts, integation managers, solution architects, business and development project managers and of course also the whole development team. Architects may also be involved in direct consultations of large and complex customer projects with technical - and business people from customer side. Architects role is to explain to business people and technical people from outside IMS the technical capabilities of IMS and be able to suggest and negotiate the most optimal solutions for different business problems. When doing the design for new developments, the architect must be able to explain the solution and also the business reasons to developers.


IMS architects are each responsible for specific shared services technical roadmaps inside IMS and they also participate in projects involving many services in combination when providing a full solution to a certain integation project. 


Responsibilities



  • Ensures that development team is building a product which is highly maintainable, scalable, fault tolerant and performant

  • Provide high level guidance and mentoring to the development teams to ensure consistency of technologies used

  • Mentors engineering staff to help develop their technical expertise and leadership competencies

  • Reviews and assesses impact of proposed scope changes to the future state architecture

  • Sets high-level design and technical standards, including coding standards, tools, platforms and frameworks

jobs.title: Technical Product Manager - DevOps
jobs.content:
The Technology Product Management team at Workday drives the product and strategy for Workday’s secret sauce - our technology platform that was designed from scratch for the cloud. We are growing at a fast pace, and we're looking for folks with a strategic vision and a proven track record for successfully getting sought-after products to market.



We’re looking for someone who is passionate about the cloud-based future of infrastructure provisioning and software development.  You have a deep empathy for what current operations and development groups experience with traditional provisioning and deployment practices, and you want to help them find a better way.



As a technical product manager you will need to understand the operational requirements as much as the user requirements.  At Workday we own the complete stack and tools that deliver our products across thousands of servers.  We are looking for a product manager to own and deliver products similar to those you would see in Amazon’s AWS suite of products or those in the Google Cloud Platform for the Workday development teams, be that virtualisation, continuous delivery pipelines, deployment, monitoring and logging.  As a leader in these teams you'll work with innovative, experienced engineers that build highly available systems and services across the entire stack.

jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ClickShare is Barco's wireless presentation and collaboration system that allows any meeting participant to share content on the central meeting room screen.
But ClickShare also means being part of an exciting technical environment, within a multicultural team at a global technology company.
To further sustain the growth of the ClickShare product line, Barco is looking for new talented software engineers.
The Software Engineer is involved in the development of both application and embedded software on all ClickShare products.


We are looking for a software engineer for streaming to join the ClickShare team.
Our team creates products for wireless presentation in meeting rooms and are used worldwide.
Being a software engineer Linux, you will work on the embedded software of our products and help in creating robust platforms that form the core of the next generation of wireless presentation products.


Responsibilities:



  • Analyze product requirements and translate requirements into product specifications

  • Discuss and review specifications to build solid architectures

  • Industrial experience with designing and developing in embedded Linux

  • Take ownership of the embedded platform in our products and guard its integrity

jobs.title: Application Support Analyst - L3
jobs.content:
Global Technology Infrastructure (GTI) serves as the central provider of technology infrastructure to JPMorgan Chase. GTI has launched a major, intensive, multi-year effort to improve and enhance the support of application messaging and integration technologies on behalf of JPMC's Lines of Business (LOB's). In conformance with GTI's Plan-Build-Operate model for distributed systems, a cross-tower team (GTI Messaging) is being developed and empowered to support this effort.



Global Technology Infrastructure Compute (GTI Compute) is responsible for managing the firm's global server and storage portfolio's across plan, build and operate functions.  The organization is transforming into a Managed Services provider for JPMC and drives product management, engineering standards and productivity initiatives in support of the Managed Services. 



The team will work on products and services that are new or in the process of maturing to meet our standards for "Managed Services". There will be a focus on providing a rigorous and transparent acceptance process to assess the adoption of new services followed by a comprehensive maturity model that will be applied to the portfolio of products and services under management.



The Software Security Assurance Program (SSAP) Static Scanning team is responsible for scanning for cyber security vulnerabilities in JPM developed source code.  This involves running over 5000 scans per month on the code base of over 2000 applications.  The static scanning engine covers most languages used in the bank including, Cobol, Java, C#.  Cyber security, is an exciting growth area for the firm and for the industry.  The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join an established and growing team as they mature their firm-wide scanning offering.



In the role of “GTI Static Code Analysis L3 Application Support Analyst”, you will be responsible to operationally support a static scanning engine across all Lines of Business using a combination of vendor tools and in-house software.


Responsibilities shall include but not be limited to:  



  • Provide Level 3 support for a unique portfolio of static scanning tooling.

  • Work with Line of Business AD teams to trouble shoot their scanning issues.

  • Schedule and roll out product upgrades

  • Create processes and tooling to improve operational efficiency

  • Assist engineering with infrastructure requirements

  • Automate manual procedures

  • Perform controlled resolution of incidents and problems including prioritization and escalation when appropriate

  • Work with vendors in problem isolation and resolution

  • Ensure security compliance with JPMC IT control policies in each messaging implementation

  • Conduct routine hardware and software audits to ensure compliance with established standards, policies, and configuration guidelines

  • Monitor capacity

  • Develop and promote standard operating procedures

  • Ensure high availability and resiliency across the system

  • Ensure solid implementation of the product by performing rigorous integration testing of the entire application

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer Office Location: Atlanta, GA (Buckhead Area) 

We are looking for Senior Software Engineers to join our rapidly growing Technology Team. Cvent’s Technology Team is responsible for the design, development and operation of the company’s suite of cloud-based software products. We are currently engaged in a major initiative to build our next generation software platform, utilizing the most cutting edge tools and technologies.

Cvent’s Technology Team is a great opportunity for you to:



  • Work on Internet scale applications, where performance, reliability and scalability, are critical design goals – not after-thoughts

  • Create beautiful, interactive and easy-to-use web applications using rich client-side code and MVC based server-side code

  • Create innovative mobile applications on a wide range of platforms including iOS, Android and others

  • Learn the nuts and bolts of Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) and Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) in real-life applications

  • Gain experience with different database technologies, ranging from traditional relational to the latest NoSQL products such as MongoDB and Redis


Skills/Qualifications we are seeking our Senior Software Engineers to have are:



The prerequisites for joining our development team are simple. We care more about your attitude and aptitude than the specific tools and technologies you have used in the past. You need to have a strong passion for software development and must take pride in your coding. You should also have great analytical skills and ability to handle complex, modular software development in a collaborative team-based environment.

In addition to this, you will have a leg up if you also meet the following criteria:



  • 5 years of programming experience in two or more of the following: Java, C#, ASP.NET, MVC, PHP, Ruby on Rails, JavaScript (NodeJS, ReactJS), Web Services and API development using REST or SOAP

  • Experience with one or more of the following databases: SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MongoDB, Redis or other NoSQL technologies

  • BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science OR related technical discipline. Equivalent experience also considered.


Cvent offers a fun, collegial work environment tailored to sharpening your technical skills and growing as a software professional. While we have evolved from startup to mid-sized company, our Technology Team has preserved an entrepreneurial and merit-driven culture where meaningful initiative and contribution are recognized and rewarded.

Need more reasons to consider us?


We offer competitive salary packages, an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees, including medical, dental, vision, stock options, bonuses, 401K, gym membership discounts and other great perks! If you would like to learn more about Cvent and our products, visit our website at www.cvent.com
