jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us


Ordnance Survey leads the world in map making and mapping technologies. Our team are adventurous, curious and always looking for new ways to create something fantastic. That’s why we’ve created our Geovation Hub in London. This location-data lab is a space where some of the industry’s best collaborate, share ideas and discover how to progress current geospatial products and services. 



About You


We are now looking to add 2 Senior Software Engineers to our team, and hopefully, that’s where you come in. 

If you’re a creative and expert Software Engineer with a collaborative work style and a passion for problem-solving, this is a brilliant opportunity to share your expertise and drive excellence within a fantastic Development Team. 

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll be taking on this sociable role where you’ll play a key part in exchanging and developing ideas and contributing to the Geovation Hub’s collaborative environment. 

Essentially, you’ll be building applications from the ground up all the way to the production environment and acting as the technical consultant for entrepreneurs. This is a varied role that will see you wear many different hats, for some projects you will act as CTO, for others the technical expert and for some you will be rolling your sleeves up and getting heavily involved in the hands-on coding. 

This is a great chance to utilise your expertise and develop new solutions for some of the most exciting start-ups in the market. And the best part? As you are working for a well-funded and fully backed incubator, you will not have the risk of joining a start-up but will have all of the excitement and engagement of operating within the start-up environment. 


Good Stuff




  • Competitive salary




  • Great pension scheme




  • Get 25 days holiday per year (30 days after five years)




  • State-of-the-art workspace




  • Freedom to innovate




  • Sociable culture




  • Tech events




  • Work MacBook Pro




  • Support for your health and wellbeing




With your ‘we’ll find a way’ mentality, positivity and enthusiasm, you will be capable of conversing with entrepreneurs calmly, professionally and in a supportive manner. As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll also need to possess a sense of fun, be able to propose your own ideas and will be eager to keep growing and learning.

jobs.title: Software Engineer / Data Scientist  Java Backend Services
jobs.content:
trivago offers a highly dynamic, international, and result driven environment, where you’ll get the chance to make a meaningful impact on millions of users. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice!

We are looking for a Software Engineer with a solid background in data science who wants to join our Backend Services team and help us to optimize our revenue growth by building models and algorithms that improve our CPC bidding market. In your new role you’ll cooperate closely with individuals from Product Management and Business Intelligence, as well as engineers, and take full ownership of your work as a team – from the initial idea generation to the implementation in our search core. You should be passionate about your craft, versatile and ambitious to push our business forward.


Your responsibilities:



  • Work in a cross-functional team that takes full ownership of its products, from ideation to the rollout of fully fledged features written in Java/Python.

  • Contribute with your technical expertise to the development of new algorithms that improve our traffic monetization.

  • Conduct rigorous testing of your work and monitor its impact on both our tech and business metrics.

  • Be creative, challenge yourself and help take trivago to the next level.



Essential requirements:



  • Minimum 2 years of relevant work experience.

  • Master’s degree (PhD preferred) in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.).

  • A very good understanding of Java with a strong focus on concurrency.

  • Knowledge of at least one scripting language, e.g. Python or R.

  • You have experience implementing multi-core/distributed software, preferably in a Linux environment.

  • Exposure to SQL and relational databases.

  • You are comfortable communicating in English (our company language).



Preferred requirements:



  • Experience with Cassandra, Redis, MongoDB, or Spark.

  • Interest in machine learning.

  • You are knowledgeable in packages such as Pandas and NumPy.

  • Excellent English communication skills: you have the ability to easily convey your message to team members and other stakeholders.

  • You have worked with the Hadoop Ecosystem.


Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Being an active member of our PHP, JavaScript, and UI guilds.

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hoursbased on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • Working at our head office in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highestquality of life in the world for expats.



Start date:



  • As soon as possible.


Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Front End Developer with Graphic Skills
jobs.content:
We are looking for a detail-oriented front end developer (CSS, HTML) with intermediate graphic design skills to join our marketing team.

You DO need to be on top of details and super organized. You DO need to be able to implement front end design updates with CSS and HTML. You do NOT need to be an amazing graphic artist, but you need to have some solid design chops with Photoshop, Illustrator and quick tools like Canva. Even if you are a brilliant designer - but can't implement online - you won't be a good fit with this role.

To thrive at this job you MUST be a details person, a fast learner and able to work independently. We are looking for something very specific, and unless you live for details and can take a task and run with it, you will not enjoy this job. Coffee is for closers, and you absolutely must be a closer to be considered.
Ideal candidate: a project management-oriented front-end developer with good design chops.

This role will focus on updating content for our website (www.SCOTTeVEST.com), email marketing and social media. A lot of graphic work can be done "quick and dirty" which is why organization and implementation skills are more important to us than graphic artistry. You must be able to respect and follow the file naming conventions and organization system of the company. Simple, but critical.

A Bachelor's degree is required and B2C marketing/e-commerce experience is a plus. We are open to a brilliant rookie or a seasoned veteran, but you will primarily be judged by your portfolio.

Be ready to hit the ground running - we work at a very fast pace and you will be expected to keep up. After a trial period of several projects, the successful candidate will transition to full-time work with our standard benefits package.

YOU WILL PREFERABLY HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS (or will need to learn them quickly):
-Great Eye: Understand visual balance; how colors come together; notice elements that are out of place; able to take a decent photo.
-Visual creativity and consistency is a requirement. If you are good with words as well, even better.
-Communication skills: Quick and accurate communication with a high email volume; understand basics of social media.
-Logic skills: Apply blanket rules to multiple situations to determine your course of action; be able to work independently.
-Technical skills: CSS and HTML (at a minimum), be generally tech-savvy; adept at Google mail, calendar, docs; must know and use Skype; experience with Google Analytics a big plus.

ROLE SPECIFIC SKILLS (Listed in order of importance):
-CSS and HTML
-Graphic design for web (including image optimization - this is key)
-Photo manipulation
-Vector artwork
-HTML5 is nice for ads, but we can convert files, too
Updating files for print e.g. product labels. Creating new designs is not specifically required.
You MUST have a working knowledge of design and development for web... we are primarily an online retailer.

PROGRAMS REQUIRED
-Creative Cloud: Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver or other web editor, InDesign, Canva, open to other platforms

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE
-Prioritizing responsibilities and communicating effectively in order to maintain an efficient work flow and insure goals are met (there is a reason this responsibility is listed at the top).
-Creating and implementing website graphics, landing pages, retargeting ads, and additional assets for sales, product launches and more.
-Designing for email marketing and maintaining the SCOTTeVEST newsletter.
-Creating assets for social media.
-Updating assets and ensuring SCOTTeVEST collateral and branding is consistent and current.

READY FOR NEXT STEPS?

jobs.title: Softwareudviklere
jobs.content:
I AS3 koncernen arbejder vi for at være Nordens førende virksomhed indenfor Job Transition Management. For at opnå denne målsætning kræves det, at vi er markedsledende digitalt, både eksternt og internt, og derfor investerer vi kraftigt i intelligente og velfungerende digitale løsninger. Målet er at AS3 skal være ledende indenfor digitaliseringen af rådgivningsbranchen.



Til hovedkontoret i Aarhus søger vi to softwareudviklere til at supplere vores team, og varetage alsidige udviklingsopgaver.


HVAD TILBYDES DU?


Med reference til Head of Digitisation and IT tilbydes du en spændende stilling med en central placering i koncernen, hvor du kommer til at arbejde med innovative tools og teknologier.


Du bliver en del af en professionel og dynamisk arbejdsplads, hvor du vil blive en del af et kompetent og engageret team, hvor alle har indflydelse på løsningerne og bidrager til et godt arbejdsmiljø med fokus på humor og fællesskab.


For at sikre en god start, deltager alle nye medarbejdere i vores interne introduktion og oplæring i vores rådgivningskoncept på AS3 Academy. Du vil også få en grundig introduktion til de systemer og platforme som bliver din nye hjemmebane.


ANSVAR OG OPGAVER


Du vil – sammen med udviklingsteamet – få ansvaret for ny- og videreudvikling af vores CMS-baserede portaler og tilpasning af standard software/platforme. Din hverdag vil bestå af:



  • Softwareudvikling: Størstedelen af din tid bruger du på webudvikling. Derudover tilpasning af standardløsninger samt test og dokumentation.

  • Sparring om løsninger: Du bidrager til kvalitetsløsninger for IT, forretning og slutbruger, hvor du deltager i kravformulering, sparrer med kolleger og forretning, ligesom estimering/poker planning vil være en del af dit arbejde.

  • Opsætning af miljøer og tools: Vi hjælper hinanden med at holde tools og miljøer i topform. Det være sig source control, deployment tools og udviklings-, test- og driftsmiljøer.

jobs.title: UI/UX & Visual Designer
jobs.content:
UI/UX & VISUAL DESIGNER

Doist’s Design team crafts engaging experiences to make people’s live more productive. Whether ideating functional interfaces or marketing pages, design is always one of Doist’s central areas. We are now looking for a very talented designer to join our international team.

Doist is the company behind the famous to do app Todoist, used by over 8 million people around the world.

REQUIREMENTS

As a designer in Doist, you will work across different areas, as web design, app development and marketing.

Requirements include:

  • Passion about detail and love for what you do
  • Experience in both marketing and interaction design
  • Knowledge of the iOS, Android and Windows Interface Guidelines
  • Responsibility and Team-player
  • Fluent written and spoken English, we’re an international company, so you’ll need to communicate with people who have very diverse communication styles.

Good to have:

  • Icon and illustration work
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS and GIT.

BENEFITS

This is a remote position, so you will be free to work from wherever you please. You could also choose to work from our office in Porto, Portugal or get a co-working space in the city where you live.

You can read more about how we work in this Forbes article, or in this Fast Company article.

At Doist, our best resource, hands-down, is our team. For the last four years, we’ve focused on fostering an amazing culture of scrappiness, independence, responsibility and ownership. We believe that a strong, vibrant and cohesive company culture comes before anything else.

We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Director of Customer Success
jobs.content:
Weâre looking for an extremely organized and self-driven Customer Success Director to help build and foster a self-service Customer Success program and community. Your main objectives will be to empower and help users through top notch resources, onboarding, support, and act as a champion for our users and a visionary and leader for the customer success team. You must be passionate about customers and have the ability to not only solve for the customer, but also strive for excellence in both staffed service interactions and self-service resources.

This is an excellent remote career opportunity in a key role with a fast growing and innovative tech startup.

As the Director of Customer Success youâll be responsible for:

  • Leading, training, and mentoring the customer success team on an ongoing basis.
  • Develop a model and community where the customer is aware of our self-service tools, can find and navigate to them easily, and can successfully use them to answer their questions or troubleshoot their problems.
  • Collaborating with the leadership team to shape and prioritize the customer lifecycle and deliver insights into how our customers are engaging with the application itself and the self-service resources we provide
  • Driving customer success outcomes (e.g. renewals, reduced churn, expansion revenue, product adoption, and customer satisfaction).
  • Defining and optimizing the customer lifecycle (e.g. mapping the customer journey, standardizing intervention points, defining strategies for customer segmentation, and identifying opportunities for continuous improvement).
  • Creating 'WOW' moments by consistently delivering world-class support, and promptly communicating with users on our support channels.
  • Supporting customer success and marketing initiatives as they pertain to growth and the customer journey.
  • Proactively reaching out to customers to understand their goals, challenges, and needs by interviewing and surveying them on how they use Hotjar.
  • Advocating customer needs/issues cross-departmentally.
  • Taking calls and presenting demonstrations to users and clients.
  • Collaborating with the dev team to troubleshoot and investigate bugs and issues.
  • Measuring the effectiveness of customer success through company-wide KPIs.

Requirements
  • 3+ years experience in leading customer-facing organizations for a SaaS business
  • Extremely strong English communication skills â both written and verbal.
  • Analytical and process-oriented mindset.
  • Proficient with HTML, JavaScript and using browser dev tools.

Job Perks:

  • Work remotely from the comfort of your own home
  • A free Kindle and Fitbit when you join Hotjar
  • â¬3,000 home office budget
  • Yearly personal development budget
  • Access to thousands of online courses
  • Attend conferences around the world
  • Regular company meetups

To apply: Complete the form here http://careers.hotjar.com/o/director-of-customer-success/c/new

jobs.title: AWS Cloud architecte Lead DevOps - H/F
jobs.content:
Aujourd’hui reconnu comme l’un des acteurs majeurs du Cloud AWS (Amazon Web Services) en France Morea recrute plusieurs ingénieurs Cloud. Nous concevons et exploitons chaque jour des plateformes  Cloud hautement disponibles, sécurisées, et élastiques pour répondre aux enjeux business critiques de nos clients.


C’est dans ce contexte d’engagements forts vis-à-vis de nos clients, de génération de valeur, et de pédagogie sur les nouvelles approches liées au Cloud, que nous cherchons des ingénieurs confirmés et sensibles aux vertus du Cloud.


La diversité des métiers de nos clients fait la richesse du notre.


Social, Gaming, Industrie, Streaming, E-Commerce…  Nos clients sont des startups ou des sociétés du CAC40 partageant une volonté commune : bénéficier des avantages du Cloud.  En nous rejoignant vous travaillerez sur des architectures « complexes » et diverses sans jamais tomber dans la routine. 



En tant que Cloud Architecte, vous serez en charge du build et de la conception de nouvelles architectures ou projets de migration de nos clients. Vous serez un acteur principal pour guider nos clients dans l’adoption des technologies cloud et l’évolution de leur applicatif pour tirer parti de tous les bénéfices de l’architecture cloud.



Missions principales :


Au sein d’une équipe composée de Builder et de Runner pour des comptes clients AWS vos missions seront :



  • Définir l’architecture cible d’un applicatif sur AWS

  • Sélectionner les services AWS et technologies les plus pertinentes

  • Proposer un plan de migration/conception au client

  • Réaliser l’intégration de l’infrastructure

  • Automatiser les process de déploiement, d’autoscaling, de génération d’environnements « on demand », d’extinction/allumage de ressources…

  • Préconiser les adaptations applicatives pour rendre l’application « Cloud compliant »

  • Travailler avec l’équipe en place en sollicitant les bonnes compétences

  • Contribuer au développement de nos outils de déploiement continue

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Data & Semantic - AI team
jobs.content:
What will you be doing?


We are looking for a software engineer with big data experience to join our data & semantic team. You will be working on developing our market-leading products, in the collaborative and growing AI team based in our central London office. The future of our product is focused around utilising AI solutions to revolutionise how we diagnose, treat and prevent diseases; your effort will contribute heavily to the services that the data science and NLP teams are building within the Artificial Intelligence team.


You will help us build and support great products across Babylon, as well as shaping our vision of an intelligent virtual assistant for the medical domain, in order to make health care affordable and accessible for everyone.


You will be working with the rest of the AI team, identifying solutions that can enhance their services through data integration, planning how required data can be sourced, provided and utilized to have the greatest impact. This will include working with the output of our information extraction pipeline and feeding it into our large medical domain knowledge base and graph database. This will be done via transforming existing data sources as well as a crawl-and-extract pipeline to form new ones. You will be involved with setting up a reproducible, automatic process across different data sets, and making sure that our knowledge base is up to date when an update is published for a data set that was loaded in the past.


As a member of our artificial intelligence team there will be opportunities to learn about ontologies, data science, natural language processing and information extraction. Our company is a fast growing, dynamic environment where your tasks will constantly evolve and you will have the opportunity to learn something new every day.


We have a team of the best people you’d ever want to meet, working on some of the most futuristic projects. We like people who are smart, funny, innovative and tenacious, who can adapt and work together.

jobs.title: DevOps engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking to bring on board a bright and talented DevOps engineer to work along side our talented team of developers. Someone who is a self motivated individual who loves getting stuck in with Linux.


We are currently building some exciting new products and require someone who can help us maintain our development workflow and build up our new and existing cloud infrastructure.


The role is mainly to start building up new services and systems for 2 key products. We pride ourselves on building solid and scalable systems and want someone talented enough to push that even further.


We are looking for someone who is slightly more on the Sys Admin side of DevOps with a strong understanding of scaling and load management. As an example we are taking one product from a small MVP application and building it up to mange hundreds of thousands of users.


A major part of the job will be helping us plan the longterm development road map for a few of our key products.


Initial Roles:



  • Work alongside our team of developers to help improve the existing workflow.

  • Help put in place a solid framework for tackling DevOps related issues going forward.

  • Maintain CI servers ( Jenkins / Hudson )

  • Maintain Test servers to ensure solid code coverage.

  • Help to build solid and robust scalable services on AWS. ( Vertical / Horizontal scaling )

  • Implement load balance on some existing services. 

  • Advice and help improve security.

  • Provide solid concurrency testing. With the ability to demonstrate scientifically that the system can perform well under load.

  • Stay on the absolute cutting edge by being paid to attend conferences and talks. We strongly encourage all of our developers to do the same.

jobs.title: Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The technical areas of ALTEN Technical Software are: Embedded Systems, Simulation & Modelling, Monitoring & Control and Business Critical Systems. We are looking for keen Technical Software Engineers who would like to work on complex problems in diverse segments of the high-tech industry. In addition to your technical skills, communications and social skills are also important as you will be working directly with our customers.


ALTEN Netherlands has ambitious aims for growth in the coming years. These goals form part of the Alten Group’s international strategy, which will naturally provide many opportunities for committed school-leavers like yourself! If you choose a career at Alten, you can into e.g. a Systems Engineer, Architect, Technical Team Lead or even the ultimate Specialist.


Alten offers challenges galore – apply now to enhance our team!


ALTEN offers:



  • Interesting projects, mainly in the Netherlands but potentially throughout Europe

  • An ambitious environment with technically-minded colleagues

  • Immediate employment on a permanent contract

  • Our full attention and space to develop both technically and personally

  • An excellent salary and fantastic benefits, including company car, non-contributory pension and of course an ample training budget

  • An international ambience with many contacts across Europe

jobs.title: Technical Lead - Games Integrations
jobs.content:
Are you intrigued by challenges? Want work to be both serious and fun at the same time?

Paf offers safe and socially responsible money games to hundreds of thousands of customers worldwide. We are now recruiting in our Helsinki office a

Technical Lead, Games Integrations

With us, you will help generate more excitement and fun for our customers. You will work with challenging software integrations and achieve a global reach with your work. It is a

Versatile role with experienced colleagues

You, as a hands on technical lead, are part of Integrations unit at Paf and will work with complex software integrations in an easy-going, collaborative and informal atmosphere. You will collaborate with experienced developers, architects and the lead architect to develop and improve the Paf systems. We actively discuss, plan and share knowledge within and outside the teams. We live in/use/do Scrum, CI, 3rd party Integrations.

You will work with one of our two scrum teams and actively communicate with 3rd party suppliers and partners. Like all other team members, you will contribute to the whole system development chain from requirement analysis to design, implementation and quality assurance.

We require

- Deep knowledge of Java EE and programming in general
- Architecture design and implementation skills
- Experience with Web services integration and thread programming
- Understanding of transaction management theory
- Good communication skills, and proactive in involving internal and external people
- Understanding of business as the driving force for development
- Ability to see the bigger picture and coaching attitude

Nice to have
- Experience of Spring and other popular frameworks
- Experience on mobile, HTML5, AngularJS etc.
- Experience in integration projects
- Pragmatic, user-centric and conceptual approach to development
- Experience of collaboration with other architects and professionals to resolve dependencies

With us, you will work across the Paf platform on solutions from the front-end to the deepest core. At the same time, you will bring your own personality and contribution to our team spirit. We face and solve complex challenges together.

Interested? Please submit your application along with salary request on-line no later than August 15th 2016. All communication and applications will be treated confidentially. For more information about the position, please contact our recruitment partner Arja +358 40 7621564 on Wednesdays between 1pm. - 2pm.

Paf was founded on Åland in 1966 with the clear purpose of creating profit to support public good. This is still the company’s primary purpose. Today Paf is an international gaming operator with over 200 games including slots, casino, poker, betting, bingo and lotteries. Paf also operates a large physical gaming operation on land and sea with about 1,500 slot machines and 55 gaming tables on ships in the Baltic Sea, in Paf Casino on Åland and Casino Sunborn in Gibraltar. Paf offers safe and socially responsible money games that give players pleasure and entertainment. In 2015 the Paf Group had a total revenue of 110 million euros producing a profit of 22.7 million euros. The contribution to public good was 20 million euros. The group has nearly 400 employees, is headquartered in Mariehamn on Åland and serves players from countries including Finland, Sweden, Estonia, Spain and Italy. Paf is licensed and controlled by the local Åland government. More information can be found at www.paf.com/about-us.

jobs.title: Sr Program Manager
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




thePlatform, a part of Comcast Wholesale, is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.



thePlatform, the industry-leading provider of broadband video management and publishing solutions, is seeking an experienced Technical Program Manager to work with our product development and cloud computing groups as technical product owner.



This position requires strong experience in software design.This is not a Project Manager role.You will need to have a strong technical program management background as well as several years of software development experience. We are looking for candidates that have a proven ability to design solutions based on a service-oriented architecture, can drive design across multiple teams, and thrive in a strong, collaborative relationship between program managers, developers, and QA engineers as partners in the delivery of quality services.



Core Responsibilities:




  • As a technical product owner, work with development and operations teams to establish overall product vision, create user stories, manage and prioritize the product backlog, participate in daily scrums and meta-scrums, and validate delivered software designs.

  • Partners with engineering project manager to provide consultative direction and develops long term objectives and plans to determine resources, technology and course of action to achieve results.

  • Participates in the product lifecycle process. Contributes to and creates product and technical requirements, detailed design documents including transaction, capacity and bandwidth models, systems definitions, and operational procedures as part of this process.

  • Understands key business drivers and applies the knowledge of internal/external business issues to improve products and services.

  • Anticipates and interprets customer needs, assesses requirements and identifies solutions.

  • Ensures that projects are properly accepted into the engineering team, worked on in a timely and efficient manner and smoothly transitioned into customer use.

  • Interprets internal/external business issues and recommends complete solutions based on best practices and proven technologies.

  • Solves complex problems. Takes a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions.

  • Provides guidance for the performance and reliability of various cross-platform applications and services. Ensures that system failures are restored in a timely manner.

  • Participates in the review of failures and provides feedback to prevent future occurrences.

  • Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.



Requirements:




  • At least 5 years technical program management experience in a software product development environment including direct experience in operational cloud computing.

  • Proven design experience with SOA, design patterns and web service technologies.

  • At least 4 years software experience at an engineering level. Proficiency in Java a plus.

  • Proven experience as a technical leader. Demonstrated ability to lead the design and development of complex applications.

  • Strong sense of responsibility and ownership for the success of projects from inception to rollout and maintenance.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Ability and confidence to work closely with select customers in pre-sales and collaborative scenarios.

  • A BS degree in computer science or a related field is required.

  • Knowledge of video encoding and video delivery highly preferred.








Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Engineering Efficiency
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Job Description





Do you love to write code? Are you passionate about software craftsmanship? Would you like to work on projects with tangible impact?





As a software engineer in the VIPER Engineering Efficiency group your work will multiply the productivity and effectiveness of a large engineering organization.





We work in many languages and on many platforms to create libraries that encourage best practices in large distributed systems through ease of use, we build sophisticated CI and build systems capable of understanding large microservice architectures, and we write libraries that will back applications for millions of customers





Who Will I Work With?





You will collaborate with industry experts from many disciplines: software architects, network engineers, big data scientists, player developers, content security specialists, and various streaming video technologists. An EE engineer also engages with quality assurance engineers, technical operators, and development managers on a daily basis to ensure other teams workflows are optimal and, easy, and fun to use.





What Will I Work on?





You will build tools and libraries to make other developers more efficient. Your tasks will include work on CI systems, dependency management, distributed trace libraries, multiplatform protocols, turnkey distributed systems allocation and more.





What's my Impact?





Your code will drive the everyday workflows of hundreds of top engineers from deployment to debugging, provide performance and application critical functionality, and allow the business to innovate and execute with much greater confidence and speed.





Responsibilities:




  • Design new software applications, support applications under development, customize and contribute to open source software

  • Collaborate with engineers and stakeholders to identify and minimize process inefficiency and provide exponential increase in engineering effectiveness




  • Maintain and operate internal developer and manager facing infrastructure

  • Ensure the software architecture is lean and extensible

  • Build software libraries for others

  • Works with Quality Assurance team to develop integrations for automated end to end testing

  • Experiment with and drive adoption of radically new technologies in the organization





Skills & Requirements




  • BS in Computer Science and 7+ years equivalent experience; MS in Computer Science highly preferred

  • Language polyglot with production experience in Go, Java, C/C++, Objective-C, Javascript, and Python

  • Extremely strong Knowledge of Object Design, Design patterns, and Algorithms

  • Experience developing software for Networking, Web services, HTTP, and TCP/IP

  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and distributed systems.

  • Experience with API and library design.

  • Excellent communicator; able to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies understandably and engagingly. Able to quickly grasp and fix others issues with your software.

  • Great design and problem solving skills

  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership

  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment





About Comcast VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research)



VIPER(Video IP Engineering & Research), is a startup division within Comcast's Technology and Product Division and spun out from IP Video and online projects originated within Comcast Interactive Media is based in downtown Denver, CO. We are a cloud-based, IP video infrastructure that's been built to deliver a broad mix of on-demand video, live TV streams and an assortment of other digital media to an array of connected devices in the home.






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Senior DevOps CDN Analytics Engineer
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Job Description



­Software engineering and data science skills combined with the demands of a high volume, highly-visible analytics platform make this an exciting challenge for the right candidate.





Do you love to build massive, distributed, and amazing systems? Are you passionate about open source software, and building systems using it? Do you like to add immediate, tangible business value?





As an engineer in the CDN team, you will help build the infrastructure and develop tools to support the systems that deliver IP content for a wide range of mobile and first-screen television devices. As part of the larger Comcast engineering teams, you will help shape the next generation of IP content delivery and transform the customer experience. Using the tenants of DevOps, you will have the opportunity to own the entire stack, from architecture to production.





Who does the CDN analytics engineer work with?



Traffic Control is the Open Source CDN control plane for which we lead the development, and this project represents our primary focus. Want to learn more? Visit http://traffic-control-cdn.net/ There you will find the documentation, source code, and every open bug. We're a small team, delivering state-of-the-art software solutions at the leading edge of CDN technology.





What are some interesting problems you'll be working on?



We deliver petabytes of traffic and billions of transactions everyday. Our analytics infrastructure is crucial in analyzing this data to visualize trends, and enable deep-diving into issues.





Where can you make an impact?



Thinking out-of-the-box and considering our customer's experience is key to our success. As a lead engineer, you will own the end-to-end implementation of our analytics infrastructure. We need additional team members to join our passion and create outstanding products and services.





Responsibilities:




  • Develop solutions to CDN analytics problems utilizing common tools.

  • Develop, maintain, and perform analysis within a real-time architecture supporting large amounts of data from various sources.

  • Analyze massive amounts of data and help drive prototype ideas for new tools and products.

  • Design, build and support APIs and services that are exposed to other internal teams

  • Employ rigorous continuous delivery practices managed under an agile software development approach

  • Ensure a quality transition to production and solid production operation of the software

  • Hands-on technical leadership for analytics infrastructure

  • Thought leadership in process and system optimizations

  • Triage, deep-dive and troubleshoot complex issues in CDN and CDN analytics infrastructure




  • Collaborates with other engineers, project stakeholders, and operations team to deliver new features

  • Implements system automation for testing, deployment, and operational monitoring

  • Diagnose performance issues and propose and implement code improvements

  • Ensure the software architecture is lean and extensible





Here are some of the specific technologies we use for analytics in Traffic Control:




  • ELK (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)

  • Heka

  • Apache Spark

  • Apache Storm

  • Apache Kafka

  • Apache Hadoop

  • Apache HBase

  • Apache Flume

  • MapReduce, Apache Pig

  • InfluxData

  • OpenStack

  • Git

  • Go (golang)

  • Perl

  • tcpdump, Wireshark

  • Docker, Kubernetes, LXC containers





Skills & Requirements




  • An open mind and a passion for systems excellence

  • BS or MS in Computer Science or Engineering and 7+ years equivalent experience

  • A passion for open source software

  • Experience in OO programming languages and models, including object design, design patterns, and algorithms

  • Extensive experience troubleshooting massive, complex, high-performance systems

  • Detailed experience troubleshooting system problems, including TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP

  • Outstanding communicator; able to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies

  • Great design and problem solving skills, with a strong bias for architecting for performance, and at massive scale

  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment





About the CDN team in Comcast



The CDN team is a quasi-startup group within Comcast's Technology and Product Division and is based in Denver's LoDo district. Our technology is open-source based, and our products deliver video and other content over IP infrastructure to an array of connected devices in and out of the home.








Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Sr. Manager, iOS Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Job Summary:



Comcast Interactive Media (CIM) is seeking a Software Engineering Senior Manager to join our Xfinity Home Engineering team. This group is responsible for ensuring the timely development, testing, and release of Xfinity Home iOS products with a high degree of quality that exceeds customer expectations. We are passionate about our products, our engineering and our people.





In this role you will directly manage a team of software developers and test engineers. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams (management, web, mobile and API developers, UX designers, test engineers, operations engineers, product and business managers) to develop features for Xfinity Home products and applications. You must be a strong technical leader, an independent, critical and analytic thinker, have excellent communication skills and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands.





REQUIREMENTS:



- 2+ years managing software engineers



- 2+ years professional experience developing native iOS applications



- Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills



- Experience setting individual and team goals



- Experience developing individual career plans for engineers



- Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle and Agile methodologies



- Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Deployment tools (Jenkins, AntHillPro)



- Fundamental understanding of the HTTP protocol and caching





ADDITIONAL PREFERRED SKILLS:



- Experience building/operating mobile applications dependent on large-scale platforms with high availability



- Programming experience with Objective-C and Swift



- Knowledge of source control and code review systems (Github, Gerrit)



- Experience with DevOps, Automated Testing and Continuous Delivery





Additional responsibilities may include:



Responsible for leading a team of Software Development Engineers in the

planning and designing of software and web applications. Manages

projects from design to testing, including new programs, enhancements,

and modifications. Collaborates with Quality Assurance team to conduct

testing. Develops financial and operational objectives. Ensures

operational plans are aligned with business objectives. Contributes to

functional strategy development. Has a greater degree of impact on

business results, and typically manages one or more groups of

professional employees.



- Oversees the planning and designing of software and web applications,

including new programs, enhancements, and modifications.

- Provides guidance to the Software Engineering team and other

departments in identifying product and technical requirements. Serves as

primary point of contact and liaison between Software Engineering and

other teams.

- Directs implementation initiatives for new software products and

applications. Organizes software update process for existing

applications and coordinates the roll-out of software releases.

- Manages all the deliverables to ensure adherence to deadlines,

specifications, and budgets. Implements performance metrics and prepares

period reports and/or proposals. Monitors and tracks project progress

and reports findings to leadership team.

- Ensures all engineers keep current with technological developments

within the industry. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and

products.

- Provides leadership and direction to department personnel from

lower-level managers to non-exempt employees.

- Manages cross-project communications.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters

of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work

nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.





Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent

- Engineering, Computer Science

- Generally requires 8-11 years related experience

jobs.title: Mid-Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
IN A NUTSHELL


Bellroy's sister company Trike Apps is in need of more, excellent mid-senior web developers to build intuitive, profitable websites. We work principally in Ruby and Rails, so ideally you'd have at least a working understanding of those technologies. We're looking for talented individuals who know what we're talking about when we say 'heroic cowboy refactoring vs Fowler refactoring'; people who love the smell of design patterns in the morning; developers who know when to apply OOP principles or when functional programming is a better choice. Sound like you?


WHY WORK FOR TRIKE APPS AND BELLROY?


Our culture is built on radical effectiveness - we're a crew of rational, life-hacking folks who are obsessed with automation. We also believe in making things awesome for our people so we have free snacks, coffee, t-shirts, monthly events ranging from ice cream tasting to escape rooms, a sweet office in heart of Fitzroy and a leadership team that cares so much about our people we have a Head of Staff Flourishing (you'll meet her in the interview).


We know that we provide our clients with a better service when our people are the best that they can be. We're in the process of building our own set of technical courses. We encourage our people to identify specializations they're interested in and to spend 20% of their time working towards those learning goals.


We work with great clients, and you'll get to connect deeply with them. Our major clients make the world a better place. Bellroy has recently attained B Corp certification and commits a generous percentage of its revenue to GiveWell charities. Radiopaedia trains radiologists around the world, and provides substantial discounts to students in poorer countries.


Worked on the web for a few years? Love to learn? Come learn with us.


TO APPLY


Email the MD5 hash of the string "I am not a robot" to jobs@trikeapps.com for more information or go to http://grnh.se/o3tsu7 1xnr to submit your cover letter and resume.

jobs.title: Junior Growth Hacker
jobs.content:
IN A NUTSHELL

You’re creative, analytical and driven to help online businesses grow. You’re interested in marketing, but fascinated by growth. You might not be very experienced yet, but you’ve probably read widely, dabbled in some web development and you’re keen on experimenting and analysing the results to really understand what’s working. You want short feedback loops, a laser focus on growth and you don’t want to be constrained by tried and true methods. We want that too, and our world class team is ready to give you the freedom, resources and support you need to really make a difference.

WHAT'S A JUNIOR GROWTH HACKER?

As our junior growth hacker, you will work with our digital advertising co-ordinator, data scientists and General Improvements team to help us reach the right customers, at the right time, in the right place, with the right message – through data analysis, some technical problem solving, and a bit of creative thinking. You’ll look at the nitty gritty to give us a better idea of what’s working and what isn’t. When something isn’t working, you’ll take an active interest in figuring out why, and what might make things work better.

You might not have much work experience under your belt – and that’s OK with us, because you’re probably familiar with this way of thinking through your time at uni, by working on your own thing, or via your insatiable consumption of blogs, articles, books and forums. We are looking for someone who is driven to learn and improve all the time, and who isn’t afraid to try new things.

So, bring your imagination, creativity and analytical brain to Bellroy and help us grow – in return, we’ll give you a community of like minded folks, the tools and resources you need, and the autonomy you crave. Helping our crew flourish is one of our core values.

YOU COULD BE OUR JUNIOR GROWTH HACKER IF...

You are excited about using technical platforms to reach an audience, but even more excited to understand what the impact of our efforts has been. You are well aware that people interact with different social media platforms and websites in different ways, and you’re curious to figure out what that means from a brand perspective. You can look at a whole mess of data and then turn your mind around to how it relates in human, real-world contexts. You eagerly seek to understand how an algorithm works, so you can feed it the right information to get the best result. Numbers and complexity don’t scare you. Instead, they inspire you to find innovative solutions to complicated problems.

You believe that great products can make a positive impact on people’s lives and you take pleasure in getting the right information in front of them to help them make the best choice. You’re not interested in selling people things they don’t want, or using sales tactics that are anything but genuine. Instead, you want to bring great things to new people in interesting ways.

You’re technically literate. You may have started with technical interests or come to them as you began to explore what computers could do for you. However you got there, you’re now able to write simple programs, or at least know what tools you’d use to get a basic website up and running and integrate some external services with it. You love understanding how technology works, and thinking about how you can use it to make things easier, faster and better.

And at the end of the day, you’re super keen to keep learning. In fact, lifelong learning might actually be your guiding purpose in life.

A WEEK AS OUR JUNIOR GROWTH HACKER MAY INCLUDE:

  • Responding to an alert from Adwords that one of your ad groups had paused due to one of your spend triggers being reached; logging in and checking the analytics to decide whether to turn it back on;
  • Adding some newly released products to our Google Shopping feeds (and making sure we’ve queued development of automatic feeds with our programmers so you don’t have to keep doing this forever);
  • Building some new keyword lists for search and display ad targeting, thinking about which terms our key audiences might use and checking that against our analytics;
  • Downloading some of our ad data and sharing it with internal and external people as required;
  • Checking and approving changes made to the currency lookup table in Google Tag Manager (and at least pausing to think about how we can better automate this process);
  • Working with our data science team and creative team to update the latest performance data regarding the effectiveness of our ads to better understand how the ads are performing;
  • Having a discussion with the team about our social media platforms and figuring out some new insights and approaches to bring to the creative team.

SKILLS THAT WOULD COME IN HANDY:

  • Basic level HTML/CSS/Javascript skills, or an interest in taking on technical tasks;
  • Familiarity with (but not necessarily mastery of) Adwords/Facebook Advertising;
  • Familiarity with (but not necessarily mastery of) APIs and how they work;
  • Experience in a start-up (or your own online business) and an interest in how and why people buy things;
  • Strong attention to detail and a sense of curiosity around complex information;
  • Proactivity – a preference to get in and try something, then learn from the result;
  • Ability to get the details right, and an understanding of when perfection is worth aiming for and when it’s not;
  • A sense of teamwork and collaboration.

LOCATION AND HOURS

This role is located in our Fitzroy office and is a full-time position.

jobs.title: System & Technology Specialist - SDN Product Development
jobs.content:
Req ID: 115178

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & an innovative & engaging environment where employees enhance their potential everyday. Our employees live our vision & core values. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.

We welcome the opportunity to meet you!

Job Summary

As a Technology Specialist you will ensure the development of innovative and competitive technical solutions, products and/or components. You will be involved in the R&D process to ensure the development of high quality, innovative solutions, products and/or components using the most appropriate technology available across that area.

Position Qualifications

Job Responsibilities

  • Responsible for system architecture and applications software for Ericsson’s SDN Controller Platform and applications for Service Provider networks (both fixed and mobile).
  • Provide leadership in standards and open-source communities related to SDN technology
  • Provide technology leadership during entire life-cycle: product strategy and development
  • Drive innovation in the organization: forward-looking technology initiatives, contributions to industry forums (including standards) and patents.
  • Responsible for product requirement analysis, technical solutions and implementation strategy.  Ability to synthesize from the big-picture (customers, competitors, market and technology trends and standards).
  • Primary interface towards Product Management, other Systems & Technology teams, and Ericsson Research; also make technical contributions to customer engagements.

Core/critical competencies

The successful candidate will require an excellent track record that exhibits some or all of the following capabilities and skills:

  • Strong background in network solutions and architectures, including customer expectations and pain points
  • Expertise in SDN technology, SDN Controllers, Open Flow, Open Daylight, Optical Network Controllers and related product development
  • Proven knowledge of Network Element and Network Management systems.
  • Excellent knowledge IP networking and transport products (BNG, Routing, Metro, Optical transport) and mobile products applications (Gateways, Gi Services)
  • Demonstrated experience in design of highly scalable and fault tolerant system including hitless software upgrade, distributed control and redundancy.
  • Strong understanding of design issues related to software abstraction and componentization versus system performance.
  • Design experience in BSD/Linux and multi-core CPU and NUMA.
  • Hands on experience in gathering and documenting engineering requirements.
  • Consultative behavior, business minded and strong team spirit.
  • Excellent interpersonal and customer management skills.
  • Team player with outstanding skills in cooperation amongst key stakeholders.
  • Fluent in written and oral communications in English.
  • Be willing to travel occasionally and attend off-hour meetings with other teams around the world.
  • Strong technical understanding of Java and multi-threaded application development.
  • Self sufficient, and have good self initiative/drive.
  • Ability to invent and innovate.
  • Strong and proven leadership skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence product and technical directions.

Minimum education and experience requirements

  • Minimum 10+ years of industry experience.
  • Bachelor degree or equivalent in electrical engineering or computer science is required, Master’s or Ph.D. is highly preferred.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Polyglot Developer
jobs.content:
This is the perfect opportunity for a smart Software Engineer with at least 5 years experience developing elegant and scalable solutions in an agile software environment.


What you'll be working on

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Lead
jobs.content:
WeCounsel is growing! And we need you, a highly motivated, skilled Quality Assurance lead, to join our team.


WeCounsel is revolutionizing the way behavioral healthcare is delivered with its innovative SaaS telehealth solution. We are seeking a dynamic, experienced team member to lead its Quality Assurance and product testing capability.


Role reports directly into Product Manager, with direct visibility into strategic product roadmap, market demand and development priorities.


This is a highly interactive, team-based, Agile development environment, where you will work alongside a team of skilled, accountable and collegial software professionals. We pride ourselves with a fast-paced, get-the-job-done culture.


We are located at BDC (business development center) in the beautiful NorthShore area.
***MUST BE LOCAL OR WILLING TO RELOCATE***


Key Responsibilities:
Extensive automated testing experience with proprietary and open-source applications
Define test objectives for new features and write test cases/scripts based on external and internal design specifications.
Develop and document application test plans based on software requirements and technical specifications.
Work closely with development team and Product Manager while providing support to track, report, and verify software errors and inconsistencies.
Record and document results and compare to expected results
Use of exploratory testing to find bugs in software
Handle special projects/other related assignments as requested
Experience: 4+ years experience in technical quality assurance. Must have the experience in testing automation and be able to build foundational infrastructure for quality assurance department.



Benefits


$70,000 to $85,000 base salary. 5% bonus via incentive compensation based off performance. Company health benefits.

jobs.title: .NET Software Engineer - Renewable Energy
jobs.content:
We build digital control systems for the next generation of solar thermal power plants. We're a very small company still in "startup mode" - which means there are only 3 of us - and are looking for engineers to join our fledgling software team. You could be a recent graduate or have 15 years experience - what’s important to us is demonstrable ability and brains.


Our product is composed of two main parts:



  • The hardware - a custom designed PCB 'controller' including custom firmware written in C++

  • The software - a .NET based control system designed to safely manage thousands of controllers


Primarily we need engineers with .NET experience who are familiar with the entire stack including including C# 6, WPF, WCF, LINQ, Async, BCL etc. Familiarity with Git, SQL, PowerShell, NuGet, NHibernate, TeamCity, MSBuild, Windows (server, management, deployment, permissions, diagnostics etc.) and communications & protocol design are also desirable. You would definitely need to have some experience of unit testing using technologies such as Nunit. If you constantly sing the praises of Resharper you would fit in well round here. HTTP, RESTful principles, and a good understanding of architectural and software patterns would also be cool. We are considering rewriting our UI as a browser app in the near future so any relevant skills you could bring there would be an advantage.  And lastly, a passion for the latest ideas & innovations in our industry would be good.


Your work would be directed by an experienced engineer, who could become both your mentor and/or your student, depending on what experience you bring to the party. For the team to all get along you would need to have an agile mindset, not to mention a good sense of humour. His bookshelf has got things on it like “The Pragmatic Programmer”, “The Mythical Man Month”, “Code complete”, “Windows Internals”, and “How to Stop Worrying and Start Living”. If you are familiar with any of those you will probably get on well around here. We try to use Kanban to plan our work, and try not to over-engineer. We try to refactor as we go and are open to investing in better tools and approaches when we see opportunities. Broken builds get punished with a harsh stare, especially if it happens on a Friday night. Unit testing is a [wonderful] tool not a universal prescription. The same applies to pair programming.


As it's still a small company, this is an opportunity to learn everything that goes on behind the scenes. You'll likely be listening in on (or get involved in) meetings about about everything from project planning, industrial design, PCD engineering, power plants, steam turbines, sales, suppliers and manufacturing. You may also be required occasionally to sign for deliveries or buy milk...so, yes, you really do need to have a startup mentality. If you want freedom to provide input on business decisions and take risks (where appropriate!) this is the place for you. If you just want the simple life working from dull specification documents it probably isn’t.


Our current office is modest but in an amazing location, slap bang in the middle of Surry Hills - one of Sydney's most beautiful suburbs - surrounded by some of the city's best cafes and restaurants. We plan to upgrade to a larger office in the vicinity sometime over the next 6 months in anticipation of a rapid expansion of the company over the next 2 years. There has recently been an announcement in the news for a $1.2bn solar power plant which we may or may not be involved with :) Because of that, and other opportunities globally, you might have the option of some international travel.


Working on commercializing renewable energy technology? Gotta be better working for a bank, surely.


Fine print:



  • Role is local only

  • Must have right to work in Australia

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Software Engineer you will:



  • Play a critical role in a cross-functional team of talented software engineers and product managers that has full ownership of our Marketplace seller experience. (We call these RED teams.) The team builds software systems and processes to onboard sellers; to manage their stores, product information, inventory, prices and promotions; to communicate and track marketplace orders; to track finances, manage invoices and make sure sellers are paid on time.

  • Be responsible for delivering on key business KPIs in your area, for example seller success score, fill rate, out of stock, etc. You’ll be expected to make a significant impact on these through deep business and process understanding, close relationships with your business and operations counterparts, great product judgement, focused execution and frequent delivery.

  • Work with Marketplace business head and Seller Experience team leader to drive the product vision and strategy to scale our Marketplace business.

  • Build innovative, high-quality roadmaps based on team strategy and vision.

  • Manage product backlogs, including prioritizing and balancing tactical and strategic goals, and making correct trade offs between customer experience, operational, financial and technical priorities.

  • Work closely with software engineers to ensure the technical solutions areproperly prioritized, delivered on time, to provide great customer and seller experiences and to solve the right business problems.

  • Drive product launches, including partnering with others in the organization to prepare high quality training plans, branding and marketing material, and seller communication.

  • Help define metrics that measure and drive the success of the Marketplace business. Analyze them to inform product strategy and tactics.

  • Take a lead program management role on multi-team Marketplace projects on behalf of Seller Experience.

  • Build working relationships with Marketplace sellers and support seller success and outreach programs.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Who You Are


You’re smart, you’re a good engineer, and you get things done. You get a thrill out of building things from scratch and taking ownership over your work. You live and breathe for the start-up culture where life is fast-paced and full of opportunity. You enjoy working with smart people, value their feedback, and like working collaboratively on problems. You enjoy writing clean and testable code, you don’t overcomplicate things, and you know how to choose the right tool for the problem you’re trying to solve.


About the Role


As a senior member of our backend team, you will be creating APIs and services to provide access to a wide range of data sets - weather, satellite imagery, soil information, farming practices, seed inputs etc. You will collaborate with our data science team to design and build machine learning models to be able to make better recommendations to increase profitability and yield for a farmer.


Tasks You’ll Be Juggling



  • Understand business requirements, work with other team members, and develop solid engineering solutions

  • Responsible for implementing features from inception to deployment

  • Commitment to maintaining and improving functionality on an ongoing basis

  • Provide coaching and mentorship to junior engineers

  • Review code for your peers and provide feedback

jobs.title: User Experience and Interface Designer
jobs.content:
ABOUT US:

SimpleTexting is a tight team of digital professionals who develop and operate a compelling text message marketing software platform—much like Mail Chimp but for SMS marketing. Businesses of all sizes in the US and Canada use us for their SMS campaigns. As a leading player in the text marketing SaaS space we strive to provide a seamless web-based (and soon to be app based) software product that lets businesses send mass text messages to their subscribers.

WE WANT:

A seasoned user interface and experience design professional who can help us improve the yet to be released version of SimpleTexting—2.0. Version 2.0 is mobile first and strives to provide a consistent experience across desktop, tablet, and mobile.

We think we’re 75% there and we’re searching for the right fit to take us to the next level and get us to 100%. The right candidate knows how to work in a modern and agile remote work environment. Must be self-motivated and exceptional.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Help us transition our present UX/UI professional into a HTML5/CSS role.
  • Take ownership of the product user experience, designing interactions and` interfaces for SimpleTexting 2.0.
  • Lead regular design reviews, and conduct usability tests.
  • Create documentation that enables software developers to build software that fosters a delightful user experience.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Four or greater years of user experience design in building and shipping web and mobile applications. This is not a junior position. We need someone who knows what they are doing and can be counted on to consistently make well informed, coherent, forward thinking decisions independently.
  • Excellent functional analysis skills. You should be able to break down complex workflows that include multiple layers of dependencies and reframe them into elegant, simpler workflows.
  • Rich understanding of user experience, user research, interaction design, and design principles—particularly emerging design standards such as Google’s Material Design.
  • Adept in developing storyboards, information architecture, work flows, user journeys, wireframes, pixel-perfect mock-ups and prototypes
  • Expert use of tools such as the Adobe Creative Suite, Balsamiq, Invision, Sketch, etc.
  • Solid portfolio demonstrating strengths in designing interfaces that are enjoyable to use
  • Understanding of HTML5 and CSS3
  • Great portfolio of work including interaction design and visual design showing refined design sensibility

jobs.title: Sr. Full Stack Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
Are you ready to build great mobile and web-based applications and lead global teams with some of the brightest thought leaders, designers and technologists?

As a Sr. Full Stack Solutions Architect, whether you are faced with a brand new system with a full galaxy of choices to make about server stacks, front end frameworks and supporting tools, or you have to assess a project with 10 years of technical debt, connections to legacy systems and a nasty performance cliff that has to be solved, you have the chops to figure it out and help the team find a way to succeed.

A good Full Stack Solutions Architect will have had exposure to a broad variety of front end and back end frameworks and multiple software ecosystems and will be able to explain patiently to clients and prospects about where the source of their pain may originate: anything from the network, database, back end, middleware, API, or front end - to the human factors that influence an application’s success or failure. Whether you’re consulting across multiple projects and teams or rolling up your sleeves to dig into code on just one, your flexibility makes all the difference.

We’re looking for candidates with experience in the following areas:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related Engineering discipline or equivalent professional experience
  • 8-12 years of progressive experience in designing, building and maintaining software systems
  • Multiple operating system families and environments (Mac OS, Linux, Windows, Android, iOS, for example)
  • Wide variety of computer languages, including at least one from each of these buckets Java, C#, C, C++, Objective C, Swift, Rust Python, Ruby, Bash, Perl JavaScript, TypeScript, Dart, Scheme, LISP, Haskell SQL, GraphQL, NoSQL queries, Lucene queries
  • Designing and implementing APIs for systems, with both RESTful styles of communication and other legacy approaches (e.g. SOAP)
  • Track record of writing responses to requests for proposals (RFPs) and writing original proposals that win consulting work
  • Software estimation skills, including Agile estimation with Story Points and Scrum planning experience.
  • Agile team leadership and leading by example in mixed teams of clients and consulting staff

Highly qualified candidates will also have:

  • An advanced degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, a related field, or equivalent experience
  • Used software configuration management frameworks (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, or Salt) to configure both individual servers and fleets of machines
  • Entrepreneurial experience or experience as a lead consultant opening new client engagements
  • Hands-on experience developing native or hybrid HTML applications on iOS, Android, or other mobile platforms
  • Multiple publication credits in peer-reviewed scientific and technical journals or in technology industry publications
  • Designed and taught classes in an area of technical expertise
  • Active participation in the world wide development community, such as Open Source Software commits and social media involvement (Stack Overflow, programming language/ framework forums, Meetup groups, blogging, Twitter)

Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech startup? Let’s start a conversation.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
You will have -

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer
Nice for you to have -
  • Professional experience in the financial services industry
  • Master’s degree in relevant major
You will definitely possess these technical skills –
  • Extensive experience with the .NET platform and .NET framework
  • Client/Server fundamentals and Browser/Server interaction using IIS
  • In-depth knowledge of C#, HTML, XML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery
  • In-depth knowledge of TSQL: stored procedures, understanding of general database structure
  • Broad experience in troubleshooting

Bird’s eye view of your role – We are looking for an innovative, client-focused, experienced full stack Software Developer to create and maintain cutting edge software product for investment professionals that will enable them to transform the precision and efficiency of their back office operations. Support internal sites for clients and business groups. Excellent candidates will be analytical, problem-solvers, collaborative, continually improving and work well in a rapidly growing, vibrant workplace. Your role will be to collaborate with your team to drive solving complex application and software problems.

Skills and competencies you will bring - You are a team player with minimal supervision, work cross-functionally and closely with engineering, product management, and quality assurance peers to develop innovative technical tools and solutions. You continually seek to improve the code and efficiency of our systems. This is an opportunity you do not want to miss! Great team, great company, and a great place to learn and grow. Commitment to quality, team success, higher level technical skills, responsiveness and a sense of humor!

Your performance objectives will be –

  1. Create solutions for new product features and enhancements
  2. Own feature areas and deliverables
  3. Work with management and team members to clarify needs and plan delivery of major product changes, future version and new products
  4. Collaborate cross functionally to provide responsive support to escalated customer issues, plan delivery of product changes and new products.
  5. Ensure adequate testing of all product releases
  6. Continually grow skills to enhance your technical expertise
  7. Participate in code reviews
  8. As part of the responsibilities for this role, you will understand and readily support Envestnet's established corporate business practices, policies, internal controls and procedures designed to create value or minimize risk

How will you translate your lofty goals into specific actions / short term goals –

  1. Within first 30 days, you will quickly get familiarized with architecture, systems and current process and tools
  2. By the end of the first quarter, you should be able to contribute to the successful delivery of a feature

What’s in it for you? (EVP – Employee Value Proposition) -

  • Learn, explore and contribute towards technologies, organization and self-growth by working with technology experts and architects within the organization
  • Participate, grow and influence design and feature delivery on various products across the organization
  • Work on new technologies
  • Earn a competitive compensation package with unique benefits and facilities

Meet Tamarac, Inc:

Tamarac a division of Envestnet, Inc. (NYSE:ENV), is a leading independent provider of technology-enabled investment and practice management solutions for independent financial advisors, as well as small and mid-sized financial advisory firms and larger financial institutions.

Tamarac serves over 800 RIA firms, collectively managing more than $500 billion in assets. Investment Advisors that use Tamarac's solution range in size from managing less than $10 million in assets to over $10 billion.
Tamarac was founded in 2000 and is headquartered in Seattle, WA.

Envestnet|Tamarac is an Equal Opportunity Employer
