  1. Create solutions for new product features and enhancements
  2. Focus on integration solutions between our existing product suite and additional 3rd party vendors
  3. Own feature areas and deliverables, including a focus on owning all code solutions relating to integration
  4. Work with the management and team members to clarify needs and plan delivery of major product changes, future version and new products
  5. Collaborate cross functionally to provide responsive support to escalated customer issues, plan delivery of product changes and new products.
  6. Ensure adequate testing of all product releases
  7. Continually grow skills to enhance your technical expertise
  8. Participate in code reviews
  9. As part of the responsibilities for this role, you will understand and readily support Envestnet's established corporate business practices, policies, internal controls and procedures designed to create value or minimize risk
How will you translate your lofty goals into specific actions / short term goals -
  1. Within first 30 days, you will quickly get familiarized with architecture, systems and current process and tools
  2. By the end of the first quarter, you should be able to contribute to the successful delivery of a feature
What’s in it for you? (EVP – Employee Value Proposition) -
  • Learn, explore and contribute towards technologies, organization and self-growth by working with technology experts and architects within the organization
  • Participate, grow and influence design and feature delivery on various products across the organization
  • Work on new technologies
  • Earn a competitive compensation package with unique benefits and facilities

Meet Tamarac, Inc:

Tamarac a division of Envestnet, Inc. (NYSE:ENV), is a leading independent provider of technology-enabled investment and practice management solutions for independent financial advisors, as well as small and mid-sized financial advisory firms and larger financial institutions.

Tamarac serves over 800 RIA firms, collectively managing more than $500 billion in assets. Investment Advisors that use Tamarac's solution range in size from managing less than $10 million in assets to over $10 billion.

Tamarac was founded in 2000 and is headquartered in Seattle, WA.

Envestnet|Tamarac is an Equal Opportunity Employer

jobs.title: Senior PHP Web Developer
jobs.content:
Develop innovative game-based platforms that empower people to be part of the climate change solution.


Cool Choices is a fast-growing nonprofit offering an innovative game-based platform to inspire people to adopt sustainable practices.


We’re looking for a Senior PHP developer who will lead the evolution of our platforms, which will include the development of new web and mobile tools.


If you’re an exceptional programmer with terrific time and task management skills and a penchant for the environment then we’d love to hear from you.


At Cool Choices you’ll work with a smart and ambitious team that’s committed to making change happen. We put the “fun” in sustainability. Our approach is collaborative and casual and values a work-life balance. At Cool Choices it’s ok to leave work early to catch a kid’s baseball game or kayak across the lake. After all, there’s little point in ensuring the planet is habitable if you’re not going to enjoy it some.


Our ideal candidate has at least five years of successful development experience, communicates effectively as part of a team and has a passion for sustainability.


We’re geeks: we get really excited when our users start biking to work or eat less meat as a result of our platform. If you want to create a product that matters then we hope you’ll reach out to us.

jobs.title: DevOps Manager
jobs.content:
The DevOps manager will be in charge of managing the DevOps team at Spokeo. This role requires a strong people manager who will have oversight of the entire infrastructure for running the Spokeo website, as well as providing support for any projects being worked on. 

DevOps is responsible for all the production environments as well as test and internal environments, as well as facilities and office operations. The DevOps manager is responsible for hiring sysadmins and effectively coordinating and managing work schedules for all of his/her staff members.



Desired Skills and Experience:



  • 5+ years of DevOps system administration experience. 

  • Significant experience with AWS and other cloud services. 

  • Strong people management experience: having managed at least 5-10 individuals. 

  • Articulate: eloquent in working with many personalities and in cross functional teams. 

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Experience with *NIX system administration, Java, Ruby, Perl, Python.

  • Strong technical and business vision.

  • Experience in an internet customer-facing environment.

  • Ability to work cross organizational boundaries with people of different perspectives and experiences.

  • Ability to recognize technical needs and recommend suitable technologies.

  • Willingness to tackle any challenge, even if not directly relevant to core competencies. 


We Provide:



  • Top Salary

  • Flexible Hours

  • Casual Dress Code

  • Stock Options

  • Free Lunch Catering Every Day

  • Nerf Gun Armory

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits

jobs.title: Bioinformatics Software Developer
jobs.content:
Pacific Biosciences is seeking a talented Bioinformatics Software Developer to contribute to tools that use SMRT sequencing data to address diverse sequencing applications areas.  The candidate will develop robust, reliable and performant software components that enable our customers and collaborators to rapidly get the insights they need from SMRT sequencing data.

jobs.title: Design Team Leader - Kids GM & Active
jobs.content:
At Kmart Australia, we are all about being IRRESISTIBLE! Our products and prices are amazing and each day we do our utmost to exceed our customers’ expectations… and a huge part of our success is attributed to our amazing team of Designers who are responsible for creating such in demand, on-trend products. Operating as a design led retailer, we harness global trends and create designs and products unique to Kmart! Our products are in huge demand and have an incredible social media following – it’s a great time to be part of the Kmart design team!

The role!

Due to an internal movement we are now seeking to recruit a Design Team Leader to manage a team of 5 talented designers who focus on our Kids General Merchandise and Active categories. This portfolio will include categories such as toys, nursery, stationery, craft, events and party plus active apparel and sporting goods.

Based at our National office in Mulgrave and reporting to the Design Manager, as the Team Leader you will be responsible for overseeing trend and forecast, product development, ongoing critical path management and ensuring the team delivers on Kmart’s vision. You will focus on cultivating a positive and nurturing team culture, managing performance, setting goals and identifying development opportunities coupled with the day to day management of the team which will include workflow and IP.

This strategic role will require you to understand the trade results and financials and use this information to make commercial decisions and influence internal and external stakeholders. You will work closely with the Buying team in an account management capacity along with suppliers, our Indian design team and various stakeholders across the retail business units.

You!

…are a highly experienced designer who has a broad range of experience with multiple portfolios – ideally across both general merchandise and apparel. You will capable of design at all levels including graphics and have a strong background with trend analysis and product development. Essential to the role will be your ability to engage stakeholders and influence. As a leader you will be capable of setting clear direction and goals, recognising great work, providing feedback and adopting a transparent, supportive and outcome orientated approach to managing people.

Your success in this role will be measured by the success and happiness of your team, high level of stakeholder engagement and great sales as a result of your strategy and vision. In addition, a strong working knowledge of Adobe Illustrator CS and Adobe Photoshop CS will give you the ideal background to excel in this position.

Here is what our Designers say about working at Kmart!

• “The Design team are brilliant; they really are great people to work with. Having direct influence on the product is key for a Designer and working so collaboratively with the buyer / planner is great”
• “I love the products I get to design and the creativity I get to add into the products and graphics”
• “I love the job security, it’s such a successful business, great team atmosphere, hands on design role”
• “Kmart offers lots of creative potential, room for growth and development, great work/life balance, a world class Design team who are all very easy to work with, positive team leaders, fun, get to work across a broad range of product”

Why you will love Kmart!

Being IRRESISTIBLE means we pride ourselves on being a values led organisation and believe that integrity, boldness, team work & customer service drives our success. Our culture is fun, positive, honest and professional. We treat each other equally, with respect and we like to keep things simple.

We operate at a fast pace, are highly results focussed and we all work collaboratively to ensure the continued success of our business and that we delight our customers every day! Our structure is non-hierarchical; our leaders are approachable and foster a culture that encourages innovation, creativity and autonomy.

We have a lot to offer our team members including great development opportunities across both Kmart and the Wesfarmer Group, excellent remuneration, an uncapped bonus scheme, free parking, benefits program and access to Wesfarmer share plan.

So if you have the required experience and our culture sounds like the right fit for you – don’t miss this great opportunity to join Australia’s most profitable retailer.

Phone screening and interviews will occur prior to the closing date of this advertisement. Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies. Agencies - Please do not contact us or send applicants to us unless requested to by a Recruitment team member.

To apply please upload your current resume and FOLIO / EXAMPLES of your work or include your website details and complete the online application form by clicking on Apply below.

jobs.title: Sr. Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Help us establish Bluebeam's new Boston office!



Bluebeam is building a new team and is focused on finding some highly motivated, talented, JavaScript developers with full stack web application development experience. If you are a computer science graduate with OO design experience and a passion for building high-complexity, extensible, JavaScript web client applications, this is the job for you.  You should have extensive knowledge of the JavaScript language including ECMAScript 6 features and JSX syntax extensions.  You should have experience consuming, extending, and designing JavaScript frameworks. Knowledge of frameworks like React / Flux, AngularJS, lodash, jQuery, etc are a plus. You should have experience building and consuming RESTful web services.  In addition, you should be dangerous in ASP.NET 4.5, with general knowledge of MVC and Web API as a huge plus.



Want a peek at what you’ll be doing? You will play an integral role on a new team created to bring more of our core business product functionality to the web.  As part of the Bluebeam web application development team you will be charged with taking our flagship product into the future by participating in JavaScript client and RESTful web service design and development. Starting with laying the groundwork and initial releases, you’ll be a key contributor on our high throughput agile team working alongside other talented developers. You will have opportunities to contribute to our technical roadmap and will have exposure to a wide array of technologies including cutting edge frameworks, large scale image rendering, real-time collaboration services, 3D Image Processing, and Complex Algorithms, just to name a few. 



Want to see who you might be working with? http://careers.bluebeam.com/culture



What we'd like to see in you:



  • 5+ years of experience in a related field

  • 1 year minimum of intensive JavaScript development, more is better

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher - Computer Science or equivalent field

  • Extensive knowledge of the JavaScript language including ECMAScript 6 features and JSX syntax extensions

  • Knowledge of frameworks like React / Flux, AngularJS, lodash, jQuery, etc are a plus

  • Experience with Node.js, Webpack, and npm.

  • Strong understanding of JavaScript performance and optimization

  • Web Development experience in .NET technologies, particularly C# 

  • Extensive use of APIs and understanding of HTTP and REST architecture

  • Experience using OO methodologies in designing software solutions

  • Strong understanding of design patterns and development frameworks such as MVC, MVVM, Flux

  • Proven ability to work in a rapid release production environment

  • Passion for delivering strong dependable code

  • Full understanding of the SDLC 

  • Comfort with working in an Agile/SCRUM environment



If you think you are a good match for Bluebeam, please send the following:



  • Cover Letter (Try to show us who you are.  If you send us the generic one you send to everyone else, we will be bummed.)

  • Resume

  • Web portfolio (Be prepared to discuss)



 Learn more about Bluebeam here: http://careers.bluebeam.com/.

jobs.title: Linux System Administrator - Sling TV
jobs.content:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Move Networks, makers of Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet.


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


With content from ESPN, ESPN2, AMC, A&E, TNT, HISTORY, H2, TBS, Food Network, HGTV, Travel Channel, IFC, El Rey, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, ABC Family, Disney Channel, CNN, Lifetime and Galavision, Sling TV is a next-generation service that meets the entertainment needs of today’s contemporary viewers.


#TakeBackTV


We are seeking a Linux System Administrator to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Responsibilities:


We are seeking highly motivated individuals to join our Production Operations team to:



  • Design/deploy/operate expanding systems for a critical, highly available OTT  TV solution in an emerging market

  • Manage the technology that powers Sling TV’s service in support of world-class internet television

  • Maintain systems that transcode content into Sling TV’s format and make it available for consumption

  • Allowing publishers to manage their video assets

  • Provide reporting on viewership

jobs.content:
Join our 6-person engineering team in our mission to disrupt the $50bn DIY space.


After about 1 year of operation, our online marketplace/community already had 50 million users - that number is growing quickly!


We want you to take full ownership of our just-released iOS app.


After only 1 week in the App Store, we ranked #8 in the Lifestyle category.


You will work closely with our product team to build new and exciting features...we are looking for someone who is an active participant in the development process, more than just a coder.

jobs.title: Lead Android Engineer
jobs.content:
Android is the core of our consumer offering. We’re looking for an experienced Android engineer to lead the Android team in an Agile environment.


This position will report to the VP of Engineering and will require flexibility, regular coordination, and effective cross-functional communication.


As a team member, you'll be a passionate and unrelenting individual willing to brave the storm of learning. We're a company with assumptions to validate and a product to build, refine and improve. You're expertise and input is what you have to offer.


We believe innovation is a result of collaboration across teams, especially in an industry like ours. As such, this position will require flexibility, regular coordination and effective communication with the operations, business development, technology and marketing teams.


Our team is a diverse yet like minded group of individuals. Our educational background spans pre-med, pre-law, physics, mathematics, computer science, and computer engineering. Our technological background spans Mac, Windows, Linux, Python, Ruby, JavaScript, C#, Android, iOS, and even PHP! Our gaming background ranges from Counter-Strike and Overwatch to foosball and basketball.


The Engineering team works in a semi-private space of our office along side the Product team giving us an easy platform for collaboration and discussion. We run Agile with two-week sprints.


You can find more about the engineering team at engineering.gopangea.com.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.content:
Are you ready to build great mobile and web-based applications and lead global teams with some of the brightest thought leaders, designers and technologists?  

At Modus Create our __[Senior Product Managers](https://moduscreate.applytojob.com/apply/8i2CV6/Senior-Product-Manager?source=wfh.io)__ work remotely and play a hybrid role encompassing product, project and relationship management. We are the bridge between the design, development and business worlds, partnering with our clients to envision and build great products.  Weâre responsible for managing agile, distributed product teams including front/ back-end engineering, architecture, user experience and visual design, QA and DevOps. While we canât see the future, we can help shape it by breaking down complex problems into actionable steps to get things done. We are problem solvers: passionate, curious and always pushing the envelope on innovation, creating order out of chaos.  

__Required Skills and Background:__

* 7 years of product or project management experience in a high-growth, interactive product organization 
* Demonstrated knowledge and experience with Agile and Lean methodologies from project inception through delivery
* Comfortable working in high intensity, fast-paced consulting engagements across a variety of industries
â* Proven experience managing multiple (sometimes interdependent) complex, strategic projects and initiatives with finesse and ease, building confidence with clients and creating long-term relationships as a trusted advisor
* Track record of completing and shipping excellent products on time and on budget
* Bachelor or Masterâs degree in a relevant field (or equivalent)
* Excited and ready to expand your portfolio of building and shipping products for some of the biggest brands in the industry      

__âAs a Sr. Product Manager, your responsibilities are to:__

* Serve as the proxy product owner to our clients, gathering and analyzing large quantities of information, producing insightful business recommendations and a compelling product vision 
* Collaborate with our UX team to conduct design and user research as needed
* Create and execute product roadmaps and Agile release plans as well as write detailed user stories and acceptance criteria
* Practice Agile project management with the Scrum framework to facilitate daily standups, release and sprint planning, sprint reviews, user acceptance testing and retrospectives - managing the business weighted value of features and communicating feature development priorities
* Use your deep understanding of mobile and web products and supporting technologies to identify and communicate risk and any impediments to delivery
* Ensure that the project budget and schedule are closely monitored, communicating regularly with our client stakeholders
* Oversee a full stack software team with roles including Front-end and Back-end Engineering, UX and Visual Design, Automation QA, and DevOps
* Collaborate with our management team to identify new opportunities and move the company forward while confidently and credibly sharing your point of view and expertise
* Present/ participate in industry conferences as well as contribute to our social media engine (Blog, Twitter, Meetups, etc.)

__Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech startup? Letâs start a conversation.__

Client Services and Security

UCSC strives to embrace diversity in all its forms; it strives to be an inclusive community that fosters an open, enlightened & productive environment.

Entry-level professional with limited prior experience; learns to use professional concepts to resolve problems of limited scope and complexity; works on assignments that are initially routine in nature, requiring limited judgment and decision making.

Under supervision applies basic IT security concepts, campus, medical center or Office of the President policies and procedures to resolve routine security problems. Works on problems of limited scope. Follows standard IT security practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained.

In charge of generating and tracking security tickets on internal and external notifications, supporting compliance processes, and reviewing security system alerts for security incidents on campus. • Ability to follow department processes and procedures.

jobs.title: Full Stack Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
Are you ready to build great mobile and web-based applications and lead global teams with some of the brightest thought leaders, designers and technologists?  

As a [Sr. Full Stack Solutions Architect](https://moduscreate.applytojob.com/apply/ujYt9e/Full-Stack-Solutions-Architect?source=wfh.io), whether you are faced with a brand new system with a full galaxy of choices to make about server stacks, front end frameworks and supporting tools, or you have to assess a project with 10 years of technical debt, connections to legacy systems and a nasty performance cliff that has to be solved, you have the chops to figure it out and help the team find a way to succeed.  

A good [Full Stack Solutions Architect](https://moduscreate.applytojob.com/apply/ujYt9e/Full-Stack-Solutions-Architect?source=wfh.io) will have had exposure to a broad variety of front end and back end frameworks and multiple software ecosystems and will be able to explain patiently to clients and prospects about where the source of their pain may originate: anything from the network, database, back end, middleware, API, or front end - to the human factors that influence an applicationâs success or failure. Whether youâre consulting across multiple projects and teams or rolling up your sleeves to dig into code on just one, your flexibility makes all the difference.

__Weâre looking for candidates with experience in the following areas:__

* Bachelorâs degree in Computer Science, a related Engineering discipline or equivalent professional experience
* 8-12 years of progressive experience in designing, building and maintaining software systems
* Multiple operating system families and environments (Mac OS, Linux, Windows, Android, iOS, for example)
* Wide variety of computer languages, including at least one from each of these buckets
          Java, C#, C, C++, Objective C, Swift, Rust
          Python, Ruby, Bash, Perl
          JavaScript, TypeScript, Dart, Scheme, LISP, Haskell
          SQL, GraphQL, NoSQL queries, Lucene queries
* Designing and implementing APIs for systems, with both RESTful styles of communication and other legacy approaches (e.g. SOAP)
* Track record of writing responses to requests for proposals (RFPs) and writing original proposals that win consulting work
* Software estimation skills, including Agile estimation with Story Points and Scrum planning experience.
* Agile team leadership and leading by example in mixed teams of clients and consulting staff

__Highly qualified candidates will also have:__

* An advanced degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering,  a related field, or equivalent experience
* Used software configuration management frameworks (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, or Salt) to configure both individual servers and fleets of machines
* Entrepreneurial experience or experience as a lead consultant opening new client engagements
* Hands-on experience developing native or hybrid HTML applications on iOS, Android, or other mobile platforms
* Multiple publication credits in peer-reviewed scientific and technical journals or in technology industry publications
* Designed and taught classes in an area of technical expertise
* Active participation in the world wide development community, such as Open Source Software commits and social media involvement  (Stack Overflow, programming language/ framework forums, Meetup groups, blogging, Twitter)

__Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech startup? Letâs start a conversation.__

jobs.title: Application Security Analyst
jobs.content:
University of California, Santa Cruz

Application Security Analyst
Applications and Project Management

JOB #: 1606551

FULL TIME; CAREER
Starting Salary Range: $88,100 to $115,000/annually. Salary commensurate with qualifications and experience.

UCSC strives to embrace diversity in all its forms; it strives to be an inclusive community that fosters an open, enlightened & productive environment.

Technical leader with a high degree of knowledge in the overall field and recognized expertise in specific areas; problem-solving frequently requires analysis of unique issues/problems without precedent and/or structure. May manage programs that include formulating strategies and administering policies, processes, and resources; functions with a high degree of autonomy.

Applies advanced IT security concepts and campus, or Office of the President objectives to resolve broad and/or highly complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Selects methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results.

Is primarily responsible for the application security program within the Applications and Project Management (APM) portfolio of services. Provides Application Security expertise to establish and support implementation and maintenance of security standards within application development, in collaboration with Information Security analysts within UCSC and across UC. Is the primary analyst that supports risk and vulnerability assessments of applications, and facilitates remediation.

Qualifications include:

• Bachelor's degree in related area and/or equivalent experience/training.

• Information Assurance certification such as ISC2 or GIAC (CISSP, CSSLP, GWEB) and/or equivalent experience/training.

• Advanced interpersonal skills sufficient to work effectively with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization.

• Advanced experience using IT security systems and tools.

• Full-time experience serving as a dedicated application security analyst for an organization of similar size and complexity. Solid experience with security processes and procedures.

Position is open until filled; Initial Review Date: 08-09-2016

APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO USE THE UCSC ON-LINE PROCESS
View full job description and access on-line application: http://apptrkr.com/844908

To ensure review of application materials by the hiring unit they must be submitted electronically via the Staff Employment Opportunities web site (http://jobs.ucsc.edu ) on or before the initial review date. Computers are available at the UCSC Staff Human Resources office located at 1201 Shaffer Road, Santa Cruz. For further information or to request disability accommodation call 831-459-2009. Hearing impaired are encouraged to use the California Relay Service 800-735-2922. The University of California, Santa Cruz is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Sr. DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you ready to build great mobile and web-based applications and lead global teams with some of the brightest thought leaders, designers and technologists?

As a Sr. DevOps Engineer, you embody the interdependence of software development and IT operations. You love when things come together to rapidly develop and deploy products. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet.

If you can measure the performance of a production system, write automated tests to verify correct behavior, set up continuous integration and then make changes to the system to improve performance, you’re on the right track. Modus Create helps its clients build products and deploy them in production and we often need to cross the lines between development, quality assurance, and operations. Whether you’re consulting across multiple projects and teams or rolling up your sleeves to dig into code on just one, your flexibility makes all the difference.

If you have at least 4-8 years of experience working with a software development or automated QA team, using the tools and practices associated with DevOps, we have a place for you.

We’re looking for candidates with experience in the following areas:

  • Ability to set up a Continuous Deployment pipeline
  • Virtualization and containerization, especially with Docker and Vagrant
  • Automated functional testing with Cucumber, Selenium Webdriver, Watir, Capybara or similar systems
  • TDD or BDD practices
  • Jenkins, Bamboo, CircleCI or comparable continuous integration systems
  • Linux system administration
  • Proficiency in multiple scripting languages: bash, Ruby, Python or comparable systems
  • Ability to set up and customize open source software, such as LAMP stack CMS systems and Java applications
  • Familiarity with multiple database systems, both SQL and NoSQL (For example, MySQL and MongoDB)
  • Demonstrated experience in using Amazon Web Services, Heroku, or Google Compute Platform to deploy dev, test, and production applications
  • Configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, or similar systems
  • Blue/ green deployments
  • A/B testing

Highly qualified candidates will have:

  • An advanced degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field or equivalent experience
  • A track record of writing responses to requests for proposals (RFPs) and writing original proposals that win consulting work
  • Software estimation skills, including Agile estimation with Story Points and Scrum planning experience.
  • Substantial open source contributions to tools or methodologies used in the DevOps field
  • Have designed and taught classes in an area of technical expertise
  • Track record of active participation across social media (Stack Overflow, programming language/ framework forums, Meetup groups, blogging, Twitter)

Let’s Talk about You

  • You value outcomes above all else: You have a proven track record shipping great mobile and web products. By understanding the big picture, you articulate strategy and vision with strong written and verbal communication.
  • You Lead by Doing: You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.
  • You Love Work, Growth and Learning: You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. You’ll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 60 people in 10 countries in 5 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

The perks:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to work remotely / telecommute
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
  • Fun company sponsored events and activities to connect with team members

Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech startup? Let’s start a conversation.

jobs.title: Senior DBA
jobs.content:
Rockstar San Diego is seeking a Sr. DBA to join our award-winning development team. Your primary role will be architecting and operating the databases that play a vital role in the support of critical platforms and services. You should have prior experience in database operations, design and architecture, administration (monitoring and proactive maintenance, tuning and backup and recovery).

The ideal candidate will have a passion for database engines and developing a deep expertise in database internals and systems integration. The DBA must possess strong ownership qualities and be service oriented. Experience in the game industry is not required, but a passion for gaming is a huge plus.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Installation, architecture, and configuration of MS SQL 2014 & 2016.

  • Proactive and reactive performance tuning.

  • Participation in ongoing SQL development projects.

  • Physical data modelling.

  • Developing SSIS and other ETL solutions to analytical platforms.

  • Issue detection and resolution.

  • Development of automation and scripts to perform proactive maintenance.

  • Participate in 24/7 operations via on call rotation schedule.

  • Backup and recovery.

  • Provide guidance to engineers, architects and additional team members.

  • Strong knowledge of deployments and source control.

  • Documentation skills for processes and procedures.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Six or more years of current administration experience in MS SQL Server.

  • Must possess advanced SQL skills.

  • Proficiency in TSQL.

  • Expertise in storage, servers, operating systems and application interaction.

  • A sense of ownership, initiative and drive.

  • Experience in MongoDB, Hadoop, Vertica or Redis is a big plus.

  • Solid understanding and proficiency in Linux is a big plus.

  • Passion for Rockstar Games is a plus.

jobs.title: Full Stack Senior Software Engineer - Sling TV
jobs.content:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Move Networks, makers of Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet.


We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary. We only hire super stars and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


#TakeBackTV


Responsibilities:



  • An intimate understanding of Object Oriented design principles and patterns.

  • An intuitive understanding of software design/architecture and the ability to discuss and make design considerations and trade-offs.

  • A strong understanding of computer architecture concepts such as operating systems, processes, threading, memory, libraries, cloud computing, multi-core processors, etc.

  • Strong development experience with Linux server software

  • A working understanding of computer networking such as Ethernet, IP, TCP, UDP, network routing and switching, etc.

jobs.title: Experienced Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
MyFyx is looking for an experienced Full-Stack Developer to help connect people with music. MyFyx is a social music platform that amplifies the connective power of music in a unique way. MyFyx also provides artists with a novel distribution and funding model.

As a Full-Stack Developer at MyFyx, you'll be responsible for the day-to-day development and infrastructure operations. MyFyx maintains a variety of products; we have a pair of recently released iOS and Android mobile applications built with React Native, as well as a web site running on Ruby on Rails. We have a variety of backend services facilitating the mobile apps running on Google Cloud Platform with Kubernetes. We believe in using the right tool for the right job, and constant progression.

Our stack:

  • React Native with NuclearJS
  • Node.js
  • Golang
  • Elasticsearch
  • Redis
  • MongoDB
  • Ruby on Rails
  • AngularJS (1.x)
  • Kubernetes on GCP via Google Container Engine
  • Heroku

By joining MyFyx, you'll get significant input into production direction and features. We are a completely distributed company with flexible work hours.

About You:

  • Experience with modern Javascript (ES6 and beyond) and Javascript app architectures
  • Experience with Node.js
  • Experience designing and implementing backend services and APIs
  • Experience with managing deploys and infrastructure, monitoring
  • Experience with NoSQL datastores
  • Strong incite into user experience and interface design, awareness of standard iOS and Android component design patterns
  • Down to earth, easy to work with
  • Consider yourself a generalist engineer and are willing to wear many hats, sometimes at the same time
  • Comfortable with "owning" products / features and ideally have experience with being responsible for the entire end-to-end development process
  • Comfortable and willing to learn as you go. There's probably pieces of our stack you haven’t worked with before, and that's okay as long as you’re confident enough to learn as necessary.
  • Excited to work with a small team and have lots of input in product direction

It would be a big plus if you have had experience working with with some of the following:

  • Experience with any of the technologies used in our stack
  • Building products with React Native or React
  • Flux architecture. We use NuclearJS, but knowledge of Redux / Reflux / etc. will transfer easily
  • Functional Javascript libraries (e.g. Ramda, Immutable)
  • Swift, Objective C, and native iOS app development
  • Java and native Android app development
  • Prior experience working remotely

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
__Summary of Role__

As a product marketing manager at Puppet, you will be part of a team that is redefining the way businesses deliver great software faster than ever.  

You will be responsible for positioning Puppetâs products based on a clear understanding of our products and services, market needs, and competitive dynamics. You will work closely with the marketing team to create compelling demand generation programs, with the product management and marketing teams to take our products to market, with customer success to help customers excel, and with sales to increase the velocity of our business.

* You are creative, articulate, influential, and engaging, with a proven track record of success marketing software and services.
* You get the value of helping businesses deploy better software, faster. You understand how software is built and deployed.
* You are constantly improving, experimenting, and trying to be a better marketer. You love to learn.  
* You take ownership of problems and take on big challenges.
* You have a deep understanding of your product and business and are a vocal advocate of how to make both better.
* You are honest, direct, and professional. You are ambitious, but you know how to earn your opportunities, not create them.
* You know how to prioritize your work and the initiatives you champion.
* You thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment where every day brings new challenges and the need to intelligently adapt.
* You get it done.

__Qualifications__

* At least 5 years of product marketing or related experience in enterprise software, ideally with experience in the DevOps or security/compliance software.
* Ability to travel. You will spend time at industry events, and working directly with prospects and customers.
BA or BS.

__Working for Puppet__

Puppet is leading the movement that will define the next decade of software.

Today itâs characterized by the general realization that for companies to remain relevant, they have to constantly provide great software to their users.

Tomorrow itâs defined by a world of frictionless software change â where any company can deliver a better experience to their users, at any moment.

Weâre building a world of unconstrained software change. Where the software that powers everything around us is always available, is constantly modern, and accessible from anywhere

The company is growing fast and we're determined for everyone here to have a real impact on the company and our customers every day. We're driven and restless. We encourage creativity and collaboration. By challenging each other, we foster continuous improvement. Thatâs why we hire carefully for passion, self-motivation, intelligence, curiosity, and adaptability.

Puppet offers excellent health benefits for employees and family, a flexible time-off policy (that we do insist you use), and a variety of methods to grow your skills and further your career.  We have employees all around the US, the UK, Sweden, Canada, the Czech Republic and Australia.  Our headquarters in downtown Portland, Oregon, is one block off Tom McCall Waterfront Park withâ views of Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens and the Willamette River.

More than 30,000 companies â including more than two thirds of the Fortune 100 â use Puppetâs open source and commercial solutions to achieve situational awareness and drive software change with confidence. We power companies including Twitter, Yelp, Disney, Google, Citrix, eBay, NYSE, Cisco WebEx, Salesforce, Bank of America and PayPal.

Our investors include Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, VMware, Google Ventures, Cisco, True Ventures, Radar Partners, and Emerson Street Partners.

Puppet is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact +1-877-575-9775 for assistance.

_Interested in learning more about working at Puppet? Register to chat with our recruiters during Online Office Hours every [Tuesday](https://app.brazenconnect.com/a/puppet/s/0anKG/next) from 10 a.m. - 11 a.m. PDT or [Friday](https://app.brazenconnect.com/a/puppet/s/bGPMX/next) from 11 a.m. - 12 p.m. PDT._

jobs.title: Systems Administrator
jobs.content:
Dartmouth College is seeking to add a talented computing professional to our Application Infrastructure Group team. We are currently looking to fill the position of Systems Administrator. If selected, you will help support the infrastructure that provides services to a large portfolio of applications sustaining many activities at the institution. If you are a self-starter and team player who is looking to work within a challenging, leading-edge College environment we welcome your inquiry and application.



This position requires:




  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field; or the equivalent combination of education and experience.

  • Experience with installation, configuration, maintenance and support of Application Software, SharePoint, OnBase, O365, FileMaker, CyberArk, Exchange or SMTP mail.

  • Experience troubleshooting complex technical issues in a diverse technology environment.

  • Ability and willingness to quickly learn new technologies.

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills; ability to work in a collaborative team environment and provide excellent customer service; ability to communicate effectively and respectfully to a diverse community.

In return, Dartmouth College can offer the dedicated professional:

Apply Here

jobs.title: Product Owner - $100k
jobs.content:
Do you get excited when you read Ben Horowitzs definition of a good product owner? Do you love setting the vision of products and bringing them to market? Do you analyze every product you interact with and internalize good and bad ideas? Do you consider yourself the CEO of your current successful product? If so, this role is for you.

Crossover is looking for a world-class Product Owner to help us define and build the software products that underpin our continued success. You are going to be the CEO of your product and be fully hands on with everything from setting the vision to the execution to continual refinement as you receive feedback from customers. You work closely with the CEO of Crossover and with our customers to understand their needs, interpret them into requirements, work with the design team to build mockups then get them built by your dedicated engineering team.

You will be working as a pair with our engineering managers to make your roadmap reality. We will be measuring your performance based on the volume of quality features being released to production - which emphasizes how tightly you will be working with the various execution teams.

This is a completely remote position. You can work from anywhere in the world but also with people from all over the world. Therefore strong communication and presentation skills will be crucial for your success.


Company Description:

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop the vision and product roadmap that bring Crossovers mission to reality

  • Create innovative user interactions and work with our visual designers to create great visual comps for use by engineering

  • Create and prioritize the product backlog

  • Work closely with our engineers to go from comps to working software

  • Manage a development process with an expected weekly (or faster) production release within a highly agile framework

  • Continuously collect customer feedback and build suggested improvements into the product


Compensation:

  • Salary: 50 USD/hr.

  • Position type: 40 hours per week and up.

  • Location: Global - Remote. We encourage contractors to work where they are most productive.

jobs.title: App Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
The application platform/framework team builds and maintains the framework and libraries that both web and native feature teams develop on top of. The fundamental goal of the team is to make developers’ lives as easy as possible when building applications for Walmart Inc. Our secondary objective is to open source the work that we do, to make the lives of external developers easier as well. We have been currently heavily investing in NodeJS, React, and React Native. The platform that we have built is currently being migrated to across Walmart.com and Samsclub.com


Our current web platform is built on React, Redux, and NodeJS. We are trying to solve problems such as: how do you make server side rendering more performant and scalable; how do we scale hundreds of reusable react components across hundreds of developers; how do we bring react native into the mix and how do we leverage all of its goodness; how do we effectively support all of these teams migrating to our application platform.


On the native mobile side, we are heavily investing in React Native. We are trying to figure out problems, such as; what’s the best way to share code between web, Android, and iOS or what’s the best way to do over the air mobile updates.


The team is close knit with a get it done, but get it done right attitude. The team has a diverse set of backgrounds ranging from systems, telecom, mobile, to web development and with an even more diverse language skill set, but with a current focus on JavaScript. We are all here for one reason though - build innovative platforms that unlock our engineers to bring tremendous business value quickly.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Web Front End
jobs.content:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay - a company you can be proud to be a part of.

Do you want to use your software engineering skills to make the world a better place? eBay is looking for a web front end engineer to join our charity team and help make eBay the largest platform for charitable giving in the world.

For immediate and confidential consideration, please send your resume to kelcenko@ebay.com In this role you will build and enhance features that connect eBay customers and charities. You will help make it easy for eBay customers to donate funds, buy, and sell items that support good causes.

You will be joining a small but passionate and exceptionally talented team of people who are committed to making a real difference and having a lasting impact. You will be working with the latest technologies and frameworks and be called upon to innovate and grow.

What you will do:

• Define, design, implement, and test interactive experiences that connect eBay customers and charitable organizations

• Segment and design system layers to support componentized and layered application development, including user interface, business functionality, and database access.

• Work with other engineers, managers, Product Management, QA, and Operations teams to develop innovative solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles.

• Estimate engineering effort; plan implementation, and rollout system changes.

• Independently design, code, and test major features, as well as work jointly with other team members to deliver complex changes.

• Share engineering support, release, and on-call responsibilities.

• Identify technical areas for improvement and make detailed business cases for improvements or new areas of opportunities.

• Find and help fix stability/scalability issues in a very time critical environment.

• Develop industry and product technical expertise relevant to eBay’s deployment and business model.

• Lead/mentor other engineers

• Should be able to work with offshore and third party development groups and contractors.

• Expected to deliver consistently with little supervision.

Job Requirements:

• 7+ years of industry experience; A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design.

• Strong software design, problem solving and troubleshooting skills.

• Strong expertise of Python, Django, HTML5, CSS3, pure Javascript (not having to rely on JS frameworks), Nodejs (is a plus), XML Schemas, AJAX, JSP, REST/SOA services, WSDL, etc

• Experience building responsive websites is highly desired, working across platforms/browsers is a must.

• Experience in Java; can code in JSP, read/write in Java (min be able to modify existing code), understand design patterns, perform application profiling, debugging and solving DB performance issues.

• Experience with IBM WebSphere or other J2EE application servers, Eclipse IDE.

• Working knowledge of Windows and UNIX development environment and associated tools like source code management, bug tracking etc.

• Have design sense (know how critical design is to the product)

• Able to communicate effectively (verbally and written)

• Proven results oriented person with a delivery focus in a high velocity, high quality environment.

•eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms. Collectively, we connect millions of buyers and sellers around the world, empowering people and creating opportunity through Connected Commerce. Founded in 1995 in San Jose, Calif., eBay is one of the world’s largest and most vibrant marketplaces for discovering great value and unique selection.

CS degree or equivalent
