* __You Lead by Doing:__ You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.  
* __You Love Work, Growth and Learning:__   You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. Youâll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

__Letâs Talk About Us__

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 60 people in 10 countries in 5 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great. 

__The perks:__

* Competitive compensation
* Ability to work remotely / telecommute
* Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
* Fun company sponsored events and activities to connect with team members

___Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech startup? Letâs start a conversation.___

jobs.title: Development Manager
jobs.content:
About You


You are looking to do something meaningful and fulfilling with the software skills you have developed over the years. Previous roles have made you wonder if you’re actually making a difference, and you swore the next job would be different.


You’ve probably come up through the ranks, starting as a developer, and developed into a leader who can help build a winning team by hiring, mentoring, and training people. You support the team to achieve their best, by providing an environment where the team can excel – and then letting them do it. You have an interest in what users actually do with the software we build. You have tact and diplomacy in maintaining cooperative relationships and are skilled at communicating with both technical and non-technical people. You thrive in a dynamic environment, while maintaining a quality approach to software development.


You understand that water is our most precious natural resource and look forward to maintaining and continually developing an intimate knowledge and understanding of the water industry, our customers, and their requirements.


About the Opportunity


As Development Manager you will lead the Hobart development team, and are responsible for delivering multiple products within the AQUARIUS product line.


Responsibilities will include:



  • Coach, train, and encourage career development, as well as conduct performance reviews.

  • Assist with recruitment of new hires.

  • Work with the VP, Product Development, to coordinate deliveries and optimize utilization of resources and collaboration across Hobart and Vancouver development teams.

  • Responsible for scrum team health.

  • May serve as scrum master for one or more scrum teams.

  • Define and implement Agile development processes.

  • Continuously improve the productivity and quality of the development team and its deliverables.

  • Significant contributor to culture on the development team: defining, influencing and leading by example.

  • Deliver releases from development within plan and budget.

  • Work closely with the development team to contribute to design, development and code reviews.

jobs.title: CTO
jobs.content:
Paladin is streamlining corporate social responsibility (CSR) by building a global pro bono marketplace where professionals—starting with lawyers—connect with personalized pro bono opportunities and companies can track their positive impact.


We recently closed pre-seed funding by top investors and were accepted into a premier New York City-based accelerator. Its founding team has a track record of both legal pro bono expertise and scaling a YCombinator company across the country.


The CTO is a founding team role that sets the vision for the company’s tech platform and leads the creation of intuitive, impactful software that helps professionals change lives.


Key Responsibilities Include:



  • Own all technology strategy and decision making including tech stack and architecture

  • Build out the architecture and tech stack to enable Paladin to realize our mission

  • Grow and lead the engineering team

  • Be the voice of technology within the Paladin team

  • Develop and deliver the product roadmap to update Paladin as the market evolves

  • Manage day-to-day of engineering processes


Qualifications:



  • Proficiency in modern web and mobile technologies

  • 5+ years of experience, preferably in a start-up environment

  • Comfortable building out and scaling technology in a small, effective and iterative environment

  • Enjoys and has experience working in (and leading, preferably) small teams

  • Excellent communication skills


What We Offer:



  • Meaningful and impactful mission of increasing access to justice for those who need it most

  • Opportunity for rapid growth as we continue to grow

  • Benefits package and equity ownership potential

  • Fast-paced, exciting and fun startup environment within a premier accelerator program

  • Dedicated, passionate and experienced team (with backgrounds at Skadden, the United Nations, the Justice Department and Expa) committed to driving Paladin’s success


 Please contact Kristen Sonday (COO), at Kristen@JoinPaladin.com with any questions.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
At ChefSteps, we’re not just cooks—we are engineers and designers; it’s as much a tech company as it is a culinary one. We believe the future will be better when software helps cooks to learn from each other and powers the tools that put them in control of the kitchen.


You could play a key role in making that vision a reality. See this blog post for some of the areas we are working on.


We are looking for developers able to work effectively across both server and client-side to create beautiful experiences for our users on our website and in our HTML5 mobile app. Some of the core technologies we use are Rails for API generation, Angular.js, Ionic Framework and Cordova. You might be the right fit if you love food, are self-directed, enjoy refactoring, and are experienced enough to know how and when to ship.

jobs.title: BlackRock Java Web Developer
jobs.content:
The Compliance team within APG-Core Transaction Processing is responsible for building, supporting and enhancing the Compliance platform on Aladdin. The Compliance team develops tools to implement the critical business processes that ensure BlackRock complies with regulatory and investment guidelines. Our clients include Business Operations (Portfolio Compliance), portfolio managers, traders, and risk analysts across the firm. This position is for a Java Web Developer on the team. We are in search of an experienced developer to create and deliver software, take ownership of projects from start to finish, and work independently or with a project team.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop high quality software and user interfaces as well as associated unit tests.

  • Liaise with Business Analysts and Technical Leads to understand business requirements.

  • Support test team in system, integration and user acceptance testing.

  • Diagnose, research and resolve software defects

  • Work with the Project Manager and Development Manager to participate in project planning and ongoing status reporting.

  • Utilize configuration management tools to track and record changes to software

  • Work with the support/release management team to deploy software

  • Participate in and conduct code reviews.

jobs.title: Java Software Engineer Rock Star
jobs.content:
Enjoy working with some of the best and brightest. Encounter new challenges and opportunities to diversify and expand your skills. Contribute to something greater than yourself to make a real impact in a meaningful mission organization. We work hard for our mission and are compensated accordingly.


We are seeking talented, mission oriented, driven individuals to be a part of a successful team to build and improve powerful tools which greatly increase our customers' success. We are looking for problem solvers who thrive while working in a collaborative environment


This position is responsible for application engineering in support of next generation tools through the System Development Life-cycle. Specifically, this role requires development and documentation with is then handed off to operations. You will work with a team of developers to deliver business value. The target development platform includes Linux, Python, MySQL, and related tools.


Responsibilities include;



  • Software Engineering in JAVA

  • Monitor software builds and creation of installation kits per product release schedules

  • Assist quality assurance team by providing assistance to testers and support personnel as needed to determine system issues

  • Write and maintain documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections

  • Provide input to establish and improve processes and procedures

  • Participate in design and code reviews with other developers

jobs.title: Rapid Prototyping Software Engineer Ninja
jobs.content:
The Rapid Prototyping Software Engineer will join a dynamic team supporting a Department of Defense project.


The responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to;



  • Developing for modifying existing software to satisfy critical mission needs in a rapid time frame (within minutes to a week)

  • Developing new analyst ideas into prototypes in short periods of time (1-10 days)

  • Coming up with innovative new solutions to solve mission needs


The most successful candidates:



  • Have experience in a variety of languages and platforms (Most common languages are Python, Java, Javascript, Bash) (Most common technologies include SQL, JQuery, XML, elasticsearch, web-based APIs) (Most common platforms include RHEL/Centos 5/6/7, Windows Servers, and docker containers)

  • Are willing to learn new things as needed on the job and work in a dynamic mission-oriented environment.  

  • Are okay with sacrificing perfection for speed (strive for an 80% solution that can be done ASAP rather than expending a long development effort to get the software to 99% perfection)

  • Enjoy the pressure / benefits of rapid development (and near-immediate feedback on the software developed by mission elements)

  • Are able to work very independently and are self-motivated

  • Are able and willing to do whatever technical tasks (other than programming) to get the job done (ex: Install and configure an OS, deploy and configure software via rpm and yum, etc.)

  • Have a solid understanding of networks and network protocols

jobs.title: Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for the brightest engineering minds to solve the world’s most complex financial challenges. Join us in building and bettering the world’s smartest financial technology, Aladdin.


This position is for a Software Engineer on BlackRock’s Aladdin’s trading platform. The Aladdin Trading System is one of the most critical components of the BlackRock technology stack and is designed to handle multiple asset classes on a unified platform. It is a distributed system designed to handle high volumes at low latency. The key components of the trading system include the order management system, the order crossing components, smart order routing, FIXconnectivity and execution management system.

jobs.title: CND Software Engineer Whiz
jobs.content:
Enjoy working with some of the best and brightest. Encounter new challenges and opportunities to diversify and expand your skills. Contribute to something greater than yourself to make a real impact in a meaningful mission organization. We work hard for our mission and are compensated accordingly.


We are seeking talented, mission oriented, driven individuals to be a part of a successful team to build and improve powerful tools which greatly increase our customer's success. We are looking for problem solvers who thrive while working in a collaborative environment. 


Responsibilities to include but not limited to;



  • Seeking someone to work directly in an operations organization on a small, tight-knit development team helping to drive the customer's CND mission into the future. 

  • You'll interface directly with expert CND analysts to design and develop tools. 

  • The most common languages we currently use are Java, Python, PHP, Bash, Perl, and C++.

  • Should have solid understanding of networks & protocols, host-based collection and analysis methods/tools.

jobs.title: Director of Software Engineering
jobs.content:
Edlab at The Gottesman Libraries envisions, designs, and pilots knowledge projects for a fundamentally different education sector that is attuned to the emerging post­industrial, information­based, globally­connected world. EdLab is organized in small flexible multi­disciplinary teams that collaborate to develop products of distinction.


The Director of Software Engineering is responsible for all software development. The individual in this position will direct the software engineering team in developing, releasing and maintaining software applications and platforms according to EdLab and Library needs.


The director will design and implement information systems to adequately support the enterprise infrastructure of the Library, as well as:



  • Analyzes system requirements and ensures that systems will offer security and will be effectively integrated with current applications.

  • Supervises solutions architects, software developers and software engineers to ensure that all systems are working at optimal levels.

  • Provides leadership to application developers regarding new technologies and system requirements.

  • Has thorough knowledge of infrastructure, application programming, and web and software applications. 

  • Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.

  • Performs a variety of tasks.

  • Leads and directs the work of others.

  • A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.

jobs.title: Cloud Software Engineer Guru
jobs.content: The best candidate for this position would be a self-motivated individual who has a strong attention to detail.  Must be able to work independently as well as part of a team, and be able to identify support gaps, and work pro-actively to get tasks done.  Provide software development and engineering support to a specific program and its cloud infrastructure. Direct experience with Big Data Store technology, such as Hbase, Cloud/Base/Accumulo, and Big Table. Experience with Map Reduce programming models and technologies are also a plus.

jobs.title: Adobe AEM / CQ Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an exceptional Java/JSP developer with a background in developing web applications in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM).  You will join a team that is responsible for developing and delivering websites on Adobe Experience Manager (AEM). Your role will span all aspects of the software development lifecycle and you will collaborate closely with our marketing, user experience, design and web development teams.

This position requires a strong technical background.  The ideal candidate will have a degree in Computer Science or related field, with hands-on coding experience.  Critical skills include HTML, CSS and JavaScript front-end development in addition to a strong proficiency in Java for server-side development. Familiarity with RESTful web architectures and experience with scalability, availability and stability are desired.


This position is ideal for someone with strong programming skills who wants to grow rapidly while working with latest web programming languages and technologies.

jobs.title: Front-End
jobs.content:
Feature upgrades to live e-commerce site with 70k lines of JavaScript, back-end of Scala, with a middle tier involving Endeca

Fast forward 1 year - you have built, maintained, upgraded, and developed new features and shopping experiences for Canada's #1 e-commerce website & app


While making feature upgrades to the site, we are also working on 2 native apps for this client. You will be working on a large team with a lot of expertise

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content: The engineering team at OpenX is looking for Python experts to build and maintain high-performance distributed systems. This is a Lead Software Engineer role with emphasis on Python/Django.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
BigCommerce is looking for Senior Software Engineer - Core Services (PHP, Go, Ruby) in our San Francisco office to decompose our product into robust core services, which can be scaled to meet demand. To be successful in this role, you will be expected to write highly-performant code and have a deep understanding of large distributed systems.


What You'll Do



  • Build highly-available, highly-performant, redundant, scalable distributed systems.

  • Write code that is performant, maintainable, clear, and concise.

  • Work closely with other engineers to decompose our current codebase into a SOA.

  • Work closely with our Omni-Channel team to build new services and collaborate with teams focused on our Control Panel, Merchandise, and Ecosystem/Apps/Themes.

  • Work closely with operations and infrastructure to build and improve the architecture

jobs.title: Magento Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you want to change the world? Most do, but few actually accomplish this feat. DEG, named one of Inc. Magazine's "25 Companies That Are Changing The World" is changing the world and is looking for a talented, innovative, team-oriented associate that makes DEG more than the sum of its parts.


DEG, a Magento Gold Partner, is seeking a Magento Engineer with experience implementing solutions with Magento for a full-time position leading eCommerce project development for a diverse group of interesting companies. Applicants must have at least 3-5 years demonstrated experience building database-driven web-based applications. In addition to some level of relevant technology domain expertise, this individual must have basic project management skills and be able to contribute meaningfully to client meetings, deliverables and proposals.


Engineers are primarily responsible for delivering client value by implementing applications and solutions in various platforms, frameworks and languages. The successful candidate will build innovative solutions on-time and on-budget with low technical debt. This is a great opportunity to work on complex solutions in a variety of industries and emerging technologies. Contribute to a leading digital consultancies mission and vision by delivering functional applications and services with a high degree of excellence.


DEG is a growing company with an employee-centric culture and high regard for technology. Our highly entrepreneurial, collaborative, and dynamic environment is the perfect place for smart, motivated people to make an impact. With competitive benefits and a dedication to work-life balance, we are also a great place to come work.


Responsibilities


The Magento Engineer is responsible for implementing the project from design and functional specifications. Depending on the project, this may include the following responsibilities:



  • Implements business logic and integration services as defined by the client and BA

  • Implements data access layer, database model and logic

  • May implement interface layout and behavior

  • Performs unit testing, both automated and manual, of business logic and behavior to confirm proper implementation of requirements and quality execution

  • Documents work

  • Estimates development tasks during discovery, scoping, planning and development stages

  • Communicates technical dependencies, blocks and risks to project stakeholders and management

  • Interacts with clients and project leads to provide technical direction and recommendations

  • Collaborates with senior engineers and project leads on technical decisions

  • Implements front-end layout and behavior with HTML, JavaScript and CSS

  • Learns and adheres to company coding standards and conventions

  • Database design, implementation and query development

  • Provides valuable written feedback on peers and evaluation of team performance

  • Follows project level design decisions and conventions

  • Manages time effectively to meet deadlines and commitments

  • May configure and deploy projects to various hosting environments for review

  • Provides exploratory and budget estimates as well as feasibility assessments

  • May perform basic server administration and configuration of development and hosting environments

jobs.title: Classic ASP Software Engineer
jobs.content:
What you’ll be doing:



  • New Feature Develop for the current product.

  • Help with testing in the form of drafting beta test scripting as well as active testing on your own and others’ work.

  • New Client Installs (Setting up the product website, databases, data importation)

  • While graphic design is not necessary clean, progressive, and responsive interfaces are very important to our brand. Tasks will include wireframing and sharing ideas for UX.

  • Help with maintenance tasks for our clientbase running Classic ASP/SQL, and our Reporting Spreadsheet Add-Ins.


What we’re looking for:



  • Someone able to work onsite in San Diego, as well as from their own location(s). Candidate will work onsite for first week or two then taper off to weekly visits as necessary.

  • A past history of development in ASP is preferred, however a competency in VB Script is required.

  • Assistance in writing and designing UI, means candidate should be fluent in HTML5.

  • A high competency in adapting JQuery to support our highly prized and important Product UI.

  • Will have thorough knowledge of TSQL, and have demonstrated creative and efficient use of stored procedures, and query tuning.

jobs.title: Full Stack Senior Developer
jobs.content:
You will be responsible for developing new features and extending existing features of the YouVisit platform. You will also be required to understand all aspect of our platform including frontend and backend technologies; develop high-quality code, perform code reviews, write unit tests, optimize SQL, and conform to the latest best practices.


Responsibilities:



  • Architect, design, and scale solutions for web-related development

  • Collaborate with product and design teams to define, iterate, and implement new features

  • Provide technical leadership around the delivery of component designs and development

  • Write thorough technical specs

  • Break down tasks  

  • Perform Code Reviews

jobs.title: Full Stack Ruby On Rails Developer
jobs.content:
As a Ruby on Rails Developer, you will have the opportunity to code at all levels of our e-commerce stack and collaborate with team members who value writing high quality software that make significant contributions to the value of the company. Your contributions will yield in creating innovative experiences for our online customers.


Position will report directly to the Head of Technology.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer


We believe data can change the world.


And we believe people can, too.


At Qlik, we’re committed to making it easier for people to make transformative discoveries in their data and act on them. We want to enhance everyone’s natural ability to ask questions, analyze data, and make decisions. And that helps make analyzing data a natural part of making decisions and creating value.


What makes you Qlik?


Would you like to work for a great company where you can make a difference?  If you love simplicity and share a passion to challenge the conventional, here is your chance to make a career of it.

Qlik offers a fast paced, high-energy, innovative, global and team-oriented culture, with a flexible and exciting work environment, as well as plenty of opportunities for you to grow as a professional and as an individual.


We’re looking for developers who are passionate about moving fast, solving new problems and building awesome software for the cloud. Our team members have expertise with web applications and APIs, containerization, and testing best practices. Everyone is expected to understand the full system, help develop it and make sure it runs smoothly in production.


This is what you’ll be working on:



  • Scalable data persistence microservice deployed to AWS;

  • NoSQL database technology such as Apache Cassandra and Titan;

  • Clean, tested code that contains well documented RESTful APIs in line with web API standards;

  • Writing high-performance production ready code that is deployed continuously; and

  • Automation of everything!

jobs.title: Interaction Designer
jobs.content: Google is hiring an Interaction Designer in Onsite in Kirkland, WA

jobs.title: IOS App Engineer
jobs.content:
Join our team as we create the best car search engine to help shoppers more easily find the best car deals around! We are turning used car shopping on its head by applying Big Data analytics and using proprietary algorithms to objectively analyze, score and rank millions of cars and tens of thousands of dealers. iSeeCars was founded by technology and business executives from TripAdvisor and SAP, and we're growing at a rapid pace. iSeeCars has been featured extensively in the media, including the Wall Street Journal, CNN, Consumer Reports, Cars.com, AutoTrader, Forbes, Fortune, “TODAY” show, USA TODAY, ABC, CBS, NBC and more.


What you’ll do:


Conceive of ways to make the iSeeCars native IOS app even better in terms of user experience, features and performance


Take charge for all aspects of software engineering, from design, development, QA and maintenance.


Effectively communicate your coding solutions and articulate the reasons for your decisions


Take ownership of the app and investigate and fix any bugs that come up or are mentioned by our users


This role would be full-time at our office in Woburn, MA (just outside of Boston). We would consider working remotely on an exception basis. Will only consider candidates from the U.S..


PLEASE: Only local candidates who are authorized to work in the US without sponsorship should apply. No 3rd party recruiting or consulting firms.

jobs.title: iOS App Engineer
jobs.content:
Join our team as we create the best car search engine to help shoppers more easily find the best car deals around! We are turning used car shopping on its head by applying Big Data analytics and using proprietary algorithms to objectively analyze, score and rank millions of cars and tens of thousands of dealers. iSeeCars was founded by technology and business executives from TripAdvisor and SAP, and we're growing at a rapid pace. iSeeCars has been featured extensively in the media, including the Wall Street Journal, CNN, Consumer Reports, Cars.com, AutoTrader, Forbes, Fortune, “TODAY” show, USA TODAY, ABC, CBS, NBC and more.

Effectively communicate your coding solutions and articulate the reasons for your decisions


Take ownership of the app and investigate and fix any bugs that come up or are mentioned by our users

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are expanding our product  engineering team and looking for high level contributors. Are you looking to work on a smart team where you can both learn and share?

At Kissmetrics, we’re solving hard problems with simple solutions that make our customers happy. We’re creating an analytics and conversion platform that helps marketers drive conversions. And we’re having fun doing it.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Cloud Foundry - Santa Monica
jobs.content:
The Cloud Foundry engineering team is looking for a few great engineers to join us in building an open source platform that transforms how the world deploys and scales software.


Watch this short video from the engineers at Pivotal!


You
 
You love shipping features, but know that well factored code is what lets you keep shipping features in the long run.  Maybe you get antsy writing code without tests, or perhaps you’re a large-scale system operator interested in leveling-up your coding skills.
 
Either way, you judge your success by the success of your team; you are interested in learning about distributed systems; and you are excited to work on open source.
 
Us
 
At Pivotal Cloud Foundry we are opinionated about how software should be built. We pair program, all-day every-day, because we know it delivers remarkable results. We work in small teams, and rotate between them frequently. We believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge, and refocus.
 
Where


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.

We’re seeking more amazing developers to add to our team. Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter.
 
Desired Skills/ Experience:
      Operations or Systems Administration experience, particularly on UNIX. (You know what a daemon is and how to restart one. When the daemon won’t start because some other process is listening on the port it needs, you can find and kill the errant process.)
      Experience and/or interest in Test Driven Development (TDD) and agile methodologies
      Ability to dive into a polyglot codebase and contribute while learning
      BA/BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
 
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
PeopleDoc is seeking a Developer to join our front end team.  This small but important team is responsible for designing and implementing UX and UI across our solutions.


 Based in Paris, or able to telecommute (European timezones only), the successful candidate will have experience building modern web applications and working with other developers towards shared goals.  He / She will be skilled in writing production grade HTML and CSS, be familiar with front end tooling (such as Grunt and Make), and have experience working with Git or other similar version control systems.  Knowledge of JavaScript and CSS preprocessors is advantageous.


 Candidates with experience working on large CSS code-bases, or those who have investigated various CSS methodologies (BEM, SMACSS, etc.) will be viewed favorably.


 As a member of the team, the developer will be responsible for integrating new front end code into existing systems, fixing production bugs and rolling out new user interfaces.


About the Position:



  • Developing, reviewing and testing new UI components (HTML, SCSS, JS)

  • Working with product owners and back-end developers to integrate front-end code into existing product codebases

  • Supporting the team by triaging bugs and implementing new UIs

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer - HERE - Java, AWS, Big Data
jobs.content: The research, architecture, and systems engineering team in HERE’s traffic and dynamic content organization is looking for multiple software development engineers to help drive the development of new and innovative technologies for connected vehicles and smart cities.   Located in downtown Chicago, our team is responsible for identifying and creating the prototypes for future products and systems that shape the efficiency, safety, and performance of delivering the dynamic content relevant to tomorrow’s vehicles.  We are expanding and this is a great opportunity for experienced and motivated software development engineers who have a proven track record with creating large scale highly reliable systems to contribute.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
As a company, we believe in driving efficiency through technology and automation. Our IT team shares the same passion. 


Reporting to the Senior Software Architect, the job incumbent will be responsible for the design, development, testing and maintenance of new and existing programs and applications. The Software Developer position is a very hands-on role that requires an individual with a highly motivated and methodical approach to work with users on technically challenging issues.


Duties Include:



  • Develop intuitive and responsive web based user interfaces for both internal use and external customers.

  • Develop new features and improvements to the existing Warehouse Management System, dashboards, automated reporting, intranet sites as well as developing new applications.

  • Collaborate with the senior software architect to improve back end tools to drive improvements to our Continuous Integration process (Docker, Gitlab)

  • Communicate with customers and employees to evaluate requests for enhancements to existing programs, or develop new ones.

  • Some travel between our various facilities is required

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description:


PeopleDoc is looking for experienced and talented web developers who love working with Python, Django, JavaScript, ember.js. You will join a passionate and entrepreneurial team, and work in a very challenging environment in one of the fastest growing SaaS startup in the HR space.


Successful candidate will be able to:



  • Design and ship new features in collaboration with the Product & UX Team

  • Use your deep understanding of web technologies and APIs to advise on the system's architecture and improve our processes to get new code on production

  • Analyze, rethink and refactor the code to scale the application

  • Write unit, functional and performances tests

  • Push your code in production, optimize our deployment process

  • Contribute to our OpenSource Projects


What we bring to the table:



  • A passionate and welcoming team,

  • Team work is in our core values; we learn from each other by pair programming or via extensive code reviews

  • Double screens, supercharged PCs,

  • Croissants every monday,

  • 2 annual programming events sponsored,

  • Babyfoot, tennis table and PS4 for the lunch break

  • Open to remote workers

jobs.title: Human Resources Business Partner
jobs.content:
Are you looking to join a team that is building a world class employee experience? MuleSoft is looking to expand their People Operations team, and are looking for a dynamic HR Business Partner. In this role, you’ll be partnering with functional leaders on their people management and be building people ops programs to support our rapidly growing company. 

About the Position:

In this position, you will partner with senior business leaders across the U.S. to ensure their strategic goals have the people power in place to make them a reality. Coach all levels of managers as they work through the various scenarios that come up when managing people in a dynamic organization. Actively participate in functional leadership meetings to understand both business and talent needs and how they intersect. Collaborate with the people ops team in the design and implementation of a variety of people programs that give managers and employees leverage in executing effectively against their objectives.

Position Deliverables:

30 Days:

  • Gain an understanding of how we operate, and what the roadmap looks like for the business
  • Meet the key business leaders in the US and begin to build relationships with the leadership teams in sales, engineering, product, marketing, etc.
  • Identify opportunities to partner with the business that further support the key objectives of people operations for 2016

60 Days:

  • Serve as a change agent in the support the business as people operations introduces quarterly check-ins
  • Assist in the development of key content for manager trainings and development series
  • Collaborate with the People Operations team to rework the promotion process and career mapping for organization
  • Partner with the Sr. Director of People Operations in the delivery of a global employee engagement survey
  • Continue to ingratiate yourself within the business, establish yourself as a trusted advisor

90+ Days:

  • Partner with the Senior Director of People Operations to execute key objectives that are on the roadmap
  • Continue to support the business in the roll-out of quarterly check-ins
  • Identify opportunities for impact (both small and large) from a people perspective

About You:

  • You have 5+ years working as an HR business partner or equivalent in a rapidly growing technology environment
  • You have enough business acumen to give you the credibility you need to coach leaders far more experienced than you
  • You are a creative problem solver that doesn’t rely simply on “best practices” or the standard HR playbook
  • You think about the tradeoffs between risk tolerance and common sense
  • You use analysis, empathy and good judgement to approach business and people problems
  • You are an amazing communicator and an effective influencer. People trust you and they follow you
  • You are both analytically driven in your decision making and empathetic to the impact your decisions have on real people
  • We’re going through hyper growth so you need to have the some experience helping organizations scale at high velocity MuleSoft has exceptionally fast development cycles and an entrepreneurial culture offering Product Managers 100% ownership of their products and the opportunity to become an industry leader as we revolutionize the $550+ billion dollar integration market

About Our Benefits:

  • Pre-IPO equity
  • Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family
  • 401(k) and pre-tax health care, dependent care and commuter benefits (FSA)
  • “No policy” vacation policy
  • Commute up the peninsula on the MuleSoft shuttle
  • Gym discounts and on-site yoga classes
  • Mac or PC
  • Fully stocked kitchen, regular catered lunches, weekly happy hours, family nights
  • Annual, all-company weeklong MeetUp trip for collaboration, learning and inspiration

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Ad Systems
jobs.content:
We are seeking a Software Engineer to help define our next-generation, real-time bidding platform. With over 500,000+ decisions per second, we are building out infrastructure enhancements to focus on availability, performance and availability.

Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings.  However, you should have a true passion for technology that is apparent in your work and/or personal projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and maintain a robust and fault tolerant real-time bidding system
  • Monitor and plan out core infrastructure enhancements (a.k.a. stay ahead of possible scalability bottlenecks)
  • Work with machine learning team to implement optimizations to increase campaign effectiveness
  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

Requirements:

  • Excellent problem solving skills and ability to work independently
  • Strong sense of ownership and track record of quality work
  • Exercise good judgment about which tools to use and when to use them
  • Java experience and Linux/Unix skills
  • Good written and oral communication skills

Compensation and Benefits

You'll appreciate a competitive compensation package including an equity component and excellent benefits. You'll love a challenging work environment, exceptional colleagues, strong business momentum, clear objectives and the ability to make a difference. Benefits include: medical, dental, vision, 401K matching, company events and an extraordinary culture.

About TubeMogul

TubeMogul is the global leader in software used by brands and agencies to plan, buy and measure their brand advertising. By reducing complexity, improving transparency and leveraging real-time data, our platform enables marketers to gain greater control of their video advertising spend.

TubeMogul is founder-led and we strive to hire people who have a high “Do:Say” ratio - these are the people that excel at TubeMogul. We were recently ranked as the #5 Best Place to Work in the Small/Mid-Sized category by Glassdoor and our core value of ‘Getting Stuff Done’ defines our hard-charging culture where accountability is valued above all else.

TubeMogul was founded in 2007 and is a public company listed on the NASDAQ Stock Exchange under the symbol “TUBE”. We are based in Emeryville, California with offices in New York, London, Singapore, Tokyo, Sydney, Toronto and across the United States.

How to Apply

Please submit a cover letter with your resume explaining why you are an ideal candidate for this role. Please use the link provided to apply. This opportunity is full-time only.  No contractors, consultancies or recruiters will be considered.

jobs.title: Senior Product Security Engineer
jobs.content:
Twilio Senior Product Security Engineers are responsible for making sure Twilio products meet the highest security standards in the industry. Successful candidates have a strong software development background, have prior experience working with product teams and are experts at securing applications.

About the job:

  • You will excel at talking with engineers and business teams, in language they understand, about their products’ and systems’ security posture.
  • You will understand security implications of our products and give guidance to ensure that they are as secure as possible.
  • You will build security tools to find and fix security bugs at scale.
  • A successful candidate will have a proven track record of building secure applications. They should understand the security impacts and security decisions that need to be made to build secure products, and then be able to articulate those to engineers outside the Security team. 

Responsibilities:

  • Be part of a small, high-impact and multi-talented Security team.
  • Work with product management and engineering teams to perform security/privacy reviews of their products and systems.
  • Develop tools to find and fix security issues at scale.
  • Create automated tests to enforce security standards.
  • Develop security training and education for developers.
  • Find vulnerabilities in different tech stacks and languages (Java, Python, Scala, PHP, C/C++).
  • Excel as an engineer and be a productive member of the team where leadership is a behavioral trait, not a title.

Requirements:

  • Strong understanding of vulnerabilities, common attack vectors and how to resolve them.
  • Ability and interest to educate software engineers on secure coding practices.
  • Strong understanding of authentication and authorization protocols.
  • Expert in web application security issues (OWASP 10).
  • Strong development background and secure coding best practices in different languages/stacks.
  • Ability to develop threat models and attack trees using a standardized process.
  • Familiar with cloud technologies and are hands-on with AWS.
  • Deep experience in a minimum of three (applied cryptography, web app security, security protocols, AWS security, threat modeling, network security, writing secure code).

About us:

Twilio makes communications easy and powerful. With Twilio's platform, businesses can make communications relevant and contextual by embedding real-time communication and authentication capabilities directly into their software applications. Twilio gives businesses the ability to innovate, prototype, create, and connect with their customers at the right time and in the right way. Founded in 2008, Twilio is a public company based in San Francisco, California with other offices around the world.


Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. #LI-POST

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Identity Team
jobs.content:
We're looking for a great Sr. Software Engineer to join our Identity and Access Services team and help us transform the internal service architecture at the very heart of Twilio.


About the job: 


In this role, you will work on our foundational building blocks, implementing the vision of self-service SOA infrastructure within a company experiencing exponential growth and rapid-fire product rollouts. You will develop a suite of scalable, resilient and very secure services underlying all of our products. You will be implementing globally available, resilient and highly performant services used by millions of people every day. You will make key technical decisions and design choices, as well as writing amazing code, and you’ll provide advice and support to more junior engineers.


We expect and encourage you to learn, grow and take on ever more ambitious challenges as the company and team scales. This role is as technically demanding as it gets; if you’re interested in tackling a real challenge, this is *the* job.


Responsibilities:

  • Join a small, high-impact, multi-talented engineering team with openings in San Francisco, CA and Tallinn, Estonia.

  • Create, maintain, own and operate your team’s services that supporting fundamental capabilities within Twilio’s products.

  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems you can face developing high availability services in a distributed cloud environment that needs to scale exponentially.

  • Help evaluate and choose emerging technologies…new service protocols and architectures, self-healing capabilities, globally distributed caching, performance and code quality tooling, etc. Determine the right tool for the right task.

  • Write high quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced startup environment with tight schedules.

jobs.title: Accounting Manager
jobs.content:
Responsibilities
  • Supervise accounting staff on daily tasks
  • Provide training to new and existing staff as needed.
  • Ensure an accurate and timely month end close by providing leadership and support to the accounting close process. This role includes serving as a hands-on team member responsible for performing and reviewing transactions.
  • Assist with daily banking requirements. Monitor and forecast cash position
  • Establish and enforce proper accounting policies and principles
  • Assist in development and implementation of new procedures to enhance the workflow of the department.
  • Responds to inquiries from the CFO, Controller, and company wide managers regarding financial results, special reporting requests and the like.
  • Assist in preparing for and managing annual external audit. Coordinate with other auditors as needed.
  • Support overall department goals and objectives
  • This person will initially coordinate third party providers as an individual contributor. Over time this person will be expected to build and manage a team.
Requirements
  • MUST:  Proven work experience as an Accounting Manager or similar leadership role.
  • Ability to contribute to the career development of staff and a culture of teamwork
  • Strong working knowledge of GAAP principles and financial statements
  • MUST: Must have experience with Netsuite
  • Proficient with excel and google sheets
  • MUST:  Must have multiple entity consolidation entry experience with International tax experience preferred.
  • Detail-oriented, self-directed and able to effectively complete tasks with minimal supervision
  • Proficiency with GitLab
  • You share our values, and work in accordance with those values.

To apply: Visit our team page and click on the "apply" button.

jobs.title: Manager of Application Development
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a leader within engineering to build cutting edge cloud applications to revolutionize the world of content marketing and enterprise software. Desired applicant will wear the hats of both a well-rounded senior hands-on engineer and a leader for fellow engineers. This role will be responsible for technical design, new feature development, working with UX designers, researching and evaluating new technology, and maintaining a well-tested and high quality software codebase. Individuals that succeed at NewsCred are intelligent, highly motivated, fearless team players capable of working in an agile environment. They are proven self-starters and quick learners. We have a passion for technology but are not dogmatic. We use Node.js, Angular.js, MongoDB, Python, Solr, MySQL, and a number of big data analytics tools.


We are looking for strong technical leaders who:



  • Are eager for opportunities to mentor and teach.

  • Thrive in an autonomous, high energy environment.

  • Enjoy pairing with team members to produce innovative solutions.

  • Care about efficient code, beautiful algorithms, fearless refactoring, and iterative development.

  • Love to delight users.


What you’ll do:



  • Provide technical leadership to the development team

  • Evangelize great practices across teams

  • Work closely with product owners, designers, agile coaches and developers in a dynamic, agile environment innovating on new products and features

  • Design and develop software collaboratively in a pair-programming environment

  • Continuously deploy high quality software to customers

  • Design and architect solutions focused on performance, scalability and high availability

jobs.title: Sr. UX Engineer - Voice
jobs.content:
As a full stack engineer on the Programmable Voice team at Twilio, you will be responsible for creating compelling web experiences for Programmable Voice.

About the job:


You will define the interactions that developers both external and internal have with Twilio’s expanding Programmable Voice product and create new dashboards and analytics to convey user-critical information. The interfaces that you build will be relied upon by Twilio’s largest customers on a daily basis, and you will continually expand and refine the experience to meet our customers' changing needs. 


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain the backbone of our web framework to support the Programmable Voice product line.

  • Own your production infrastructure end-to-end.  You’ll deploy your own code multiple times a week.

  • Work directly with product and engineering management to define, architect, and build new customer-facing features.  At Twilio, product roadmaps are a team sport.

  • Write quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced professional software engineering environment.

  • Influence cross team initiatives and mentor junior engineers.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - C++/C#
jobs.content: Help us develop the next generation of our industry-leading, physiology-based credibility assessment software, which is utilized by government agencies and thousands of users worldwide in multiple languages.  This position is a ground floor opportunity to redesign our existing commercial Microsoft Windows application to incorporate leading-edge technologies that allow our software to fully utilize Windows 10 running on computers in all forms to include laptops, desktops, tablets, and other mobile devices.  The current system provides an extensive user interface and performs functions such as data acquisition, data display, automated data analysis, audio/video recording, and automated report generation.  Our system has appeared on television programs such as Myth Busters, Dr. Phil, and numerous others and is routinely referenced in the media.  Join us for this unique opportunity!

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
When it comes to modern day software development, you will have your finger on the pulse of the entire pipeline. You will need to be comfortable interfacing with various software components and always considering how best to deliver in a rapidly iterative fashion with a strong focus on service availability, scalability and resilience.


DevOps is as much about communication and business relationships as it is about any of the software or tools you will use.


Duties & Responsibilities


As a New Context DevOps Engineer you will be expected to provide technical leadership with a hands-on approach. On a daily basis you will be interfacing with our clients and other New Context staff members while working from the New Context office, at client sites or from your home. Expect to heavily leverage open source software to tackle challenges like delivery of highly secured containers to IoT devices or building Big Data ecosystems at petabyte scale and beyond.


The team works well together, but also understands that sometimes they go rogue to motivate the group into being effective. Your most important daily responsibilities: have fun, lead by example and solve exciting challenges.


Qualifications



  • Seasoned Technical Veteran


    • We are looking for a team member with 5+ years of experience in a similar role that can demonstrate they have already learned how to excel in this role.

    • Experience with highly available and high-performance open source web technologies

    • Existing familiarity (or the eagerness to learn) Ruby and/or Python is helpful, given they are the common languages of systems automation.


  • Strong communication skills


    • You must be ready to communicate current status in an effective and professional manner.


  • Independent worker


    • Work may often require direct interaction with clients or team members without direct supervision. You must be able to think on your feet, communicate constantly and professionally, and above all else meet the expectations of our clients.


  • Calm and professional demeanor


    • This is critical! You will be faced with frustrated clients, team members and situations. You must be able to handle yourself in a professional manner and find the best course of action to take in order to please the client as much as is possible.

jobs.title: Head of Architecture
jobs.content:
eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds, with 12 brands that offer services in more than 1000 cities around the world. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities - whether it’s a job, an apartment, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Our central product and tech organization services all our markets by providing key capabilities & services which are demonstrated by all of our sites. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our environment.



What you can expect from us:




  • A harmonious, informal, international and playful work environment

  • Work with cool modern technologies, processes and consumer facing products

  • Access to tools and resources to do your job (best in class laptop, Safari Online subscription

  • Ability to join multiple internal interest groups in eBay in trending topics like Data Science, Mobile Development, Customer Experience and more

  • Continuous Deployment of product changes to get rapid feedback about your work

  • Being part of the eBay family, a company with a history and great potential



We are a community of technologists who have effective relationships with many satisfied internal lients. We are committed to understanding the e-Commerce sector intimately. We are looking for a leader to drive our architecture into its’ next generation. You will work with a team of architects around the globe to keep us modern and lean. You have a deep understanding of web-scale architectures and understand how our (micro) service based application stacks help our business thrive. Clouds and Containers are what you have for breakfast, large scale NoSQL and Kafka for lunch and Native mobile clients for dinner. You operate across different technology stacks. You are well rooted in the Open Source and Java world, but are not scared of venturing into the worlds of .NET, Node.js and GoLang.



Responsibilities:




  • MSc degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence or similar field.

  • 10+ years of professional experience in the described or and adjacent field with an established track record as an architect or consultant.

  • Proficient oral and written communication skills, including presentation experience, with attested leadership and mentorship abilities.

  • You will coordinate a (virtual) team of highly qualified professionals on web scale application architecture.

  • Excellent in priorities and direction based on our overarching architecture plans.

  • Participate vendor selection and technical diligence of new acquisitions

  • Work with our compliance and security functions keep us resilient in that space.

  • Engage with teams around to world to coach.

  • Working knowledge of various technologies like Java, Kafka, Elastic, MongoDB, Cassandra, Mesos, Marathon, Openstack

  • You have demonstrated leading change and transformation through participation as a senior technology leader.

  • Experience with running Big Size projects across multiple time zones.


Interested?

Than we are pleased to meet you. Please apply through our career site with cv and cover letter. For more information contact Donja Huidar, Digital Talent Manager eBay eCG +31 650839943.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps
jobs.content:
DialogTech (formerly Ifbyphone) provides the only platform for end-to-end call attribution and conversion essential for data-driven marketers. DialogTech’s platform solves one of the most pressing challenges in today’s mobile-first world by eliminating the black hole inbound calls create in understanding true marketing performance.


Thanks to smartphones, consumers are calling businesses to engage in conversation at record rates throughout every stage of the customer journey, and at DialogTech we are changing the world of voice communication for our customers.  We enable our customers to better attribute their voice interactions at each stage of the marketing and sales processes and more quickly convert those calls to sales.


Looking for a team member that is passionate about building highly scalable and reliable systems, and relentless about driving continuous improvement. You will be part of a multi-location team developing web, analytics, and telephony systems.


This role is located in our Independence, OH office, with convenient access from both Cleveland and Akron.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Android Applications
jobs.content:
Since its inception, Google has built products that change the way people all over the world live and access information - looking up recipes, finding their favorite song, turn-by-turn directions, checking their email, and so much more. How and where people view this information continues to change as the world becomes an increasingly mobile place.


As an Android Applications Software Engineer, you’ll drive new innovations and build beautiful user experiences on the largest mobile platform in the world. You’ll work with world-class mobile developers and resources to drive the next generation of apps at Google. Whether building native applications on Google’s core products and services - Search, Gmail, YouTube - or pioneering new visions - like Google Now on Tap, Android Wear, Cardboard - you’ll impact people’s lives wherever they interact with our products - in their homes, on the go, or someplace in between!


You will develop applications primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. You might design and develop open-source Android applications that are part of the Android Open Source Project or closed-source Google applications that are the interface to Google services on Android.


Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.





Responsibilities




  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s products.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support large, complex web applications like Gmail, Google Search and Google Maps.

  • Write scalable, performant server-side code. Build on top of our world-class infrastructure to create the services that support an amazing mobile experience.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer - Learning, Teamwork, Humility, and Fun
jobs.content:
We're looking for software developers of all experience levels to join our Chicago-based team. We build complex and compelling web applications for clients in the health and well-being industry, utilizing our own software, Pepper. To best serve our clients, you'll delve into new subject matter every day, and you'll always be on the lookout for innovative ways to approach our software projects. We're looking for curious, collaborative people who are eager to teach what they already know and who jump at an opportunity to dive into new territory. 


Here's where you come in:


You'll join our cross-functional consulting teams in developing custom web applications for our clients. Our software is currently written with Java, the Spring Framework, Vaadin, HTML5, CSS (using Less), and a very heavy dose of JavaScript (primarily jQuery, Dojo, and Angular). You might have a greater interest in some of these technologies than others, but we're looking for people who want to make a well-rounded, full-stack contribution to every part of a project.


Since work is a huge part of your life, we want it to be interesting (new technologies, subject matter, and challenges) and fun (company outings, team sports, catered lunches, etc). Vodorians work hard, support each other, and walk away satisfied. We keep up with the latest technologies, tools, and tricks of the trade - we're always refining our approach, and everyone has a seat at the table.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.content: Society of Grownups is hiring a Product Designer in Boston, MA

jobs.title: C# Software Developer
jobs.content:
• Coding, testing and debugging programs according to computer engineering specifications,

  • Modifying, expanding and updating applications,

  • Communicating with a team that includes analysts, engineers and quality assurance testers in order to coordinate and document application development and testing,

  • Developing software prototypes

jobs.title: Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are searching for an outstanding web developer to be responsible for developing innovative, reusable Web-based tools for progressive online activism and community building. Our web developer/database administrator will work closely with our project managers, strategists and design team members to develop specifications and make recommendations on the use of new and emerging technologies. Programming, graphic design and database administration are all elements of this position. Responsibilities

  • Work closely with Project Managers and other members of the Development Team to both develop detailed specification documents, with clear project deliverables and timelines, and to ensure timely completion of deliverables.
  • Produce project estimates during the project process, including expertise required, total number of people required, total number of development hours required, etc.
  • Attend client meetings during the sales process and during development.
  • Work with Project Managers to build and refine graphic designs for websites. Must have strong skills in Photoshop, Fireworks, or equivalent application(s).
  • Convert raw images and layouts from a graphic designer into CSS/XHTML themes.
  • Determine appropriate architecture, and other technical solutions, and implement recommendations.
  • Communicate to the Project Manager with efficiency and accuracy any progress and/or delays. Engage in outside-the-box thinking to provide high value-of-service.
  • Alert colleagues to emerging technologies or applications and the opportunities to integrate them into operations and activities.
  • Be actively involved in and contribute regularly to the development community of the CMS of your choice.
  • Develop innovative, reusable Web-based tools for activism and community building. Required Skills
  • BS in computer science or a related field, or significant equivalent experience
  • 3 years minimum experience with HTML/XHTML, Javascript, Python and CSS
  • 2 years minimum Web programming experience, including ASP.net, Linux, and Apache
  • 1 year minimum experience working with relational database systems such as MySQL, MSSQL or Oracle and a good working knowledge of SQL
  • Development experience using extensible web authoring tools
  • Experience developing and implementing open source software projects
  • Self-starter with strong self-management skills
  • Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities

jobs.title: Web Application Engineer
jobs.content: We are looking for a passionate developer to be the next member of our small developer-owned company (everyone here writes code every day). The ideal candidate would have experience with Ruby or Rails, but this is not a requirement. Instead, we are looking for someone who has experience building production web applications and is as passionate about helping customers as they are about working with new technologies. We need a candidate that is confident and values freedom (we work 100% from home), but is humble enough to ask questions when they are stuck. We need a candidate who wants to build new things, but doesn’t mind rolling up their sleeves and doing some maintenance work. We know this is a hard mix to find, but if you feel like you’re up for the challenge, please get in touch!

jobs.title: Team Leader Software Developer
jobs.content:
The Team Leader of Software Developer manages a variety of subject matter experts including Software Engineers, DBAs, etc. They lead a specific team to support and maintain existing applications and development of new technical solutions.


What you’ll do:



  • Accomplish results by communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results; coaching, counseling, and disciplining team members; initiating, coordinating, and enforcing systems, policies, and procedures

  • Maintain team by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training team members; maintaining a safe and secure work environment; developing personal growth opportunities

  • Maintain effectiveness and efficiency by defining, delivering, and supporting strategic plans for implementing information technologies

  • Complete projects by coordinating resources and timetables with teams of focus

  • Verify application results by conducting system audits of technologies implemented

  • Recommend information technology strategies, policies, and procedures by evaluating organization outcomes; identifying problems; evaluating trends; anticipating requirements

  • Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies

  • Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer, Publisher Engineering
jobs.content:
Quantcast’s publisher engineering team is responsible for developing products to deliver valuable audience insights and products to publishers. As a Senior front-end Engineer you will help define the front-end architecture, and direction of the product. You will work closely with our Product Design team to bring their designs to life, while keeping your eye on the future with re-usability always at the front of mind.

The right applicant will thrive in an environment where independent decision-making based on product requirements is the norm. Individuals in this role be excited to see their user interface being used by customers, and spot usability and code issues before customers. You should be comfortable implementing APIs (in Java) that are required for a complete implementation of a user interface.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Work with your team to determine product direction and customer needs

  • Develop interactive user interfaces using modern frameworks (in particularly AngularJS)

  • Share knowledge and best practises amongst the publisher engineering team and the wider engineering team

  • Participate in a team-wide on-call rotation to keep the systems ticking along

jobs.title: Embedded Software Developer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION We’re looking for a focused & driven Senior Embedded Developer to be a key participant in creating the architecture, systems, and technologies that are core to Cirrent’s services. This person will be a key contributor to our embedded code base, and will work closely with our early customers to ensure their success.

REQUIREMENTS Cirrent demands the best. The successful candidate will be a hotshot coder, a thoughtful architect, a voracious learner, and an all-around smart person with a strong desire to succeed. Must have been a key contributor in a previous company and must have shown the ability to innovate, understand complex systems, and solve problems. The person should also have:

  • High-energy work habits
  • BS or MS in computer science or equivalent
  • Experience with embedded development for consumer products
  • Proven experience in a startup environment
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver highly robust and reliable products
  • Experience with connected products (preferably as a developer and a consumer!)

The person must be proficient with:

  • Embedded OS: embedded Wi-Fi development platforms from Qualcomm IoE, Broadcom WICED, TI, Marvel, and others; linux, micrium, VxWorks, and others
  • Embedded development: C, C++, python, java
  • Wireless: 802.11, 802.1x, OpenWRT, wpa supplicant, hostapd,
  • Networking: TCP/IP, dhcp,
  • Security: Public key cryptography

BENEFITS Competitive salary and equity. Excellent health, vision, and dental coverage. Great downtown San Mateo location and a fun work environment.

** Local candidates only **

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Prospecting
jobs.content:
The Prospecting team’s vision is to help our customers better understand their audiences and to deliver relevant advertising across all internet media. The team builds and operates real time prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge machine learning techniques and advertising delivery systems. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of predictive models, use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second, and deliver advertising to relevant audiences 24x7.

We are looking for top tier talent to solve day-to-day advertising campaign issues, identify opportunities to improve our machine learning and advertising delivery technologies, and implement those improvements to reach relevant audiences on behalf of our advertisers. We are interested in Senior Software Engineers with a strong production development background as well as a keen interest in data analysis, machine learning and control systems. You might have used one of our open source projects like QFS,or maybe you’ve read our blog post on how we manage the key-value distributed store using Keebler. If this sounds like you, join the team that’s building the next generation pacing services.

jobs.title: Exhibit Designer
jobs.content:
Southwest Displays and Events seeks to hire an entry-level to junior-level exhibit designer. This position gives the opportunity to work and grow as an exhibit designer with a full-service trade show exhibit and events company in Carrollton, Texas. The designer will work within the design department and work closely with the project management team to develop rental and custom exhibit concepts and solutions.

Responsibilities:
• Assist design director with all phases of exhibit concept development
• Work with project management group to develop and engineer rental exhibit solutions
• Create concept 3D renderings and design presentations.

Skills:
• Proficient with AutoCAD, and 3D design programs such as 3DS Max, FormZ, etc.
• Proficiency with Adobe CC (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.)
• Good sketching/drawing skills
• Technologically and engineering savvy

Qualities:
• Bachelors or Associate degree in industrial design or related field
• 0-3 years design work experience
• Strong 3D visualization capability
• Ability to communicate concepts and ideas visually/verbally
• Strong sense of design/eye for detail and making beauty out of pieces and parts
• Comfortable working independently and proactively

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager
jobs.content:
Omada Health is on a mission to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. We are seeking a Technical Project Manager (TPM) to facilitate technical integrations with Omada’s customers and partners. The TPM works directly with customers and coordinates with Omada’s Program Delivery and Engineering teams to ensure the timely technical integration and ongoing support with multiple customers in parallel.


The TPM will be responsible for educating customers about the technical integration process and the capabilities of Omada’s systems, determining the specific requirements of the integration that both delight the customer and minimize the engineering workload, keeping stakeholders updated with technical progress and challenges, being an ongoing technical point-of-contact for customers, and informing our Product team about the features that might make customers happier or integrations easier.


Responsibilities:



  • Own planning, tracking, and documentation to ensure the timeliness, effectiveness, and overall success of your internal and client-facing projects

  • Track technical progress of integration between Omada’s and our clients’ systems

  • Meet with clients and provide technical direction

  • Ensure that technical requirements are never the bottleneck in delivering Omada’s services

  • Work with engineering groups at Omada to understand and evolve how our internal software interfaces with clients

  • Maintain good judgment regarding promises made to clients and internal stakeholders

  • Write concise, friendly, and timely email responses to internal and external stakeholders

  • Contribute to the development and sharing of best practices within Omada

  • Limited travel (5-10%) to client sites


Strong candidates for this position will have:



  • A bachelor’s degree and 5-7 years customer-facing project management experience

  • Proven experience managing complex projects and technical implementations with grace (health care focused experience strongly preferred)

  • Ability to write clear, concise, friendly emails

  • Ability to balance day-to-day execution with long-term priorities

  • Ability to engage with all levels of an organization and with different types of teams (executive, technical, marketing, product, etc.)

  • Familiarity with agile engineering practices

  • Familiarity with file transfer, specifically SFTP over SSH

  • Familiarity with web development, specifically Ruby on Rails

  • Knowledge of chronic disease prevention, the US healthcare system, digital health, and the startup work environment

  • Proficiency in Google Docs, Keynote, Powerpoint, Excel, CSV files


Benefits:



  • Competitive salary

  • Stock options

  • Flexible vacation

  • Parental leave

  • Health, dental, and vision

  • Healthy snacks and meals

  • Wellness events (e.g. running club)

  • Community volunteering

  • 401k retirement savings plan

jobs.title: Front-End Web Developer
jobs.content:
The Tepper School of Business at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is seeking a talented Front-End Web Developer. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing academic unit whose mission is to advance technology behind both graduate and undergraduate education at Carnegie Mellon.



As part of the Application Development team, this position will be focused on front-end software engineering to implement and support high quality websites and applications that will enhance the experience and usability for faculty, staff, students, and visitors.



Primary professional responsibilities:



The Front-end Web Developer is responsible for implementing, deploying and supporting customized Sitecore-based websites and applications for Tepper’s web portals using Microsoft C#, ASP.NET, HTML, JavaScript, CSS and XSLT. This includes:




  • creating new Sitecore templates and layouts from provided Adobe Illustrator or Adobe Photoshop files;

  • translating wireframes and design mockups into HTML/CSS files including dynamic elements;

  • creating web front-end user interfaces to existing ASP, ASP.NET applications, SQL Server databases, and other web services;

  • ensuring that the visual presentation and content of Tepper websites reflects and enhances the overall branding visual identity practices and marketing plan of the school;

  • testing websites thoroughly and ensuring that they function properly across a variety of browsers and devices;

  • working collaboratively with peers and Tepper operating units to enhance the user interfaces in a variety of applications. 



The person selected in this role will demonstrate excellent interpersonal, presentation and problem-solving skills.  Previous experience in a higher-education or other non-profit organization preferred.

jobs.title: Jr. JavaScript/Python Developer - Blockchain
jobs.content:
Our development team is looking for an entry-level developer with related experience building software using primarily Javscript/HTML5, python and golang, and is comfortable straddling both the front and back end. You will use your skills to help us build a blockchain-based data verification system.
