As a startup we are interested in a person who is excited to take on new (and sometimes unexpected) roles, tools, and languages as requirements pop up, and is familiar with Agile or Scrum project management methodology.



In this role you will:



  • Help design and build backend and frontend services for our Bitcoin, Ethereum, and blockchain-based services.

  • Prototype new ideas and explore innovations made possible by the blockchain.

  • Interact with the bitcoin developer community, online and in New York City.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - Messaging
jobs.content:
The Twilio platform enables companies to integrate communications directly into their applications via simple cloud API’s and with on-demand global reach.  Twilio is therefore challenged with abstracting away a world of complexity so that our customers can go global without concern for managing a global communications network, carrier integrations and relationships throughout the world.


About the job:

 As Manager in the Carrier Services organization, you will lead by guiding the engineering team through the implementation of messaging services using Java and Scala while leveraging standards such as SMPP, MM4, MM7, ENUM and HTTP.  To take it to scale, you will be managing a complex distributed platform with points of presence globally and will be concerned with availability, throughput, latency, payload fidelity as well as scalability considerations. There are significant data components so you will be working with distributed SQL and NoSQL databases and caches at Web scale.  At the core are cloud technologies that enable deployment and management of computing resources globally.   


Responsibilities:



  • Lead and grow a team of passionate engineers through their journey to Agile Maturity.  Provide support and guidance that enables the team to self-organize and to achieve sustained high velocity and predictability.  

  • Manage employee career development by providing coaching and mentoring to junior engineers while guiding senior contributors to maximize their potential.  Write performance evaluations, collaborate with employees on their objectives and provide a clear path for progression through personal development plans.  

  • Own, operate and maintain your team’s services.  Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.  Institute and maintain a rotating on-call incident escalation and response processes for the team.

  • Collaborate on roadmaps with Product Managers, Architects and Tech Leads to ensure the team has clear direction and priorities.  Ensure there is cross-training and a healthy balance between features and technical debt.

  • Institute development best practices to ensure the team produces high quality, well architected and supportable code.  Lead reviews of architecture design.  Also work to enable a Continuous Integration environment.

  • Serve as the team’s Scrum Master, breaking down roadblocks as well as managing communications with stakeholders and dependent teams.  Create a culture of continuous improvement through retrospection.

  • As a member of the Engineering Management team, foster leadership principles and behaviors throughout the organization to groom the next generation of leaders.

  • Act as an ambassador for Twilio, recruiting and motivating top talent.

jobs.title: AngularJS Developer
jobs.content:
The Equity Engineering Group, Inc. is seeking a well-rounded AngularJS (Angular 2) Developer responsible for creating the client side of complex engineering applications. The primary focus is to implement a complete user interface in the form of a dynamic mobile and desktop web app, focusing on performance, accuracy and usability.


Main duties will include:



  • Creating modules and components and coupling them together into a functional application

  • Setting up and maintaining cloud-based platforms for delivery (such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Computing, Amazon Web Services, etc.).

  • Creating stages of interface design, such as

    • Developing an effective theme and style

    • Creating mock-ups for discussion and review, animations, CSS, and final HTML output.



  • Developing 2D and 3D engineering element-based data visualization of the results coming from CAD, FEA, and CFD (element based data) using WebGL, VTK, Paraview or similar technologies.


This team is composed of several back-end developers, engineers and mathematicians and communicate with RESTful APIs using standard methods. A thorough understanding of all of the components of our platform and infrastructure is required. A knowledge of Python based development environments (such as Django) is helpful.


Candidate applicant must have two years of demonstrable experience developing dynamic, resizable, web based applications similar to the ones described above.


https://www.equityeng.com/jobs/angularjs-developer/

jobs.title: Senior Salesforce Administrator
jobs.content:
Company Overview:


Morgan & Morgan is one of the largest personal injury law firms in the United States. We are currently implementing a new Call Center and Matter Management platforms in order to support our rapidly expanding business, to position our firm as a technical leader in our industry.


We are looking to add a permanent, seasoned Salesforce Administrator/ Business Analyst to maintain our production environment, support end-users, assist with requirements gathering, and help make our salesforce roll-outs be successful.  This is a very fast paced environment where the only constant is change.  We are looking for an individual that can be agile and easily change focus in accordance with business needs.


Job Description:


The Sr. Platform Administrator will work closely with business stakeholders and project teams for all things related to the company-wide salesforce.com deployment.  Act as a subject matter expert for salesforce.com. 



  • Lead meetings to define business processes and put together documentation that maps these processes back to salesforce.com functionality for a working solution.

  • Establish support processes for production users, and manage deployment schedules.

  • Manage and maintain sandboxes including development and UAT environments.

  • Deploy metadata changes from sandboxes to production environment. Conduct UAT sessions with users prior to releasing net new functionality.

  • Assist project team with new system related configuration.

  • Work with 3rd party vendors for applications that integrate into salesforce.com, as well as 3rd party consulting partners to ensure project and support related tasks are completed on time.

  • Build and deliver any training initiatives for new functionality released.

jobs.title: Demand Planner
jobs.content:
Plum, PBC is seeking a supply chain professional to work at their Emeryville, California headquarters to drive the business forecasting process as a Demand Planner.  Plum is seeking an individual to lead the Demand Planning process in partnership with Sales, Brand, Innovation and Operations teams to drive the dynamic growth business. This role requires a very hands-on professional to support, execute and evolve the forecasting and S&OP processes.  This role will report to the Demand Planning Manager. 

 

Key Responsibilities:

Leads Demand Review Process – 20%

  • Leads Monthly Demand Review Process across pods with cross functional teams to communicate upside and downside to forecast and align on impact to future demand.

Collaborative Forecasting – 30%

  • Collect, evaluate and document forecast inputs from cross functional partners, including Sales and Marketing, and providing an unbiased view of these inputs based on historical performance, challenging as needed.
  • Communicates documented assumptions and impact on demand forecast volumes, and gains consensus on final demand forecast with cross-functional teams.
  • Represent Operations in forecasting alignment discussions to ensure clear understanding of interaction between changes in demand and supply.
  • Manage the collaborative forecasting process with key major retailers.

Statistical Forecasting – 20%

  • Responsible for the creation and continuous refinement of the Customer/Item/DC demand forecast.
  • Develops enhancements for forecasting processes, tools and systems to support business requirements.
  • Analyze customer’s response to new products and develop reliable forecasts for new items.

Forecast Accuracy/Variance Analysis – 20%

  • Generate reports and performance analysis of KPIs, including: forecast accuracy, WOS impact, forecast MTD reporting and aging inventory analysis, communicate key learnings and next steps, and utilize the data to inform forecasts.
  • Analyze performance to forecast, monitor business trends, identify opportunities and risks and make recommendations to ensure the volume plan continues to reflect truth, supporting strategic decision making thru the S&OP process.
  • Generate hindsight reporting for major events to inform future demand forecasts. (new item performance, major reset timing, promotional sets).

Data Administration/Other – 10%

  • Maintain data integrity of forecasting tool, Just Enough, ensuring the master data is current and accurate (new products, product phase out, new customers).
  • Ensure that history loads are recorded for reporting purposes.
  • Other duties include ad hoc reporting, participation in design and implementation of forecast models, product lifecycle management and process documentation. 


Experience / Qualities

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or related field
  • 4+ years of experience in forecasting, business planning or related function.
  • Demand Planning experience, preferably in consumer products or retail industries.
  • Detail oriented with strong problem solving, analytical and project management skills.
  • Ability to toggle between managing day to day tactical activities and assist the Demand Planning Manager to shape long term strategies.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of supply chain and overall forecast to delivery of product to market.
  • Proven ability to apply advanced planning analysis techniques with supporting assumptions.
  • Strong computer skills including ability to create reports with database and/or spreadsheet programs and experience with forecasting systems.
  • Effective communication skills and strong track record of successful cross team collaboration. 


Personal Characteristics 

  • An Analytical Wizard – You have an affinity for numbers and can extract meaningful insights from large sets of data.  You enjoy analyzing data up, down and sideways driven by a curious mindset.
  • An Action Oriented Doer – Someone who is driven by results. Someone who strongly believes in accountability. A task oriented self-starter who stays calm under pressure and proactively takes on big ideas and projects.
  • Hands On – Someone humble enough to tackle low level mundane tasks some days and then drive high-level strategic discussions the next. Someone who is hungry to learn and take on more responsibility as the company grows.
  • A Collaborator – One who works well with teams, and can listen while still sharing a strong point of view. Can lead diverse groups to consensus and remain calm and collected as a facilitator.
  • An Optimist – Someone with a can-do attitude, who can lead in the face of uncertainty, and with a great sense of humor. 

Who we are – Plum, PBC – Emeryville, California
Plum, PBC is home to Plum Organics, a values-driven company committed to nourishing the next generation with great tasting, nutritious food from high chair to lunchbox. Plum, PBC is a group of extremely passionate people that truly love what they do and why they do it. They are parents, aunts, uncles, big brothers… tooth fairies. They are curious connoisseurs and joy seeking foodies that have come together to discover, celebrate & create all things healthy, inventive & yum. 

For more information, visit www.plumorganics.com. You can also follow us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/PlumOrganics) and Twitter (@plumorganics). 

Plum, PBC is committed to providing equal opportunity for employees and applicants in all aspects of the employment relationship, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, disability, age, religion or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you love solving problems, and love even more automating the solution so you never see the problem again? Are you interested in Docker, Mesos, service discovery, and 12 factor apps? Can you take your good idea, and lead the charge to develop it from concept to production?

At CloudPassage, we are all about making cloud computing more secure and agile for leading global enterprise companies by resolving the number one inhibitor to cloud adoption: security. We invented agile security for modern infrastructure. Our platform protects the most critical business assets. Staying in front of the cloud security landscape is a huge challenge that requires expertise, creativity, hard work and intense collaboration.

Leading enterprises like Citrix, Salesforce.com and Adobe use CloudPassage to enhance their security and compliance posture, while remaining agile. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, CloudPassage is backed by Benchmark Capital, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Meritech Capital Partners, Tenaya Capital, Shasta Ventures, Musea Ventures and other leading investorWe want to bridge the gap between developers and traditional tech ops by building processes that provision, configure, deploy, and monitor our infrastructure.  This role will focus on building a platform that allows us to scale up with customer demand while providing the best customer experience possible.

You Enjoy...

  • Designing and implementing automation for orchestration of production and development systems.
  • Assisting in maintaining information security practices and procedures.
  • Working with both internal and external groups to ensure systems are effectively integrated, configured, managed and supported in production.
  • Working in an agile environment.
  • Keeping up on the latest trends, watching for new technology that can improve our workflow.

You're Great at...

  • Working with a IaaS vendor such as: Amazon Web Services, Rackspace cloud or SoftLayer.
  • Orchestrating server deployments and configuration.
  • Working with information security compliance programs such as SOC2, ISO 27001, FedRAMP and PCI.
  • Understanding of networking fundamentals.
  • Git, Jira, Jenkins, and other managed workflows.

Bonus Points...

  • You have an interest in startups
  • You have passion for security
  • You are an effective communicator
  • You are very organized with a keen attention to detail
  • You drive to succeed in a fast pace and continuously evolving environment

Why should you be part of the CloudPassage Engineering Team! 

Engineering Technologies and Methodologies 

  • Mesos-Managed and Container based SaaS Infrastructure 
  • Big data (TB scale), NoSQL, Distributed systems, Horizontal scaling (Cassandra, Kafka, Elasticsearch, etc)
  • Use of latest technologies for App development (Go, Ruby, AngularJS, Flux, Webpack, etc)
  • Github/open-source collaboration style of development
  • Development methodologies that facilitates being nimble, as we attend to quick customer needs, as well as highly predictable as we build large capabilities that enable Enterprise customers.  
  • An organizational structure that fosters collaboration around Development, QA and DevOps functions. 

Growth Company 

  • 50%-100% growth over the last 2 years 

Security Company

  • Nextgen Workload Security 
  • Distributed and highly scalable 
  • Supports Public and Hybrid clouds

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer II
jobs.content:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Engineer II


Location: Portland, OR


Reports To: Senior Manager, Quality Assurance


JOB FUNCTION


The Quality Assurance Analyst will conduct thorough product testing and maintain agreed upon quality standards in order to provide the highest quality software products to both external and internal customers. The QA Analyst will work to understand the business requirements and objectives relative to the desired functionality of products and applications. Additionally this role will evaluate and test new or modified software to determine that software meets user requirements and established quality standards.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Writes and executes detailed test cases; performs complex manual, integration, and regression tests

  • Documents software issues and enhancement requests and assists development with concise and detailed steps for duplication of the problems found while performing manual functional, integration, and regression tests

  • Verifies resolved Jira issues and maintains accurate status for Jira issues entered and assigned

  • Assists fellow team members and customers with problem reporting and resolution and maintaining appropriate follow-up communications throughout the resolution process

  • Creates master test plans with clearly defined test objectives

  • Contributes towards QA estimation and scheduling process

jobs.title: Junior to Mid Level Software Engineer
jobs.content: We are looking for a passionate, experienced PHP Developer who enjoys both the thrill of building custom solutions for our customers as well as the discipline in resolving complex bugs. You will have the opportunity to do full stack WordPress/PHP development, from backend scripting to frontend HTML/CSS/Javascript work.  You must be as comfortable working with people as you are working with code, and be able to communicate well with people in different groups such as Client Services, Engineering, Support, and Sales.

jobs.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications
jobs.content:
At Google, we care deeply about our iOS users, and we develop for iOS as enthusiastically as we do for Android. We strive to enable users on any platform to access Google products and services — from mainstays like Maps, Search, and YouTube to cutting-edge projects like Translate, Photos, and Google Now — in the best possible way. And we solve problems at Google's unique scale, bringing large data to small devices and crafting elegant user experiences.


As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most delightful and useful services and apps to life. You should be comfortable with Objective-C and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.


[Responsibilities]



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s large, complex mobile applications.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support authentication, copresence, and cutting-edge network protocols.

  • Optimize mobile applications on the iOS platform.

  • Develop prototypes quickly.

jobs.title: Python/Django Developer
jobs.content:
Prezzee is a new eGift Card marketplace based in Sydney. We are currently looking for a Python/Django developer on a 3-month contractor basis, with a view to further collaboration for the right applicant. We are working with top tier Australian retailers, this is an opportunity to work with a highly motivated team delivering excellence in all areas of our business. Beautiful user experience, security and seamless backend integration are core to our business.

After launching 6 months ago, we are firing on all cylinders as we develop our API, new apps, new merchant platform integrations, and new business oriented features. Now we are looking for someone to work closely with us on a contractor basis, initially creating new merchant API integrations on our back end, but looking to move into more general development duties across our Django powered application.

We are after an intuitive, switched-on person who is passionate about all areas of tech, and understands that aesthetics and functionality go hand in hand. Initially you will be working with our Technical Director but you are also expected to have a high level understanding of how our platform works.


Benefits


The Prezzee office is in one of the most beautiful turn of the century buildings in Sydney just off Martin place on George Street and backs onto Ash lane, surrounded by great bars, restaurants and boutiques where you'll often find the team. You will be joining a fun and dedicated team with an exciting roadmap of development ahead.

Salary is commensurate with experience

jobs.title: Software Engineer - iOS
jobs.content:
Our Mobile Software Engineering Team work on the cutting edge to produce high-quality mobile apps for both iOS and Android. We are now on the lookout for an iOS Software Engineer to join this dynamic team. If your heart beats a bit faster when you are writing clean code and if you have a natural instinct for spotting new trends or technologies then we want to hear from you. Our Software Engineering teams help to shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search. With around 3 billion requests per month, we are operating on a large scale, complex and rapidly evolving IT landscape. We encourage all team members to question established processes and give them the freedom to experiment with new technologies in order to drive trivago to the next level.

Your responsibilities:

  • Develop our mobile apps in an agile environment.
  • Use your expert knowledge to bring fresh new ideas to the table.
  • Analyze feature requests and then plan & implement them in a test-driven way.
  • Create and review pull requests in order to achieve the best possible solution.
  • Contribute to the maintenance and development of new and existing open source components.
  • Exchange ideas and share your knowledge with the rest of the team and participate in pair programming. .

The ideal candidate:

  • Is looking for a new challenge!
  • Has earned a degree/equivalent qualification in computer science or similar field.
  • Can prove their technical skills in native iOS development and can share code references.
  • Has experience in dealing with iOS frameworks, design patterns and software architectures such as MVC/MVP/MVVM.
  • Is genuinely interested in agile development processes and automated testing. Experience in these areas would be a plus.
  • Is familiar with Scrum, Kanban, TDD, BDD, Reactive Programming and Continuous Integration.
  • Speaks English fluently. German language skills would be a plus.

Life at trivago is...

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.
  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.
  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.
  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.
  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.
  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.
  • Living in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.  Additional information:
  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.
  • We do not require the services of an agency for this position.  If you would like to learn more about the application process at trivago, please click the link to the right.

jobs.title: .Net Developer - Mammoth Mountain Ski Area
jobs.content:
Mammoth Resorts is in the recreation and leisure business. We own and operate ski areas, summer bike parks, hotels, restaurants, retail shops, and golf courses. Our main office is located in Mammoth Lakes, California, on the eastern side of the Sierra Nevada mountains. Mammoth Lakes is a mountain town in one of the most beautiful places on earth. National Geographic recently ranked the Sierra Nevada mountains as the #2 destination choice in North America.


 Our IT team is looking for a .Net web developer to help us support and enhance Mammoth Resort’s corporate websites and web applications. We currently have 24 corporate web sites (e.g. www.mammothmountain.com), and lots of ideas for how to improve them for the benefit of our customers. We also sell products on about half our web sites through our in-house developed e-commerce software. Here are the specific duties of the position: 



  • Develop web-based solutions in C#, ASP.NET, CSS, JavaScript, HTML5, Visual Studio, and SQL Server.

  • Developing new websites on the Sitefinity Content Management System. For example, developing custom Sitefinity widgets for Marketing to show winter trail status.

  • Developing new e-commerce functionality to help us increase our revenue.

  • Provide break/fix support as we do have 24 web sites and they sometimes need fixing.


 YOUR TYPICAL DAY


You’re a member on a small development team (4 developers and a manager), and you’re clear on your priorities for the quarter. You have a 20% chance you have a meeting with the Marketing team sometime during the day to talk about your latest progress on a project, or about new projects that are coming. Projects that you may be working on:



  • Improve our e-commerce check out flow to make recommendations for other products our customer may have interest.

  • Simplify the checkout process so purchases are made with as few clicks as possible.

  • Improve how we present our lodging to our guests so they can easily filter and sort to find what they need.

  • On rare occasion, staying up late or getting in early for an implementation.


OUR CULTURE


If it’s a powder day (that means there’s fresh snow), you’ll find many of us on the slopes making turns. We take our jobs and the work we do seriously, but we always leave room for fun and play. If your job is the #1 priority in your life, then Mammoth Resorts is not the place for you. We are looking for people with a well-rounded perspective on life.


BENEFITS



  • A season pass for you and your immediate family.

  • Three health care plans for you to choose from.

  • 401K plans with 50% matching donation up to 5%

  • 3 weeks of vacation, 5 paid holidays, and a bunch of “I’m leaving early today to go play outside” days.

  • No long commutes.

jobs.title: JavaScript Software Developer
jobs.content:
Varen Technologies is looking for a software developer who enjoys solving hard problems, delivering mission capability to the operator and analyst, working independently or on small-distributed development teams, and has the expertise to hit the ground running with little to no supervision.


This position supports the DoD’s Big Data Platform (BDP) cloud development team by working across multiple tasks and ensuring that all front-end applications adhere to a shared vision, resulting in a consistent user experience. The developer may also work to modernize legacy codebases written in a host of frameworks, coalescing around a standard toolchain and sound front-end architecture.


The position will also include writing tests, test plans, and test scripts and optimizing and troubleshooting the front-end interfaces of the BDP. Primary development languages for working with the BDP’s web services are Javascript and Java. Team members are expected to participate and collaborate with other team members as well as with end-users through agile development cycles.



  • Employee will select their laptop (MAC, IBM, DELL, etc) and work in an environment that allows you to use approved resources. (Github, ZenHub, Slack, Node, etc)


Participate in development and implantation, use software deployment tools; code and test software based upon software specifications and designs; support using formal specifications, data flow diagrams, and other accepted design techniques; use sound software engineering principles to ensure that developed code is modifiable, efficient, reliable, understandable, and fault tolerant.


Familiarity with:



  • with D3, WebGL, git and gitflow

  • Open source contributions, and modern frameworks such as Angular, Ember, and Backbone


Desired Experience:



  • js’s ecosystem

  • in-depth knowledge of web standards and page optimization

  • displaying/navigating streaming data (SSE, WS, CometD)

  • knowledge of distributed systems software design

jobs.title: Embedded Software Developer
jobs.content:
Cirrent is a breakthrough company in the hot internet-of-things space. We've built a strong business working with the big internet service providers, and are positioned to revolutionize Wi-Fi for connected products.

Were looking for a focused & driven Senior Embedded Developer to be a key participant in creating the architecture, systems, and technologies that are core to Cirrents services. All of our developers are smart, driven, friendly, and fun -- if that sounds like you, we want you to join our team!

On a day-to-day basis you'll be writing code for linux or RTOS platforms (Broadcom/Cypress' WICED platform, Qualcomm's IoE, Marvell's Ez-Connect), reviewing and merging code from other developers, and working with our customers -- product companies integrating our technology into their products.


Benefits


Competitive salary and equity. Excellent health, vision, and dental coverage. Great downtown San Mateo location and a fun work environment.


** Local candidates only **

jobs.title: Sr. Cloud Integration Specialist
jobs.content:
Our Computing and Information Systems (CIS) division has an exciting opportunity for a Sr. Cloud Integration Specialist who will develop, plan and support integrations between Argonne’s business systems, vendors and cloud systems. 


In this position, you will:



  • Analyze the requirements, define projects, and implement and support integrations and web based solutions for our customers here at the Laboratory

  • Develop and support web-based applications used in production for Argonne’s business systems and public web pages

  • Translate technical information to a non-technical audience and provide excellent follow-up with clients. Ensure correspondence & communication is complete, concise, professional & timely. Express written ideas clearly. Verbal presentations are logical & well thought out.

  • Provides direction and on-the-job training to other staff members when appropriate.

jobs.title: Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
One of the most exciting human rights charities around needs a Ruby developer.


Survival is the leading organisation supporting tribal peoples around the world. We're radical, uncompromising in our belief that tribal peoples should be able to take their rightful place in the 21st Century, and innovative in our use of technology. Our website is a vital campaigning tool, and we're now looking for an experienced Ruby developer to drive its evolution in the years ahead.


- You need to be highly familiar with Ruby on Rails, HTML, CSS and Javascript, which Survival uses across its web platform.


- Experience of SCRUM/ AGILE project management is an advantage, as is experience of working with legacy code.


An absolute commitment to Survival’s aims and objectives is essential, as is a willingness to help out with all aspects of Survival’s work. Our website is a vital part of our campaigning, so your work will be central to all aspects of Survival’s mission. This is a unique opportunity to be at the heart of one of the most exciting campaigning organisations around; it is not just a job.


Salary £30-35,000, depending on experience.


To apply, send your CV, and a cover letter explaining why you are the right person for the job, to rubydeveloper@survivalinternational.org, by 22 July.


- You must have the right to work in the UK


- Hours of work: Monday - Friday, full time (10am - 6pm)


- Contract: 12 months (renewable), with a 6-month probationary period.


- Location: Survival's London head office.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Java Developer
jobs.content:
• Improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of grocery shoppers

  • Go where nobody has gone and get wide recognition for a world class web store

  • Design, create, own and maintain our high-performance cloud-based eco-system (Java stack)

  • Innovate, design and implement elements like the online store, order management, inventory and warehouse management, transportation planning and many more

  • Push your limits in creating super clean, well structured, testable, performant, high quality code and application tests

  • Keep up with the latest technologies and define our future technology stack

  • Be challenged every day again by our extremely talented team

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Full Stack Developer - Product Engineer

TransferWise is a VC-backed, international money transfer start-up co-founded by Skype’s first employee and backed by some of planet's most experienced innovators, including Sir Richard Branson and PayPal founder Peter Thiel, we're disrupting the world of currency & international money transfer. That means flipping a gazillion dollar industry on its head using only real exchange rates and tiny non-hidden-fee. Headaches averted, revolution sparked.

Are you up to building a modern international financial institution from the ground up, but better than any of the existing global banks? We are looking for a number of Product Engineers to join our Tallinn office. As a Full Stack Product Engineer you will have solid experience with the full stack of web technologies. You will be hands on within the technology and working towards making our product the best that it can be by solving the challenges that we face. However our flat organisational structure means you'll be someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy. What really excites you is problem solving and delivering innovative technology and products that create happy customers.



You will collaborate with product managers, UX and design experts, data scientists and other developers to work towards one unified goal - growth. There are a number of teams that we are currently looking for awesome developers to join in Tallinn, you will be applying for all and throughout your journey with us you will get to find out about them all!



As part of the a Product-Engineering team, you'll be making sure that the user journey is as precise and delightful as it can be. You'll join a great team that is customer focussed to it’s core.



Product engineers only

Here at TransferWise we don’t hire coders, who pick up tickets from a backlog and push code to production.

We hire engineers that empathise with our customers problems, develop solutions and measure results. We’re proud of engineering team - it's built an incredible product that’s changing the world. They operate autonomously within their teams, focussing relentlessly on our customers.

jobs.title: Linux Services Lead
jobs.content:
This role exists to develop and manage a Linux Services capability. Encompassing Professional Services, technical and support activities for a wide range of customers. The role requires a strong technical background which has been applied to the delivery of customer solutions through a skilled and specialist team of people.


The main aims of the role are:



  • Lead the development of a non-Public Cloud Linux community, with the prime drive of meeting customer needs, whilst doing so in a commercial beneficial way for Claranet.

  • Develop and drive the Linux services offerings within the Professional and Support services areas.

  • Create and support our Linux services methods and model supporting our sales colleagues in winning new business.

  • Lead the development of process and system evolution relating to Linux Services

  • Work with Service Operations functions to ensure the right technical support model is in place and delivered for all customers taking Linux services

  • Develop a strong Claranet voice and market presence in Open source and Linux technologies. Create thought leadership and brand awareness working with Marketing.

  • Develop and lead a strong Linux Services team. Attracting and retaining the right people.

  • Develop a strong working relationship with the Public Cloud area, to drive capability and opportunity.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Accountabilities



  • Linux Services capability across all non-public cloud elements

  • Leading team of technology experts

  • Delivery of the Linux services professional services targets

  • Supporting and underwriting the sales commitment to customers

  • Delivering what we promise to our customers in the most effective and efficient way

jobs.title: Senior/Intermediate Full Stack Node and Angular Dev
jobs.content:
We are currently hiring 2 senior/intermediate software devs for Broadsoft (http://www.broadsoft.com).
You will be working in BroadsoftLabs. The coolest place to work at Broadsoft. (https://broadsoftlabs.com)


Your day to day will include working on bugs and features in github for several projects we maintain and develop. The main project is a corporate messaging app and the other pieces you will work on are integrations to cloud services. Such as google, slack, spotify etc. We also will be making some small games for teams to use while waiting for meetings to start.


Salary can be something around 100k USD per year for this permanent position for the right person. Its a secure company on the NYSE (https://www.google.com/finance?q=NASDAQ:BSFT) and has been in business for about 20 years with over a thousand employees. Around 350 are software devs like yourself. There is lots of room to move up. Health benefits and share options are also added to salary.

Your team will consist of about 10 other developers that have been working on this project for over a year. You will be programming in javascript with Node and angular.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Java Developer


TransferWise is a VC-backed, international money transfer start-up co-founded by Skype’s first employee and backed by some of planet's most experienced innovators, including Sir Richard Branson and PayPal founder Peter Thiel, we're disrupting the world of currency & international money transfer. That means flipping a gazillion dollar industry on its head using only real exchange rates and tiny non-hidden-fee. Headaches averted, revolution sparked.



Are you up to building a modern international financial institution from the ground up, but better than any of the existing global banks? We are looking a couple of strong Senior Java Engineers to join our new Budapest office. As a Java Engineer you will have solid experience Java/JVM based technologies. You will be hands on within the technology and working towards making our product the best that it can be by solving the challenges that we face. However our flat organisational structure means you'll be someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy. What really excites you is problem solving and delivering innovative technology and products that create happy customers.



So, what’s the role?


Our growing engineering team needs experienced people (like you) to help us push TransferWise forwards. We expect from you solid architectural decisions, rock hard integrity and clean code. You must know how good software is built, and be able to figure out what are the best decisions for TransferWise.  Good communication skills are put into good use as you evangelise your way through our team and tell us all about the next best things and forgotten best practices alike. Someone needs to coach our apprentices and journeymen, so it will be up to you, the craftsman, to guide them.

jobs.title: Developer
jobs.content:
Sift are a market leading digital B2B publishing & subscriptions business, based in the heart of Bristol. We believe that we can inspire action everyday, through the creation of amazing content, experiences and insight for our audiences & clients.


We’re on the lookout for an experienced and passionate Drupal developer to join our highly-skilled development team. You’ll be working alongside project managers, back-end and front-end developers and the UX and design team to estimate, scope, deliver and document expansions and enhancements to our products, helping us to serve ever-richer content to our readers.

jobs.title: Business Development Consultant
jobs.content:
BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT CONSULTANT


Cloudreach is an idea that started out in a London pub that is now a global cloud enabler and one of the world’s largest AWS partners. We have hubs in North America and Europe, with more certified technical staff than anyone else in the world.Cloudreach works on challenging technical projects such as data center migrations, data analytics, and managing digital estates. This is not your average company; we keep our feet on the ground and our heads in the cloud.


We are looking for a superstar sales professional who can contribute to our growth in the Northeast.


How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?



  • As a Business Development Consultant, you will be accountable for meeting / exceeding customer acquisition targets as well as being the main face and Cloudreach’s ambassador for our partners.

  • Owning, developing and driving the strategy across your account set.

  • Working with some of the largest companies in the US across all verticals.

  • Partnering with the top cloud technology providers (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google, SFDC).

  • You will wake up every morning thinking about how we penetrate the Enterprise organizations assigned to you and how to execute your customer acquisition plans.

  • You will develop relationships with our partners on building joint account plans as well as using your consulting skills to engage senior decision makers within the customer’s organization.

  • Working with a sociable, friendly team of people who love what they do!


What are our cloudy perks?



  • MacBook Pro, big screen monitor, and phone coverage.

  • Unlimited vacation daysand your birthday off every year.

  • A well-rounded benefits package including great health benefits, a competitive 401(k) plan, discounts on restaurant meals, gym memberships, travel deals, and more. We also believe in rewarding work when it’s done; if you do something amazing, we’ll give you a spot bonus.

  • We provide world-class training and career development opportunities through our Cloudy University.

  • Good food (free snacks and drinks in the office) and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a local restaurant every Friday. There are also cool office amenities like beanbags, games like pool and ping pong, and big screen TVs

  • Quarterly meetings around North America.

jobs.title: C# Software Engineer - Baltimore
jobs.content:
We (Adashi) are a US company that builds interconnected multi-platform software apps that allow fire, police and ems personnel  to respond to emergencies. We are  looking for highly motivated C# developer to join our core team and perhaps make the world a little safer.


Client applications are developed in C# using WPF. Server applications are written in C#, are database agnostic and support a large number of concurrent clients (both mobile and pc) that keep the entire fleet instantly in sync.


Preferred Experience for all positions:


Ability to understand an end user’s requirements and story, and then work with a team to build a solution that meets the user’s needs.


Nice to have:


Domain knowledge in Public Safety.  Specifically 911 centers, command and control, and mobile data terminals, Computer aided dispatch systems.


Experience in ESRI and other Geospatial technologies.


Database knowledge and experience. 


Experience with WPF and XAML.


Experience implementing UIs using the MVVM pattern.


Appreciation for visual design and its impact on user experience.


Compensation: Competitive full-time salary dependent upon skills/experience plus a great benefits, vacation package and opportunities for advancement.  Offices located in Farmington Hills, MI, and Baltimore, MD

jobs.title: Mid Level Full Stack C# Web Developer
jobs.content:
Do you want to work and learn from some of the best developers in the Twin Cities?


Do you want to help solve some big data problems?  


Do you want to help build something significant that can help keep counterfeit pharmaceuticals off the market?


Then this job is likely for you.


Verify Brand is looking for up to 4 web developers with strong technical skills and a desire to make a big impact at a growing software company.  We are a fast-paced, agile development team working on a web based SaaS product written in C# MVC with a SQL Server backend.  We also use ElasticSearch and RabbitMQ to support analytics and scalability over terabytes of data.  


We are currently expanding our industry leading software platform to have international capabilities in the Pharmaceutical landscape.  This means tracking product as it flows through the supply chain and keeping a record of updates along the way. A large portion of our software’s value comes from our innovative ways to report on the massive amount of data we acquire on a constant basis. Your contributions to our software will go towards many lofty goals; such as counterfeit detection, supply chain diversion detection, and improving customer-loyalty brand programs.


The types of problems you'd be working on at Verify include:



  • Creating APIs with 100% up-time that can handle 100 requests per second

  • Designing responsive UIs to display data from over 100 million database records

  • Working directly with customers to design new APIs and new UIs that meet, and exceed, their needs and wishes.


You will be tasked with creating software that contributes directly to the success of the company. We are constantly striving to find the right tools, methodologies, and techniques such as Domain Driven Design, Continuous Integration, and Agile to ensure that we are at the top of our game.


To be the right candidate, you need a balance of interpersonal skills and technological savvy; you must enjoy working with others in order to make great software designs come to life.  Our ideal candidate would be strong in the Microsoft web stack, but we recognize that good problem-solving skills are language-independent.


Perks of working at Verify include:



  • Competitive salary

  • A stake in our private company

  • Working for a small, agile company (~25 people) with the financial backing of a large parent company (+200 people)

  • Develop exclusively in the latest and greatest (.NET 4.6.1, MVC 4, SQL Server 2014)

  • 4PM Friday Happy Hour!


Some of the technologies we currently use:



  • C# MVC

  • SQL Server

  • .NET API 2.2

  • Angular

  • SQL Server

  • RabbitMQ

  • HaProxy

  • ElasticSearch


We do not expect that you have used all of these technologies, but knowing about them and being excited about them is a major bonus.


This is a an opportunity in Plymouth, MN, just west of downtown Minneapolis.  All applicants must be local or willing to relocate to the Twin Cities.

jobs.title: Development Manager
jobs.content:
Senior Delivery Manager

To manage 3 delivery managers how each manage several scrums, within the Software Engineering Capabilities function at Sky, Covering TV Services, Recommendations, Search and Programme Database. Ensuring the consistent on-time delivery of high quality software applications and the ongoing management of these systems in production.

The Delivery Manager will report to and provide advice and support to the Head of Technology. Delivery Manager will have line management responsibility for several Scrum Masters and other key delivery resources.

Key Responsibilities:
  • To lead and coach Scrum Masters, managing the delivery of the roadmaps and establishing and agreeing best practice to improve the predictability, efficiency and quality of software delivery
  • To build an effective working relationship with the Stakeholders requesting delivery from his/her team.
  • To educate business stakeholders on the benefits of agile delivery and influencing their behaviour to support this delivery method.
  • To ensure the adoption of Agile/XP methods within his/her scrums.
  • To act as the key contact within their area of delivery.
  • To manage delivery of projects across their scrums.
  • On a case by case basis to act as the lead delivery manager for projects that span various delivery managers within Sky Technology
  • To provide management reporting on the delivery status of their area. Balancing the requests for a defined delivery date, from stakeholders, with the agile delivery method.
  • Being aware of, and ensuring appropriate communication of, any delivery issues, dependencies and or risks to the roadmap.
  • To monitor and assess the demands for resources across their area and ensure appropriate staffing levels to meet the customer demands whilst ensuring effective & efficient delivery.
  • To support their Scrum Master in the communication of delivery and application support issues.
  • To work with senior leadership of other delivery streams inside and outside of the team to negotiate and agree how dependencies will be managed and assured.
  • To develop and coach delivery personnel to improve their personal and collective performance as Scrum Masters and Delivery professionals.
  • To be accountable for managing the quality and timeliness of the delivery across their Scrums.
  • To manage (with the help of their team, the Principal Software Engineer & Architects) the technical direction of their portfolio.
  • Work with integration partners (Broadcast and STB) to build better relationships and agree testing strategies.


Expertise Expected:
  • Use cutting-edge practices in Project Management, Product design, Requirement Analysis, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Automation & Unit Testing in a software development environment.
  • Commercial experience in managing software development teams, with a least 18 months being in a commercial agile environment.
  • Proven capability in managing team dynamics, building team relationships, mentoring team members and delivering feedback.
  • Experience in release planning, estimation, capacity planning and managing project risks in a multi Scrum environment.
  • Direct Scrum Master experience.
  • Certified Scrum Master credentials are a plus.
  • Good at understanding complex technology intensive domains.
  • Exceptional listening, written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience with Extreme Programming , Scrum and other agile techniques.
  • Management experience of full life-cycle system development with teams of developers, analysts, and testers/QAs.
  • Awareness of one or more automated testing tools such as Silk Test, QTP, RFT or exposure to any open source testing tools such as Selenium, FitNesse etc.
  • An awareness and appreciation of current development tools and their usage.


Capabilities Specifics (Team Overview):

The Capabilities Group currently provide a number of online services to Web, Mobile and more recently the STB propositions, The teams are as follows:
  • TV Services
  • Recommendations
  • Search
  • Programme Database


To support this application set is a diverse set of technologies and skills from software engineering

Key Technologies and Challenges:

Due to the diverse array of applications this team provide and the sheer number of customers that make advantage of our services there is constant pressure to delivery more for less. Working with the business we need to change the way we are structured and deliver software. Recent integrations with the STB have brought about its own challenges with the risk adverse testing strategy and lengthy development cycles.

One of the key challenges in this area is this area is to deliver to scale, the current STB enjoys over 6 million connected users that are putting an ever increasing demand on the capabilities platform,

Specific Candidate Desired Attributes:

The successful candidate will be an excellent people manager and motivator and should be able to get the best out of a diverse team, by fostering collaboration and cross-fertilisation, where applicable. They should be experts in the agile process, and specifically be able to ensure the right level of discipline is maintained to ensure only quality software is delivered. They should also be able to creatively find solutions to operational challenges.

If you are appointed to this role you will be subject to the successful completion of a Criminal Record Check.



Sky - Believe in Better

jobs.title: Sr. Developer - Outlook Integration
jobs.content:
Why EMS?


If you crave the chance to achieve at the highest level while working with an exceptionally talented team with enlightened leadership, we have the opportunity you’ve been looking for.


Used by millions of people, EMS manages some of the highest profile spaces in the world like the NASDAQ bell! The EMS team is consistently delivering new features to its suite of products, and we want to grow our team, tackle even bigger challenges, and do amazing things. We work in small, concentrated teams to constantly improve our code base, and have amassed a large backlog of interesting technical challenges and product initiatives. We’re growing our team to enable even greater success within our industry. This is where you come in.


Summary:


Our integration with Microsoft Outlook and Exchange must be slick, fast, and easy. We’ve made great strides but we need another great mind on the team to accelerate our pace.


As a senior developer on Outlook, you’ll help maintain the current generation of our integration (VSTO based) while building a new integration using Microsoft’s latest add-in technology. You have strong experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and you have mastered .NET applications. Additionally, you have hands on experience working with RESTful API’s.


Responsibilities:


In your first month, you’ll focus on learning both the architecture and functionality of the current generation of our integration with Outlook. You’ll also learn our tools, processes, and people.


In your second month, you’ll help build out additional capabilities of our product’s integration with Outlook. You’ll also start learning the Microsoft Office Add-in architecture.


In your third month, you’ll continue to work on building out our existing product, but you’ll also work with our UX team to help them understand the capabilities and limitations of the Add-in architecture, especially as it applies to our software.


By the sixth month, you and the team will have completed the next release of our Outlook integration and then you’ll be off and running on developing against the Add-in architecture.


Your duties and responsibilities will include:



  • Design and develop new functionality for our existing .NET-based Outlook integration.

  • Learn Microsoft’s new Office Add-in architecture

  • Work with UX to extract the best possible user experience from the Add-in architecture

  • Help develop our next-generation integration with Microsoft Outlook and Exchange

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About You:



  • You are a developer who thrives in a collaborative environment where you are looking for new challenges to hone your skills

  • You have experience in developing and administering enterprise CRM/ERP platforms and are familiar with MS Dynamics, MS Dynamics AX, Salesforce, SAP, or similar enterprise platforms


Responsibilities:



  • Work in an iterative environment during the construction phase of projects, helping to collaborate on the planning, design, and functional and non-functional requirements

  • Maintain current knowledge of platform, integration and technologies to drive future innovation

  • Design, implement, test, deploy and maintain integrated enterprise platforms, with a core focus on integrations with CRM and ERP platforms

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.content:
WHO WE ARE:
GigMasters, recently acquired by XO Group, is the marketplace for every event, providing party planners and hosts with an online tool to find entertainment and event services of all kinds. We’ve helped facilitate over 275,000 bookings and have over 70,000 event vendors, ranging from musicians and photographers to impersonators and magicians. GigMasters empowers people to make a living doing what they love, and we take pride in being able to do so.

GigMasters was founded in 1997, so technically we're not a startup, but the fun atmosphere, fast-paced work environment and regular happy hours kind of make us feel like one. We're a tight-knit group. We hold regular company events, and we believe in celebrating company milestones.

ABOUT THE DIGITAL PRODUCT DESIGNER ROLE AND OUR TEAM:

This is the first Digital Product Designer in-house role for the GigMasters team! We are looking for an experienced, full-stack Digital Product Designer with both UI and UX experience, to join the GigMasters product team.

The right candidate will possess the following qualities:
• You are excited about the opportunity to be part of a small, entrepreneurial company with a lively startup feel.
• You are passionate about creating user-first digital products for a diverse community of users.
• You are capable of producing high-quality, pixel-perfect design work.
• You are a strategic thinker and champion of the user with great collaborative skills.
• You are a thoughtful problem-solver with a passion for research and study/analysis of user feedback and habits.
• You are an excellent communicator, capable of presenting your ideas clearly and in the context of user value and brand value proposition.
• You process quantitative as well as qualitative data alongside empathy as a driver to distill into innovative, user-centric solutions and designs.
• You are self-managing, detail-oriented, and express ownership down to the last pixel.
• You are interested in partnership and collaboration with your product team.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Work as a partner within the product team, contributing at a strategic and tactical level.
• Work collaboratively within product teams on defining requirements, producing wireframes, user flows, user interfaces and interactions, complete visual designs, prototyping, testing, and delivering pixel perfect design assets.
• Contribute to the brand visual language and user experience through the honing of our brand digital guidelines and holistic site experience development.
• Work as a partner within the product team, contributing at a strategic and tactical level.
• Balance needs of users with technical constraints and business objectives.
• Demonstrate sensitivity to user interaction through intuitive and engaging solutions and design.
• Design and iterate on interfaces and interactions for desktop, web, and mobile devices, including iOS and Android apps.
• You’ll maintain a spirit of shared ownership, cooperation, and accountability through all phases of product development: conception through release, and post-release.
• Collaborate with product managers and engineers to define and deliver innovative, iterative solutions.
• Work with the engineering team to meet technical requirements for projects.
• Deliver design assets with complete UI implementation specifications. Pair with front-end developers to ensure best execution.
• Effectively present and discuss solutions with stakeholders.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Graphic Design, Interaction Design, or a related field.
• 5+ years proven experience designing user interface solutions for interactive media, mobile, and web.
• Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, and favorite prototyping tools)
• Demonstrated experience with brand development and designing branded experiences.
• Demonstrated experience with UX design principles and practice.
• Experience working as a UX/UI designer in a mobile-first, Lean UX process.
• Experience designing for iOS and Android applications.
• Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript; iOS, Android.Excellent typographic, layout, and visual system design skills demonstrated through a portfolio.
• E-Commerce experience a plus.
• Illustration abilities a plus.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re revolutionizing financial services for everyone’s benefit. Think of us as an IT company revolutionizing financial services, not a financial company with an IT department. Join a dynamic front end development team and build our trading platforms and applications from the ground up.


The ideal candidate for this position is experienced in designing and developing highly performing and scalable applications that meet the business requirements. The Sr. Software Engineer will be involved into small to large scale projects through all stages of the software development life cycle from requirements gathering to implementation. The Sr. Software Engineer will collaborate with user interface team, back-end and front-end developers, and database architects to design and develop functionally rich, robust, user friendly web applications as defined by business requirements.

jobs.title: Production Designer
jobs.content:
Who We Are
PlanetArt’s mission is to be the leading online destination for personalized invitations, announcements, home décor and other personalized products. We provide consumers with unmatched tools and content and an unparalleled end-to-end customer experience that result in high-quality and meaningful finished products and memorable celebrations of life events.

Visit www.planetart.com to learn more.

Overview
• This position is on-site at our office in Calabasas, CA 91302
• This role is ideal for someone who finds satisfaction in transforming messy artwork files into clean, organized documents. It is not a good fit for someone looking for a creative design position.

What You’ll Do
• Prepare print-ready artwork files to meet specific requirements using the Adobe Creative Suite.
• Export assets and upload designs using our proprietary tools
• Ensure all designs have accurate merchandising information
• Quality control the work of other content team members

What You Should Have
• Positive, can-do attitude is an absolute must.
• Keen attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills
• Ability to work well under pressure of tight deadlines without compromising accuracy.
• Solid understanding of Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, with higher pay for individuals with proven experience using these programs in a production environment
• Good written and verbal communication skills
• A fast learner who is always looking for ways to improve processes and automate tasks

How To Apply
If you would like to work in a creative, collaborate, high-growth environment, PlanetArt’s Production Designer role may be for you! Please submit your resume and cover letter. We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Take Three Technologies is seeking a Senior Developer to join our team. Located in Denver, we are an exciting and vibrant technology company that builds enterprise solutions for the residential mortgage banking industry.


We are preparing for the launch of our brand new Loan Origination System and need a talented developer to help us provide additional features and enhancements that will support this product. Along with our existing software (The Rule Tool – a business rules engine for loan officers in our industry), we will also be developing back-end systems for the secondary mortgage market aspects of our business. As such, the right candidate for this position will thrive in a fast moving, dynamic, and ever evolving environment.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with stakeholders and other team members to determine features and enhancements and priorities for implementation.

  • Design and support external API’s


Experience Requirements:



  • A minimum of three year’s direct hands-on experience.

  • Strong project and process management skills are critical as these are highly complex systems in an ever evolving industry.

  • Ability to work independently to design, develop, test, and maintain our proprietary systems.

  • Must take ownership of projects and be accountable to quality and timeliness of completion benchmarks.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills will be absolutely critical in being able to keep the primary stakeholder up to date at all times.


Developer Qualifications:



  • C#VB.NET

  • .NET framework

  • net

  • Microsoft Visual Studio

  • JavaScript

  • HTML 5

  • SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS

  • CSS


We are an exciting entrepreneurial company and will provide you with a competitive salary that will be based on your experience level. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, life insurance and a 401K.

jobs.title: Senior Director, Advertising
jobs.content:
The NBA is seeking a qualified candidate for the position of Senior Director, Advertising.
The Senior Director, Advertising will be responsible for leading the advertising, promotional and creative campaigns for the NBA, WNBA, D-League, and USA Basketball. He/she will manage an internal marketing team responsible for in-house creative assignments with the NBA's internal creative and production teams in addition to external assignments with our creative agencies. In addition to supervising broadcast, digital and print creative development and production , the ideal candidate must successfully guide multiple simultaneous projects from project briefing through final approval. This requires solid management and organizational skills and ability to accurately track timelines, due dates and budget details.

Major Responsibilities:
• Lead the day-to-day working relationship and creative development with external creative agencies.
• Manage the briefing process, projects (e.g. agency meetings, timelines, deliverables, and budgets), requests for internal assets (e.g. footage, photos, etc.), and financial transactions (e.g. tracking budgets, invoices and reconciliation).
• Lead regular communication efforts with internal constituents about brand and advertising campaigns, timelines, and creative, and advise on how key themes and graphic standards can be integrated into various business units
• Ensure creative campaigns are on strategy and consistent with the brand platform.
• Manage and plan the creative workload for internal creative team.
• Lead collaboration between internal creative teams and external agencies to develop key video elements, visuals and graphic standards.
• Create and deliver in-person presentations to internal and external partners about campaigns and creative.
• Oversee digital creative development for a variety of elements, including campaign landing pages, digital displays, video assets and other online solutions for emerging digital technologies.
• Provide feedback on creative briefs.
• Collaborate with internal project management team on creative execution.
• Participate in Business Review process for agency brand work and broadcast partners (ESPN and Turner).
• Oversee the submission of creative on their behalf and report feedback and ensure that recommendations and outcomes from Business Review are incorporated according to brand standards.
• Manage creative team responsible for advertising and creative development.
• Evaluate advertising agency performance.
• Performs other related duties as assigned.

Required Skills/Knowledge:
• Ability to lead within a fast-paced environment and deliver against demanding timelines.
• Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire a creative team.
• Experience leading a creative agency.
• Ability to organize and oversee multiple priorities and projects simultaneously.
• Extensive understanding of creative production processes.
• Extensive experience developing digital creative solutions.
• Strong problem solving, decision making and analytical skills.
• Demonstrated understanding of how creative and media work seamlessly to help brands succeed.
• Exceptionally strong interpersonal and communication skills.
• Strong presentation skills.
• Independent, self-motivated and creative.
• Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint.

Experience:
• At least 10+ years of experience managing advertising/creative production on the agency or client side, with a heavy emphasis on digital creative production.
• At least 8+ years of experience within the sports, entertainment, advertising agency or media industries.
• At least 8+ years of experience working with media agency to coordinate delivering creative assets in accordance with media plans.
• At least 3-5 years of direct supervisory experience.


Educational Background Required:
• Bachelor’s degree.

jobs.title: Principal UI Developer
jobs.content:
• Develop beautiful and intuitive User Interfaces for Video Cloud Analytics team and potentially other components of Brightcove’s offerings.

  • Collaborate with UX Designers, Product Managers and other Engineers to shape user experiences that utilize the latest technology, tools, and techniques and delight users.

  • Iterate and refine designs quickly with a small team of developers and UX designers

  • Enjoy working in teams and having fun!


Skills:



  • 5-10 years of UI / Front End development experience

  • Strong passion for User Experience, simplicity and intuitive designs

  • Fluent in Javascript, CSS, and a number of javascript frameworks

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
As a Front-End Web Developer you'll work as part of a mixed team of Back-End, Windows and web developers; you’ll be confident in making justified decisions, and have fun creating exciting interfaces and interactions.


Working mainly as a Front-End Developer you will be working primarily with web apps and interfacing with our private API. You’ll need to be able to create initial prototypes quickly as you’ll be working closely with our teams across the company as well as our clients.


You’ll be a key part in our project life cycle from conceptualisation to implementation and release.


Your good understanding of design and user experience will allow you to fit comfortably into our team where you will also have the opportunity to head up your own projects. 


The technologies used will include:



  • JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, SASS

  • Bootstrap

  • Angular 1.x

  • Gulp and Bower

  • .Net Core MVC 6, C# (Nice to have/keen to learn)

  • SQL Server (Nice to have/keen to learn)

  • Microsoft Visual Studio (Nice to have/keen to learn)

  • Telerik Controls (Nice to have/keen to learn)

jobs.title: Junior Technical Consultant
jobs.content:
Techfino has a unique opportunity for a Technical Consultant interested in building an exciting new start-up bus-tech consultancy.  At Techfino, we help our clients to grow their business by improving their operational efficiency, increasing revenue, and reducing their IT costs using cloud-based technology.  We provide customization, support, implementation, and systems integration services for industry leading cloud solutions such as NetSuite and SalesForce.


We are seeking a bright JavaScript developer who will work closely with management to prioritize needs, resolve conflicts, and develop high quality solutions for our clients.  Here, you will receive two weeks of paid training on how to develop on the NetSuite SuiteCloud platform and apply Techfino’s best practices on client engagements.  You will interface directly with clients and be given additional responsibility as you progress in your career.  Tons of opportunity for career advancement, on the job training, and exposure to all aspects of business.


This is a full-time position based out of Philadelphia, PA.  We offer flexible work from home arrangements.  Must be willing to travel up to 40% depending on the needs of the project.
