Att jobb på Omegapoint


Vi är ett konsultbolag. Här blir du del av ett medarbetarägt företag som kännetecknas av öppenhet, engagemang och passion för utveckling och säkerhet. Du har stora möjligheter att påverka din egen situation men även företaget som helhet. Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling värderas högt hos oss och erbjuds alla.


Vårt mål är att din tid på Omegapoint blir den mest givande och roliga i din karriär.


Låter detta intressant? Om du är redo för nya utmaningar och vill joina vårt härliga team så skicka in ditt CV redan idag.


Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Dilba Demirbag  +46 70 7353400

jobs.title: User Interface Specialist / Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Open Source. Open Data.


Help create useful applications for municipal governments everywhere. The Information and Technology Services Department at the City of Bloomington, Indiana develops custom software to solve challenges common to all cities. We publish these solutions as open source software via our Github page, and we strive to make use of existing open source solutions when possible.


We're looking for a skilled Front End Developer (aka Webmaster and User Interface Specialist) to help us as we make our web applications easier to use. You'll use the latest best practices in HTML, CSS, and Javascript to guide the look and feel of our public website (https://bloomington.in.gov/alpha) and internal applications (https://github.com/City-of-Bloomington). You'll manage the City of Bloomington’s website content and serves as the City’s primary Webmaster while working in a modern office environment providing health, holiday and paid time off benefits. This is a full-time non-remote position. For more details, visit us here: bloomington.in.gov/jobs.

jobs.title: Exciting Developer Opportunities-
jobs.content:
Overview


The tech team at viagogo is focused on building a platform that will revolutionise the way fans across the globe buy and sell tickets for live events. With buyers and sellers using our website and mobile applications in over 60 countries, 30 languages and hundreds of delivery and payment options, we're constantly taking on tough, exciting engineering challenges - and we're doing it at scale! We are looking for passionate, skilled Developers who want to make meaningful, measurable improvements that impact millions of users.


How We Work


We work in a start-up like manner and we work in small scrum teams of 4-7. Every team member is encouraged to take full ownership of their part of the platform but also to contribute ideas, suggestions and code to other areas of the business. We believe that features have no value until they are in production adding value to our customers so teams deploy fast and often. The tech team is building something that has never been built before so we're always trying to think outside the box. We hold monthly hackathons where team members inside and outside of tech bring their most creative ideas for the product; some of which even make it to production the same night!


Here are some examples of cool things we built in 2015:



  • We built a notification platform (comprised of RabbitMQ, C# Services, SQL Enterprise) which handles thousands of concurrent changes every minute. This reduced the latency for sale notifications from hours to seconds. We built a scalable delivery pipeline that delivers notifications in real-time to website users (via SignalR) and iOS and Android users (via Microsoft Azure Notification Hub).

  • We built a world class, hypermedia driven, RESTful API with outstanding documentationand several open source SDKs written in .NET, Ruby, Python and PHP

jobs.title: Xamarin Developers
jobs.content:
Headquarters: San Francisco
URL: http://bit.ly/1YwuqbZ

About Toptal
Toptal is one of the most innovative and rapidly expanding tech start-ups from Silicon Valley. With backing from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Adam D’Angelo, our platform is the fastest growing labor marketplace in the history of the Internet—connecting thousands of elite engineers all over the world. In the last four years, Toptal has become the #1 choice for tech companies requiring top-tier engineering talent and for the top 3% of freelancers looking for their next challenge.

Position Description
We are looking for a Xamarin Developer passionate about creating highly performant, scalable, cross-platform, and feature-rich mobile applications for Android and iOS. Your primary responsibility will be to build production-ready, Xamarin-based mobile applications for a large variety of industry-leading clients. To do this position, you must have a deep love for creating top quality C#-based mobile applications for Android and iOS.

By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Benefits:
  • Freedom to choose your own schedule and choose from a variety of hourly, part-time, and full-time projects.
  • The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.
  • Access to a thriving, collaborative community of talented peers.
  • Invitations to frequent Toptal events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.
  • Extremely competitive compensation.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead the development of iOS and Android applications using Xamarin, including writing and maintaining code, creating unit tests, collaborating with team members, and leading teams as necessary.
  • Ensure the highest level of quality throughout the mobile software development life cycle.
  • Use C# and Xamarin best practices to ensure the same quality of applications across multiple platforms with minimal duplication of effort.
  • Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code.
  • Design, build, and maintain high performance, reusable, and reliable C# code.
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.
  • Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders. 
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

Requirements:
  • Extensive experience developing mobile applications for both Android and iOS, including a deep understanding of the differences between them and the nuances of working with each.
  • Extensive experience building mobile applications using C# and the Xamarin framework, including familiarity with the APIs available with Xamarin.
  • Excellent object-oriented programming skills in C#.
  • Strong knowledge of Android SDK, different versions of Android, and how to deal with different screen sizes.
  • Strong knowledge of iOS SDK and experience with Xcode.
  • Experience with integration of web services into mobile applications, including a record of working with SOAP, REST, JSON, and XML.
  • Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning.
  • Ability to design applications around natural user interfaces, such as “touch”.
  • Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers.
  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements.
  • Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications.
  • A knack for benchmarking and optimization.
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.
  • Be open to receiving feedback.

To apply: http://bit.ly/1YwuqbZ

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.company: KNMP (De Koninklijke Nederlandse Maatschappij ter bevordering der Pharmacie)
jobs.content:
Ben jij de ICT expert die graag luistert naar de klant en samen tot een oplossing wilt komen? Zie je het als een uitdaging om onze core-systemen naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Heb jij daarnaast affiniteit met de apotheek-/zorgsector? Dan is deze baan iets voor jou!

Software Developer Fulltime, Den Haag centrum

Je hebt de vrijheid om bij andere producten en teams mee te helpen. Denk hierbij aan de KNMP Kennisbank, Apotheek.nl, SFK Select, knmp.nl, pw.nl, zindex.nl, sfk.nl, de appotheek, de oncologie app, de verminderde nierfunctie app, de verkeersdeelname app en verschillende andere apps en websites. Daarbij werk je met bijzondere data en de ‘next generation’ informatievoorziening voor de zorg.

Wat ga jij als Software Developer doen?

  • Het ontwikkelen van de back-end van onze core-systemen waarmee wij onze unieke informatie ontsluiten voor de zorgsector binnen Nederland;
  • Het herkennen van structuren en patronen in data door het analyseren van onze meer dan 40 unieke kruislings verbonden bronnen;
  • Het koppelen met andere systemen en het bedenken van nieuwe manieren om onze informatie te delen met anderen via layering, API´s en webservices;
  • Het steeds verder uitbouwen en door ontwikkelen van het bestaande producten- en dienstenpakket middels het ontwikkelen van nieuwe functionaliteiten;
  • Het in kaart brengen van wensen en eisen voor nieuwe functionaliteiten en wijzigingen bij de business;
  • Het opstellen van een functionele ontwerpen aanleiding van de requirements;
  • Het werken met agile, waterval of hybride projectmethodieken.
  • Het testen van de ontwikkelde code;
  • Het bedenken van manieren die de data integriteit hoog houden en de voorspelbaarheid maximaal (door bijvoorbeeld invoerprocessen te harmoniseren).

Jij bent een Software Developer met:

  • HBO werk- en denkniveau
  • 5 tot 10 jaar ervaring als software developer
  • Je hebt ervaring/affiniteit met complexe systemen en data
  • Je hebt een passie voor het koppelen en ontsluiten van informatie via kanalen
  • Je bent zeer bekwaam in minstens één moderne programmeertaal
  • Je bent gemotiveerd om de taal Python op te pakken

Daarnaast ben je analytisch, proactief, kwaliteitsgericht en een teamplayer (ervaring met multidisciplinaire teams; zoals klanten en product owners). Je bent van nature nieuwsgierig en zeker niet bang om vragen te stellen.

Verdere Pre’s die we graag zien: Je hebt affiniteit met de apotheeksector, de zorgsector of specifieker met AIS/ZIS/HIS systemen. Je hebt ervaring met het aansturen en coachen van collega´s en teams. Eerder hebben gewerkt met online dienstverlening/front-end systemen zien we graag. Daarnaast is ervaring met pair-programming en ervaring met Python een pre. Als laatste zien we graag ervaring met Django, Pyramid, JavaScript, PHP, Flask, GIT, Angular, Bootstrap en IBM RPG.

Wat bieden wij?

  • Werken voor dé beroeps- en brancheorganisatie voor apothekers
  • De mogelijkheid om te werken met diverse back-end én front-end systemen
  • Werken in een open (minded) sfeer met gemotiveerde en slimme collega’s
  • Een uitstekend salaris
  • Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals; een goed opleidingsaanbod zowel incompany als persoonlijk afgestemd op de medewerker, 30 vakantiedagen, reiskostenvergoeding
  • Een werkplek in het centrum van Den Haag op loopafstand van het Centraal Station.

Werken als ICTer bij de KNMP, wie zijn wij? De Koninklijke Nederlandse Maatschappij ter bevordering der Pharmacie (KNMP) is de beroeps- en brancheorganisatie voor apothekers. De KNMP heeft tientallen producten en diensten en het merendeel hiervan is digitaal. Deze producten worden door afdeling ICT & Business Innovatie in nauwe samenhang met de product owners gerealiseerd.

Z-Index (onderdeel van de KNMP) levert bijvoorbeeld ook de G-Standaard databank uit. Dit is de standaard in Nederland die processen in de zorg zoals voorschrijven, afleveren, bestellen, declareren en het vergoeden van zorgproducten mogelijk maakt. We onderhouden ook praktijkgerichte informatiesystemen zoals de KNMP Kennisbank, wij maken en onderhouden de genomineerde website Apotheek.nl met bijna een miljoen unieke bezoekers per maand. Ook lanceren we verschillende apps en hebben we regelmatig nieuwe ideeën die we zelfstandig en met partners ontwikkelen.

Solliciteren Spreekt het je aan waar de KNMP voor staat en lijkt de baan jou op het lijf geschreven? Dan nodigen wij je graag uit om te solliciteren middels ons digitale sollicitatieformulier via de link.

Klik hier voor het sollicitatieformulier!

Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Bill Marks (manager ICT), tel: (070) 373 72 76.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Trefwoorden: Vacature, Fulltime, Den Haag, Software engineer, Software ontwikkelaar.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Ben jij de ICT expert die graag luistert naar de klant en samen tot een oplossing wilt komen? Zie je het als een uitdaging om onze core-systemen naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Heb jij daarnaast affiniteit met de apotheek-/zorgsector? Dan is deze baan iets voor jou!

Software Developer
Fulltime, Den Haag centrum

Je hebt de vrijheid om bij andere producten en teams mee te helpen. Denk hierbij aan de KNMP Kennisbank, Apotheek.nl, SFK Select, knmp.nl, pw.nl, zindex.nl, sfk.nl, de appotheek, de oncologie app, de verminderde nierfunctie app, de verkeersdeelname app en verschillende andere apps en websites. Daarbij werk je met bijzondere data en de ‘next generation’ informatievoorziening voor de zorg.

Wat ga jij als Software Developer doen?



  • Het ontwikkelen van de back-end van onze core-systemen waarmee wij onze unieke informatie ontsluiten voor de zorgsector binnen Nederland;

  • Het herkennen van structuren en patronen in data door het analyseren van onze meer dan 40 unieke kruislings verbonden bronnen;

  • Het koppelen met andere systemen en het bedenken van nieuwe manieren om onze informatie te delen met anderen via layering, API´s en webservices;

  • Het steeds verder uitbouwen en door ontwikkelen van het bestaande producten- en dienstenpakket middels het ontwikkelen van nieuwe functionaliteiten;

  • Het in kaart brengen van wensen en eisen voor nieuwe functionaliteiten en wijzigingen bij de business;

  • Het opstellen van een functionele ontwerpen aanleiding van de requirements;

  • Het werken met agile, waterval of hybride projectmethodieken.

  • Het testen van de ontwikkelde code;

  • Het bedenken van manieren die de data integriteit hoog houden en de voorspelbaarheid maximaal (door bijvoorbeeld invoerprocessen te harmoniseren).
jobs.location: De Koninklijke Nederlandse Maatschappij ter bevordering der Pharmacie

jobs.title: Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Front-end is everything in e-commerce, it’s your job to build the smoothest front-end combined with implementing the business logic in the back-end for the best performance according the latest standards and for every device. Do you want to be part of a dynamic and fast-growing fashion E-commerce department? Then we are looking for you!


As our new developer you will be part of our E-commerce department in the center of Amsterdam, where you will be working together with more than 100 colleagues from all over the world in a young, fast-paced and agile environment. You will play a key role within our Amsterdam office, leading the way to help BESTSELLER E-commerce push for quality systems and high converting websites in 12 countries and for more than 17 different brands.  


Moreover, your tasks will include:



  • Building new features in the front-end and integrating them in the back-end of our websites using i.a. SASS, Javascript

  • Working closely with the UX team to support and improve the user experience

  • Improving performance, standards & SEO to always adapt to the latest standards

  • Conducting code reviews, pair programming and writing automated tests 

  • Implement Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices

  • Sharing knowledge with your team members


Your Profile
Your work is used and seen by a huge group of users and the applications are cutting edge on every thinkable device.  You will be working in an environment with a genuine start up culture, therefore it is vital that you are pro-active and a real team player. Solid knowledge of e-commerce and the processes within is essential, as you will be navigating in an international and dynamic e-commerce department. Our ideal candidate will be an all-rounder with extensive knowledge of the backend and OO programming.

jobs.title: Java Full Stack Developer  Spring, AngularJS
jobs.content:
At Pavilion Health, we are building creative, innovative and successful software for the healthcare industry. We are analysing huge data sets to provide insights on quality and cost. We are pioneering ways to use the cloud securely for healthcare applications. We are bringing the best of contemporary web UX to enterprise software.


We’re a small team, and we like to keep it that way. Management is flat, and despite our many years of profitable operation, we still have the feel of a startup. We have a nice mix of iterating existing products and developing brand new ones. Some of the things we’re building have the potential to be rather disruptive.


Every member of our development team is important. Some of our best new ideas have come from within the team, and management is proud of our team’s success. We believe in ongoing professional development, sending our team to key conferences and courses. We take time to ensure every team member’s personal goals are being met, and that they have a positive career path within the company.


Today, we’ve taken the major step of deciding to add another member to the team. We’re looking for someone with the right skills, sure, but even more importantly, the right fit.


Location


Kirribilli, Sydney, Australia.


Skills


Required



  • Java

  • Spring framework

  • Javascript

  • AngularJS framework

  • JUnit

  • Karma

  • Git


Desirable



  • HTML/CSS

  • Angular Material

  • Microservices architecture

  • Kanban or similar agile development practice

  • Security

  • Large datasets

  • Search


Experience


3 years minimum full-time experience in developing full-stack applications, working as part of a team.


Education


CS or IT Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent.


Tasks & Responsibilities



  • Working with the Pavilion Health development team lead to:


    • Analyse and design appropriate development responses to defects and enhancement requests

    • Contribute as part of team to overall solution design

    • Establish priorities for development and ensure work is completed within the sprint


  • Working with other members of the team to:


    • Coordinate work on multiple parts of the system

    • Review code in a productive and quality-driven manner

    • Share knowledge and learning about implementation, framework dependencies and overall technology stack


  • Working alone or paired to:


    • Write unit tests to describe desired code behaviour

    • Write code to satisfy unit tests

    • Refactor code and identify opportunities for refactoring

    • Improve code in response to code reviews



Career Path


Starting as part of the development team for a particular product, the successful employee has the opportunity to graduate to the position of Senior Developer within that team, and thereafter to the Team Lead/Architect position for that product. From there, a path into management (Engineering Manager, CTO) is possible, as is a more client-facing path (Product Manager).


Salary Package


$75-85k including superannuation, depending upon experience



If this feels like the job for you, contact me at mike@pavilion-health.com with your full resume, LinkedIn profile, Github or StackOverflow ID, or anything else you think we might like to see. I look forward to hearing from you.

jobs.title: Game Developer PHP
jobs.content:
As a Game Developer PHP, you will be part of our agile, cross-functional and international development team. You will drive the development of new features as well as maintain and improve the current code of our successful game Forge of Empires.


Your mission:



  • Game development within an agile, cross-functional and international team

  • Customize and upgrade our existing architecture of PHP and node.js

  • Collaborate with experienced games professionals and get in touch with multiple teams and departments

  • Ensure a high quality of code through tests, code reviews, refactoring and Continuous Integration

  • Maintain our development tools and environments (i.e. Jenkins, Docker)

  • Plan and implement database structures

  • Optimize performance

  • Analyze and resolve errors

  • Play an active part in the quality of our games by contributing your own ideas in the development process


Your profile:



  • University degree in computer science or an equivalent qualification

  • Several years of experience in object-oriented programming in PHP

  • Appreciation of software quality and maintainability using unit tests, TDD or Continuous Integration

  • Profound SQL skills, ideally with high performing PostgreSQL databases

  • Open to additional languages like ActionScript or C++

  • Proficient in Git, Vagrant/Docker and on the UNIX command line

  • Familiar with terms like SOLID, KISS, DRY and YAGNI

  • Solution-oriented, efficient way of working and able to perform under pressure

  • Good communication skills and team player

  • Proactive and motivated personality with a willingness to learn

  • Comprehensive understanding of game development

  • Very good English language skills


Why join us?



  • Shape the success story of InnoGames with a great team of driven experts within an international company culture

  • Competitive compensation and an atmosphere to empower creative thinking and strong results

  • Exceptional benefits ranging from flawless relocation support to company gym, smartphone or tablet of your own choice for personal use, roof terrace with BBQ and much more


Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Game Developer PHP with us? Then we look forward to receive your application (cover letter, CV and code samples) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Sven Wohlfahrt.

jobs.title: QA Technical Tester - New Mobile Game
jobs.content:
Do you consider testing as a technical activity? Do you enjoy making your work more efficient by automating it? We are looking for someone to strengthen our team as QA Technical Tester, who works to ensure a high standard of quality every day – for ingenious software for fascinating games!

Your mission:



  • Review test requirements and provide feedback for Product Managers

  • Initial feedback for newly developed features through exploratory testing

  • Automation of service-level and UI-level tests

  • Develop system test plans / beta test plans

  • Coordinate testing activities with development teams and the Release Manager

  • Report about product quality status and follow up on it

  • Support the team to optimize the testing process

  • Plan and organize team and crowd test sessions


Your profile:



  • 3 years of professional experience in software testing

  • A degree in technical sciences or relevant work experience

  • Hands-on testing experience regarding web applications

  • At least 2 years of experience in e-commerce, e-gaming or a similar domain

  • Excellent knowledge of software testing

  • Good understanding of SDLC

  • Passion for computer games

  • Enjoys working and communicating in an agile team

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, open-concept work environment within cross-functional teams


Preferable:



  • Experience in testing mobile applications

  • ISTQB/ISEB certification

  • Experience in automating tests on the UI-level as well as on the service-level

  • Experience with MySQL/Oracle/PostgreSQL databases

  • Experience in mobile HTTP debugging (using for example Charles Proxy)


Why join us?



  • Shape the success story of InnoGames with a great team of driven experts in an international culture

  • Competitive compensation and an atmosphere to empower creative thinking and strong results

  • Exceptional benefits ranging from flawless relocation support to company gym, smartphone or tablet of your own choice for personal use, roof terrace with BBQ and much more


Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a QA Technical Tester with us? Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Sven Wohlfahrt.

jobs.title: Systems Analyst
jobs.content:
Bring your in-depth knowledge of the software development lifecycle to Arco, UK Market Leader spearheading Safety at Work.


Up to £35,000, dependent on experience, plus 8% bonus and company benefits


As Systems Analyst reporting to our Development Manager, you’ll lead on the design and implementation of technical solutions to help us achieve our strategic objectives. Working with business analysts and domain architects, you’ll identify, investigate and recommend solutions and then create accurate and detailed specifications. That’ll entail managing implementation through all stages of the software lifecycle, overseeing external resources to ensure accuracy and completeness, and supporting the project manager to ensure adherence to budgets and timescales.

Other key deliverables as Systems Analyst include:
• assisting with training where required to ensure system acceptance
• enabling the testing team and helping where required with system integration
• supporting handover to our service teams.
• SAP Configuration Skills and Knowledge

jobs.title: Embedded Software Developer
jobs.content:
Would you like to share in Riedel Communication’s success?


The position will be based at our RIEDEL Headquarters in Wuppertal (Germany).


Your responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain embedded software for a real-time video-, audio and data-network

  • Autonomously plan, design, implement, and test components for the Linux operating system

  • Demonstrate ownership of dedicated areas of the system’s software architecture

  • Document design from high-level block diagram down to specific implementation decisions

  • Participate in Design and Code Reviews, both formal and agile forms (pairing etc.)



Your profile:



  • University degree in a technical discipline preferably in IT, computer engineering and/or electronics

  • Proven experience in embedded software development

  • Very good knowledge of Linux as well as C ++ and object-oriented software design, knowledge of common internet protocols and Java is a plus

  • Experience in agile software development methodology

  • Good communicator with the ability to cross-domain thinking and willingness to collaborate closely with other company functions Pro-active team player who works on own initiative, result orientated, asking and giving assistance to other team-members

  • Fluent English as a must-have with German fluency a strong advantage


To keep up with our goals, we need YOU! Why? In such a fast moving environment we are always looking for innovative ways to move on. Thanks to our employees who bring in their knowledge as well as fresh ideas RIEDEL could become this big. Therefore we need highly motivated and qualified employees who will join our family and develop with us.


We are ready for the future! - What about you?


Be with us!

jobs.title: Frontend Web Developer in IoT Company
jobs.content: To strengthen our international team we are looking for a Web Developer who is responsible for further development of our website as well as of our webshop. Independently, but also in cooperation with the design team, you will develop a superior frontend and implement it on diverse devices and high-responsives. Furthermore, you will also contribute to the development of the backend functionalities. In the dynamic environment of a high-tech start-up you have the chance to quickly bring things forward and to highly influence the appearance and customer experience of tado°.

jobs.title: Analyst Programmer
jobs.content:
Working within the Technology team at Citywire, you will play a key part in designing, building and delivering systems that help grow the business. As well as our public websites, we build many of our internal applications in-house; such as our CMS, email and magazine circulation management tool, audience engagement analytics platform, investment management and analysis tools.


Although we mostly use Microsoft tools you will also be exposed to a broad range of technologies; in the past 12 months alone we have successfully put into production systems built with Couchbase, Hadoop, Elasticsearch and Amazon Cloud to name but a few.


We work in an agile environment; developing in small iterations and working directly with stakeholders on a wide range of projects. You would gain strong exposure to the skills and ideas we have across all departments and every opportunity to develop your own skills. You will manage your projects as an equal stakeholder, and form initial requirements and identify revisions as projects progress.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Build and maintain web applications, APIs and services.

  • Explore new technologies and tools to help shape and advance the Technology Team.

  • Planning your projects and establishing requirements with other project stakeholders.

jobs.title: Graduate Junior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Role Summary:


Our multi-award winning SMS marketing platform is trusted by brands including Volkswagen, Surfers Against Sewage and Uber; and our API allows our customers to integrate SMS with Eventbrite, Zendesk and Zapier as well as many others, allowing customers to add their own integrations.


We are looking for someone who will be involved in the development of all aspects of our powerful web application, including automating the provision of our infrastructure, designing database models, building APIs and server code (primarily in PHP), as well as writing front-end HTML, CSS and JavaScript.


The role offers excellent opportunities for growth, so our ideal candidate will always be seeking to improve their knowledge and skills, and we’ll support that by sending you to conferences and providing access to relevant training.  We are a distributed agile team operating on 2-week sprints with a strong focus on testing, so the ideal candidate has great communication skills and takes ownership of code and development. 


You will report directly to FireText’s Chief Technology Officer and company directors and we are happy for you to be based at either of our offices, Reigate, Surrey or Penryn, Cornwall; remote working may be considered for the right candidate too.


The role will involve some travel to our office locations.


If you're a graduate or an engineer with web development experience looking to further your skills, apply now!


Example Duties: 



  • Development of new features, and maintenance of existing applications

  • Work with the team to design, program, and deliver software solutions using a variety of technologies and programming languages

  • Troubleshoot and fix operational issues as they arise

  • Continuous improvement of the systems and codebase

  • Ad-hoc internal support of operations

jobs.title: Chief Technology Officer
jobs.content:
The CEO is seeking a highly intelligent and self-motivated Software Team Lead to work in an intellectually stimulating, fast-paced, startup environment. Our ideal CTO is a talented, and highly ambitious person to join our talented team in Tehran (next to Sharif University). PersianGig is a full-service cloud service provider that employs a team of 40 -- the CTO must be interested in being be heavily involved in the growth and development of all facets of the company.

We are looking for a leader that will drive the technology roadmap, build an A+ engineering team, deliver quality products that delight users, and be the technological face of the company. You must be able to architect at the 30 thousand foot level and able to roll up your sleeves and code. You should be solution centric, results-oriented, and experienced in distributed systems, front-end, mobile technologies. You must be able to turn complex and aggressive vision into an actionable set of prioritized objectives.

The Chief Technology Officer (CTO) is the lead executioner who will become a partner to the CEO (based in the US) in implementing the vision and strategy to grow the company through the use of data driven analysis of the business. The CTO leads the engineering team and will provide leadership to the technical and product teams and will oversee development that involves international communication and operations between Silicon Valley and Tehran.

In this role, you will:
• Evolve and execute the company's strategic direction and technical roadmap
• Build and shape the engineering culture, drive technical decisions and deliver new product features
• Grow and manage our top-flight engineering team
• Be the technological face of the company with conferences, events, and media
• Experience in implementing architectures for large-scale web application systems
• Work with product owner (CEO) to guide and refine requirements, and design next generation features.
• Monitoring and optimizing performance for various services
• Create elegant & scalable Infrastructures for millions of users
• Manage and prioritize the troubleshooting & triage problem reports as part of a 24x7x365 support rotation

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs.content:
• Development and implementation of new and exciting features for our award-winning idealo travel App to help our users plan their next holidays

  • In cooperation with UX and Project Management teams, your UX expertise will help us achieve great user experience

  • Involvement with technical task and contribution to the overall development process including assessment of requirements and architectural decisions

  • In cooperation with our Backend Team you will define the necessary Infrastructure needed to make our Apps to innovative Products

jobs.title: Lead UI Artist
jobs.content:
Our goals for this role



  • Your goal is to help DIGIT continue the growth of our hit title Kings of the Realm

  • You will bring our title to the next level, helping DIGIT to truly push the boundaries of UI design in the game

  • As Lead UI Artist, you will be hands on, as well as leading a small experienced team of games UI designers.


Here's what you will be doing



  • Provide art direction and own the UI for the game

  • Rapidly deliver intuitive and rewarding user interfaces to millions of players for all new game features

  • Design fully responsive user interfaces, that work seamlessly across multiple mobile devices

  • Concept, create and validate UI designs for the game (from user flows through to release)

  • Assist in rapid iterations and testing ideas (using wireframes and sketches, in-engine mockups etc.)

  • Create clean and easy to implement UI assets, which can seamlessly move straight over to the development team and into games production

  • Own the UI pipeline - create and define style guides and monitor consistency and quality across your team

  • Lead and technically manage a small skilled team of UI designers - review work daily, act as technical mentor and guide, set goals etc.

  • Guide the UI vision and art direction across the team (explorations, colour, composition, iconography etc.)

  • Innovate and try new things - always push the quality bar on every single topic.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.content:
Hi, we’re Canary… a NYC-based startup that helps people connect to their family, their community and their home in new ways. Our first product is an award-winning, all-in-one home security device that makes it easy to not just see, but understand what’s happening in your home from anywhere.

As a product designer at Canary, you’ll contribute to an experience-focused team that values collaboration, optimism, and stellar work. The product design group is responsible for all digital properties of Canary, including our mobile apps, website, and email. You'll work with brand and industrial design to think through the full customer journey. We believe in holistic user experiences and deliver them through quality products, services, and brand.

What You'll Be Up To:
You’ll be tasked to balance the design work within one of our agile squads and contributing to strategic working groups. Your challenge is to support the needs of the business while maintaining a high standard of quality for the design work. You’ll partner with the product and engineering leads to define the team’s roadmap, collaborate with senior stakeholders and squad members through the design process, and own bringing your concepts to life and into the hands of our users.

• Hands on design work from strategy to UX to UI to copy. You’ll be responsible for all aspects of the design throughout the process.
• Drive an end-to-end process for design work, from framing the problem to UX and functional design, to communication and visual design, through delivery and QA
• Drive and manage the feedback loop. This includes taking responsibility for sharing work with stakeholders throughout process.
• Own design planning on the squad. Give input to squad on timing and milestones for design work.
• Identify the various scenarios a user may encounter and define an experience that accommodates them
• Maintain asset libraries for reusable design systems
• Deliver all assets needed for development
• Create prototypes that express your design intent
• Support and participate in user testing
• Engage in design QA to make sure we’re shipping quality
• Communicate effectively and deliver on time.

What You'll Need To Have:
You are an optimistic problem solver who exemplifies the values of collaboration and design integrity. You love to learn and to share the power of design with your colleagues. You’re self motivated and tend to exceed expectations when given the freedom to manage your own work. Your technical knowledge allows you to create feasible concepts, but doesn’t inhibit your focus on creative problem solving.

• 3+ years experience as a designer
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent knowledge of design principles and foundations
• Strong UX skillset
• Comfortable with visual design
• Strong communicator and presenter
• Experience on a real-world mobile or web application a must
• The ability and interest to collaborate with engineers
• Strong grasp of your own process
• Love of learning and problem solving

A Little About Us:
We’re Canary, a New York City-based startup that believes the best technology makes you smarter, puts you in control, and gives you access to the information you need. That’s why we’re dedicated to developing easy-to-use technology that protects, empowers, and has a meaningful impact on people, families, and their communities.

Our first product made Indiegogo history as the most successful connected home crowdfunded product ever, and has proven that there’s a real demand for a simple, intelligent, all-in-one home security device. We think it’s because Canary does more than protect your home; it gives people control, connects them to their loved ones, and helps them hold on to the moments that matter.

We're looking for brilliant, talented people who love toppling giants, working autonomously in small teams, solving challenging problems, and developing real solutions for everyday use. If that sounds like you, come join us and help us make the world feel safe and secure.

What can we give you?

• Comprehensive health insurance
• Daily catered lunch
• Flexible work hours
• Unlimited vacation
• Reimbursement for commuter costs
• A beautiful and industrial office space

jobs.title: Senior Developer to challenge the norm AND love what they do
jobs.content:
We love the fact that we use cutting edge technology to build amazing products for our clients.


AND, we think we’re really good at finding the right people to ensure that happens!


We also think our hiring philosophy of meeting the perfect match and offering them the same day, makes us the fastest in the market right now!


So, we know what we want – do you? Apply now to speak to one of our Developers to hear the whole story!


Here, at ANDigital, Senior Software Engineers and Senior Developers are known as Product Developers because of the amazing, digital products they build.


Here’s an insight into what you’ll be doing and the benefits you’ll be earning when you come on board at ANDigital!


Your day-to-day


As a senior member of your team you will be an expert in your domain, applying your experience and knowledge when influencing your team or Client:



  • You will lead by example and be the most senior Developer on the team

  • You will work with our Clients onsite in a multi-skilled Agile delivery team to design, architect and develop digital and e-commerce products

  • Work with bespoke and innovative software platforms and components to turn your hand to front end, back end and mobile web and application development

  • You’ll be an ambassador on engineering best practice -  advising Clients and ANDis on coding standards, Scrum, code refactoring, code performance, continuous integration and testing

  • Design and develop compelling and commercially viable customer experiences across multiple digital and e-commerce channels: web, mobile, social, in-store

  • Adopt Continuous Integration and Delivery techniques throughout the delivery lifecycle

  • You’ll be driving the team to deliver on time and to the best achievable code quality

  • Advise the Product Owner and stakeholders on adopting change: be it architecture enhancements, data model improvements or database optimisation

  • Using your depth of knowledge and experience, you’ll shape the outcome of delivery by leading discussions around technical subjects to deliver effective products and code – challenging the norm and sharing insight

  • You’ll be an inspirational mentor and coach: encouraging regular feedback, promoting skills development, fostering strong relationships, building connections, encouraging open communication


Benefits:


Work hard AND play hard with ANDigital.


After going through our intensive (but seriously fun!) ANDBootcamp with the rest of your new team, you will be ready to be deployed to one of our clients and enjoy the many benefits of being an ANDi!



  • Market leading package and equity – from an annual tech budget to spend on the latest gadgets, to bonus challenges, private healthcare, flexible holiday and share options!

  • Join a growing, professional and driven squad team that is closely knit and supportive

  • Make a huge impact in creating a unique company

  • Learn, develop and grow as part of a fast growing company

  • Work hard, play hard in a fun environment where everyone is valued

jobs.title: Problem solving Ruby & Javascript developers wanted - Southampton & London
jobs.content:
Working at Alliants


At Alliants we love to solve business problems; sometimes with technology and sometimes without. We are always looking for creative and enthusiastic people who share that spirit to join our team. All of our work comes from recommendation and the fact we take great pride in the work that we do means that we continue to get recommended.


Our aim is to work in self-sufficient and collaborative cross-functional teams. We develop iteratively, responding to feedback and change, while taking a pragmatic approach to delivery. Communication is a key part of how we function.


We are committed to providing an atmosphere where everyone’s opinions and ideas are respected, work-life balance is valued and all our colleagues have opportunities to learn and grow. We hire people rather than functions and take great care to ensure that the people we hire share our values.


Who Are You?


You care about providing value to the client and want to engage with them to understand their needs. You think about the bigger picture rather than just your current task and are prepared to turn your hand to whatever needs to be done to help the team.


You are keen to share your well considered opinions while also welcoming ideas of others and healthy debate. You are good at what you do, more than that you are so passionate about it that that passion is contagious.


Roles


As a Software Developer you understand and have experience of robust development frameworks including source control, unit testing and daily builds. You see the value in TDD and pair programming but also understand when they are valuable and when other methods are more beneficial. Our current preferred technology stack is Ruby on Rails with Angular or React for web and native iOS and Android apps for mobile. You should be able to demonstrate excellence in one of these. Open source projects which can demonstrate your skills will be highly regarded.


Why Join Us?


Great things we provide to all employees:



  • Investment time to explore new ideas, and work with the wider community

  • An annual training budget to enable you to learn and develop

  • Sponsorship to represent us at conferences and local hack days

  • A budget to spend on hardware of your choice (we’re typically a MacBook crowd)

  • Awesome Fridays with breakfast, lunch and drinks fridge

  • Popular benefits including pension, healthcare, bonuses, child care vouchers and cycle to work.


If you value collaboration, technical excellence and continuous improvement then get in touch and tell us about yourself.


Alliants is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Als Java Developer lever je een belangrijke bijdrage aan het realiseren van onze projecten of die van onze klanten. Je draagt als specialist bij aan het succes op basis van een proactieve houding, een hoog ambitieniveau, een extreme drive en je uitgebreide kennis en ervaring.


Deze kennis en ervaring richten zich specifiek op het vlak van Enterprise ontwikkeling op basis van JEE en gerelateerde frameworks en projecten als Spring, Grails, Wicket, JavaScript, AngularJS en Scala.


Net als wij ben je nieuwsgierig naar de trends en ontwikkelingen op ons vakgebied en spreken bijvoorbeeld concepten als NoSQL, Functional Programming en API's je aan en ben je bereid je hier verder in te verdiepen.


We vinden het belangrijk dat je in staat bent om deze kennis met je collega’s en onze klanten te delen. Je bent goed in je vak en hebt er plezier in.



Please note that due to the nature of our clients we are looking for Dutch Speakers Only...!

jobs.title: Development Team Lead, 80-100%
jobs.content:
You will be the top tech guy in our company, responsible for the development team and it’s output. As the interface between your team and the rest of the company, you’ll be translating business needs into architectural decisions and manageable features. Because our CEO was previously the CTO, you will get lots of understanding and appreciation for the work of your team. Besides your managing duties, we also expect you to get your hands dirty in code on a daily basis.


Responsibilities:



  • Manage our team of software developers, which currently consists of five people

  • Take decisions on our architecture from backend to frontend, which currently consists of a Python REST API hosted on AWS and AngularJS as well as native iOS and Android apps on the client side

  • Lead by example by writing well-tested, concise code across our stack

  • Choose the right tools and institute good development practices

  • Be the interface between the development team and the rest of the company

  • Manage the hiring process for your team


In addition to senior candidates with management experience, we are also considering ambitious juniors who want to take the next step in their career.

jobs.title: Lead Platform Security Analyst
jobs.content:
The Square Security team works to ensure the security of every transaction from dip to receipt and beyond. We strive to provide a secure environment that allows Square to build world-class products for both customers and employees. Our ultimate goal is to ensure that every single experience with Square is simple, secure, and safe.


The Platform Security team is responsible for the security of all of Square’s corporate and production infrastructure. The members of this team are deeply involved in all facets of our infrastructure design, operation, and monitoring; ready to respond to any sign of compromise. The Lead Platform Security Analyst is specifically responsible for helping shape our intrusion detection, incident response, and threat intelligence capabilities as well as identification, investigation, and direction of response to suspicious behavior within our infrastructure. The position requires extensive experience identifying and developing defenses against real-world threats and responding to incidents.

jobs.content:

Crazy-Factory.com is the world’s largest online piercing store. Our company was founded 10 years ago and is continually growing. We sell 17.000+ products worldwide.


To expand and implement our current projects we are expanding our IT team at our headquarters in Thailand Bangkok. If you think you have what it takes to work with an international team on the biggest piercing online shop in the world, see specs below!

Technologies

We are promoting

We are moving


Not now, but around August 2017 our company will move from Bangkok to Bang Sa-Re. This area is quieter and more rural than bangkok, but none of the less beautiful and a great place to settle down. If you ever wanted to built a house next to a beautiful beach ... THIS is your chance!


Take a look at the area here: https://goo.gl/maps/GNzecd5YaTw

jobs.title: Mobile Application Manager
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Job Summary:



We are looking for a mobile application leader to join our Xfinity Connect Mobile Development team. This team is responsible for ensuring the timely development, testing and release of the Xfinity Connect iOS and Android applications with a degree of quality that exceeds our customers’ expectations. We are passionate about our product, our engineering, and our people.



In this role, you will directly manage a team of software developers and test engineers.  You will collaborate with cross-functional teams (management, web, mobile and API developers, UX designers, test engineers, operations engineers, product and business managers) to develop features for Xfinity Connect products and applications.  You must be a strong technical leader, an independent, critical and analytic thinker, have excellent communication skills and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands.



- Responsible for developing and managing a team of mobile developers and QA engineers who are focused on building and maintaining the mobile application, while working with numerous supporting application teams. 



- This individual will manage a team which may include exempt and non-exempt employees. Employees will be a mix of local and remote workers which includes offshore outsourced resources. They will provide subject matter guidance to employees as required and serve as a point of escalation.



- Passionate and driven to improve the customer experience through solving problems and delivering a superior application.



- Develops processes and procedures to drive departmental and process efficiencies, as well as meeting of departmental budget. 



Requirements:



- Experience managing software engineers



- Professional experience developing native iOS or Android applications



- Demonstrated knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle and Agile methodologies



- Demonstrated knowledge of Continuous Integration and Deployment tools (Jenkins, AntHillPro)



- Knowledge of source control and code review systems (Github, Gerrit)



- Experience with DevOps, Automated Testing and Continuous Delivery



- Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills



- Experience setting individual and team goals



- Experience developing individual career plans for engineers



- Establishes and maintains productive relationships with peer organizations contracting vendors.



- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.



Additional Responsibilities May Include:

Responsible for recruiting, developing, and managing a team of product

development engineers. Designs, implements, and sustains engineering of

Company’s applications and services. Manages team which may include

exempt and non-exempt employees. Provides subject matter guidance to

employees as required. Develops processes and procedures to drive

department efficiencies, assist in development, and meeting of,

departmental budget.



Core Responsibilities:

- Manages the full life cycle product development to include analysis

and planning related to product development, launch and deployment.

- Creates documents for architecture, design, technical requirements and

service specifications. Presents architecture, design, and technical

choices to internal audiences.

- Demonstrates technical leadership and mentoring on the application of

new technologies and system development methodologies.

- Monitors technical and engineering progress to ensure strategies,

goals and objectives are met. Aligns operational plans with business

objectives. Communicates changes to all affected personnel.

- Develops requirements to be used by the vendor community to develop

solutions to meet Company application needs.

- Evaluates various architectural solutions and implementations.

- Establishes and maintains productive relationships with peer

organizations and equipment and software vendors.

- Identifies trends, services and/or capabilities that may be beneficial

to product offerings. Manages and forecasts resource needs to meet

departmental objectives. Recommends action plans or solutions.

- Participates consultatively in the testing and certification process

as needed.

- Ensures effective implementation of the department budget. Prepares

financial statements and monthly forecasts and reports. Prepares and

analyzes monthly financial performance and makes budget and new

technology recommendations. Prepares direct reports.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters

of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work

nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent

- Engineering, Computer Science

- Generally requires 6-9 years related experience

jobs.title: National Data Center Services Engineer II
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.






Major Responsibilities:



- Day to day responsibility of coaching and mentoring other team members on deployment methodology acts as the go to person for technical assistance



- Assists in the risk assessment, quality, and scope management of deployment project plans.



- Responsible for the racking and stacking of equipment within the Data Center.



- Responsible for the operational inventory of all Data Center equipment in Aperture



- Installs, maintains and troubleshoots Data Center cabling and infrastructure.



- Manages Data Center cable running lists, and records of deployed equipment.



- Supervises the maintenance and repair of all facilities systems and hardware.



- Ensure all equipment is labeled in compliance with NDCS standards



- Maintain copper, fiber and power cord inventory



- Monitor security within the data center and raised floor environment



- Interfaces with vendors to maintain, troubleshoot and install related equipment.



- Continued focus on streamlining Methods and Procedure for equipment deployment and implementation.



- Minimal direction required for job duties and high performance



- Knowledge and experience of providing Tier I IT support.



- Some travel required



- Be available to support 24 x 7 shift schedule.



Qualifications/Experience:



- Five plus years of experience in deployment and installation of switches, routers and servers



- Five plus years of experience in High Speed Data, Voice, IP and Data Networking.



- Knowledge of all aspects of power generation and power distribution including facility and cabinet based PDU's, ATS's, and UPS's.



- Diverse knowledge of HVAC dynamics.



- Proven experience to effectively plan project installations and forecast infrastructure growth-including ordering supplies, maintaining inventory control, and documenting processes.



- Basic knowledge of all current types of networking and server hardware.



- Demonstrated experience documenting policies and procedures.



- Proven analytical, problem solving and organizational abilities.



- Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to work with vendors, employees and management.



- Effective leadership skills to resolve conflicts and retain high morale.



- Good personal computer skills.





Demonstrated success in the following core competencies:



- Ability and willingness to adapt and accept change with strong decision-making skills to complete project successfully.



- Strong team working skills; Develop and maintain excellent leadership skills including proactive, customer service oriented working relationships with all appropriate levels inside and outside the company.



- Personal qualities to include integrity, respect for others, personal responsibility, and a passion to approach all aspects of the job with enthusiasm.





Skills Required:



- Solid technical skills relative to HSD and Voice network engineering, planning and management including experience with IP routers, switches and CMTS equipment



- Advanced understanding of the IP protocol suite (e.g. ARP, IP, TCP, DNS, SNMP)



- Strong grasp on server administration (i.e. Unix, Linux and Windows platforms)



- Strong understanding of AC/DC power configurations and HVAC related thermal architecture



- Data Center planning and engineering



- Solid abilities using Microsoft Office



- Proven analytical skills



- Excellent written and oral communication skills



- Generally requires 2-5 years related experience

jobs.title: Manager, Site Reliability Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Job Summary:





We are looking for a leader that shares our passion in innovating and constant improvement. We are always looking for the next challenge to overcome. With this we heavily believe in automating everything possible.



This position is responsible for managing and maintaining a large infrastructure and related applications used for storing Comcast's residential customers email messages. We are in the process of revitalizing the Comcast customer email system. This means new technologies, new challenges, and the opportunity to provide input into the direction for the future.





- Responsible for developing and managing a team of engineers who are focused on Site and Service Reliability. This team is well versed in the application technologies and Platforms used to deliver an excellent email experience for Comcast customers.





- The SRE group is focused on improving the availability and responsiveness of internal and external components and Platforms through the application of engineering best practices, tooling and instrumentation advances and cross organizational coordination. The SRE team helps drive efforts to improve triage time and bring down MTTR (Mean Time to Repair) and provides follow-up support to provide mitigation in the future.





- This individual will manage a team which may include exempt and non-exempt employees. Employees will be a mix of local and remote workers which includes offshore outsourced resources. They will provide subject matter guidance to employees as required and serve as a point of escalation.





- Passionate and driven to improve the customer experience through solving problems which impede reliability, resiliency and responsiveness.





- Develops processes and procedures to drive departmental efficiencies, assist in development, and meeting of departmental budget.





Core Responsibilities:





- Participates in the management of full life cycle product development to include analysis and planning related to product development, launch and deployment. Assist peer product development organizations with launch readiness and post-launch triage and analysis.





- Being proactive, evaluating multiple options and considering our customer's experience is key to our success.





- Drive the adoption and implementation of Operational Best Practices and associated tooling to improve resiliency and reliability. Improve tooling and instrumentation to accelerate triage and remediation.





- Conduct War Game exercises to simulate adverse conditions and situations in a controlled fashion. Collect and communicate learnings and areas of opportunity to advance Operational Stance and Preparedness.





- Effectively manage local and remote employees including offshore resources. Creating a culture of inclusiveness across all locations for direct and dependent teams.





- Document and detail areas of improvement to bolster architecture, design, technical requirements and service specifications. Present architecture, design, and technical choices to internal audiences.





- Demonstrates technical leadership and mentoring on the application of new technologies and systems management methodologies. Can tailor and adapt approach to build consensus and alignment across peer Operational and Engineering Groups.





- Monitors technical and engineering progress to ensure strategies, goals and objectives are met. Aligns operational plans with business objectives. Communicates changes to all affected personnel.





- Presents periodic updates to Senior Management on impairments, mitigation opportunities and progress.





- Evaluates various architectural solutions and implementations and supports development and deployment of solutions as determined by the SRE team.





- Establishes and maintains productive relationships with peer organizations and equipment and software vendors.





- Identifies trends, services and/or capabilities that may be beneficial to product offerings. Manages and forecasts resource needs to meet departmental objectives. Recommends action plans or solutions.





- Participates consultatively in the testing and certification process as needed.





- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.





- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.





- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.





Job Specification:





- Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent



- Engineering, Computer Science



- Generally requires 6-9 years related experience

Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms.
