jobs.title: Technical Lead Software Architect
jobs.content:
We are a software engineering group within HBO that develops and supports applications critical to the creation, marketing, distribution, and reselling of HBO products and are a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and success, with offices in New York City and Los Angeles.
 
Realizing this mission requires a staff of highly motivated and technically flexible software professionals across a variety of disciplines: development, program management, test, and design. We are hiring people to build a team that can create engaging, high-quality solutions, platforms and interactive experiences.
 
We are looking for a Technical Leader with the knowledge, motivation, and energy to help build robust and flexible custom applications as well as implement third-party software packages. Our group supports departments such as Business Affairs, Creative Services, Enterprises, and Program Strategy and Planning. The applications we architect, develop, and support are critical to the creation, marketing, distribution, and reselling of HBO products and are a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and success.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
THE ROLE

Verve is seeking a Sr Full Stack Engineer to help design and build scalable software systems and infrastructure. You will design, test, deploy, maintain, and scale software with a small awesome team, founded as ROXIMITY, now part of Verve.

  • Design and build maintainable software solutions that are supported by automated tests
  • Mentor and collaborate with the team to solve difficult problems
  • Be aware of and help implement sustainable DevOps solutions
  • Apply your skills to; MongoDB, Cassandra, Spark, Clojure, Ruby & Ruby on Rails, and AngularJS
  • Deploy continuously across AWS using Jenkins.

ROXIMITY is the most comprehensive, full-featured location-based analytics and advertising platform in the world, offering technology that enables retailers, brands, and venues to interact with nearby consumers. ROXIMITY offers innovative beacon hardware, a robust SDK, and a full suite of targeted mobile messaging and analytics tools.

THE PERSON

You are excited and energized by a dynamic and fluid start-up environment. You are comfortable on a small team and don’t fear taking charge. You can make wise, strategic decisions despite ambiguity. You can communicate your ideas and understand others well. You focus on great results and getting things done. You produce innovative solutions to problems. You have strong opinions that are held lightly. You are constantly learning and improving. You are known for your candor and directness. You collaborate with others to solve hard problems. You must have a solid understanding of building large software systems and the potential trade-offs involved. You have a desire to learn and to mentor others.

ABOUT VERVE

Verve is a location-based mobile marketing platform that connects advertisers with consumers to deliver successful business outcomes. The company's proprietary location intelligence, patented technology, premium inventory, and analytics capabilities empower marketers to identify, reach and engage consumers with compelling advertising experiences. Headquartered in New York City, Verve has offices in Washington, D.C., Chicago, San Diego, Denver, San Francisco, Los Angeles, London, Eastern Europe, India and Southeast Asia. For more information, visit www.vervemobile.com.

Verve is en equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, creed, ancestry, marital status, non-job-related handicap or disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

jobs.title: Opportunity for Faculty Position
jobs.company: Graduate School of Media Design, Keio University
jobs.content:
The Keio University Graduate School of Media Design, known as Keio Media Design or KMD, invites applications from qualified individuals for a tenure track faculty position. The preferred starting date is February 1, 2017, or as soon as possible thereafter.

KMD is a graduate program which educates creative global leaders who understand the core creative skills of design, technology, management, and policy. Education will take a practical, hands-on, and global approach by offering various projects grounded in practice by collaborating with international partner institutions and research facilities. KMD is planning to expand the current multi-location operation to incorporate transnational education. The formal languages are both English and Japanese, thus we welcome faculty, researchers, and students with English proficiency.

KMD invites collaboration-minded applicants with relevant qualifications, experience, and demonstrated excellence in innovative works combining two or more of the following areas:
・ Design Thinking
・ Experience Design
・ Fashion and Wearable Design
・ Food and Gastronomy
・ Health and Wellness Design
・ Hospitality Design
・ Information Aesthetics
・ Interaction Design
・ Responsive Architecture and Ambient Design
・ Multi-Sensory Design
・ Service Design
・ Singularity and Deep Learning
・ Smart Cities and Enchanted Homes
・ Sports Design
・ Transmedia Cinematography
・ Technology-based Agriculture
・ Cognitive Design

Qualified candidates should have a master’s and preferably a doctoral degree with a proven commitment to quality teaching at the graduate level, or professional equivalence in a related field. The salary is commensurate with experience, according to Keio University guidelines.

The successful candidate will undertake teaching duties, engage in projects (called “Real Projects”), and share some administrative tasks including joining committees and meetings. The successful applicant will be expected to teach theoretical and practical hands-on courses at the graduate level, build and lead a team of graduate students in collaborative projects, and secure corporate partnerships to conduct research that has social and economic impact. Education duties will be conducted mainly in Yokohama, Japan, with some additional teaching and project activities around Japan as well as overseas at international partner locations.

Interested individuals should include the following in their application package:
• Letter of application (please tell us why you are interested in this position, and how you see yourself fitting into the program)
• Curriculum Vitae
• Statement of teaching and/or research philosophy
• 3-5 examples of published works (papers, design works, commercial products/services)
• 3 letters of reference:
Please arrange to have three letters of reference submitted via email directly by the referees by the deadline to kmd-search@adst.keio.ac.jp.
The letter should be sent as a signed PDF file.

Please register your information on our website:
http://www.kmd.keio.ac.jp/en/information/2016/07/openposition.html

Applications should be received by September 22, 2016 to receive full consideration.
All application materials should be sent as PDF files via email to kmd-search@adst.keio.ac.jp.

For the second screening, short listed candidates will be invited to an interview session which can be arranged to be conducted remotely by a video conferencing system such as Polycom or Skype.

For more information about KMD, see http://www.kmd.keio.ac.jp/
Questions should be directed by email to the Search Committee at kmd-search@adst.keio.ac.jp.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Infogroup is looking for top talent to join our fast-paced and innovative team. We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our Papillion office. In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop software solutions to meet customer requirements through team and individual efforts. You will participate in the analysis and composition of requirements, design of architectural and component software features. Additionally, you will be involved in the design and implementation of systems, test plans, and documentation of the final product.


Initial duties may include reviewing code, writing documentation, and following test procedures. Later duties may include having responsibility for production software components and development. You will develop applications written in JavaScript, C++, C#, or Java as well as work with queuing systems, databases and distributed environments. You should be able to adapt to new languages, methodologies, and platforms to meet the needs of the project.

jobs.content:
We are looking for a Software Engineer in Data Science to join our team supporting research and development at a fast-paced agronomic solutions company. Mendel's goal is to be a global leader in delivering targeted, science-driven biological products that improve crop productivity.  As part of the Data Science group, the employee will work closely with Mendel's fermentation, high-throughput screening, chemistry and expression profiling groups.  Responsibilities include a wide range of data-driven programming tasks involving automation, analysis, and interfaces for proprietary and public databases, and data from internal laboratory information systems.  Excellent oral and written communication skills and a demonstrated ethic of documentation are required. 


A Day In The Life Typically Includes:



  • Data analysis: Support and develop server-side software for autonomous data collection, analysis and reporting from sources, such as, laboratory robots and scientific devices

  • Data visualization: Support and develop client-side data-driven web interfaces to data

  • Life cycle management: Interact with chemists, biologists and other scientists to define requirements and formal specifications, quickly build prototypes, and specify deliverable timelines for analysis pipelines and data interfaces 

  • Collaboration: Work cross-functionally within the business and with corporate IT support on small to large projects


If interested, please go to www.kochcareers.com and apply via Job Number 040538. You may also apply via the link below.

We’re building a native mobile app that will be a companion to consumer vehicles that will be on the road in 1-2 years. We’re writing greenfield code, implementing designs created in 2016 that incorporate the latest and greatest features and interactions.


Our teams are small and lean, and every member is encouraged to engage in discussions about application architecture and direction. As a mid-level/senior developer, you will be expected to help facilitate these conversations and guide the team to collectively make final decisions.

This is a full-time salaried role with full medical and dental benefits, 401k matching, monthly team outings, and more.

jobs.title: Senior Oracle Software Engineer
jobs.content:
It is an interesting time to be in enterprise IT. There's the old world and new world. There's the SAN + proprietary database world and there's Cloud + open data formats world. In the new world, you own your data and can process it any way you like, simultaneously. Hadoop with Spark, Storm, Flink, Phoenix, Presto, Hive, Impala or straight MapReduce - you choose. Modern software running in cloud, on commodity hardware, slowly eats the legacy world. However, the old world is not going away - any time soon. We've been around for long enough to know that. Enterprise data continues to be born in many different old world systems, where it will graduate to new world for modern analytics and processing. We connect the old and new worlds. We "glue" them together.


We're looking for Senior Software Developers to join our team. Remote work offered if located in the US and open to travel.

jobs.title: iOS Engineer

As a VTS iOS engineer you’ll be working on all ends of our product, whether it be building out a new backend service to consume or polishing up a UITableView interface to match a mock. We’re always trying new technologies to fit the appropriate situation, and at VTS you'll definitely pick up a few skills you haven’t learned elsewhere.

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Engineer
jobs.content:
Ad Copy THE ROLE

Verve is seeking a self-motivated Sr. Mobile Engineer to join its beacon technology team, founded as ROXIMITY, to help build and improve our mobile offering on Android and iOS platforms. You’ll be involved with all aspects of our mobile scope including our SDKs which power location based messaging to millions of devices worldwide. Key responsibilities:

  • Confidently makes updates to an SDK in use by a great number of applications.
  • Have a deep knowledge of how the ROXIMITY SDK interacts with ROXIMITY Beacons.
  • Answer any and all questions related to an implementation of the ROXIMITY SDK.
  • Digest feedback and comments and determine the code-level actions necessary.
  • Collaborate with the team to solve difficult problems. What you’ll be applying your skills to: Development of Android and iOS SDKs and applications utilizing them. A deep understanding of each platform’s location and bluetooth APIs. Handling and understanding of the interactions between ROXIMITY Beacons and mobile devices. An automated build process that can release to development, beta, and production.

ROXIMITY is the most comprehensive, full-featured location-based analytics and advertising platform in the world, offering technology that enables retailers, brands, and venues to interact with nearby consumers. ROXIMITY offers innovative beacon hardware, a robust SDK, and a full suite of targeted mobile messaging and analytics tools.

THE PERSON

You are excited and energized by a dynamic and fluid start-up environment. You are comfortable on a small team and don’t fear taking charge. You can make wise, strategic decisions despite ambiguity. You can communicate your ideas and understand others well. You focus on great results and getting things done. You produce innovative solutions to problems. You have strong opinions that are held lightly. You are constantly learning and improving. You are known for your candor and directness. You collaborate with others to solve hard problems. You must have a solid understanding of end-to-end mobile development, from Storyboards to memory analysis. You’re concerned with performance, responsiveness, and battery efficiency.

ABOUT VERVE

Verve is a location-based mobile marketing platform that connects advertisers with consumers to deliver successful business outcomes. The company's proprietary location intelligence, patented technology, premium inventory, and analytics capabilities empower marketers to identify, reach and engage consumers with compelling advertising experiences. Headquartered in New York City, Verve has offices in Washington, D.C., Chicago, San Diego, Denver, San Francisco, Los Angeles, London, Eastern Europe, India and Southeast Asia. For more information, visit www.vervemobile.com.

Verve is en equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, creed, ancestry, marital status, non-job-related handicap or disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

jobs.title: Podcast-loving product managers, come shape the future of audio
jobs.content:
Slate Magazine helped pioneer podcasting back in 2005, but in the last 10 years, the technology powering on-demand audio has barely changed. 


But it’s about to.


In 2015, Slate launched Panoply, which brings millions of listeners the smartest conversations that podcasting has to offer through 50 shows from the New York Magazine, Wall Street Journal, Vox, Vulture, Gretchen Rubin, Tablet, Vanity Fair, Sports Illustrated and many more. 


Panoply is a tight knit group of some of the smartest engineers, producers, entrepreneurs and thinkers, and today we’re looking for a brilliant Product Manager to help us chart the future of podcasting. 


Working at Panoply means flexible office hours, casual dress, full benefits, competitive salaries, an office 20 steps from the Farragut North metro exit in Washington, DC, team happy hours, and working alongside our colleagues at Slate. We have a friendly work environment, but coolness under pressure, and comfort with short time horizons is a must. 


Responsibilities



  • Lead a cross-functional team of world-class engineers, designers, and podcast creators to conceptualize and build innovative best-in-class digital audio products.

  • Work closely with the Director of Product to shape the product roadmap and overall strategic direction with an eye towards maximizing customer acquisition, advertising revenue, and partner satisfaction.

  • Stay abreast of all changes in the rapidly evolving digital audio market, from new advertising formats to in-home audio APIs to app store requirements, share that learning across the organization, and adjust product strategy accordingly.

  • Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of new and existing products.

  • Integrate usability studies, market research and analysis, and customer feedback into product requirements.

  • Conduct testing to understand how potential UX modifications will influence core business metrics before deploying them broadly.

  • Proactively engage with stakeholders, including the editorial team and external content partners, the sales team, the Panoply executive team, and others throughout the organization, communicating with them on product cycles and strategic priorities.

  • Deliver products on time and on budget, working with a 7-person development team dedicated to audio.

  • Lead projects in a transparent and productive way, applying standard project management practices.

jobs.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
OpenCar, recently acquired by INRIX, is powering the next generation of connected cars with unique, easy-to-use applications designed specifically to use behind the wheel. INRIX is the global leader in connected car services and intelligent movement, a new approach that leverages big data and the cloud to help manage urban mobility.


Our partners are automakers, governments, mobile operators, developers, advertisers, as well as enterprises large and small. We are literally everywhere with over 450 customers across 60 countries. INRIX has offices around the globe.


We’re looking for an experienced advanced C++ developer to join our team in Seattle. You will be part of a growing team building In-Vehicle Infotainment (IVI)integrations to support our JavaScript framework for in-car services and APIs used by automotive applications.


In this position, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with OEMs on integrating the INRIX/OpenCar framework to their key IVI features across operating systems and technologies through common interfaces and specifications.


Who we are looking for: 



  • You are an experienced embedded software engineer working with automotive IVI systems and devices from BSP to middleware to application layer, or similar from other industry.

  • You are fluent in C/C++, adept with Linux and Make / Autotools, debuggers, toolchains, and profiling tools.

  • You are proficient with board bring-up from one or more silicon vendors.

  • You are familiar with optimizing embedded systems.

  • You thrive on writing the adapter logic that ties functionality across API boundaries to match requirements.

  • You understand and are comfortable working with threads, sockets, services, and IPC.

  • You’ve delivered products in an iterative, agile software lifecycle

  • You have experience adapting existing functionality to meet service interface requirements.

  • You are collaborative, have a strong work ethic, are reliable and a self-starter.

  • You have a Bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science or related discipline/


Extra bonus points if you:



  • Are familiar with Yocto.

  • Are familiar with Wayland and window management

  • Are familiar with GENIVI.

  • Are quite adept at JavaScript and have worked on significantly JavaScript-based projects. (Our platform is an HTML5 application platform.  Embedded engineers, do not let this deter you from applying).

  • Have background or knowledge with integrating an HTML5 runtime engine.

  • Have worked with automotive applications or stacks.

  • Have experience in QNX (for integrations).

  • Have experience in Windows and Mac (for SDK).


What you’re looking for:



  • A chance to work in a dynamic environment, learn new technologies and hone skills

  • Solve complex problems to develop software which delivers direct value to our customers

  • Ability to work at multiple levels in the technical stack and not get pigeonholed.

  • Ability to lead teams of external engineers working with automotive OEMs and tier-1 suppliers.

  • Be part of a team where fun, smart, passionate, ambitious engineers work together to build great systems

  • A fast–growing, global company where you’ll be challenged to think about things that no one has thought of yet

  • A position where you’re a critical voice in development


Are you ready to join a different kind of company? Exciting things are happening all the time. 


Come join us!

jobs.title: Senior Experience Designer, Lead
jobs.content:
Job Description: Senior Experience Designer, Lead-43404

Our company
At Adobe, we’re changing the world. How? We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We're the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and we’re the ones who harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight and insight to action by delivering content that people crave most.

We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders throughout the organization.
If you’re passionate about leading from where you sit, join us.

The challenge
XD Studio is an internal incubator within Adobe’s Experience Design (XD) organization that employs an experience-first mindset coupled with a highly iterative, rapid prototyping process to develop new products and services. As a cross-disciplinary team of designers, developers, and product managers, we believe in examining and evaluating ideas through the respective lenses of design, engineering, and business. Currently, we are looking for someone to represent and champion the design perspective of this trifecta.

As a qualified candidate, you will have played a crucial and leading role in designing, delivering, and launching products. Bringing a high level of creative energy and strong design intuition to the team, you challenge teammates to think big and push beyond the obvious or first idea. You operate as a natural visionary, following technical and design trends in the industry and contributing strong ideas on how to influence or capitalize on the potential of those trends. You are both opinionated and a compassionate listener, willing to dive deep to understand a problem before jumping to conclusions and knowing how to ask the right questions. And, you define personal success as making a meaningful and unique contribution to the team’s success.

We are a team that is:
• Tasked with finding new growth opportunities for Adobe, often looking beyond the boundaries of the existing business.
• Passionate about tool making, and respectful of the responsibility that this practice entails.
• Constantly striving to help users create something that they would not have otherwise created.

What you’ll do:
• Lead a team of talented designers
• Seeding ideas and asking the questions that will help teammates iterate towards the best solution for their particular problem domain.
• Providing guidance on how to effectively prioritize design efforts.
• Giving insightful and actionable feedback.
• Facilitating moving past obstacles, disagreements, and tough choices encountered during the design process.
• Network and evangelize for the team within the company, seeking opportunities for collaboration with research, product, and other design teams.
• Provide mentorship to younger designers,
i.e. giving sound guidance on design career development, connect teammates with other design professionals to provide career insight, and serve as a strong example of where they might be in the future.

What you’ll need to succeed:
• Experience, appreciation, and passion for building tools and the services that support them.
• Ability to make progress in the midst of uncertainty, i.e. you know how to tackle discovering and answering unknowns through design thinking, research, and talking with the right people.
• Ability and willingness to design for users, products, and industries that may be unfamiliar.
• Work within business, organizational, and resource constraints.
• Negotiate situations where design intuition conflicts with user research.
• Knowledge of how to take the first step, coming up with a big idea as well as the first, most important experience to build.

Qualifications:
• 10+ years of design experience in software UX.
• Significant mentorship and design leadership experience, either acting as design team lead or design manager.
• Experience with and appreciation for building interactive prototypes, either using code or visual prototyping tools.
• Experience using Adobe's existing product ecosystem, with emphasis on core design tools (Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, InDesign, etc.)

Bonus:
• Experience with digital marketing tools, understanding both digital marketing and analytics problem domains.
• Experience in design for massively-multi touch user interfaces, spatial gesture interfaces, voice, virtual reality, augmented reality, and other "non-standard" interface modalities.


Making our technology accessible to all

We believe everyone should have equal access to technology and its benefits. To help achieve this, Adobe is focused on making software more accessible for everyone.

When we hire for engineering, development and design roles, we look for the following accessibility skills:
• Base knowledge of the W3C’s Web Content Accessibility Guidelines v2.0
• Exposure to current tools used by people with disabilities (screen readers and other assistive technologies)
• Experience with accessibility evaluation and validation software
• Understanding of input and output modes used by people with disabilities
• Familiarity with compliance requirements - state, Federal, international

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to grow your career, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences through the Adobe Life magazine.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer Needed
jobs.content:
We have an opportunity for an Senior Full Stack Developer with top-shelf skills to join our tight and talented team in Toronto (no remote—sorry). You’ll be collaborating closely with strategy, design, and helping to lead engineering teams. You'll be working with our amazing client teams and creating exceptional, responsive, digital experiences.


You should be equally comfortable with big picture thinking and the fine details of deployment. You know what it means to be part of a team and you’ve never started a sentence with “it’s not my job…”


You’re a great communicator and you know that communication also means the other part — listening. You’re good at that too. You know that you may not have the full answer but as a leader, you know that you can rely on your teammates to get everyone across line. You know that feedback isn’t an insult but a way to build upon ideas and make things better. You embrace the constant of change and are flexible and open-minded.


You've managed and maintained server architecture as well as cloud VMs. You've managed servers with WHM/Cpanel or nothing at all. You're comfortable managing DNS — basically, you manage all aspects of the dev process, inclusive of architecture. 


We believe in making work an experience and will fund professional education and development, foster your passions outside of work, help you be a better human when you leave than when you walked in.

jobs.title: AngularJS Developer

  • Interacting with REST APIs, both internally built and 3rd-party

  • Adding dynamic functionality to HTML/CSS markup created by the rest of our team

  • Working with our other frontend developers for site front-end build-out

  • Crafting clean, quality, well-documented code to ensure long-term maintainability

  • Communicating with product owners to understand their vision, and our technical leads to advise on technical feasibility and recommend implementation strategies


 Required skills:



  • Strong knowledge of modern frontend technologies, best practices, and load speed optimization techniques

  • Advanced experience with JavaScript frameworks, specifically AngularJS

  • Expertise working as part of a team developing and delivering web applications

  • Ability to work with and coordinate other developers

  • Experience with version control tools, such as Git

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English


Benefits



  • Flexible hours and paid vacation policy

  • Free meals and snacks availalbe all day, every day

  • Health, Dental, and Vision insurance

  • Retirement plan with company matching

  • Perks and discounts from many stores and services-- cell phone bills, hotels, rental cars, gyms, etc...


Join Us!


If you’re interested please apply immediately, attention Ben Smith. Examples of your real-world work are more important than a perfect resume. If you’ve worked on a project with a team, please provide examples including an explanation of the parts you were responsible for.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - Ecosystem Open Source
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Contentful (https://www.contentful.com) is a content management developer platform that enables web and mobile developers to manage, integrate, and deliver digital content to any kind of device or service that can connect to an API - be it smart cars, VR, mobile, web, digital signage, or any new platform. We solve the complexities of content management for tens of thousands web and mobile developers, some independent and many working at enterprise customers that include Jack-in-the-box, Petsmart, Specialized, Fidelity Investments, and Urban Outfitters.

We're a fun team of more than 60 people from 28 nations with offices in Berlin and San Francisco, backed by top VCs (Benchmark, Trinity, Balderton, Point Nine), growing at an amazing pace, and looking for more amazing individuals to join our team!

ABOUT THE ROLE

At Contentful engineering is responsible for developing, running and maintaining the software that builds our highly available and scalable platform. Our engineering team grew to more than 30 people last year. We are now looking for an experienced engineering manager to work with our CTO on leading this fast-growing team.

As an Engineering Manager at Contentful, you are responsible for building and maintaining a healthy team, driving improvement of our development processes, and ensuring consistent delivery of high quality software that adds value for our customers.

You’ll collaborate regularly with engineers to gather feedback on topics ranging from project progress, technology choices, internal processes, career development, mentoring, and general happiness.

You’re already an engineering manager or you’re a development team lead ready to make a jump into management. You enjoy the idea of working in a developer-centric company where engineering is central and not only a support function. Catch this opportunity of taking care of the team who builds the material publicly available at https://github.com/contentful

REQUIREMENTS

  • You either already managed a team involved in developing Open Source SDK and libraries or you’ve been involved in similar projects as a developer previously in your career.
  • You already worked in an environment revolving around a publicly available API.
  • You know how to recruit and hire engineering talent and facilitate onboarding of new team members.
  • Provide technical and non-technical guidance to the team, both individually and as a group.
  • Experience in troubleshooting the software delivery process and continuously streamlining it.
  • You’re used to working with engineering teams to identify and anticipate changing requirements and opportunities to improve the development environment.
  • Proven experience managing or leading technical teams, setting goals and crafting plans to achieve them.
  • Solid, battle tested engineering background that allows you to establish credibility with brilliant engineers quickly.
  • You are used to collaborate with other functions of the company like product, support and marketing.
  • You are a strong communicator and you’re great in teasing out complex, conflictual situations bringing clarity when confusion and ambiguity creep in.

BENEFITS

  • Be in a fast-paced environment in a company that’s growing quickly. Garner responsibility and make a significant impact, instead of being just another cog in a machine.
  • Join a rapidly growing developer-centric company with lots of amazing international customers. We count people like Adam Wiggins (Heroku) and Francesco Cesarini (Erlang Solutions) as our advisors.
  • We have plenty of interesting engineering challenges, ranging from scale factors, global cache invalidation to multi tenant “bring your own schema” data. Use a diverse set of modern technologies, stay updated on best practices and help to create an effective and pragmatic organization.
  • Be part of a team of experts in a company where technology matters and is key.
  • We offer education budget and extra days off to be spent on your self-development.
  • Pick any tools you feel comfortable with. From hardware, to software, to your work environment, we've literally got your back.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of time and place of your work.
  • Brush up your language skills! Our team speaks more than 20 languages.
  • We fully support your move to Berlin with a relocation budget. We also get your back in terms of settling down in a new city.

jobs.title: Sr. DevOps Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
This role is highly versatile and a mix of self-directed work along with enabling the plans the team has with the application stack. The current roadmap involves continued decoupling - breaking our larger apps up into smaller independent services. You'll be responsible for supporting those efforts and leading the charge on all things infrastructure.


What We Care About:



  • Autonomy. The ability to make, own, and carry out decisions. The ability to determine what processes and best practices are most conducive to productivity, transparency, and coordination.

  • Building scalable and flexible systems to cater to continuous business improvement and growth

  • Writing clean and maintainable code with complete unit & integration tests when possible

  • Setting realistic estimations and meeting deadlines

  • Following up after deployments & analyzing system metrics to ensure that the systems work as intended

  • Collaboration and effective communication

  • Having a no-ego, humble team

  • Automation - we are looking for leverage

  • Influencing outcomes. Thinking big. Being paranoid. Speaking UP.


What You Will Be Responsible For:



  • Building out & managing our chef driven infrastructure on AWS

  • Evaluate, plan and rollout a more standardized build ecosystem (for example - the Hashicorp ecosystem)

  • Configuring and deploying Services including Redis, RabbitMQ for high availability

  • Managing and analyzing the different performance and availability monitoring that is in place (Nagios, ELK/Sumo/Splunk, Newrelic, PagerDuty)

  • Defining a proper monitoring, alerting and escalation plan for quickly resolving problems

  • Implementing compliance and security monitoring and reporting

  • Helping to plan and build out a standardized development environment for our engineering team

  • Working closely with the entire engineering team to develop infrastructure requirements for projects

  • Planning ways to help the engineering team automate where possible to improve productivity

  • Managing the relationship and projects with our current infrastructure management service provider


What We Offer:



  • The opportunity to make a massive impact on a team of passionate engineers

  • The opportunity to influence outcomes for an emerging company

  • Competitive salary, equity and full benefits (health/dental/vision insurance & 401k)

  • Work from home Tuesdays and Thursdays (what we call Maker Days)

  • Fresh pressed juices every morning, full-stocked fridge + snacks

  • Office located at Sansome & Bush in downtown San Francisco

jobs.title: Sr. Web Developer
jobs.content:
As a member of the Information Technology Development Team, a Senior Web Developer designs, develops, tests, implements, and maintains proprietary web based user interfaces for Empyrean and our clients. They are responsible for troubleshooting systems problems and issues and identifying ways to improve existing or developed applications.


To fulfill this role, the web developer will:



  • Create reusable and modular components using modern JavaScript frameworks (Aurelia, React, AngularJS).

  • Communicate to backend services (Orleans, OWIN, Service Stack) using Falcor and REST APIs.

  • Leverage functional programming to keep component state manageable.

  • Utilize PostCSS to compose reusable CSS styles.

  • Transition a legacy MVC application to a modern, single-page application (greenfield project).

  • Write unit and end-to-end tests based on system requirements.

  • Work within an agile development team working in sprints with deliverables and demonstration of results.

  • Participate in design meetings in order to create logical and innovative solutions to complex problems.

  • Design, develop, test, implement, and maintain client/user-facing self service tools for activities such as benefit elections, manage life events, beneficiary changes, etc.

  • Understand expectations that were set with product owner and recognize when issues/events may affect delivery.

  • Work closely with a variety stakeholders to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction.

  • Ensure that there is proper documentation of standard procedures.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer - $60k
jobs.content:
Full Stack Developer - $60k


Are you an experienced Full Stack developer with a mastery of Javascript? Are you looking for a position in a fast-paced, high-achieving software start-up where you can work with the best and brightest to create web based real-time geographical systems? If so, this could be the perfect role for you.


Job Description:


As a Full Stack Developer with Dispatchr you will work both collaboratively and independently on different aspects of your projects. Your primary responsibilities will include creating a real-time, web-based geographical system using Node .js, MongoDB, and Meteor as well as a mobile system based on React Native and Java. You will be responsible for maintaining and scaling these systems as well as continually improving their performance. You will be a major contributor on an exciting and hard-working team of engineers who are developing technology that enables reliably energy delivery to millions of people. .


Company Description:


Dispatchr is building the worlds most sophisticated fleet management software using the power of predictive analytics and mobile technology. With barely a year of operation, we have already secured contracts with the nations largest utility providers. Dispatchr is backed by some of Silicon Valleys top venture firms and run by visionary computer scientists and entrepreneurs.


Dispatchr offers a lively, fun, and engaging work environment, compelling and challenging problems and great compensation. At Dispatchr you have the ability to make a real difference; safeguarding millions who depend on the safe, reliable delivery of energy.


Crossover is partnering with Dispatchr to recruit, hire, and manage top talent.



Key Responsibilities:


  • Build and maintain a mobile system based on React Native and Java

  • Use Node .js, MongoDB, and Meteor to create a web-based, real-time geographical system

  • Research algorithms that can pull and post large data sets in a short time

  • Collaborate with the team to create a fast and scalable system

  • Maintain the mobile and web based systems daily

  • Take responsibility of design meetings, coding sessions, and deployment

  • Institute the core architecture necessary to deliver features, scalability, and performance.


Required Skills and Experience:


  • 6+ years of experience in Javascript

  • 3+ years in Node .js

  • 1-2 years of Java experience

  • Working knowledge or use of Python, ESRI, relational databases, version control (git preferred), and AWS (Windows and especially Linux)


It would be nice if you have:

  • Knowledge of MongoDB, Meteor, and React Native

  • Experience with Agile Development (SCRUM, KANBAN)

  • Angular JS

  • Great communication skills that will enable you to collaborate with the rest of the team


40 hrs/week

Compensation: $30/hr

Location: Global (remote)


Were one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.


To qualify, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online skills examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time - so we thank you in advance for your efforts.


Are you up for the challenge?

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer  C#/.Net
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance.  You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment via website architecture built on a cloud infrastructure. 


Come be a part of our exciting fast paced team, proud of building the solutions that drive our websites seen by millions of Crate and Barrel customers.


Job Description:



  • Design, develop, and implement solutions using C#, ASP.NET (MVC and WebForms), and Javascript Frameworks as your tools and Visual Studio 2015 as your environment.

  • Conceive and build unit testable solutions for our website applications.

  • Participate in technical design meetings with other developers and assist in defining the system architecture and choosing technologies.

  • Work on a cross-disciplinary Agile team to develop, estimate, test, and maintain our websites, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective.

  • Work directly with business stakeholders to understand requirements and communicate progress.

  • Be an active contributor to back-end development practices and code reviews.

  • Update and maintain site documentation.

  • Communicate effectively and efficiently with all associates and business contacts and promote a strong sense of teamwork.


Requirements:



  • You have been building websites for 5+ years with C#, ASP.NET, MVC with a preferred focus on e-commerce solutions.

  • Possess 5+ years experience with relational databases like SQLServer, NoSQL experience a plus.

  • You have strong communication skills and experience working with business stakeholders and web designers.

  • You can work with jQuery right away. You have some experience and knowledge of another script framework (e.g. AngularJS, node.js).

  • Real world problem solving and technology excites you.

  • Experience working in a web environment such as IIS administration.

  • You have worked in an Agile environment.

  • You can write unit tests and testable code.

  • Ability to work efficiently and meet project deadlines with minimal supervision.

  • Ability to analyze business problems and provide accurate development estimates

  • Experience in domain-driven development and cloud technologies is a plus.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or comparable work experience.

  • You have good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).      


For immediate consideration please apply on-line at http://crateandbarrelcareers.silkroad.com/.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Front End Developer to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture. This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Front End Developer, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance. You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.



  • Design, develop, and implement solutions using HTML, CSS, and Javascript as your tools and ASP.NET (MVC) as your environment.

  • Conceive and build responsive and adaptive solutions for website applications.

  • Work on an Agile team to develop, test, deploy, and maintain, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective.

  • Participate in technical design meetings with other developers and assist in definition of front end web architecture.

  • Work with product team and stakeholders to understand and communicate progress.

  • Update, maintain and adhere to pattern-libraries, styleguides, and site documentation.

  • Be an active contributor to front-end development best practices.


Requirements: 



  • You have been building websites using HTML/CSS/Javascript for 5+ years, and you can show it.

  • You can communicate to people in product management, design, user experience, and QA, and they will understand you.

  • You have excellent knowledge of CSS and Javascript coding best practices.

  • You can build responsive, cross-browser, highly-performant, and accessible applications.

  • You can work with jQuery right away. You have some experience and knowledge of another script framework (e.g. AngularJS, node.js).

  • You have worked with Twitter Bootstrap or Foundation or the like. You know about CSS preprocessors (LESS or SASS).

  • Maybe you’ve worked with C#, ASP.NET MVC, the .NET Framework, and VisualStudio.

  • You have basic knowledge of SQL language.

  • Bachelor’s degreein Computer Science, Graphic Design, or Visual Communication desired but not required.

  • You have good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).

jobs.title: Machine Learning Data Scientist
jobs.content:
The Role


As part of the early engineering team, you’ll be instrumental in developing our artificially intelligent user experience and matching algorithms. You will integrate data from web sources, real-time adaptive questioning, and human-intelligence, to develop algorithms that create smart relationships across a variety of organizational entities.


Culture is important to us, so you should be highly collaborative and confident, yet humble and empathetic.

jobs.title: Software Release Engineer
jobs.content:
Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc. is a Systems Software Engineering company that has been creating software products of our own design for thirty-five years!

As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Software Release Engineer who is excited to learn and work with the latest software technologies and who enjoys the Software Engineering process using Agile/SCRUM methodologies.

The successful Software Release Engineer candidate would work on our flagship product, ActiveBatch®, a best-in-class Cross-Platform Enterprise Workload Automation and Job Scheduling system geared for high performance with customers running over 1 Million jobs per day. With over 1500 customers in over 46 countries and the strong demand for our products and services, the Software Release Engineer will help us to continue achieving our goals of producing the highest quality software using the most efficient processes.

Relationship and Roles:

Will be responsible for testing the implementation of Systems Software products on Microsoft Windows and UNIX platforms. Must be able to work independently as well as within a group.
Must show attention to detail, positive attitude, the ability to learn and be challenged, and take pride in quality and timeliness
Requirements:

Must have experience with Team Foundation Server. Must have experience with Microsoft Visual Studio 201x (or equivalent version). Must be knowledgeable in Powershell and/or Shell scripting. Must be very knowledgeable in latest .Net Framework (or later version) and C#. Job Specifications:

BS/MS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering (or equivalent work experience). Minimum requirements include 2 to 5 years engineering experience

Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc is an EEO Employer No VISA Sponsorships - Must be U.S. citizen or Permanent Resident

jobs.title: Senior .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Senior .NET Developer (Boston, MA)

jobs.title: Data Architect
jobs.content:
The Twilio Architecture team is responsible for the architecture of Twilio’s platform. The Data Architect will be a core member of the team focusing on designing data topologies and pipelines for handling and storing the immense amount of data we capture every day.


About the job:


As an experienced software engineer, you will be developing the architecture that will be instrumental in operating globally available, resilient and highly performant services used by hundreds of thousands of developers and apps.

Successful candidates will be strong developers with deep experience in data modeling, data storage and Business Intelligence systems.


Responsibilities:



  • Drive the technologies and policies needed to store, manage and interact with Twilio's data.

  • Work with the engineering teams to help choose technologies, design system architecture and model data in a scalable and efficient way.

  • Develop proof of concepts, shared libraries and services that will be used across the product engineering organization.

  • Coordinate with Sales Operations, Marketing and Finance to help understand their data needs and how disparate systems will integrate.

  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems in distributed computing, data persistence, and more.

jobs.title: Back-end Developer
jobs.content:
Are you an experienced Back-end server and database technologist who is looking to apply your knowledge and skills to make a positive impact in people’s lives and society? Have you been searching to join a small fast paced team where you can make a difference? Do you enjoy working in a creative environment where we are creating innovative ways to share knowledge and help people make better and more educated decisions?

If so, VoteCircle wants you! VoteCircle is a hot, growing US startup based in Silicon Valley that is trying to make a difference in the world. We are looking for a Spring developer who is responsible for key server-side features in our evolving service. Your primary focus will be to design Cassandra data models and surface them through server APIs that power our web and mobile apps. You will work closely with the engineering, design, and product management teams to take functional requirements through the design and implementation process. While you are not directly responsible for the design or the front-end client applications, you will need to understand the feature and components from front to back.

Responsibilities

  • Deliver complete back end features from the database level to the server API
  • Deliver tested and documented RESTful API’s
  • Integrate external services and packages to build out a complete solution
  • Work closely with the design and product management teams
  • Join our team to do something different and make a difference in our society and the world!

Main requirements

  • Proficiency with Java, J2EE, and UNIX/Linux
  • Experience delivering and maintaining Spring-based applications in a production environment
  • Strong knowledge and working experience in distributed database technologies like Cassandra
  • Experience interfacing with external services, such as Amazon CloudSearch is preferred
  • Commitment to developing reusable and testable components
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Commitment to teamwork and respectful communication

Nice to have

  • Interest in politics, campaigns, and the election process is a major plus

jobs.title: Senior UX/UI Designer
jobs.content:
We are Ludopoli, an international design & development firm based in Zürich. Founded in 2008, we have worked on projects for some of the world’s most recognisable brands.

We build products for web, tablets, and mobile devices and specialise in content publishing and content tracking solutions for the media, as well as data visualisation and UX/UI design. Our products include Flowli, a powerful and innovative API-based publishing system.

We are looking for a Senior UX/UI Designer to complement our distributed team. You will play a crucial role between product owners and our development team and will be working on an exciting range of products and services for our clients, as well as our publishing system Flowli.

Please note that this position will start as a 6 months contract as a remote worker, which might then, if successful, be extended to a full-time position.

Main requirements

  • You have experience designing for web and mobile and understand the challenges of responsive design or a mobile-first approach
  • Product design experience (web or mobile) is a big plus
  • You are comfortable with production and prototyping tools such as Illustrator, Sketch, Balsamiq, InVision, or Flinto (if you have your own efficient toolset, that’s fine, too)
  • You are hands-on, self-motivated, and love finding creative solutions for complex problems
  • You are a pro-active communicator and are able to effectively present and explain your work and design decisions
  • You have a love for detail and have a solid knowledge of design fundamentals such as composition, hierarchy and typography
  • You are passionate about user-centred interaction design and regularly read and listen to the leading UX/UI blogs and podcasts
  • You have an excellent understanding of the entire interaction design workflow, including personas, user stories, information architecture, flows, wireframes, design style guides, final production assets, and documentation for developers
  • You are fluent in both written and spoken English

Nice to have

  • Ideally, you should have a good understanding of the possibilities and limits of frontend technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Actual coding abilities are a plus
  • UX & UI portfolio

Perks

  • A highly competitive pay package
  • The freedom to work from anywhere you choose (we don't have a permanent office)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Giving you creative ownership of an exciting range of projects and clients
  • Working with and learning from a super friendly, highly motivated and skilled international team

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Are you a passionate, highly skilled full stack developer looking to work for a profitable startup in DTLA? Do you solve problems that no one else can?

We are looking for a Full Stack Developer to bring his or her extensive experience in software development to lead our growing engineering team. The right candidate is someone with technical chops as well as strong communication and leadership skills. Among other things, you'll have autonomy to architect and implement a real-time analytics tracking platform to help us unlock key insights about our customers' behavior.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

  • Oversee the construction and maintenance of our real-time analytics tracking platform.
  • Manage the workflow of the engineering team and work with stakeholders to establish project priorities and timelines.
  • Lead the development of our mobile sites and app.
  • Help automate and streamline our operations and processes.
  • Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, test and production environments.
  • Increase productivity and efficiency within our engineering team.

Benefits


  • Health insurance
  • Catered lunch everyday
  • Snacks/drinks available throughout the day
  • Paid vacation, sick days and holidays

jobs.title: Python Developer
jobs.content:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in time zones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious front-end developers who would love an opportunity to learn more and become full-stack developers. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

What skills are we looking for?

As a developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. Besides Python, you will also be given training on front-end languages and frameworks (such as AngularJS) allowing you to become a full-stack developer. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

Main requirements

  • Strong background in benchmarking, optimization, scaling and dealing with high levels of traffic
  • Experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Python
  • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium
  • Familiarity with distributed revision control systems such as Mercurial or Git
  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity

Nice to have

  • Experience with any of the following - jQuery, AngularJS, PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, Lua, Linux, Nginx, Elasticsearch, and Amazon Web Services

Perks

  • Remote & flexible
  • Prestigious clients
  • Kindle + Personal development budget
  • Personal Home office budget
  • Make a difference
  • Only the best hardware and software
  • Work with a very talented team

jobs.content:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in time zones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious front-end developers who would love an opportunity to learn more and become full-stack developers. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

What skills are we looking for?

As a developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. Besides JavaScript, you will also be given training on back-end languages (primarily Python) allowing you to become a full-stack developer.   • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium

jobs.title: Lead React.js Front-end Developer
jobs.company: React Js Front End In The Window
jobs.content:
In The Window™ is the social platform for design storytelling and curation. We were founded on the belief that the stories of great design need to be told.

Through an exceptionally immersive user experience, In The Window enables designers, makers, and brands to deeply engage a global community of design lovers with stories and curations. In The Window’s community can discover, experience, curate, and share the content.

We use React.js and React Native primarily, in addition to Node.js on the back-end.

We’re looking for a solid full-stack developer, with a love for developing breakthrough rich front-ends, to drive development, with a focus on the front-end. This is an influential role that will drive one of the most ambitious user experiences in social!

We have a fast-growing international community of high-caliber designers, in the areas of object and space design. The strong market validation that we're experiencing is quite thrilling.

Note: candidates from the EU will be highly preferred due to time zone reasons

Main requirements

  • Solid full-stack object-oriented coder, with love for the front-end
  • Strict about elegant, maintainable, scalable code. Rigorous on quality & testing
  • Strong in JavaScript
  • Familiar with React
  • Have a portfolio of awesome web products you’ve led/coded, on desktop or mobile
  • Super motivated to build awesome, delightful user experiences
  • Work fast. Positive energy
  • Have a university degree in Computer Science or proven expertise

Perks

  • Flexible schedule

jobs.title: Full-Stack Python Developer
jobs.content:
Hotjar is a rapidly growing startup that is giving thousands of website owners the tools needed to discover how their visitors are really using their website. We are looking for passionate and ambitious full-stack developers who can help us shape the product and company whilst growing with us.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by 99,671 companies worldwide. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

What skills are we looking for?

As a full-stack developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript and Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

Main requirements

  • Experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS and Python
  • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium
