jobs.title: Software Development Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
At Workiva, we create best-in-class, next-generation collaborative solutions for enterprise productivity. We pride ourselves on bringing the consumer level user experience to business users. We love our customers, and they love us back. We hire smart, talented people with a wide range of skills who are excited to solve some of today’s most challenging problems. Workiva started with an idea, to make complex collaboration easy. Wdesk is an all in one platform that simplifies complex collaboration while keeping data in sync, thus reducing risk. Wdesk is used by thousands of companies globally and we boast a 96% customer satisfaction rating.

As a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET), you'll build and utilize cutting-edge testing tools with agile processes to plan and conduct all aspects of testing our software products. SDETs are the predominant contributor for instilling a culture of quality within their team(s). You'll be a member of an agile development team using a number of test frameworks and methodologies to ensure that we provide the best possible experience to our customers through quality driven products and efficient delivery cycles.


What You'll Do:




  • Understand the purpose of the product and the customer’s workflow, advocating for quality practices that put the customer’s needs first

  • Contribute positively to the company and our culture

  • Collaborate closely with product teams and stakeholders to correctly identify issues

  • Involvement in planning, grooming, and designing discussions to ensure testable, quality products are built and necessary testing frameworks are identified

  • Understand and assist in defining acceptance criteria, and utilize that information to write test requirements. Apply that research and knowledge in the development and implementation of test plans.

  • Utilize analytics, telemetry, and other data to drive an understanding of our users

  • Create, review, and maintain robust automated testing using Dart, Python, Go, and/or Java

  • Engineer tests to verify and validate performance and scale

  • Understand and teach the appropriate application and execution of exploratory testing

  • Identify successful patterns for producing quality software from communication to release

  • Educate your team to understand the most effective & efficient ways to test the product and how to use the tools that have been implemented.

  • Break things so we know how to improve them

jobs.title: Full Stack Python Developer
jobs.content:
Hotjar is a rapidly growing startup that is giving thousands of website owners the tools needed to discover how their visitors are really using their website. We are looking for passionate and ambitious full-stack developers who can help us shape the product and company whilst growing with us.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by 99,671 companies worldwide. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

What skills are we looking for?

As a full-stack developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript and Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

Main requirements

Strong background in benchmarking, optimization, scaling and dealing with high traffic
Experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS and Python
Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium
Familiarity with distributed revision control systems such as Mercurial or GitHub
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity

Nice to have

jQuery
PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, Elasticsearch
Lua, Linux, Nginx
Amazon Web Services (AWS)

Perks

Remote & flexible
Prestigious clients
Kindle + Personal development budget
Personal Home office budget
Make a difference
Only the best hardware and software
Work with a very talented team

jobs.title: Confidently Humble Visual Designer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Salt Lake City, UT
URL: https://www.youneedabudget.com/

YNAB makes friendly, humane, high quality software that changes lives through effective budgeting. We’ve got an ecosystem of apps, live classes, and stellar support. Now we need a visual designer to bring the same attention to detail to our branding, marketing, and educational materials.

You come to the table with some experience under your belt. You know how to create, expand, and maintain meticulous brand guidelines. You catch color mismatches that are mere shades off, you bristle at poor kerning, you know that good design is in the details. That said, you love to dream and get that our dream is to build a brand that is fun, smart, and approachable. Bonus points if you can illustrate, animate, or film as well.

Requirements (these are real, actual requirements):
  • You must have at least two years of experience working in marketing design, interactive design, or UI design.
  • Experience working with strict, existing brand guidelines.
  • Experience doing fast-paced production work.
  • Experience designing for responsive web.
  • Ability to work and communicate effectively in a remote environment.
  • Your home base must be located +/- two hours from North American Central Time.

A Bit About Us

At YNAB (or You Need A Budget, if you have a lot of extra time on your hands), we build the best budgeting software around. For more than a decade, people have been buying YNAB and then telling their friends what a difference it has made in their lives. (Google us, or read some of our reviews on the app store, and you’ll see what we mean.) We love building something that has a huge positive impact on people’s lives.

We’re profitable, bootstrapped, and growing. YNAB started in 2004 and we haven’t taken any outside funding—we’re in it for the long haul.

We have one overarching requirement when it comes to joining our team: our Cultural Manifesto has to really click with you. If you’re nodding emphatically while reading it, you’ll probably fit right in, in which case, we can’t wait to hear from you!
First, let’s talk about life at YNAB and then we’ll go into detail about what we’re looking for.

How You’ll Work at YNAB

We work really hard to make working at YNAB an amazing experience. We have a team full of truly exceptional people—the kind you’ll be excited to work with. Here’s how we operate:

Live Where You Want
We’re a distributed team, so you can live and work wherever you want. Proximity doesn’t influence productivity. As I write this, Taylor (our CTO) is in, London or Brazil, or maybe back in Austin? Not all of us travel so extensively, but the fact that he does is totally okay because we’re all adults. Just make sure you have a reliable internet connection.

No Crazy Hours
We rarely work more than 40 hours per week. There have been a few occasions where things got a little crazy and people had to log some extra hours. But then they took some extra time off, so it all balances out. We work hard and smart but we’re in this for the long haul. There’s no need to go crazy on the hours.

Take Vacation (Seriously)
We want you to take vacation. In fact, we have a minimum vacation policy of three weeks per year (plus two extra weeks for Christmas break). It’s important to get out and do something. We’ll look forward to seeing pictures of your vacation in our internal chat room, creatively named #office_wall.

The YNAB Meetup
We get the teams together once a year to catch up on spreadsheets and powerpoints in a Best Western conference room. Just kidding. This year it was a gigantic cabin in the mountains. The time before that it was in Costa Rica.  We do really fun things, but the highlight is always just hanging out together and having a blast.

Up Your Game
We’re serious about helping you improve your craft. We budget for it (hey-o!).. Think conferences, Lynda subscriptions, dedicated time away from work to learn something new... it’s really up to you and your manager. But we love to see our people grow.  

International is Absolutely Okay
If you are Stateside, we’ll set you up as a W2 employee. If you’re international, you’ll be set up as a contractor. Employee or contractor, it’s all the same to us. You’re part of the team. (We are spread all over the world: Switzerland, Scotland, Brazil, Canada, and all over the United States.) For this particular role though, please pay attention to the timezone requirements above. 

If You’re Stateside…
YNAB offers fantastic health, dental, and vision insurance, where we cover 100% of the premium for you and your family. (No need to check your vision, you read that right, 100%. Although if you did need to check your vision, no big deal, we’ve got you covered!)

We also have a Traditional and Roth 401k option. YNAB contributes three percent whether you choose to throw any money in there or not. It vests immediately. (Are you a personal finance junkie like Jesse? He set up YNAB’s 401k to have the lowest fee structure possible, where all plan costs are paid by YNAB, not your retirement nest egg. The investment funds available are fantastic, passively-managed, ultra low-cost index funds. You’re not a PF junkie? Why then, did you muddle through all of the above awesomeness?)

Other Tidbits
  • We do birthday and Christmas gifts: No gift cards here. We tried that. Super boring.
  • We have a bonus plan based on profitability. You’ll be in on that from day one. YNAB wins, you win. That kind of thing.
  • We want you firing on all cylinders so we’ll set you up with a shiny new computer and replace it every three years.
  • Did I mention we make a huge, positive difference in people’s lives? You may not think that matters much, but then a few months down the road you’ll realize it’s made your job really, really enjoyable. Don’t underestimate this one!

If this sounds like your ideal environment, read on because now I want to talk about you. You will play a big, big part in helping the YNAB brand come to life and reach wider audiences. You will change lives. I’ll only say that six more times

Now, back to you, our new Visual Designer...

What Success Looks Like:
As a visual designer at YNAB you’ll be a prized resource for our marketing team, churning out ads, landing pages, and web updates while maintaining and expanding the YNAB brand. As a member of the design team you’ll work alongside UX designers to consistently improve the quality of visual design across all our platforms including upgrades to product UI and educational projects. You will be on the ground, protecting our brand with your pixel-perfect attention to detail and will shepherd your designs through development.

You’ve made our CEO cry twice. Our campaigns are so beautiful he can barely look at them without bringing out a tissue. The marketing team marvels at your ability to think big and execute quickly on the smallest of tasks. You roll up your sleeves and deliver what’s needed, sometimes before the marketing team asks for it. Other designers can’t stop praising you for your organized documentation of brand guidelines and strict approach to file management. You also make us laugh. We like to laugh.

You take direction from multiple teams, and communicate freely. You understand that great communication and time management is critical to your success in a remote work environment.

You know a great designer loves the very smallest parts of the job. Some call it pixel pushing. Others call it production work. We call it craft.

You love tweaking your designs in the browser and communicate easily with developers. Basic awareness of HTML and CSS is a must.

Finally, the success of a designer at YNAB hinges upon the ability to approach design as holistic problem solving for both creative and business goals. We work collaboratively here and you’ll listen to ideas, questions, and critiques from teammates with grace and patience. That said, you know your stuff and can eloquently and logically explain design decisions. You see this type of exchange as critical to the success of yourself and our company: it is through sharing ideas and being open to the brilliance of others that we arrive at the best solutions.

Bonus Points:
  • You already use and love YNAB.
  • You have one or more of the following skills: Motion graphics, video, illustration.

To apply: Apply through this link: https://ynab.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk06r53. Be sure to follow instructions on that page. Deadline is 11:59PM on August 1st, 2016.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Backcountry’s engineers are aggressive about finding new technologies to make systems better, faster, more stable, and more interesting to work on. Any developer in the company can get passionate about something new, start using it, and rally others around putting it into production.


SREs at Backcountry play a crucial role in helping facilitate and provide structure to this innovation. We vet technologies for production readiness, provide deployment guidelines and support the operational environments. We strive to do this in a collaborative way with our Engineering counterparts as we work toward migrating the organization to a DevOps culture.


About the Job



  • Full stack ownership databases, web servers, application servers and caching services.

  • Write and review code to provision servers, monitor systems and integrate ops workflows.

  • Develop system documentation and capacity plans.

  • Debug hard problems on our live production systems data, hardware, software, application and network.

  • Monitor system health and capacity planning and take proactive action to fix problems before they impact users.

  • Participate in an oncall rotation and serve as an escalation contact for incidents.

  • Collaborate with Development Engineering teams to build, deploy, support, and maintain new functionality.

jobs.title: Web Engineer
jobs.content:
The OmniTI Web Engineering team is responsible for building out software solutions for our clients. The team works within a wide variety of projects, solving existing problems or enabling new business objectives, empowered to use (or build) the tools that ensure security and scalability, while not sacrificing time to deployment. We believe that great technology experts are also software generalists; able to build your own environments, and unafraid to jump up and down the stack to solve the problems that come our way.


Do you want to write code that gets used by other developers around the globe? Want to work on sites with millions of users, getting millions of hits per day? Want to work on systems that are mission critical, that must move fast, and be resilient? This is what it takes to do web engineering at OmniTI. You'll have the opportunity to work with some of the largest companies in the business and build sites that push the envelope, but you'll need to embrace responsibility to do so.


About the Job:



  • Building new web functionality, sometimes from scratch, other times augmenting what's there

  • Finding website bottlenecks and improving website performance, both up and down the stack

  • Building back-end systems, internal support, and business communications tools

  • Scaling data and web systems, and automating as much as possible

  • Improving deployment, monitoring, and operability in everything you do

jobs.title: Principal Infrastructure Technologist - ThoughtWorks
jobs.content:
At ThoughtWorks our dedication to the art of software delivery has long meant driving deeper collaboration between different parts of an organisation. We literally wrote the book on Continuous Delivery, which recognises the deeper role of infrastructure and operations as an integral part of the delivery process, and have been an active part of the DevOps community since the beginning.


As an Infrastructure Developer at ThoughtWorks you are responsible for bringing and spreading the knowledge, ideas, and hands-on implementation skills needed to deliver and run software services.


ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We're a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems using a philosophy based on lightweight design, Agile, and open-source.


We help our customers to adopt DevOps approaches, break out of rigid, traditional ways of working and move to more customer-focused and agile approach. We currently have multiple positions for experts in infrastructure as code and DevOps to join us. 


As a Lead or Principal Consultant, here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks:



  • Hands-on implementation work to get projects off the ground, evaluate and drive improvements to existing infrastructure, and to coach developers and infrastructure engineers

  • Take the needs and challenges of a client and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.

jobs.title: Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: San Francisco
URL: http://www.toptal.com

About Toptal
Toptal is one of the most innovative and rapidly expanding tech start-ups from Silicon Valley. With backing from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Adam D’Angelo, our platform is the fastest growing labor marketplace in the history of the Internet—connecting thousands of elite engineers all over the world. In the last four years, Toptal has become the #1 choice for tech companies requiring top-tier engineering talent and for the top 3% of freelancers looking for their next challenge.

Position Description
We are looking for senior Drupal developers to be responsible for front-end development and theming. This position requires a combination of programming skills (PHP, HTML, CSS, JS, etc.) and aesthetics (understanding element arrangements on the screen, the color and font choices, and so on). The best candidates will have a strong understanding of industry trends and content management systems. Experience with responsive and adaptive design is strongly preferred. In addition, an understanding of the entire web development process, including design, development and deployment, with some back-end knowledge, is preferred.
By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects, ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s, with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Benefits:

  • Freedom to choose your own schedule and choose from a variety of hourly, part-time, and full-time projects.
  • The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.
  • Access to a thriving, collaborative community of talented peers.
  • Frequent Toptal events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.
  • Extremely competitive compensation.

Responsibilities:

  • Formulate effective, responsive designs and turn them into working themes.
  • Work closely with back-end developers and customers to ensure an effective, visually appealing, and intuitive implementation.
  • Design and implement new features and functionalities, including establishing and guiding the website’s architecture to ensure high performance and availability.
  • Manage all technical aspects of the CMS, and work closely with front-end developers and stakeholders to ensure visually appealing and intuitive implementations.
  • Handle custom Drupal programming and web application development needs, including maintaining and extending Drupal modules and sites.
  • Integrate open source and third-party applications into existing systems as needed.
  • Assess client requirements and convert needs into an elegant, intuitive architecture that meets Drupal best practices.
  • Write reusable, testable, and efficient code.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders. 
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

Requirements:
  • Strong experience building user interfaces for websites and/or web applications.
  • Experience building responsive websites using Drupal CMS, HTML/HTML5, CSS/CSS3, and JavaScript/jQuery.
  • Experience developing web solutions in Drupal and PHP implementations in a LAMP environment.
  • Ability to architect enterprise Drupal solutions including data, display, and information architecture.
  • Advanced site-building experience, including deep familiarity with Drupal modules such as CTools, Views, and Panels.
  • Experience creating custom Drupal modules, working with key contributed modules, and making use of the core API.
  • Deep knowledge of PHP, PHP files and theme functions, and the Drupal theme layer.
  • Through understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle (e.g. Requirements, Design, Development, Testing) and exposure to Agile or iterative SDLCs.
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.
  • Be open to receiving feedback.

To apply: http://bit.ly/1Ua1x00

jobs.title: Senior UI Developer
jobs.content:
We are currently looking for Sr. UI Developers to join our team in Austin, Texas.


We require you to believe firmly that you can change the world by implementing unique user experiences. You deliver what you promise and exceed expectations. You’re creative and positive when working as a part of our specialist team, but you can also take responsibility independently. jobs.title: Senior Designer, Consumer Experience
jobs.company: Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association
jobs.content:
The Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association (BCBSA) is a membership organization of independently owned insurance companies and is the strategic leader behind the Blue Cross and Blue Shield (BCBS) brand, one of the most recognized brands in America and the choice of more than 100 Million Americans for their healthcare coverage. There are 36 Blue Cross Blue Shield Plans across the country and internationally which depend on BCBSA's consulting and operational support, enabling them to move proactively to gain a competitive edge in their respective markets.

This position is located in Chicago, IL.

Are you a seasoned designer who wants to make a great impact? Are you looking for a career that is truly helping people, not just a job that helps sells products? At Blue Cross Blue Shield Association, our Consumer Experience team is focused on reimagining healthcare and to help people during both the everyday moments and the ones that matter the most. We touch the lives of 106 million members and are shaping the future to make healthcare more approachable, effortless, and smarter, for all.

The Senior Consumer Experience Designer will work as a team member on CX improvement initiatives using human-centered, lean start-up methodologies. This is a role focused on holistic, omni-channel experience design and qualitative consumer research. The Senior Consumer Experience Designer will be responsible for leading mid-sized projects, portions of larger projects and cross-functional “design sprints” across the nation to improve each stage of the end-to-end consumer lifecycle. This is a hands-on design and research role that includes: qualitative consumer research, design strategy, experience and ecosystem design, storytelling, concept development, work shop facilitation and partnering on implementation.

Required Basic Qualifications
• 5 years of related experience with a minimum of 3 years in Consumer Experience design
• Experience with lean startup methodologies strongly preferred
• Experience with formulating, conducting, leveraging, and reporting on qualitative consumer research
• BFA or MFA in Design preferred (Human Factors, Information Science or HCI, Graphic Design)
• Fluency with Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, InVision or tools with similar depth
• A background working directly with Operations for the implementation of designs
• Start-up environment experience (optional)
• Low-fidelity video creation (optional)
• Basic coding and editing for digital prototypes (optional)
• Industrial design prototyping skills (optional)

Highly Preferred Qualifications:
• Consumer Experience Design - Hands-on experience designing holistic, omni-channel consumer and service delivery ecosystem designs. Ability to transform tasks into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs through the entire experience lifecycle, from the first-time user to the expert. Ability to execute visual, information, interaction, and service design elements of the initiative that meets business and customer needs and delights customers. Ability to communicate the initiative and product to others (Business Partners) through consumer journeys, storyboards, ecosystem and service designs, prototypes, wireframes, infographics and other materials.

• Design Research – Seasoned in fast-paced design research. Ability to conduct informal consumer studies and present findings that will inform improvements in the customer experience. Capable of establishing research methods and strategies with our consumer research teams. Ability to discover customer and business needs through contextual inquiries, generative and quantitative research, and identify solutions to meet those needs.

• Fast Paced Innovator – You are able to prototype rapidly in multiple mediums and levels of interactivity (physical, digital, low and hi-fidelity, tangible and conceptual). The ability to translate insight and strategy into concept prototypes and communicate your vision through your artifacts. Creative use of technology and alternative approaches. Enthusiasm to learn new technologies, and ability to do so quickly, on the job. Appreciation of high quality visual design, innovative technology, marketing strategy, business strategy, as well as business analysis and quality assurance disciplines.

• Consulting and Mentoring – Ability to teach team and partners experience and human-centered design techniques to improve their every-day processes.

• Influence and Relationship Building – Ability to nurture productive, reciprocal partnerships to influence change. Demonstrated ability to influence corporate strategy, Consumer Experience strategy and building trusting relationships internally and externally with Plan partners. Excellent interpersonal skills with a strong ability to excel in a collaborative environment.

• Storytelling and Concept Selling- Strength in using storytelling to share your discoveries, influence business partners and create energy around an idea or an initiative. Ability to pitch concepts in a clear, concise, and compelling way to obtain buy-in and/or funding.

• Consumer Obsessed – Ability to build consumer empathy in business partners and emotionally connect to the lives and realities of the people we serve. Advocating for our consumers at all times. Experience in designing and conducting Consumer Experience Immersions.

• Approachable, Kind and Considerate Working Style - Care about the well-being of your partners, team members, and leaders. Seek the good in people first and help move projects along gracefully.



BCBSA employs more than 1,000 of the best strategic thinkers in the health insurance industry and offers a dynamic work environment, competitive compensation package, work/life balance, a diverse workplace, and much more!
Here’s your chance to make your mark on the future of healthcare. Bring your skills and talents to an organization committed to providing the most advanced technology and services.

Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V

jobs.title: Creative Director
jobs.content:
NewCity, an interactive agency in Blacksburg, Virginia, is looking for a strategic creative leader who will challenge us to think differently and keep moving forward in our work and as a company.

THE COMPANY
NewCity is 30 people, working in a highly collaborative, low-ego environment to create digital experiences for real people. We ask big questions, dream big dreams, but at the end of the day we build things that work. Our culture is can-do, roll-up-your-sleeves, I’ve got your back and you’ve got mine. We’re constantly learning, experimenting and reinventing NewCity.

We’re organized around seven key disciplines: user experience, visual design, content strategy, development, digital marketing and analytics, project management and business development. Our project teams are made of people from each discipline.

THE JOB
As a Creative Director at NewCity, you will:
• Shape our clients’ digital, brand and campaign strategies, working as part of 3-7 project teams at a time.
• Mentor and coach other designers, guiding their creative work.
• Help set the direction and vision of NewCity.
• Help shape NewCity’s own brand and marketing strategies, working with our Marketing Director and business development team.
• Participate in some pitches to prospective clients (all of our design team are experienced at presenting for NewCity, so it won’t all be on you).
• Travel to work with clients, usually not more than once a month for 2-3 days.

We do have several remote team members, but this position would require that you work from our office in downtown Blacksburg.
We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package.

YOU:
• Got the digital experience (at least 5 years) to know what really works, but you’re not afraid to break things to make them better.
• Demonstrated creative leadership in a team environment, working with complex multi-faceted brands.
• Are a skilled and persuasive communicator, both in writing and in person.
• Enjoy helping others develop and grow.
• Look at NewCity and you see opportunity, both to challenge us and to be challenged.

THE CLIENTS
If you review our portfolio, you’ll see a lot of work in higher education. It represents about 70% of our work each year. We love working with colleges and universities. It’s a dynamic, constantly changing space that always presents fresh challenges. The rest of our work is mainly with non-profits and B2B corporations. Roughly half our work each year is with repeat clients.

Our clients say there’s nothing cookie-cutter in our portfolio. They say we capture the unique DNA of their brand. That’s huge for us. You’ll be instrumental in helping us continue to do that.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Mitra Capital LLC is a Boston hedge fund seeking a driven and talented Lead Software Engineer to build out our proprietary software and machine learning systems.  In this role, you will be responsible for developing and deploying internal systems that parse and score earnings call transcripts using machine-learning based models and that transform and integrate data from third-party providers for use by our investment team.  We are seeking an individual well-suited to the challenge of managing and organizing the build-out of robust, scalable software solutions at the core of our firm’s investment process.


The Lead Engineer will interface directly with our tech-savvy CEO and be responsible for closely supervising a small engineering team.  The Lead Engineer will balance his/her time among overseeing overall system architecture, managing the team, contributing to coding, and ensuring that deliverables meet business objectives and quality standards.

jobs.title: Senior Mac OSX Application Developer
jobs.content:
About Nexsan

Nexsan is a global leader in storage, back up and data management solutions that are focused on seamlessly and securely enabling a connected workforce. Its broad solution portfolio empowers enterprises to securely store, protect and manage valuable business data whilst allowing users to sync, share and access files from any device, anywhere, anytime.

Established in 1999, Nexsan has more than 11,000 customers worldwide, with over 40,000 systems deployed in over 100 countries through a comprehensive worldwide network of cloud service providers, value-added resellers and solutions integrators.

Nexsans portfolio of secure archive solutions, high-density enterprise storage arrays, and unified hybrid storage systems are ideal for mission-critical IT applications such as virtualization, cloud, databases and energy efficient, high-density storage for backup and archiving. Nexsan Transporter private cloud solutions are leading the way in securely connecting the modern workforce with business data held securely in primary storage systems around the world.

The engineering team is located in Campbell,Ca, Montreal and in the UK. We are a global team working together as a team to implement the Nexsan vision. 

Overview

Senior Software Engineer working on a small team producing Mac OSX, and (iOS, Windows, Android) applications. The applications are bundled with Nexsans Unity - enterprise focused storage systems. The position requires a passionate professional who can work on all facets of our Host App software, focused in the area of OSX application development.  You will be working closely with the Product Management and Web/Central Services Development teams to build the APIs and user-facing management applications to support Unity based Private Cloud users. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, with extensive experience working with the latest and greatest Apple inspired user interface methodologies and styling.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, improve, and maintain scalable, maintainable, user-facing applications.
  • Research and implement modern user interface stylings and technologies for OSX applications.
  • Mentor and lead technical direction for the application development team.

Requirements

  • UI development experience
  • Experience with application development for Mac OS X
  • Excellent Objective-C coding skills
  • OSX Kernel knowledge
  • Good understanding of network enabled applications (TCP/IP, UDP)
  • Experience with File System primitive functions
  • Solid understanding of multi-threaded development concepts
  • Cocoa/Carbon, Objective C/C++, Swift
  • Solid debugging skills
  • Excellent at juggling multiple tasks
  • Use of OS system API calls
  • 5+ years of OSX development experience
  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Bonus Points

  • Mobile development experience for iOS and xCode
  • Background in enterprise storage management
  • Good understanding of NAS concepts such as CIFS, SMB, AFP
  • Experience in File, Sync and Share product space

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Satellite networks are highly diverse and challenging to manage, whether you’re participating in a global service or operating your own regional infrastructure. Networks can involve thousands of customer sites, spread over a range of satellites and beams with both fixed and mobile terminals. Success means bringing all of that into a single view controlled by a common Network Management Solution - iDirect Pulse®.


iDirect Pulse® is designed to service a wide range of users, giving everyone the access and information they need to run their networks. That includes satellite operators partitioning bandwidth or data rates, network operators creating a hierarchy of virtual networks, and service providers selling to enterprise clients or a large consumer base. It also includes end users who want to keep a vigilant eye on performance and administer basic changes to their service plans


We’re looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join us in our Herndon, VA engineering office. You will implement front-end tools and services into iDirect’s next-generation Network Management System, Pulse. Our customers use Pulse® to monitor and control large satellite networks which span the globe.


You will work in all aspects of the development lifecycle, including architecture, implementation, testing, and integration. We’re looking for sharp engineers with great communication, teamwork and problem-solving skills. We work in an exciting and fast-paced industry so people who do well at iDirect are those who are comfortable with solving technical challenges and learning new things.


As an iDirect Engineer, you will be responsible for:



  • Writing high-quality code, starting with unit tests

  • Ensuring our APIs meet our customer’s scale and data needs

  • Troubleshooting issues in customer systems

  • Peer reviewing the work of other development team members

ABOUT TECHNOLOGY @ Oportun

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
About Helpling


We at Helpling love helping people to find the cleaner they want. On our website or app, you can outsource the time-consuming housework within a couple of clicks. For cleaners, our technology platform makes it easier than ever to access new clients and to manage when and where they want to work. For our vision to digitize the world of home services, we have raised more than 56 million Euros from renowned internet pioneers such as Lakestar (Airbnb, Facebook, Spotify) and Mangrove Capital (Skype). Today, we are already a team of 300 and two thirds of us are based at our headquarters in the vibrant heart of Berlin. If you want to make a difference and help changing a whole industry, then Helpling is the right place for you.


Currently, we are looking for a Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer (m/f) to enhance the technical architecture behind the scenes.


How we work


Our application is build on top of Ruby on Rails framework using PostgreSQL database. We use Redis and Memcache as well, and Sidekiq as a queue system. We have integration with Stripe, Adyen, Nexmo and Twilio.


We have a strong agile culture, where some of the teams uses Scrum or Kanban.


We believe that testing should be part of the implementation and not something to (rarely) do later. We do TDD with Rspec for Unit and Integration test and we use Capybara for feature tests.


We develop on a fully reproducible environment using Vagrant and provisioned by SaltStack that we can completely create from the scratch in less than 10 minutes.


We deploy several times a day to Heroku and AWS through a continuous Integration pipeline with Snap-ci and Jenkins.

jobs.title: IT Quality Assurance Programmer
jobs.content:
IT Quality Assurance Programmers & Analyst - You’ve been looking for a place that is comfortable, easy going, and offers plenty of room to learn different technologies.  You know Java and want to learn .NET. You know .NET and want to learn Java. You want to be able to build using the latest UX, make it responsive, and make it easy for people that use a screen reader.


Do  you have a passion for software quality assurance and programming?  Then this would be a great opportunity for you our team and make a difference.


Your current situation doesn’t allow for flexible work schedules, pay for your health insurance, or may not be around next year.  And a retirement package?  Just what you put into it.


You want to have a life outside of work.


You want a place that will challenge you professionally.


Do you have a four year degree and three years of experience coding?  Are you looking for a place to challenge your abilities?  Would you like for your work to be both satisfying and helpful to the public?


If this sounds like you, we need to talk.

jobs.title: 3D Graphics Programmer - Build the most cutting-edge new software
jobs.content: StackState is growing. With you, we want to design and develop two products: a web scale IT Operations platform and our own Graph database, which will be made open source. We offer you the freedom to expand and unleash your expertise and personal skills. A unique opportunity to conquer the world with a new and challenging product.

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Etsimme nyt ohjelmistokehittäjää suurella sydämellä. Haluatko päästä toteuttamaan hienoja kartta- ja paikkatietoratkaisuja pinnalla olevilla teknologioilla yhdessä innostuneen ja osaavan devaajaporukan kanssa? Senior Developerina tunnet ohjelmistokehityksen salat ja toimit luontevasti asiakkaille tehtävissä projekteissa.
 
Osaamisten check list:
- Java EE (Spring Framework, JPA) tai funktionaalinen ohjelmointi (Clojure)
- Web-kehityksen perustuntemus (HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3)
- Tietokantaosaaminen (PostgreSQL/Oracle)
- Halu oppia ja kehittyä


Ja vielä parempi, jos taivut lisäksi ketteriin kehitysmenelmiin ja sinulla kokemusta moderneista JavaScript kirjastoista (esim. Backbone, Angular, React, Node ), paikkatiedosta (esim. GeoServer, Leaflet) tai jopa tietokantojen spatiaalilaajennuksista (esim. PostGIS, Oracle Spatial). Myös Integraatio-osaaminen on plussaa.
 
Tarjoamme sinulle tasapainoisen työpaikan, jossa voit toteuttaa itseäsi omilla vahvuusalueillasi. Pääset mukaan haasteellisiin ja oikeasti mielenkiintoisiin projekteihin ja voit lisäksi vaikuttaa käyttämiisi työkaluihin ja menetelmiin. Myös osaamisestasi pidetään hyvää huolta.
 
Sijaintisi tulee olemaan valintasi mukaan joko Helsingissä tai Tampereella.
 
Jos tarvitset lisäspeksejä ole yhteydessä Miika Saloon miika.salo(at)karttakeskus.fi

jobs.title: Software Quality Engineering
jobs.content:
At Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.                                               

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Frontend Developer
Experienced specialist in HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript

Jobsrepublic is a fast growing company in the digital recruitment space. We create high end recruitment technology that helps people finding their dream jobs by seeking the perfect match based on their passion, skills and goals. In order to meet our customers increasing demands, we are looking for a highly motivated and talented Frontend Developer to join our ambitious development team.  

You will be working in the Amsterdam office as a member of our agile software development team. We develop in short 2 week sprint cycles in which team members collaborate closely to deliver great solutions for our users. You'll work side by side with designers, backend developers, product owners and growth hackers to conceive, analyse, develop & test your ideas. You’ll be given the freedom and responsibility to make meaningful and measurable improvements.

Responsibilities



  • Translate requirements and mock-ups into new features using JavaScript, HTML and CSS

  • Create and maintain responsive sites for tablet, smartphone and desktop

  • Implementing A/B tests to contentiously improve user experience

  • Create concise and high performance scripts and continuously improve the speed of the application

  • Improve personally and professionally by learning new technologies and methods



Essential skills



  • At least two years' experience in frontend development in a commercial environment

  • Extensive understanding of core front-end web technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)

  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks like JQuery, Backbone.js and AngularJS

  • Ability to write modular and reusable code

  • Experience troubleshooting cross-browser compatibility issues

  • Knowledge of version control systems

  • Excellent communication skills in English

  • Passion for technical excellence and interest in software development

  • Drive, imagination and a capacity to learn. Turning ideas into reality in an agile environment

  • Experience in the implementation of highly robust solutions with third parties.


Desirable skills



  • Experience with implementing and measuring A/B test

  • Experience with agile/scrum development

  • Knowledge of Java or PHP

  • Experience with WordPress



Your benefits 



  • Good salary, pension and travelling cost compensation, 25 vacation days

  • Flexible working hours

  • The possibility to work part time (32 or 36 hours)

  • Excellent hardware and work environment

  • Free lunch

  • Experienced teams

  • An innovative, challenging and exciting learning environment in our office in Amsterdam



Our products and company - We help people find jobs that really make them happy
Jobsrepublic is a fast growing company in the digital recruitment space. Our product line offers a complete solution for the workforce sourcing process and aim to find the right job based on the individual’s talents and motivations. Our strategy is to provide intuitive products that help every candidate finding their dream job and increase employment satisfaction. We are one of the leading suppliers in recruitment software in the Netherlands and own a number of household brands.

Application process
Our procedure is set up to ensure that we have a good match from both sides. We want you to have a really great job and we want to be sure that we expand the team with a great team member that helps us getting to the next level.

Following your application, we'll arrange a quick chat on the phone. After this we want you to perform a short coding exercise so that you have an opportunity to show us your skills. You will then be invited to meet us in our Amsterdam office. Finally you will be given the chance to get to speak to other members at Jobsrepublic so you will have a good understanding of our project and teams. 

Interested?
Please apply through our application form or contact our Product manager Agnesa Krasniqi directly at a.krasniqi@jobsrepublic.nl or +31 (0)20 - 26 11 260.

For additional information about Jobsrepublic, click here.

Acquisition by third parties is not appreciated.

jobs.title: Senior Back End Sitecore Developer
jobs.content:
De functie
Als Senior Back End Sitecore Developer ben je een cruciale speler in het realiseren van innovatieve IT oplossingen. Je staat daarmee aan de basis van ons succes als online media bedrijf. 

Verantwoordelijkheden

  • Opstellen en aanpassen van functionele en technische ontwerp documenten;

  • Creëren van hoogwaardig software, die goed aansluit op de business behoefte;

  • Opbouwen van kennis en kennisdeling binnen het team, hieronder valt het goed documenteren van de software;

  • Tijdig opleveren van de afgesproken userstories;

  • Actieve deelname aan de Scrum meetings om inspanning en haalbaarheid te bepalen.



Wij bieden

  • Een kans om Scrum toe te passen in de praktijk;

  • Een omgeving waarin we kennis delen en zelfontplooiing stimuleren;

  • Werken met geavanceerde technologieën (o.a. MongoDB, Fuse ESB, CI);

  • Een vriendelijke en informele werkomgeving;

  • Een open omgeving met mogelijkheid om innovatieve ideeën te suggereren;

  • Samen met architecten, DevOps en de business streven naar het voortdurend verbeteren van ons proces.


Voelt goed?
Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw cv en motivatie. Wil je eerst meer informatie? Neem dan contact op met onze recruiter Paul Peters: 06-129 69 405.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Bynder is looking to hire you, a DevOps Engineer, who wants to help build the most advanced and easiest to use branding automation software in the industry. Our Development team is building a cloud-based SaaS product for marketeers to automate and streamline their workflow in today’s globalized business environment.


Our clients are some of the world’s largest brands, including Spotify, KLM, Nest, & Logitech to name but a few. We’re looking for someone who understands the challenges involved in creating a globally available, distributed system with four nines of reliability. We don’t take “no” for an answer and we stress the boundaries of what’s available.


We work with a microservice architecture, using multiple asynchronous systems and pushing the limits of both the technology and AWS to the limits to adapt our product to use state of the art technologies.


How we roll

We are hiring for this role in Amsterdam, where our rapidly growing team of developers are situated. The office is situated in the heart of the city.


Our development team is split into autonomous squads, each with responsibility for their own area of the product.


We have perks: each developer gets their own mac. We supply daily lunch at the office. We relax every day with beers, and we have ping-pong tables on hand for when you need a break.


You will join an international team: we have 20 nationalities between our 60 developers - and many more when you include our other offices in London, Boston, Dubai, and Barcelona. Bynder Amsterdam has cutting-edge innovations and free spirited lifestyle, where we bike to work and hang out at the canals.

jobs.title: Java Developers
jobs.content: Here at CDL, we love what we do. On a daily basis we deliver industry-leading software and solutions to insurance market giants such as Tesco Bank and moneysupermarket.com – and now you can join us too. We’ve got an exciting software role up for grabs. We are passionate about Continuous Delivery, Scrum, TDD and Lean delivery practices. If you have the skills to help us we should talk.

jobs.title: Java Team Lead
jobs.content:
De functie
Wij zijn op zoek naar een ervaren Team Lead met uitgebreide ervaring voor het aansturen van een tweetal Agile software delivery teams. Je werkt binnen de Build afdeling met een sterke focus op ons Java technologie domein.Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het dagelijks management van deze twee hybride teams waarbij sprake is van zowel on-shore als off-shore bezetting.

Met deze rol vervul je een leidende functie in de transformatie van onze huidige IT Build afdeling naar een eersteklas functionerende, zelfstandige club medewerkers die volgens de laatste marktstandaarden en met de meest uitdagende technologieën werkt. Je rapporteert direct aan de Manager Software Delivery

Verantwoordelijkheden



  • Je leidt een tweetal hybride software development teams (totaal 10-15 fte) in het realiseren van hoogstaande bedrijf kritische applicaties;

  • Je leidt de Scrums en acteert bij tenminste een van de twee teams als Scrum master om de team activiteiten te coördineren en blokkades weg te nemen die tijdige oplevering in de weg staan;

  • Je neemt een leidende positie in het verbeteren van bestaande processen en het standaardiseren van technologie en methodologie binnen de IT Build afdeling;

  • Je optimaliseert je team samenstelling op het vlak van kennis en kunde en verkleint waar mogelijk de afhankelijkheid van externe expertise waarbij de snelheid en kwaliteit van de oplevering niet in het gedrang komt;

  • Je bent tevens verantwoordelijk voor het algemene onderhouden en tijdige upgrades van de bestaande applicaties om de onderhoudslast tot een minimum te beperken en de toekomstvastheid te garanderen. Je past je uitstekende analytische, probleem oplossende en communicatieve vaardigheden toe om altijd tot het beste eindresultaat te komen;

  • Je analyseert bestaande applicatie(s) binnen je domein en stelt plannen op om deze te optimaliseren en toekomst vast te maken;

  • Je bent (mede)verantwoordelijk voor het managen van het team budget.



Wat wij jou bieden?
De mogelijkheid om Agile te werken en Scrum in de praktijk toe te passen. Een werkomgeving waar ruimte geboden wordt voor kennisdeling en continue verbetering.  Een open en eerlijke cultuur waar ruimte is voor het opwerpen van innovatieve ideeën en tevens de mogelijkheid geboden wordt om deze ook daadwerkelijk te implementeren. 



Voelt goed? 
Mooi! Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw cv en motivatie. Wil je eerst meer informatie? Neem dan contact op met onze recruitmentafdeling via WhatsApp: 06 578 134 96.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Java Developer
Spring MVC | Hibernate | Agile development

Jobsrepublic (Amsterdam - Netherlands) develops technology that brings people and jobs together. In an increasingly competitive marketplace we create and deliver products and services that exceed our customer’s expectations, whilst ensuring the product management efforts support the company’s overall strategy and goals. The core values of our company are innovation, customer satisfaction and robustness and we expect the candidate to demonstrate innovative thinking that creates new products and services that enhance these values of our product.

Working closely with the product manager, the development team takes ownership of all technical aspects of our web based applications, increasing usability and functionality for our customers. You will be working in an agile environment iterating quickly on ideas and bug fixes. We are passionate about producing clean maintainable code and fostering a coaching culture within the team. 

Responsibilities
Using agile methodology, our team works in sprints of small regular releases. Each developer is involved in the full software development lifecycle from requirement analysis and design, to programming, testing and release. This role is split approximately:



  • 80% Development (coding and testing)

  • 10% Scoping and planning

  • 10% Support


Liaising with customer service, graphic design and other developers, your constructive input is expected and appreciated. At times you may also take responsibility for the full-delivery of any assigned functionality and/or task. 

As a senior developer you will support the technical strategy of the product. You will be asked to ensure the technical development and new features meet the business plan of the company. 

You will have the opportunity to innovate, creating and designing your own ideas. This is a role for a developer who likes to be able to play with new technology, but who can also look at their designs and applications from the customer’s point of view. 

Essential Skills



  • Proven tech leadership experience in JAVA and Spring MVC environment

  • BSc in Computer Science or any maths/physics related degree and 6+ years’ experience in software development. Or 10+ years’ experience without a degree

  • Scrum or XP experience

  • Extensive experience with TDD

  • Good knowledge in Object Orientation, Design Pattern and Data Structure

  • Relational databases

  • Web services (RESTful)

  • Working with ORM’s, eg. Hibernate

  • Passion for technical excellence and interest in software development

  • Drive, imagination and a capacity to learn. Turning ideas into reality in an agile environment

  • Experience in the implementation of highly robust solutions with third parties



Desirable Skills



  • JS / backbone, HTML, CSS, Git, Mocking frameworks, Tomcat, MySQL, AWS, Linux

  • Continuous integration and continuous delivery

  • Scrum master experience



Your benefits



  • Good salary, pension and travelling cost compensation, 25 vacation days

  • Flexible working hours

  • The possibility to work part time (32 or 36 hours)

  • Excellent hardware

  • Free lunch

  • Experienced co-workers

  • An innovative, challenging and exciting learning environment in our office in Amsterdam



Our products and company - We help people find jobs that really make them happy
Jobsrepublic is a fast growing company in the digital recruitment space. Our product line offers a complete solution for the workforce sourcing process and aim to find the right job based on the individual’s talents and motivations. Our strategy is to provide intuitive products that help every candidate finding their dream job and increase employment satisfaction. We are one of the leading suppliers in recruitment software in the Netherlands and own a number of household brands.

Application process
Our procedure is set up to make really sure that we have a good match from both sides. We want you to have a really great job and we want to be sure that we expand the team with a great team member that helps us getting to the next level.

After checking your cv we'll have a quick chat on the phone. After this we want you to perform a coding exercise so you can show us your skills. After this you will then be invited for a skype call and have an interview with Xin Zhu (Architect, Lead) and Eric van Bourgonje (CEO). Next step will be that we will set up a meeting here in Amsterdam to meet the team and go in more detail. If we hire you we will help you out with relocation. But that's for later...

Interested?
Please apply through our application form. (The form is in Dutch, but you'll find out ;) ) or contact our Team Lead Xin Zhu directly via x.zhu@jobsrepublic.nl or +31 (0)20 - 26 11 260.

For additional information about Jobsrepublic, click here.

Acquisition by third parties is not appreciated.

jobs.title: Tech Lead .NET
jobs.content:
Voor onze collega’s in Amsterdam zijn wij op zoek naar een
 Tech Lead .NET

 
De functie
Als Tech Lead .NET speel je een hoofdrol in het ontwikkelen van innovatieve IT oplossingen binnen DTG. Wij zijn op zoek naar een ervaren ontwikkelaar met brede én diepgaande kennis van software ontwikkeling. Deze heb je opgedaan door te werken in complexe omgevingen met cutting-edge technologie.
 
In deze rol heb je veel direct contact met belanghebbenden uit onze business en weet je een goede relatie te onderhouden met de gebruikers van onze systemen.
 
Verantwoordelijkheden



  • Het bedenken, presenteren en verdedigen van de optimale technische oplossingen en richting binnen het .NET (CRM) applicatie ontwikkel domein;

  • Opstellen en onderhouden van (Engels- én Nederlandstalige) functionele- en technische specificatie documenten;

  • Ontwikkelen van gebruikersvriendelijke software oplossingen van hoge kwaliteit die overeenkomen met de wensen van onze business en die goed past in een complex systeemlandschap;

  • Kennisontwikkeling én kennisdeling binnen het team van ontwikkelaars, inclusief het opstellen van documentatie;

  • Zicht houden op het tijdig en op tijd leveren van de user stories waar jij verantwoordelijk voor bent;

  • Actief deelnemen aan Scrum meetings.


 Jouw profiel



  • HBO werk- en denkniveau met minimaal 4 jaar ervaring met software ontwikkelen in een complex IT landschap;

  • Ervaring met het dragen van technische eindverantwoordelijkheid voor de gekozen oplossingsrichting(en) binnen een applicatie domein;

  • Ervaring met design methodologieën, data modellering en system architectuur – inclusief SOA;

  • Brede én diepgaande kennis met het ontwikkelen van oplossingen voor Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2016 (en eerdere versies);

  • Ervaring met het begeleiden en uitvoeren van upgrade trajecten en software re factoring

  • Gedegen kennis en ontwikkelervaring met .NET / C# en gerelateerde technologieën als ASP.NET, MVC, LINQ en Javascript (jQuery);

  • Ervaring met het ontwikkelen van high performance en scalable systemen;

  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel Nederlands als Engels.


Wij bieden
Een uitdagende functie in een jonge en dynamische werkomgeving binnen een groeiend  en ambitieus bedrijf waarin succes centraal staat.
 
Voelt goed? 
Mooi! Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw cv en motivatie. Wil je eerst meer informatie? Neem dan contact op met onze recruitmentafdeling via WhatsApp: 06 578 134 96.

jobs.title: Backend/Full-Stack Developer on research web platform for engineering microbes
jobs.content:
In this position you will develop parts of our research platform that deals with storing, processing and analyzing experimental data. We use primarily Python 3.x with SQLAlchemy and a light-weight web framework on the backend and (at this time) AngularJS written in JavaScript or TypeScript on the frontend. You are encouraged to apply whether you consider yourself more of a data architect or more of a full-stack web developer. We are looking for software engineers who aim to be great at what they do, have a cooperative nature, and are willing to nurture talent in themselves and their teammates.


We are moving towards using microservices with a monolithic application also currently in use. This means you will be entirely responsible for some services and tools that you will develop on your own, where you must understand the needs of your users, who may be scientists or other software engineers.



Primary areas of responsibility:



  • Develop data models, methods and APIs for services

  • Distribute, collaborate on, and deploy services using GitHub, continuous integration (CI) and Docker

  • Write unit tests and integration tests

  • Potentially develop front-end tools and UIs, depending on your background and interests


Salary and appointment employment:


The salary and appointment terms will be based on collective agreement. The allowance will be agreed with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years, with the possibility for renewal.


Please submit your application no later than Friday, August 12 2016!

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Development
jobs.content:
Build and lead a talented team of world-class developers. Deliver features and bug fixes for a market-leading software product for tens of millions of users. Work in an Agile environment architecting and building SAAS solutions to perform at internet scale. Get a chance to help redefine the Travel industry!


In this role you will:


• Complete your team by hiring great developers: You will start out with a core of experienced developers. We’ll work with you to hire the rest of your team.
• Be a technical leader on your team : Our development managers are also involved in architecting our product and helping drive the solutions your team produces
• Empower your team to do good engineering work: Our teams use the right tools for the right job, and we do not have to hack fixes to meet arbitrary deadlines. We give our engineers the chance to do their work the right way the first time.
• Be a mentor to future leaders: Your team will have a mix of senior and junior developers. They will look to you to help steer their careers at Concur.
• Maintain a work/life balance: We are not a sweatshop. Our developers and managers work hard and have challenging problems to solve, but they go home at the end of the day and enjoy their evenings and weekends. We can’t promise you’ll never work late, but we can promise that it is not accepted as “normal.”

jobs.title: Software Quality Assurance Tester
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Software Quality Assurance Tester to join our Bynder Team in our Amsterdam office!


About the job


You will be responsible for Software Testing and Quality Assurance and provide the means and also the measures for testing all aspects of our software solution to meet the requirements and overall quality. You will setup QA procedures, lead the testing of the web application, work closely with development and provide communication on updates as to the weekly releases.


By actively supporting our product development, you will make our solution even better then it already is and therefore drive our customer happiness effectively.


Role & Responsibilities



  • Setting up and describing QA procedures

  • Functional testing on our releases and bug fixes

  • Reproducing issues experienced by clients

  • Release management and communication

  • Writing functional documentation

  • Cross browser testing

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.content:

Bynder is used across 46 countries and is available in 6 different languages. jobs.title: Tableau Jedi

Tableau Jedi (m/f)

jobs.title: Software Architect
jobs.content:
As Software Architect you are working in an international and interdisciplinary team to provide innovative solutions for lab automation to our customers.



Your responsibilities will include:



  • You create and document the Software Architecture based on the System Architecture and the Software Requirements and enhance it with missing quality attributes

  • You participate in the definition of the software requirements based on the system requirements

  • You define interfaces between software components and interfaces to external systems. (e.g. Laboratory middleware, Hardware, User Interface)

  • You observe the software implementation, assess the software architecture quality and ensure that the agreed software architecture has been successfully implemented

  • You participate in the software development activities by implementing the software design and supporting the development team in architecture and technical questions

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
This is a really exciting opportunity to get into a company at the start, shape the growth and strategy and help create the future for a company leading the next wave of market network technology.


You'll be given the freedom to shape how the product works and to work on new code in line with our business plan.  You will have responsibility for the technology and will provide updates, feedback, suggestions in our weekly team meeting.


The initial 3-6 months, we expect you'll be focused on:


1) Strengthening our existing technology platform


2) Developing our mobile apps - iOS and Android 


3) Creating APIs with other solutions such as google calendar, Sage Pay etc.


The aim is to provide more benefit to our customers, strengthen our technology and ultimately broaden our reach.

jobs.title: Support Engineer
jobs.content:
An excellent opportunity for an experienced Support Engineer to join our innovative team. The successful Support Engineer will lead on delivering high-quality professional service to our customers, represent Marmalade through our support channels to assisting customers to resolve technical issues whilst fostering positive customer relationships.


You will be expected to solve complex technical tasks and proactively work to prevent new issues from developing. The role is a mixture of troubleshooting complex technical issues and delivering first class customer service in a fast paced environment.


  Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities



  • Take ownership of cases from the incoming queue of support issues. 

  • Show technical understanding of the Marmalade Platform from a customer point of view with regards to architecture and user experience.

  • Identify root causes of technical issues and actively participate in the development of the solution.

  • Identifying weak or unintuitive parts of the documentation and actively contribute to the improvement of quality.

  • Follow troubleshooting scenarios provided by the Marmalade documentation to identify issues present in the product.

  • Coach customers on how to efficiently use Marmalade and work with the community manager to help shape blogs, tutorials and forum activities.

  • Actively track problem areas of the product and report them back to the Technical Marketing Manager.

  • Increasing test coverage and provide documentation updates.


Qualifications/Experience and Skills Required



  • 2+ years of engineering experience, preferably in the mobile games industry.

  • Understanding and experience of modern software development principles such as test driven development, continuous integration and continuous delivery.

  • Experience dealing with end-users in a support role.

  • Strong interpersonal communication skills and confident when customer facing.

  • Excellent problem solving skills and ability to consider the user experience in the bigger picture.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with experience of contributing to technical documentation in a clear and user focused manner including tutorials.

  • Outstanding team player with an ambition to really make an impact by working closely with professionals of a variety of disciplines and skillsets.

  • C++ 11 skills and familiar with the SOLID principles for object oriented design principles.


 Preferred skills



  • General game development experience.

  • Good understanding of mobile devices and their specific mobile OS features.


 Useful skills



  • Understanding of content creation tools and pipelines.

  • A sociable and motivated team player.

  • Experienced in technical presentations or webinars.


 Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Benefits include an employer-contributory pension scheme and share options

  • Opportunity to grow within a talented team working on the cutting edge of gaming technology in the heart of London

jobs.title: Senior Devops Engineer
jobs.content:
Our booking engine infrastructure consists of multiple Linux servers. The stack runs on Debian, Nginx, PHP and Percona MySQL. We do provisioning with Puppet and deploy with Jenkins. We have a MySQL ring replication, are using Memcache, load balancing, NFS and Elasticsearch. Currently we are working on scaling and high availability, to serve our booking engine to the fast growing market. We also have internal web based tools, which are used by thousands of people. The administrator team works and sits directly together with the development team, there is no strict separation.


The company is growing very fast, so there will be opportunities to grow. You will start out with a big share of hands-on work and some product management. As the company and the team grows, the share of managerial tasks will also grow.


So, for our Berlin office we are looking for a senior devops engineer (f/m)


What we offer:



  • Experience a fast growing startup with incredible offline value (You have probably already seen our green buses on the streets, right?)

  • Join a diverse, experienced team to exchange your ideas and contribution

  • Office at Alex

  • Competitive salary

  • Soft working hours

  • Conference visits

  • Room to grow

  • Help with your relocation to Berlin


You can expect:



  • to be a fully-qualified member of a passionate team with a flat hierarchy

  • flexibility in working hours - we have fun working together, but home office is always a possibility

  • professional training and continuing education


Here is a video from our head of software architecture about why it is interesting to work for us: 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TUWB7cW8UTg

jobs.title: Front End Engineer (m/f)
jobs.content:
You are a passionate Front End Engineer with an eye for details and strong skills in web development with JavaScript? You would die for playing around with state-of-the-art technologies and frameworks? You have knowledge how a web application works, both on the front end and backend side? You have an eye for simple to use and responsive design? Great! We are looking for a talented Software Engineer & JavaScript hero to work with us on huge projects. Join us and get your hands on one of the best e-commerce PaaS solutions in the market!

Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement a modular and scalable e-commerce web application in JavaScript
  • Implement UI/UX requirements in close collaboration with our UX/UI design team
  • Design, implement and maintain automated frontend tests
  • Analyze requirements and discuss technical approaches
  • Close work with an interdisciplinary, agile team consisting of Back and Front End Developers, DevOps, UX/UI Designers and Product Manager

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science and/or equivalent experience/qualification
  • Min. 3 years of work experience as a Front End Engineer (ideally on e-commerce projects)
  • Excellent knowledge of JavaScript and good experience with HTML and CSS
  • High UX/UI affinity
  • Experience with test automation
  • Practical work experience with e-commerce solutions and software development in an agile environment (SCRUM/Kanban etc.)
  • Experience working with Pull Requests and code review
  • Fluent English for the work in international teams, German would be a plus
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Structured, analytic and self-contained way of working -Team player with good communication skills and a good dose of pragmatism
  • Aspiration to constantly improve yourself and learn new technologies and concepts

Nice-to-have:

  • Experience with frameworks / libraries such as React.js, Backbone.js, Ember.js, Angular.js
  • Familiar with the whole web stack, including protocols and web server optimization techniques
  • Experience with Node.js
  • Practical experience with tools such as JIRA, Confluence (Atlassian stack)

What we offer:

  • Great team of highly qualified and motivated Software Engineers who work with a mutual respect and appreciation, take responsibility and evolve together
  • Work on and with Open Source Software
  • Joint decisions regarding tools and approaches
  • New technologies (Java 8, asynchronous IO, reactive architectures, microservices, etc.)
  • Attend (and organize) internal trainings, workshops, tech talks as well as hackathons, meetups and conferences
  • Challenging and meaningful projects in a company with over 10 years of history, which has became with their innovative commercetools platform one of the technology leaders in the growing e-commerce business
  • Long-term and strategic stability by being a 100% subsidiary of REWE Digital (part of the REWE Group)
  • Growing, international company with four offices in Berlin, Munich, New York City and Durham
  • Collegial, open working atmosphere and scope for new ideas
  • Healthy feedback and error culture and a climate of mutual appreciation
  • Modern workplaces and technology (e.g. MacBooks) in bright offices (open-plan spaces as well as conference rooms and smaller rooms for quiet times)
  • Flexible, family-friendly working hours and the possibility of working from home
  • Free water, coffee, tea, fresh fruits and some colleagues who really love baking cake ;-)

jobs.title: Python Developer
jobs.content:
Athena



Innovation in Investment Banking Technology


Athena is J.P. Morgan's cross-market risk management and trading system that provides functionality for traders, salespeople and operations staff globally. It is used in our foreign exchange, fixed income, credit and commodities businesses. Athena includes a globally replicated object-oriented database, a powerful dependency graph and a fully integrated stack across pricing, risk and trading tools. The code is a combination of Python and C++: C++ for speed, and Python for flexibility and rapid but controlled releases. Athena is designed to provide a continuous deployment environment, and pull developers close to the business to help increase revenues, while improving operational processes and controls to reduce costs.
The role requires a technically strong and disciplined developer. A record of delivering high quality, well-tested solutions in a mature controlled environment is a prerequisite. The role will require an ability to attain clear understanding of Athena environment and of the unique design considerations that come into play in a diverse and highly interdependent systems environment. A high level of interaction with the business is required as application involved are revenue generating and directly used by the businesses globally.


Skills



  •  Experience in large system development in an object-oriented or functional language such as Python, Java, C++ or C#



  • Willingness to become proficient and develop in Python if not already a primary language



  • Good understanding of Agile development methodologies, responsible for elucidating and agreeing requirements, building relationships with business users, and taking ownership of deliverables all the way to the production environment.



  •  Focus on testing through the entire development cycle to produce reliable and maintainable software



  • Experience in finance or investment banking as an application developer preferred, or willingness to rapidly learn the business domain



  • Ability to develop a good understanding of end to end business processes



  • Enthusiastic to keep learning and growing, in technical aptitude, business understanding and personal effectiveness



  • Excellent interpersonal skills to interact confidently and credibly with business users, to understand and agree business requirements and their prioritisation



  • Ability to collaborate with and influence other technology teams to deliver end to end solutions to the business in a constantly changing environment



  • Eager to take ownership of work, have real business impact, overcome obstacles and take it through to completion, working as part of this team and collaborating with a much bigger community of developers sharing the technology and code base.

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Developer
jobs.content:
