jobs.title: Director of Platform Engineering
jobs.content:
This is a newly created position to further drive the growth of the Betsson business and bring the business and the team to the next level.  You will lead significant, geographically dispersed, product executives to deliver results that will differentiate the performance of the business. You will manage a business going through change to service increasing amount of complexity; more channels, devices, brands, technologies, and rapidly changing customer requirements.


Your responsibilities will include:



  • Building new products and champion customer centric innovation in Betsson’s product verticals; understand product gaps in new and developing markets.

  • Demonstrating excellent people skills with an ability to influence others and form strong relationships, in order to take Betsson’s product engineering division to the next level.

  • Hire, continuously develop and manage product engineering teams to be world class.

  • Comfortable and capable of building strong relationships across the organisation – partnering with the Chief Marketing Officer’s team, the Chief Commercial Officer’s team – to deliver results.

  • Deliver continuous product development, not just “hit-and-run” project based development. Commercial bias to thinking. Being able to translate business strategies into action.

  • Strong focus on quality, efficiency and productivity improvements. The function is not broken – this is about driving / delivering improvements.

  • By international experience be able to lead a geographically diverse team across Stockholm (Gaming), Sportsbook (Malta) and Payments (Ukraine).

  • Able to optimize the international structure, including organisation re-design; capable of setting up a new development centre in Europe and staff that up.

jobs.title: Dev Ops Engineer
jobs.content:
Which? has a fantastic opportunity for a talented Dev Ops Engineer to join our fun and creative Digital team, based in our Central London offices next to Regent’s Park. This is a great role for a engineer wanting to embrace the latest technologies.


What you’ll be doing



  • Build and support development and testing environments for the Agile development teams working on digital projects.

  • Build and support continuous integration pipelines for the Agile development teams working on digital projects.

  • Support the continuous delivery mechanism for the Agile development teams working on digital projects.

  • Support the current Release process for development teams working on digital projects.

  • Attendance at Agile ceremonies (grooming, kick off, standups, retrospectives) to contribute DevOps knowledge and ensure best practices are followed.

  • Support migration to Amazon Web Services via automation tooling and scripted infrastructure.

  • Become expert in the use of Which? Digital DevOps tools and technologies.

  • Be fully aware of, and follow as far as possible, DevOps best practice guidelines.

  • Keep abreast of the latest DevOps technology trends, tools and practices.

  • Comply and contribute to the departmental as well as company standards and procedures.

  • Willingness to assist with critical releases or high priority bug fixes with occasional out of hours working.

jobs.title: Cloud Software Developer
jobs.content:
Think Intel is all about hardware? Well, think again. On its own, Intel's software business would be one of the largest and most influential software companies in the world.
So join us to help create the next generation of technologies that will shape the future for decades to come.

Intel is currently looking for a passionate Cloud Computing Software Developer with depth technical knowledge to join Software Defined Infrastructure (SDI) team at Intel Gdansk.
SDI is an emerging technology focused on accelerating IA optimization, private, and public cloud. SDI is driving innovation for the future of intelligent cloud computing.

As a Software Developer in Clouds you will be involved all major stages of software defined infrastructure software development lifecycle, e.g. requirements definition, research, pre&post-release customer support activities.
Required qualifications:
- Minimum of 4+ years of working experience in Object Oriented Software development (preferably: Golang, C++, Python)
- Practical knowledge about multithreaded, multi-core, and distributed software architecture & development
- Recognized industry expertise in distributed systems and software including File Systems, Network, Scheduling, Operating Systems, Virtualization, and HW
- Strong desire to learn new technologies, show initiative, prioritize, deliver and contribute
- Experience in HPC and/or Cloud Resource Managers and schedulers
- Strong English communication skills (both: written & verbal)

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Intrigued by building business-focused software with modern techniques? Passionate about coding? Then this might just be the opportunity you are looking for! We’re currently seeking JavaScript Developers to join our Front-end team in Malta!


You will be part of a truly agile team, focused on building customer facing web sites that are visited by thousands of users every day. With over 80 front-end developers and QAs spread over 3 locations, Betsson aims at delivering the best user experience in the industry. Each front-end team works on multiple products, including sportsbook, casino, poker as well as their mobile-web counterpart! We’re a growing team looking for developers of all levels so it doesn’t matter whether you’re a newbie, an established developer or a code veteran.


Responsibilities


As a JavaScript Developer you will be responsible for software development in a scrum team using light-weight agile processes. You will be contributing directly to the success of our brands by materializing our business teams’ visions into a tangible user experience. You will participate in sprint planning, task estimation, development, testing, code reviews, bug fixing, deploying great software, implementing new features as well as maintaining and improving the existing functionality.

jobs.title: Front-End/Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
You work as a developer in our various customer projects including both web and desktop applications as well as mixed reality solutions. You design and implement large-scale solutions for our customers together with our project team. Our customers are operating in healthcare and industry domains and the solutions we’re developing to them really make a difference.


We offer You a chance to work in highly versatile projects in which your skills can greatly develop.

jobs.title: BMW Group - Software Developer for Digital Services
jobs.content:
INNOVATION IS IMAGINING WHAT NOONE ELSE CAN.


WHY JUST BUILD A CAR WHEN YOU COULD REINVENT MOBILITY?


Everything starts with passion at the BMW Group. It turns a profession into a vocation.  It drives us to keep reinventing mobility and to bring innovative ideas onto the roads. Enthusiasm for joint projects turns a team into a strong unit where every opinion is valued.  It is only when expertise, highly professional processes and enjoyment of work are united that we can shape the future together.  Whatever your heart’s desire – in the BMW Group, you will find a wide range of departments and disciplines across the world where you can share your professional passion with us.


Software Developer for Digital Services (m/f)
Job reference: 100645


The BMW Group is offering an interesting opportunity in the area of aftersales. In the age of digitalisation, the automobile is becoming a part of our networked lives in the context of individual mobility. The networking of vehicle functions is currently the basis for numerous automotive innovations. The next logical step is networking vehicles with their environment via innovative cloud technology. This technology opens up completely new areas of application: vehicles measuring street geometry while driving, creating a live digital map and vehicle sensors detecting a hazard area and reporting this to other vehicles via the backend. Road, traffic and weather conditions are recorded in real time. Our job is to establish a consistent digital location experience across all access channels and vehicle utilisation scenarios. As Software Developer (m/f) for Digital Services, you will be responsible for the development and management of development processes in the area of apps and web frontends for new digital services. In the management area, you will design the use of tools for development, error analysis and tracking, analytics, A/B testing and other methods for agile product evaluation and improvement. Your tasks will also include the conception, procurement, setup and operation of a distributed test infrastructure for vehicle-related applications. Your activities in the development area will comprise various application platforms for smartphone-based applications for iOS, Android and Windows Mobile, along with web-based applications. This includes the design and implementation of interfaces to the vehicle system (via BT or WiFi) as well as backend systems (via GSM / LTE) primarily using REST-based communication. You will coordinate your efforts closely with various product owners considering feasibility, efficiency, ease of maintenance and scalability of the solutions that are to be implemented. The development process is based on the Scrum methodology whereby you will take over various roles as a Scrum Member (m/f) or Master (m/f) with the management of other internal or external Scrum Members.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
This position may not be available at this time, but in the very near future


Creating and extending computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth--that's our vision, is it yours?


That’s where you come in. We need innovators and proven communicators like you to push our thinking. We need your strong collaboration and organizational skills, as well as your ability to effectively work within a team environment.  You will help push us to the next level.  Joining Intel means joining a dynamic company that has established a reputation for innovation.


Responsibilities


As a Software Engineer, you will work with Intel Shannon Data Centre Group, DCG/NPG Software development team to deliver leading edge software that will enable tomorrow’s Network Infrastructure and optimise key Data Centre and Communications workloads.


You will be based in Shannon, Co. Clare, Ireland as a member of a talented team of software engineers with a broad 


range of experience. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with multi-site projects, working on cutting edge hardware. You will enjoy a world class work environment and you will be empowered to full fill your greatest ambitions.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer

jobs.title: Backend Clojure Developer
jobs.content:
Autheos is an early-stage, VC-backed startup that makes a video syndication and analytics platform that connects webshops with brands. We are currently looking to hire our third Clojure backend engineer, who wants to use their favorite language to develop cutting edge technology.


At Autheos, we are trying to push the envelope of online video distribution, and in order to achieve that, we need a core team of developers who are eager to use their abilities to help make that goal. Being an early-stage startup, you get the opportunity to have a big impact on our product, infrastructure and our team, while working in an environment where responsibility, freedom, innovation and quality all play very important roles.


As a Clojure backend developer, you will work directly with our CTO to architect and develop core components of our Clojure backend to allow for sophisticated deployment of video distribution, data mining and machine learning algorithms. You like to solve big problems, and don't shy away when you have to design services that can scale-out over thousands of machines; on the contrary, this is exactly why you would choose this job: get the hands-on experience with designing these types of systems, knowing it will have a huge impact in our organization.


Keywords of technologies we love: Redshift, Druid, ElasticSearch, Spark, Github, Travis, CodeDeploy, R, PostgreSQL, Nginx, CloudFormation.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced, enthusiastic and personable Software Engineer to work on our market leading Data Analytics product.


(Sorry, no agency applications please).


This is an opportunity to work on a great variety of projects including frontend or backend, (dependent on your background). Typical responsibilities might include:



  • Developing new microservices for our flagship analytics product

  • Automating deployments to our AWS cloud servers

  • Supporting our complex ETL and data processing pipeline

  • Creating stunning new data visualisations with the React, D3 and other charting libraries


We use a mixture of technologies including Java 8, Python 3 and React-JS. We don’t expect you to know all of these, of course, but be confident enough to learn on the job.


We have a strong engineering culture and a “20% off-plan” policy (where everyone works one day a week on pet projects, ideas and other non core tasks). This has produced some of the most popular user features in our software and allowed us to adopt new technologies.


We use agile methodology, have regular learning lunches, flexible working hours, decent coffee, iMacs for all and we’re a friendly team.


This is an amazing chance to work with cutting edge technologies like Docker, AWS, React, and ElasticSearch, collaborate with experienced engineers, and work on an interesting variety of projects.

jobs.title: Front End Developer - Cloud-focused technical consultancy
jobs.content:

Our way of working is different to many agencies and you will find yourself immersed in a development team with our clients helping define the solution as well as using your development skills to produce a quality result.

You will be responsible for making sure we are developing the very best technical solution whilst keeping within the client’s business requirements. A strong knowledge of design patterns, team leadership and working with clients is important, as well as being able to deliver quality code.

jobs.title: ThoughtWorks - Technical Principal
jobs.content:
ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’re a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. We’re dedicated to the art of software delivery, by keeping it lightweight, agile and open-source. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems to help them solve their toughest business problems. As a Principal Consultant at ThoughtWorks you have total responsibility for technical delivery on a client engagement so you are likely to have extensive experience.


As a Principal Consultant, here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks: 



  • Disrupt, Lead and Innovate.

  • Take the needs and challenges of a client and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.

  • Provide Technical leadership across all areas of the enterprise, to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions

  • Formulate and articulate the technical and political implication of real world solutions

  • Orchestrate the management of technology scope and risks

  • Mentor on approach and execution of solutions, coach on technologies and establishing a team wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction

  • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met

  • Drive ThoughtWorks’ Thought-Leadership on engineering and architectural practices and standards

  • Be an inspiration of innovation to the client

  • Become a trusted and valued partner of the client CIO/CTO and team

  • Exploit opportunities for networking and relationship building that arise out of delivery activities

  • Creates and supports sales activities

  • Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products

  • Code! We don’t subscribe to the “post-technical” ivory tower leadership style


We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel. 


We offer amazing benefits from the day you start including private medical insurance, travel insurance, income protection, critical illness, life assurance, pension scheme, child care vouchers, personal development budget, 25 days holiday and a ride2work scheme.


To apply please submit your CV and tell us why you want to join ThoughtWorks. One of our recruiters will be in touch.


At ThoughtWorks we promote diversity in all its forms and reject discrimination and inequality. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve

jobs.title: Senior Ruby On Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Your Role:


As MODOMOTO expands internationally, your work will have immediate impact on our customers and the many departments of MODOMOTO that are serving them. You will be continuously developing and optimizing our system with the goal of making it more reliable, scalable, and performant as we grow.


Therefore, we are looking for an experienced, passionate, and self-motivated engineer who will contribute to and influence the direction of this vision.


To be successful in this role, you must be a quick learner and have excellent software development skills. You must also be a great communicator and excel at working in a highly collaborative and cross-functional environment. There is no shortage of opportunities to shape the future of our product.


The Team:


You will be joining a tight-knit team of experts, in which decision-making is open and collaborative. Sharing knowledge and discussing technical strategy is just as much part of our day-to-day as quiet time to deliver excellent code.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer
jobs.content:
Responsibilities



As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will conduct both functional and non-functional testing across multiple mobile platforms. Understand project requirements, develop and implement test plans and design high quality test cases, conduct test execution and report test progress. Proactively identify issues/blockers, risks and take the necessary steps to mitigate them.

In this position, you will collaborate with developers to ensure defects are well documented in the bug tracking system as well as collaborate with them to implement automated tests.

jobs.title: Security Engineer
jobs.content:
Responsibilities


Working with engineers and technology directors to ensure new features are designed and implemented to the highest possible security standard


Performing security code reviews and work with engineers to resolve issues at a very detailed level


Building tools for continuous security monitoring and assessment

Keeping yourself updated of the latest vulnerabilities, exploits and malware that might affect the company, and their mitigations

jobs.title: Product Manager, Agile Coach
jobs.content:
As a highly organised and results-driven Product Manager, you will be part of a department which focuses on the efficient creation of products. You will manage one or more complex agile software projects, breaking down barriers for your team, and both planning at a higher level and getting into the detail to make things happen when needed.


You provide coaching in the team in agile concepts, principles and values and lead them to higher levels of performance and productivity.


As a leader of the dedicated cross-functional team your duties include coaching and mentoring of team members, recruitment, performance assessments, staff development and reporting on staff related matters. You will improve efficiency, communication and product quality.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Backend
jobs.content:
Responsibilities


Your responsibilities will include the continuous development and improvement of the current backend and service architecture of Centralway Numbrs.


You will administer and support our backend API, databases and other components. Researching and remaining up-to-date with the latest technologies will help you to implement scalability and redundancy in all parts of the application.


In close cooperation with the various departments of Centralway, you will continuously develop and improve the backend structure, based on the product vision.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Android
jobs.content:
Responsibilities


Working alongside our design, business and project teams, you will join our team of top engineers in developing and shipping new features, using state-of-the-art technologies.

You will design, build and maintain high performance, reusable and reliable Android code. You will be responsible for the development and maintenance of our Android apps, within a team of engineers, ensuring the best possible performance and quality.

Additionally, you will conduct regular code and peer reviews to ensure the quality requirements are met.

jobs.title: (Senior) C++ Backend Developer
jobs.content:
In our Data & Technology department we are responsible for the complete life cycle of our software products. We develop applications for our internal customers in the fields of market research and big data. In our development process we are working test driven and do continuous integration.


As a (Senior) C++ Backend Developer (m/f) you are part of our Star Track Solutions department.

We are a fast-growing team with more than 70 software developers, architects and requirement analysts.
In an ultra-modern landscape of development, design and analysis tools, we are responsible for the technical design and development of our data production system "Star Track".

In various international agile project teams the software components of Star Track are being developed, covering the entire business process of data input, master data management, quality assurance, production and delivery of reports to the end customer reporting.
In this environment, you are joint responsible for the development of new highly interactive and data-intensive research applications as well as the maintenance of existing applications.

In this environment you are responsible for the development of new modules, interfaces and features of our high performance and data intensive analytic backend for our market research applications
as well as for the maintenance of our existing applications.
The functions that you develop in the analytic backend will be used by our clients and client service departments to get valuable insights out of “Big Data”.


You will:



  • Design and implement new software modules within the analytic backend of StarTrack as well as interfaces to important subsystems,  e.g. web services for interactive dashboards for our end customers (In close coordination with our analysts, testers, frontend specialists)

  • Maintain our existing applications in the area of reporting, report delivery and management of customer reference 

  • Perform effort estimations

  • Analyze and resolve performance bottlenecks in our applications

  • Create and execute unit tests or integration tests for your own components based on standardized frameworks and integrated in the Continuous Delivery Process

  • Cooperate closely on international level with our colleagues in Malaysia and Bulgaria and Netherlands

  • Analyze and clarify system problems within the 3rd level support

jobs.title: (Senior) Application Developer .Net/C#
jobs.content:
In our Data & Technology department we are responsible for the complete life cycle of our software products. We develop applications for our internal customers in the fields of market research and big data. In our development process we are working test driven and do continuous integration.



As a (Senior) Application Developer .Net/C# (m/f) you are part of our “Panel Operation Development” team. In a high modern environment of development-, design- and analyzing tools we are responsible for the technical conception and development of our worldwide used panel data production system. In this environment you are engaged with the development of new web based system components especially in the field of data management. Beside the conception this field consists mostly of the further development of existing system components for master data management based on Oracle and .Net. Within the existing panel production system you are responsible for individual software components across the entire life cycle.



Depending on your experience you analyse roughly granular business requirements regarding the technical implementation and gauging the expected development expenses. Furthermore you create technical designs for future implementations based on functional designs regarding architectural guidelines. Last but not least creating automated unit-tests accompanying the implementation belong equally to your daily work as maintenance and care of existing applications. After the rollout you finally undertake the analysis and clarification of systems difficulties within the 3rd level support.

jobs.title: Image Processing\Computer Vision Engineer for FreeD 3D reconstruction team
jobs.content:
Come and Join the Intel freeD Group, a dynamic and creative group with a start-up atmosphere within Intel, developing the future of video technology.
"freeD" stands for Free Dimensional Video, and is an entirely new concept for capturing, processing and rendering video that allows users to interact with real, live video. Our content is captured in the largest sport and entertainment venues in the world -Super Bowl, Soccer, NBA, etc.


About Your Team:


The SW/HW R&D team specializes in 2D image processing / computer vision and 3D multiple view cameras geometry to triangulate and correlate features and colors from multiple calibrated cameras (today:36X15MP cameras) into a high quality - millions of points- high precision 3D Model.


Your Challenge:


As an Image processing/Computer Vision algorithm developer you will be responsible for driving the latest and most powerful processors, from all architectures to their limit using the best patented algorithms to reduce the complexity of such High-Performance computing tasks in real time.

jobs.title: 3D Image Processing Algorithm Expert
jobs.content:
Come and Join the Intel freeD Group, a dynamic and creative group with a start-up atmosphere within Intel, developing the future of video technology.
"freeD" stands for Free Dimensional Video, and is an entirely new concept for capturing, processing and rendering video that allows users to interact with real, live video. Our content is captured in the largest sport and entertainment venues in the world -Super Bowl, Soccer, NBA, etc.


We are looking for an Algorithm Expert that will work with us to power the development of 2D and 3D image processing technologies.


Challenges in this role include - Literature search and application of articles, development and improvement of new and existing algorithms and working on cutting edge 3D technologies with field experts.

jobs.title: Sr. Business Analyst
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Job Summary:
Responsible for formulating and defining systems and objectives through
research and analysis of functional/business needs of applicable
provisioning and support systems. Participates in software/hardware
releases, rigorous testings, installation tasks, and supports
implementation planning and other operational preparations. Devises or
modifies procedures to solve complex systems problems. Plans and leads
team projects and may act as a cross-functional liaison. Acts as a
subject matter expert.

Core Responsibilities:
- Works with Software Developers and collaborates and/or leads
cross-functional teams in software design and development. Assesses and
revises test sequence and scope based upon test results and/or changes
in product design. Coordinates component, system, and documentation
testing with the appropriate technical groups and leadership team.
- Works with business partners and engineering leads to identify the
appropriate data for testing and prepares that data for the test cases.
Collaborates with Software Engineers and Data Configuration Analysts to
negotiate and define data solutions.
- Reviews proposals, including gathering facts, analyzing data, and
preparing project overviews which compare alternatives in terms of cost,
time, availability of equipment and personnel, etc. Recommends course
of action. Writes detailed business requirements and translates into
system requirements to present solutions to other team members and
parties.
- Serves as a Subject Matter Expert on custom software systems and
guides consumers on best preactices and guideline on systems
integrations. Analyzes and revises existing system logic difficulties
and documentation as necessary.
- Prepares detailed functional and technical specifications from which
software will be written.
- Interacts with end users to gather requirements and scope of effort.
Performs analysis of user needs, documentation of requirements, and
translation into proper system requirement specifications.
- Identifies and assesses probable interactions of related systems and
predicts impact of a change in an assigned system.
- Functions as a liaison between the client, community, and internal
Software Engineers and/or external software vendors to develop system
solutions for processing systems or business problems.
- Ensures data quality and integrity across data-specific application
implementations.
- Supports the testing team and business users in validating that the
systems meet the requirements. Participates in unit, integration, and
test procedures. Compares test results against requirements to validate
that coding is accurate.
- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters
of significance.
- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work
nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.
- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Job Specification:
- Bachelors Degree or equivalent
- Information Sciences/Technology
-
- Generally requires 11+ years related experience

jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.






Responsibilities:

- Assists in the risk assessment, quality, and scope management of deployment project plans.

- Responsible for the racking and stacking of equipment within the Data Center.

- Responsible for the operational inventory of all Data Center equipment in Aperture

- Installs, maintains and troubleshoots all Data Center cabling and infrastructure.

- Manages Data Center cable running lists, and records of deployed equipment.

- Supervises the maintenance and repair of all facilities systems and hardware.

- Ensure all equipment is labeled in compliance with DCM standards

- Maintain copper, fiber and power cord inventory

- Monitor security within the data center and raised floor environment

- Interfaces with vendors to maintain, troubleshoot and install related equipment.

- Monitors and optimizes Data Center power utilization, HVAC utilization and related requirements.

- Continued focus on streamlining Methods and Procedure for equipment deployment and implementation.

- Some direction required for job duties and high performance

- Knowledge and experience of providing Tier I IT support.

- Some travel required

- Be available to support 24 x 7 shift schedule





Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent

- Engineering, Computer Science

- Generally requires 0-2 years related experience





Qualifications/Experience:

- Experience in deployment and installation of switches, routers and servers

- Experience in High Speed Data, Voice, IP and Data Networking.

- Diverse knowledge of HVAC dynamics.

- Basic knowledge of all current types of networking and server hardware.

- Demonstrated experience documenting policies and procedures.

- Proven analytical, problem solving and organizational abilities.

- Proven interpersonal skills with the ability to work with vendors, employees and management.

- Good personal computer skills.





Demonstrated success in the following core competencies:

-Ability and willingness to adapt and accept change with strong decision-making skills to complete project successfully.

-Personal qualities to include integrity, respect for others, personal responsibility, and a passion to approach all aspects of the job with enthusiasm.





Skills Required:

-Technical skills relative to HSD and Voice network engineering, planning and management including experience with IP routers, switches and CMTS equipment

-Server administration (i.e. Unix, Linux and Windows platforms)

-Understanding of AC/DC power configurations and HVAC related thermal architecture

-Data Center planning and engineering

-Solid abilities using Microsoft Office

-Proven analytical skills

-Excellent written and oral communication skills





Core Responsibilities:

- Collects and organizes technical data related to assigned projects.Presents data and findings for review at the next level of engineering management.

- Reads and analyzes technical references and sources to obtain knowledge of assigned Engineering Operations topics. Identifies common operational and technical problems with standard solutions. Escalates more complex issues to senior Operations Engineers.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Job Summary:



Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





As a Site Reliablity Engineer with the Xfinity Home Operations team, you will work other DevOps practitioners to produce mission-critical infrastructure, tools, and processes that enable our systems to scale at a rapid pace. One day might involve performance tuning of a Java web application; the next may be building tools to enable continuous delivery. You'll investigate and create new systems for scaling development and production.





You're right for the job if you're comfortable with deep technical Linux, networking topics, and distributed architectures. You'll excel if you have enthusiasm for digging deep, and a flare for sharp technical communication, prioritization and organization.





You will develop, deploy, and operate web and mobile properties and their supporting APIs at scale. You will work directly with Software Engineering teams to build our next generation, cloud-based, architecture.





Where are we headed?





Our goal is to build, scale and guard the systems that delight customers. To do so, you will need to strong skills in following areas:





Software Development



- Build tools and alarms that would inform of potential problems or customer issues



- Adapt what exists and build what doesn't to scale the system



- Build tools and develop processes for continuous integration and delivery of services



- Build and drive the automation systems that maintain system health





Site Reliability Engineering / Operations



- Root-cause complex problems involving multiple parties, networks, hardware and software that relate to scaling and performance



- Participate in on-call rotation



- Engender reliability and availability starting with metrics and measurements



- Enable scaling by providing tools, developing training or augmenting processes



- Secure the system from issues, be they real, perceived or notional



- Obsess over collecting and digesting metrics



- Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible, CFEngine, Chef and Puppet



- Experience building tools for automation (building, testing, releasing, monitoring and alarming)





Additional responsibilities may include:



Responsible for planning and designing new software and web

applications. Analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new

applications. Documents all development activity. Assists with

training non-technical personnel. Has in-depth experience, knowledge

and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities.

technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration

needs.

software update process for existing applications, and roll-outs of

software releases.

internally developed software applications.

- Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements,

including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical

manuals and formal recommendations and reports.

literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of

skills, and their application in the area of specified engineering

specialty.

and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design, and

technical choices to internal audiences.

- Displays knowledge of, and ability to apply, project management

skills.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters

of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
thePlatform, a part ofComcast Wholesale,is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.






As part of a team dedicated to Comcast's video playback experience, you'll have direct impact on the consumer experience of watching video over the web. We provide solutions for content protection (DRM), advertisements, and realtime analytics of the video playback experience. Our libraries interact with many different external systems in order to provide a consistent playback experience across multiple devices and applications.



This position is targeted for JS player but there is opportunity to work on all platforms. The Player Platform currently runs on iOS, Android, Desktop (Flash & JS), Set Top Boxes, Xbox, and Samsung Smart TVs.You'll be working with the best and brightest minds in Comcast building the next video platform that will power Comcast for years to come. You will drive the future of the IP Video industry.



Combine your software engineering skills with the latest web and mobile technologies and come work as a Software Engineer at thePlatform, the leading online video management and publishing company.



Skills & Requirements

B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related Field

3+ years experience

Passion for HTML5 and Javascript development

Familiarity with ES6 and TypeScript is a plus

Familiar with JavaScript module loaders such as CommonJS and/or RequireJS

Familiar with JavaScript build tools such as grunt, gulp, webpack, etc

Experience with writing JavaScript unit tests

Familiar with a scripting language

Familiar with design patterns and how they apply to JavaScript applications

Experience with version control tools such as git.

Experience designing clean, concise, maintainable APIs

Experience with multi-threading programing

Good communicator and able to clearly articulate complex issues and technologies

Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution

Comfortable working in a fast paced agile environment.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer Java/Web
jobs.content:
This might be an exciting opportunity for you. We are an independent FinTech company developing software applications for financial messaging since the early 2000's. Companies like SIX, Zurich Insurance Group, DHL, or Credit Suisse rely on our products to enable and/or monitor communication between applications, organisations, and people.
In the development department located in the Zurich area we are a diverse team of seven people who enjoy solving hard problems on a daily basis. Some highlights:



  • we work on large scale, distributed messaging systems using technologies like Kafka, Cassandra, or SolrCloud

  • we have the privilege to use our theoretical knowledge in advanced concepts like type systems and static checking to optimize the user experience of our rules engine for message transformation

  • we are building up cloud services to enable our customers to use the software without having to operate it

  • we enjoy working in a product development environment where idea generation, design, and quality have the right importance and we see and hear how our customers like our work


There is more information about the job on our website: http://www.incentage.com/cms/company/careers.html - in German because, while our company language is English, a basic knowledge of German will help you stay in the loop when the locals have their coffee break chat.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Computer Graphics for Intel FreeD
jobs.content:
Come and Join the Intel freeD Group, a dynamic and creative group with a start-up atmosphere within Intel, developing the future of video technology.
"freeD" stands for Free Dimensional Video, and is an entirely new concept for capturing, processing and rendering video that allows users to interact with real, live video. Our content is captured in the largest sport and entertainment venues in the world -Super Bowl, Soccer, NBA, etc.


Our Team and challenges:


The Rendering team is always in a search for the best rendering techniques so we’ll be able to render and broadcast 3D reconstructed reality in real-time.


We don't only aspire to improve Optimization and look, we are also in charge of creating visual effects and supplying eye pleasing statistical information on top of our renders. Our tools of trade are C++, OpenGL, GLSL shaders etc.

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer for Ariba Cloud Platform
jobs.content:
As a principal software engineer, you have the opportunity to accelerate the innovation and delivery of the Ariba products.  You will collaborate with designers, product managers, and other engineers to expand the Ariba Cloud to cover every corner of the globe.  You will have the opportunity to work on internet scale level problems and complex business problems.  You will work with Java, HANA, Hadoop, and Ariba Cloud technologies. To succeed in this position you must be incredibly smart, passionate about the user experience and be very results-oriented to get things done.


Responsibilities:



  • Work in core components for the Ariba cloud that include persistence, meta-data model, object model framework, common data server, customization framework, UI frameworks

  • Master the art of the framework design and modeling, understand the impact of object model design in a large-scale multi-tenant on-demand environment

  • You will be member of the core Ariba cloud engineering team

  • Work on solving scalability and performance problems

jobs.title: Principal UX Designer for the Digital Economy
jobs.content:
The goal of our UX team is to bring consumer-like ease to large-scale Enterprise products. If you are passionate about technology and how people use it, have a knack for simplifying the complex, and love working with developers in an agile process, then this is the place for you. Our UX team in Palo Alto is looking for a rock star Principal Interaction Designer.


 Responsibilities:


The Principal Interaction Designer should have experience presenting to and managing relationships with stakeholders and their adjacencies on a variety of efforts that support both the business and a strong user experience. Also, provide direction and inspiration to their peers, and maintain and influence the design language. Managing vendors and providing design direction will be key to this role.



  • Design and deliver web applications, from high-level concepts through to screen designs which are brand aligned and globally scalable

  • Deliver to Mobile First strategy

  • Evolve the design pattern library for web and mobile

  • Work closely and influence product management, engineering, documentation and training; understand and contribute to product requirement documents

  • Work with a globally distributed team

  • Facilitate brainstorming and co-design activities with internal groups and with customers

  • Work closely with visual designers, content strategists, product managers, and development teams

  • Manage and mentor other designers and vendors

  • Able to travel globally

jobs.title: Sr. Python Engineer
jobs.content:
Where you come in:


Write, test, document and deploy code that ensures the integrity of our operations and unique user experience.


Create, review and optimize relational database operations in our applications.


Design, create and deliver new system solutions by collaborating with other teams


Write code that will perform efficiently and accurately in an asynchronous architecture.


Design and update RESTful APIs and their documentations.


Work on internal web tools that are crucial to our Operations Team.


Collaborate with our world-class design & engineering teams to create the best UX we can offer.


Our stack includes: a Python/Django/MySQL/RabbitMQ/Redis application running on Amazon AWS maintained with Docker/Ansible.

jobs.title: Development Tech Lead
jobs.content:
Key Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for software requirements, software architecture and algorithms for Gogo in-flight entertainment products and services.

  • Responsible for understanding software behavior, and may need to navigate source code to debug lab & field issues and suggest fixes or product improvements.

  • Will support all development, integration and verification and validation activities for projects and products by working with internal developers and 3rd party development teams.

  • Work with development team to troubleshoot lab and field issues and track that fixes are provided.

  • Responsible for tools that are used for manage and distribute content.

  • Interface with operations and Infra team on software release deployment plan.

  • Interface with operations team to debug and root cause issues seen in the field, and if necessary, reproduce issues in lab.


Qualifications:



  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, electrical engineering or related technology – advanced degree preferred.

  • A minimum of 6-8 years of relevant experience in the telecommunications industry, Streaming Media, Inflight Entertainment industry.

  • Strong experience / skill in Object Oriented Design / Implementation in Java/C++

  • Experience with AWS Cloud platform is a Plus.

  • Understanding of Multimedia and digital video encoding and playback is desirable.

  • Strong development experience with Spring framework

  • Strong coding / debugging Skills

  • Experience developing in Linux environment is a big plus.

  • Working on DRM technologies a plus

  • Test driven development is a plus.

  • Strong communication skills including technical documentation, written reports and proposals, development and delivery of presentations and the ability to listen to and communicate effectively with customers and vendors


Working at Gogo, you'll be asked to think outside the box, think next to the box, and even ponder smashing the blasted box. Our team is transformative, dynamic and enthusiastic. If you have even the slightest desire to be part of something this different and innovative, to be inspired daily and applauded like a rock star… give us a call.


Gogo?is an equal opportunity employer and works in compliance with both federal and state laws. We are committed to the concept regarding Equal Employment opportunity. Qualified candidates will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, medical condition or disability.? The EEO is the law andis available here.


Gogo participates in E-Verify. Details in English and Spanish. Right to Work Statement in English and Spanish.

jobs.title: Mobile Lead  no BS
jobs.content:
As one of the first full-time hires – and the first non-founder engineer – you'll be a core member of the founding team. You could be someone who wants to remain an individual contributor or someone who wants to grow and manage an engineering team. We’re open to both.


Your primary initial task will be building out the Galore Android app, but we'll also ask for your help supporting our iPhone product (which is currently launched/live). As such, the ideal candidate will be able to work with both android and objective-c/swift – although we'll make an exception for anyone who's exceptionally talented in either environment and open to learning the other.  


Speaking more generally, your role will be to build and support a marketplace that connects parents with teachers, coaches, performers and other providers of activities, camps and classes. You’ll work closely with our product team to find the sweet spot between customer development, design and code. You’ll also help set the company’s overall technical direction. The ideal candidate is someone who values code simplicity, readability and reliability, but who also realizes that successful software is more than just a passing test... it’s a happy customer!


The Galore founding team is based in SF, but we’re open to making this a remote position. If you’re not located in the Bay Area, we’d establish clear and open lines of communication. We use Slack, so this should be easy, and we'd need to spend at least one week per quarter working together in person.


Though we’re well-funded, we’re scrappy and very intentional about the way we spend money. We expect you to value equity and that you’ll make millions of dollars if and when Galore reaches a liquidity event. Also, take comfort in the fact that our funding gives us a very long runway to seize this opportunity, and we’ll increase cash comp as our revenue grows.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
VidMob, a well-funded mobile-first marketplace connecting video editors with businesses and consumers interested in having their raw media turned into high-quality videos, is looking for experienced Java developers to join our team at our Pittsfield, MA location.


We’ve recently launched our mobile app for iOS and are looking for additional team members to take our mobile marketplace capabilities to the next level.


We’re looking candidates with



  • demonstrated expertise in developing large scale server-side applications in Java, or a Java derivative (eg Groovy, Scala)

  • full-stack development experience. We’re a small team, so everyone is expected to be able to contribute at each layer

  • the ability to take basic product requirements and turn them into a well designed implementation

  • a desire to learn, contribute and work with the team to build the best user experience possible

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Indianapolis, IN
URL: http://www.driverreach.com/

We’re a small group of passionate development geeks working on an up-and-coming software startup called DriverReach in the fast-growing trucking industry.

There are a lot of challenging issues and features for a talented Ruby on Rails developer to tackle. You’ll be working alongside the rest of the team and collaborating on feature development.

We’re a 100% remote team, that takes care to do good upfront design (specs and wireframes) before starting to code and have a lot of fun working on the project.

You’ll be a good fit if you:

  • Are self-disciplined and have a great work ethic
  • Have good time management skills
  • Communicate well
  • Love to learn new things and are willing to take direction
  • Can work until 1pm EDT M - F (if not based in the U.S.)

Requirements:

  • Ruby on Rails
  • JavaScript
  • jQuery
  • SQL
  • Git
  • MySQL
  • Unit tests
  • Memory profiling
  • Performance profiling
  • TDD
  • Background workers
  • Writing design docs / specs
  • Wireframing
  • Caching
  • API implementation

To apply: Send your resume and the answers to the questions below to jaredbrown@gmail.com. Answer the following questions: 1. Are you available full-time? 2. Will this be the only project you are working on? 3. Can you work until 1pm EDT each weekday so that there is some overlap with the team members here in the United States? (If not located in the U.S.) 4. We work as a team and are available via group chat while working. All major decisions and features are discussed prior to code being written. It is important to have worked in a team-based setting before and being open to discussion and debate. Is this OK and have you worked in a team before? 5. Each team member uses Hubstaff to track their time and sends a status update via email at the end of each day. Is this OK? 6. Have you worked on a project remotely before? 7. Can you send me links to your GitHub, StackOverflow, and LinkedIn profiles? 8. Do you have any sample code I could take a look at? 9. Can you give us 2 - 3 references to speak with? (names and emails) 10. We want to work with each of our team members for years to come. Are you interested in this project going on for multiple years?

jobs.content:
As one of the first full-time hires – and the first non-founder engineer – you'll be a core member of the founding team. You could be someone who wants to remain an individual contributor or someone who wants to grow and manage an engineering team. We’re open to both.

Though we’re well-funded, we’re scrappy and very intentional about the way we spend money. jobs.title: Account Manager - Water
jobs.content:
Overview

As a member of the Business Development Division, you will work collaboratively with an account team to sell and promote adoption of Esri’s ArcGIS platform within an organization. As part of an account team, you will be responsible for facilitating the development and execution of a set of strategies for a defined portfolio of accounts. Utilize your experience in enterprise sales to help customers leverage geospatial information and technology to achieve their business goals.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Prospect and develop opportunities to partner with key stakeholders to envision, develop, and implement a location strategy for their organization
  • Clearly articulate the strength and value proposition of the ArcGIS platform
  • Develop and maintain a healthy pipeline of opportunities for business growth
  • Demonstrate a thoughtful understanding of insightful industry knowledge and how GIS applies to initiatives, trends, and triggers
  • Understand the key business drivers within an organization and identify key business stakeholders
  • Understand your customers’ budgeting and acquisition processes
  • Successfully execute the account management process including account prioritization, account resourcing, and account planning
  • Successfully execute the sales process for all opportunities
  • Leverage and lead an account team consisting of sales and other cross-divisional resources to define and execute an account strategy
  • Effectively utilize and leverage the CRM to manage opportunities and drive the buying process
  • Pursue professional and personal development to ensure competitive knowledge of the water utility industry
  • Leverage social media to successfully prospect and build a professional network
  • Participate in trade shows, workshops, and seminars (as required)
  • Support visual story telling through effective whiteboard sessions
  • Be resourceful and take initiative to resolve issues

Requirements

  • Five or more years of enterprise sales experience providing platform solutions to businesses
  • Demonstrated experience in managing the sales cycle including prospecting, proposing, and closing
  • Ability to adapt to new technology trends and translate them into solutions that address customer needs
  • Demonstrated experience with strong partnerships and advocacy with customers
  • Excellent presentation, whiteboarding, and negotiation skills including good listening, probing, and qualification abilities
  • Experience executing insight selling methodologies
  • Demonstrates understanding and mitigation of competitive threats
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to manage and prioritize your activities
  • Demonstrated experience to lead executive engagements to provide services and sell to the water industry
  • Knowledge of the water industry fiscal year, budgeting, and procurement cycle
  • Highly motivated team player with a mature, positive attitude and passion to meet the challenges and opportunities of a business
  • Ability to travel domestically and/or internationally up to 50%
  • Bachelor’s or master’s in GIS, business administration, or a related field, or equivalent work experience, depending on position level

Recommended Qualifications: 

  • Understanding of the ArcGIS platform and how it relates to the water industry
  • Experience working with the water industry
  • Experience working with GIS
  • Fundamental understanding of certifications and requirements of the water industry
  • General knowledge of spatial analysis and how it is used for problem solving
  • Results oriented; ability to write and craft smart, attainable, realistic, time-driven goals with clear lead indicators

 

#LI-RR1

 

The Company

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.

 

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.

 

Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobs.title: Senior Distributed Data Engineer
jobs.content: Twitch is building the future of interactive entertainment. We’re looking for someone to help design and develop reliable and scalable applications with substantial database components. We facilitate the storage of twitch.tv web, video and chat persistent state, servicing over 40 billion low latency production transactions a day and will be scaling to over 100 billion in the coming year. You will work closely with our engineering teams to build tools, applications, and services that improve our ability to reliably deliver low latency answers to data needs in production.

jobs.title: Lead Server Engineer
jobs.content: Our mobile peer-to-peer mesh networks depend on several essential backend services for account management, identity management, and routing among partitioned clusters of mesh-connected phones. In this role, you will have ownership over the development, architecture, and operational stability of several key backend services.

jobs.title: Database Developer/Feed Integrator
jobs.content:
Markit Digital is looking for a mid-level software engineer to join a fast-paced, collaborative team, focused on building and Maintaining the back end data layers supporting financial web sites. The position requires a diverse set of data integration and database development skills, along with demonstrated excellence in problem solving and communication. 


Primary duties include the Following: 
• Database development: develop and maintain database objects: such as stored procedures, tables, views, and functions - Primarily using MS SQL Server 2008 or newer.  
• Production support:. Provide research and support for client-reported issues  
• Feed development: set up feeds to load a diverse range of formatted files and documents (eg XML, CSV, RIXML).  
• Script development: develop and maintain scripts using C# and other scripting languages.  
• Performance considerations: research performance issues and optimize objects we manage. 


Background and skills required: 


• minimum 3 years technical experience coding SQL within a relational database or coding in on application development language (preferably C#). 


• An undergraduate degree in a technical field: such as computer science or mathematics.


• Strong troubleshooting skills. 


• Attention to detail. 


• Excellent communication skills: ability to collaborate Effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues, vendors , and clients. 


• Willingness and ability to dig in and understand underlying data.  


• ability to manage risk in a highly sensitive production environment serving clients, over the Entire development life-cycle, across vendor components, infrastructure, and application code. 


• Experience with XML content using XSLT and / or scripting languages is a plus. 


• Experience with / knowledge of data Utilized in the finance industry is a plus. 


What you want to learn to do: 


• Use both industry-standard and proprietary technologies to integrate and distribute a wide of dataSources did power our high traffic, high visibility sites for the world's large largest financial firms and media outlets. 


• gain exposure to the stock market and other financial data. 


How we will compensate you: 


• A position with a growing, global enterprise 


• Salary - Commensurate with experience 


• Medical, dental, and vision insurance 


• Company paid life insurance 


• matching 401 (k) 


• Gym reimbursement 


• Three weeks paid holiday plus holidays, personal time, sick time and paid volunteer days 


Markit Digital is at EOE.

jobs.title: Senior Service Manager, Network Engineering
jobs.content:
Role Summary



The Senior Services Manager - Network Engineering role in Corporate IT is responsible for fully managing and enabling the evolution of outsourced IT services within Russell’s global technology environment for selected technologies including office and data center Local Area Networks (LAN), Wide Area Networks (WAN), and telephony infrastructure. This position manages the delivery of services in these and other technology areas by actively and proactively managing value from service providers, understanding best practices and current/evolving technology standards, identifying strategic opportunities and enabling processes solutions.


The responsibilities of the individual in this position include:



  • Provide for proactive management and compliance/oversight for the specific outsourced services and/or applications designated including:

    • Monitoring of service and performance metrics

    • Incident escalation facilitation

    • Service incident communication facilitation

    • Troubleshooting problem areas in collaboration with the service provider

    • Validation of monthly service allocations and charge backs

    • Service and industry trend analysis

    • Global budget and maintenance oversight

    • Global service contracts

    • Status and value proposition reporting

    • Infrastructure upgrades and new service offerings



  • Manage, tune and evolve internal IT service, change, and request management processes to facilitate clear communication and service value benchmarking, architectural compliance, technical review and overall financial tracking

  • Serve as Project Lead in the implementation of projects for new or enhanced infrastructure technologies or services. Act as a project liaison to business projects and initiatives

  • Senior level technical aptitude and ability to step into complex issues and configurations and perform necessary tasks

  • Serve as the Global IT and Operations liaison to the business unit

  • Provide detailed technical instruction to service provider technicians.

  • Remain current with industry brokered service and technology trends, costs and strategies as well as Russell business drivers.

  • Responsible for monitoring and management tools like Cisco Prime and Solarwinds.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer for Growing Motorcycle App
jobs.content:
Rever is a fast-growing motorcycle technology startup based in the mountains of Colorado. We build mobile/web products that help motorcyclists discover the best places to ride, track their riding experiences and share them with friends.

If you are an awesome Rails developer and interested in combining your passion for motorcycles with your profession (life’s too short to work on lame projects!) we’d love to talk.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Role Summary


In this role, you’ll work collaboratively with Global Application Delivery and Support to build, deploy and support our custom line of business applications. Help automate and streamline our Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery and SDLC operations and processes. Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations. And troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, test and production environments.


The responsibilities of the individual in this position include:
