jobs.title: Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
At Hulu our leads are strong technically—from code to design to large system architecture-- and have a passion to lead by example. We are looking for a talented engineer to help us evolve the team core to Hulu’s business & success—the Content Platform. You wouldn’t strictly be involved with people management as you will help us with content ingestion & machine learning.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Lead a team of engineers & help them grow as developers and be successful

  • Architect, design, and extend a high-capacity, large scale media processing platform

  • Own the end to end workflow for Hulu content publishing. This includes ingestion, publishing, and distribution

  • Collaborate with senior internal team members and external stakeholders to drive implementation

  • Evangelize your team’s work across Hulu, the industry, and the open source community

jobs.title: Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Details






















Join us

As a member of Concur's Performance and Load team, you will lead and collaborate with other smart Engineers in the evolution of our SAS platform. Your work will benefit tens of millions of customers and gives you the opportunity to be in the driving seat as we move towards highly-efficient systems coupled to high-quality automation, and new performance and load strategies.


As a member of our agile teams, you will contribute to all aspects of the development process, including shipping features you develop (look Ma, I created that!).  You bring with you a special expertise in performance and load along with a strong sense of curiosity, a keen desire to learn new tools and methodologies daily.


What you bring with you…


At this stage of your career, you are not looking for a simple set of tasks or well-defined problems with a clear solution.  You are looking for a new technical and organizational challenge – assessing the environment, and creating your own path – working with others to solve key challenges you have identified. At heart, you are a strong, technical Engineer who continues to learn and grow - and grow those around you. If this sounds like you we’d love to start a conversation.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
Thomson Reuters is looking for a motivated, self-starting front-end developer. You will help us design and code industry-disruptive products with the latest tools and technologies. Your primary efforts will focus on Thomson Reuter's Data Fusion platform, a hybrid of big data and linked data technologies, which allow organization to put all their relevant structured and unstructured data in a larger context of Thomson Reuters knowledge graph.


You’ll need to bring all of your skills with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and provide recommendations to the UX design team, the back-end development team, and product management on ways to make and keep the product nimble and fresh to consumers.


Your job will be to help us transform our product into a responsive, scalable interface and keep us on the forefront of technologies across all major platforms, browsers, and device form factors.

jobs.title: Senior Network Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Amazon Web Services is searching for industry-leading Senior Network Engineers and Architects to join our network team. We own the design, scalability, and availability of the global networks that power Amazon Web Services. We push our networks to their limit; traditional network vendors simply cannot deliver cost effective solutions capable of meeting our requirements for capacity, availability, or performance. In AWS Networking, we invent, design, refine and then we invent again.

Our ideal candidate is highly autonomous, possesses strong written and verbal communication skills, strong project management and time management skills and has a successful track record of designing and delivering simple, scalable solutions. The desire and ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment is essential.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work with some of the best engineers in the industry and help shape the direction of one of the largest and fastest growing cloud networks in the world.

Responsibilities

- As a Senior Network Engineer working in AWS Networking you will have end to end ownership (architecture/design/scale) of our current and newly developing networks

- Lead the design of highly available ultra-scale networks, driving them from concept to launch

- Define and influence strategy within and outside the team

- Lead project teams to deliver impactful benefits to our customers

- Work closely with our software developers to full automate network deployment and operations

- Drive operational excellence projects to improve network performance and reliability

- Troubleshoot complex problems and develop innovative solutions

- Mentoring and coaching junior engineers

- Review and implement changes on the network

Basic Requirements


- Substantial background in large scale network design

- Informal project management experience or experience leading project teams

- Proven experience designing and delivering complex network projects

- In-depth knowledge of and significant experience with major Internet protocols: BGP, OSPF, ISIS, MPLS, TCP

- Deep knowledge of network hardware and packet forwarding architectures

- Must be comfortable working in a Linux/Unix environment.

- Demonstrated experience creating software to automate network deployment or operations

- Must be willing to support an off-hours, engagement only pager rotation.

- Experience dealing with customers during problem resolution and operating efficiently under pressure.

Preferred Qualifications


- Highly autonomous, very detail oriented, possesses strong written and verbal communication skills.

- Excellent analytical skills

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills and an ability to interact efficiently with peers and customers is required, as well as experience initiating, driving and managing in-event conference calls.

- The desire and ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment is essential.

- Effective prioritization and time management.

jobs.title: Principal Engineer
jobs.content:
Using C++ and other languages, you'll develop the next generation of security technology. We’ve used C++ to:



  • Accelerate device level forensics by more than 10x over existing technology

  • Implement new network protocols enabling collaborative defense against distributed attacks

  • Detect patterns of insider data theft in real-time through file system analytics


C++ is our language of choice for low level systems software. We write modern C++ (STL, RAII, and Boost). But, given our addiction to innovation and our position on its leading edge, our platforms and tools are always evolving. Therefore, a good fit requires that you thrive on learning new domains and tackling new challenges. Deep talent, problem solving, and a commitment to quality are more important than proficiency in any single language.


Our work straddles the fence between engineering and research. Like research, we’re inventing things that have never been done before. We thrive on discovery and are comfortable with risk. And our domain is never static. Yet, like engineering, we haven’t succeeded until we’ve produced well-built systems that people actually use.


We write code to be read. We’re looking for someone who cares deeply about clear, clean, well factored code. We emphasize architecture: the right architecture leads to a robust, simple, flexible implementation. Our project management is strong but hands off: you’ll be given clear goals and the support you need. From there it’s your job to deliver: you’ll be expected to solve problems independently and get the job done.


If this is the type of challenge you thrive on, we’d love to speak with you further. We’re located in Central Maryland, in between Columbia and Baltimore, about a half hour from the beautiful Chesapeake Bay. All day-to-day work can be done work remotely.


We offer competitive salary and benefits, including health, dental, and vision; 4 weeks paid vacation and holidays; opportunities to perform research, speak, and publish; unlimited technical books at our expense and whatever tools you need.


Grier Forensics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Experienced Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: New York, NY
URL: https://www.myfyx.com

MyFyx is looking for an experienced Full-Stack Developer to help connect people with music. MyFyx is a social music platform that amplifies the connective power of music in a unique way. MyFyx also provides artists with a novel distribution and funding model.

As a Full-Stack Developer at MyFyx, you'll be responsible for the day-to-day development and infrastructure operations. MyFyx maintains a variety of products; we have a pair of recently released iOS and Android mobile applications built with React Native, as well as a web site running on Ruby on Rails. We have a variety of backend services facilitating the mobile apps running on Google Cloud Platform with Kubernetes. We believe in using the right tool for the right job, and constant progression.

Our stack:
  • React Native with NuclearJS
  • Node.js
  • Golang
  • Elasticsearch
  • Redis
  • MongoDB
  • Ruby on Rails
  • AngularJS (1.x)
  • Kubernetes on GCP via Google Container Engine
  • Heroku

By joining MyFyx, you'll get significant input into production direction and features. We are a completely distributed company with flexible work hours.

About You:
  • Experience with modern Javascript (ES6 and beyond) and Javascript app architectures
  • Experience with Node.js
  • Experience designing and implementing backend services and APIs
  • Experience with managing deploys and infrastructure, monitoring
  • Experience with NoSQL datastores
  • Strong incite into user experience and interface design, awareness of standard iOS and Android component design patterns
  • Down to earth, easy to work with
  • Consider yourself a generalist engineer and are willing to wear many hats, sometimes at the same time
  • Comfortable with "owning" products / features and ideally have experience with being responsible for the entire end-to-end development process
  • Comfortable and willing to learn as you go. There's probably pieces of our stack you haven’t worked with before, and that's okay as long as you’re confident enough to learn as necessary.
  • Excited to work with a small team and have lots of input in product direction

It would be a big plus if you have had experience working with with some of the following:
  • Experience with any of the technologies used in our stack
  • Building products with React Native or React
  • Flux architecture. We use NuclearJS, but knowledge of Redux / Reflux / etc. will transfer easily
  • Functional Javascript libraries (e.g. Ramda, Immutable)
  • Swift, Objective C, and native iOS app development
  • Java and native Android app development
  • Prior experience working remotely

To apply: Send a resume and cover letter to hiring@myfyx.com

jobs.title: Generalist Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Can't be tied down to a single specialty? This is the job for you. It's hard to say what tomorrow's challenge will be, but you'll be happy to hack away at it, whether it's a Ruby on Rails web UI, a distributed analysis Hadoop application in Java, or something completely new.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and build sophisticated systems to process and visualize massive amounts of data.

  • Make mistakes. Fix them; learn from them; make different ones next time.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become better engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas for our company during Hackweeks.

  • Contribute towards building a great company


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Excited by the idea of building scalable and reliable products.

  • Comfort in multiple languages, frameworks, and environments.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary.


EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Own equity in the company. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future.

  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

jobs.title: Senior/Lead Developer for Rails SaaS Product
jobs.content:
Hey. You there. I'm Jon, the founder and original developer of our SaaS platform. We're a small team now, but we're looking for a Rails developer who out-ships all of us.


You will become part of a growing team who's mission is to help small businesses--and the marketers and agencies who serve them--thrive in a world where the "voice of the customer" is everything. We're fighting the good fight.


Specifically, we're expanding our platform of marketing automation tools for managing, monitoring, and amplifying online customer feedback and reviews. We're looking for a strong Rails product developer who can drive the evolution of our product and capabilities around: data collection and manipulation, dashboard- and report-building, communication workflows, cross-site publishing, third-party API integrations, web-crawling, job-queueing and all kinds of automation.


We'd love to hear from Ruby on Rails developers who are passionate about building a product that users love. Ideally, you share our vision of empowering business owners to succeed. We are deeply customer-oriented but still maintain a strong bias for good design and engineering. You'll work directly with the company founder (a developer) as well as other developers, designers and a product manager.


You will be able to work remotely, but you should still be in the NYC metro area for our periodic in-person gatherings. Salary/equity is negotiable.

jobs.title: Lead Backend Developer
jobs.content:
With 1.4 million vehicles, mobile.de is the largest online vehicle trade site in Germany. This is an excellent opportunity to work for one of the most challenging product development organizations in eBay Germany. We support the entire mobile.de platform including our international marketplaces, mobile devices, and build critical technology to build the best of class experience in the vehicle market.

Mobile.de is hiring in Berlin! The Technology group is looking for a


Lead Backend Developer (m/f), Trust & Safety Team


The Trust & Safety team creates algorithms and applications to automatically detect fraud on the site as well as to improve the quality of listings and the communication of sellers and dealers. As a Lead Developer Trust & Safety you will be responsible for choosing the right technology and further develop our fraud and quality detection algorithms as well as our dealer rating and communication platform.


Job responsibilities:



  • Further develop our fraud and quality detection, communication and dealer rating platform

  • Own the entire development lifecycle from specification to deployment

  • Be an active partner for Product management in order to provide the best value for stakeholders and our customers

  • Innovate technology, process and product with your team

  • Leading and coaching junior developers


Job requirements:



  • 5+ years’ experience as a Java developer with a deep understanding of the surrounding technology ecosystem

  • Strong architecture and design experience

  • You are an absolute pro in Java / MVC / Spring4 / Hibernate / MySQL / Linux / MongoDB

  • You speak HTTP and REST like your mother tongue

  • Ideally you also have knowledge in machine learning, pattern matching and text mining technologies and previous experience in fraud detection

  • Solid understanding of up-to-date front-end technologies (Javascript, modern JS frameworks, CSS)

  • You firmly believe in lean and agile development (Kanban / Scrum)

  • You get up to speed with new systems and concepts quickly

  • You understand that quality is not assured by a QA engineer, but by the team

  • You believe in cross-functional teams and know that responsibility does not end with deployment

  • Proven excellence in analysing, designing, implementing, running and maintaining large scale distributed scalable solutions for the Web

  • Ability to plan strategically and execute in a result-oriented manner

  • Ability to thrive in a cross-functional environment while juggling multiple responsibilities

  • Passion for keeping up to date with the latest developments in the industry

  • Outstanding communication skills, ability to explain technical decisions to colleagues at all levels and from all trades

  • Excellent English language skills, German language skills not required, but a plus


What we offer:



  • A competitive salary, great benefits and an excellent working environment

  • Dynamic, international teams with very skilled personalities, a passion for e-commerce and a great sense of humor

  • Potential for career advancement in just about any line of business and the opportunities to work almost anywhere in the world within eBay Inc.

  • Silicon Valley Amenities (iPhones and MacBooks, Ping-Pong and kicker tables, volleyball and basketball courts, free coffee and juice, tasty subsidized lunches, a nice forest for walking and thinking and a free on-campus gym with trainers)

jobs.title: Senior Finance Manager, FP&A - Commerce and Content
jobs.content:
Twitch is seeking a Senior Finance Manager to help build our FP&A team and focus on Twitch’s commerce and content production/acquisition initiatives.  This position will report to the Director of FP&A and will eventually manage one or two financial analysts. 

Responsibilities

  • Develop and lead management reporting – analyze financial results, distill and synthesize issues, and communicate key messages to senior management with focus areas in e-commerce, content production, and acquisition
  • Monitor and track new, existing, and expiring content agreements to ensure the team accurately forecasts costs
  • Partner with members of the content acquisition team to determine appropriate resource allocation across content types and geographies
  • Develop insightful presentations that summarize data and facilitate decision-making for senior management
  • Proactively develop key financial analysis and insights to help enable the company to meet its monthly, quarterly, and annual targets, as well as strategic objectives
  • Work closely with the e-commerce functional leads to provide tracking, reporting, and operational insights to drive improvements for the business
  • Collaborate with the finance team on monthly financial closes and re-forecasting processes
  • Communicate financial results and trends to management and recommend appropriate course of action when results differ from plan
  • Recruit, train, and develop financial analyst(s) and other team members
  • Develop repeatable business, operational, and financial processes widely understood by all key stakeholders
  • Maintain strong relationships with members of the corporate finance team at Amazon
  • Evaluate and implement systems to improve reporting and monitor company performance

Requirements

  • BS in finance, engineering or accounting
  • Minimum 10 years finance or operational experience, with prior experience within media, entertainment, or tech industries
  • Track record of managing and developing team members
  • Strong Excel and financial reporting skills are a must
  • Must be analytical and have strong effective communication skills
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, with a focus on generating results
  • Must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, and able to work autonomously
  • Comfortable interacting with all levels of management
  • Highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized
  • Demonstrated ability to roll-up sleeves and do “analyst” work when needed

Bonus Points

  • Passion for or previous work experience with gaming industries highly preferred
  • Experience in reviewing contracts and business development deals preferred
  • MBA a plus

Perks

  • Full benefits, including medical, dental, vision and life 
  • 401(k) savings plan with a company match
  • Catered daily lunch and dinners (and hearty breakfasts three times a week)
  • Unlimited snacks and drinks
  • Monthly in-office massages
  • Corporate gym membership
  • Clipper Card to pay for your commute from anywhere in the Bay Area
  • Flexible time off policy
  • Weekly happy hours and opportunity to attend one gaming event or tournament
  • Top of the line technology to help you build your own workspace

About Twitch

Twitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at http://twitch.tv.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

#LI-AV1

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.content:
You will use your proven sales and business development talents to create and implement the business development strategy to encourage your account-based hotels to partner with TripAdvisor's Business Listings / Instant Book/ Meta/CPS models. The ideal candidate will combine sales, relationship building, analytical and presentation skills. S/he will have a strong experience in account management/hotel acquisitions and industry/trade relations in the relevant account base.

This role will combine high level sales, solution engineering and a strong negotiating skill set with major clients.  In addition, this candidate will have the ability to build out a comprehensive account management strategy. S/he will have a strong background in business development, sales and sales operations, with a track-record of hitting and or exceed goals.

The successful candidate will be a skilled hunter/farmer and have experience managing a portfolio of accounts. Sales methodology, process and pipeline management, as well as detailed analysis on performance to drive change and output will be critical to the success of this role.

What You'll Do:

  • Own the account base making sure that all opportunities are maximized both in customer acquisition/lead generation and retention business and upselling.
  • Identifying organizations that have large accommodation databases/memberships and negotiating deals, signing contracts and working with them to bring incremental Business Listing purchases.
  • Host Webinars/QBRs with clients.
  • Achieve and exceed agreed sales targets and customer engagement KPIs.
  • Produce weekly/monthly reports as required.
  • Keep up with product training and new offerings as well as latest TA value proposition

What We Seek:

  • Proven experience in hotel acquisition/retention within sales at a leading company.
  • Excellent prospecting, negotiation and sales skills.
  • Able to leverage contacts in the travel community– hotels, representation companies, third party resellers and other hospitality businesses, etc.
  • Accomplished candidates with 4-6 years of experience in account management, search marketing and and/or e-commerce.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, TripAdvisor is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

jobs.title: Content Specialist

jobs.title: PROCESS ENGINEER III - COATING
jobs.content:
Overview

Are you Mohawk Material? We’re the biggest and the best flooring company in the world, and we are looking for the best professionals to support our continued growth! At Mohawk there are always opportunities for high performing professionals to excel! Are you the best? If so show us what you are made of and come build your career with us!

 

Mohawk Industries, Inc. is a leading supplier of flooring for both residential and commercial applications. Mohawk offers a complete selection of carpet, ceramic tile, laminate, wood, stone, vinyl, rugs and other home products. These products are marketed under the premier brands in the industry, which include Mohawk, Karastan, Lees, Bigelow, Dal-Tile, American Olean, Unilin and Quick Step.

 

 

Mohawk Industries, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to an inclusive workplace and a proud Drugs Don’t Work participant.

 

EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Responsibilities

P

Responsible for providing support and assistance to the coating process and implementation of production/processing methods and control to meet quality and cost efficiency standards. Incumbent will work on projects of high complexity for manufacturing operations.  Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish Company objectives. 

  • Develops, assess and implements techniques and equipment of high complexity used in production processes to maximize the efficiency of the operations.
  • As assigned works directly with manufacturing management staff to assess business needs and determine appropriate course of action in areas of manufacturing technology requirements and/or modifications, product and process quality standards and cost control applications.
  • Trouble shoots problems with production staff and suggests/implements correction with limited supervision of more senior engineering staff.
  • Identifies, defines and measures improvement opportunities for assigned projects of high complexity.
  • Implements and documents potential process improvements for assigned projects.
  • Prepares test reports, system documents and/or closing reports from assigned engineering projects of high complexity.
  • Manage daily, weekly and monthly maintenance and other reporting systems output as assigned.
  • Assists in cross-functional projects or meetings as required. May provide assistance to junior level Process Engineers.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering – Process or Industrial.  Masters preferred.  Knowledge or experience with Six Sigma and Lean required. 
  • Min of 3 years job-specific work experience as a Process Engineer working on projects of high complexity.  Experience must be in a manufacturing environment.
  • must have textile coating experience.

jobs.title: Vice President, Bevel
jobs.content:
About ZestFinance

ZestFinance is a technology startup that uses machine learning and large-scale data analysis to transform credit availability for millions of Americans. Over the past 5 years, ZestFinance has built a big data underwriting technology that more accurately predicts likelihood of repayment.  ZestFinance uses this technology to make loans to customer that banks typically overlook.  ZestFinance also licenses its technology to other companies, including JD.com in China.  

ZestFinance was founded in September, 2009, by founder and CEO Douglas Merrill, an accomplished technology executive who previously served as CIO of Google.  Over the past five years ZestFinance has build an underwriting platform with strong demand from other companies who want to use it.  We call that business Bevel. This executive level position reports to Zest’s President, Mike Armstrong. Mike is a seasoned data-driven executive and has held senior roles at Capital One, startups, and strategy consulting.

Role description

ZestFinance is looking for a highly strategic and hungry executive to devise, implement, and scale a game changing business within a profitable mid-stage startup. This involves determining appropriate partnership and/or licensing channels and working closely with Zest’s VP, Business Development to bring that strategy to bear.  Building this innovative business, you will own and grow new and existing multi-million dollar business segments using your business acumen and strategic planning skills.

Responsibilities

  • Create, communicate and implement the strategic plan/framework for the organization while adhering to the direction set by the CEO
  • Identify and drive new business opportunities and strategic objectives with full P&L responsibility
  • Work collaboratively with other executive team members, ensuring that the strategy is communicated and easily understood by everyone company wide
  • Perform staff and organizational planning to support strategic plan
  • Execute -- and lead others to execute -- flawlessly in conditions of uncertainty as bevel grows

Qualifications

  • Experience developing & shaping strategies, building/optimizing businesses or product lines, managing P&Ls, and driving business growth
  • Experience building and developing teams and operating in cross-functional environments
  • 10+ years experience in a client-facing management consulting or Business Development role
  • Verifiable experience building a successful business at a data driven company
  • Exceptional analytical skills & demonstrated accomplishments with a steep career trajectory, increasing levels of responsibility and driving innovation
  • Strategic – goal oriented, organizes thinking within analytical frameworks
  • An MBA or Graduate Degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related quantitative field
  • Prior experience at a data driven company required; Experience in FinTech or related fields (preferred)

jobs.title: Associate UI Visual Artist
jobs.content:
Pocket Gems, a leading mobile entertainment company backed by Sequoia Capital and Tencent, is continuously breaking new ground by building graphically rich mobile games, developing fun new genres of mobile entertainment and creating innovative technologies like our proprietary Mantis Engine. Launched in 2009, Pocket Gems has grown to over 200 employees and its games have been downloaded over 200 million times by players around the world. With its pioneering team, Pocket Gems is uniquely capable of making original and genre-defining products as mobile devices become the primary computing device for everyone in the world.

We are currently looking for a talented Associate UI Visual Artist to join our team of artists, engineers, and product designers, to help build intuitive and cohesive experiences in our next line of hit games. Please note that this is would start off as a 6 month project.

This person will join one of our new teams at Pocket Gems working on core/mid-core games in the sci-fi or fantasy genres. We are looking for people excited to bring AAA quality work to mobile and establish Pocket Gems as a leader in 3D art for mobile. We are excited to be shaping and defining games as we know it on mobile.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist the Lead UI Designer to develop and execute original UI
  • Assist front-end engineers and UI developers with implementation to ensure final product reflects design vision

Requirements:

  • A portfolio of UI work (see submission requirements below) 
  • Ability to create production quality UI and art assets
  • Ability to develop and present UI ideas

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer

Being a small team allows our developers to make key decisions and take ownership over their projects. We encourage collaboration with our developers across all projects and a typical day can include project planning, architectural discussion, and pair coding.

jobs.title: Front-End Architect
jobs.content: As the leader of our front end development team you will be seeing through your vision of an ideal UI architecture, focused on extensibility, performance, and usability. You will be choosing and applying modern web frameworks on top of an existing highly scalable and flexible back end. You will be designing mobile/responsive best practices and then guiding team members in applying them. EcoSys EPC’s web functionality includes a configurable interface whereby users can build dashboards and interactive screens from UI building blocks that include rich HTML5-based graphical data visualizations, responsive spreadsheets and forms, and an in-browser report builder.  These are the building blocks your new framework will deliver.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
How This Job is Different


As a developer looking for your next job, the world is your oyster.


Except that most job openings involve working for massive companies where you'll spend most of your time sitting in meetings, dealing with internal politics or refactoring an ancient codebase.


Or you might work for a consulting firm, where your shockingly original ideas will be managed into mediocrity by your clients.


We've done all of the above, and we'll never go back. That's why we started Drip...to build a company where phenomenally talented people want to work.


If you wind up working with us, you'll witness first-hand how a small SaaS team maintains double-digit growth every month (and how we scale our technology to handle it).


You'll learn the stuff that they don't teach in school or, frankly, at any other job you've had. We achieve better results than larger, highly-funded teams. Come learn how we pull it off...


Who We Are



  • Drip is a 3-year old SaaS product in the email marketing space, with an 8-person team. We’re part of a larger, well-funded company called Leadpages, that has 180 employees. 

  • Working with us gives you the best of both worlds: the intimacy, influence, and speed of a small development team (currently 3 developers), but all the perks of a well-funded parent company (stable, health insurance, stock options, 401(k), etc.).

  • Leadpages and Drip are well-known in the startup scene so having our name on your CV (and an endorsement from our founders) doesn't hurt, either.

  • Both of Drip’s team leads are developers, and everyone on the team has a technical bent. As such, we are a developer-focused team that's a haven for expanding your technical chops.


The Code



  • Our Ruby on Rails code base is meticulous; we have 2.5 lines of test code for every line of production code. Our technical debt is the lowest of any app I've worked with.

  • Everyone uses Macbook Pros + a high-quality external monitor.

  • The best part about being a product company (rather than consulting) is the freedom to work on super interesting issues, and to take the time to solve them right. Without a client rushing you or telling you to change it later.

  • We place a high emphasis on code quality, test coverage, and UI/UX. We spend a lot of time making Drip look gorgeous both inside and out..


What You'll Do



  • Build and launch a production feature your first week on the job.

  • Help us scale our Rails app, optimize performance of existing features, write Rails code and tests for new features, and perform dev ops work as needed.

  • Work directly with two SaaS founders on a kick-ass small software team.

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
Wrangler of Mobile Bits - Senior Mobile Dev Position @ LifeTales


What we want to see in you:



  • You’re fluent with modern mobile development technologies and techniques and are willing and able to learn more. You want to build products that solve problems and make a positive impact.

  • Fluent in Agile and believe in the process. You are constantly striving to improve best practices.

  • You’re an innovative developer that can take instructions and find effective ways to work with our UX team to consistently deliver high quality code that is well tested using TDD (automatic integration - CircleCI, xcodebuild).

  • You bring a problem solving attitude and approach to development. You’re self-driven, quality focused, goal oriented and pursue learning as a lifelong achievement.

  • You have strong mathematical skills and are skilled at turning abstract concepts into algorithms.

  • With your research skills, you can find the latest advances on a given topic, and can quickly incorporate the key learnings into your work.

  • Have a GitHub profile with public repos and will provide the link in your application.


A little bit about us:



  • We want to create a profitable business while contributing to the overall important social well-being of our customers. We care about our members and put their needs first.

  • Our vision is to enable people everywhere to preserve their life experiences for themselves, their close friends and their descendants, in a fun way and with little effort nor planning.

  • We appreciate new and emerging technologies and considers how they can transform people's lives.

  • We are looking for a developer who has the desire to do not only do great work but also do social good.


What we can do together…



  • Build a culture that considers the wider impacts of it's decisions and focuses on the greater good.

  • We will push technology limits, learn lots, have fun, and build a great tech company headquartered here in Toronto.

  • Work collaboratively in a small, high performing, cross-functional team.

  • Regularly deliver completed stories using Scrum methodology including regular Standup and Retrospectives.

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
Cambridge, MA


 Do you want to work on products that help make the world a better place?


 Would you enjoy working with a diverse, talented, and passionate team to make sure that researchers and policy makers around the world have the best data and insights for their communities to be successful?


 Do you love working with the latest technology and tools?


 If so, this is your opportunity to work on applications used around the world, in a position where your work can make a difference to improve the livelihoods of millions of people.


What we do


We take real world government data and research, and turn them into interactive data tools affecting policy at the highest levels and citizens worldwide. The Atlas of Economic Complexity is our current online tool that lets users interactively visualize a country’s trade and explore growth opportunities for more than a hundred countries worldwide. We build tools that can ultimately help many stakeholders eradicate poverty.


CID has partnered with countries and firms who for the first time are making their vast data sets available to create public goods and insights. We're now working with individual countries, like Colombia and Mexico, to take their biggest civic datasets and use them to drive regional development using network analysis and visualization.


What you’ll do



  • Work with our UI designer to implement designs in clean, modern cross-browser, mobile friendly, and standards-compliant HTML/ CSS / Javascript

  • Organize current code bases and optimize loading speed in coordination with the backend developer (Django / Python)

  • Help build and integrate new visualizations for large amounts of data into websites

The Data Scientist will join CIS' Data Science Practice, a central team of data experts who support a range of data-intensive projects across the university. The Data Scientist's primary role will be to collaborate with top researchers in economics at the Rhode Island Innovative Policy Lab (RIIPL) to design, maintain, and optimize secure database infrastructure that integrates sensitive data from various state agencies, and to develop predictive models that inform smart policy.


This is a 2 year fixed-term staff position, with the possibility of promotion to a permanent staff position contingent upon available funding.


Please note: Cover letters and resumes must be included with all candidate applications.

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer | new project, small team, make a big impact
jobs.content:
HubSpot users rely on mobile because it's key to the way modern businesses run. Now that we do most of our work online, marketers and salespeople can do their jobs from anywhere. That means they need the power of HubSpot to engage with contacts, prospects, and customers when they're not at their desks. Cue the HubSpot mobile team.


We're a small team with big goals. We want to empower our users to grow their businesses from their phones, create an intuitive mobile experience, and help teams collaborate through the HubSpot mobile app. So far, we've made an impact by identifying which use cases are most valuable for users on-the-go (for example, the social media tool for publishing and monitoring real-time social content) and building features that compliment the desktop experience.


We work closely with our product manager and designers to set the vision for what we build. Next, we're building new additions to the mobile experience that will make collaboration and communication between teams, prospects, and customers easier.


We're proud of our mobile tech stack and are keen to contribute to the community through open source projects and the HubSpot Product Blog.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
The D. E. Shaw group brings together some of the best minds in computer science, mathematics, physics, and engineering to work at the intersection of finance and technology.  Members of our versatile technical staff exhibit a range of strong quantitative and programming abilities, with software developers and quantitative analysts collaborating on challenging problems that directly impact the firm's continued success.

Quality and innovation are imperative for creating computationally-intensive solutions for trading profitably in markets around the globe.  Developers bring strong analytical, mathematical, and software design skills to a variety of projects, including the formulation of statistical models for our computerized trading strategies, distributed system development, real-time data analysis, and the creation of tools for advanced mathematical modeling.  Technology is an integral part of virtually everything we do and our team enjoys access to some of the most advanced computing resources in the world.  Successful candidates have traditionally been the top students in their programs and have extensive software development experience.  We welcome outstanding candidates at all experience levels.

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer- Scala
jobs.content:
The Principal Scala Application Developer designs, codes, and tests custom application code for HBC Digital’s saks.com, off5th.com, lordandtaylor.com, and thebay.com stores and their supporting systems, with particular emphasis on issues that require special insight into areas of complexity such as enterprise integration, concurrency, data management, or HBC Digital-specific processes and legacy systems.


The Developer will be expected to possess the independence and people skills necessary to work across IT functional teams and directly with business units in order to accomplish their tasks. Although these tasks will be prioritized and assigned at the management level, the Developer will be expected to take ownership and show initiative in order to achieve resolution.


The Developer will be expected to demonstrate the ability to clearly and effectively communicate with the leadership of both technical and non-technical teams.


The Developer will be expected to thrive in an environment that stresses the value of innovation and proactive process optimization.


The Developer will take a lead role on significant projects, and will work closely with business stakeholders, project managers, and other IT teams to define and communicate effective strategies for project execution.


The Developer will at times be asked to lead troubleshooting and remediation efforts for significant production issues. He or she will be expected to demonstrate the ability to select an appropriate course of action, and take decisive measures to implement it, under the stress of a significant production crisis.


The Developer will be expected to take a proactive role in contributing to a knowledge base as they learn about the behavior of HBC’s existing systems, and define the behavior of new systems and subsystems.

jobs.title: Software Engineer III | Inbound Engineering
jobs.content:
Moz is looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join our web and inbound engineering team. The team is responsible for Moz.com (our main web property) and supporting services including: user authentication, signup process (including PCI compliance), customer tracking/engagement, mailing service, and a number of other services used by Moz products.

About the position

  • Work closely with the Engineering Manager, Technical Project Manager, and product owners to understand the function and system requirements.
  • Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes.
  • Development of new applications by following a set of requirements from other departments to assure production of a quality product.
  • Responsible for monitoring and analysis of current applications including performance, diagnosis and troubleshooting of problem programs, and designing solutions to problematic programming.
  • Follow good development practices and software development life cycle methodologies throughout product development.
  • Assist in resource and time estimation in areas such as creating engineering designs, hiring, and mentoring the team.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of professional software developing experience
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or Engineering or you love to code.
  • Expert knowledge of Node.js.
  • Strong understanding of Git, MySQL, Redis, Memcache.
  • Comfortable managing VMs and deployments, NGiNX, Varnish.
  • Promotes the agile process and methodology.
  • Experience converting from monolithic to microservice architecture.
  • Sense of humor.
  • Motivated by solving company/user problems, not just technical problems.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with emphasis on verbal and written communication.

About Moz

We develop an analytics software product to help people do better marketing. Behind the tool is a sea of Mozzers with a wide array of personalities, experiences, and expertise. We’re a startup with the ability to turn a profit, backed by a passionate community of followers, and with an exciting and hopefully VERY lucrative road ahead.

We’ve worked hard and deliberately to build a cultural roadmap. It’s not just about ping pong games and company parties (though we have those too!)— We’d love you to learn more about it below before you apply:

Moz believes in the TAGFEE tenets. As Mozzers, we strive to exemplify these core values.

Making the web a better place (http://moz.com/about) and watch how we do it (http://moz.com/products).

Not convinced we are awesome yet? Check out our video “Why we love Moz” and our amazing benefits package.

Sneak peek at the goodies

  • Competitive salary, 401K, stock options
  • Generous time off plus $3,000 per year towards your vacation!!
  • Home internet and transportation subsidies
  • 150% charitable donation match
  • And so much more (feel free to grill us about the rest in the interview!)

Moz is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing a work environment that is free from any form of discrimination. Moz values diversity and fosters mutual respect among its employees.

jobs.title: Software Engineer III | Moz Local
jobs.content:
Moz Local is a service every business with a brick and mortar presence needs. Partnered with major search aggregators, it helps businesses manage their online listings to ensure Google, Apple Maps, Bing, and customers can find them. It is simple to use, and the value is simple to understand.

Simple doesn’t mean easy. Moz Local engineers, designers, and our sales group work to automate a tedious manual, error-prone process while creating tools to give customers insights into optimizing their data and reporting for local search success.

Simplicity requires tough choices, flashes of brilliance, novel engineering solutions, and persistence in building our business. And for our customers, simplicity is king. We’re a group of diverse interests and abilities, and we’re eager to work with others who share those qualities. We believe in using the best tools for the job at hand. For us, that’s the NodeJS ecosystem, ReactJS, NSQ, MySQL, RethinkDB, and Docker.

About You

  • You're an experienced (5+ yrs) software engineer.
  • You have a commitment to shipping software.
  • You love the product you work on and you want to work with other people who feel the same.
  • There aren't parts of the stack that is someone else's problem.
  • You have something to contribute but want to learn from your team.

About the Team

  • NodeJS / JavaScript development on Linux.
  • Advanced services based group.
  • Hard working, hard charging, and mostly self-sufficient.
  • We love open source and we want our team members to contribute as much as possible.

About Moz

We build analytics software that gives our users the technical edge towards better marketing on the web. We are dedicated to the future of marketing analytics. We’re obsessed with it. We’ve been at it for over 7 years and we’re in it for the long haul. We’re a leader in our space, growing fast and receiving frequent recognition for our accomplishments (2014 lists include: Inc 5000, Deloitte Fast 500, and the Puget Sound Business Journal's fastest growing private companies).

Behind our software is a sea of Mozzers with a wide array of personalities, experiences, and expertise. We’ve worked hard and deliberately to build a cultural roadmap. It’s not just about ping pong games and company parties (though we have those, too!). Learn more about it below before you apply:

TAGFEE is the glue that holds us together and binds how we do everything at Moz. As Mozzers, we aspire to live and breathe these values. We make the web a better place: (http://moz.com/about) and this is how we do it: (http://moz.com/products). Not convinced we are awesome yet? Check out our video “Why we love Moz” and our amazing benefits package.

Sneak Peak at the Goodies

  • Competitive salary, 401K, stock options
  • Generous time off plus $3,000 per year towards your vacation!!
  • Home internet and transportation subsidies
  • 150% charitable donation match
  • And so much more (feel free to grill us about the rest in the interview!)

Why Moz? Because we love what we do.

Moz is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing a work environment that is free from any form of discrimination. Moz values diversity and fosters mutual respect among its employees.

jobs.title: Full-stack engineer
jobs.content:
Kaggle has a community of almost 600K data scientists who come to Kaggle to learn, compete, and collaborate on the cutting edge of machine learning. We are best known for running machine learning competitions with organizations like Facebook, NASA, and GE. 


In our next chapter, Kaggle is expanding to become the place where data scientists share code and analysis in a reproducible way. We're building this platform for data science collaboration (the closest analogy is Github for data science) around our thriving community. As part of our small team, you'll be a part of designing and building this platform in its early stages. We don't expect you to know everything coming in, so we'll pair you with mentors who will help you grow and develop your skills.


We like working remotely: a lot of our team is distributed. We prefer US-based timezones but will hire the right candidate anywhere in the world. If you’re in the San Francisco Bay Area or interested in relocating here, you’ll enjoy our easy-going office culture and all the beauty the Bay Area has to offer.


What you'll do



  • Architect and create new site features, ranging from discussing wireframes to creating the data model and deploying the end result.

  • Implement local tooling to facilitate users transferring their analytics between local environments and Kaggle's infrastructure.

  • Build features in our current web stack (C#, ASP.NET MVC,  TypeScript, React, SQL Server, and Azure).

  • Create and build on our services layer (which includes Linux,  Docker, and Python for running user code).

  • Measure, optimize, and scale Kaggle’s infrastructure.

  • Ship every day.

jobs.title: Delivery Lead - First Level
jobs.content:

As Delivery Lead First Level you will lead our 24x7 monitoring team. Together with your team you are an essential part of the safety net, which ensures availability and operating of our systems. You will challenge the status quo and improve the availability and robustness of our systems together with our engineering teams.


You will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand, while receiving meaningful support at every step.

  • Identify and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies that will help us innovate faster

  • Represent Zalando at conferences and meetups, give technical talks and help to recruit great people

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
• Be in-the-know of all  needs within the engineering teams and strive for excellence in providing tools and environments that foster  efficient and high quality development

  • Ownership of all solutions for tool development, inclusive of deployment, mocking & test-isolation, etc.

  • Development of new deployment solutions based on Capistrano & Docker and related technologies

  • Monitoring, maintenance and continuous optimization of our existing infrastructure based on Linux and virtualized servers on AWS

jobs.title: Sr. Java Developer
jobs.content:
Sr. Software Developer


Seattle, WA


Overview


Rylem Consulting is a leading resource in the Northwest for talent management. We help dynamic companies- Fortune 500 companies as well as innovative and exciting startups- identify and recruit game-changing talent. We currently have new contract position for a Sr. Software Developer at a company that is a leader in retail and apparel.


Job Description:


Rylem is looking for a Sr. Software Developer who will take part in the development of large scale RESTful Web Services and customer facing applications in a retail space. Also be able to mentor junior developers to grow them to similar levels of technical expertise.

  • RESTful API

  • J2EE

  • SOA Environments

  • Cloud experience a plus


Benefits:



  • Great pay

  • Good Medical/Dental and Vision

jobs.title: Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The Opportunity


In order to empower our product teams to deploy their applications themselves, the continuous delivery team provides an infrastructure which builds, tests and deploys our applications automatically. The DevOps engineers in this team are automating every step of our delivery pipeline as well as they are supporting other teams to use this pipeline. The continuous delivery team is based in Berlin.


What You Are Going To Do



  • You will be working in an agile team which develops and maintains our delivery infrastructure

  • You are going to support our product teams in using our delivery infrastructure

  • You will take an active part in scaling our delivery infrastructure by using cloud services

jobs.title: Delivery Lead
jobs.content:
As a Delivery Lead at Metrigo, you will be responsible for leading teams to deliver the most important components within Zalando’s advertising stack and play a leading role in making Zalando the world’s largest fashion serving platform.


You will have the possibility to work with a motivated, autonomous Delivery Team and the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’, build internal community around your interests, speak at conferences and strengthen your personal brand while receiving meaningful support at every step.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Developing and executing the mid- & long-term technical vision and architecture with your teams

  • Help your teams to find the right solution for complex problems by supporting, not steering them

  • Drive team mastery of world-class development techniques

  • Keep a close connection to Product Owners / Product Specialists and be a sparring partner when creating the product vision

  • Define Objectives and Key Results with your team to achieve a high-level alignment on a quarter-year basis

  • Facilitate communication and decision-making between teams and stakeholders

  • Support People Leads in developing the individuals in your teams

  • Coach and develop team members in technical questions

  • Identify and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies

  • Represent Metrigo / Zalando at conferences and meetups, give technical talks and help to recruit great technical talent

jobs.title: Analyst, Board Practice
jobs.content:
Description

ANALYST, BOARD PRACITCE

About Spencer Stuart

Founded in 1956, Spencer Stuart is one of the largest privately-held global executive search firms, specializing in senior-level executive search, board of director appointments and executive assessment services. Across its 56 offices in 30 countries, Spencer Stuart has a professional team of approximately 600 search Consultants and Associates.

As a private firm, we pride ourselves on fostering a special culture, which is both highly collegial and non-hierarchical – one in which intelligence, insight, excellence, responsiveness, humor, global spirit and interpersonal skills are highly valued. 

Board Practice

Spencer Stuart has been a worldwide leader in director search and other board advisory services for more than 25 years. We recruit chairmen and directors for public, private equity-backed, major private and family-owned companies, as well as startups and nonprofit organizations. We have a strong local presence in key markets around the world and our consultants have access to a growing pool of high-quality international directors.

Our knowledge of board dynamics and privileged access to and knowledge of the most sought-after directors helps clients build balanced and effective boards.

The Board Practice at Spencer Stuart includes some of the highest-regarded and sought-after leaders in the executive search industry including North American Board Practice leader Julie Daum.

Position Summary

The Board Analyst is responsible for producing industry and/or functional analysis reports in support of search engagements, internal meetings and new business initiatives. This includes competitive information, trends across sub-sectors and target company list development. The board analyst provides analysis and conclusions to be incorporated into client-ready documents. Over time, it is expected that the board analyst will develop functional expertise by maintaining an awareness of industry trends and “best in class” leaders/future leaders.

This is a full time role ideally located in Spencer Stuart’s Stamford office.

Ideal Experience

We are eager to hear from recent graduates (1-2 years of work experience) or members of the Class of 2016 interested in exploring professional services opportunities within the field of executive search. Applicants should have majored in liberal arts, business, or related fields of study and evince general well-roundedness, including significant leadership experience. A 3.5+ GPA is desired.

The successful candidate is someone who is self-directed, independent and able to proactively address the needs of the practice. Outstanding candidates will have demonstrated a passion and ability for performing critical research and communicating their findings clearly and cogently. They will be graceful under pressure, enjoy fast paced environments, and be excellent multitaskers.

Compensation and benefits are commensurate with other high-end professional services firms.  

Please visit The Muse to learn more about the people and culture of Spencer Stuart

https://www.themuse.com/companies/spencerstuart/

Spencer Stuart is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet

jobs.title: UX Specialist - personalized eLearning for healthcare
jobs.content:
Role Purpose


Elsevier is building a new (and awesome) innovation team to develop a next generation learning experience and redefine healthcare education. To transform the business and company culture, we're creating a team in Philadelphia, PA to work boldly and collaboratively on concepts and designs for a user-centric suite of teaching and learning tools. Reporting to the UX Strategy Lead, we now require a UX Specialist to conduct user research, run usability studies and create concept wireframes for our education products.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Backend
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.





You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Engineering Team


We work together in a pretty novel fashion - team leaders are elected by their teammates, and responsibilities normally held by a single manager are distributed across multiple roles. We have very open discussions about our product, our organization, and shared priorities.



We’re always iterating on how we work and what we build. We’re growing fast and we know that what may have worked a year ago won’t necessarily work a year from now. This applies to both the technology and the organization of our teams. We want to provide the best analytics experience for developers and co-create the best work environment for each other - willingness to evolve is essential.



About the Job


Keen is building the future of analytics-by-API. Our team is focused on shaping the interactive environment where anyone can put our APIs to work and get value out of our platform. We do this through apps and interfaces like our Explorer, Dashboards, and Dataviz SDK. Our customers' expectations for both technical capability and quality have never been higher than they are right now.



To meet these challenges we have to work efficiently and effectively, both as individuals and as a collaborative team. You will help us be thoughtful and deliberate about tackling the right problems at the right time. You’ll help make building and maintaining our projects easier. You’ll have the opportunity to gain deep understanding of every aspect of our service and teach others! Most importantly, you will collaborate with some pretty amazing humans.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer - ExtJS
jobs.content:
You are a forward thinking, creative problem solver with a passion for core JavaScript. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet. At Modus Create you will collaborate with a cross-functional Scrum team to deliver high quality innovative products in short sprint cycles. Be part of the best remote, distributed team in the industry.

FE Engineer w/ ExtJS Responsibilities

  • Write lots of quality, high performing code utilizing ExtJS 6
  • Collaborate daily with UX, Engineering, QA and DevOps to deliver stunning device-agnostic apps for highly visible consumer facing products
  • Consult to a variety of clients in a broad range of industries - from burgers to ball bearings, we’ve done it all

Required Skills and Experience

  • Experience delivering high value, heavy UI front-end products
  • Good understanding of front-end MVC architectures
  • Strong experience with JS frameworks including ExtJS 5
  • Strong Javascript basis and very good understand of the JS core (ES5/6)
  • Good understanding of HTML5 and CSS3
  • Experience with at least one of the SCSS compilers Sass or Less
  • Experience in building native hybrid apps using PhoneGap is a plus

Apply to be our newest FE Engineer! Discover what is possible at Modus Create - named one of the fastest growing companies in the United States. jobs.title: Talented Software Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Folsom, California

Looking for a good programmer.

Must be good technically and have good verbal and written communication skill.

Must be able to research, learn and figure out new programming and development technologies quickly.

This position is at a small software development company that is growing. The job can be done remotely.

The position requires programming solutions with Python, Java, Java Swing and databases such as MySQL and SQL Server.

You will learn a software platform called Ignition to implement custom software solutions for manufacturing companies. 
More information here: http://www.perfectabstractions.com/about-ignition.html

Please complete the following test:
Requirements:
1. Below is some data in a text format called Format 1. Below that is some data in a text format called Format 2. Write a program that converts the data from Format 1 to Format 2.
2. Format 2 is valid JSON.
3. The data in Format 1 can be a string value in the program.
4. The program should print out the data in Format 2.
5. The program should be written in such a way that if different data in Format 1 was input into the program the program would convert and print out successfully that data in Format 2.
6. The program must be written in Python, using Jython 2.5.3

The quality of your code will be judged by these factors:
1. Does the program meet the requirements?
2. How simple, readable and understandable it is.
3. How much code is used (less code is better).
4. How much duplicate code exists (less duplicate code is better)
5. Correctly uses built-in functionality and capabilities of Python and/or Java.
6. How efficient the code is (space and time).

Respond to this post if you have questions about the requirements.

After completing the test respond with information about yourself and/or a resume and send the complete test program you wrote.

Data in Format 1:
data = """

S2F3 
accept reply: true
L,3
ASC,"This is some text that 
gets to the next line
and the next line and possibly any number of lines." 
L,3
integer,6
bool,true
float,5.21
L,2
ASC,"More text"
L,1
integer,8

S10F11
accept reply: false
asc,"test2"

S9F1
accept reply: false
L,0

S1F15
accept reply: true
L,4
bool,true,false,true,true,false
Integer,3,5,6,3,7,2,6 
float,9
L,3
integer,4
L,2
float, 4.6,9.3

bool, false
L,2
L,1
L,2
integer,5
L,0
L,3
asc,"test3"
asc,"test
4"
L,0

"""

Format 2
The program should generate and print out this result. Remember that this should be valid JSON.
Here it is:
[{"header":{"stream":2,"function":3,"reply":true},"body":[{"format":"A","value":"This is some text that\ngets to the next line\n and the next line and possibly any number of lines."},[{"format":"U4","value":6},{"format":"Boolean","value":true},{"format":"F4","value":5.21}],[{"format":"A","value":"More text"},[{"format":"U4","value":8}]]]},{"header":{"stream":10,"function":11,"reply":false},"body":{"format":"A","value":"test2"}},{"header":{"stream":9,"function":1,"reply":false},"body":[]},{"header":{"stream":1,"function":15,"reply":true},"body":[{"format":"Boolean","value":[true,false,true,true,false]},{"format":"U4","value":[3,5,6,3,7,2,6]},{"format":"F4","value":9},[{"format":"U4","value":4},[{"format":"F4","value":[4.6,9.3]},{"format":"Boolean","value":false}],[[[{"format":"U4","value":5},[]]],[{"format":"A","value":"test3"},{"format":"A","value":"test\n4"},[]]]]]}]

To apply: Send the test program and information about yourself to nick@perfectabstractions.com

jobs.title: Service Agent
jobs.content:
At Goosehead, our clients trust us. In fact, gaining and honoring their trust is our strongest selling point. So we’re more than just a bit selective when it comes to hiring new people. But if you think you have what it takes to grow with our company, we’re recruiting Service Agents and would love to meet you. For more information about Goosehead Insurance, please visit our website www.goosehead.com. You can also get more insight into our unique culture at www.themuse.com/companies/gooseheadinsurance.

About the Job:

The primary responsibilities of a Service Agent are managing client insurance portfolios and delivering an exceptional service experience to all of our clients. This includes everything from routine servicing, billing, and maintenance of home and auto insurance policies, to complex additions and alterations of multimillion-dollar commercial accounts and risk portfolios. The Service Agent is also responsible for managing retention of accounts, preventing cancellations among clients, generating cross-sell leads and upselling coverage to existing clients. Associates work closely with senior management to develop the skills necessary to carry out these duties, as well as completing a training and licensing program.

Compensation is competitive including base salary and bonus. Current benefits include: 401(k) plan, disability, medical, dental, and vision insurance, and two weeks paid vacation.

About You:

Having prior work experience in a fast-paced environment or being proficient (reading, writing, and conversing) in a secondary language, specifically Spanish are a plus. You should also:

  • Demonstrate strong intellectual ability
  • Have a passion for being part of a team that drives our company to industry leadership
  • Have a college degree with a minimum 3.0 GPA or previous business experience
  • Show evidence of organizational and multitasking abilities
  • Have strong interpersonal skills

Submit resumes online at careers@goosehead.com or contact Julia Jordan, our Recruiting Manager at 214-838-5438.

jobs.title: Senior/Lead UX/UI designer with impact...
jobs.company: Senior Lead Ux Ui Impact Compucorp
jobs.content:
About

We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… for Non Profits, Charities and Art Galleries. We’ve been growing fast over the past few years and so we’re on the lookout for a confident and ambitious Senior/Lead UX/UI designer to join our distributed team in a unique position to help us work on the improved user design for a product that is used by tens of thousands of non profit organsiations wordwide.

About CiviCRM and CiviHR

CiviCRM is an open source CRM application that is used by tens of thousands of organisations worldwide.

Compucorp are being funded by a charitable foundation in the UK to develop CiviHR. CiviHR is an HR system for non profit organisations based on the open source CRM system "CiviCRM" and "Drupal" an open source CMS framework.

More details on CiviCRM and CiviHR can be found here:

https://civicrm.org/

https://civihr.org/

As part of the development of CiviHR one workstream is dedicated to redeveloping the user interface for CiviCRM (and therefore CiviHR!). Work has started and the designs so far can be seen here:

https://invis.io/MU4RTI1S5 - toolkit

https://invis.io/KD4KSB2H7

The role:

We have a unique opportunity for a Lead UI / UX designer to join the team and really help us take the UX design of CiviCRM and CiviHR to the next level. We want to make these applications into beautiful and immediately familiar applications that people love to use.

The new Lead designer will set overall direction on these projects to our mid level designers who are working on this and other projects, and also help us to develop a clear design and approval process.

The ideal candidate will be comfortable designing in a browser (HTML/CSS) (as most user interface challenges relate to fluid design) as well as in Photoshop/Sketch, will have existing experience developing UI for complex applications and giving direction to more junior members of a team.

Key skills we are looking for are:

  • Strong HTML/CSS skills and ability to prototype quickly
  • Strong knowledge of UX component libraries
  • Expert experience with fluid design principles and best practices
  • Comfortable with Photoshop and/or Sketch
  • Demonstrable experience creating user interface toolkits for web applications
  • Comfortable working with and leading a team of other designers

We anticipate this being a part time role for a number of hours per week, but may ramp up or down depending on the impact that the person is able to have on the project and other projects in the team.

A bit about us:

We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and real team mentality. Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but also companies, trade associations and government bodies. We're a distributed team with our head office in London. What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and most importantly loves a tech challenge. In short, we’re a team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right, and we’re looking for someone with a similar attitude to join our growing team.

* Strong knowledge of UX component libraries
* Expert experience with fluid design principles and best practices
* Comfortable with Photoshop and/or Sketch
* Demonstrable experience creating user interface toolkits for web applications
* Comfortable working with and leading a team of other designers

We anticipate this being a part time role for a number of hours per week, but may ramp up or down depending on the impact that the person is able to have on the project and other projects in the team.

__A bit about us:__

We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and real team mentality. Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but also companies, trade associations and government bodies. We're a distributed team with our head office in London. What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and most importantly loves a tech challenge. In short, weâre a team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right, and weâre looking for someone with a similar attitude to join our growing team.
